669297597.name: Awesome place for a day trip
669297597.author: a TripAdvisor user
669297597.reviewBody: I loved Roberto Barrios waterfalls. Some of them were quite crowded with families but not all. We went during the week, after Easter Sunday so was quite ok. I can imagine that Sunday can get busy with friends and families doing bbq. I found what I looked for which are amazing views, a lot of fun trying multiple pools and nice walks in between. In my opinion whole day is needed to truly enjoy it. \ntour operators offer organized trips there but my suggestion would be to take a collective taxi from palenque (50 pesos) and avoid group setting. It\u2019s a bit remote but seems safe.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

663657523.name: The best time!
663657523.author: a TripAdvisor user
663657523.reviewBody: It was drizzly and cool when we arrived here, and it turned out the water was warmer than the air temperature!\nThe best advice I can give you for here is GET A PROPER GUIDE. You will get far more out of the experience, as they can show you the safest places to swim, dive and explore. We had a great guide that didn\u2019t speak English (please be aware of this and ensure you know a few words of Spanish for your own safety) but whose knowledge of the falls was second to none. He took us from the top down the falls themselves; clambering, diving, sliding and jumping between pools. He took us behind parts of the falls and showed us wildlife. For those brave enough he also took us under the falls into a tiny cave where there was only enough air for 3 minutes. It was eerily silent after diving under the rushing water and was an amazing experience. Our guided fun finished up with a slide down the rocks on a plastic bottle (provided by the guide - don\u2019t do this and leave stuff lying around) into a big, deep pool. \nIf you are not a strong swimmer or get dizzy at all I would not recommend swimming; but it\u2019s a stunning place to look around.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

657081958.name: Stunning, no tourists!
657081958.author: a TripAdvisor user
657081958.reviewBody: U can take a tour to get here or do it yourself by taking colectivo from palenque. We took colectivo for 50 pesos and it took 50 min to get there. U will be dropped of in the village next to the hut where u pay 30 pesos and there is a path to the river. U can ask the guy selling u the ticket. When u reach the river, go left... That\'s where it all starts. U are free to go everywhere u want... No guide needed, but if u like to support the locals in the village, u can pay some kid and they will show u around, however its not needed, maybe u can rather buy something from them in the small stands they have at their homes. The people don\'t have much there, they are really modest and the area is absolutely safe. Important: last colectivo to palenque leaves at 4.30pm from where u were dropped off !!!! Do not miss it!  I suggest to spend there at least 3 hours.... Each level of waterfalls is different and beautiful, so take your time. U will love it. \nIf you want to do this as a part of a tour with the ruins, u can. The price is also reasonable. Attached leaflet they offer around palenque.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

644134597.name: Fun, fun, fun!
644134597.author: a TripAdvisor user
644134597.reviewBody: Try to get a guide. We got one of the owners to go with us. He showed us three caves that no-one else seemed to know about.\nWomen, wear shorts over your bikini bottom to prevent scraping on the last slide.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

643868791.name: Pleasantly cool and refreshing
643868791.author: a TripAdvisor user
643868791.reviewBody: After an early morning two-hour hike through the Top Che jungle at Lacondon (Montes Azules ecological reserve) and a visit to the Bonapak ruins, we had a refreshing afternoon dip in the numerous waterfalls and clear pools of Cascada de Roberto Barrios.  A must swim and selfie  location. Amazing clear, safe and comfortable jungle river.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

643733741.name: Don\'t miss, this is stunning
643733741.author: a TripAdvisor user
643733741.reviewBody: We visited after spending the morning at the Palenque Ruins, so it was great to come somewhere cool and enjoy the natural beauty of the cascades.\nThese were a series of cascades, with limestone rocks and green water flowing over the different levels. The water was lovely and cool on this hot day and we were able to navigate this waterfall by climbing down it, sliding down it in places and swimming in the pools. There are even ropes there to help you do this.  There\'s plenty of pools to swim in and explore, so take your time and enjoy the time in the natural surrounds.\nThe waterfall wasn\'t very crowded even though it was Sunday (but it was election day in Mexico).

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

638236755.name: Beautiful nature!
638236755.author: a TripAdvisor user
638236755.reviewBody: Cascada de Roberto Barrios is a great place for a swim or a cooling off in the cascading waterfalls. It is a short walk through the jungle from the parking area.  I agree with skipping Aqua Azul as we had heard that it was way more touristy.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

635073711.name: Beautiful Blue Water
635073711.author: a TripAdvisor user
635073711.reviewBody: Plenty of space to have a relaxing swim. Gorgeous photo ops too. Safety ropes in the water if you need them in the strong currents. Lots of side pools too for kids. The varying shades of water were amazing. The trail around the falls lead you safely around to new places to swim or take photos. The trails are pretty rustic so wear good shoes. \nAfterwards, you can stop in at a little open air cafe and enjoy freshly prepared food and an ice cold beer. The food is a variety of Mexican and Yucat\u00e1n food. Everyone we spoke with enjoyed their meals. We didn\u2019t know it was there so had packed a lunch. The kitchen is open and you can watch them preparing your food. Be patient, as there are only about 3-4 people working, waiting and cooking.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

630559281.name: Nature at its best!
630559281.author: a TripAdvisor user
630559281.reviewBody: Magnificent waterfalls everywhere, jungle all over the place and local guides very friendly and helpful. You walk through the \njungle and don\u2019t stop being surprised by the (at least) 5 different waterfalls you find.\nThe water is pristine and the scenes are gorgeous!! A must if you are in Palenque!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

629009024.name: Skip Agua Azul!
629009024.author: a TripAdvisor user
629009024.reviewBody: We decided to skip Agua Azul because there was a road block that was taking advantage of tourists on the way there.  We are so glad that we did!  These waterfalls are frequented mostly by locals, and they are spectacular.  Layer after layer of waterfalls spill down a hillside in numerous directions.  There are tons of pools and falls to swim under, caves under the falls, and even natural slides down the rock faces.  We could have spent a week exploring this place and would love to return someday!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

614165563.name: The best cascading waterfalls I have ever seen!
614165563.author: a TripAdvisor user
614165563.reviewBody: No words can express how beautiful this place is. Surprising to know that not much pictures nor videos have been taken from this place. Would love to see someone use a drone to capture its immense beauty.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

605555977.name: Unexpected highlight
605555977.author: a TripAdvisor user
605555977.reviewBody:
When we decided to go, we had no idea what to expect, but were so glad we went.

The waterfalls themselves are amazing to look at, with multiple levels cascading down and the water has an incredible azure colour.

Take swimwear so that you can jump in. There are loads of spots where you can jump into from the top into the pools below or you can walk down each level.

The current is obviously quite strong being a waterfall, so be careful if you’re not a strong swimmer. There are ropes to hold onto around the water to make it easier, but even holding these can be challenging at times.

There are locals who will show you around the best parts of the waterfalls for a small fee and it’s definitely worth doing so.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

599400770.name: Beautiful
599400770.author: a TripAdvisor user
599400770.reviewBody: There is a small restaurant outside of the waterfalls were they have some meals and drinks.\nThe waterfalls are beautiful and very refreshing to swim in.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

596232877.name: Magical!!
596232877.author: a TripAdvisor user
596232877.reviewBody: I didn\u2019t really learn about Roberto Barrios until I arrived in Palenque. I took a half day tour with Kichan Bajlum tours. It was about a 40 minute drive from town. There are multiple levels of waterfalls in all directions it seems! Locals are excited to show off caves and places to jump into turquoise waters. Make sure to make time for each level as each has it own unique beauty. Next time, I would love to camp here!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

593135490.name: Make the time to go to these waterfalls
593135490.author: a TripAdvisor user
593135490.reviewBody: We took a collectivo from near the market in Palenque to Roberto Barrios (50 pesos per person one way). We had heard good things about the waterfalls and that they are less touristy than Agua Azul. Reading previous reviews we thought that it would be easy to find one of the local children to guide us on the waterfalls and show us where is safe to jump in, however we couldn\'t find any children. When we asked at the desk where you pay to get in we were informed that the village has stopped the children doing this now. The guy who took our entry fee offered to show us around instead and he took us through the waterfalls, told us where to jump, and we slid down the waterfall on a 2L plastic bottle (although this was fun we both cut ourselves, as the rock is quite sharp as it goes into the water). He "suggested" we should pay him 200 pesos (for two people), which we did in the end as he spent a few hours guiding us. Although it wasn\'t as we expected it was an amazing experience. The waterfalls are beautiful and there are several different sections in which you can swim. There were probably more locals there than tourists. If you want to jump, but don\'t want to pay for a guide, you could probably just watch where the locals jump or ask them where is safe.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

589883604.name: Unspoiled beauty
589883604.author: a TripAdvisor user
589883604.reviewBody: Camping style toilets 5 pesos before you go down to the waterfall. Saw howler monkeys from afar. You may be able to pay for local guides to guide you down the waterfalls (jumping) but if you are risk adverse you can stay at the top and swim in several areas, even cross and sit in a small cascade.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

588131490.name: Must see
588131490.author: a TripAdvisor user
588131490.reviewBody: Awesome cascades, spend 4 hours here just in the water. another 2 just visiting the jungle. Take the offroad road if you have an appropriate vehicle, not so much crowded. entrance is 25 pesos per person. Gave the local people a good tip, so he showed us around for an hour. Was an awesome experience, and i m not the waterkind guy

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

584206363.name: Simply gorgeous
584206363.author: a TripAdvisor user
584206363.reviewBody: Out of this world. Would recommend a half day here atleast.  Beautiful surroundings.  Will go back again

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

580875114.name: A Must See and Swim
580875114.author: a TripAdvisor user
580875114.reviewBody: We ended  up here after our guide at Palenque suggested the side trip.  It was one of our favorite days of our trip!  We had already been to Agua Azul, and enjoyed walking the falls and swimming in the pools where allowed.  We were expecting about the same, but we\'re pleasantly surprised to get so much more!! While we were enjoying the first of the falls a local offered us a guided tour down the falls.  We were quickly off on a adventure- sliding, jumping and swimming our way down the falls.  There were even caves to stop and explore under the falls.  Another local carried all of our gear to where we got out of the falls, he even took one of our phones and took pictures and videos of us along the way.  IIt is great for all ages (including my 70+ parents!).  They even rent life-vests if you aren\'t a strong swimmer.  One of the best things is you aren\'t swarmed by people selling things every step of the way.  A few little girls sold us bracelets, but that was all!!  The only warning is there isn\'t really a place to change or restrooms available, so come ready to swim!!  We can\'t wait to go again!!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

580202802.name: Less touristy version of agua azul
580202802.author: a TripAdvisor user
580202802.reviewBody: Great for a chilled out afternoon relaxing. We had a lot of fun exploring the different waterfalls, you could definitely spend a few hours there at least. I haven\u2019t been to agua azul but the friends I whent with have and they said its basically the same but without people constantly harassing you to buy stuff

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

578181056.name: Much better than Cascada Azul
578181056.author: a TripAdvisor user
578181056.reviewBody: The place is really beautiful with waters going from green to turquoise. All kind of places to swim from shallow to more profound waters. Also places where you can stay just under the cascade fall. In part of the path we saw monkeys that got really close to us. It was great, a place where you can spend the day. Just one warning for people with movement limitation and elderly people: although is not a difficult path to all cascade falls, you will be stepping in tree roots, wood bridges and stones and they can get slippery if they are wet. There is no pavement at all and no access to wheel chairs.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

576146691.name: Crystal clear waters
576146691.author: a TripAdvisor user
576146691.reviewBody: A definite must to what is, in my opinion, the Semuc Champey of Mexico but 10 times better. Beautiful waters to swim in and it is safe to jump or slide between sections. The underwater cave is just great.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

576136090.name: Great afternoon cooling down after Ruinas
576136090.author: a TripAdvisor user
576136090.reviewBody:
This is a great place for a swim. Laid back , not too many people . 
There are about 4 different sections to visit all a short walk from the car park. 
Our driver kindly came with us an minded bags while our small group swam. 
We arranged transport to here and the Palenque ruins as a full day package - 180 pesos. Good value and means not chasing around for collectivos.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

570926689.name: Most beautiful waterfalls in the area
570926689.author: a TripAdvisor user
570926689.reviewBody: Forget about agua azul, this natural wonder is truly impressive. Beautiful clear waters, waterfalls and scenery. Much more local than any other touristy places around but it is an absolute must.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

566590526.name: Undeveloped
566590526.author: a TripAdvisor user
566590526.reviewBody: The most well known waterfalls near Palenque are Agua Azol and Misol Ha. If you want a rather different experience, try Cascada de Roberto Barrio. About 45 minutes from town on a winding mountain road, it is set in natural jungle and is pretty much undeveloped. Rough dirt (and sometimes muddy) tracks lead down past a series of cascades, each with its own swimming area at the bottom.\n\nBe warned that to get into the water you have to walk across rocks and bridges that can be slippery at times. It is worth it for a tranquil swim in natural surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

563348831.name: Ssh don\'t tell many about this place...
563348831.author: a TripAdvisor user
563348831.reviewBody: I almost don\'t want to write a review, as it\'s under the radar on the tourist trail. \nThis is a great place to visit to swim in the water and even better, get the locals to take you water fall jumping. The guys that took us were fantastic and were really patient with those of us that were nervous/and didn\'t want to do all the jumps. \nFun afternoon out and make sure you take some beers to celebrate all the fun afterwards.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

559579859.name: Beautiful off tourist trail
559579859.author: a TripAdvisor user
559579859.reviewBody: Natural beautiful tumbling waterfalls , in the jungle . Wonderful scenic walk fairly rough terrain .  Not yet developed for tourist industry. But toilet drinking water snacks available in what appears to be local families small businesses. Very scenic, beautiful waters to swim in , several different areas as u follow the water down and lots of dare devil diving for those young or able enough and thrill seeking . Though I would recommend a guide if planning to dive it looks deep but rocky. Maybe about 10 couples in the whole area while we were there.We went by local connectivo or chicken bus 50 pesos. About 40 minutes out to the mountains with beautiful countryside views. Connectivo near the fruit markets or ask anyone as it\'s all central and not a big place . Not for wheelchair, quite slippy mud and roots once in the water area so a trip hazard . Very enjoyable and not a rip off

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

557198461.name: Lovely place ... lovely experience
557198461.author: a TripAdvisor user
557198461.reviewBody: The place is simple. Great to do it the Chiapas way with local children taking you to jump off the rocks amongst the waterfalls .. they are really professional and cautious! Trust them! The place is lovely very rustic but waterfalls are amazing ! I wish I could have spent longer there

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

556771742.name: Beautiful, fun....
556771742.author: a TripAdvisor user
556771742.reviewBody: These waterfalls were beautiful! My friends and I had such a great time! Water temp was great in December. The waterfalls are not huge from a height perspective, but certainly from a width and length perspective, i.e. there were numerous falls, working their way down-river. Swim, and work your way down the falls. A highlight of a two weeks trip throughout Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

550651950.name: Favorite day in Chiapas
550651950.author: a TripAdvisor user
550651950.reviewBody: This is my kind of place! We had a rented car so we drove (about an hour from Palenque). My husband, kids, and I love to swim in rivers and waterfalls so this place was perfect for us. Five levels of falls, perfect water temperture (we went the end of December), tucked away in the beautiful jungle, not too many tourists, a few locals  selling fruit and empanadas if you get hungry... we could only spend a few hours here but easily could have spent the whole day. We happily paid a local kid/ guide 100 pesos ($5) --which he was  REALLY happy with--to guide us and show us the caves, where it was safe to walk, slide, jump....  (shout to Leandro even though I don\'t think he will ever read this!) I saw some people wearing life vests--I wasn\'t paying too much attention but was under the impression they were provided for those who needed them. It looked like some people came just to look at the falls-- I didn\'t see them swimming. That would be tortue for me! Not sure I would bother coming here if not to swim. If you read my other reviewss you will see I am stingy with my stars, but this place easily earns  five stars as far as I am concerned!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

548512235.name: Just awesome for a swim
548512235.author: a TripAdvisor user
548512235.reviewBody:
We combined Barrios with Azul.

1) don’t believe people who say Barrios is as beautiful as Azul. It’s not, Azul is more impressive. But Barrios is also really really beautiful 
2) Barrios is in no way as touristic as Azul. No stalls or restaurants here, just nature and amazing falls 
3) if you like to swim in the falls, go here and skip Azul. This is the bomb! Sliding, jumping etc etc...  you can do all here.
Get a guide or ask a local for a trip down the waterfall, to jump, canyoning and slide. It’s a blast.
4)If you have your own transportation... combine Azul and Barrios like we did. If you like a bit of adventure, take the dirt road to your right after Santa Maria (coming from Azul) on the 199 that goes through Nuevo Samaritano. It takes you all the way to Roberto Barrios (one hour drive, the road is not bad and easy with a high riding car, no 4x4 required) and is beautifull. Just the road itself is worth 5 stars.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

546787772.name: Get a local guide
546787772.author: a TripAdvisor user
546787772.reviewBody: If you are there (and are a good swimmer), ask the service of the local guides for some tip, and you will have fun! They will guide you through the different levels of the waterfalls, jumping from the rocks to the pools below. Excellent adventure!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

543719407.name: Could be better
543719407.author: a TripAdvisor user
543719407.reviewBody:
The place is good. It is for sure worthy a visit. Just few points.
1. If you go by car be prepared that 10 kids will surround your car and promise to watch it. They are not dangerous and you need to pay few pesos to one or two of them, but it can be quite annoying.
2. Everything is run by local. There is a small house, you enter and you pay 20 pesos per person plus 10 for the auto.
3. They try to force you to take a guide. You don’t need one but maybe you can negotiate one for few pesos to support the local economy.

All in all is nice but it is a pity that such a nice place is left to local with no organisation and a sort of feeling of abandonment. 
Nothing happen but it could have been a better Experince

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

540543006.name: not touristic
540543006.author: a TripAdvisor user
540543006.reviewBody: nice experience. Several waterfalls. It is slippery to you should wear shoes with profile. There is a toilet and a shower room where you can change only this costs 5 pesos. The views were amazing and not many tourists were there when we were there. There is also a boy that takes you to the waterfalls and after that wants money so you should be aware of that. \nI would recommend these falls because of the atmospehere, the blue water and several waterfalls. Some are more excessible than others so i would first look at them all and then decide where to get in. there are also chairs to sit on and places to hide from the rain.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

535094294.name: Must see - amazing waterfalls
535094294.author: a TripAdvisor user
535094294.reviewBody: This was one of my best experiences in Mexico - its almost 4 levels of waterfalls that you can jump off, swim behind and explore - and at the bottom waterfall you slide down on a flattened 2 litre bottle - bonkers but amazing\n\nDont worry if you cant jump from high heights either every waterfall has a walking option down so you dont have to jump. I would recommend having a guide as some waterfalls can be VERY slippy and you will need to know where you can and cant jump but this is a MUST see experience!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

534963786.name: Well Worth Going Here
534963786.author: a TripAdvisor user
534963786.reviewBody:
Our guide took us here (with my 13 and 10 year old kids) and they absolutely loved it.  

The place is very rustic and the local kids will swarm your car to offer guide services.  Accept one of them only.  

The local community do have a cover charge of $20 pesos per person.  

There are lots of signs where swimming is and is not allowed so it is safe from that point of view. 

The waterfalls themselves are fabulous just to see them and take photos even if you don’t plan to swim there.  

Very cool place to see

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

534962398.name: Not as great as we thought it was going to be :(
534962398.author: a TripAdvisor user
534962398.reviewBody:
The photos look incredible on the internet but for the short amount of time that we were there it wasn’t as great as we thought.. pretty good but nothing too spectacular.

Only 20pesos to get in and you don’t need a guided tour. 

To get there do not get a taxi.. it’ll cost you 420pesos! Oops. Instead grab a little “collectivo” which is a mini bus or truck with a tarp on the back. They will only cost you 50pesos per person and the journey will then be a little bit more worth while. 

It’s not an all day activity.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

534087976.name: Beautiful!
534087976.author: a TripAdvisor user
534087976.reviewBody: We decided on Robert Barrios over Agua Azul after recommended by our guide Edgar at the ruins who told us it had rained too much and Agua Azul would be muddy. We ended up going to with the tour company right outside the bus station and because there was another operator there they bid against each other and we paid $450 (for 3 of us) with them and bought our tickets for Yaxchilan and Bonampak with the operator inside for $750. But Roberto Barrios was unlike anything I expected! I went in thinking it would be a swimming experience with pretty falls to look at. The falls are everywhere - the water is everywhere. Our guide had us make about 5-6 stops over the course of 3-4 hours. The first place we slid down a waterfall on plastic bottles he provided into a giant body of water. We also hiked up waterfalls, jumped off more, swam under them to hidden caves and jumped off trees and cliffs into the water. There are caves that can be reached by swimming under the water. There was only enough time for one of us to experience it as it was towards the end so make sure to ask about it if that interests you. We only saw about 5 other people the whole time. It was really nice to feel like it was just us and the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

533593442.name: Immersive waterfall experience in Palenque
533593442.author: a TripAdvisor user
533593442.reviewBody: We stayed an extra day to see some of the waterfalls in the Palenque area when going to the ruins. It was definitely worth it! Aguas Azules and other places offered similar experiences, but what makes Cascada de Roberto Barrios stand out is you can jump down the waterfalls to enjoy them as well as walk down the sides. We paid 50 pesos each for a colectivo from downtown Palenque and then 20 pesos to get in. This area is still not as well known as the others, so we had a good time without lots of other tourists. When you get there, guides (we ended up tipping each guide 100 pesos) to take us to the safe jumping spots to reach the awesome natural waterslide at the end. \n\nIf you\'re looking for an interactive water experience, definitely check out Roberto Barrios! We had rain and cloudiness throughout the time, but the water was warm enough and refreshing that it didn\'t feel cold or uncomfortable. If you go quickly, it takes about an hour to jump down through the falls, but you can spend time swimming in larger calm waters and hanging out in caves under the waterfalls. The colectivo ride is about 45 minutes each way.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

532574777.name: A pleasant surprise
532574777.author: a TripAdvisor user
532574777.reviewBody: We were very much looking forward to Agua Azul but our tour guide at Palenque Edgar told us to do Roberto Barrios instead as the rain would make Agua Azul muddy and we would probably be disappointed as it wouldn\'t be blue. What a unique experience! We had toyed with the idea of renting a car and doing it on our own but because we went through a tour company, we were guided the entire way. It wasn\'t expensive though I don\'t remember the price. If you bargain with the guys they generally will give you a good price. We went with the booth in front of the Ado bus station and the one inside to book Yaxchilan and Bonampak. \n\nThere was water everywhere! So many falls. I\'ve never seen so many. Our guide showed us an area between the streams to set our stuff down and invited us out to a large waterfall where he gave us large plastic bottles to sit on and hold between our legs while sliding down the waterfall. So much fun! We spent some time in various in little areas with him showing us a cavern beneath a waterfall, a larger cliff to jump off and an underwater cave towards the end only one member on our tour got to see which was towards the end - of that interests you, ask about it in the beginning so there\'s enough time. We really enjoyed ourselves and I\'d return to play in a heartbeat. Bring food and water as it\'s in the middle of the wild.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

530667177.name: Truly an oasis
530667177.author: a TripAdvisor user
530667177.reviewBody: Words can not do justice to this place. The locals will give you a tour and you definitely want that. They were friendly and extremely knowledge. They will try to sell you things but they are very shy and unassuming. The water falls entertained is for hours. This will be s leftover memory for us.\n

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

529401458.name: Very pretty waterfall in the Palenque forest
529401458.author: a TripAdvisor user
529401458.reviewBody: These are very pretty falls close to Palenque and are worthwhile visiting to get a feel for what Palenque has is all about. When we visited the falls were not overflowing that much but still looked very nice. You can swim there although we did not.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

523571952.name: Best day in Mexico
523571952.author: a TripAdvisor user
523571952.reviewBody: I was brought here and I as taken aback by the views and beautiful waterfalls.  A local kept telling me there was more but he had no English.  Eventually we followed him and it was the best decision we did! He told us where to walk down the waterfall (as it can be quite slippy) and where it was safe to jump off.  We did this and jumped into the pool below where we found another waterfall! And we jumped off again into the pool again to find another waterfall.  It was never ending! It was so much fun it was like an adventure course!  We were shown an underwater cave.  At the very last waterfall we were asked if we wanted to sit on something plastic and slide down the waterfall!  We said sure! Low and behold, the local brought out 5 squashed 5L water bottles for us to sit on! We couldn\'t stop laughing! We slid down and boy did it hurt! It ripped our bums badly! But it was so much fun! A little money maker idea for locals - get better sliding equipment and also have someone with a camera at the end as we couldn\'t bring our phones and we have no pictures of us in the water or sliding down! There were ropes to pull on in order to get back up the waterfalls! Brilliant day! Watch your belongings and if a local asks you to go down with him follow him!!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

521797074.name: a little paradise
521797074.author: a TripAdvisor user
521797074.reviewBody: It still a little secret, but i think its the most beautiful place to hang out. you have severals places to swin, just walk along in a scketchy trail. the cascadas are fantastique, you have to paid to get in, to park you car just over the place.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

515615394.name: WOW!!
515615394.author: a TripAdvisor user
515615394.reviewBody:
These cascadas are the best my wife and I have ever done. 40 minutes by taxi from Palenque (the driver will wait for you while exploring and enjoying the refreshing water).
Opened in 2014 it is still not a crowded place.
When you arrive a young guy that lives in the area will guide you  (150/200 pesos is a fair tip) to visit the place from the top to the bottom and if you want  he can guide you to a swimming tour of all the 5 terraces (I strongly suggest to do it) and caves behind the falls. If you have a waterproof camera bring it with you, it's fun to record your jumps and discovering the caves!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

505656332.name: Such Fun
505656332.author: a TripAdvisor user
505656332.reviewBody: What a great time swimming the pools and riding the waterfalls. The local guide was so very helpful and kept a good watch on everyone. Breathtaking, a new experience that would do again.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

498714743.name: Super exciting!!
498714743.author: a TripAdvisor user
498714743.reviewBody: We had such an awesome time st the waterfalls - they are huge and there are different options to go swim. Most of the time we were just by ourselves - a must do when you stay in Palenque!! \n\nJust catch a collectivo from downtown to get there.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

498074951.name: Cool paradise on a blazing hot day.
498074951.author: a TripAdvisor user
498074951.reviewBody: Staff members at our resort (Chan-Kah) recommended this great location and helped us to set up a tour, with only two hours notice! The van-ride to the waterfalls was bumpy, and at times a little scary (by urban U.S. standards), but also remarkably beautiful and educational. The highlands of Chiapas are a patchwork of virgin jungle and human development. On our way to Roberto Barrios we saw rising deep-green mountains, ejidos (small communal farms), a stone quarry, clinics (Autonomous and otherwise), and a healthy dose of Zapatista graffiti. When we arrived at the Cascadas, the heat and humidity were intense in the parking area, but that vanished once we hiked down to the water. The falls were roaring after a historically rainy month. The water wasn\'t exactly crystal clear, but we had faith and got in. If you\'re not an especially strong swimmer, then don\'t go into the deeper pools. I nearly got pulled over a dangerous edge, but that\'s because I was being reckless. Lucky for us that a good guide offered his services, in exchange for half of our lunches! He was a very friendly and harmless stray dog who took us to a second set of falls where we climbed around like giddy children in the tumbling roar of clean cool water. When we emerged, our guide was gone, but we made our way back to the van easily. At Cascadas Roberto Barrios, we found a joy that can\'t adequately be described. You have to experience it for yourself.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

495523119.name: A great fun outing
495523119.author: a TripAdvisor user
495523119.reviewBody: A great excision to these lesser known waterfalls.  We hired some of the young guys who would swim with us across the waterholes then show us the best and safest places to jump from the top of the waterfalls to the waterhole below.\n\nA thrilling day negotiating the waterfalls.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

494068175.name: Vacation
494068175.author: a TripAdvisor user
494068175.reviewBody: Went to visit with my brother.  It was very beautiful and clean.  Water was warm and very clean.  Everyone was very friendly..

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

494066278.name: Awesome waterfalls
494066278.author: a TripAdvisor user
494066278.reviewBody: Once you get there you\'ll be followed by a young boy who will show you the waterfalls. There are 5 or 6 and it\'s good to have him show you as you might miss some. Our guide was really cute and held my hand when going down slippery surfaces! We paid him $100 pesos which he was very happy with. \nThe waterfalls were awesome to swim around, very powerful in parts but rope helps you to not get carried downstream! Very close to palenque and not far from another waterfall.\nNo food to buy at the time we came so eat before!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

494049358.name: After two days of rain....
494049358.author: a TripAdvisor user
494049358.reviewBody: The waterfalls were too violent to swim.  The thundering falls took a bit of effort to get to.  I expected gently tumbling falls with aqua pools for swimming.  The trip took about an hour and cost $250MX (about $14 USD) including park admission.  After the tour of the falls, our small group returned to the palapa & drank beer ($20MX) and socialized.  \nDefinitely check the weather & ask locals about the conditions.  The tour companies are glad to take your $$ whether the falls are aqua and swimmable or brown and violent.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

492577077.name: Highlight of our visit
492577077.author: a TripAdvisor user
492577077.reviewBody: This was our final outing on a week-long visit to Palenque, so we were looking for a mellow outing. Although it rained off and on during the afternoon, it was a truly unique and worthwhile outing. The falls themselves are numerous and spectacular. And, for the moment, relatively undiscovered. You can swim, explore, and kick back all day. There is an old church nearby that we also visited, and a restaurant across the road from the serves some of the best BBQ chicken we have tasted.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

489494370.name: Great Cascada
489494370.author: a TripAdvisor user
489494370.reviewBody: these are the falls to visit!  get there in the morning and you\'ll have them to yourself.  lots of exploration

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

484504857.name: Roberto barrios
484504857.author: a TripAdvisor user
484504857.reviewBody: Roberto barrios has a lot of history it is one of five of the caracoles of the zapatistas. The waterfalls aren\'t huge but they river is pretty wide. If you have a couple extra hours and your in Palenque I would recommended a trip by combi or colectivo.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

480510379.name: Just great !
480510379.author: a TripAdvisor user
480510379.reviewBody:
Hot temperature and willing to swim in a cool and clean water?  ... Go there !
We have been on Sunday = real Mexican spirit ! And it is worth it !
5 cascadas allowing to select the spot you prefer (depending if you want to swim or to play with the water )
No dangerous at all wherever you go

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

474527420.name: Wonderful Cascades
474527420.author: a TripAdvisor user
474527420.reviewBody: 5 top cascades. You can either walk or jump from one to the next one. They are noy too high. Easy to do it. Also with little caves. The locals use the 3rd cascade like a spa. It is better to go before 12.30. It is not as hot and the excursions from palenque arrived at 12.30 so if you want to enjoy the place virtually alone go before 12.00

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

474289678.name: Nothing spectacular but peaceful and not too touristy
474289678.author: a TripAdvisor user
474289678.reviewBody: We heard so much about Roberto Barrios waterfall. So we went all the way to Palenque to check it out.  These waterfalls are nothing spectacular but still pretty much natural and not ruined by tourism.  The kids will accompany you and someone will come and tell you that somebody has just been robbed their belogings.  So you need the kids to look after your stuff while you are swimming.  I pretty much doubt that people from outside will come and steal your stuff because you have to walk through the village to reach the waterfall.  We didn\'t mind hiring the kids.  If you are in the area, it doesn\'t hurt to visit Roberto Barrios waterfall.  But definitely not a destination that you would make from other places like we did from San Crist\u00f3bal de las Casas.  Agua Azul is a lot more spectacular but so ugly with all the stalls, vendors, etc.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

473616489.name: Good good
473616489.author: a TripAdvisor user
473616489.reviewBody: This is so beautiful and theres not as much people as other similar places idk if this review could change that... Visit but keep it a secret, please take care of places like this...

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

470855356.name: Worth the time
470855356.author: a TripAdvisor user
470855356.reviewBody: While not the most spectacular waterfalls in Chiapas they are worth the trip.  An attraction less travelled providing a peaceful day swimming and basking in the sun.  Very few vendors.  Take a combi from Palenque Centro, 50 pesos.  Entrance fee 50 pesos, pack a picnic lunch and just relax the whole day.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

470353516.name: Better than Agua Azul
470353516.author: a TripAdvisor user
470353516.reviewBody: This place even is not as amazing as Agua Azul it\'s a better experience. Remember to arrive early so it is not crowded. You will have to pay for a local guide but is not expensive and it worths the value.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

463343378.name: Beautiful fairly new
463343378.author: a TripAdvisor user
463343378.reviewBody: We did this because it was only 30 min from Palenque, and was recommended. We heard it wasn\'t as commercialized as Agua Azol and Misol Ha, and it was true. Just a dozen local indian vendors selling tostadas and shirts. The water was clean, and they do a good job maintaining it. Go here but please pick up your trash.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

462932144.name: A must do if your around Palenque!
462932144.author: a TripAdvisor user
462932144.reviewBody:
Absolutely fantastic experience to be had here.
you can jump off, slide and even walk down some of these waterfalls. There are some underwater caves you can go into if you're up for it. 
The locals here are super nice and will show you around the waterfalls.
Definitely recommend this place to anyone that fancies a dip. 
This place isn't swarming with tourists either which is nice.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

461609573.name: Spectacular and amzing place. You should not skip it
461609573.author: a TripAdvisor user
461609573.reviewBody:
When we asked a waiter at a hotel what is an easy way to Agua Azul. He suggested us to skip this "overcrowded place" and to visit Cascado de Roberto Barrios instead. "It's a special place" - he told "which local people use for themselves." The main problem is  how to drive there. Nor google neither Apple with Waze answered the question. So, we got the map drown on a piece of napkin and general description. Well, consider it's as a first part of an adventure. 
To our astonishment,  such direction worked. And in an hour we arrived in front of big road sign pointed to Cascada.  When we drove in a small village two person asked us for 20 pecos to enter. Then we parked car on a small street and went down to the river. Actually, we did not have any issues with orientation. After ten minutes walk we arrived in front of the river and small but clear trail leaded as down to waterfalls. 
It was a spectacular view. I think pictures could say better then me. I just can give a few recommendations:
- Start early. There are a lot of local companies come after midday for a picnick.
- Take swim suits. There are people there even in early hours. Do not count on nude swimming
- Buy curved mango. It's  delicious. 
- There is a small grotto under one of waterfall  steps. try to find it 

And last thing. we saw a few local people who worked to improve the trail and river bank. It seems in few years this place will become touristic. Hurry up.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

457558816.name: A day to remember!
457558816.author: a TripAdvisor user
457558816.reviewBody: It costs 20 pesos for admission, but there is an expectation that tourists will hire local boys to to guide them around the falls. Do it! Our group got 3 guys, age 18-25 with one speaking excellent English. They took us on a hike for photo ops and to see the area. Afterward, some of us followed them into the water for 2 hours of diving and sliding through the falls. (The falls close at 5 pm.) I\'m not a daredevil by any means and bailed on 2 of the jumps. The boys made sure one of them was with me to walk me to a less daring jump or to walk to the next point. They told us where to be especially careful around slippery rocks and showed us exactly where to jump. There\'s no set amount to pay the boys, as they work for tips and share money with the entire community. (I gave each 100 pesos because I\'m a scaredy cat and they made sure I always felt safe.) This is definitely a day I will remember forever!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

456311240.name: How to go to Cascada de Roberto Barrios
456311240.author: a TripAdvisor user
456311240.reviewBody:
everyone already  wrote lot how wonderful cascades, so I don't need to write more. so I write about how to go, to be exact where can find transport public to cascade from Palenque by yourself in my experience.

colectivo (pickup type, not small van) is waiting at almost corner between calle Quinta Pre. Nte. and Quita Avenida Nte. Pre. Walking on 5A. AVENIDA NORTE PONIENTE for Bodega Aurora (big supermarket) behind PARQUE CENTRAL, and one block before Bodega Aurora turn right on calle Quinta Pre. Nte.. There are lot of colectivos but not only for cascade, so have to ask to driver. 
it costs 50pesos (maybe price for tourist) and takes 30 minutes till entrance of cascade. there pay 20pesos for entrance. last colectivo for Palenque comes at 16:00 but in my case came early at 15:50 better to have time waiting there.

the way to cascades is a little bit complicated because of walking in the forest and uneasy way sometimes. so better to accompany local chico or follow somebody!

and at last absolutely have to swim in cascade! enjoy!

多くの人が滝の素晴らしさについて書いているのでここでは個人で行く方法を書きます。中央公園を背に5A. AVENIDA NORTE PONIENTE通りをBodega Aurora（スーパーマーケット）に向かって歩きます。スーパーマーケットの一つ手前の通り（ calle Quinta Pre. Nte.）を右に曲がるとコレクティーボなどが多く停まっています。私が乗ったのはトラックタイプなのでコレクティーボではないのですがコレクティーボもあるかもしれません。滝行きだけではないのでドライバーに確認してください。
料金は50ペソ（恐らく観光客価格）で所要30分前後。滝の入口で降りて、そこで入場料20ペソを支払います。パレンケに戻る最終コレクティーボは４時と言われましたが私が乗ったのは３時５０分だったので早めに着て待っている方が無難です。

そこから森に入って６つの滝を巡るのですが道が途中から分かりずらくなっているので（未舗装なので）チップを渡して地元の子とかと一緒に行くかどこかのグループについていく方が安全です。

最後にここは絶対に泳がないと醍醐味が味わえないので是非泳いでください！では楽しんで！

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

456043692.name: Unreal!
456043692.author: a TripAdvisor user
456043692.reviewBody: Not easy to get to, lots of climbing involved, cold water but so lovely! Good fund raiser for locals, support local guides & crafts.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

454277936.name: Adventure in nature
454277936.author: a TripAdvisor user
454277936.reviewBody: After visiting the pyramids of Palenque it is exciting to discover a natural place rarely visited by tourists but with a surprising beauty, perhaps even more than the waterfalls of Agua Azul that also keep a formidable charm.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

453191345.name: Most highly recommended place to visit
453191345.author: a TripAdvisor user
453191345.reviewBody: This is the best waterfall I ever visited.  I visited Ocho Rios in Jamaica and Aguas Azures in Chiapas.  They are similar, but Casdaca de Roberto Barrios is by far the best.  It only cost my family (of 5 people) 100 pesos.  Then you get to enjoy the whole waterfall (cascada) for as long as you want.  This place is not crowded like Ocho Rios or Aguas Azures.  You get to venture up and down the waterfall.  There is no official watch or guide, but some locals offer some guides there; how to slide the rocks, where to dive, and so forth.  You pay him a tip as you feel.  I paid the local 50 pesos and he seemed to be happy.  This place is definitely under rated.  You got go before it get crowded.  It takes about 30 min from Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

448909093.name: Amazing
448909093.author: a TripAdvisor user
448909093.reviewBody: Is like Aguas Azules, just less crowded. Walking in the jungle is amazing, water is perfect for swiming or just walking in it. Gorgeus!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

447473011.name: Fun! The locals are pushy to guide you or watch your car.
447473011.author: a TripAdvisor user
447473011.reviewBody: We had heard there was a  guide who was non verbal and when he approached we didn\'t have the heart to refuse his services.  He was actually able to communicate a lot and we had a great time with his assistance. It would be fine to experience this without a guide but you might miss the secret caves and bottle slide without one. Don\'t pay the kids to watch your car...

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

444555785.name: Closer and calmer than Aqua Azul and very beautiful
444555785.author: a TripAdvisor user
444555785.reviewBody: The beautiful area consists of 5 major aqua blue falls which are connected by trails.  Great swimming holes on a hot day.  The only complaint was the kids following us around wanting to be guides.  We had cameras, phones and wallet with us and never felt like it was safe to set anything down so my wife and I had to swim separately.  If we had taken the time to cross the river, there was a place to walk out on the rocks and sit away from the kids but I suspect they might follow you until you give them money. Aqua Azul was way too far of a drive from Palenque and more crowded.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

440111358.name: Wow!
440111358.author: a TripAdvisor user
440111358.reviewBody: We visited Roberto Barrios a week ago and we really loved it! Amazing waterfulls which you can walk on, nice pools and wounderfull views! Highly recomended!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

434828476.name: A quiet beauty
434828476.author: a TripAdvisor user
434828476.reviewBody: Knowing the rainy season would make the big falls (Aqua Azule) pretty murky, we asked our hotel manager for a good place to swim near Palenque, and he recommended Roberto Barrios Falls. This was a 30 minute van ride out of town (pretty challenging to find the Roberto Barrios Van) and totally worth it. The hike down to  the cascadas was guided by a local man who, for a few pesos, showed us the different falls, pools and safe swimming areas. The water was cool and refreshing, the falls were beautiful, and very few people were around (another big difference from Aqua Azule, which we heard would be filled with vendors, - the selling of wares by indigenous people in Chiapas is WAY out of control. San Cristobal was almost unbearable for the street hustle there, which included very small children who would come into restaurants and buildings to sell, sell, sell). We found this location very relaxing and beautiful, there are no changing areas or cabanas, so come with your suits on.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

431639666.name: No crowds nice falls
431639666.author: a TripAdvisor user
431639666.reviewBody: About 45 minutes out of town on local shuttle bus.  No crowds a series of about 5 or six nice falls with many swimming opportunities next to a cute little village. Very pretty.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

431264731.name: Peaceful and undeveloped
431264731.author: a TripAdvisor user
431264731.reviewBody:
This gem is about 45 minutes from Palenque town, at the time of writing for the price of 40mx$ with a collectivo. Be aware that there are not many collectivos going there or bringing you back. Miss the last one and you are stuck in the low profile dusty but friendly village at the entrance. We had the same driver both ways.
Nice waterfalls, swimming areas (at own risk) and a lack of paved roads is what make this my favourite place.

Remember to ask permission before taking pictures of the locals, they tend to appreciate this.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

429679266.name: Hidden treasure
429679266.author: a TripAdvisor user
429679266.reviewBody: Google maps is wrong about the location of these awesome waterfalls. They are about 30 mi s from Palenque and simply incredible. Bring plenty of change with you to pay the entrance and give the children some coins for showing you around. Swimming in the pools is exhilarating.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

427733480.name: A hidden Paradise
427733480.author: a TripAdvisor user
427733480.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfalls full of water.  Empty of tourist and locals.   Almost all alone for us. \nDon\u2019t miss it!!!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

426423173.name: Beautiful
426423173.author: a TripAdvisor user
426423173.reviewBody: You\'re surrounded by locals very humble people. The waster falls are amazing. We continued to walk further down to find a location we would be able to lay and set our things down. The pools that are created between waterfalls are the perfect place to swim.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

416579834.name: One of the best trips we made around Palenque
416579834.author: a TripAdvisor user
416579834.reviewBody:
Many people will visit Agua Azul since this is offered by most tour operators, and the only fall discussed in the Lonely Planet. However it is worth to avoid the tourist crowds and visit the waterfalls of Roberto Barrios instead. 

When we visited the falls last month we haven't seen a single tourist, and we had a great time together with one of the local people as a guide. Initially we were a bit skeptical whether we could get there and away on our own using the 'collectivos'. However this is rather simple, go to the junction of 5a Avenida Nte. Pte. and Cuarta Pte. Nte, and ask around for the collectivos to Roberto Barrios. We found them by starting to ask around near the ADO bus terminal, and people where directing us to the 5th Avenida, asking a few more people on 5th Avenida pointed in the same direction, and eventually we found where the collectivos left. 

It is a 40 minute drive to Roberto Barrios, and it will cost around 50 Peso p.p. When you arrive at Roberto Barrios there is a small hut which serves as the 'entrance', there you have to pay 20 Pesos p.p. After you bought the entrance tickets, a local will offer you to be your guide. I would advice to accept their help, also for your own safety. They know the falls, where it is best to swim, where you can dive, and also where it is safe to slide down from one stage to the stage below (this was really fun!). They will also watch your stuff while you enjoy swimming in the falls. Our guide was super friendly, and was never in a hurry or bored to get back. I think they also like guiding the few visitors per day, it gives them also an incentive to spend some time in the falls and to cool down, instead of hanging around the entrance.

After a few hours enjoying the falls, we went back with our guide. He didn't even ask for a tip, but of course you can't and don't want to leave without. We gave him around 100 Mxn. After a short wait near the entrance, a collective back to Palenque arrived. 

Looking back we were really happy that we went to Roberto Barrios ourselves with a Collectivo, instead of a tour/taxi to Agua Azul. The waterfalls are very beautiful, there are hardly any tourist and it is super cheap. (In total we spend p.p: 120MXN p.p. excluding the tip for the guide)

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

416531636.name: Unexplored water falls.
416531636.author: a TripAdvisor user
416531636.reviewBody: Very small indigenous town, or pueblita in state/region of Chiapas, Mexico. This small village has group of blue waterfalls and tourism is just pitching into this beautifull place. Remeber it is very small village - no place to stay or to buy items. So you need to bring all your food, and plan to leave back Palenque town by evening. The collectivos mostly stop running by 6:00 in the evening, butlater you have can go for special rides from the collectivo owners houses which is normally expensive. Also you need to pay 10-20 Pesos to local community friendly people and if you speak spanish you can ask someone to accompany you to show all falls and caves in jungle. But this falls and caves are close each other, so you can explore them your own always. Be carefull with hidden rocks while jumping from cliffs if you are your own, check for rocks before jumping :)

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

400181140.name: unexpected incredible place
400181140.author: a TripAdvisor user
400181140.reviewBody: My friends and I booked a tour with a guy (like a taxi driver) that took us there and helped us during the whole morning to discover and explore this incredible place. It was the best place I visited in Chiapas. I totally encourage you to explore all the falls nearby and jump into the water. it was amazing. \nI\'d do it again 100 times.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

387267847.name: A Must See If In the Area
387267847.author: a TripAdvisor user
387267847.reviewBody: If it has not rained for a few days, the water will be aqua blue.  We arrived after a couple days of rain and the water was chocolate milk color.  But impressive none the less.  If you go, look to spot "Puff, the Magic Dragon."  Nearly 2 hours out of Palenque on winding roads.  The drive is worth seeing all the different people and very small villages of the hill country.  Reminded me of Costa Rica in lots of GREEN ways!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

374509637.name: Beautiful waterfalls area
374509637.author: a TripAdvisor user
374509637.reviewBody: I visited the place with an organized tour group. A young local guide joined us to walk us through the waterfalls, showing where it was safe to jump and slide (on plastic bottles:)). There are many spots good to stop and rest by the water or go in and swim. Very reccomnded! I really hope it stays clean and beautiful even with all the tourists finding out about it.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

373382347.name: Worth it
373382347.author: a TripAdvisor user
373382347.reviewBody: Not crowded. Real jungle waterfall experience. We hired a taxi to take us and wait there for 2 hours and were glad we did. Went swimming in several areas, each time it was just us. We did hire one of the local kids to walk us around for a tip. Im not sure that we actually said we wanted a guide, they kind of just lead you, which was fine with us since we had no idea where we were going . They left us after 30 minutes and we continued on. We weren\'t scared about getting lost at that point since if you stay near the water, you can just follow the water line back up. Nice alternative from the Disneyland experience of agua azul.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

370501185.name: Worth it!
370501185.author: a TripAdvisor user
370501185.reviewBody: We didn\'t visit the other waterfalls, but I had heard they can get crowded. This place was perfect. It was around 45 minutes outside of Palenque, on a nice drive. We just took a random taxi out there and had him stick around for around 2 hours. You basically drive into this very small village, walk into the woods a bit, and come upon these beautiful cascading waterfalls. It was very pretty and great to swim in them, you can even do a few jumps and go in some small caves.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

366050655.name: Amazing waterfalls
366050655.author: a TripAdvisor user
366050655.reviewBody: After having a BBQ with a nearby family we went swimming in the Roberto Barios-waterfalls. It was an amazing experience with clear water and some good jumps to do. You don\'t see many tourists around here but more locals. Take your food and drinks with you, because there isn\'t much around.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

362017086.name: Beautiful!
362017086.author: a TripAdvisor user
362017086.reviewBody: Very very beautiful. This waterfall is not commercially explored like the others, so theres not much tourists in it. You can enter the water everywhere, and enjoy a very clean crystal cool water. So much better than agua azul!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

355354589.name: Great Afternoon in the Water
355354589.author: a TripAdvisor user
355354589.reviewBody: My family of four (two elementary aged kids) had a great time at this waterfall. We drove there (decent signage on the road) and showed where to park. While driving there, the road was empty and we were wondering if this had been a good idea. There were several other cars and collectivos in the parking lot, so we felt good. We paid 10 pesos per person (kids were not free) and the parking attendant also charged us 10 pesos to park. However, we think this is because he didn\'t want to give us change. He didn\'t charge the people next to us for parking. Bring exact change! Two 18-ish year olds walked us to the waterfall and gave us a guide of the area. Other guides were walking their groups through the waterfall (yes, in the water and showing them a safe path to go). We didn\'t do this because of our young kids. There were several swimming holes and women selling food. \nThe highlight was walking on top of the big falls and enjoying the incredible views. We\'d highly recommend this falls.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

353635815.name: Incredible Blues within Jungle Greens
353635815.author: a TripAdvisor user
353635815.reviewBody: My favorite day in Palenque was spent here.  Not so easy to get to without a rental car but well worth the effort of local transportation.  Roberto Barrios has several falls.  Be sure and gather one of the many children waiting on the road to act as your guide to the swimming falls and he\'ll watch your stuff for you while you swim.  Ask about the caves behind the falls, and if you are feeling really crazy, ask to use the deflated Pepsi liters to slide down a huge rock to the river section below.  Only in Mexico!  Be sure and leave them a generous tip! And ladies, off to the right as you walk down the dirt road to the falls, look for a beautiful young woman sitting under a palapa embroidering blouses.  I love the one I bought!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

351857881.name: Amazing falls and less packed than Agua Azul
351857881.author: a TripAdvisor user
351857881.reviewBody: Guided swims down the falls and the guides are decently safety conscious without being restrictive. Treat yourself - this is a fabulous place!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

348701363.name: My favorite falls.
348701363.author: a TripAdvisor user
348701363.reviewBody: We visited the six falls and had a great time. The green water was beautiful and the tour guides were friendly. It was cold so we didn\'t swim..next time. This was our favorite due to the beautiful water and great photos.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

344039740.name: Few visitors, gorgeous blue water from cobalt mineral
344039740.author: a TripAdvisor user
344039740.reviewBody: See a village, pay 50 for parking and 50 each person well worth it to help the young person who guides you and lives on this income.\nYou see several waterfalls on the tour, which lasts maybe half an hour. It was about 40min from hotel and drive through jungle was gorgeous.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

343682744.name: Much better than Agua Azul- the most beautiful I\'ve seen
343682744.author: a TripAdvisor user
343682744.reviewBody: Roberto Barrios is a series of waterfalls off the beaten path, perhaps 20 minutes from the Palenque ruins.  They were breathtaking.  I\'ve been to Victoria Falls, and Niagra Falls, and though these don\'t come close in sheer volume, the beauty is even more extraordinary.  Also, much less touristed than options like Agua Azul.  We saw perhaps 15 people in the hour and a half we were there.  Picked up a nice "guide" where we parked our car and it was well worth the 5 bucks he charged.  You can swim in sections, and some people actually walked on the falls themselves.  Unlike virtually every other waterfall I\'ve seen, these bow outward like small domes because they are made of limestone deposits.  I\'ve attached a few pix to do is justice.  Breathtaking and  feels like you\'ve stepped into southeast asia.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

342815563.name: Less crowded and spectacular
342815563.author: a TripAdvisor user
342815563.reviewBody: A less visited waterfall area, Roberto Barios is worth the side trip. Lovely for swimming without all the tourists stands of Agua Azul. It is a more natural setting. You are guided by local kids who were fun to talk with. They carried my bag and helped me along, very kind and protective to the "abuela". Not quite as spectaular as Agua Azul, but the quieter setting makes it a wonderful outing.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

340271894.name: Virgin Cascades
340271894.author: a TripAdvisor user
340271894.reviewBody: If you are looking for a clean space to swimm and be calm this is it. No people. You will be by yourself

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

339287169.name: Idyllic if you are brave
339287169.author: a TripAdvisor user
339287169.reviewBody: This is a private community that permits access to this stunning Series of waterfalls  (more like cascades of water over rocks) where you can walk down then jump into the pools\nBeautiful but quite steep, boys will help carry your drinks & cool box down if you want & then guide you around (for a minimal tip)\nYou can just swim around until various pools but if you are going with others & they are being guided by the boys it\'s easy to be left behind & not find them until they return some time later so agree plans in advance

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

327720909.name: Amazing and Dangerous :-)
327720909.author: a TripAdvisor user
327720909.reviewBody: We took a collectivo not far from the center. Just asked for other collectivo drivers where it is. 40 mxn and 40 minutes of driving up the hills. 20 mxn for the entrance and tips for a guy, that showed us the cascades. Some places were dangerous to climb and jump, but some were fun. We felt couple of times and skrached ourselves on the rocks, but it\'s a part of the fun. Soon this place will be very touristic so hurry up to visit the bare nature. Bring good water shoes that don\'t slip or go bare foot.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

323478854.name: Beautiful waterfalls
323478854.author: a TripAdvisor user
323478854.reviewBody: The waterfalls are next to a small community were you have to pay a small fee to visit, however, the people use it to build stairs and huts next to the river and enjoy the place. A small kid Luis Miguel was our guide and showed us the 4 waterfalls, he was very good taking us pictures. \n

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

322701887.name: Stunning
322701887.author: a TripAdvisor user
322701887.reviewBody: Go there and jump from one to the next waterfall, slide down, walk barefoot, let your spirit feel free while listening the water going down.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

322172378.name: Sweet memories
322172378.author: a TripAdvisor user
322172378.reviewBody: After we visited the archeological site of Palenque Kim Tours took us at the Cascado de Roberto Barrios.  Francisco our Site guide together with the local kids took us for a walk along the river and the cascades.  For company the screaming monkeys.  Muddy sometimes slippery it was for us  nice  to remember our walks in the jungle when we lived in Sarawak (Borneo).  Do not expect Iguazu Falls !!!\nNicole and Marcello - (Ariccia/Roma) - October 5-9, 2015

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

314143448.name: Hidden treasuree of palenque.
314143448.author: a TripAdvisor user
314143448.reviewBody: This is a better alternative than going to Agua Azul. Less tourists and better conection with nature. Try to find the hidden underwater cave. :) enjoy

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

312231174.name: The real deal ,,Cascadas hermosas virgenes
312231174.author: a TripAdvisor user
312231174.reviewBody:
This place is great we  did it all 
In Palenque and Had one more day to hang out ....
are front desk guy Juan told us about is home town village where he grew up , and invited us. The next day  he had a day so we decided to check it out  and it was the most beautiful waterfalls  we saw on are trip to Palenque  was so pure and beautiful.  Especially we got a tour from a real local  guy and we spent. The day swimming and cliff jumping with Juan are hotel guy and his beautiful girlfriend   Afterna great day swiming we. Had lunch in the only place in town POLLOS  los CARNALES  asados  incredible WITH hand made tortillaS,,,,tortillas echas a mano. And asked the owner to play a song he loves.  to play the guitar  great host.  So
Check it out    Waterfalls and pollos los Carnales in cascadas roberto barrioss. U have to
Check it out

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

303955960.name: Better alternative to Agua Azul
303955960.author: a TripAdvisor user
303955960.reviewBody: We visited Roberto Barrios after seeing Palenque. After the heat of Palenque, it was so refreshing to cool off in the pools here. It was fun to slide down the falls and jump off the ledges into the pools too. It\'s a beautiful setting and is close to Palenque. And the best part was that it was almost deserted - only a few locals enjoying the pools. We heard mixed reports about Agua Azul - but mostly that it was overcrowded with tourists. This was not the case here. Also, Agua Azul tends to be visited on a group tour from San Cristobal to Palenque BEFOREHAND reaching Palenque (as it\'s quite a distance from it). But you want to swim in the pools AFTER visiting Palenque, to cool off! Hopefully all these good reviews won\'t make Roberto barrios too popular, as its relative lack of visitors is what makes it so nice.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

298825151.name: Beautiful!
298825151.author: a TripAdvisor user
298825151.reviewBody: This place was amazing! It was so refreshing and a lot of fun to trek down the six waterfalls and swim in the crystal clear water. A local boy also showed us the caves underneath the waterfalls and the easiest way to trek down them. As its quite a secluded place there were hardly any tourists which made it that much more beautiful. Would absolutely recommend, you won\'t want to leave here and don\'t forget to bring a GoPro!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

298514165.name: Great nature!
298514165.author: a TripAdvisor user
298514165.reviewBody: It\'s the place where I want to stay forever. The most beautiful nature, nice people working where and even a natural infinity-pool! Is is just perfect. and this place is twice closer to Palenque than the famous Agua Azul Falls.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

292798252.name: It is a must!
292798252.author: a TripAdvisor user
292798252.reviewBody: This is a must in your visit to Palenque and it is very close to the city.  With much less visitors than all of the other Cascadas, these are a series of waterfalls and waters to swim which are beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

285636020.name: Must see!
285636020.author: a TripAdvisor user
285636020.reviewBody: This place is a must! Amazing views and waters to swim. No so much advertised yet, so it is very likely you will have less other people or won\'t havr them at all ( as in our case). Once driving there ignore first banner saying Entrance. Drvive further until locals will meet you charge you for tickets. Park at the small church. Local guide is mandatory ( for a small tip) and belive me you\'ll need him to find all ways.\n

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

281357181.name: Hidden Gem
281357181.author: a TripAdvisor user
281357181.reviewBody: You must visit this place, there are 6 Cascadas where you can choose to dip in. Some are better than other ones, but all of them are beautiful. Nice spot for naturelovers.\nAsk for a tour guide.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

274668369.name: something you must visit
274668369.author: a TripAdvisor user
274668369.reviewBody:
these are waterfalls with a particular beauty. they are a little hidden from what we usually know about touristic places, but it totally worth a visit. 
fortunatelly, here you won't find any touristic development, so, the place keeps natural. 

You can choose to enjoy 1 of the 6 waterfalls locations or swim in all of them if you have enough time. I just recomend to be careful and not to feel so confident even when you are a great swimer.

when you arrive here, local people try to reach you to help you to carry your things and show you the way, they will spect some tip, i recommend to take this service and give them $30 or $50.

you can bring your beverages and snacks even a freezer. But if you don't bring anything, there is a small store where you can buy. Ask the local people, they are pleaced to help.

to access the waterfalls you have to pay $50 per person, i'm not so sure, i can't remember the exactly ammount, but i remember it is really cheap and beautiful there.

to get there, i recommend you to stay at palenque, there are no hotels or anything in  the waterfalls, some people do camping but it is dangerous, so please, avoid it.

so... from palenque, take the road to ocozingo, then take the road to Benemerito de las Americas (you wil take a deviation to your left when you find the road sign). You keep straight on the road and at the km 14 you will find a deviation to your right to the waterfalls. Please stay alert because this sign is a little hidden and you could missed it. This is like a country road, keep straight and you will cross a bridge with a beautiful view, after this bridge you will arrive to the community of Roberto Barrios.

from Palenque, it takes like 30 minutes to get there, maybe less.

once you are there, keep on the road and you will find the signs to the waterfalls or you can ask to the local people. A few steps from the waterfalls you can park your vehicle.

if you are visiting this natural jewel, keep in mind that you should be there before 4 pm the access can be denied after 5pm.

have fun!!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

271560448.name: Nice little spot, worth a visit :)
271560448.author: a TripAdvisor user
271560448.reviewBody: It is quite cheap to get there (70-80pesos with collectives and entrance) and it is an uncrowded and lovely little area. There are many waterfalls and you can take an easy short hike to see them all. You can walk and swim on most of them, and stand under several :)\nThe local kids are really nice, make sure to bring a bit of extra change to buy something from them :)\nIt is a nice alternative, if you wanna avoid the crowds and go where the locals go.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

263338616.name: Hidden Treasure!!!
263338616.author: a TripAdvisor user
263338616.reviewBody: These are the most beautiful waterfalls of Chiapas by far!! i was in total Awwww of this place especially after my terrible experience at Agua Azul, i highly recommend you go here, its worth every minute!! although no tourist service provides this cause ots off the beaten track but taking a local Auto from Palenque will take you straight to the site. The locals and caretakers were extremely nice and not once did we feel unsafe or cheated. You wont find shops or venders selling you things, you dont have to walk through 100 stalls to get there just simply free and easy. I think we aid only 20p to get in and you got a guide with you, when we tipped him he was refusing the tip!!I can go on but it simply is magical here!!! SOOOOO WORTH IT!!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

261971529.name: Beautiful location and sweet people
261971529.author: a TripAdvisor user
261971529.reviewBody: Our family decided to visit this site since we were in the area. Our two young guides were very thorough in showing us all the different waterfalls to be seen and they were so polite and friendly we really enjoyed their company on the trails. The waterfalls were magnificent and the water was such an amazing color is made for some really picturesque scenes. We also heard a cacophony of howler monkeys in the nearby trees!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

260641318.name: Amazing
260641318.author: a TripAdvisor user
260641318.reviewBody: Incredible experience, just ask for Franciso as your guide. He is mute, but he knows all the best places to dive and swim. Lovely fellow

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

251568048.name: Cascada
251568048.author: a TripAdvisor user
251568048.reviewBody: quite a hike, it might have been the time of year but very wet and muddy.  the sites were impressive and nature never lets you down. \n

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

240902187.name: Amazing amazing amazing
240902187.author: a TripAdvisor user
240902187.reviewBody: We read about this place on TripAdvisor,  but no one in Palenque seemed to know how to get there. There were no tours or public transport. However, after asking 20 or so "collectivo" drivers, one driver took us 20km out of town to a road where we had to take another collectivo to Roberto Barrios (just keep on asking). After 30 minutes there was a collectivo coming from Palenque (there seems to be 1 direct collectivo from Palenque each day) and it took us to the town. The collectivos were both 15 pesos and the entrance fee to the falls 40 pesos. The place is amazing! Several falls with blue water, no people and rocks and trees from which you can jump into the water. This place is paradise. We hitchiked back to Palenque since there was no collectivo (last one seems to be at 15.00). Go to these falls! This was a "traveller\'s dream" experience. Finding a pristine and undiscovered place all to yourself.....

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

237590227.name: If I could give it more stars, I would!
237590227.author: a TripAdvisor user
237590227.reviewBody:
(To get there: Going South, in the big intersection to go to Agua Azul go left for a little over 7 Km, turn right in the paved road and go for 14 km to the town of Roberto Barrios, once in the central park ask for some guides to the waterfall, usually a couple of kids).
