It's like you're walking your way back in time to the Jurassic... tall thick jungle, howler monkeys, small dirt trails and then the first waterfall... WOW, walk a little more and the second and third, triple WOW, you get the idea!

You will so not regret going on this adventure! not developed at all, pristine environment, cristal clear to cobalt blue pools, one wow after an other and it's all for your self, only a couple of more tourists but the place is huge, you feel like one with nature.

The towns people will charge $20 pesos per adult, children are free and $10 for parking; take all you need from the car once you get there, 'cause once your there no one wants to go back for anything.

Don't believe the pictures, they don't make it any justice!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

236967186.name: Amazingly beautiful
236967186.author: a TripAdvisor user
236967186.reviewBody: These waterfalls are yet undiscoverd by massive tourism, which makes them a quite unique experience. We were able to swim in the clear blue water by ourselves, which we weren\'t able to in e.g. Agua Azul or Misol Ha, because of the lack of time and huge amount of tourists (we were with a tour). A local in Palenque told us about these waterfalls and we went there by colectivo. The ride took us about 45 minutes. When we arrived we had to pay a small entrance fee to some guys who appeared to be just chilling in the shade. Another guy was also working on some sanitary facilities, which gave me the idea they were expecting larger groups and perhaps tours to visit soon. Anyway, I believe that if you want to get the unique experience of being there by yourself you better be quick, as it likely won\'t remain undiscovered.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

225008017.name: Beautiful and refreshing
225008017.author: a TripAdvisor user
225008017.reviewBody: Well off the beaten path - we went as part of a small tour group. When you get there, find the local children who know the falls well and hire them to guide you - they will show you things like a small caves that you reach by swimming under rocks. You can work your way down the falls, jumping from one level to the next. Hours of refreshing fun in a beautiful setting.

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

157254297.name: beautiful alternative to more famous agua azul
157254297.author: a TripAdvisor user
157254297.reviewBody: perfect waterfalls to swim and cool down in, there are no shops and restaurants with souvenirs, but there are local kids that are more than happy to beg you for a tip (usually for no service) so if you want to get rid of them have some change ready. its worth the visit and its a beautiful place!

address.streetAddress: Comunidad de Roberto Barrios

664236833.name: A lovely walk
664236833.author: a TripAdvisor user
664236833.reviewBody: The falls are beautiful, but the walk was interesting with lots of flowers and birds, and not too steep.  Also, there\u2019s a nice gift shop and snacks so that you can help support the local people.  It was a wonderful place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

651467037.name: Small but Powerful
651467037.author: a TripAdvisor user
651467037.reviewBody: Misol-Ha is a single tall waterfall forcefully making it\u2019s way through surrounding jungle.  I really enjoy all kinds of waterfalls so this one was no exception. The place is quite small, we came around 16h on a Saturday and it wasn\u2019t crowded. You can go behind the waterfall and into a cave (10$MX per person) which has an inner small waterfall and lots of bats (\ud83e\udd87 \ud83e\udd87\ud83e\udd87). On the way in you are charged first 10$mx per person and few meters down 20$mx/ person.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

643587361.name: Misol-Ha
643587361.author: a TripAdvisor user
643587361.reviewBody: Misol Ha \nThis waterfall is beautiful and the surroundings full of vegetation the jungle and all the birds singing it is so peaceful you need to visit this place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

641692946.name: Not wow
641692946.author: a TripAdvisor user
641692946.reviewBody:
It is a high waterfall.
The Park brings you to the base.
The is a cave in the waterfall base which is nice to visit - small but nice (the is another water spring inside the cave) .
The cave is at an extra cost but it is only 10 pesos a person with is 0.5 a dollar.
You can take a guide for a voluntary fee ( will walk you through and provide lamps).
About the waterfall- the are straits to climb down to the water pool at the base and later climb up.
Not accessible to wheelchair!
The is a restaurant and toilets.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

640583269.name: pretty waterfall
640583269.author: a TripAdvisor user
640583269.reviewBody:
On our anniversary earlier this year my husband and I visited Mexico. We drove between San Cristobal de las Casas and Palenque and stopped at the Misol-Ha waterfall along the way.

We did bring swim gear but the area to get into the water was very crowded and looked a little slippery so we just walked around the path and stood under some fun trickling areas. There was a cave, that was bordered off, that water was running through and it was pretty to look at the flowing water even if we couldn't walk back there.

There were a lot of people. Some kids, around 10 to 13 years old were in the area we were standing to also get wet from the splashes. They were polite and wanted to practice their English with us.  

Another cool thing, in the area between the parking and the waterfall area were large trees full of howling monkeys. They were so loud and active in the trees, it was neat.

Though I planned to swim and ended up not I am still glad we stopped, it is a relatively small area, but still quite pretty. There is a small restaurant and store near the parking area too. We did eat there and it was decent, though not great, and checked out the small store.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

638954049.name: Nice to swim
638954049.author: a TripAdvisor user
638954049.reviewBody: After visiting the Cascadas de agua azul which were kind of disappointing as these were brown due to heavy rainfalls, stopping in Misol-ha to get fresh was really nice

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

631808954.name: Power of water
631808954.author: a TripAdvisor user
631808954.reviewBody: Impressive falls & nice that you can also get behind them to truly see the power of the water. \nNot the same as Agua Azul which comprehenses a series of many falls, but definitely worth a visit!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

629452465.name: Great place to visit.
629452465.author: a TripAdvisor user
629452465.reviewBody: I did visit in September so as I understand it, the water fall is not as a strong as it usually is but it still makes for a beautiful place. Parking is easily available, you can walk down towards the falls and even walk behind it if you don\'t mind a little water.\nNow there is a small toll or price to enter (admission) and there is a small toll to enter on the road. Nothing major, just make sure you have some pesos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

625624682.name: Not worth it
625624682.author: a TripAdvisor user
625624682.reviewBody:
We payed 10 pesos per person to enter the park and another 20 per person to enter the cascade. 

When we were to pay the 20 pesos we gave a 100 pesos bill to pay 40 pesos and they didn't have change. They remained there like idiots with the 100 pesos bill not doing anything. At the end, we gave 31 pesos we had in coins and they were playing fools to also keep the 100 pesos. Thieves!

The cascade is simply nothing special. I have seen way better. So, I wouldn't recommend to waste your time. 

We went with "colectivo" (small buss) and is 40 pesos to go and another 40 to come back to palenque city. 

When you go, the colectivo leaves you in the entrance of the park and you have to walk about 2 km to get to the cascade.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

622263851.name: Small but pretty
622263851.author: a TripAdvisor user
622263851.reviewBody: It\'s a nice waterfall but it is a pretty small area to visit. 30 minutes is plenty unless you want to swim.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

611270822.name: Nice swim
611270822.author: a TripAdvisor user
611270822.reviewBody: The cascada is really great to see, we did visit it after Agua azul it was fresh and good to swim here, there is a cave but we didn\'t visit it because we had only 30min there

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

605088684.name: Misol Ha is worth a stop
605088684.author: a TripAdvisor user
605088684.reviewBody: We stopped by this beautiful waterfall on the way from Palenque to San Cristobal, by way of another impressive archeological site, Tonina.  After being in the crowded site of Palenque, this beautiful natural setting was a lovely respite.  It\'s run by people from the communal lands (ejido) who are hoping to attract more eco tourist.  Fantastic place for a picnic and a swim.  Were were told Misol-Ha could get very crowded during Semana Santa, but in early August it was green and lush and only one other couple was there. So grateful to have the opportunity to see this.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

601145599.name: Beautiful Cascadas!
601145599.author: a TripAdvisor user
601145599.reviewBody: We arrived with an hour before closing, but it was well worth the trip! the Cascadas de Misol-Ha were breathtaking. There is a place to swim, though we chose not to, but again, it\'s available. The place was really worth the drive to it. Beauty in Chiapas!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

595729159.name: Beautiful waterfall
595729159.author: a TripAdvisor user
595729159.reviewBody: Very beautiful waterfall with a little cave, but don\'t spend too much time here. There isn\'t much to do besides that.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

594782697.name: Big, gorgeous waterfall
594782697.author: a TripAdvisor user
594782697.reviewBody: Miso-ha cascades are typically a pit stop destination if you decide to do a tour. It\'s an impressive, breath-taking waterfall. There\'s a short pathway you can walk (about 1/4 of a mile) to appreciate the waterfall from almost underneath it. You can swim here, so take your swim clothes. However, if you\'re going with a tour, you\'ll probably be pressed for time. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

590264379.name: Quick pit stop
590264379.author: a TripAdvisor user
590264379.reviewBody: There isn\'t really much to see here, but I would still say it\'s worth a stop. I like that you can walk behind the waterfall!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

587284242.name: Beautiful little waterfall in the middle of the jungle.
587284242.author: a TripAdvisor user
587284242.reviewBody:
The place is magical the waterfall is a small tall thin one, 45 meters high, the pond where if falls is nice, and you can have a good swim there. You can walk behind the water curtain on a path they made. There is also a little cave behind the waterfall with a tiny waterfall coming out of the wall.
You can either make a superfast visit, go take the picture wet your feet, and go away, that its what most people do. But this way yo will not be able to feel the place. You can also stay in rustic cabins they have for rent, and stay one or two night to have a peaceful stay, then you can walk into the jungle though the trails they have. The flora and fauna there are abundant and wonderful, you can see and hear howling monkeys, among many other jungle creatures. The cabins are very simple but clean. The family cabins have a kitchenette and a little dining room, so you can also cook your meals there. 
The restaurant is super efficient, fast, and the food is excellent.
The entire place is run by an indigenous community. People are a bit shy but super friendly once the first simile appears on any side. They keep the area impecable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

583417416.name: A tropical postcard
583417416.author: a TripAdvisor user
583417416.reviewBody: The falls are majestic. It is a great opportunity to sit and enjoy the beauty, sound and feel of the falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

577202145.name: Nice waterfall but not outstanding.
577202145.author: a TripAdvisor user
577202145.reviewBody: The falls are nice and there\'s also a cave that you have to pay 30 Pesos extra to get into that has a small waterfall in it, very small actually but novel.\n\nThere\'s the main falls and some smaller ones along the path that takes you behind the falls and to the cave I mentioned.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

572299963.name: Nice to see as part of a bigger plan
572299963.author: a TripAdvisor user
572299963.reviewBody: The Misol-h\u00e1 waterfall is beautiful.\nIt\u2019s a very quick spot to see.\nIf you have time please do take a swim!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

570930429.name: Just beautiful
570930429.author: a TripAdvisor user
570930429.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfall with a small hidden cavern. Good place to spend a couple of hours. The water is perfect for a swim in a hot day. They have cabins to spend the night there and there\u2019s a restaurant by the parking lot. Wear comfy clothes and make sure you take your swimwear.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

570169084.name: Bring a Swimsuit
570169084.author: a TripAdvisor user
570169084.reviewBody: Beautiful tall waterfall with a walkway behind it and a pool in front of it. Where-oh-where was my swimsuit. In the heat and humidity of the jungle, I watched with jealousy as others were able to immerse themselves in the water. I\'m sure if I\'d had my swimsuit, this would have been a 5.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

569469747.name: Go
569469747.author: a TripAdvisor user
569469747.reviewBody: Se took a service guide to take us here and the others lagoon, i liked it a lot.  For a little time only

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

568702248.name: Beautiful waterfall you\'re allowed to swim beneath
568702248.author: a TripAdvisor user
568702248.reviewBody: Just a 30 min drive from Palenque and surprisingly beautiful. The cascade was higher and had much more water than I expected. I took my best picture from behind the fall in front of the cave. On top of this it\'s a great feeling to go swimming right beneath that powerful waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

564765559.name: Lots of fun
564765559.author: a TripAdvisor user
564765559.reviewBody: It\'s a really nice tall waterfall and you can go behind it. Not many people were swimming in the pool when I went.  Definitely go into the cave just beyond the main tall waterfall. It\'s only  10 pesos (50 cents) more and pretty cool -- you wade through knee deep water to where there\'s a small waterfall inside the cave!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

560641862.name: The best
560641862.author: a TripAdvisor user
560641862.reviewBody: Smaller than Agua Azul, but in an amazing set. You can walk in the back of the falls and you can swim in an incredible location.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

559895578.name: Very beautiful
559895578.author: a TripAdvisor user
559895578.reviewBody: Worthwhile seeing but tour only stopped for an hour.  So you have to hustle your feet to walk under the falls and got in the water.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

559842152.name: Interesting but overrated stopover site
559842152.author: a TripAdvisor user
559842152.reviewBody: You get there and OK, it\'s a very tall waterfall.  You get out and look at it, take a picture, walk behind the falls to a grotto (along with a hundred other visitors, or more).  It\'s not conducive to swimming.  There are a hundred vendors and no place to sit down or put our stuff.  It is a stereotypical tourist trap-stop that has been spoiled by the vendors.  Would not recommend, because the bus trip is exhausting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

559234152.name: Beautiful Waterfall near Palenque
559234152.author: a TripAdvisor user
559234152.reviewBody: Misol-Ha is a beautiful waterfall near Palenque, where you can swim in the pool or walk under/behind the waterfall. There is also a cave there. Nice relaxing spot. There are changing rooms, bathrooms and several cafes there on the site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

557661652.name: Wish I\'d had more time because this place looked great
557661652.author: a TripAdvisor user
557661652.reviewBody:
We only had a day trip here and for the mere price of $30 Australian dollars it was worth it. You can stay in one of the cutest little wooden cabins that face directly overlooking the waterfalls and would've done that if I'd done by research.
Anyway, we were invited into the huts for a few hours by some tourists and ended up staying and having food, wine and a good night. So jealous.
Eventually we made our way back to our own digs but this place is very special. 
Give it a go.
Not really wheelchair friendly. Kids would like it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

553863033.name: Beautiful waterfall for a short visit
553863033.author: a TripAdvisor user
553863033.reviewBody: We paid $200 MXN for a day trip to Misol-Ha and Agua Azul, and it was worth it. We were given 45 minutes to spend at Misol-Ha on the way to Agua Azul, and that\u2019s about all you need to get a nice photo and take in the view. It\u2019s possible to swim at the base of the falls, and you can walk behind the waterfall for a different view. Worth a quick stop.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

544576537.name: Stunning waterfall
544576537.author: a TripAdvisor user
544576537.reviewBody: Did a tour that included this waterfall, cascadas de Agua Azul and the palenque ruins. All three very nice spots. This waterfall was spectacular and you could go under ( behind) the fall which was very cool. There is a cave there as well, cost something 10-20 pesos extra, with a tiny tiny waterfall. Nothing special really, just crowded and a bit claustrophobic. \nOverall, I am glad I went on this tour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

542933242.name: Stunning.....
542933242.author: a TripAdvisor user
542933242.reviewBody:
Fortunately we have opportunity to stay overnight at one of the wooden cabin facing directly to the waterfall "STUNNING" fresh atmosphere with jungle music, reasonable room size with queen bed and hot shower plus 2 complementary water bottle only cost us 290 pesos per night, superb right?!....

They didn't provide WiFi in the room however you can use WiFi facility on their restaurant which we used and worked until 2am, the restaurant also have overnight staff "very friendly and  helpful in our case" as he was happily cooked my late  snack request "fried banana".

The next morning we take a short track to the cave and enjoy the splash of water-fall from the height.

PS 
If you come by your own car, you will be asked for two times entry ticket from two different gate
- 10 pesos per person for the road maintenance 
- 20 pesos per person for tourist pass

& 10 more pesos per person to visiting the cave.

WiFi ONLY good for exchanging email and social media.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

542504834.name: Beautiful Waterfall
542504834.author: a TripAdvisor user
542504834.reviewBody:
I visited the waterfall on a transfer from San Cristobal to Palanque, so the visit felt a bit rushed. The water is pristine. You can walk behind the waterfall (though I recommend sturdy shoes). You can also swim in a rock pool at the bottom, but I didn't have time to do this. 

There are lots of stalls at the bottom selling cold drinks and tourist souvenirs. 

If you only have time to visit one waterfall I preferred Aqua Azul which is wider but less high, and on multiple levels with pools in between. 

There are bathrooms but you have to pay to use them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

540440335.name: Smaller waterfall - but great that you can walk behind it
540440335.author: a TripAdvisor user
540440335.reviewBody: I would give Misol-Ha 3,5 - it is not so impressive as Agua Azul and we were unfortunate that it was raining quite a lot.  You need to do the walk behind the waterfall and visit the bats (a lot of bats inside the cave!).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

539818915.name: Perfect trip
539818915.author: a TripAdvisor user
539818915.reviewBody: We drove our own car. Always pay only against the ticket! Never give money to somebody who has no tickets. Number of persons = number of tickets you receive. Everyone here will be trying to cheat you. Waterfalls are great, water is clean.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

537758319.name: Nice waterfall in the woods
537758319.author: a TripAdvisor user
537758319.reviewBody: Pretty waterfall in the woods, place to swim.  Eco touristic huts to rent for overnight stays.  We saw some toucans flying here.  Peaceful and pretty!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

534759729.name: Beautiful with heavy flows!
534759729.author: a TripAdvisor user
534759729.reviewBody: We went there on the 20th via collectivos from Palenque (40 from town and 30 to ADO stop) which took approx 40mins. No need for a tour! Due to the recent rain, the water was more brown than blue but it was incredible. We weren\'t able to walk behind and to the top as it was fenced off. We were absolutely drenched 5secs in. A local dropped by and offered to show us but not sure of how much you need to tip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

524987687.name: Love love love
524987687.author: a TripAdvisor user
524987687.reviewBody: I would have preferred to have spent time swimming here! Very romantic and family friendly. I was wearing flip flops, not much waking. We didn\'t try the restaurant, no your guide.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

521804116.name: Beautiful but very crowdy !
521804116.author: a TripAdvisor user
521804116.reviewBody: If you looking for a place with not alot of people like me, you wont like this place. For sure, its beautiful, and you can walk behind the cascadas, but i after 20 minutes i was tired to wait in line just to take a walk. But i went, and its beautiful but you can find other place where you wont have tourist buses all around!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

521209278.name: Beautiful falls - bring a swimsuit!
521209278.author: a TripAdvisor user
521209278.reviewBody:
I took an Ocosingo-bound combi to the Misol Ha turn off for 40 MXN. The drive was quick, no more than thirty min. Combis won't drop you off right at the falls. It's maybe a 1.5 km walk through beautiful jungle and farmland. You have to pay 10 MXN close to the turn off and then I think 20 MXN or so later on, but a police officer found me on the walk in and drove me the rest of the way, through the second payment place. 

The falls are absolutely gorgeous. There's an area towards the bottom where you can rent life jackets and swim. It's also possible to go behind the falls. Go barefoot or where shoes with good grip as there's a lot of water. Going all the way behind the falls and out the other side, there's a cave that you can enter but it isn't possible to do so with shoes (unless you don't mind getting them soaked). Apparently there's another waterfall inside the cave but unfortunately I couldn't make it all the way in with my shoes and pants. 

There's a nice dining area and little store nearby that's not overtly touristy. 

Was easy to flag a Palenque-bound combi from the turnoff on the way back. Paid only 25 MXN.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

520327349.name: Nice day trip
520327349.author: a TripAdvisor user
520327349.reviewBody: A great little day trip to this waterfall and cave. Refreshing cooling dip in the lake (lifebuoys available to hire). No changing rooms but rocks to hide behind. A good inexpensive restaurant at the site (eat early to avoid the tour groups :-)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

519359844.name: Majestic!
519359844.author: a TripAdvisor user
519359844.reviewBody: This is one of the places that if you do not visit, you do not know it exists! Incredible to see what nature offers, imposing, real, natural, it is best to arrive early to enjoy it calmly. The visit is short 1 hour maybe, this is because you do not walk much to get to the waterfall.Take a change of clothes, you can walk behind the waterfall and you are going to get wet! Another of the wonders that Chiapas offers!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

516517803.name: Spectacular
516517803.author: a TripAdvisor user
516517803.reviewBody: We took a day tour including this place and the Azul waterfall. I\'d say this was the better one out of the two, the waterfall itself was spectacular and the swim at the bottom is cool and refreshing. Would recommend it as a day tour with Palanque ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

515609698.name: Impressive!
515609698.author: a TripAdvisor user
515609698.reviewBody: Watching Misol-ha cascadas you admire nature at its best.\nSwimming is not allowed but you can enjoy the water with your swimming shorts walking in the rear of the cascadas.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

512316496.name: Lovely fall, relaxing and beautiful place to go for a swim!
512316496.author: a TripAdvisor user
512316496.reviewBody: Misol-ha waterfall is located in the heart of the Chiapas jungle, 45-60 min drive from Palenque (you can go in one of the many small buses that take visitors every hour). It is worth a visit, the waters fall from 35 meters above. A swim is permitted and totally recommendable. Between 1 and 2 hours is enough to enjoy the sight. You can also walk right behind/under the fall and enjoy a view of the fall from below. No need to pay 10 pesos to go into cave right at the end of the path (nothing to see), better invest it in buying water!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

511598308.name: Must do
511598308.author: a TripAdvisor user
511598308.reviewBody: If you are in San Cristobel heading to Palenque, go to jalape\u00f1o tours, you can see agua Azul, misol ha, and the palenque ruins for 350 and just stay in Palenque. (Or return to SC but I wouldn\'t, your starts at 4am if you want to return you won\'t be home until 10pm) quite an impressive spot

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

508156989.name: Waterfall nice, swimming nice too
508156989.author: a TripAdvisor user
508156989.reviewBody: This doesn\'t compare to Agua Azul, but it can be a nice hour or so spent relaxing and swimming.  There were plenty of howler monkeys when we visited.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

507110233.name: So much fun!
507110233.author: a TripAdvisor user
507110233.reviewBody: In a place filled with waterfalls, this is a great one. You can swim right up to it and walk behind it. Very fun visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

506906302.name: Nice to see, not an option to swim...
506906302.author: a TripAdvisor user
506906302.reviewBody: This is a nice waterfall to appreciate nature and this is the site where Depretator movie was filmed. It is very deep, although there are life vests for rent, however there are rocks and could be difficult to get in. If you are looking for swimming options ask your guide to take you to the many options around.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

504445726.name: Not a must, but nice if you\'re already in the area
504445726.author: a TripAdvisor user
504445726.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to stop at if you\'re going from Palenque to San Cristobal (or vice versa), but not really special enough to visit just for the waterfall. I would say 20 minutes is enough, unless you decide to get into the water.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

504441181.name: Simple, relax
504441181.author: a TripAdvisor user
504441181.reviewBody: We visited Misol-Ha in the rainy season so we couldn\'t swim but it was still beautiful to watch. The huge waterfall has a path behind it where you just get completely wet. Vegetation nice, a restaurant where we had a snack and some beers and where the service was great!\n\nI think visiting this place + the Cascadas Roberto Barrios are a wonderful plan for one complete day and you can skip Agua Azul which street from Palenque there is not only dangerous (road is a mess and people stopping you in the mountains) but are by now extremely commercial and a bit dirty.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

500515579.name: Cool
500515579.author: a TripAdvisor user
500515579.reviewBody: A really cool waterfall.  You have to pay two fees to get here, after a tortuous drive along a road that is still being repaired.  You could view the waterfall from one area, then walk along to get almost behind it.  Signs actually have rules for if you want to swim in the pool at the bottom of the falls, but it immediately flows into some rocks, so I don\'t know that that would be a good thing.  Beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

500116096.name: Get wet behind the waterfall. Great way to cool down the summer heat
500116096.author: a TripAdvisor user
500116096.reviewBody: Perfect photo opp. Great place for a quick pit stop to/from Palenque (in fact much better than Agua Azul - read my review). Wife & kids loved the experience of going behind the waterfall and getting wet. Perfect to cool down the summer heat. Mishol Ha has been a set for a couple of Hollywood movies. So ask your guide to find out. Hasta la vista...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

492780041.name: Go into the Bat Cave!
492780041.author: a TripAdvisor user
492780041.reviewBody: Being from the Pacific Northwest this was very similar to a Columbia River Gorge waterfall - but the water was warm enough to swim in! Also, the cave at the top has another waterfall and we waded to the back of the cave to explore. Afterwards we had a tasty lunch at the restaurant there. Go after lunch to avoid the tour buses and you\'ll have the restaurant to yourself!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

492603272.name: Can be skipped
492603272.author: a TripAdvisor user
492603272.reviewBody: The waterfalls are part of the fixed bus tours that take you to Palenque. Both waterfalls can be skipped and instead one can spend a bit more time at the ruins. The waterfalls only provide a good break in the journey and place to refresh if it is very hot.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

488566620.name: VERY UNIQUE WATERFALLS OFF THE BEATEN TRACK
488566620.author: a TripAdvisor user
488566620.reviewBody: VERY INTERESTING and  very uncrowded. the falls are spactacular where you can actually walk on a path BEHIND the falling water. a long walk down to get there but worth it. water very refreshing

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

487639419.name: Great Falls
487639419.author: a TripAdvisor user
487639419.reviewBody: Went there with a tour agency. The allotted time of 30 minutes is inadequate to see the falls as although the main falls is just one, there are pathways (slippery and dangerous) to go behind the main waterfall and the smaller ones situated far away from the main ones.\nReserve at least an hour to explore the falls properly.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

486256934.name: Wonderful experience
486256934.author: a TripAdvisor user
486256934.reviewBody: We rented a car and drove to the water falls. At first you are charged a road tax and then a park entrance fee. Nothing official, just people literally sitting on the side of the road with a rope. Once you get in, you see the nice cooling waterfalls, there is a path under the falls next to the mountain wall. Just a wonderful walk, specially after a hot day. At the end of the path, there is a grotto, which you can pay to visit. It was late for us and did not visit. The fall has a natural pool where you can swim, although I think they might charge for the swimming. BTW, the charges are very modest but do come out of nowhere. There are bathrooms and a restaurant in the location as well as bungalows that they rent. Its probably a nice place to stay and from there you can explore the heart of the mayan civilization.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

485585537.name: A quintessential plunge waterfall.
485585537.author: a TripAdvisor user
485585537.reviewBody: You should visit these falls in combination with a visit to the Agua Azul waterfalls or perhaps the Robert Barrios falls. A sole visit here would perhaps be underwhelming. With the being said, the water is fairly spectacular as it falls from such a height and the greenery around enhances the experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

483742064.name: Nothing special
483742064.author: a TripAdvisor user
483742064.reviewBody: The waterfall is nice and ok to visit if you are in the area anyway but I would definitely not plan a trip just to visit this place. It is ok but really nothing special and very crowded.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

481925429.name: An average waterfall.
481925429.author: a TripAdvisor user
481925429.reviewBody: If you have seen other more spectacular falls in the world, then this is an average waterfall However, on a hot day, it is a good place to relax. There are better waterfalls in this area notably Cascada Azul.\nFrom the car park, it is a short walk to the falls. You can walk behind the falls and take a dip in the pool.\nBack at base, there is a good restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

481440214.name: Beautiful waterfall
481440214.author: a TripAdvisor user
481440214.reviewBody: Very elegant and picturesque. Not many visitors. Just sit on the stairs and enjoy the great surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

479608038.name: Nice place to see
479608038.author: a TripAdvisor user
479608038.reviewBody: If u are planning to do a tour to agua azul they usually take u to this place before. It\'s an high natural waterfall in the middle of the nature.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

477686814.name: A refreshing natural wonder
477686814.author: a TripAdvisor user
477686814.reviewBody: About a 30-minute drive from the town of Palenque is the Misol-Ha waterfall, a single cascade of approximately 100 feet.  Upon arrival, we followed the path that winds its way behind the cascade, stopping to take numerous photos.  Having planned ahead we wore our swimsuits under our clothes and we both swam in the refreshing waters of the pool formed by the plunging waters. It was a very refreshing way to relax after our visit to the ruins and the jungle trekking we had done earlier in the day.  Misol-Ha is very popular destination, but we did not find the crowd unmanageable.  Part of the drive is on a road with many unpaved dips, intended to keep the speeds low, they work!  Drive slowly.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

476579111.name: Magical Place
476579111.author: a TripAdvisor user
476579111.reviewBody: It\'s a very close and pacific place where you can swim and watch one of the must amazing waterfalls in the area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

476225369.name: nice kill-time when you\'ve done the ruins of palenque
476225369.author: a TripAdvisor user
476225369.reviewBody: Swimmable lake under the waterfall, no risk of undercurrent and drowning, sometimes you see a howler monkey in the trees overhead. You pay a roadtoll for some farmers "owning the road" (10 peso) and the entrancefee for the falls themselves. You\'ll need a car to get there. Good road, shouldn\'t pose a problem for a rental car.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

475561895.name: Quick stop
475561895.author: a TripAdvisor user
475561895.reviewBody:
If You're on the region and on the way to San Crostobal or agua azul, it's worth stoping by taking a few pictures.

It's a nice setting and beutiful waterfalls, if you plan to swim better wait and head to agua azul

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

472953193.name: A Beautiful Way to Cool Off
472953193.author: a TripAdvisor user
472953193.reviewBody: Only four of us in a group of 12 decided to swim, but it was worth it, a bit of a scramble to get down the rocks into the water barefoot, but once in enjoyed floating on my back, looking up at falls. Not sure if i was supposed to swim out. A lot of kids were hanging on a rope. Getting out was another matter. Slippery! Some young locals helped me, an old gringa. They were so kind. My advice: do it but wear tevas or sneakers or some kind of rubber soled shoes!  Beautiful site. I think it was a school holiday so lots of kuds there, but the did not swim out into the middle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

463315886.name: Not much impressive as agua azul
463315886.author: a TripAdvisor user
463315886.reviewBody: However it s a great spot to relaxe and have a nice break. The road for it is really messy with a lot of stops and holes in the road.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

463161535.name: Beautiful....lovely path behind the falls.
463161535.author: a TripAdvisor user
463161535.reviewBody: This was a great falls to visit.  Only a few people there.  There is a nice walking path behind the falls....wear tennis shoes ...can be a bit slippery but safe to do.  Great photo ops.\nThere is a roped off swimming area although we chose not to go swimming that day.  Looked like a very nice restaurant near the parking lot. Definitely worth the trip up the winding mountains.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

460761253.name: Unexpected beauty in the jungle
460761253.author: a TripAdvisor user
460761253.reviewBody: I didn\'t realize this would be such a huge waterfall, 35 meters high, cascading dramatically off a cliff into a large picturesque pool.  You can just stop by the road and take pictures.  But much better: wear non-slip shoes and follow the path up behind the waterfall.  It\'s wet, be careful.  Great views.  At the end of the path is a cave (only 10 pesos, 50 cents to enter).  They give you a flashlight and you walk into the completely unlit cave across uneven wet rocks to another pool and a small but powerful waterfall within.  Only for the fit.  Misol-Ha is a stunning sight!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

459170555.name: Quite a splendid place
459170555.author: a TripAdvisor user
459170555.reviewBody: Easy parking by the restraunt,gradual slpe down to the water fall and for those more nimble a chance to walk behind the fall itself. Although signs prohibit swimming several you bucks and their girls were taking advantage of the waters on that hot day.  You should if in the area make the trip here. Decent well priced food at the resteraunt.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

459043847.name: Breath Taking!
459043847.author: a TripAdvisor user
459043847.reviewBody: We made a pit stop here between Agua Azul and Palenque, and I was blown away by the majestic beauty of this location! Must See!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

458373896.name: What a fabulous swim
458373896.author: a TripAdvisor user
458373896.reviewBody:
Gorgeous large waterfall.
Great for swimming. But it's very deep.
There is also a walk around the waterfall which we did not do as it looked slippery.
About 30 mins from Palenque on bumpy roads!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

458173441.name: Visit if you have time
458173441.author: a TripAdvisor user
458173441.reviewBody: There are many things to do around Paleque. Misol Ha is usually recommended by travel agencies but there is nothing great about this place. Its your basic, garden variety waterfall. The place is very crowded and travel buses don\'t wait long enough to get a cooling dip in the pool

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

458149291.name: Not sure it is worth the drive
458149291.author: a TripAdvisor user
458149291.reviewBody: The waterfall is interesting but unless you are intent on swimming in the plunge basin at the bottom of the fall I am not sure that it is worth a 2 hour or so round trip drive from Palenque.  If you happen to be driving on the highway it would be worth your while to stop briefly. Once you get to the falls you can take a trail that leads you down to the base o f the falls.  Be careful because the trail near the falls is wet and can be very slippery.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

455740120.name: Amazing waterfalls
455740120.author: a TripAdvisor user
455740120.reviewBody: The height of these Falls are really impressive. We went in the morning before the day got too hot. We enjoyed seeing them face to face and walking underneath them. they have a well prepared path to walk under the Falls. There are areas that are wet and a little slippery but a railing is available to hold. A must see site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

454831124.name: Top place to visit
454831124.author: a TripAdvisor user
454831124.reviewBody: We visited Misol- Ha two weeks ago and it was worth the trip!  Absolutely loved this place. The scenery is impressive. You should wear non slippery water shoes if you want to walk behind the waterfall!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

453286501.name: Wonder of Nature
453286501.author: a TripAdvisor user
453286501.reviewBody: I just love this place and keep visiting it every time I am in Chiapas. Beautiful by itself? is hides a secret - a small cave with underground lake and waterfall - just pass behind the main waterfall following the stairs, which it quite an astonishing experience by itself, especially during the high waters season, and proceed to the cave of the other side of the lake. Get ready to get wet! A waterproof flashlight and photocamera are recommended. The place has also cabins to stay a night, and a nice restaurant with a slow service, but good food.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

451953280.name: Well worth the few minutes to get there.
451953280.author: a TripAdvisor user
451953280.reviewBody: Very nice falls where one can swim in the pool at the base or walk around just to observe.  A nice break on the road to Tonina.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

451912562.name: Beautiful Waterfall
451912562.author: a TripAdvisor user
451912562.reviewBody: This waterfall is very impressive and you can swim in its lagoon. The walk behind it is also fun to do. It can be quite crowded on holidays, so my advise is to go during the week.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

450719459.name: Maybe my expectations were too high
450719459.author: a TripAdvisor user
450719459.reviewBody: This waterfall is beautiful and huge, it is beautiful but there is not a place to swim and it is very crowed, you can you go behind the waterfall and get wet and walk inside a little cave which you have to pay extra, after the 2 payments point you have to stop and pay to enter. For me the best of Misol Ha was the Elotes with mayo, cheese and salt (chilli optional) on the entry.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

448665973.name: Very nice!
448665973.author: a TripAdvisor user
448665973.reviewBody: Misol-ha is a nice quiet place not so turistic as Agua Azul. We went there with tour from Palenque, spent there about 30minutes, it was enough to see the place and take some pictures, than we continued to Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

448588098.name: Amazing
448588098.author: a TripAdvisor user
448588098.reviewBody: This is a very impressive waterfall.  There is a rope that you can follow to cross the pool of water and get to some grutas on the opposite side

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

447816151.name: Nice place to go and relax
447816151.author: a TripAdvisor user
447816151.reviewBody: I enjoyed my stay here at these cascades. The place is much smaller than Agua Azul, not that spectaculous - but good for a relaxed time. Be careful: the roads to go there are quite winding.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

440121939.name: Beatifull but there are better one
440121939.author: a TripAdvisor user
440121939.reviewBody: If this is not on you trail i would not make a special ride here although it is beatifull. Look for a secret path that takes you up the waterfall,if you can find it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

438333894.name: Swimming under cascade Misol-Ha
438333894.author: a TripAdvisor user
438333894.reviewBody: What a beautiful cascade. Don\'t hesitate and swim on the river and under the cascade.The inside is wonderful and the water delicious. What an experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

434797619.name: Nice, but crowded
434797619.author: a TripAdvisor user
434797619.reviewBody:
This site is only about 15-20 min outside of Palenque. We caught a combi van from the main highway at the edge of town direct to the site for something like 30 pesos each. 
     We visited on a Sunday the week before Easter (a popular time to vacation throughout Mexico for both Mexicans and foreigners) and it was very crowded. It's still worth seeing, but when it's that crowded, you have to walk down the short path to the falls, behind it, and up the bank on the other side by walking in a slow shuffling line of people. It's very difficult to take any pictures without at least 5 other people in them. Booo. 
     Others speak of a cave you can enter behind the waterfall, but there were so many people, we never saw it. 

 You can also swim here. I recommend stopping here, walking around behind the waterfall, then heading on to swim at Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

434011026.name: Beautiful and quiet
434011026.author: a TripAdvisor user
434011026.reviewBody: The powerful falls are impressive to see and you can walk behind then and let yourself be splashed by the water. \nSwim at your own risk- and don\'t if you\'re not a strong swimmer. We\'ve been told there have been drownings.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

432514579.name: I want to live here, the paradise!
432514579.author: a TripAdvisor user
432514579.reviewBody: This is what you will find here: beautiful everywhere. This is a cascade around 2 or 3 floors tall. you can swim on the river, and you can walk below the cascade! The cascade outside is beatiful. The cascade inside is amazing! then the flora is like no other place. The leaf of a plant is mid my body, around 80-90cm each, they are giant!. The place you see, the place is beautiful, he pictures are not the half of beauty you can find here. \n\nBad side: I was with a tour and the time here was too short, I just want to live here, even though the weather is tropical, because the cascade you have a light rain that refresh all Try to spend one day on this place. There are places where you can buy food

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

432115256.name: Just a cascade
432115256.author: a TripAdvisor user
432115256.reviewBody: It\'s just a cascade, there isn\'t much anything around it and beyond that. And I saw bigger and more beautiful ones. It was already in the package, but go there only for it that can be a waste. \nThere is a short trail that you can go behind the cascade. Be aware that you will get soaking wet.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

429249597.name: Not much to see.
429249597.author: a TripAdvisor user
429249597.reviewBody: This place is a "walk up, take a picture and leave" kind of place.\nNot a whole lot to do, except see the cascades.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

428380966.name: Small but impressive
428380966.author: a TripAdvisor user
428380966.reviewBody: A very small place but well worth the visit.   A very impressive waterfall by its strength.  About half an hour feom Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

424070943.name: Nice for a short visit
424070943.author: a TripAdvisor user
424070943.reviewBody:
The waterfall is great to see and you can walk up al the way behind the waterfall.
Very touristic though and not really big.
In my opinion it's worth a short visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

419980220.name: very pretty
419980220.author: a TripAdvisor user
419980220.reviewBody: it\'s not the main attraction, but pretty to see :)  i saw this during part of a tour to Agua Azul.  the falls is nice to see, but we didn\'t have time to go swimming or anything.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

417995913.name: Worth a trip
417995913.author: a TripAdvisor user
417995913.reviewBody: This is accessible by car and can be seen from the driveway for those who are mobility impaired. It is a beautiful waterfall with a large pool and several smaller waterfalls surrounded by lush foliage. It looks like the pictures you see in a movie about Hawaii. You can swim in the pool if desired and there are stone stairs with walkways to go behind the waterfall. Even though I have seen LOTS of waterfalls on many continents, this one was still worth it and very pretty.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

413601814.name: Wonderful Misol Ha
413601814.author: a TripAdvisor user
413601814.reviewBody: At only 45 minutes of Palenque, Misol Ha is an amazing waterfall.\nBrood in the middle of Chiapas in Mexico, it \'s a perfect romantic place for couple.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

411002418.name: Within the falls
411002418.author: a TripAdvisor user
411002418.reviewBody: Beautiful falls few miles away from Palenque.\nThanks to a walkway you can walk behind the fall and take picture there with tons of water falling just in front of you.\nNot Good as Agua Azul to dive a little

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

409407642.name: Great end of the day activity after a long drive
409407642.author: a TripAdvisor user
409407642.reviewBody: We stopped in Misol-Ha after a long drive from Las Guacamayas to Palenque. We had done Agua Azul a couple of years ago (very impressive) so decided this for a refreshing swim. \nSimple waterfall but with a great swimming hole with clean and clear water. The cave behind the main waterfall is great as well with a small internal waterfall. Tip: bring rubber sandals or acquasocks as it is a rough 20-30 meter walk but well worth it. All in all a very good experience if you are around the area.  The water is deep so watch out for your smaller kids!\nWe ate lunch at the restaurant after the swim, Ok but if you can wait until Palenque for lunch better do so.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

397306170.name: Nice for a swim
397306170.author: a TripAdvisor user
397306170.reviewBody: Impressing waterfall with great water clarity and nice scenery. worth a one to two hour visit but not a whole day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

393055718.name: Package tour
393055718.author: a TripAdvisor user
393055718.reviewBody: I really think this is a beautiful place but it is not something to do on its own. There are cabins but it is so humid I couldn\'t imagine staying in the cabins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

391897849.name: a must when visiting Chiapas
391897849.author: a TripAdvisor user
391897849.reviewBody: You have to visit this site when in Chiapas, it is so beautiful. Waterfall is impressive, vegetation, the sounds of the water and birds... you can safely walk "behind" the waterfall and had a once in a lifetime experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

388881726.name: Fun!
388881726.author: a TripAdvisor user
388881726.reviewBody: You can walk around behind the waterfall and for $10 pesos you can walk into a cave where you can see an inside waterfall, stalactites, and stalagmites. You can also swim here. I recommend stopping here, walking around behind the waterfall, then heading on to swim at Aqua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

388713187.name: Not worth it on its own
388713187.author: a TripAdvisor user
388713187.reviewBody: This is often packaged with a trip to the Palenque ruins and Agua Azul. Alone it\'s not worth it, but it\'s a nice spot if you\'re already going to the others. \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

387338073.name: Breathtaking
387338073.author: a TripAdvisor user
387338073.reviewBody: Very easy to get to, just a 2 minute walk from the parking lot. \nBring a swimsuit so you can go swimming while you enjoy the beautiful waterfall. \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

384066808.name: Fantastic Waterfall
384066808.author: a TripAdvisor user
384066808.reviewBody: We vistied this waterfall during the second week of June, 2016, and it is a beautiful site.  To get to the falls, though, you must pay a toll to use the road, which I thinks was 20 pesos per person.  The entrance to the falls is nominal and if you decide that you want to explore the cave with the falls, I think that\'s another 20 pesos.  All nominal fees.  The swimming here is great, and the falls are spectacular.  All in all, a great way to cool off on a hot day in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

384020431.name: I suggest to spend a night here:)
384020431.author: a TripAdvisor user
384020431.reviewBody: To get here with no tours it is not to difficult, just wait for a collectivo at Palenque near the "Mayan head" in front of the ADO bus station. Just bargain the one way..30 mxp I paid, maybe you can get a better deal;)\nThe collectivo will leave you at a croassroad and then you have to walk for 3 kms and pay 2 times at 2 differentes "casitas" 20 mxp for the daily entrance. Once you reach it I suggest to find a cabana for the night. In case you are starving there is a restaurant, too. It is one of the best the experiences of my life, so far. Enjoy it!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

382701587.name: Pretty and Lunch tips!
382701587.author: a TripAdvisor user
382701587.reviewBody: Not as impressive as Agua Azul, but beautiful all the same. There is one restaurant. The tip they gave us: Order at the restaurant, leave a sweater or something at the table. Ask the waiter when the food will be ready (usually within 30 minutes) and then you have enough time to explore the waterfalls. You could go swimming, but we decided not to after already exploring Agua Azul. About the food, be aware: They just put the food on the table regardless if you\u00b4re there or not. If you\u00b4re late, your food will be cold!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

380406605.name: Magical
380406605.author: a TripAdvisor user
380406605.reviewBody: We preferred Misol-Ha to Agua Azul. Beautiful and quiet and you can swim if you like and walk in behind the falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

379158462.name: Beautiful single drop waterfall
379158462.author: a TripAdvisor user
379158462.reviewBody: I suspect this waterfall is being taken off the tourist list for visitors to Palenque and Agua Azul falls, but I can\'t understand why because it is singularly beautiful in its simplicity and grace, and closer to Palenque than the more \'popular\' Agua Azul. If you love water falls you will love this one. It is accessible, you can walk behind it or, like me, just sit and admire its beauty. If you want to just swim and play then agua Azul will satisfy your needs but awe and wonder are reserved for Misol ha.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

379151414.name: Beautiful waterfall
379151414.author: a TripAdvisor user
379151414.reviewBody: You can walk all the way behind the waterfall and hear the thundering noise of the water coming down.  A great experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

377877236.name: Idyllic Setting
377877236.author: a TripAdvisor user
377877236.reviewBody: It\'s not the biggest waterfall in the world but it is in a beautiful jungle setting. You can follow a short, slippery path, underneath the falls for a spectacular photograph. \nSwimming is supposedly allowed, however i didn\'t see anyone brave enough to take a plunge whilst I was there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

374539656.name: Most beautiful waterfalls in a small package
374539656.author: a TripAdvisor user
374539656.reviewBody: The waterfalls dropping straight down off the mountain is an amazing sight.  The walkways lead you right under the falls for a full immersion experience.  To enjoy the falls even more, take a swim and get closer to the falls as they plumment into the pool.  Very refreshing on a hot day.  Cost is very minimal and helps support the community and keep the park surrounding the falls clean.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

371600287.name: lovely! take a pic on the rock with waterfall on background
371600287.author: a TripAdvisor user
371600287.reviewBody: The short stop we did there prior to our visit to agua azul was nice.  The view is lovely.  You can take a walk towards a cave if you\'d like.  The pathway passes almost right below the waterfall.  You have to take a pic on a  big rock with the waterfall on the background!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

370715122.name: Beautiful
370715122.author: a TripAdvisor user
370715122.reviewBody: Visited the waterfall with a small tour and it was beautiful. Easy access to walk around behind it into the cave. A little slippery as the rocks can be mossy so be careful. Swimming was beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

367982812.name: Just beautiful
367982812.author: a TripAdvisor user
367982812.reviewBody:
We took collectivo from Palenque centre for 20 pesos. / next to ADO terminal/ The journey takes about 20 to 30 minutes. When you arrive you pay 10 pesos to walk all the way to waterfall/ charge for walking on private road/. After walking maybe 15 minutes you arrive to waterfall. Entrance is 20 pesos. 
We absolutely loved it. Hardly anyone there. You can take a swim, chill out or explore small cave for extra 10 pesos. 
We were told it is open till late / we got there at 4 /. Definetely worth doing. 
No problem getting back to Palenque - we waited for 5 minutes before van pulled over and offered a ride back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

366888794.name: Good to get in touch with the Nature
366888794.author: a TripAdvisor user
366888794.reviewBody: Peace, nature, good food at the reach of your car. The waterfall is very beautiful with a clean and refreshing water for swimming. Nearby there is a very good restaurante where you cannot miss the Mojara Frita. And the best thing for the ones traveling with young children, everything is at a few meters from where you park your car! I Recommend!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

365584678.name: Incredible!
365584678.author: a TripAdvisor user
365584678.reviewBody: Absolutely loved the experience. Cheap and beautiful! You can have a walk behind the waterfall, you can have a swim, and you can even hike downstream through the water and rocks. really exciting and adventurous. A place to visit with any person or age.\n\nBeware!!! Of the kids which set up a rope to stop you driving in the road towards the waterfall. Just stop and buythem food or give them money. But be discrete with your wallet, as if they see large amounts, they will not stop till you give them more. Its a must to give them, if not they will dammage the cars, and hang onto them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

364647040.name: A stop off point on our trail for lunch
364647040.author: a TripAdvisor user
364647040.reviewBody: On arrival at Salva Mayo we had lunch and then off down the stairs to walk behind the waterfall. Only a few drips occasionally.and it wasn\'t slippery. Some good photo opportunities. There were people swimming across. Well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

360565374.name: Very nice waterfall with a possibility of swimming
360565374.author: a TripAdvisor user
360565374.reviewBody: This is a nice big waterfall. You can take a concrete pathway behind it and get to a cave which is interesting. But be prepared to have your shoes and clothes wet! And behind the waterfall the stones are very slippery!\n\nWe stopped there on the way to Agua Azul. It was a trip organized by our hostel El Panchan from Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

359901380.name: Loved this place
359901380.author: a TripAdvisor user
359901380.reviewBody: We went first to the more famous Cascadas de Agua Azul, but we liked this more, it is a lovely waterfall which you can walk behind and have a spectacular view, we went in the afternoon and the light coming through the water, was amazing

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

354466881.name: nice big waterfall
354466881.author: a TripAdvisor user
354466881.reviewBody: nice to look at, you can walk behind it and around to the far side, great views in there. you can swim at your own risk, no shoes, swimsuit only, very deep water, beautiful

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

352415736.name: Like other reviews Worth the detour/stop on way to Palenque
352415736.author: a TripAdvisor user
352415736.reviewBody: Having enjoyed waterfalls in such places as  Hawaii Island, these falls are more with great views and the joy of the trail behind the waterfall A WOW experience and photo delight

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

351175759.name: Tall waterfall falling into a deep pool
351175759.author: a TripAdvisor user
351175759.reviewBody: Nice walk down to the waterfall, and there was a trail you could follow to walk behind the falls.   It looked like,there were cabins to rent but we didn\'t stay there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

348949218.name: Huge waterfall plunging down into a big pool
348949218.author: a TripAdvisor user
348949218.reviewBody: Swimming is good, you can hike a trail that goes up behind the falls, and there are several little places for refreshment.  Very crowded, but it was Christmas Eve so lots of people were out and about!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

348700484.name: Amazing falls. Well worth the stop.
348700484.author: a TripAdvisor user
348700484.reviewBody: Stopped here to see the falls and swim. Wasn\'t disappointed. Swimming was great and saw the giant bats in the bat cave. Clean, accessible, and nice bathrooms.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

347462114.name: Definitely worth the extra stop!
347462114.author: a TripAdvisor user
347462114.reviewBody: We went to Misol-Ha and ate a picnic by the waterfall on a misty day. It had been raining for several days beforehand & because of the rain, the water had turned a brownish color, but the waterfall itself was still an impressive sight to see. It was several kilometers off the main road but it was worth the detour especially since there were only a handful of other people there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

345657757.name: Easy, quick visit to a beautiful place
345657757.author: a TripAdvisor user
345657757.reviewBody: Misol-Ha is not far from the main road. There is plenty of parking and the falls are an easy walk from the lot. You can wear flip flops but if you want to walk under the falls, shoes with a better grip are probably better. There are plenty of "perfect" photo shot locations both from a distance and up close. Take 30 minutes out of you day for a quick visit to this beautiful place.  Pay restrooms are available.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

345034416.name: Climb the waterfall and go in the cave!
345034416.author: a TripAdvisor user
345034416.reviewBody:
I have been here twice, once on my own and once with my family, and both times it was magical. My girls, ages 6 and 8 loved it. They climbed all over the rocks and were fascinated with the waterfall as we hiked under it. Wear good shoes (no flip flops) and be prepared to get wet because it's unavoidable. You can swim in the pool at the base of the falls, but we didn't bring our suits so we just waded.  

The best part was at the end of the water fall trail, the "gruta," a cave with water rushing out of it. You are given a guide who works for tips, flashlights and led back into the cave through the water. It's not terribly far, but I was surprised to see a large underground waterfall inside the back of the cave. Our guide took pictures of us, pointed out stalagtites and stalagmites, as well as fossils and bats. I skipped the cave the first time, so glad we didn't this time around!

If you go with a guide they will limit your time, usually around an hour and a half but this is doable. We spent about 2 hours and 15 minutes taking our time to explore it all.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

342972752.name: OK but not great.
342972752.author: a TripAdvisor user
342972752.reviewBody: We traveled by car and was on our way to San Cristobal de Las Casas after visiting Palenque so we stopped as it was on our route.I would not make a special trip to come here as the falls are nice but not spectacular by any means..I do believe that the majority of overseas visitors leave from Palenque or San Cristobal de Las Casas by bus or mini van and this stop is in conjunction with other stops en route,e.g. Cascadas de Aqua Azul and perhaps other places so in this sense it\'s worth a visit.\nThere is a decent restaurant here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

342966496.name: Beautiful falls
342966496.author: a TripAdvisor user
342966496.reviewBody: Enjoyed the falls, and the walk around and behind the cataract.  There was little infrastructure (toilets closed and no food nearby), but at the same time there were no annoying pedlars trying to sell cheap souvenirs.  A good stop on the way to Agua Azul

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

342438277.name: Worth a detour
342438277.author: a TripAdvisor user
342438277.reviewBody: Lovely fall with walkway that goes under and a cave accessible for 30 pesos at the end. Unfortunately, the tour bus only stopped for 30 minutes and we did not have time to go in for a swim,

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

342008880.name: Go late
342008880.author: a TripAdvisor user
342008880.reviewBody: Got there after 1630, welcome the fact we didn\'t have to pay the various fees we had to, for the other attractions from various people who stop you at the entrance. When we got there, no one was manning the entrance, everybody was gone so we had the place to ourselves. Beautiful

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

341542456.name: Good for a dip and photo-op!
341542456.author: a TripAdvisor user
341542456.reviewBody: Nice waterfall just off the road a bit. It does charge an entrance fee (but what doesn\'t these days?) but the falls do justify it. Definitely worth a stop for a refreshing dip or at least a quick photo-op.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

339499622.name: Cascata suggestiva
339499622.author: a TripAdvisor user
339499622.reviewBody: A beautiful waterfall where you can take a bath. We unfortunately we came in one day with rain so we were unable to be impressed by its beauty.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

338610010.name: Well worth a visit
338610010.author: a TripAdvisor user
338610010.reviewBody: Visited after heavy rain so very fast flowing and could not take the path behind the falls as dangerous. Startled by a rather angry crab!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

336304357.name: Beautiful waterfall.
336304357.author: a TripAdvisor user
336304357.reviewBody: We went there after the rainy season, so the waterfall was amazing. You can swim or just watch the spectacle. You should wear a windbreaker, since you can be really wet after visiting the falls, specially if you go behind the falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

334324799.name: Another nice, but not great waterfall
334324799.author: a TripAdvisor user
334324799.reviewBody: Easy collectivo ride from palenque .  Pretty but not stunning. Interesting  birds and butterflies  in area. Cheap

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

333724186.name: Just one of many waterfalls in Mexico
333724186.author: a TripAdvisor user
333724186.reviewBody: I really enjoyed my stay at Misol-Ha, but I don\'t think that it is outstanding from the many waterfalls Mexico has to offer. It is a nice visit when you are about to pass it anyways but I wouldn\'t go there only to see the waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

333577652.name: Fabulous!
333577652.author: a TripAdvisor user
333577652.reviewBody: There were plenty of people swimming. I opted to head straight to the cave. I had my own flashlight, but there were also lights available for a few pesos. Definitely could have made a day of it, but I had other plans.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

333187121.name: Better than expect
333187121.author: a TripAdvisor user
333187121.reviewBody:
This is not a very famous attraction in the Palenque area, but it should be. 
It's "only" one medium size waterfall, but you like it as soon as you see it, and as you get closer you want to swim next to it or walk behind it, both things can actually be done! 
It's very close to Palenque, the entrance is low cost and it doesn't take more than an hour to visit and take excellent selfies behind a wall of water.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

330107178.name: Nice Waterfall
330107178.author: a TripAdvisor user
330107178.reviewBody: Misol-Ha is a 35 metre drop waterfall, which you can view both from front and back, due to a cave that allows access to the back of the drop. You can also take a dip in the pool there, although there aren\'t any changing facilities.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

330023694.name: Beautiful
330023694.author: a TripAdvisor user
330023694.reviewBody: to be able to walk behind the water fall is breathtaking, the sound the water makes when falling, the vegetation, the color of the water, it is a magical adventure.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

328790201.name: Worth the trip from Palanque to walk behind the fall.
328790201.author: a TripAdvisor user
328790201.reviewBody: Even in rainy season this waterfall, which is much closer to town than Aqua Azul is worth the trip as you can walk behind the fall and even with the brown water it is fun to feel the power of the fall in the rain.  Good for tweens.  Nice little bar/resaraunt with clean bathrooms on site. The roads are cruvy and dangerous but the jungle sceney and agriculture is pretty.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

328105918.name: Very nice quick stop
328105918.author: a TripAdvisor user
328105918.reviewBody: Great place for a quick almost "drive-thru" nature experience. It takes less than 30 minutes and the waterfalls are wonderful. Must stop.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

327590280.name: Name is NOT misleading!
327590280.author: a TripAdvisor user
327590280.reviewBody: MISOL-HA is simply Mayan for "waterfall".  But it is truly beautiful!\nWell worth the toe-curling bus ride up there.  We didn\'t swim, but you can if you\'d like.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

327245372.name: An ok visit.
327245372.author: a TripAdvisor user
327245372.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to visit, you can even walk behinf the waterfalls. Still, it\'s not mind blowing...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

325814161.name: Amazing waterfall (2nd best)
325814161.author: a TripAdvisor user
325814161.reviewBody: Aside from Agua Azul, this is the second best waterfall coming from San Cristobal to Palenque. Definitely recommend this. Make sure you bring your swimsuit and fresh clothes because you may get slightly wet.\n\nThe best: you can actually walk behind the waterfall

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

325702227.name: You can skip it
325702227.author: a TripAdvisor user
325702227.reviewBody: If you are really into waterfalls, than go see it, but if you are thinking about something else, go for something else. It is a nice landmark, but nothing extraordinary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

325652907.name: Ever walked in the gap behind a waterfall?
325652907.author: a TripAdvisor user
325652907.reviewBody: 30 metre high waterfall where the path leads behind the water but only go there if you\'re prepared to get soaked.  We were and we did!  Not much else besides.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

323038135.name: Nice but so busy!
323038135.author: a TripAdvisor user
323038135.reviewBody: This waterfall is nice but because it is so busy it was hard to fully enjoy. The trail is wet and with so many people on it can feel a little unsafe. I choose to swim back instead of fighting the herds on the trail. I highly recommend this because there is no better view of the waterfall then right in the middle of the pool, plus the spray and the force of the waterfall is spectacular. We were there towards the end of the day and the howler monkeys were out making noise which added to the experience of being in the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

315448750.name: Cascades along the way
315448750.author: a TripAdvisor user
315448750.reviewBody: May be because it was rainy season, and the waters were too brown, but the cascade di not impress me very much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

312149478.name: So beautiful!
312149478.author: a TripAdvisor user
312149478.reviewBody: A great little stop along the way.  We stopped for just a few moments but it was such a beautiful view.  Would recommend going and getting some photos taking ... quite a breathtaking view!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

310319012.name: Amazing
310319012.author: a TripAdvisor user
310319012.reviewBody:
The fall is  by far the best.

You must visit  the back of the fall  and the bat  cave.

Lunch  is a great option.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

310127543.name: Beautiful
310127543.author: a TripAdvisor user
