310127543.reviewBody: Very nice dual waterfall within amazing surrounds.  Like other reviews though appears to be a money making racket so be prepared to take pleanty of money for what seems like everything you want to do!.  A must is to walk kinda behind the waterfall, sweet!\u2661

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

307757061.name: Nice dual waterfall
307757061.author: a TripAdvisor user
307757061.reviewBody: High drop waterfall which is a beauty to see. Somewhat crowded, but understandable with that look in the waterfall

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

307601570.name: More beautiful than Agua Azul and you can go behind the falls
307601570.author: a TripAdvisor user
307601570.reviewBody: I always love it, when I have the chance to go behind the waterfall. It wasn\'t super full, but it was still stunning view. It wasn\'t as touristy as Agua Azul, but feeding money to these people every corner is just ridiculous.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

305086484.name: Not very impressive
305086484.author: a TripAdvisor user
305086484.reviewBody: If you have never seen a waterfall I suppose this would be impressive.  Being a big hiker from Utah I have seen many more impressive falls that didn\'t cost me anything to get to. We had to pay for transportation, entrance to the park and entrance to the falls. They charge extra if you want to go to the cave.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

303352860.name: The nature is worth 5 stars ... but since it turned into a cash machine
303352860.author: a TripAdvisor user
303352860.reviewBody:
Seriously ... you take money for the road to the waterfall and entry fee ? May I make a proposal, you should also add a fee to the parking lot ... Holy crab.
Beside that, the waterfall is nice a great place to come and stay a while... And since you have to pay the money as stated above, you should take something to eat and drink with you and enjoy the day with your beloved ones there ... It's not worth the money to go there just to have a quick view and leave again ... Don't do that ... 

PS.: I assume there is the possibility to take a walk through a cave with a lighttorch for a ... guess ... entrance fee :) ... but we didn't try it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

301594532.name: Highly recommended when in the Palenque region!
301594532.author: a TripAdvisor user
301594532.reviewBody: I loved these falls much more than Aguas Azul.  We visited in Jan 2015 and the falls were RAGING.  It was truly unlike any waterfalls I had ever seen before...absolutely inspiring!  Be prepared to get wet if you want to get up close.  You have the opportunity to walk behind the falls, and do it! What a special place...!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

298315384.name: Nice views of an impressive waterfall
298315384.author: a TripAdvisor user
298315384.reviewBody: A beautiful waterfall, +100 ft. drop. Very much a tourist destination, can get crowded with tour buses.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

295431531.name: underrated - loved it!
295431531.author: a TripAdvisor user
295431531.reviewBody: This place feels underrated to me. EVeryone was suggesting we only spend 20 minutes here, but you coul really enjoy an afternoon picnic here. I loved it and would go back any day. You can go here after you visit palenque if you are heading back to san cristobal, its on the way!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

294965145.name: Magnificent Chiapan Waterfall
294965145.author: a TripAdvisor user
294965145.reviewBody: If I had to choose between going to the Misol-Ha Waterfall and Agua Azul, I would definitely chose the latter. This is much more beautiful than the Agua Azul (which is not blue at all). \nThere I quite a trek to get to the waterfall and it is very beautiful when you get to it. Do take care however when approaching it as the path gets quite narrow and one can easily slip off the edge!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

293854360.name: Worth a stop? would I go again???
293854360.author: a TripAdvisor user
293854360.reviewBody: After a great morning at the Palenque ruins we drove to Agua Azul, and then to Misol-Ha. Easy, well marked drive, but be prepared to be stopped along the way by people asking/demanding money to pass on a public road. We were traveling with our dog, so when this happened I would give them 10 pesos, and lower the back window. She would start to growl, and they were happy to see us leave. \nAfter Agua Azul, this waterfall is pretty, but... not spectacular. At least for me. Here you also have to pay at one checkpoint for something? and then pay again to get in???  Would I recommend the place? No.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

293164507.name: Cold water
293164507.author: a TripAdvisor user
293164507.reviewBody: Lovely waterfall with cold water to swim in. Not so busy if you visit early in the morning. You can rent life jackets and there is a restraint and shop.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

291400415.name: Beautiful waterfall
291400415.author: a TripAdvisor user
291400415.reviewBody: You don\u2019t need to choose between Misol-ha and Agua Azul, you can do both in just one afternoon, after visiting Palenque ruins during the morning. Bothj are different and interesting. If you spend 40 to 60 minutes in Misol-ha, is enough.  The main attraction there is the spectacular 35 meters high waterfall, with so much water that makes you feel the forces of nature. You can easily walk behind the cascade for the best views and to receive some fresh moist, particularly in those hoy summer days. Don\'t take your bath at Misol-ha, but at Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

288979919.name: Poor
288979919.author: a TripAdvisor user
288979919.reviewBody: There was a problem with our tour and we had to stay more than 2 hours in this place, there is nothing to do. Sincerely the waterfall is not that amazing and the only thing left to do was to swim or eat

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

277544664.name: Nice place to visit
277544664.author: a TripAdvisor user
277544664.reviewBody: This was a nice place to visit for a short period of time.  It was neat walking behind the waterfalls.  If you have a choice between here and Agua Azul...go to Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

275321045.name: If you are there, visit them
275321045.author: a TripAdvisor user
275321045.reviewBody: It was a nice high waterfall, with an interesting cave. If you are around the area you better stop and have a look. Its worth it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

273801690.name: Beautiful falls but site is like an amusement park
273801690.author: a TripAdvisor user
273801690.reviewBody: The falls are very pretty but the crowds are horrible on a weekend. One waits in line to do the walk under the falls and up to a cave. A ten minute stop would have been enough for me!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

271681033.name: A quick stop and a few pictures
271681033.author: a TripAdvisor user
271681033.reviewBody: A quick stop and a few pictures is all you need here. We didn\'t have time to take a swim.  Very tall waterfall with very little water.  A few small restaurants looked like quality . No vendors hassling you.  I wouldn\'t make a special trip to see this

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

271244876.name: Beautiful Water Falls
271244876.author: a TripAdvisor user
271244876.reviewBody: This place is stunning! If you visit Chiapas you must stop by and see this natural beauty. Making it here was worth my time and I would recommend this to all travelers. I would recommend taking your bathing suit, spend time in the water and go inside the cave.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

270472497.name: What Can I say, I have travel all over the world and in this beautiful place I Feel Free
270472497.author: a TripAdvisor user
270472497.reviewBody:
If you go to Chiapas you must go to Misol-Ha
I could not believe the beauty, of this place...
Honestly speaking if you are a dreamer and believe of a sacred place this is it.

As soon as I arrived I felt free, I have a very Important Job, I am always in my phone or in my Ipad or Computer etc. As soon as I arrived to this miraculous place, everything change in my life.

I was free.......  
This said I am going back this September of 2015, Again I have travel world wide and San Cristobal and their surroundings are awesome,  Don't stay at a fancy Hotel trust me I have travel all over the world and this time I stayed in a small hotel "la casa de Mama"  "my mother house" I dedicated this trip to my dead mother whom I love and guess what... the hotel was just great the owner Mrs. Flor took take of us like if we were their own family.

By the way I took my two sisters with me,  We had the most wonderful time and the food at the Hotel was specially made for us, all original  ..

My name is Cesar and I can say that as soon as I arrive ...IT WAS JUST MAGIC

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

270456769.name: beautiful place,but no law neither security.
270456769.author: a TripAdvisor user
270456769.reviewBody: there is no doubt that the place is beautiful, but I have to tell you the that road from san cristobal de la casas to Palenque is very dangerous, we have to pay double , first to a group of people that has installed their toll illegally and second to the original community has always been there, it is so sad to see that many incidents have happened there and nor authorities neither the local people care about it. you should think twice before you go

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

268829611.name: Nice waterfall in a nice nature
268829611.author: a TripAdvisor user
268829611.reviewBody: If you have time on the road between Tonin\u00e1 en Palenque, it is surely worth to visit and to have some rest and a small walk in nice nature.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

268735822.name: Very nice Waterfall
268735822.author: a TripAdvisor user
268735822.reviewBody: We took a tour guide which brought us to the Cascada (Waterfall) of Misol-Ha, it was a very nice experience! they have a restaurant at the beginning of the waterfall so you could easily be there the whole day and have lunch and you can also go swimming if you like. we visited the Misol Ha and also the Agua Azul and the agua azul is much bigger but both very nice to enjoy for a day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

268710788.name: Double your pleasure!
268710788.author: a TripAdvisor user
268710788.reviewBody: A stop by the double waterfalls of Misol-Ha and take a quick dip is worth the effort. Take the path under the falls to the cave for some additional thrills.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

267388713.name: Very nice
267388713.author: a TripAdvisor user
267388713.reviewBody: A little unsafe the sidewalks and no acces for babies or elders, but worth the trip. The restaurant had chefs for a fair price.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

262545583.name: surprisingly beautiful
262545583.author: a TripAdvisor user
262545583.reviewBody: OK I admit I\'ve seen the Iguazu Falls in full gush so find most other waterfalls a \'trickle\'!  Having admitted this - the Misol Ha was  pretty - a single giant tap of fall falling into a clear turquiose pool.  You can walk around the back of the falls. Wear good non slip shoes as sometimes the path is slippery and narrow.  Did this on an organised trip & enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

262174124.name: Tranquil and so relaxing
262174124.author: a TripAdvisor user
262174124.reviewBody: We have been to Cascada Misol Ha in the past and wanted to return and stay there in one of the cottages they rent. The current cost of a cottage rental is 400 pesos per night and it is absolutely worthwhile. The cottage we rented was for three people and we had plenty of hot water and the most relaxing atmosphere on earth. The sound of the nearby waterfall sounds like rain in the night and in the early morning we heard the local howler monkeys protesting the dawn, even before the rooster woke up. Just outside our window was the edge of the jungle and a flowing stream that was so inviting for a morning dip. We had a nice breakfast at the restaurant up the hill and then set out to explore behind the waterfall and up into the cave in the hillside next to it. There is an underground waterfall and shallow pool deep in the cave but you better bring a flashlight as it is pitch dark and you won\'t see your hand in front of your face. My husband took a dip in the underground pool and then disappeared behind a curve in the rock only to reappear a few minutes later standing behind us as the overflow from the pool runs out to the cave mouth. We had a wonderful time in this location and we plan to return again in the future. It\'s a great place to unwind, meditate and relax.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

261988677.name: Not so far from Palenque
261988677.author: a TripAdvisor user
261988677.reviewBody: I was not sure if giving 5 stars or 4, why? The place is beautiful, fulfilling indeed, but I tried to put everything in perspective and the Cascadas de Agua Azul are way more beautiful than this place and if I give 5 to there, it\'s unfair to give the same score. \nNow, if I was not sure about the score is because certainly this waterfalls are great by itself. You cannot take your eyes away from the mountain and the water. There is a small cave with a waterfall inside which is interesting. \nCan be a short visit like 1-2 hours but make sure you don\'t skip it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

260931698.name: Beautiful Waterfalls
260931698.author: a TripAdvisor user
260931698.reviewBody: A very nice, and refreshing place to spend a couple of hours while touring in wonderous Chiapas. Take the short hike up to the falls from the car park area, and you will finds three different trails into the waterfalls. Be sure to take the trail to the left that leads to the area behind the falling water. It is cool, refreshing and inviting. You will be hard-pressed not to take a swim. Take your bathing suit and enjoy some water time if you want. \n\nAs a part of their "peace agreement" treaty with the Feds you will be asked to pay both a toll to the Zapatistas and the the PRIistas on the road in. Don\'t be surprised just plan to pay twice and enjoy the beauty of the Falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

259847723.name: Beautiful
259847723.author: a TripAdvisor user
259847723.reviewBody:
The waterfall is excellent.
You can't swim directly under the waterfall but you can swim in the pool beneath it(they have roped off area)
There is a little cave you can check out while you are there for 10 pesos it has 2 little waterfalls not much else but its so cheap.
Walking behind the waterfall is really nice too you will get wet though from spray

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

259622684.name: "Spellbinding Beauty!"
259622684.author: a TripAdvisor user
259622684.reviewBody: The falls is Majestic and you can actually swim there! But find the path to go behind the falls and you could stay there forever, taking photos and drinking in the beauty. We were there before sundown and it was extra amazing. Caves to explore also behind falls, will do that next time we come! Worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

259598284.name: Dramatic!
259598284.author: a TripAdvisor user
259598284.reviewBody: This isn\'t one of the wonders of the world, but it is beautiful. Walking behind the falls is refreshing! Also a great way to break up the 5 hour bus ride from San Cristobal to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

259496119.name: Beautiful waterfalls
259496119.author: a TripAdvisor user
259496119.reviewBody: These waterfalls are beautiful, reminiscent of some in Hawaii. It\'s a short walk from the road and a welcome break if you are taking a long drive in the area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

256935501.name: Step behind the Falls
256935501.author: a TripAdvisor user
256935501.reviewBody: Take your bathing suit to swim beneath the falls.  A (sometimes slippery) path will lead your behind the falls for a beautiful view.  You can carry on at your discretion (across water & rocks) to the upper falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

256088258.name: Beautiful place to visit
256088258.author: a TripAdvisor user
256088258.reviewBody: I went to Palenque to see the ruins and knew nothing about the waterfalls before getting there, but they are definitely not to be missed. The waterfall thunders down into a lovely clear pool perfect for swimming. You can walk behind the waterfall and for a small fee explore the little cave on the other side. You are given a torch to wade into the cave with and a short walk through the cave takes you into a chamber with another little waterfall. Perfect for creeping up behind people & doing Golum impressions!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

256077847.name: nothing there
256077847.author: a TripAdvisor user
256077847.reviewBody: As with Agua Azul you must pay tribute to the Zapatistas in order to get there, never mind if you agree with it or not, falls are quite small and really not worth the detour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

253584312.name: VERY impressive falls.
253584312.author: a TripAdvisor user
253584312.reviewBody: So beautiful and easy to walk to- intact you can walk under the falls.  Don\'t  forget to bring bathing suits so you can swim in cave behind waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

252749463.name: Quite wet
252749463.author: a TripAdvisor user
252749463.reviewBody: Don\'t forget to take a bathing suite. The best part of the waterfall is walking underneath it to go to the other site. As it\'s quite impossible to not get wet trying to go to the other site, i\'d suggest to take appropriate clothes with you.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

251568278.name: 2nd Cascada
251568278.author: a TripAdvisor user
251568278.reviewBody: the site is very small but beautiful, you can bathe and the water is very pure. the walk behind the falls was a nice hike. The restaurant at the site was very good

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

250238827.name: Wow
250238827.author: a TripAdvisor user
250238827.reviewBody: We went to visit the falls after a couple of days of very hard rain and they were amazing. They have a walk way that goes underneath the back but it was so much water and wind from the power we couldn\'t go behind it. However it isn\'t normally like that from the pictures we saw it was due to all the rain.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

249032890.name: Linda cachoeira
249032890.author: a TripAdvisor user
249032890.reviewBody: When I went to Misol-Ha the volume of water was not very big, but that did not take away the beauty of the waterfall instead. You ccan see all its fall perfectly. The most amazing of this fall is that you can walk through a super simple trail to pass behind the waterfall and see it in this other angle. After going behind it, you can still continue to walk, arriving in a cave in the mountain wall, which takes you to a dark and hot spring inside the stones. There is a guide at the entrance renting helmets with lanterns at a much cheaper price. It is an amazing experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

248764727.name: Beautiful
248764727.author: a TripAdvisor user
248764727.reviewBody: Beautiful place. Nice pathway behind the waterfall and howler monkeys nearby! You need to pay two different entry fees if you drive there yourself.  That is a little confusing but worth it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

248175351.name: Average waterfall with lots of people
248175351.author: a TripAdvisor user
248175351.reviewBody: This is a good place to stop and stretch your legs if you are on the road for a bit. Short stop. Beautiful falls. Too many people.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

248103568.name: Misol-Ha A Must-See
248103568.author: a TripAdvisor user
248103568.reviewBody:
In the same area as Agua Azul but completely different, is the waterfall called Misol-Ha.

The spectacular waterfall cascades into a huge, deep, green pool.

It's a wonderful place for a refreshing swim and for sunbathing on the rocks.

Make sure you also walk on the path that takes you under the waterfall through a cave which allows you to experience the power of the falls close up.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

246850537.name: Nice waterfall
246850537.author: a TripAdvisor user
246850537.reviewBody: A beautiful traditional straight up and down waterfall. You can walk all around it, which is pretty cool, although not much space so it gets crowded very easily. We didn\'t swim due to the weather but it looked lovely. Much smaller and very different to Agua Azul, worth a visit to both, but if you only have time for one, I\'d skip this one.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

246107817.name: great waterfall
246107817.author: a TripAdvisor user
246107817.reviewBody: A lovely waterfall, not too inviting to swim when there are so many people. There is a cave and an underground waterfall but there are so many people at weekends that I advise to only go inside if you can stand being in a contained space!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

243060083.name: You can go behind the fall of water and swimming is good
243060083.author: a TripAdvisor user
243060083.reviewBody: Beautiful spot with a path all around the back of the waterfall. Option to get to the far side but you will get a bit wet and it is slippier towards the end. Quite busy as the area is small and there was even a queue for the best photo spot. We took a joint tour with Agua Azul and only spent 40 mins here. Regretted not having time to swim. It looked really great.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

242152607.name: Perfect
242152607.author: a TripAdvisor user
242152607.reviewBody: Perfect place to laze around swim and admire the beautiful waterfall. \n\nWe hired a local minivan and driver to take us around the area for the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

241497822.name: You will not believe your eyes!
241497822.author: a TripAdvisor user
241497822.reviewBody:
Pretty easy to get there, lots of parking, $25 per person, children are free, and then... 

Among the trees you see this white tall cloud with an emerald green pool at the bottom, it seems big enough until you reach the water, it's super high, so much that you only see dots of people behind and around it.

Once you get over the site ( which you never actually do) you can swim all over, the water is rally fresh and even though it's super deep it's crisscrossed by ropes you can hold on to, even my 8 year old was enjoying herself.

There are other smaller waterfalls and can get under the big one, don't miss the small cave at the far right, for $10 pesos per person you'll get a flash light and will explore an inner waterfall with a vault full of friendly bats, it's not super exciting, but since you're there why not?

It's really close to Agua Azul and cascada Roberto Barrios, but it's better to stay a whole day in Agua Azul and Misol Ha and Roberto Barrios on an other... It's so worth it if you have the time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

241126398.name: Impressive Waterfall
241126398.author: a TripAdvisor user
241126398.reviewBody: Mishol-Ha is an impressive Waterfall. You can make nice pictures in front of it and even walk behind it. Definitely worth a visit as part of a combined tour or if it is on your way.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

241033695.name: Nice waterfall that\'s all - Overated
241033695.author: a TripAdvisor user
241033695.reviewBody: This is a nice waterfall - that\'s all. \nThis place is hugely Overated, in comparison to Agua Azul the place is a dump. 1 waterfall barely place to swim and just an overall shabby look. \nRecommend skipping it and going straight to Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

240719751.name: SHY HIDING BUT VERY BEAUTIFUL
240719751.author: a TripAdvisor user
240719751.reviewBody: this is the first water fall on the right going from palenque to ococingo, it doue not have the grandeur of it\'s close neighbour AGUA AZUL, but it has a more shy and misterious character. it is very impressing tall and narrow streams, and a very nice attraction, of getting behind the waterfalls to the hidden cave and watch the power of nature splashing and roaring spreading mist of water everywhere, very beautiful.\ntake your time to visit

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

235709439.name: Get your camera ready.
235709439.author: a TripAdvisor user
235709439.reviewBody: Really beautiful setting...Make sure to bring good running shoes or sporty sandals as you ll need them to get around the site .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

234317844.name: Breathtaking, Easy and Accessible!
234317844.author: a TripAdvisor user
234317844.reviewBody: I have visited many waterfalls before, from Arizona to Hawaii, often requiring long muddy walks... Mishol-Ha was by far the easiest to reach. We visited the Falls on the way to Palenque. I was surprised to find a short paved walkway for tourists. Don\'t get me wrong, I love hikes through nature but this one was fantastic because I was traveling with my 84 year old mother and wanted to share the sights with her. Misol-Ha made it possible. Don\'t miss lunch at the outdoor restaurant near the parking lot. The seafood was amazing! We had garlic shrimp, "al mojo de ajo,"  and a michelada - spicy, ice cold beer and hot tortillas. Truthfully, I was a but hesitant, but the food was fresh and safe. After lunch, we walked to the falls. A tip: tourists who were more prepared than I, with suimsuits and towels, jumped in to a beautiful pool. They said the water was refreshing. What makes Misol-Ha so nice is that is accessible. There\'s a walkway that takes you right up to the pool, and another that goes behind the fall for an amazing perspective.  On a hot day, the mist feels great against your skin!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

234122805.name: Awesome and beautiful place natural attraction!
234122805.author: a TripAdvisor user
234122805.reviewBody:
Cascadas Misol Ha is one high beautiful waterfall.
They charge a $30 pesos fee to enter the "park".
There is only one restaurant inside, and it is not veeery cheap but the food is good.
I recommend to wear tennis because first you can walk behind and around the waterfall. Also, if you can, take with you $10 pesos ton enter to a small cave with a little waterfall inside, its worth it.
Then you come back and you can swim, so take also a bathing suit. The water is a little cold, but not that bad. You can see a rainbow and swim very near the waterfall. Definitely a beautiful experience.
It will take you about 2 hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

231966793.name: My Favorite Place
231966793.author: a TripAdvisor user
231966793.reviewBody: This waterfall ... what can I say . I thought I was dreaming.  I was yelling, crying, etc. I was so happy ...... This is the real nature,  you can actually walk behind the waterfall and swim in the bottom of it.  My english is not the best ! but this place is a dream

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

225925159.name: just 1.5 km off main road to Agua Azul...well worth a visit...beautiful
225925159.author: a TripAdvisor user
225925159.reviewBody: beautiful waterfall with walkway that goes behind the waterfall...don\'t miss it.  Great photos and even a small cave.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

225889604.name: WOW
225889604.author: a TripAdvisor user
225889604.reviewBody: A definite must-see!\nAmazing how small you feel under such waterfall, get in the cave to discover another waterfall in total darkness.\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

225523794.name: Nice place to have lunch and refreshing walk
225523794.author: a TripAdvisor user
225523794.reviewBody: after our early morning visit to the site of Palenque, we did not want to drive all the way to Agua Azul, so we made it to Misol-Ha.  The biggest surprise was the restaurant! We had the best grilled fish during our three weeks trip through Yucatan!  The waterfall is nice, albeit that the small lake is not so inviting to take a swim.  A nice trip for an afternoon if you stay in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

222785140.name: Everything you imagine a waterfall to be
222785140.author: a TripAdvisor user
222785140.reviewBody: This waterfall is the type you would expect to see in the movies. In fact I\'m surprised it hasn\'t been been used for movie locations. It\'s a stunning , very high waterfall that is breathtaking to watch. Love that you can walk behind it and around into the cave on the far side. Wear good footwear as it can be slippery at times , and you will need 10 pesos to enter the cave . Keep an eye out for some of the wildlife too, we saw a few different species of lizard .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

221894863.name: Incredible nature
221894863.author: a TripAdvisor user
221894863.reviewBody: The waterfalls of Mishol-Ha are lovely, especially during the rainy season when the water cascades down with incredible force.  We especially liked going behind the falls to photograph them from behind.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

221795129.name: Very high waterfall
221795129.author: a TripAdvisor user
221795129.reviewBody: Totally different than Agua Azul, excellent view and very nice spot to take pictures. High waterfall, you may walk behind it up to small cave (additional fee) at the end of the path. The path itself is very narrow, sometimes slippery, and later run over stones and in some places goes through streams, so have a proper shoes. In season it might take some time to walk as there are many "traffic jams". Look at plants which sometimes are difficult to recognize where are roots and branches are...\nYou may take a swim (there are toilets - bigger at the parking, near restaurant with 5-6 cabins and small - 2 cabins near waterfall). There are some ropes fixed across the pond and someone probably act as life-guard, but for us - difficult decent, very deep, geen water was not really welcome (especially after Agua Azul bath).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

221752412.name: Spend the entire day
221752412.author: a TripAdvisor user
221752412.reviewBody: We went here on a tour and did not get to spend as much time here as we would have liked, so if you have time, dedicate at least 1/2 a day here.  You start by walking down a path in the jungle to the falls.  You can go down for a swim or you can take the trail that leads you behind the actual water fall.  Fantastic.  They have run lines across the width of the swimming area, so you don\'t actually have to be able to swim that far.  There was a life guard on duty when I was there. The water is quite cool and everything is very slippery, so you do have to be prepared.  There is a restaurant with a great view of the falls, plus lots of fruit snacks and ice cream for sale in the parking lot.  It appears that there are cabins for spending the night as well.  Nice family vibe and the waterfall is stunning.  P.S.  The road to these falls is very twisty and if you tend to get car sick, I suggest taking a Dramamina before leaving (the bus station usually sells them)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

220197405.name: WOW
220197405.author: a TripAdvisor user
220197405.reviewBody: WOW. A proper waterfalll - not like Aqua Azul, which is a set of cascades (still beautifull and totaly worth seeing). You can take a lot of pictures there but watch out for the mist as it can get your camera wet. There is a place where You can\'t pass without getting Your feet wet but come on it\'s so hot in Mexico that it dosen\'t really matter (flip flops are the best). Definietly worth seeing!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

217266251.name: Tremendous
217266251.author: a TripAdvisor user
217266251.reviewBody: So high, so beautiful. The visit is Worth to go back of the fall.  Take some time to see, and relax.  Not so crowded, so even better at those first days of July.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

216691545.name: Loved it, less touristy than Agua Azul!
216691545.author: a TripAdvisor user
216691545.reviewBody: The entrance fee worked out at MX$40 per person It\'s a more interactive experience than other waterfalls we\'ve been too here in Mexico. You can walk under the waterfall and venture into the grotto cave and see another waterfall inside, as well as sleeping bats (an extra MX$10 to do the grotto). You can also swim in the lagoon under the falls but stay within the roped areas.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

216054119.name: Beyond lovely
216054119.author: a TripAdvisor user
216054119.reviewBody:
What a wonderful spot we found here! There was virtually no one there. We arrived early.. Water is cool and deep, fall is impressive. Take the climb to the back to visit the cave with the waterfall inside. 10 peso's. They claim not to have change so beware. 

This fall was a Highlight. Definately. 

Road advice: (!!!)

When travelling by car to misolha, you will find that with every "topes" there are children trying to sell you food and drinks. They pull up a rope with rags attached to it, so you have no other option as to stop. Then, they start pounding your car (we had a rental!) till you buy something. If you are not interested: try not to stop, but drive on. They will drop the rope! Keep the speed.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

211303862.name: Stunning view
211303862.author: a TripAdvisor user
211303862.reviewBody: You will be blown away by this beautiful waterfall near Palenque.  You\'ll just stare in amazement.  Definitely a camera moment.  So refreshing.  Swimming allowed beside it.  Theres \na pathway behind the waterfall but be careful not to slip.  Worth taking a bus trip to see it.  I \nwould book another trip there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

209937416.name: Pretty Waterfalls
209937416.author: a TripAdvisor user
209937416.reviewBody: Mishol-Ha is a pretty park with waterfalls. I would recommend for a visit but I much preferred Cascadas de Agua Azul. If you choose to do an organized tour you will probably stop in both anyways.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

209456153.name: If Your Passing
209456153.author: a TripAdvisor user
209456153.reviewBody: A charming location we enjoyed the short walk down and behind the waterfall. Getting wet was well worth the view from behind the falls but if you are planning to take the walk ensure you have a plastic cover to protect your camera. If you have children keep them close as the path very quickly changes from a dry safe path to a slippery wet path with a drop to the base of the falls. It is cetainly worth a short visit if you are planning tp visit the ruins at Palenque, but I would not travel to the area just to see them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

206874012.name: Just awesome !!!
206874012.author: a TripAdvisor user
206874012.reviewBody:
My family and I went to this place a couple of weeks ago ... and it was gorgeous .
Unfortunately the water flow increased cause it was raining a few days before we arrived but still amazing .
Next time we'll go on April ( locals told us is the best time of the year to go ..cause its dry and you get to explore I little into the cave and swim without being pull down the stream).
Definitely take your family y'all will enjoy it !!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

205644087.name: Powerful during the rainy season.
205644087.author: a TripAdvisor user
205644087.reviewBody: I want to give these falls and the whole park a better review, but it was not as good as it could have been. The falls were thundering. An astounding force of nature and quite hypnotic. \nThe point deductions go to the silly ejido fees we saw in this part of Mexico. You pay a few pesos to get on the land, then a fee to enter the the falls. All of this is done at two separate areas.\nThere are some cabins for rent very close to the falls. We did not see inside any, but we did walk around the outside of a few. The jungle seems to be moving in on the little bungalows. It seems a little unkempt and quite dank. The mozzies must be brutal in the evening.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

205545535.name: Beautiful and fun
205545535.author: a TripAdvisor user
205545535.reviewBody: We only had 45 minutes there on a tour but would have liked to stay longer. They have cabanas for rent and plan on staying at least one night on our next visit to Palenque. It was a lot fun to walk behind the falls but over rocks that were wet and slippery in places so you have to be careful. We paid 10 pesos each for a flashlight and admittance to the caverns behind the falls which was adventurous but again need to use caution. You can swim in the pool at the bottom of the falls. Also has a restraunt that we did not have time to try. Was very clean, no annoying vendors. Very nice, a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

204210071.name: Speechless
204210071.author: a TripAdvisor user
204210071.reviewBody: The natural beauty of Chiapas is just amazing. The waterfalls were just stunningly beautiful. Make sure you don\'t go too soon after a major downpour because the water will run muddy. You can actually go behind the waterfall, just don\'t get your camera wet!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

203055021.name: Go for the cavern tour
203055021.author: a TripAdvisor user
203055021.reviewBody: Mishol-Ha has a small cavern with another small waterfall you can view for an additional 10 pesos. They give you a small flashlight, and while the fall isn\'t that great, it\'s fun to explore the cave.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

202900924.name: Spectacular atmosphere but mediocre service
202900924.author: a TripAdvisor user
202900924.reviewBody: Cabanas here are comfortable, sleep 5, have kitchens, and a view out the window of the waterfall.  In my opinion it\'s a bargain for about US$40 per night.  We spent 4 nights here and this is the place to come to immerse yourself in beautiful jungle in relative comfort with a massive natural swimming hole available day or night.  From our cabana we saw toucans, trogon, motmot, parrots, and were awakened by howler monkeys. This is about a half-hour drive to Palenque to the East and to Agua Azul to the West.The food at the restaurant is very good too, and after about 5:00 we had the this entire beautiful place to ourselves. I long to return here some day!\n\nThe only drawback is the service.  We ran out of propane and asked to swap with one of the empty cabanas, but we were told they were all "full".  Power was lost to the entire property for 2 days while we were here.  Not the fault of Misol-ha, but no offers of discounts for the hassle either.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

202643925.name: Lovely stop
202643925.author: a TripAdvisor user
202643925.reviewBody:
Our tour group stopped here following our visit to Aqua Azul. It was a nice location with rainforest surrounding the waterfall and lagoon. There is a short walk down to the base of the waterfall and the path is fairly safe, though there are parts to watch and especially near the waterfall, which you can walk behind of, which is mossy. 

A few people swam at this location, the length and breadth of this swimming hole is quite vast, so ropes have been strung across it, so swimmers can have a rest. 

There appears to be cabins you can stay in and there is also a restaurant on site.

It was a nice side trip on our way to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

202158376.name: A nice little surprise
202158376.author: a TripAdvisor user
202158376.reviewBody:
It doesn't seem like a big waterfall but it has a lot of charm...
it feels like a secret place, hidden in the mountain, and there are some smalls cabins to spend the night if you want... 

i would just stop here for an hour and move on to other places in chiapas :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

199221037.name: Nice Stop and Go object
199221037.author: a TripAdvisor user
199221037.reviewBody: If you are visiting Palenque, it is nice to have a look at this waterfall, too. There is nothing special to see if you have visited for instance Niagara or Victoria falls. But as said: "It is a nice stop and go object".

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

198968158.name: Great photo opportunities
198968158.author: a TripAdvisor user
198968158.reviewBody: We took some photos from an overlook in front of the falls. Maybe it was the lighting, but the photos came out incredibly well.\nThere are two tolls - one for the road right when you turn in and a second closer to the falls. That was a little irritating and l wondered if there would be a third toll - there wasn\'t.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

198229313.name: Nice waterfall close to Palenque
198229313.author: a TripAdvisor user
198229313.reviewBody: MisolHa is a nice waterfall conveniently located close to Palenque and on route from Palenque to San Cristobal de las Casas. Worth visiting if you have time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

197515448.name: Another Beautiful Waterfall!!
197515448.author: a TripAdvisor user
197515448.reviewBody: Palenque is situated around so many great waterfalls, check them all out!! Take a tour that includes 2 or 3 and take your swimsuit!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

196938003.name: A nice stop at the Predator waterfall
196938003.author: a TripAdvisor user
196938003.reviewBody:
First things first as a heads up, you have to pay twice to get into Misol-ha. The first one is at a booth near the main road where you have to pay some Union Campesina guys to enter the land, and the second is at the actual entrance to the car park. But then again, I was travelling with a Mexican family and not in a tour. I can't remember what the fees were but to my knowledge they didn't cost much.

Anyhow, this waterfall is known for a scene which was filmed for the movie Predator. It doesn't take long until you see the waterfall after a short walk from the car park and one can follow the trail which goes behind the waterfall. At the end of the trail is a cave which costs 10 Pesos to enter and the guy will lend you his torch to see inside the cave. The average time it could take to experience the waterfall in a basic way would be about 30-60 minutes, but if you take it easy and have the time then you need about 1-2 hours (maybe 3 tops) to explore the place.

Beginning from where the cabins are is a trail which leads into the woodlands downstream from the waterfall where you might find a photogenic place or two, and is possible to have a dip in the stream. But don't venture too far if you don't want to get lost.

I don't think it would be a good idea to swim in the main pool under the waterfall especially as it looks too murky and deep.

We also stayed in a cabin overnight before heading out to Agua Azul the next morning.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

196573610.name: A pretty stop
196573610.author: a TripAdvisor user
196573610.reviewBody:
We (there was six of us) booked a two part tour of Misol-ha and Agua Azul through Maya Tours, for the afternoon of Sunday, Feburary 16, 2014.  
Mishol-ha is a pretty waterfal in a rather remote jungle setting.  It's not especially tall, or wide, or memorable in any particular fashion.  Our stop there was only for 75 minutes, but that was probably enough time to see the falls.  There were people swimming there, and that might have been fun, but may not have been entirely safe, as one would assume that there would be significant currents and possibly an undertow.  

We were not happy with Maya Tours - We were under the impression that the six of us would be on this tour, and that we’d be given information about the area.  In fact, we were placed in a 14 passenger van with eight other people (some quite large) who were picked-up from various locations around the area.  With the driver, that was 15 people, forcing one person to sit on the jump seat between the driver and the front seat passenger - on the positive side, the drive to Misol-ha was not far.  
The van driver did not speak much english, and he provided no information about the falls - other than to let us know when we’d be departing, and that we were not to swim there.  If we had it to do over again, we’d have just taken a cab to the site, paying the driver to wait for us & drive us back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

196351903.name: Nature showing off
196351903.author: a TripAdvisor user
196351903.reviewBody: Beautiful, and full of hands on experience, especially for children.  The installations do need to improve the hand rails and ropes for safety, but we managed well. We all enjoyed the views and the forest, and as in Palenque and Agua Azulejo, thousands of pictures.\nEnjoy, great second attraction after the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

194565221.name: Very dramatic
194565221.author: a TripAdvisor user
194565221.reviewBody: Breathtaking access under the falls. There are rails and ropes and other tourists were gracious helping others. A tall stairway offers interesting looks and strange and exotic everywhere.\nMake the effort to add to your itinerary

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

193793128.name: very high and impressive
193793128.author: a TripAdvisor user
193793128.reviewBody: the place is very nice and worthy to visit it, it is spectacular how the waterfall is so clean and with the jungle behind, i will not recommend to swim, because it is very deep and also because they don\u00b4t have where to change and shower

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

193072647.name: Little gem in the rain forest
193072647.author: a TripAdvisor user
193072647.reviewBody: We found out about Mosol-ha when asking folks about getting to Agua Azul. It is one the way and worth stopping for, even though there is only the one cascade. The height of the drop and the power is great. The best part was being able to walk the trail and get behind the cascading waters.\nDon\'t skip it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

190524545.name: go behind the waterfall
190524545.author: a TripAdvisor user
190524545.reviewBody:
We stayed in the cabins overnight so were able to explore in the morning without too many people around.  

* Going behind the waterfall is awesome. If you climb along the path (it is a little treacherous) there is a cave at the end you can go in for 10 pesos.
* We hiked a bit in the trees, but it was muddy/dirty at least behind the cabins so don't think it was worth it. 
* There's a restaurant (which is not bad) and a little store that supposedly is open 24 hours.
* According to the website there are a few tours you can do but we didn't try them. 
* We were unable to swim as the water was roped off (and too cold anyways).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

190451141.name: Misol Ha ("Waterfall" in Maya language)
190451141.author: a TripAdvisor user
190451141.reviewBody: Misol Ha is worth visiting because the waterfall is beautiful (30 m / 98 ft). Just know that it won\'t take you more than 15 min, unless you sit at the snack-bar next to it to have a drink. There is a fee to get in, but like mose sites in Chiapas, it\'s pretty cheap.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

190209006.name: Palenque
190209006.author: a TripAdvisor user
190209006.reviewBody: Misol ha is beautiful, my favorite waterfall in chiapas. Way better than agua azul, though both are worth your time and money

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

189011439.name: Nice and quite.
189011439.author: a TripAdvisor user
189011439.reviewBody: Nice surroundings, but only worth for a couple of minutes.  The oness in Agua Azul worth for a couple of hours minimum.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

188737041.name: Bring waterproof clothes!
188737041.author: a TripAdvisor user
188737041.reviewBody: The waterfall is impressive and it\'s worth it to go behind it. Definitely bring waterproof gear or a change of clothes because you\'ll get soaked. It gets very crowded on the staircase leading to the falls...not a good place for the very young or old.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

187016364.name: Worth to see
187016364.author: a TripAdvisor user
187016364.reviewBody: The waterfall is definitely worth to see. Not only because it\'s famous from the Predator movie from 80\'s who was shoot in the area, but also it\'s a wonderful natural place with possibility to swim. The entrance is just about $25 pesos and its also possible to go behind the waterfall and take a photos from The back (take waterproof camera or a plastic bag at least). For those who wants to stay overnight, the place has some bungalows and if you have a camping gear, they let you camp at the parking (for a small fee, I paid $50 pesos in low season).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

186951693.name: Nice waterfall and walking path ...
186951693.author: a TripAdvisor user
186951693.reviewBody: In my opinion this is far more impressive than the Agua Azul Waterfalls. \n\nThe intensity and height of the fall is far more intense than Agua Azul and the path behind the waterfall is amazing.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

186861619.name: Nice place to relax
186861619.author: a TripAdvisor user
186861619.reviewBody: Take about an hour to relax and walk through the path behind the waterfall and do enjoy the scenery.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

186467675.name: Go Behind the Falls!
186467675.author: a TripAdvisor user
186467675.reviewBody: The first waterfall I\'ve ever had the opportunity to walk BEHIND. It was beautiful and fascinating. Unfortunately, we did not know the opportunity to walk behind the falls would be available and did not bring a towel or change of clothes - which is necessary, because you WILL GET WET!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

185429992.name: the view behind the waterfall
185429992.author: a TripAdvisor user
185429992.reviewBody: the misol ha waterfall are big, and we can walk into the hole behind the waterfall, where you will get wet as soon as you arrive, the view is different from seeing in front of the waterfall. and there are also several people swimming in the water.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

185354670.name: Worth the visit
185354670.author: a TripAdvisor user
185354670.reviewBody: Was a cloudy day but still nice to enjoy the view and my friend saw behind the fall.  Would go visit again on a sunny day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

184214135.name: A great place to swim
184214135.author: a TripAdvisor user
184214135.reviewBody:
We did the day tour that stopped in Misol Ha then Agua Azul - and were really disappointed we didn't get longer at this stop.

When we arrived we did the walk in behind the waterfall and it was incredible. It had been raining quite a bit in the past weeks so perhaps there was more water than usual - it was a thundering cascade that had spray flying all over. We got quite wet just from the walk and the rushing water over the paths made things a little slippery but fun.

We then walked back to the pool and jumped in. The water was brisk but totally refreshing in that steamy Palenque heat. The pool has a maze of ropes across it so you can swim into the current and pull yourself through when needed. The ropes also make for fun submerged tightropes!

The pool is very deep and quite big. We only swam to the middle, because the water rushing from the cascade made a very strong current. Even in dry season I can imagine this would be a great spot for a cool off.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

182238584.name: Mishol-Ha in Flood - Amazing
182238584.author: a TripAdvisor user
182238584.reviewBody:
We travelled to Mishol-Ha the morning after an overnight tropical storm, got wet with spray and saw the falls in full flood. Breathtaking!!

Swimming, the walk behind the falls and even the paths near to the falls were not good options on the day of our visit but seeing the power of water made the trip very worthwhile.

Expect to pay a modest local access fee as well as the park entry fee.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

181772258.name: Take 45 min out of your day and go!!
181772258.author: a TripAdvisor user
181772258.reviewBody: Gorgeous lush setting with more orchids and plant life than I have ever seen. Looks like the set of a romantic movie

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

181006169.name: Beautiful Waterfall
181006169.author: a TripAdvisor user
181006169.reviewBody: This is a very nice spot, but not the biggest or best waterfall I\'ve seen. Still a good stop to cool off as swimming is allowed.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

180348023.name: Wet fun!
180348023.author: a TripAdvisor user
180348023.reviewBody: This is not a long stop, but you can take a trail that goes completely behind the waterfall, which is great fun. I got soaked (but was prepared with my bathing suit) and the path is slippery and the spray is strong but it felt great (especially after a hot half day at the ruins of Palenque!). The restaurant at teh top of the road is excellent.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

180227078.name: Nice
180227078.author: a TripAdvisor user
180227078.reviewBody: This was about a half hour outside of Palenque . I don\'t know what I expected but it was lovely and fun to take the path to walk and stand under the waterfall. I would highly recommend taking the turnoff to go down & see it when travelling to Agua Azul or San Cristobal it did not take up much time from our itinerary and we got some really nice photos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

179282748.name: Nice waterfalls
179282748.author: a TripAdvisor user
179282748.reviewBody:
These waterfalls were a nice refreshing trip from hot Palenque town and they're only 30 min away. They're not on some major park complex with trails; there's only the waterfall and nothing else but I really enjoyed them.

To get there:
You can take a tour which will charge either $120 pesos or $150, depending on the company. They'll give you either 40 min or an hour at Misol Ha and 3 hours at Agua Azul (turquoise waterfalls during dry season about an hour away from misol Ha). The whole tour will likely last 7 hours. My recommendation, don't take a tour. 

By colectivo you can go first to Agua Azul for $35 on the vans that go to Ocosingo. The'll drop you off on the road, at the entrance road to the falls. From the drop off it's a bit of a ways inside so transport to get inside can run about $15 pesos per person. For the way out, it's another $15 to get back on the main road. The bus from the drop off to Misol Ha is $25 pesos, then from Misol Ha to Palenque, it's $20.

You will have to do some waiting for buses as they only depart point of origin when they fill but it's often less than 20 min never more than 30. If you do the math doing it on your own and by tour is about the same. If you ask me, it's better to stay longer at Misol Ha and less time at Agua Azul so I would rather wait a little for buses than submit myself to annoying tour itineraries. Keep in mind that if you do it on your own, doing both falls will take about 8 hours round trip. Maybe less.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

178655437.name: Great site, but hate that you have to double pay to get into the park
178655437.author: a TripAdvisor user
178655437.reviewBody: The water in September was pouring over Misol Ha, making it tremendous.  The spray created was enough to douse you if you walked behind the falls (which I highly recommend doing).  Also... take a good waterproof flashlight and explore the river coming out of the cave.  If you venture in far enough you will find a waterfall inside the mountain.\nWe had to pay the local people 10 pesos per person to drive through their Egido on the public road, and then more money to enter the park.\nAside from that... It was a great time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

176526439.name: Very pretty waterfall!
176526439.author: a TripAdvisor user
176526439.reviewBody: This was a really pretty waterfall. You could walk on the path behind it as well as swim in the water in front of it. It was a bit cold, but worth the $30 or so pesos per person to get in.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

176245684.name: Nice, nothing more
176245684.author: a TripAdvisor user
176245684.reviewBody: It\'s a big and powerful waterfall, but nothing really special about it... A nice stop between san cristobal and palenque if youq are doing the trip anyway

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

175612499.name: Neat but not necessary
175612499.author: a TripAdvisor user
175612499.reviewBody: We enjoyed the falls, but I don\'t think it was a must-see. Given the other sites in Chiapas, this was one of the more underwhelming.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

173924425.name: Best swimming hole in Chiapas, under a beautiful water fall!
173924425.author: a TripAdvisor user
173924425.reviewBody: I like this place more than agua azul. It\'s Small and can be seen quickly but if you really want to get the full experience, go see the cave behind the waterfall, and take a dip in the water! A typical quick pit stop on tours to Palenque, not a huge fan of less than 1hr time they give for this place. A place that can be enjoyed any time of year. A must see one of the top natural wonders in Chiapas!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

172431037.name: Wow!
172431037.author: a TripAdvisor user
172431037.reviewBody: Smaller than Agua Azul but with a fully different setting. They offer a pleasant stroll behind the fall and the chance to have bath.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

171943340.name: Awesome
171943340.author: a TripAdvisor user
171943340.reviewBody: Is a long fall waterfall, you doesn\u2019t expect to see that majestic waterfall, beautiful place to swim and to visit, very nice, take your camera and something to cover it because there\u2019s a lot of mist

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

170971517.name: Waterfall
170971517.author: a TripAdvisor user
170971517.reviewBody: It\'s grand and worth the stop! Suggestion do it after going to Agua Azul, it\'s a smaller place, worth a dive and a walk under the waterfall. Payed in 2 places just to go in.\nWe were there about 40 minutes so its a quick stop!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

170864229.name: Cool waterfall, which was unexpected
170864229.author: a TripAdvisor user
170864229.reviewBody: Good spot to have a snack and checkout the falls. Falls were better than I expected and were easy to get to. Even get to walk behind the falls, pity slippery but fun. Go check it out as you can incorporate ruins and bus to San Cristobal

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

169812509.name: Amazing. Dont miss.
169812509.author: a TripAdvisor user
169812509.reviewBody: Misol Ha is truly breath taking. A sheer drop of crystal clear water. The best part is the cave/ walkway behind the falls. Great feeling behind the waterfall, seeing the light coming thru the water and getting soaked by the spray.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

168131300.name: Magical water
168131300.author: a TripAdvisor user
168131300.reviewBody: We visited the place a little before going to Agua Azul, so we were excited about it, but Misol-Ha changed our minds. The place is unbelievable. The mix of the light through the trees and the sound of the falling water makes it a magical experience. Depending of the time of day, you will experience the place in a totally different way. It doesn\'t look like a place to spend too much time, but you can find a lot to see around the falls and on the tranquil waters of the river. We found a local artisan making figures with the sandstone, and we were delighted of the delicate work that he did. A very nice place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

162968204.name: Beautiful falls with lots of water and little fees
162968204.author: a TripAdvisor user
162968204.reviewBody: The people complaining about fees are never the ones that tell you how much the fees were.  I went on a tour out of my hostel in Palenque and the fees were mostly included in the tour price.  The price of my tour included transportation to Misol-Ha and Agua Azul and entry fees and I was charged 210 pesos.  I was charged an additional fee of 10 pesos, less than $1.00 US by the cooperative who owns the land on which the falls are located.  Give me a break, that second fee did not make me go broke or cause me to cut my travels even one day short.  \n\nEnjoy the beauty of the place, there is plenty there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

162681167.name: Beautiful Waterfall
162681167.author: a TripAdvisor user
162681167.reviewBody: These place is just beautiful, the falls are amazing. the plants are unbelievable, So glad we stopped here, but the road leading up the mountain, is a ride in itself.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

162222632.name: Beautiful Waterfall - Not much else
162222632.author: a TripAdvisor user
162222632.reviewBody: This is a tall, beautiful waterfall that has a trail where you can walk under it and look out. There was a cave on the other side under the waterfall but we didn\'t go in it.  Since its just a short distance off the highway between Palenque and San Cristobal, I would recommend taking the turn-off and to see it.  But honestly, there\'s not much else to see here.\n\nThere is a small fee when you turn off the highway, then another when you enter the park area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

161611414.name: Ok.
161611414.author: a TripAdvisor user
161611414.reviewBody: Not my piece of cake but still a nice waterfall & you can take pretty cool pics there (water falling on your head etc.). You can also spend some more time swimming or zip line jumping.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

161375049.name: fantastic well worth the swim
161375049.author: a TripAdvisor user
161375049.reviewBody: ropes help you relax in the waterhole - I was enjoying this while others walked to outside rocky areas - I think I had more fun as nobody was too excited by what they saw on their trek

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

161300699.name: Just another waterfall
161300699.author: a TripAdvisor user
161300699.reviewBody: Not much time needed here as the swimming is better at Agua Azul. The surrounding ejidos collect fees for passing through (one on the road; one at the entrance to the parking area) and there was a man at the grotto collecting yet another admission fee -- which was a ridiculous request, IMO --and cutting his toenails...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

161062098.name: Misol-Ha High drop waterfall
161062098.author: a TripAdvisor user
161062098.reviewBody: When we arrived at Palenque we booked a trip to Palenque archaeological site which took in the full morning, in the afternoon we visited Misol-High waterfall and then onto Agua Azul wateralls which took up the afternoon.  After that we then went on to San Christobal for a couple of days.  Misol-High is a high drop waterfall.  As you approach the waterfall the path splits, one goes to a viewing platform and the other path takes you behind the waterfall.  It is well worth using both paths.\nThis is well worth a visit for a short while.  There are no stalls here but a cafe and toilets.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

158920670.name: Lovely place
158920670.author: a TripAdvisor user
158920670.reviewBody: I prefered Misol-ha to Agua Azul as it was less touristy. It\'s not too far out of Palenque and it\'s a lovely drive getting there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

157042159.name: Nice water fall and cave
157042159.author: a TripAdvisor user
157042159.reviewBody: The waterfall is nice with a small cave with bats. Its is nice to visit and it is in the way to Agua Azul, so you can stop for an hour to view the scene and refresh and then continue to Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

156443317.name: Very attractive
156443317.author: a TripAdvisor user
156443317.reviewBody: Well worth a visit. It was crawling with locals when we went, so it wasn\'t quite the idyllic scenario some have described, but it is a very pleasant setting. Next to the falls there are cabins for rent and a restaurant; however, other than the falls, there seems to be very little to do in the area.\nTip: combine this with Agua Azul for a full-day trip; you probably don\'t want to spend more than an hour at most here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

155459921.name: Wow!
155459921.author: a TripAdvisor user
155459921.reviewBody: None of the tourist nonsense that you get at Aqua Azul. Misol Ha is a quiet and beautiful waterfall. The underside of the falls almost look like a Japanese Garden as there are unique streams and fountains popping out from everwhere. Stunning!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

155095206.name: You have to see this
155095206.author: a TripAdvisor user
155095206.reviewBody: We hiked all the way to the top and paid extra $10 pesos per person to see the cascara in the cave. Although I didn\'t care for the smell (the cave has lots of bats), but my 12 and 9 year olds loved the little adventure! My 2-year-old was a little freaked out by the darkness though, even with me holding her hand the whole time. The water fall was awesome. To be able to walk behind the waterfall was more than awesome for the kids! You can swim in the natural pool! So, bring your swim trunks with you!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

154358917.name: Pretty Waterfall
154358917.author: a TripAdvisor user
154358917.reviewBody: If have a car or rent a car, this is a nice stop.  It\'s a pretty waterfall, but not much to it.  We were on a tour and had 30 minutes here.  Some people were hiking while others just ate at the restaurant.\nI was so car sick from our crazy van driver and the windy road from San Cristobal that I couldn\'t eat or enjoy the waterfall much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

153813585.name: Impressive!
153813585.author: a TripAdvisor user
153813585.reviewBody: Take your time and enjoy these beautiful falls!  There\'s a walkway that leads behind the falls--fun, but expect to get wet!You can continue to walk past the falls to the other side of the pool if you\'d like, but it was really slippery so we opted not to.  \n\nThere are signs warning about the dangers of swimming below the falls, but there was rope spanning the length of the waters for the brave ones to hang onto, if needed.  Instead of swimming, we found a couple of good rocks to park ourselves on, pulled out our Kindles and spent the rest of the afternoon reading and just absorbing the beauty.  To top it off, by the end of the afternoon, we spotted a bunch of howler monkeys in the trees high above the falls.  Tip:  bring a beach towel--you\'ll get sprayed no matter where you are--and non-slip shoes.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

153463115.name: Beautiful but comes expensive
153463115.author: a TripAdvisor user
153463115.reviewBody: Impressive drop and dip in the waters below the fall is very welcome. Walking through the grotto behind the fall is another  wonderful way to cool down on a hot afternoon However,  beware the double entry fee. We bought what we thought was the ticket only to find that we had been charged by landowner to cross a 100 yards or so of his land to get to another barrier where we then had to pay again to actual visit the fall

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

153028741.name: Don\'t miss it!
153028741.author: a TripAdvisor user
153028741.reviewBody: The same day with Agua Azul, you have to visit Misol Ha! You can also swim under the waterfall!! Great experience, so you need your swimming suit and your towel!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

152664970.name: Enchanting
152664970.author: a TripAdvisor user
152664970.reviewBody:
The same day we went to Agua Azul, we also visited Mishol-Ha.
Again, in the rain, so it did not matter where the water came from.
The uniqueness of this place is that you can actually walk behind the falls and look through the drops into the pool.
Neat

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

150927804.name: fun
150927804.author: a TripAdvisor user
150927804.reviewBody: it is great, specially if you go behind the fall. you\'ll get soaked but since it tends to be very hot all year round, you\'ll welcome the cooling n be dry in no time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

150478952.name: a wonderfull waterfall
150478952.author: a TripAdvisor user
150478952.reviewBody: we where here dec 23 2012 and after a heavy rainfall you get to see mishol ha at its best. The water thunder down and and its breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

150465224.name: Worth the quick stop...
150465224.author: a TripAdvisor user
150465224.reviewBody: After Palenque on the way to Agua Azul take a couple minutes and take in Misol Ha. Worth the few minutes and a couple nice photo opps...Hold off on luch until Agua Azul..more choice....

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

149506116.name: Huge, take the time to walk behind the waterfall (but don\'t forget your change)
149506116.author: a TripAdvisor user
149506116.reviewBody: We made a short stop at the Misol-Ha Waterfall. It is a gorgeous view, but the best was when we crossed behind it. The water sprayed us all over it felt soooo good. \nOnce you cross behind the main waterfall you can cross over a little one to go to a small cave. It is safe enough to walk with normal sandals or whatever shoes you are wearing.\nAs we knew we would be soaking we left all the wallets and cameras in the car, so we couldn\'t enter the small cave (they charge you about 10 or 15 pesos I think). It seems you get a flashlight and get to cross through the little river inside the cave to see a second waterfall. Maybe you can give it a chance ;)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

149170548.name: Hope you like stairs..
149170548.author: a TripAdvisor user
149170548.reviewBody: This place is worth the 1.5 km you have to climb up to. Just the views of the river and the trees going up is splendid, and then to refresh with the breeze of the velo de novia waterfall is recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

147260340.name: Not very interesting
147260340.author: a TripAdvisor user
147260340.reviewBody: We were on our way to Palenque and we stopped here to eat, but the food was terrible and expensive, I could not eat it. I do not reccomend going here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

147070704.name: More Waterfalls
147070704.author: a TripAdvisor user
147070704.reviewBody: Was beautiful but paled in comparison to Agua Azul. Should see this first them Agua Azul. The caves are an interesting part and should be seen.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

146787659.name: It was ok
146787659.author: a TripAdvisor user
146787659.reviewBody: well it wasnt as good as the Agua Azul but its beautiful on its own way especially how the falls were divided that it looks like its a twin falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

146404770.name: Wonderful!
146404770.author: a TripAdvisor user
146404770.reviewBody: Be sure to wear comfortable shoes with a good tread....I am so glad I wore comfy shoes! This place is beautiful but be prepared to get a little wet from misty falls

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

146086919.name: beautiful waterfall not far from agua azul
146086919.author: a TripAdvisor user
146086919.reviewBody: nothing to dislike.  nature in its full splendor!  take the narrow trail to go directly under the falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

145632273.name: Beautiful
145632273.author: a TripAdvisor user
145632273.reviewBody: This place is small but it was just beautiful. You can actually go behind the waterfall as well as swim in the area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

145278551.name: Lovely waterfall
145278551.author: a TripAdvisor user
145278551.reviewBody: Nice waterfalls, but unfortunately my entrance to the grotto was blocked by a man demanding 10 pesos. No idea if he was official or not, but either way I had already paid to enter the park and shouldn\'t have been charged more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

144862245.name: Be prepared to pay and pay again
144862245.author: a TripAdvisor user
144862245.reviewBody: Of the three water falls people normally visit on this same road (Agua Azul and Agua Clara are the other two) this is the least impressive and most expensive. Be prepared to pay fees twice before you get to see the falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

144016435.name: Impressive, easy to access water fall!
144016435.author: a TripAdvisor user
144016435.reviewBody: Cascadas de Mishol-Ha was the most impressive water fall we visited in a state with many impressive water falls and it was easy to walk to.  It\'s a nice side-trip if you\'re traveling to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

143493783.name: The waterfall where the movie Predator was filmed
143493783.author: a TripAdvisor user
143493783.reviewBody: If you\'re an Arnie fan don\'t miss the waterfalls of Mishol - Ha, this is where the famous scene where Arnold Schwarzenegger jumps from the top of the waterfall.\n\nNot only is it famous but it\'s a really beautiful waterfall in a lovely relaxing setting, if you\'re in the Palenque region this is well worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

142556759.name: Worth to visity
142556759.author: a TripAdvisor user
