142556759.reviewBody: Beautiful. You can walk around the waterfall, and take nice pictures. Go to swim. There is some cabanas to stay over night, but I didn\'t check the price. There is an restaurante as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

140867334.name: Truly beautiful
140867334.author: a TripAdvisor user
140867334.reviewBody: Stunning place, especially when all the tourists are in Agua Azul and you have quiet moments there. Beautiful, peaceful, magical!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

139698246.name: Nice visit
139698246.author: a TripAdvisor user
139698246.reviewBody: Nice site to visit, the spray and mist makes it refreshing. Need good shoewear since the steps behind the waterfalls and along the walkways are slippery.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

139339254.name: Incredible
139339254.author: a TripAdvisor user
139339254.reviewBody: Worth a visit.  You can walk up behind the waterfall, and there are some caves you can go into too.  Swimming is permitted and the water is clean

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

138594514.name: beautiful waterfall..with hidden cave!
138594514.author: a TripAdvisor user
138594514.reviewBody: great for photo opportunity, can also swim around the waterfall, nice trip to stay for a good 1hr or hour and a half, go round the back of the waterfall and explore the cave with a light!! be careful not to slip

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

134229418.name: Beautiful waterfall
134229418.author: a TripAdvisor user
134229418.reviewBody: We didn\'t have the time to swim, but it\'s possible. The waterfall was quite big because we\'re in rainy season now. I think it was worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

133958163.name: nice site to visit
133958163.author: a TripAdvisor user
133958163.reviewBody: Waterfalls, caves under the waterfalls, warning signs everywhere about the danger of the waterfalls... what\'s not to love about it.  Be there on a big holiday and mix in with the families from all over... it\'s a great scene - spectacular natural beauty with everybody enjoying the spectacle. We were one of the few non-Mexican visitors when we were there, and everyone was very welcoming and hospitable and in good cheer: "Welcome to Mexico!"

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

132543446.name: A refreshing breeze
132543446.author: a TripAdvisor user
132543446.reviewBody: During our visit it had rained a lot, the fall was amazing. What we like more is the possibility of walking behind the waterfall. Staying here is also a good experience, you sleep to the sound of water falling. In previous visit we had the opportunity to swim which gives you a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

132062481.name: Rained, but it was refreshing
132062481.author: a TripAdvisor user
132062481.reviewBody: As we arrived it began to rain, but we wanted to walk under the fall which we did and it was wonderful.  We got soaking wet but because of the heat it felt great. We got some great photos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

131934152.name: Nice but....
131934152.author: a TripAdvisor user
131934152.reviewBody: I think Aqua Azul may be better. Did not make it to Aqua Azul, but from the pictures I saw and conversation with a friend, I think it has more to see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

129982540.name: real beauty
129982540.author: a TripAdvisor user
129982540.reviewBody: We made a quick stop and got to enjoy the beauty. there are cabins you can rent to stay here. Pretty cool

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

129362801.name: Beautiful cascades!
129362801.author: a TripAdvisor user
129362801.reviewBody: We visited Mishol-Ha on a weekend as part of a tour that included two other Palenque attractions.  The site was very crowded, so it detracted from the experience.  \nThe natural environment is beautiful and the waterfall is breathtaking.  You can swim in a roped-off area.  \nI would like to visit this site again during a less busy time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

128953302.name: Very beautiful waterfall and short cave
128953302.author: a TripAdvisor user
128953302.reviewBody: Plan on getting wet. I took my swimming trunks, they don\'t recommend you swim right under the falls, there is a place down stream. I was soaked to the skin walking around under the falls to the cave (gruta). Wear good shoes as the sidewalks are wet and narrow in places and some steps are sloped. I didn\'t see any drink vendors there, not too hot, but quite humid.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

128498162.name: natural attraction
128498162.author: a TripAdvisor user
128498162.reviewBody: partly in dangerous terittory, agua azul for example was not accessed these days

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

128347790.name: Agua Azul is better
128347790.author: a TripAdvisor user
128347790.reviewBody: It is on the same road as agua azul, you should check it out and get some pictures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

127701332.name: Amazing Waterfall!
127701332.author: a TripAdvisor user
127701332.reviewBody: I really loved this waterfall because you can swim below it and see the power of the waterfall.  If you are there you need to A) Swim: Even if you don\'t feel like it.  B)  Walk behind the waterfall until you reach the caves

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

127258099.name: 360 Degree View of a Waterfall
127258099.author: a TripAdvisor user
127258099.reviewBody: I visited Mishol -Ha as part of a tour that I\'d booked in Palenque that included the site of Palenque, Mishol-Ha and Agua Azul. You can walk down a stairway to see the waterfall or swim in the deep pool just below the falls and there is another trail that takes you behind the falls giving you a view of the backside of the waterfall.  This trail ends at a cave that you can enter; I only took a few steps into the cave, but you can go further if you want and have a flashlight.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

126591479.name: Not as amazing as Agual Azul Cascades
126591479.author: a TripAdvisor user
126591479.reviewBody: One must go down quite a few steps to get under the Cascade. The steps are comfortable and safe as one can hold onto the railings. The only thing I disliked was that after visiting the cascade, there is no where to sit whilst waiting for the driver to take you to the next cascade.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

125874366.name: amazing!
125874366.author: a TripAdvisor user
125874366.reviewBody: Such a beautiful spot.  The scenery all the way to the waterfalls is just marvelous, and swimming in the waterfalls is a real treat.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

125823797.name: It\'s along the way from here to there
125823797.author: a TripAdvisor user
125823797.reviewBody: A beautiful waterfall and large pool at the base, which you are allowed to swim in, so bring your swimsuit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

125457366.name: Nice
125457366.author: a TripAdvisor user
125457366.reviewBody: Beautiful place on earth. is not as good as Agua Azul but you should visit since you are all ready there ;)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124670868.name: be ready to get wet
124670868.author: a TripAdvisor user
124670868.reviewBody: very nice, on the way to agua azul, there\'s a passage that runs behind the waterfalls and goes to a cave, you\'ll get wet as if you were scuba diving leave non waterproof cameras ina waterproof bag...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124667997.name: Spectaular single drop waterfall
124667997.author: a TripAdvisor user
124667997.reviewBody: Worth stooping for 30 minutes or so if in the area. This is a spectacular sinle drop waterfall. What also makes the viewing special is a pathway access  under a ledge taking you behind the waterfall

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124583865.name: Walk Behind the Falls
124583865.author: a TripAdvisor user
124583865.reviewBody: Trail takes you behind the falls to feel the spray - you\'ll get wet!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124429867.name: Magnificent rainforest setting with swimming hole.
124429867.author: a TripAdvisor user
124429867.reviewBody: This is a pristine eco-tourism setting with cabins to rent by the falls.   You walk down a rainforest canyon and can get many perspectives of this site. The water from the falls sprays everywhere, it is slippery, and the walkway has a railing that makes it easier to traverse. It takes you behind the falls so you can actually see the back side of it as you stand in a cavern.  Beautiful. Very few vendors. Clean. Flowering tropical plants.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124366031.name: Nothing special
124366031.author: a TripAdvisor user
124366031.reviewBody: A waterfall.... ok..... you can find hundreds like these in Central- and Southamerica, but mor beautiful, better for swimming, and, and, and.....\nA business, that ist it. Not worth to go there. When you traveled a lot in tropical countries you might have seen more boeautifull and less comercial places (f. e. Nauyaca in Costa Rica)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

124123254.name: Choosing your tour company
124123254.author: a TripAdvisor user
124123254.reviewBody: Though Trip Advisor and Lonely Planet had suggestions for tour companies, we decided to go with to the waterfalls with Kim Travel, because arrangements could be made from our hotel. The driver arrived in an aging van that was filled beyond safe capacity. He was a half hour late, filled tank with gas after picking us up, and announced that we would have less time at the waterfalls. (All tours go to Mishol-Ha falls and Agua Azul.) We had prepaid the trip, but the driver had no record of who had pre-paid, and kept insisting we owed more when we arrived at site.  There were problems with the engine, and he hoped that he could get us safely and reliably home! I would definitely suggest finding a different company!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

123333742.name: Long drop waterfall with caves
123333742.author: a TripAdvisor user
123333742.reviewBody: You can walk behind the waterfall which is great. Sturdy shoes are needed and surface can be slippy in places.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

122871458.name: astounding
122871458.author: a TripAdvisor user
122871458.reviewBody: surprised to find such  high falls. cool and refreshing

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

121120438.name: Nice, That\'s all...
121120438.author: a TripAdvisor user
121120438.reviewBody: It\'s one waterfall, nice if you combain it with Agua Azul.\nCheck the trips they offer in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

120504458.name: Beautiful Waterfall
120504458.author: a TripAdvisor user
120504458.reviewBody: This is a spectacular, 100 foot fall,emptying into a small lake, great for swimming.  Also, more pools lower down the stream, for more privacy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

117599754.name: You will not be disappointed.
117599754.author: a TripAdvisor user
117599754.reviewBody: We went to Cascadas Misol- Ha the same day we went to Palenque, I felt a little rushed and wished to have spent a bit more time here, it was picturesque. This is yet another great place you can stop if you are visiting Chiapas, Mexico. It does have some tourism infrastructure built like walkways and railing for safety but does not have an "attraction" feel to it. We visited a few days after Christmas and it was crowded with locals and other Mexicans "tourisnando" , hardly any Americans or Europeans. Be sure to follow the trail all the way up past the main waterfall, there are some interesting pools of water where you can soak and take in the scenery.  Tip: If you rented a car, watch out for the little kids pulling ropes accross the road, they just want you to slow down enough to sell you fruit or Coconuts. If you don\'t want to buy anything from them make them happy by taking baggies of candy and handing them out.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

117515792.name: Nice and peaceful
117515792.author: a TripAdvisor user
117515792.reviewBody: Less commercialized than Agua Azul, it allows for a nice swim in the \'pool\' around the waterfall. The water is relatively cold which is good in hot-humid Chiapas. You may take your picnic and spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

117258087.name: Beautiful site and not to be missed
117258087.author: a TripAdvisor user
117258087.reviewBody: My friend and I took an organised trip that went to the Cascades and to Aqua Azul, both places were great to see and not too far either. Well worth it. It is best to go with an organised trip because with the local bus it is a long walk from where the bus drops you off to the site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

116446710.name: Loved the waterfalls
116446710.author: a TripAdvisor user
116446710.reviewBody: The waterfals in Chiapas are amazing. there are a lot of them and they are completely amazing, you can find a lot of art crafts on your way to the waterfall and you can swim on this one.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Ocosingo Reserva de la Biósfera Montes Azules

675099377.name: Stunning Place
675099377.author: a TripAdvisor user
675099377.reviewBody: Beautiful walking trails, amazing waterfalls, take mosquito repellant, hat and water. It\'s very hot but is worth everything. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

670207220.name: amazing
670207220.author: a TripAdvisor user
670207220.reviewBody: the falls are amazing, lots of them all cascading into the river below, lots of souvenir shops all along the falls, keep walking and you come across another one you can walk behind to a cave, which they will charge you to enter give you a torch and you are in there about 5 minutes at most, doesn\'t go anywhere, just to maybe see some bats, that it!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

662254888.name: WONDERFUL
662254888.author: a TripAdvisor user
662254888.reviewBody: It was a nice experience visiting this place. Specially when there hasn\'t been rains. I would certainly visit again!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

661217668.name: BEWARE THE FAKE \u201cSTOPS\u201d ON THE WAY
661217668.author: a TripAdvisor user
661217668.reviewBody:
WARNING: you will likely encounter a series (two or three) of “stops” where a woman pulls a rope with flags on it across the road and children bombard your car and demand 20 pesos for a bundle of old bananas or stale plantain chips.  This might look sort of like the slightly more official stops where you give money to certain collectives to enter some areas, but it isn’t.

YOU DO NOT HAVE TO STOP!  Make sure the windows are up and drive slowly through the rope and flags.  The first one you run into heading south from Misol-ha is fairly close to Agua Azul.  It’s the worst one.  The woman is particularly severe and she will demand 20 pesos for each of the ten or so kids she has working for her.  The second stop in is a bit less harsh and the third one was pretty easy.  Some kids tried to stop the car at the turn to Agua Azul, even going to far as to pretend to throw something under the car, but you can just keep slowly driving through.  There are no more annoying stops after the turn.  There was only one attempt just after turning out to head towards San Cristobal, but it was basically just five little kids trying their luck.

Agua Azul itself is an awe-inspiring series of pools and waterfalls.  There are an extraordinary amount of booths & restaurants on one side of the hike and the waterfalls on the other side, so don’t expect solitude.  This place is very popular - but for good reason!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

660240236.name: Spectacular number of falls!
660240236.author: a TripAdvisor user
660240236.reviewBody: There is much to see and enjoy along the trails of these falls. The water is a stunning, glacial shade of blue/green. There are plenty of vendors if you need anything from fresh fruit or a meal to souvenirs.  A worthy stop between San Cristobal and Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

658532665.name: Raw Nature
658532665.author: a TripAdvisor user
658532665.reviewBody: The water was high, so the waterfalls were spectacular. There\'s a nice path to the top, and good parking. Was cautioned not to eat there.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

651463573.name: Majestic blue water
651463573.author: a TripAdvisor user
651463573.reviewBody: We were excited to visit the waterfall of Agua Azul on our trip to Palenque but after reading some of the reviews we got a bit apprehensive. I am glad we decided to go! The waterfalls are simple majestic, as you climb up you witness the change between calm pools and forcible water fall. There are several pools where you can swim (the water was a bit cold) and along the road there are many vendors selling souvenirs, food, etc. Along the way there we encountered two \u201croad blocks\u201d with children pulling the rope and selling some fruits and cakes (20$MX will get you a pass) and then an official entrence (100$MX).

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

647684262.name: Awesome!
647684262.author: a TripAdvisor user
647684262.reviewBody:
Great spot!
We didn't take any organized tour, but find colectivo on the side of Palenque main street (those little one looks like taxy)
They dropped us at junction and than we get taxy till the entrance.
Total cost of transport was  75peso + 50 peso entrance fee.
We spend some time walking around and in the water (it is fun that actually you can swim whether you like!)
I think it is better to go by yourself as the place is easily accessible and you can spend as much time as you like!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

645954790.name: Beautiful and Unusual
645954790.author: a TripAdvisor user
645954790.reviewBody:
Located in the green mountains above Palenque, the cascades are wonderful.

While none of the many falls are particularly high, there virtually endless series interspersed with places to swim.  A long path interspersed with reasonable stone stairways takes you along one side of the falls.  Non-aggressive (mainly) vendors and restaurants line the pathway.  Their wares were reasonable but don't fall for the smelter slag being sold as "meteorites"--they are definitely "meteorwrongs"!

The drive there from Palenque is attractive but slow due to the extremely curvy road, surprising amount of commercial traffic and great proliferation of speed bumps.  Some of the roadside sellers are quite aggressive with one pulling up a wire to block our way.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

645863537.name: Perfect day trip
645863537.author: a TripAdvisor user
645863537.reviewBody: We stayed at Palenque and made a day trip out to three waterfalls. It took approximately 2.5 hours to get to Agua Azul. Definitely the best of the three waterfalls. If you walk for about 30-45 mins from the entrance, there are several quiet spots to go for a swim. There are also several food stalls where the fresh fruit shaped as flowers and the corn are amazing! From here, we drove 45 mins towards Palenque to the next waterfall; we stopped for about 30 mins at the Misol-Ha waterfall and walked behind the falls. We then drove approximately an hour to the Robberto Barrios falls where we swam for 2 hours. You can jump into the water from the rocks and its quite relaxing. Great day trip!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

645456116.name: Trip with the family
645456116.author: a TripAdvisor user
645456116.reviewBody: This is an incredible place where you can stay the entire day. It\u2019s a natural park, full of waterfalls; there are places where you can swim in, there are tiny restaurants as well as little shops where you can buy food or souvenirs. Perfect for people who love outdoors, walking and swimming. \nAltho the highway is a little complicated and it\u2019s difficult for people who suffer of dizziness. \nIf you don\u2019t speak Spanish or you are not a person who locates yourself easily; I recommend you to go on a tour.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

644366198.name: Simply Gorgeous
644366198.author: a TripAdvisor user
644366198.reviewBody: One of our favorite "Cascadas" we have been to.  Great place to swim and just enjoy the wonderful views.  You can jump in one spot, swim a bit then get out and go to the next pool.  Very strong currents, so be careful.  Seems to go on forever.  The walk around through the woods on the side is nice too.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

641690082.name: Beautiful waterfall
641690082.author: a TripAdvisor user
641690082.reviewBody:
Long drive from Palenque.
The place is full of merchandise sellers (native people) and food stands.
Some offer toilets for only 5 pesos.
Water is accessible.
Waterfalls are beautiful.
There is a climb with stairs to the top viewing point but if you have difficulties the bottom is good enough.
On the way to the place the natives block the road and ask for money!! If you travel by car...take lots of small bills and change.
(I paid 20 pesos at each blockage and the were at least 3-5 of them).

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

640437456.name: Little paradise
640437456.author: a TripAdvisor user
640437456.reviewBody: It\'s a rough bus journey to get here but well worth it nice little restaurants here aswell we didn\'t get a good day but I can only imagine how it must be on a sunny day.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

636775403.name: This is an impreesive waterfall
636775403.author: a TripAdvisor user

The falls are not very high but are wide and close to the viewpoints and make a good spectacle. The speed of water flowing meant swimming was off the agenda but we noticed there were ropes across the river to catch swimmers being carried downriver. A lot of memento stalls and eating placed around the parking.

We would recommend going downstream a bit where it\u2019s a little bit quieter and you can chill in little natural pools on the cascades rather than in a big area full of other people. Overall a lovely experience!

We did not get to see the blue waters as it had rained the days prior, but it still did not dissapoint. It was worth the experience and we hope to come back again!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

594778614.name: impressive and majestical cascades
594778614.author: a TripAdvisor user
594778614.reviewBody: These cascades are a must if you\'re in the Palenque area. They are about 1.5 hours away from the city. If you\'re staying in Palenque or San Cristobal or any other city near by, it is best to go with a tour company. They offer roundtrip transportation and you typically go to 2-3 different sites, a combination of cascade/waterfall site-seeing and the Palenque ruins. The water is turquoise color if it has not rained in the past days leading to your visit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

590263499.name: Beautiful!
590263499.author: a TripAdvisor user
590263499.reviewBody: We stopped here with every intention to swim, but holy current! Instead, after a wander up and down admiring the falls, we sat at one of the restaurants and enjoyed some beers to the roar of the falls. There had been rain the night before so it was more "aqua sort of azul", but it was still absolutely beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

587285481.name: Majestic series of waterfalls
587285481.author: a TripAdvisor user
587285481.reviewBody:
A really beautiful place especially if it is not rainy season to really see the electric turquoise blue color of the water. In rainy season the power of the waterfalls is impressive yet the color of the water is like chocolate.
Some areas are appropriate for swimming, and other areas are forbidden due turbulent areas of the river and waterfalls.
You can walk up and downstream for a couple of kilometers.
The downside is that the main area by the parking lot and the view sites the entire shore of the river is a wall of market places, and people try to pull you to buy in their location which makes the experience a bit annoying, unless that is what you are looking for, then it might be folkloric and even fun.
There are some rooms for rent here and there, Not so nice tho, as yo will be in the middle of the crowded marketplace. Any place to eat there is not good, and you might even get sick in some places. I would not recommend to eat there.
The visit can take a full morning and you can snap some mind blowing pictures in so many places.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

583891593.name: Fantastic natural waterworks but site is top heavy with souvenir & food outlets
583891593.author: a TripAdvisor user
583891593.reviewBody: Cascadas de Agua Azul is a series of waterfalls set in a dense jungle region near Palenque. The falls are an impressive avalanche of water (more turquoise than azure). To get the best views & the best selfies of the powerful rushing torrents of water, go to the wooden viewing platform. The sheer volume from multiple waterfalls hurtles down the mountains & concentrates in a large pool of water at the base. Further down the power of the waters dissipates enough to allow bathers to wade out with the aid of a rope strung across the raging river. Because of the sloping topography of the location, visitors can climb the steps of the hill adjacent to the falls & get a number of different vantage points of the wildly gushing waters. The over-touristy nature of the site detracts a bit from Agua Azul\u2019s natural wonder, the place is teeming with too many persistent vendors & hawkers & an over-concentration of souvenir & food huts.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

583868962.name: a must go!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

578180209.name: Nice place but bad behaviour of locals
578180209.author: a TripAdvisor user
578180209.reviewBody: The cascade is really beautiful with green/turquoise waters. But if you have short time, go to Roberto Barrios cascade. It is much more beautiful and natural and you don\'t have kids forcing you to buy stuff. The problem of this cascade is that is full of kiosks selling handicraft. It doesn\'t match with the nature. And kids trying to sell cocoa and bananas get angry if you don\'t buy anything from them. Then they  start telling things in Mayan which didn\'t seem to be polite. They should treat visitors better, as their major income come from tourism. Anyway, beautiful place but in Roberto Barrios you will see the same colored waters, with better places to swim and even monkeys

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

577199786.name: Lovely waterfall spoilt by rubbish & vendors
577199786.author: a TripAdvisor user
577199786.reviewBody:
It's a lovely set of waterfalls and while not quite the pale blue the advertising photos promote is very nice just the same

I would have rated this higher but for the rubbish that was scattered around and the line of vendors all the way along the long access path that are all selling the same mass produced stuff.

There are several drops/falls along this stretch of river so it's a reasonable walk uphill if you want to see all there is but nothing a reasonable degree of mobility would not cope with.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

573182703.name: Doable as an individual half or full day trip
573182703.author: a TripAdvisor user
573182703.reviewBody:
It was a nice individual half day trip from Palenque. It’s reachable easily with the minivans or taxi colectivos leaving very frequently from the mainstreet (but closer to the busterminal, than the Ruinas-shuttles) with destination Ocosingo. One way was 50pesos and tell the driver you want to jump out for Agua Azul at the junction (after about 70min), where you take a taxi for 25pesos per person for the last about 4.5km.
We assume it’s not much cheaper than by tour but you can do it individually and decide for yourself how long you want to stay. For the way back you get back to the junction where you stop any minivan or colectivo taxi back to Palenque.

For the sight itself, we liked it, the colors are nice. The earlier you visit it, the better. Best if you walk up until the end where it is a bit more quiet due to less visitors.
Overall, a nice half or full day trip if you. For sure there are some tourists and vendors, but we liked it. We found cold coco water for 15-20pesos per coconut what was fairly priced ;-)

561634350.name: A stunning site but an uncomfortable journey
561634350.author: a TripAdvisor user
561634350.reviewBody: All the hotels and agencies in Palenque offer combination tours to the Ruins, Misolha, Agua Azul and Roberto Barrios. We chose to spend a day at the ruins independently but booked a tour of Misolha and Agua Azul through our hotel. There seems to be 2 operators providing shuttle tours to these sites and they both run at the same time and charge the same price. Tours to Agua Azul and Misolha start at 12 and return about 7pm. Both sites are spectacular but the enjoyment factor is diminished by the long and uncomfortable trip back. The road is littered with speed humps which make the journey seem a lot longer than it is. The pathway at Aqua Azul is enclosed by souvenir stalls and restaurants but the only time we were harassed was when we first stepped off the bus at a restaurant which obviously had a deal going with the shuttle service. If you need a meal here (it\'s a late lunch stop) ignore the restaurant when you first arrive and try one of the other options up the hill which seem to serve more authentic local dishes.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

559831889.name: Gorgeous cascades spoiled by commercialization
559831889.author: a TripAdvisor user
559831889.reviewBody: This trip to Misol-Ha and Agua Azul seems to be a must-see for Palenque visitors, but it is over-promoted and disappointing. The van ride out to the site is very long--winding roads, speed bumps, hour and a half travel-time.  The rural villagers have totally occupied the riverfront with a kilometer or so of cantinas and shops selling agua de coco and trinkets.  It really spoils the experience.  If you go, be sure to hike about a quarter-mile or so up-cascade for one of the three or four swimming sites.  You will be rewarded if you ascend past the last few "shops"--to a beauitful and rustic stretch of the river with virtually unpeopled swimming pools

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

556297067.name: Definitely on the bucket list
556297067.author: a TripAdvisor user
556297067.reviewBody:
Magnificent. Took us 3 hours to get here to avoid protests on the main roads so a convoy of about 8 buses headed off to remote parts to get here. Well worth it. 
Apart from seeing true Mayan territory on the way the landscape was gorgeous. 
The cascades are the most beautiful azure and don’t be lured into the first pool. There are several as you walk uphill each with its own uniqueness. 
There is a ‘lifeguard’ on duty with a whistle and flotation ring on a rope. Yes it’s trivial but some of he younger men were pushing the boundaries through the rapids. 
There are plenty of changing rooms and toilets along the way as well as stall holders with souvenirs and refreshments. 
Water temperature was brisk but within 20 seconds was so refreshing you can’t get out. Bottom is clear and mostly white sand. No creepy crawlies in these waters. 
Wheelchair friendly until you want to go uphill then it isn’t. Kid friendly. No wifi. 
There is another set of falls nearby which I’d also recommend doing on the same trip.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

We were given 45 minutes at Misol-Ha and 2.5 hours at Agua Azul, and this felt like the appropriate amount of time for each. Agua Azul has many shops and restaurants lining a path that walks up and up along the waterfalls. There are several places to swim, and the water itself is gorgeous! A nice way to spend the afternoon.

550170183.author: a TripAdvisor user
550170183.reviewBody: Spectacular waterfalls and lots of buissnesses around, where one can eat and buy souvenirs. But it\u2018s a long trip from any place a tourist will be.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

548511611.name: Gorgeous... but very touristic
548511611.author: a TripAdvisor user
548511611.reviewBody:
We were lucky to visit the falls in the week before the storm (before Christmas). It is clear they generally expect thousands of tourists a day. We only met around 20. So that was great. But the whole walk up the waterfall is packed with stalls and restaurants etc.
That being said, it’s touristic for a reason,  because it is simply beautiful. Especially on a sunny day. So it’s definitely worth a visit.

Don’t let your visits be spoiled by extorting kids on the roads with ropes (ignore them, wait a minute and they will leave you alone) or all the stalls, just enjoy the falls.

But! If you fancy a swim, this is not the place. They only have limited places where you can swim and they are not great. If you love swimming in falls, sliding, jumping etc etc...  go to the cascades Roberto Barrios!

They are impressive as well (not as much as Azul, but also really nice) and you are able to do everything you want swimwise. Get a guide or ask a local for a trip down the waterfall, to jump, canyoning and slide. It’s a blast.
If you have your own transportation... combine Azul and Barrios like we did. If you like a bit of adventure, take the dirt road to your right after Santa Maria on the 199 that goes through Nuevo Samaritano. It takes you all the way to Roberto Barrios (one hour drive, the road is not bad and easy with a high riding car, no 4x4 required) and is beautifull. Just the road itself is worth 5 stars.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

531538416.name: Take your insect repellent
531538416.author: a TripAdvisor user
531538416.reviewBody: These falls are quite spectacular, even after rain and they are not as blue as usual. The walk from the car park to the falls is quite short. There are a series of lookout points as you walk up into the park. There was no swimming the day we visited as the flow was too strong. There are lots of restaurants and markets there. Allow up to 30 minutes if just looking at the falls. You could spend all day there I am sure, if you were swimming. There is a small fee for entry. Be aware that some times children string a rope across the road that leads to the waterfall. If you stop they will make you buy something before allowing you through. If you drive straight through they will remove the rope at the last minute.

So, if this is your first trip to Chiapas, schedule a whole day for the Falls of Agua Azul, they are beautiful. But even more beautiful are the Cascadas del Velo de Novia...THOSE ARE THE GORGEOUS!

504447671.name: Interesting but a bit dangerous to get there
504447671.author: a TripAdvisor user
504447671.reviewBody:
We stayed at Palenque and did a one day tour to Agua Azul. We reached this place after about 2-3 hrs of a curvy street going through the mountains of the Sierra Chiapaneca. The street was to 50% destroyed, some parts of the street "filled out" with stones, some parts washed out by the rain,  nothing for week hearts  but the landscape just stunning. You cross many little towns in the mountains where locals sell from fruits to gasoline. (no gas stations on the way at all its only mountains. Please take precautions).

I must say, probably my experience at agua azul is bias because of a group of people who stopped our van by standing in front of it and partially surrounding it, not allowing us to drive further unless we buy souvenirs and fruit from them. They approached our van and tried to open the doors while knocking hard on the windows. This experience in "the mountains" just left us already willing to turn around and forget about the waterfall.  

Anyways, we finally made it to Agua Azul. During the rainy season the water is brown and you cannot swim however you get to see the "power" of the waterfall when 2-3 times more water is coming down. Fabulous. 

As for the rest, it's an extremely commercial place. There are places selling food and souvenirs from the bottom of the waterfalls all the way up to the calm pools. Sadly trash here and there, also in the water, mostly produced by the food sellers. 

I must say, my family visited this place 20 years ago and said to be paradise. I couldn't confirm it. Maybe we were unlucky but as a traveler I also want to share the unpleasant experiences. 

If you are in Palenque maybe try rather Misol-HA and cascades Roberto Barrios which are closer to Palenque. 

Good luck!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

501484753.name: Beautiful, but crowded and remote
501484753.author: a TripAdvisor user
501484753.reviewBody:
The water is very beautiful and it's an ideal place to spend the day walking, swimming, or doing light hiking. Do be aware that June through November are the rainy months and you're likely to see only a river of brown water. Ideally, plan your visit for February through April. 

 It's a bit far from Palenque - almost two hours by car. A mile or two before the site, your car will be forced to stop and pay local kids in order to continue. Children line the street on either side, holding wires across the road, and when you stop the car, they bombard you and demand money. This is common in very poor areas in South America, and I've seen this type of shakedown before, but it's not as common in Mexico. The children are not violent, and they were not accompanied by any threatening adults, but they do get more and more demanding as you continue down the road. We were stopped about 8 times, handing out coins each time - 5, 10, 15, 20 pesos each time to multiple hands reaching in the window. By the final point of extortion, the children were demanding more, boldly stating, "Dame 30", and "dame 50", and "dame 100" and finally "dame todo"  (Give me all of it). At first it was cute, but then it became a little tiresome, and finally off-putting, but we speak Spanish and were traveling with Mexicans from Veracruz, who came prepared with lots of change, so it was considered an endearing inconvenience. Don't let it deter you from traveling here. Just be aware, patient, and come prepared with lots of pocket change. Consider it part of the price to be allowed entry into a beautiful natural wonder. 
I usually take the bus everywhere in Mexico, so we went to Cascadas Misol-Ha first, and just ASSUMED that afterward we could catch one of many colectivos or buses passing by the entrance (they did not). There aren't any buses that leave directly from Misol-Ha other than those blasted tour buses, but I'm sure you could catch a bus from Palenque in order to skip all the extortion stops. Personally, I prefer being extorted for pocket change than having something more precious extorted from me by tour companies - my freedom of choice. Arranged tours arrive with all the crowds and limit your exposure to an area to a few hours, then round everyone up and leave early. I think it's far better to arrive here early in the morning and enjoy the day here. Definitely come on a weekday, and never during Semana Santa (spring break / the week before Easter).
As for the site itself, we paid for parking as we entered and paid another person, a "free agent" offering to "watch" our car while we visited, much like the gangs of NY neighborhoods who used to collect "protection fees" to protect local small businesses from the protectors. But we paid 20 or 30 pesos and he went away. Better to just pay than come back to a car with a broken window. 

This was the most crowded site we visited in Chiapas (aside from Las Cascadas de Misol-Ha). I debated whether it was worth visiting a site so far from Palenque, knowing it would be very crowded. It was (worth it). But you have to visit with the understanding that it will not be a serene experience in any way. This site is all about the views. You will need to screen out the background visitor chatter and vendors hawking their wares from many stalls along the river walkway. 
A wide, upward-sloping concrete walkway has been built along the left side of the river/falls, which allows you (and hundreds of others) to shuffle your way along the river, inching your way to the front of the crowds to take photos from the wooden observation decks which jut out over the water's edge.
The farther up you go, the less crowded it becomes, and the more low spots you'll find, where you can walk out along the rocks and take pictures or swim. There are restaurants along the river near the entrance, serving typical food. Pricier than town, of course. 

For an extra fee of around 60 or 70 pesos per person, you can cross the river on a bridge and explore the other side. We were limited on time and didn't do so, but I'm willing to bet its far less crowded on that side simply because it costs a few extra dollars. I only saw 3 people pay and proceed. 

Despite the many people everywhere you turn, the water, river, and various falls are so breathtakingly beautiful that you soon screen out all the people. If you resign yourself to the fact that there will be many people there and that you will have to line up for photo opportunities, you will still find the views and photos worth the crowds you must fight. 

If crowds "aren't your bag, Baby", head for the lesser known, Cascadas de Roberto Barrio, a much smaller site with far fewer people and great jumping sites. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy Palenque!

499023160.name: Why spoil the beauty with all the commerce?
499023160.author: a TripAdvisor user
499023160.reviewBody: My 3rd time to Agua Azul in over 20 years. Have great memories of my first time here back in 1991 when the place was not yet popular nor exploited for commerce. Back then we could swim freely in some of its pools with no one to bother us. I felt alive, free and enjoyed the sensation of been lost in the tropical forest.  At the time of this review  (June 2017) Agua Azul is saturated with food and souvenir stalls and crowded with vendors. It now feels claustrophobic, dirty, hard to enjoy and  lost in tourist-land.  I understand that people from the surrounding communities need to find an income but wish the authorities were more careful on how much commerce to allow in the park. It\'s still worth the stop on your way from San Cristobal to Palenque (or vise-versa) but do not make this your destination. Just stop over for an hour or two and move on. I heard from our guide there are other not well known waterfalls in the area which are more beautiful and less crowded. So ask around for an alternative before you go if you are more of a purist and nature lover.

484483091.name: Amazing Waterfalls in an Incredible Surrounding
484483091.author: a TripAdvisor user
484483091.reviewBody:
We drove up to Agua Azul from Palenque. The ride took us about 1 hour & a half up a curvy, winding road. Once you leave the city & begin heading up the mountain, the road can be very rough at times, & you are in the land of the Maya. Along the way you'll see children, & mother's selling Mayan fruit snacks, & drinks, as well as clothing & souvenir items. Don't hesitate to pull over or allow the kids to come to your window & check out the goods. . . All for a mere few pesos . . .

Once at the Agua Azul area, you'll be directed to an area to park to park your car. Then you walk through a maze of restaurants & souvenir shops to the falls. Take your beach clothes & towels, as well as wear sandals & water shoes. The water is cool & so refreshing. You can choose from several large pool areas to enjoy the 'aqua blue' waters. There is a narrow path that follows the falls up the mountain that is filled with restaurants serving fast food or sit down style. They all seem to have "empanadas", 5 for 15 pesos. The path is also filled with little shops selling clothing, t-shirts, toys, & other knickknacks.

Make the drive when you have the entire day to enjoy the drive, the waterfalls, & the food / souvenir stalls. And make the drive during the weekday, & leave early. Take time to stop along the route to buy a snack or more from the local people who are trying to eek out a living. Make sure you have plenty of cambio/change to buy a mango or two, or some other exotic fruit. Enjoy the local vibe & feel from the Mayan people. Allow yourself to encounter & experience the 3rd world in all it's natural splendor, & reality. .  I definitely recommend this day trip from Palenque after visiting the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

483744083.name: Beautiful place but very crowded
483744083.author: a TripAdvisor user
483744083.reviewBody: Very nice river landscape with amazing blue colored water. There are a lot of souvenir shops and restaurants along the waterfalls. There are also several marked areas where you can have a swim. After visiting the place, we heard that there were several tragic swimming accidents in the river just the days before our visit. I don\'t know whether that is true and if the people affected knew how to swim but just be aware of the risks and be careful if you plan to dip into one of the natural pools. \nOverall, nature has created a very beautiful place but with all the souvenir shops and crowds of visitors, it kind of lost its spirit. We did a day trip from Palenque that took us 2h each way to reach Aguas Azules and we would not do this trip again.

464565459.name: Crystal clear waters, beautiful views
464565459.author: a TripAdvisor user
464565459.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfalls surrounded by dense forest/jungle. The waters are crystal clear and range from rapid waterfalls, to bubbling brooks, to calm lagoons perfect for wading in.\nThe weather was very warm and muggy when I went, and the water was the perfect way to cool off!\nLots of merchandise vendors, and places to get drinks and food, and even a few sit down restaurants. Lots of tourists so get there early for parking and stay together to avoid getting lost!

463764035.name: Visite a Agua Azul casacadas en Chiapas
463764035.author: a TripAdvisor user
463764035.reviewBody: On the way from San Cristobal de las Casas to Palenque, our tour bus made an hour and 1/2 stop at Agua Azul the convergence of two or three rivers on the east side of the Sierra Madre mountains. This area has a lot of water and a lot of rivers. This area was special due to the color of the waters (bluish green) which arises from the geologic zones the water travels through with calcium and other minerals. As others have noted there are vendors with food and artesan items all along the trail which makes it pretty commercial. Fortunately we were there in Feb, in the morning and there were not many others there (not croweded and cooler). Beautiful just to sit and watch and listen to the water flowing and not just snap a bunch of photos, and think about earlier days, the significance of this place in the jungle and the people who have lived there for eons.\nThere are pools you can swim in and a trail that goes along the river.  We only went to the end of the main trail (1/2 mile).

462339993.name: Spectacular Azure Waterfalls
462339993.author: a TripAdvisor user
462339993.reviewBody: Water is indeed azure and the scene is splendid. Three layers of falls, each about 5-10m high and 50-80m wide.This spot is well worth the visit. The  river\'s azure is ethereal and mixed with the white foam as the water cascades over the rocks presents a unique spectacle of color. There are also areas below the falls marked for swimming. The site is crowded, and we were there on a weekday but in high season.  Lots of booths selling crafts lined path from lower falls to upper. The crafts are everything from necessities for an outdoor visit (sunglasses, sunblock) to jade, amber, and obsidian jewelry, carved wooden Mayan effigies ((panthers, serpents) and colorful Mayan weaving.

455335321.name: CHECK WITH A TOUR GUIDE BEFORE YOU GO
455335321.author: a TripAdvisor user
455335321.reviewBody:
TOUR COMPANIES WILL NOT REFUND YOUR MONEY IF THEY ARE TURNED AROUND BY A ZAPATISTA BLOCKADE.  It's in the fine print.
    Unless you book directly with a tour company and are willing to accept a bit of a price gouge, it's fairly easy to get there on your own.  You can find a collectivo near the ADO station or in Palenque Centro.   Just look for the vans with the Agua Azul sign in the front window, or head into Centro and look for a tour operator heading to Ocasingo or San Cristobal.  They will take you the 50 or so kilometers to the intersection which is 9km from Agua Azul(we paid 30p per person for this, about 2 hrs) and then take a taxi to the waterfalls. (another 40-60p total, about 5 minutes)  You will pay your entrance fee while in the taxi, 60p each if I remember correctly.
    There are way to many restaurants and souvenir vendors, in my opinion, but they at least line the path that leads you up to the top.  You will pass multiple swimming spots, and ultimately reach a sign where there will be a guide who will take you even further to a gorge that I'm sure you can read about in other TA posts.
     In our instance,  however, there was a growing protest by locals, apparently about massive gas price hikes, that went well beyond the usual 'highway toll' paid by collectivo drivers.  We were forced to leave our collectivo about half way there, and walk about 1.5 km, find another collectivo, and pay another 30p (I know it's not much), just to make it to the Agua Azul intersection.  
     This left us a little anxious about the time we should spend enjoying the beautiful waterfalls, and so we cut our time a little shorter than we would have liked, thankfully.  Upon our return, the blockade had grown to a full blown roadblock; a spiked 2x4 blocking the road until our driver paid 50p.  A few km later, there was a freshly cut tree blocking the road and several vehicles ahead of us which were not allowed to pass.  
     This is where it got crazy.  A man attampted to remove a boulder blocking the road, and he was then attacked by a protester with multiple blows from a machete.  During this melee,  all the vehicles in line managed to drive over the tree and travelled in convoy back to Palenque.  
     Talking with as many locals as we could, it was made clear that although the roadblocks demanding pesos were not out of the ordinary, the violence we witnessed was abnormal.  This was on January 25, 2017.  We left Palenque on the 27th, and as far as we could assertain,  the road from Palenque to San Cristobal,  and therefore Agua Azul, was still blockaded.
     If you've read this far, that is the point of my review statement:  Check with a few tour operators if the road is indeed open.  Although they are few and far between, some of these companies will charge you for the trip, then turn around at the blockade and tell you to read the fine print,  which clearly absolves them of refund in the case of 'blockade'.(we met 2 people that day who were turned around without refund)
  While that is understandable on the day the blockade is erected, there were others we met who went to Agua Azul the next day and we're turned around without refund, while the operators knew full well what was going on.

453976058.reviewBody: The Waterfall are a picturesque heaven. It\'s not over crowded and there seems to be very low tourism going on in Chiapas, that\'s what made the trip interesting. There are alot and I mean ALOT of children begging for Peso all over the area. we even had moments driving there where a Women and her daughters blocks the road by using rope to cut of the road and then holding the front on the car begging for us to buy something. we did give 20 peso and they let us off. but at the park I found every moment was buy this, can i have peso and on... I feel sad for them, but i felt that i was just throwing money everywhere and not enjoying my trip that took me hours and lots of money in petrol to get too.

Nowadays only a fraction of the space is open for the swimming, defenitely for security reasons, but it miss the adrenaline part of rafting throug the white waters as it was possible before... For swimming activities I would recomend other places in Chapas - there are a lot of them nearby.

The name suggests blue waters but maybe because it had been raining the water was a muddy brown. The outstanding natural feature here is a series of low cascades which give you a pleasant view but after 15 minutes of ro start looking pretty much like the other. The tour bus won\'t be leaving before another 90 minutes so you have time to tour yet another series of craft stalls, local food stalls and hawkers. Pleasant but in retrospect would have appreciated an earlier ride to the hotel after palanque. This is reasonmable if y0ou\'re on your way somewhere else but the time to get there from Palanque as well as the time spent there were in my opinion excessive. check with your tour company before you go unless you really like waterfalls .

445017178.name: Amazing beauty and refreshing mountain water
445017178.author: a TripAdvisor user
445017178.reviewBody: What at first feels like a large arts and crafts market, with a small waterfall added for entertainment, eventually turns into an amazing display of natural beauty the further up you follow the falls, leaving the ubiquitous and rather annoying vendors behind. You can follow the river for 40 minutes towards its origins, which we didn\'t do. Instead we opted for a swim in the refreshing pool at the bottom of the lower cascade. Since most of the visitors either didn\'t know how to swim or were reluctant to approach the falls, we had most of the large pool of blue water to ourselves. You can swim to some rock formations (and the next step of the cascade) to take in the sun. Overall, definitely a must-visit for Chiapas travelers, despite the excessive market activity and the resulting complete lack of solemnity that other less known cascades may offer.

Still a beautiful experience, plenty of food places and drink places along the way. I would recommend to try the small bananas, they are delicious.\nI recommend to park your car and walk around, you can walk up towards the top and just look around. I am going to try and make it back during the warmer weather so I can experience the Blue Falls for myself.

The agency told us that arrival time to SC is 21:30, but the reality was different. After we finished our visit in Agua Azul, we went by minivan almost 1 hour in the opposite direction (back to Palenque), than minivan stoped in some village and we had to wait for another minivan for another 30minutes which took us to SC. We arrived to SC at 23:15!!! The whole trip was very nice but we did not like the organisation of the transport to SC.

436926795.name: Cascading blue swimming pools
436926795.author: a TripAdvisor user
436926795.reviewBody:
A short trip into the mountains in a collectivo, or coach tour from Palenque. 

At Agua Azul, the river cascades down over the natural rock formations to form near endless blue swimming holes with small waterfalls and lifeguards looking out for you.

Lots of little stalls selling food and local crafts.

Well policed along the route and regular collectivos from Palenque to the top of the hill, you'll then need to get a taxi down to the falls.  Alternatively, you can get a taxi or bus to drive you or a group directly there.

Anyway, the place is something where I would have liked to spend the entire day...you can also swim there, and the water in a sunny day is great, a bit cool.

To reach the spring, be prepared to be stopped with "guides" trying to sell you their help. NO THANKS.
