419979760.author: a TripAdvisor user
419979760.reviewBody: Agua Azul is the attraction I tell EVERYONE about.  Chiapas, Mexico, is my all-time favorite destination, and I have to admit that the main reason is because of these waterfalls.  A tour is fairly cheap, and will take you to other nearby attractions.  It\'s well worth it.  My photos say more than I can in words.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

413873153.name: Spectacular waterfall
413873153.author: a TripAdvisor user
413873153.reviewBody: Fantastic place! Huge falls with amazing formations. Lovely cool water, bring your swimming gear! Too many vendors lining the path.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

411001873.name: Really Azul
411001873.author: a TripAdvisor user
411001873.reviewBody: Amazing puddles compose these beautiful falls that have several levels.\nWith a 30 minutes walk you can climb back the river until the spring of the falls (for the very last part of the path you are obliged to pay a guide that takes you there)\nWonderful natural place

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

406018680.name: Good place but too much suovenirs
406018680.author: a TripAdvisor user
406018680.reviewBody:
Agua Azul is "azul" only if in the days before (at least 2/3 days before) the weather was good, otherwise the water is not so clean and appears "normal" or brown.
There are several cataracts, several natural pool where you can swim and the water is cool.
The best thing to visit Agua Azul is with a tour operator, because of the streets are often "occupied" by local people, so it's better to have a a local guide. The cost to visit Agua Azul e Misol-ha is around 300 pesos per person.
The site is  about 65 Km from Palenque (1h30m) along the route towards San Cristobal. 
The site is full of souvenirs shops, food shops and other "touristic attractions" and these things damage the atmosphere.
Consider 2 hours for the visit, 1h30 to reach the site, so at least an half day (including Misol-ha).
In conclusion a good, but not a fundamental trip.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

405893709.name: Impressive
405893709.author: a TripAdvisor user
405893709.reviewBody: First, I recommend to do this activity alone and not in a day trip filled with other activities. You have to spend the entire day there. There is a lot to see and you can swim, shop, eat, drink and hike.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

399766151.name: Refreshing swim after a hot and humid visit to Yaxchilan ruins.
399766151.author: a TripAdvisor user
399766151.reviewBody: Very welcome swim after visiting Yaxchilan.  Great any time of year but in October and November after the rainy season the water is a much deeper blue.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

397305431.name: Waste of time during rainy season
397305431.author: a TripAdvisor user
397305431.reviewBody: If you plan to go there from may to august, you might find these waters all but blue! Impressive waterfalls, but after the rain really brown water (Cajeta/ Caramal) - although its possible to get in for a swim.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

397162881.name: Cascades of blue water
397162881.author: a TripAdvisor user
397162881.reviewBody: Amazingggggggggg! A definitely must see once you are in Chiapas!!!! Lovely cascades and as the name says blue waters! Lots of visitors, lots of vendors and you can bathe in the pools! A very amazing site to see!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

393221686.name: Amazing view
393221686.author: a TripAdvisor user
393221686.reviewBody: We visited this place a day without many turists. Try to go to the top and have a view down the waterfalls. There are a lot of street vendors who can be very annoying but that may be because there wasn\'t many tourists the day we visited. All in one an amazing experience.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

392673860.name: Inspiring nature
392673860.author: a TripAdvisor user
392673860.reviewBody: The falls are fantastic, my teens loved the spot! Chiapas is a great state to visit in Mexico, probably the most beautiful and interesting. Great mix of amazing landscapes and archeological heritage. We will definitively be back!!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

391897572.name: impressive
391897572.author: a TripAdvisor user
391897572.reviewBody: This waterfalls are absolutely impressive.. best time of the year to see the real shades of the water is from January to April but this is also dry season and the weather is hot.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

389136400.name: Very beautiful
389136400.author: a TripAdvisor user
389136400.reviewBody: This is another site to visit.  It does involve a lot of walking up a gradual slope.  But the views are worth, and maybe also the shopping along the route

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

388881292.name: Beatiful!
388881292.author: a TripAdvisor user
388881292.reviewBody: Agua Azul is a beautiful, turquoise colored river that you can swim in. There are a lot of food options and, of course, vendors, but not pushy, annoying vendors. You can also walk along the river to multiple swimming areas. Bathrooms are plentiful for $5 pesos. If you keep walking you\'ll come to a canyon, but you can supposedly only hike around the canyon with a guide. I can\'t vouch for the canyon because I had to catch my shuttle.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

388290860.name: Very nice.... Just how many souvenir sellers can i take?
388290860.author: a TripAdvisor user
388290860.reviewBody:
In a way it is all there... Magic falls, semi adventure to get there with your car, fab swimming in nature, ...But then... Why, why,why do we need to plaster every corner with a stupid souvenir store selling me what I have just seen in stores before... With it comes aggressive selling and destruction of any nature feeling... What a pity...
Anyway... If you are the traveller of the beaten track... You will be disappointed... If you seek safety in numbers and don't want to swim... I guess this is ok.

Ca. 200m BEFORE the 2nd swimming area is a secret spot to jump of a waterfall and balance over the water on a tree... Very nice... Local guy showed us all the tricks! Can recomend!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

387262704.name: Beautiful
387262704.author: a TripAdvisor user
387262704.reviewBody:
Went to cascada agua azul in June and they are amazing.  Unfortunately since its rain season the water was not cristal blue but more of a light brown, still they are so beautiful and i would recommend it. 

On the way there the locals block the street at least 3 different times and ask for money otherwise they wont let you pass. I think we payed for the whole van 100 pesos at one point.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

386248565.name: Amazing place
386248565.author: a TripAdvisor user
386248565.reviewBody: We visited that place with rental car and I can not say that was good idea. The road is not in good shape and we were stop twice by Mexican who stayed in front of our car and asked for the money. I recommended to use Colectivo from Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

384065459.name: Great Trip - Great Water
384065459.author: a TripAdvisor user
384065459.reviewBody: We drove to Agua Azul from Palenque, and it took over an hour and 15 minutes to get there.  There is a private toll to enter the road to the area, which I thinks was 20 pesos per person, and an entrance fee to the water.  I don\'t remember the fee to enter the area, but it was a nominal fee.  Well, the water is beautiful, and if I lived in the area, my family and I would be there quite often.  It is an absolutely spectacular water area.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

384017348.name: Amazing spot on the way to Palenque from Ocosingo.
384017348.author: a TripAdvisor user
384017348.reviewBody: I suggest to go between Semana Santa and the end of May, otherwise the rains will affect the colours of this marvellous natural spot.\nEvery year gets just a bit too turistic, though..\nin order to get here you can get a collectivo in Palenque close to the market and ask for collectivo\'s direction to "Ocosingo". Definetely cheaper than a tour;)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

382701122.name: Beautiful
382701122.author: a TripAdvisor user
382701122.reviewBody: Beautiful! And enough room to swim. Go and you will definitely not be disappointed. The pictures are exactly as it is: Blue, gorgeous and not that crowded. Highlight.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

381702364.name: Nasty visit
381702364.author: a TripAdvisor user
381702364.reviewBody: I would highly discourage the visit here, first they have blockade from some little \nGirls, they demand you buy their products or you don\'t pass, then there are 2 blockades demanding their quotas per person totaling just to have access $150 pesos per person, the government and police do nothing and who ever you talk to say is outrageous. The waterfalls are swarming with peddlers and there litter everywhere. Totally bad experience . Would not recommend, take your money elsewhere

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

379635472.name: a "don\'t miss"
379635472.author: a TripAdvisor user
379635472.reviewBody: perhaps a mile long cascade of water falls where you can walk up the entire length of the falls and see it from start to finish.  Fabulous

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

379161018.name: A beautiful aqua blue sets of cascades
379161018.author: a TripAdvisor user
379161018.reviewBody: Cascades you can swim in? Go to Agua Azul. Beautiful waterfalls to watch and admire? then go elsewhere eg Misol Ha. Agua Azul is a very nice location with cascades of water down a mountain side. The cascades are layered, none particularly high, but quite strong in their various elements. As an overall view nothing special, but a delight to swim and cool off in after a log hot day, probably walking around the ruins of Palenque. Very touristy with loads of stalls surrounding the area. None oppressive but quite dominant as you walk up the mountain side.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

379151107.name: Pretty but a lot of stalls and sellers
379151107.author: a TripAdvisor user
379151107.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfall but it was overshadowed somewhat by the plethora of stores along the side of the river and also by being hassled by children and women selling bananas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

373436094.name: Fun for a day
373436094.author: a TripAdvisor user
373436094.reviewBody:
We went there for a day, luckily for us, the place wasn't full of tourists like us. You can swim at different levels of the cascadas, lifeguards are their to keep an eye on you if you are in difficulties. 
There is a really nice mirador to go check out as the view is really amazing.

It's a really nice place to relax for the day. You can go there in collectivos, but be aware that the collectivos let you a few kilometers before the entrance of it. We walked down to the entrance (1h approx) and taxied our way back up to catch the collectivos.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

371567338.name: beautiful waterfalls but water not blue as sold online
371567338.author: a TripAdvisor user
371567338.reviewBody: I was looking forward to gorgeous blue, green like coloured water by the waterfalls (and the tourists in our tour bus were too), but we were all disappointed when we got there.  Can\'t deny that the view of the waterfalls themselves look AMAZING and the \'mirador\' gives opportunity for great pictures with the waterfalls as background, but the water looked brown and murky. Not certain if its the time of the year, but after speaking to some locals, they said it tends to be brown and murky almost all the time.  We opted not to get in the water though we were looking forward to it.  Instead we sat to enjoy the view and take some drinks.  There are plenty of options for restaurants (AVOID RESTAURANT MAYA - service is extremely slow and not so friendly) (many of the restaurants offer an order of panades for 20 pesos).  Plenty of options of souvenir shops too - many souvenir shops offer writing your name or souvenir recipient\'s name on leather souvenir, just ask (no additional cost)!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

370713056.name: Safe and Beautiful
370713056.author: a TripAdvisor user
370713056.reviewBody:
We had read some reviews about Aqua Azul being a little dangerous in terms of muggings etc, however we felt completely comfortable and safe there. It is full of tourists visiting (both Mexican and Western), shops and small places to eat or have a cerveza. Like any tourist sight, you wouldn't leave your bag or valuables unattended on the side of the path whilst swimming. 

We went with a tour and our guide told us to just say no to the small children if you didn't want to purchase anything they had to sell, rather than saying "later" or "I'll come back" as they know your lying and don't like it. 

As a side note, the road from Palenque to Aqua Azul passes through various traditional villages. At times, they will set up a make shift road block and stop you passing through to ask for a payment. This happened to us and they only wanted $3 pesos per person. Although it can look a little scary, as it's usually a group of young boys and men, they really are just asking for something small seems you are accessing their land to see the sights. Once you pay them, they are all smiles and let you through. If you don't want to pay, you'll just have to turn around & go back. 

All in all, highly recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

369727090.name: Beauty spoilt by vedor stalls
369727090.author: a TripAdvisor user
369727090.reviewBody: The falls themselves were quite beautiful.  They had the lovely blue colour and the falls were impressive.  People were swimming in the lower reaches of the falls.  If you can look at the falls (and photograph them) without seeing the stalls that line the pathway, you are lucky.  It is a very touristy place and well worth the stopover to have a look.  It was very packed when we were there with lots of families picnicking around the falls.  The stalls selling souvenirs and food were hard to miss and often spoilt some views of the falls.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

366243062.name: Not blue all year and extremely touristy!
366243062.author: a TripAdvisor user
366243062.reviewBody: It is undeniable that the waterfall itself is spectacular but it is overcrowded and full of souvenir, food stalls, etc. You can\'t appreciate the natural beauty of Agua Azul, even you try to look away from them. Do not waste your time. And most time of the year, the waterfall is brown and muddy. There are so many other nicer but smaller waterfalls in Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

365802676.name: Spectacular place!!!
365802676.author: a TripAdvisor user
365802676.reviewBody:
I have been to various falls in the Northern part of Mexico, which are nice, however Agua Azul is out of this world.
The great part is that it is permitted to swim in the falls.
There is a $1.5 USD access fee which includes lifeguards.
There are a lot of people selling crafts and food, prices are reasonable.
The driving distance between Palenque and Agua Azul is about 2 hours.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

365802504.name: Beautiful blue falls/stream
365802504.author: a TripAdvisor user
365802504.reviewBody: My son and I visited Aqua Azul on the way to Chiapas. It was beautiful. The water was cold, but refreshing.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

365584890.name: Gorgeous!
365584890.author: a TripAdvisor user
365584890.reviewBody:
Absolutely loved the experience. Cheap and beautiful! You can have a walk behind the waterfall, you can have a swim, and you can even hike downstream through the water and rocks. really exciting and adventurous. A place to visit with any person or age.

You can have nice typical food there at any stall and also do some souvenir shopping!

Beware!!! Of the kids which set up a rope to stop you driving in the road towards the waterfall. Just stop and buythem food or give them money. But be discrete with your wallet, as if they see large amounts, they will not stop till you give them more. Its a must to give them, if not they will dammage the cars, and hang onto them.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

364809383.name: Can not miss!!!
364809383.author: a TripAdvisor user
364809383.reviewBody: The waterfall is really inpressive with a light blue water color, the site seen is unique! From Palenque you drive not more than a hour and the road is not so bad, pay attention to the curves when you go down the hill. While there don\'t miss the fruits the kids and ladies from the community sells. Sugar cane was also a good surprise since Last time I tastes was when I was a young child! You don,t need the whole day to visit and you can plan for Agua Azul and Misol- Ha at the same day.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

362761584.name: Special and magical
362761584.author: a TripAdvisor user
362761584.reviewBody: Worth the trip! They are blue. They are warm and you will never see another place like these on earth again...go if you are in Chiapas!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

362147062.name: I wish I could rate it a Zero!
362147062.author: a TripAdvisor user
362147062.reviewBody: This is nothing more than a craft mall and food court with a swimming hole and some turbulent water. Sure on a hot day it\'s nice to cool off but save the gas and use your hotel pool or a bathtub. My girlfriend was there 25 years ago when it was pristine and lovely. Now it\'s a gauntlet of aggressive vendors and protection racketeers.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

361016354.name: Great for swimming
361016354.author: a TripAdvisor user
361016354.reviewBody: Lovely falls that a great for swimming. Food available on site but ours was poor to say the least. Go for the swimming and falls

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

360800984.name: Beautiful Waterfalls
360800984.author: a TripAdvisor user
360800984.reviewBody: The place is on the way to Palenque from San Cristobal. It is around 3.5-4 hours from San Cristobal. You can take some of the best photos of your life here. Go visit if you love nature. The water is very clear and u can swim also in the waterfalls. There are some local markets and restaurants which will keep your hunger silent and you can buy some of the handicrafts also. The place must be in your bucket list if u ever plan for Chiapas. I forgot to mentiona above that the waterfall is blue in color( most of the times:p)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

360573528.name: Amazing clear blue cascades
360573528.author: a TripAdvisor user
360573528.reviewBody: I\'ve seen such beautiful cascade waterfalls only in Laos so far. The water is turquoise blue, there is a path which is around 3 km long and goes along the cascades. On the way there are hundreds of stands with drinks, fruits, empanadas, clothes and souvenirs and restaurants with Mexican food. Every ca 200-300 metres there is a swimming spot. There are a lot of toilets (5-10 pesos) and changing rooms, too.\n\nOnly be prepared for tens of children and women imposing food on tourists (mini bananas, dried banana chips and other fruits). It is very cheap tough so if you like dried or fried bananas, don\'t hesitate to buy some here.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

360363192.name: A surprise upstream
360363192.author: a TripAdvisor user
360363192.reviewBody: We went there on a day tour to Palenque from San Crist\u00f3bal. The driver advised us to have our breakfast fast before the place got too crowded and then visit the waterfalls as we only hada couple of hours. Luckily we didn\'t do that. Actually there are dozens of places to eat within the park and we would have missed the upper part of the waterfalls which is a long walk upstream. I advice you to pick a local guide who can walk and talk you there). This way you can enjoy the two very different and separate parts of the waterfalls (see photos)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

359896545.name: Lovely place but we got Brown Water
359896545.author: a TripAdvisor user
359896545.reviewBody: This is a lovely place, famous for its incredible blue waters, what we did not know is that on days after a hard rain the water gets muddy and you get brown water, so try to find out before hand, or be ready for this possibily.\n Anyway the setting in the jungle is great, except for the great number of vendors all around

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

359408324.name: Natural pools
359408324.author: a TripAdvisor user
359408324.reviewBody: In this place you can find a wonderfull and deep blue natural pools. The color of the water is insane, the water is a little cold but is delicious swim in this waters. The enviroment is simply magic and the falls are beautiful. In the park you can find cheap food and a lot of crafts and souvenirs. The top of the falls are 40 minutes by walking. You must visit this place if you are in palenque

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

359134203.name: Good swim
359134203.author: a TripAdvisor user
359134203.reviewBody: These are very nice falls . We had a good swim after a hot day of tours . Had a good fish dinner . There are many restaurants and shop stalls .

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

358752876.name: Stunning!
358752876.author: a TripAdvisor user
358752876.reviewBody: Very stunning view and impeccable nature. Many shops with handcrafts line the falls in addition to food booths. Swimming is available, including some life guards and ability to jump off small falls.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

358247329.name: Surprise
358247329.author: a TripAdvisor user
358247329.reviewBody: On my way from San Cristobal to Palenque I saw signs of Agua Azul, I was a bit early and it was just 5 km. from the main road. The place was very quiet at that time of the year and late in the day. Beautifull cascade, it is worth the stop and there are some restaurants and food vendors at the cascade.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

356662989.name: Go with collectivo and stay
356662989.author: a TripAdvisor user
356662989.reviewBody:
It's winding mountain road 5-8 hours with ADO to Palanque from San Cristobal with dozens of speed ramps. So to save yourself from the terrible ride you can take some breaks by taking 60 peso collectivo to Ocosingo then 30 peso to intersection of Agua Azul, and transfer to a shared taxi 20/pp pesos to the park. You will find next transfer same place where you get off, hardly any wait time and the driver even help you take your backpack. On your way out you take another shared taxi to the intersection and catch a pass by collectivo from Ocosingo and it will take you to Palanque for 40 peso. Not counting the shared taxi it's a little over 100, cheaper than ADO pre-booking price 185 and make way more sense than going straight to Palanque and take another couple hours winding mountain road back south again for a day trip. 

20 something pesos entry fee, doesn't look like there is a close time cause I got there when it's already getting dark, a ranger asked me to pay when I entered with taxi. There are many restaurants and venders there, locals are very nice, it's possible to find a place to watch your stuff. Its actually a local village with school and playground inside the park right next to the parking place. If you like you can stay in one of the  pousadas for around 200 peso, basic accommodation but nice to hangout with kids and walk to the waterfall anytime you like in less than 5 mins. 

Even after Niaguana, Iguazu, Jiuzhaigou, and Pamukkale, didn't imagine I actually liked Agua Azuel, it's a mix of river, waterfall, water paddles and jungle. You Do NOT need a guid, just fallow the path, very easy. The water at the bottom is pretty light bright blue, it gets a little greener as you walk up, and some places it allows you to swim :) It got me a little worried when it started to rain at night till next day morning, cause some places blue water turn darker or browner when it's raining or cloudy. I was very surprised the water was still this bright blue even it was cloudy the whole day. It's not that touristy if you compare with other water places I mentioned, especially if you stay in the village and go before/after the tour bus.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

355138871.name: Awesome falls and nice swim
355138871.author: a TripAdvisor user
355138871.reviewBody: Did this and Palenque as part of your that ended in San Cristobal. Palenque can be done in 3 hours easy and a visit to a great waterfall and then 3 hours at the beautiful Agua Azul made for a great day and I also killed two birds by getting to San Cristobal the same day.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

354916973.name: Beautful cascades
354916973.author: a TripAdvisor user
354916973.reviewBody:
When you get out of the shuttle you only see two restaurant, not very attractive and a little farther a waterfall and a large pool.
But if you go on and walk along the path you will find dozens of shops, cafeterias, restaurants, food stands and more and more cascades, waterfalls and more pools where you can swim.
The color of the water is more white-green than blue (azul). Very nice.
You can walk along the river for a treck.

It takes 5-6 hours to get to San Cristobal. The road has bumps every hundreds meters and its slow down the minivan on the bumpy road.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

354466621.name: beautiful!
354466621.author: a TripAdvisor user
354466621.reviewBody: just gorgeous blue water, nice walking around then have a dip, lots of restaurant or snack places, booze of you want it, great place for a swim.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

352218724.name: Beautiful waterfalls with lots of nature in it
352218724.author: a TripAdvisor user
352218724.reviewBody: I visited this place and I was impressed by the clear blue water the falls have in it, also you can do some swimming there. You\u00b4ll find also lots of places to get some souvenirs and good food. The weather was hot so better take sunblock with you.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

351175229.name: Amazing site to visit and lunch was great
351175229.author: a TripAdvisor user
351175229.reviewBody: Well worth seeing.  The color of,the water is amazing and the numerous waterfalls are stunning.    This is,well,worth the stop.  We also had the local filet of fish  for lunch which was very good.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

349004459.name: Absolutely beautiful
349004459.author: a TripAdvisor user
349004459.reviewBody: There is a reason this is one of the most popular tourist spots around Palenque - it is breathtakingly beautiful.  Yes, it is very much on the tourist trail and can be on the busy side, with a line of food and souvenir stalls leading up to it.  But, even that can\'t spoil the wonder of this place.  The pictures simply do not do it justice - it\'s much larger than it seems, with many levels of small falls and various pools in which you can swim.\n\nI went on a tour from Palenque (which is what most people seem to do), we spent about 2 hours here.  You can probably do it yourself via collectivos for a similar price, and then set your own schedule.  Most tours seem to arrive between 11am -5pm so if you want more alone time at the falls, try to aim outside of this window.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

348953335.name: Bluer than Blue
348953335.author: a TripAdvisor user
348953335.reviewBody: Incredibly blue water and simply breathtaking waterfalls. Bring your swimming suit to have a dip in the hot day. Wish we had more time to visit the area.\nThey are not to be missed one of the most beautiful natural wonders of the country.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

348948749.name: Gorgeous, but very commercialized now
348948749.author: a TripAdvisor user
348948749.reviewBody: It was Christmas day so lots of locals were enjoying the water, but it was a fantastic time. Found a nice little restaurant (there are tons of them) along a stream that flows into the falls for a very inexpensive lunch and cold cervezas! Many children selling things from bananas to souvenirs and they are VERY persistent, but that\'s how they survive.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

348901008.name: refreshing
348901008.author: a TripAdvisor user
348901008.reviewBody: a pleasant place; one can make some short free-of-charge swim in the natural not cold(!)  pools; the usual souvenirs plus  good fish restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

348292216.name: Beautiful, water falls all around
348292216.author: a TripAdvisor user
348292216.reviewBody: It is a most in Chiapas.  Diferent types of water falls, you can find a local guide for just a tip and it is worth to do it.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

347410541.name: Impressive
347410541.author: a TripAdvisor user
347410541.reviewBody: Worth a visit, make sure you walk right up to the top\nThe stalls are worth a look I found them to stock some interesting items, the locals swim at the bottom of the falls \nI was told that part of the field Predator was filmed here

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

345865110.name: Stunning
345865110.author: a TripAdvisor user
345865110.reviewBody: Although it was a hassle to get there since locals were having a "bloqueo" on the road and no cars were allowed to go through, it was well worth it once we got there. If you take a \'colectivo\' from Palenque, you can get a cab for around M$30 per person to Agua Azul\'s entrance - otherwise it\'s a pretty long walk. It was a beautiful sunny day and the view was just breathtaking! We went to two swimming spots and it was a great way to spend the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

344101805.name: Great waterfalls and hike, too many souvenir vendors
344101805.author: a TripAdvisor user
344101805.reviewBody: Waterfalls are spectacular with nice walking trails alongside. Unfortunately the place is overrun with souvenir vendors and food stands, with someone approaching you to sell something almost every minute you are there. The natural beauty is awesome, but somewhat spoiled by the rant commercialization and wall to wall ramshackle booths and tarps covering the area and tied off to the trees.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

342971412.name: Well worth the visit.
342971412.author: a TripAdvisor user
342971412.reviewBody: This is a very interesting place.We traveled by car and found lots of parking  available but I understand some days it can get very crowded as many Mexican Nationals come here to relax and swim.There are several eateries here.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

342966326.name: Great place to visit
342966326.author: a TripAdvisor user
342966326.reviewBody: A spectacular site. Beautiful falls cascading into turquoise pools.  There is a walk up the side of the hill with a lot of restaurants and stalls selling stuff.  This can be a bit annoying, but it doesn\'t detract from the beauty of the falls.  Had a great time

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

342439688.name: Good for the sight and a swim
342439688.author: a TripAdvisor user
342439688.reviewBody: Lovely suite of falls and turquoise pools of water suitable for a swim. The walk up along the falls is littered with merchants, but they are not annoying. Plenty of food stalls for a cheap meal and fried tomales.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

342123810.name: Beautiful
342123810.author: a TripAdvisor user
342123810.reviewBody: Beautiful place, turquoise water, yellow rocks, thundering water - lot of traders along main pathway - but walk further upstream to find quieter spots. \nSwimming is very refreshing - but be aware of currents.\n

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

342008478.name: Wish it were quieter
342008478.author: a TripAdvisor user
342008478.reviewBody: Felt a bit cramp, but the water is beautiful, the waterfall too. The vendors do hassle you, but it is somewhere you need to visit nonetheless

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

341542154.name: Great Spot
341542154.author: a TripAdvisor user
341542154.reviewBody: I wish I could have seen this place 20 years ago before it was overrun with people, vendors, restaurants and the like. With that said, we\'re still very glad we made the stop and you just can\'t deny  how beautiful these sets of small falls are. Nature is amazing!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

339501102.name: Peccato la pioggia
339501102.author: a TripAdvisor user
339501102.reviewBody: Even this waterfall unfortunately we view in the rain, then we did not appreciated the way down, surely you notice that is a very characteristic.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

336305509.name: Beautiful
336305509.author: a TripAdvisor user
336305509.reviewBody: The water can be blue or not so blue, depending if it just rained. I will try to visit during the week, since it is a very popular site for the locals. When we visited it was full of people, so we had to climb up and up to feel a little bit more private, but the walk was amazing and discovered new and more waterfalls. The changing places are awful, so I will advise to wear your bathing suit before you get there. The bathrooms are awful too. So my recommendation is to go to a private bathroom in one of the good restaurants. This place, like many places in Chiapas, are in the hands of the indigenous people and believe me, the cleanliness is not their forte...they will charge you for using the bathroom and you will be happy to get a piece of toilet paper and a terrible toilet bowl. Don\'t even think of taking a shower. Other than that, it is a very beautiful place.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

334324550.name: Nice but ni Vic Falls
334324550.author: a TripAdvisor user
334324550.reviewBody: Not bad, but pretty pedestrian .  Long haul from Palenque .  Food and beverages  available . Realatively cheap ,  but overall not super impressive

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

333908298.name: Nice escapade from Palenque
333908298.author: a TripAdvisor user
333908298.reviewBody: It\'s a nice and easy trip to do. The environment is wonderfull and it brings an usefull refreshing moment.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

333188735.name: Bad luck?
333188735.author: a TripAdvisor user
333188735.reviewBody: I have been there with friends in december and I was super excited to finally get to see the cascadas. Unfortunately, we got there during rain season, so the water wasn\'t bright blue but muddy brown. I was really disappointed. Still I think if you are there at the right time it\'ll be beautiful, we probably just had bad luck

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

333185962.name: Very nice
333185962.author: a TripAdvisor user
333185962.reviewBody: Literally, it was a refreshing visit after a long drive from San Cristobal. \nThe waterfalls and swimming ponds are beautiful, and luckily there were not that many persons so we could go into one if them without too much problem. \nYes, someone might say these falls are not that high, but the total package you get is worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

332782862.name: Agua, Pero No Tanto Azul
332782862.author: a TripAdvisor user
332782862.reviewBody: We stopped here between Palenque & San Cristobal. Not bad, but definitely not \'blue\'. A bit too touisty, but worth a short stop.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

332613335.name: BREATHTAKING!
332613335.author: a TripAdvisor user
332613335.reviewBody: Amazing! All though there is too much people, but just go a little further the river and get a more isolated place. The water is amazing, go in, swim and enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

332490799.name: Unique, and tasty!
332490799.author: a TripAdvisor user
332490799.reviewBody: Walk around the beautiful river and food stands, have a bite, and relax! This phenomenon is truly remarkable and is easy to walk.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

330667843.name: Terrifying...
330667843.author: a TripAdvisor user
330667843.reviewBody: I hope things have improved in the area, but my experience was traumatizing. I made the drive from Palenque. Some two hours or so driving, and near Agua Azul, I was motioned to pass through a large crowd (200 plus) of men. As I entered the group I noticed a log lying across the other lane, and then some men pulled a large wooden plank with metal spikes sticking through across my lane. They demanded 200 pesos, handed me the document pictured, them allowed me to pass. I continued toward the cascades, but was stopped again by 3 very young men demanding 50 pesos. I was inclined to pay, but also turned around because of the men carrying assault rifles, wearing military fatigues, and wearing black bags over there heads who were standing about 40 meters away.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

330013615.name: Lovely view
330013615.author: a TripAdvisor user
330013615.reviewBody: Breath taking, the color of the water and the view. You could swim or just enjoy the natural life. Lots of shopping and places to eat.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

329016992.name: Nice site
329016992.author: a TripAdvisor user
329016992.reviewBody: On the way down to Palenque from San Critobal, stop in Aqua Azul for a couple of hours. It is a good place to rest and the cascades are really blue. There are to many merchants trying to sell you the authentic Mayan handcraft but that\'s the name of the game

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

328789425.name: Not worth it in rainy season
328789425.author: a TripAdvisor user
328789425.reviewBody: I visited 25 years ago when it wasn\'t crawling with vendors and was actually blue and much preferred it. Rainy season came late this year so there was tons of brown water, even overflowing the banks, which was interesting, but if not part of an organized tour not worth the drive on curvey poor roads. We did have some great grilled chicken and cold Superior beer in the parking lot (with free bathrooms) at the end.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

328107105.name: Great outdoor activity - bad food on premises
328107105.author: a TripAdvisor user
328107105.reviewBody: The park and waterfalls are magnificent. A great stop in a very winding road. Could not find any decent food on premises. And believe me, in this places you sometimes can find gastronomical gems.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

327590679.name: Beautiful place!
327590679.author: a TripAdvisor user
327590679.reviewBody: Well worth seeing.  A bit sad to note the impact that all of the tourism is having on the environment here.  Plenty of great places to eat all up and down the river.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

325810910.name: One of Mexico\'s most beautiful waterfalls
325810910.author: a TripAdvisor user
325810910.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many waterfalls within Mexico and I can say this place is one of the best and most beautiful waterfall places. Must visit place when coming to Chiapas and Palenque.\n\nMake sure you bring your swimsuit and fresh clothes.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

325701278.name: You can miss it
325701278.author: a TripAdvisor user
325701278.reviewBody: It is a nice landmark, but you can totally miss it. Full of vendors and restaurants. The water is not calling for a swim and it is kind of brownish azul.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

325652625.name: EXtensive waterfalls with the freedom to wander
325652625.author: a TripAdvisor user
325652625.reviewBody: Unfortunately Mother Nature decided that rainy season had arrived which meant that the blue water was brown!  But it was impressive despite that!  Plenty of time to wander around the area and bathe if you so wish.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

325159398.name: No blue in "Agua Azul"
325159398.author: a TripAdvisor user
325159398.reviewBody: I know it\'s nobody\'s fault but it was a little very dissapointing. Due to the wet season and that it just rained the day before, the waterfalls were just mood, no blue at all. The size of the waterfalls is stunishing but without the characteristic color, it was just meh. Not even swimming was very appealing, plus, the water is ice cold. Another thing I didn\'t quite like was the position of the watching spots, they are all in shadow so the pics you can take are awful. I normally hate tours but I really recommend to make one with this one, I went by my own and it was a DISASTER to go out, it took me around hour and a half to find someone to take me out since the highway is so far away. Once there, the colectivo take ages to come. Overall I didn\'t have a perfect experience but I suppose that if you come in the dry season and have tranportation this could be a really nice place.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

321737669.name: love the cascadas
321737669.author: a TripAdvisor user
321737669.reviewBody: Not sutable for babies or pregnet mothes or elders or people with special needs. The facilities are for adventure vacations.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

320491969.name: The water was grey!
320491969.author: a TripAdvisor user
320491969.reviewBody: I love the place but I was expecting the beautiful blue water that I saw in all the postcards so I was a bit dissapointed! Also, the weather is always very bad at 17:00 ( Almost every day in the raining season it starts to rain and you can not swim anymore) so make sure to get there early!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

316610079.name: Beautiful, full waterfalls
316610079.author: a TripAdvisor user
316610079.reviewBody: Waterfalls - we\'ve all seen them. However, these falls are beautiful and full. Very broad and full, these are wider rather than higher and the amount of water running downstream makes these falls a trip worth taking. There is a nice path up the falls with several viewpoints from which to take pictures or simply watch the water. I recommend visiting the Cascadas de Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

310318857.name: Nice
310318857.author: a TripAdvisor user
310318857.reviewBody: Nice.place but now way tooo  touristic.  Still if you want to take awesome  photos and walk a bit it works.\n\n

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

310131667.name: Not so blue waters
310131667.author: a TripAdvisor user
310131667.reviewBody: This place would be lovely if you were left alone.  There are so many people trying to get you to buy things it spoils the serenity of it all.  Also due to the time of year the water is not as blue as I expected, however still a nice place to go and explore.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

309408317.name: Magic place turned into a touristic trap!
309408317.author: a TripAdvisor user
309408317.reviewBody: I was there in 1997 and then in 2014. The waterfalls are amazing: the color of the water is really turquoise! \nBut the special atmosphere it used to have is ruined now. It is very touristic: lots of people, buses arriving and going at any time, lots of small restaurants without any charm... A real pity.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

307756332.name: Beautiful waterfalls
307756332.author: a TripAdvisor user
307756332.reviewBody: Meaning waterfalls with blue water, a little disappointed when we arrived, due to the rainy season the water was a mere brownish. Still a breathtaking view, the first 500 meters to walk is sufficient, as the best waterfalls is in the start of the area when arriving by car.\nA lot of shops and souvenir places all around, making it a little less beautiful than it could have been. My closest comparison is Krka nationalpark in Croatia, which is somewhat similar, but a more natural, untouched area.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

307551195.name: Just increible
307551195.author: a TripAdvisor user
307551195.reviewBody: Cascadas d Agua Azul (BlueWater Waterfalls) its a natural park near Palenque Chiapas , his name came from the true blue on the water due to many minerals and sulfurus  from upriver in the mountains...you can swim at your own risk or take a lot of pics!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

306768108.name: Amazing orange-blu waterfalls
306768108.author: a TripAdvisor user
306768108.reviewBody: Probably the best waterfalls I ever seen in my life. We spent all the day there enjoying beautiful fresh swims in the blue water, best relief for Chiapas burning sun! It\'s easy to find transportation to go there from Palenque or San Cristobal, but the trip will last few hours.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

305087097.name: Ok
305087097.author: a TripAdvisor user
305087097.reviewBody: Pretty. It\'s a good place if you want to swim, relax and not do much for the day.  I didn\'t enjoy the cold swim and was bothered a lot more than usual by the kids and restaurants trying to sell me stuff. Pretty but not really worth the price and time if you have other options for the day.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

303857986.name: Beautiful scenery, too bad for the commerce!
303857986.author: a TripAdvisor user
303857986.reviewBody: Agua Azul is definitely worth the trip.  The waterfalls are amazing to visit. The color of the water is a very special light blue, when it\'s not  raining.  You can swim in lot\'s of the natural pools.  The only reason why I don\'t rank it a 5 is because of the commerce that has sprung up along the river bank.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

301839164.name: Nice but lots of vendors
301839164.author: a TripAdvisor user
301839164.reviewBody: We came here in a tour, with the time we had available our priority was to walk up river and see what the area had to offer. This was a good idea as the nicer swimming spots are a 15 minute walk, we liked the third one (they are named and numbered). The area is pretty and definitely nice for a swim. Overall we felt that the short time we had there was sufficient. If you are planning on visiting some pools/waterfalls for swimming from Palenque we would recommend the quieter, closer and prettier Cascadas de Roberto Barrios.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

301593323.name: Absolutely worth it if you\'re in the area!
301593323.author: a TripAdvisor user
301593323.reviewBody: Agua Azul is sooo beautiful and it\'s great that you can walk alongside the falls on the path all the way up to the top.  There area  few swimming holes, but we didn\'t swim...but instead sat down and chilled out to the sound of the falls :)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

298314683.name: Spectacular falls
298314683.author: a TripAdvisor user
298314683.reviewBody: Beautiful falls in a jungle setting. I was told Arnold Schwarzeneger filmed scenes from Predator here.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

298092760.name: Agua Brown in August
298092760.author: a TripAdvisor user
298092760.reviewBody: in August it was more Agua Brown than Agua blue....still nice waterfalls in cascade and terrasses.   It took me 1h30 from the ruins of Palenque to get there with a collectivo bus (change in Palenque and at croosroad to Agua azul crosssing). Very hot weather and fun to watch people swimming in the authorized areas. Great fruit stalls along the paths. Count 2 hours of visit....

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

295679610.name: Breathtaking
295679610.author: a TripAdvisor user
295679610.reviewBody: This is one of the few natural sites that has taken my breath away. It is amazing. The water is clean and warm, people are friendly. A must see for everyone\n

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

295432107.name: beautiful views everywhere!
295432107.author: a TripAdvisor user
295432107.reviewBody: This places is gorgeous!!! We went during rain season, which means the waterfalls werent blue, instead they were a bit brown. Even so, it was gorgeous to look at and admire! you can visit after you see palenque and misol-ha if you are driving back to san cristobal. I dont recommend driving at night, it can be dangerous.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

294962898.name: Agua Azul? Not so Azul.....
294962898.author: a TripAdvisor user
294962898.reviewBody: Visited these waterfalls and as the name suggest they were nowhere near blue. You can have a look from my photos that I posted. The water just looks grey. I actually still up to this point do not know why they call them the Agua Azul. \nWill definitely not be wasting my time coming back here. \nIt\'s just a sham

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

294922822.name: Nice cooling down on the road from Palenque to San Cristobal
294922822.author: a TripAdvisor user
294922822.reviewBody: Just a few kilometres from the road. Lots of Mexican tourists. Small eating and snacking facilities. Time for a refreshing swim in front of the waterfall. Crowded but nice.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

294112982.name: Nice place after visiting the ruinas
294112982.author: a TripAdvisor user
294112982.reviewBody: It\'s a good place to be relaxed and see other the nature. For fun, take care, the water is cold and it can be less attractive the days of the affluence of tourists is too high.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

293866607.name: Cool and awesome
293866607.author: a TripAdvisor user
293866607.reviewBody: What a sight! what a Place! COOL waters, quiet, nature at its best!\nThis place has a  great combination of nature and comfort, it is pretty big so you can follow the falls downstream and you will find great places for picnics or just to relax with your family or just to hang out, great restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, it is worth the visit!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

293847539.name: A few hours to spend away from the ruins
293847539.author: a TripAdvisor user
293847539.reviewBody: Went to the Cascades de Agua Azul after a n early morning visit to the Palenque ruins. Easy, well marked drive, but DID NOT LIKE that in some places people stopped traffic to ask/demand money to pass on the public road. We were traveling with our dog, and when this happened, I would lower the back window, give them 10 pesos, and she would start to growl. Surprising how fast they would let us pass....\nThe waterfalls are nice with several places to walk up river for a different view. Lots of vendors, and different food stalls and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

293164165.name: Great falls
293164165.author: a TripAdvisor user
293164165.reviewBody: Lovely waterfalls in fact some of the nicest I have ever seen. Lots of people here at all different times so getting here early won\'t work. If you are coming from the palenque direction there will be very little chance of a blockade as there is a police presence at the turn off.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

291794426.name: Really nice waterfalls
291794426.author: a TripAdvisor user
291794426.reviewBody: If you are close by it\u00b4s definitely worth a visit. The falls are nice, and you can swim. There\u00b4s also a lot of restaurants and even ( low class ) hostels close by, which we learned when local thugs closed of the road in both directions and we had to spend the night at a " hostel " next to the falls. \n\nThe thugs however do not affect the niceness of the waterfalls, but I recommend you to be VERY cautious if you are travelling by car.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

291583860.name: Work a quick look
291583860.author: a TripAdvisor user
291583860.reviewBody: Really nice break the on the route but chose your time carefully. There are issues around this area with road blocks and protests etc... We were lucky but some people we met were not and had to get a local bus to bring them onto the next major town and hotels. Water at this time. Of the year is not blue but muddy grey.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

291407397.name: Real blue
291407397.author: a TripAdvisor user
291407397.reviewBody: Don\u2019t waste your time deciding which should you visit: Misol-ha or Agua Azul, go for both because they are different. You won\u2019t regret to bath at the Agua Azul magnificent natural pools after you briefly visited the waterfalls of Misol-ha. Agua Azul is the place for walking and bathing. Waters are blue because of their high mineral content. Photos are easy, no need to photoshop\u2026 Don\u2019t stay at the bottom near the entrance, where most lazy people stay for sights and bathing.  Go up-hill and discover the numerous blue-water cascades. You can walk for hours, as it seems to never end. Then choose a quite place to bath and enjoy the views. You have plenty of small hits to eat fish or quesadillas, or buy fresh fruit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

291320349.name: Breathtaking views
291320349.author: a TripAdvisor user
291320349.reviewBody: For those looking for an inexpensive and breathtaking view, good news, you don\'t need to take a tour or buy from the vendors to enjoy this area. Just take in the beautiful scenery and follow the hiking trail. As for the fee, the Zapatista\'s support local farmers and are non-violent so I hope that eases any concerns in this area. It\'s heavily touristed, you won\'t see much wildlife on the main trail. Absolutely worth going though, great walk and bright blue waters.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

289189557.name: Beautiful waterfalls
289189557.author: a TripAdvisor user
289189557.reviewBody: Worth a visit, the falls are really beautiful. Possible to take a swim in the lagoon although it\'s a bit muddy. The problem is the road to get there, we got stocked there due to the locals blocking the roads and had to stay the night in a really low level posada room. Take into consideration the possibility of loosing hours due to road blocks

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

285840594.name: Amazing
285840594.author: a TripAdvisor user
285840594.reviewBody: These waterfalls are really amazing, like paradise in earth. Be sure that you bring your swimming suit. A waterproof camera might be handy.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

283937865.name: 1st visited in  1981  -  re-visited  in 2014
283937865.author: a TripAdvisor user
283937865.reviewBody:
BEAUTIFUL    waters &  falls -   but it has  changed (not for the better) since 1st visit ---  still,   worth the drive to get there;  just be ready for the sales pitches from the vendors.      It is a good  day trip from Palenque -  bring  bug  juice,  water(or  your choice of beverage)  &  snacks .  Cool dip before the return drive  back to Palenque!
   
not so nice -   too many vendors   -  mostly  children selling Chiclets ....   bring stuff for them - candy or ?    They will be appreciative &  give info ........... 

There was a fee for  parking  -

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

278980858.name: A Solid 3.5*
278980858.author: a TripAdvisor user
278980858.reviewBody: Definitely a great stop for a dip during the hot season. The cascades are a natural beauty to behold. There are a few restaurants which allows for replenishing your hunger and thirst.\nWalking along the flowing river and the many levels of cascades it is inundated with retail therapy stalls one after the other and sometimes on both sides of the path. It simply \'kills\' the beauty of the cascades. Would have liked to give this venue a 4* but just couldn\'t bring myself to. It\'s not a must-see but definitely a good place to take a dip and perhaps a meal on and along your journey.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

278870586.name: Beware of shaky tour guides
278870586.author: a TripAdvisor user
278870586.reviewBody: When booking tours to Agua Azul, Misol Ha, Palenque etc. be sure and book with a company that takes credit cards so you can dispute a matter if there is an issue. We went with Tierra Maya travel in San Cristobal and sadly we had a very bad experience. We got up at 4 am to leave around 5 am to tour the above 3 spots. Tierra Maya came to get us at our hotel which was helpful. We got about halfway there and there was a citizens protest and the road was blocked. We found out later that this happens about twice each month and they were well aware of this possibility. We had no choice except to return to San Cristobal and we missed seeing everything. As unbelievable as it may sound, Tierra Maya then refused to refund our money. In the end after much arguing they only refunded a fraction and only for the entrance fees they didn\'t have to pay but they gave us nothing else. Since they know that these road block protests happen regularly any reputable company needs to inform its customers that such may happen and what the company policy is. Of course any reputable company would also refund 100% of your money since they did not deliver what they sold us. The driver also made an unannounced detour on the way back and brought us to another ruin. The majority just wanted to go home by then as we had all voted to do but once we got there 3 people in our group decided they wanted to see the ruin so the rest of us had to wait in the van for about 1 1/2 hrs for them. When we protested the driver lyingly claimed that we all voted to take the detour to see the ruins. Several Mexicans who speak perfect Spanish were in the van and so there was no misunderstanding, only lies so that they could find lame excuses to keep our money. I would never go with Tierra Maya again for any reason whatsoever and I suggest that you avoid companies that don\'t take credit cards when taking tours that have the potential to be blocked by these regular protests. These people do not believe in repeat business nor do they care about such. \n\nOn a good note though if you are going to Panajachel Guatemala there is another Tierra Maya there which is run by Rufino and his wife and they are very good.  They did a great job and come thru on every promise with very reasonable prices.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

278515417.name: Very powerful
278515417.author: a TripAdvisor user
278515417.reviewBody: A nice respite while touring the area by motorcycle. The Cascadas are amazing to behold. Be prepared for a lot of vendors, many of whom offer great food at great prices.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

277192594.name: Amazing natural beauty
277192594.author: a TripAdvisor user

The natural cascading waterfalls are amazing. You are allowed to swim in a large section of the area, and jump off the waterfalls (where appropriate). address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

276307785.name: Surprisingly scenic
276307785.author: a TripAdvisor user
276307785.reviewBody: Had lunch and a swim here on way to  SCDLC from Palenque. Lunch was average but the falls were a beautiful blue colour and we had a good swim and a water fight with locals. Worth noting we paid a first check point for adults and were informed kids were free. At a second check point an attempt was made to suck more cash from us for kids. Also on the way road was blocked by local women with rope demanding we buy fruit from them. On coming traffic forced them to drop barrier and we scooted through.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

275550794.name: Packet
275550794.author: a TripAdvisor user
275550794.reviewBody: We stayed in Palenque so we found the easiest way was to take a tour in a  van that included the Palenque Ruins and Agua Azul. We also stopped at Misol-Ha, another beautiful waterfall and cent to, along the way so it was a full day. The trip from Palenque is breathtaking enough but the stops were wonderful and of course you were on your own at all three sites, which I prefer. I think we paid 40.00 CAD and it was well worth it for a full day of transportation. Another great thing is that the other folks in the van were from all other Latin America, not just North America.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

262264702.author: a TripAdvisor user
262264702.reviewBody: Over a kilometre of turquiose blue water falling into shallow pools just perfect for swimming, agua azul is a beautiful place to spend a day. Like Guatemala\'s Semuc Champey on a larger scale, only far less publicised. If you\'re heading to Palenque you really shouldn\'t miss it - don\'t bother with a tour, just hop a collectivo. There are no shortage of places to buy food and drinks close to the entrance, and handicraft stalls if that\'s your bag.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

261988028.name: Thank you Mother Nature
261988028.author: a TripAdvisor user
261988028.reviewBody:
This place will take your breath away, will fulfill your mind, please your eyes and nurture your soul. 
Certainly is one of the most beautiful places I ever been. My rating is just based in the gift the nature have to us, but there are something that pissed me off:

1.- you need to paid twice to get in, one official and another unofficial. If you refuse, the don't allow you to go in.
2.- when the sun goes down, it's a really dangerous place to stay. Even the security guys warned us 1 hour before sunset. As a Mexican, I'm profoundly ashamed and sad about this.
3.- the food stalls are excessive. They break out all the beauty of the place. I understand that people need to making a living, but is not fair for the nature.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

261914412.name: Do not book this trip with Yaxkin Hostel
261914412.author: a TripAdvisor user
261914412.reviewBody:
I paid 570 pesos for a trip to Misol Ha, Agua Azul, and a transfer to San Cristobal. That tour was the worst travel experience I ever had. Here is why.
 
First, the driver picked me up 15 minutes ahead of time. Even though I was early and I had time to fill my water bottle (thank god I did then) he rushed me and he was rude. Then, he put my backpack (containing all my belongings) on the top of the van. Unattached/unsecured. I noticed at the second stop and I had to argue with the driver for him to buckle it up safely. 
 
The van was in disrepair: no shock absorbers left and no seatbelts. The driver drove at least twice the speed limit and passed everyone on a treacherous road. He did not give any information or welcome the guests on board.
 
Once we got to Misol Ha, the driver announced that we couldn't go to Agua Azul because of blockades on the road. I was concerned, since I paid 200 pesos extra to get to San Cristobal. He told me to go away and return at the appointment time for the next location. We tried to drive to Agua Azul, then turned around, and went to another fall closer to Palenque. There, I expressed my concerns again about getting to San Cristobal, and the driver told me, again, to go away and come back at 430. 
 
At the fall, I met with other people in the same situation but with much, much better drivers. Two drivers tried to help me figure things out. My driver would not talk to me or give me information. The AXEL bus for San Cristobal was at 5pm, and there was no way my driver would make it back on time. Nevertheless, he did not let me ride back with 2 other tour guides who offered to help me (and who kept their customers informed, and helped them out). The driver spoke no English and mocked me for my broken Spanish. I have never felt so ill-treated on an organized, expensive tour in my life.
 
To end things off, the driver dropped me off on the side of the highway to catch the AXEL bus. He had not informed me of it, and he wouldn't let me go away to grab diner and water (I did not eat or drink until 8 pm - the original tour was to include diner in Agua Azul). The driver did not apologize. He threw my bag on the bus, and I boarded without a pass.
 
I don't usually take tours, because they are too expensive. In this case, I took it for the convenience and safety - neither of which I received. AND I paid way to much money for the worst service I have ever received. There are many other tour companies in La Canada, all of which are better than the one hostel Yaxkin uses.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

It\'s great to see kids swimming in the water. The hundreds of food and chatchki sellers took something away from it from me, and they were not friendly.

259496303.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

258792072.name: WILL TAKE YOUR BREATH AWAY!!!
258792072.author: a TripAdvisor user
258792072.reviewBody:
This is such a GLORIOUS place and pictures simply do not do it justice.  It is not an easy place to get to, but WELL WORTH ALL EFFORT TO GET THERE!!!  

We had been told that we had to go there and armed with a rental car and a bit of time to explore we drove there.  The roads are not the greatest but knowing so, people appear to be more careful.  The drive from San Cristobal de las Casas is quite an experience passing through little villages and jungles where even today you can find WILD CATS and other large animals.  We finally arrived to the breathtaking waterfalls and what a majestic experience!!! I was humbled by such natural beauty!   This is a perfect place to stop and eat if heading to Palenque since there isn't very much on the road where you can stop and eat.   

There are many other impressive waterfalls like these and well worth the time to explore.  we spent two days in that area and it was just not enough.  We could have easily spent five days and still only have seen a glimpse of what all there is to see in this MAGICAL PLACE!!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

258697480.name: Wow what a beautiful site to visit
258697480.author: a TripAdvisor user
258697480.reviewBody: We had a lovely time at this attraction. It was just amazing and you can swim if you like in the cool waters of the cascades. You only have to walk up the pathway a short distance to get picturesque scenes of the cascades. On the way there were "held up" by the Zapatistas for money to pass to the cascades, it was quite funny. You can buy lots of trinkets and eat here as well.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

258302301.name: The Caribbean Sea turn into waterfalls.
258302301.author: a TripAdvisor user
258302301.reviewBody: The final destination of the amazing journey that means visiting Chiapas. Three musts there: The Ruins of Palenque, Misol-ha Waterfall and "Cascadas de Agua Azul". Many of the available tours offer the three of them on one single day and this doesn\'t make them any justice; you need at least two days: 1 for the Ruins and 1 for Misol-ha and "Cascadas". It\'s not easy to get there, transport network in Chiapas consists mainly on vans and truck\'s backpart though it is completely worthy. It\'s about an hour and a half away from Palenque city and you will find Misolha on your way there. Don\'t worry about meeting some masked "campesinos" asking you to pay a "toll" as soon as you leave the route: just pay them and keep going, no questions, no comments, no pics. Lots of stoned stairways, some swimming and you can be under the waterfall to enjoy nature to the fullest. You have some diners to enjoy local dishes, lots of souvenirs to buy and not a very friendly atmosphere. Most of the campesinos do not speak Spanish, or pretend they don\'t, but Cho\'l, their local language. Anyway they will chat with you in Spanish to sell you souvenirs or take your food order. Do not miss Cascadas for anything in the world!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

257754503.author: a TripAdvisor user
257754503.reviewBody: Lovely limstone falls with several viewing platforms. Ignore all the souvenir stalls and after taking some photos wander downstream and take a refreshing dip - just passed car park. Just us which was great.

257741971.name: Wonderful Place, once you get there
257741971.author: a TripAdvisor user
257741971.reviewBody: Agua Azul is a beautiful series of waterfalls, and offers a place to swim. There is a large marketplace where once can get souvenirs & food.  The downside is the series of \'checkpoints\' (3 of them) along the access road where you\'re charged to entry..small price to pay for wonderful view!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

256928737.name: Breathtakingly Beautiful
256928737.author: a TripAdvisor user
256928737.reviewBody: Well worth the gauntlet of three separate admissions (which was a little intimidating).  If you are a foreigner with limited Spanish (and comfort is your zone) you might like to take a tour bus/van; if you are adventurous, go for it!  Would highly recommend this attraction - can bring your bathing suit for a dip in the water, lifeguards are present.  The only distraction are all the vendors...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

256170812.name: Nice
256170812.author: a TripAdvisor user
256170812.reviewBody:
Agua azul water falls are nice like most of waterfalls i've visited but there are many factors that could make the visit better:
1. In the way to Agua Azul, almost arriving, there are many people asking forcedly for money putting fences in the road, some of them are selling fruits and other stuff and if you don't buy anything they threat you to damage your vehicle. 
2. In addition to that, there are another aborigine group asking for money only for allowing you to pass; this happened 3 times (they do not look to be bad people but i consider that someone could get scared with this situation) and each one asked for more money each time
3. Inside the park... Lots of people selling souvenirs and stuff, i think that the nature of the park is definitively affected with all the commerce.
Despite of this points, it worth it totally. Is such a nice and peaceful place. Good to go in couple!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

256077687.name: to be avoided at all costs
256077687.author: a TripAdvisor user
256077687.reviewBody: total rip off, site has been totally taken over by junk vendors, before getting there you must pay an entry tax to some Zapatista organisation closely liked to some extremist ideology.. we did not appreciate being ransomed and rudely told that the contribution to their cause is not debatable or anything.. they tell you that it is to assist in maintaining the site including washrooms and environmental issues, and this is all a lie as you still have to pay for washrooms there and the sewage runs downhill in the not so Azul agua.... watch your car and belongings, if you do not tip the " car minders" you will find nasty scratch on your return, last time we were there, there were hooded Zapatistas around and Mexican army on the road above.. really not a place for tourist

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas
