254199178.author: a TripAdvisor user
254199178.reviewBody: The lcolor of the water and the sight is just awesome as lomg as you can ignore the other 1000 people who are there and the 100 of shops who all sell the same.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

253584074.name: Beautiful!
253584074.author: a TripAdvisor user
253584074.reviewBody: These waterfalls were fabulous.  So massive and spread out.  Great stop and near the main road to San Cristobal.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

253549559.name: Simply Beautiful
253549559.author: a TripAdvisor user
253549559.reviewBody: We visited Agua Azul at the beginning of February.  The water was so beautiful and clear with the sun shining off of it.  It is such a beautiful spot and a "must see".  We had an invigorating swim in the pools.  We also enjoyed the little shops and empanadas. \n\nWe had arranged for private transfer from Palenque to San Cristobal, so were able to take in Misol Ha and Agua Azul on our way.  This seemed to be the easiest option for us.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

253266893.name: amazing!
253266893.author: a TripAdvisor user
253266893.reviewBody: Most wondrous sights! The powerful sounds and the visuals of the rushing, cascading water were absolutely magical! Great Agua frescas  and empanadas were an added bonus :)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

251282980.name: A must go if you are in Chiapas
251282980.author: a TripAdvisor user
251282980.reviewBody: There are many beautiful things to see in Chiapas, but one of the most important ones are the waterfalls. And this ones are particularly stunning because it\'s not the height what amazes you, but the extension of the waterfalls, and of course the turquoise blue color of the water.\nBut it is also true that the natives use that touristic zone to make war towards the government, sometimes they completely block the road to the waterfalls to make the government stumble, making that tourists miss the experience. \nWATCH OUT if you are taking a pre-paid tour with some agency, read the back of the receipt and you will find they won\'t make any refund if this happens during the tour.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

251196791.name: pretty
251196791.author: a TripAdvisor user
251196791.reviewBody: we were there in early june and it had been raining. situated on the way from san christobal de las casas and palenque it is a nice little lunch stop. you can play in the water, shop for little curios (slightly cheaper than the cities) and have a traditional meal. eat fish. its fresh and tasty. because of the rain the waters were muddy but the walk up to the top was a refreshing change from being cooped up in the vehicle. wear good shoes as the walkway can get slippery due to the spray from the waterfall. various stops and lookout points are there. be nice to the people manning the kiosks   as they are pretty helpful then.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

250448302.name: Agua Azul
250448302.author: a TripAdvisor user
250448302.reviewBody: Agua Azul is the source of a dispute between local indigenous Mayans and the Mexican Government. The Mayans have been driven from the area of Agua Azul, imprisoned, disappeared, tortured and murdered. Unless you are prepared to fight in their defense stay away. The Government want to provide a nice "Greeny" eco tourism development that profits wealthy tourism interests. The Mayan Indians want the tourist industry off their land. They view it as a foot in the door to oil exploration and mining.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

250411586.name: Beauty!
250411586.author: a TripAdvisor user
250411586.reviewBody: Beautiful waterfalls! We visited it at the end of December, 2014. You can swim not far from it. Water got very dirty from numerous amount of people in it (again we were during high season). We went for a walk to a camp area. There is plenty of room to swim in turquoise clean water with no people. There are many cafes there, so wont starve :)

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

249033438.name: Beautiful color!
249033438.author: a TripAdvisor user

248174853.name: Gorgeous!
248174853.author: a TripAdvisor user
248174853.reviewBody: Amazingly beautiful place! The color of the water and the seemingly endless series of pools and cascades was awe-inspiring! Wish they would relocate the vendors, though to a place a bit separate, so as not to detract fro. The natural beauty. Come prepared to swim in the pools higher up.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

247823875.name: Good to visit, but better in the summer months
247823875.author: a TripAdvisor user
247823875.reviewBody: We did a trip around Chiapas in November, it was a bit crowded and the waterfalls weren\'t as blue as we thought they would be, our guide said it was due to the raining season. So try to avoid raining season and arrive early because it gets really crowded as the day goes by.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

247679513.name: Very crowded
247679513.author: a TripAdvisor user
247679513.reviewBody: I like bit more wild with my waterfall. Food stands and craft vendors all over. Big buses and small vans bring in lots of people. Had to elbow in to see the falls. You can only swim in an area off to the side. Should have walked up further or gone in off season.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

247082859.name: Beautyfull
247082859.author: a TripAdvisor user
247082859.reviewBody: The sights here are amazing, although I would recommend trekking up until the last swimming areas... The first ones are usually packed with tourist... Near the fourth swimming area,, you can actually swim on your own... We had a great time here

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

246851041.name: You must go here!
246851041.author: a TripAdvisor user
246851041.reviewBody: If you like waterfalls, this is definitely the place for you. There is so much water coming from all directions, it\'s quite overwhelming and the colour is amazing. Make sure you walk all the way to the viewpoint at the top, well worth it. It was quite cloudy the day we went so didn\'t swim but plenty of people were. Try the empandias and fresh fruit - yummy.\nThe only down side is that it is a slow drive from Palenque - took us about 90 minutes and along the way there are villagers who try to get you to pay a toll or buy things from them by putting a string across the whole road. In reality they are just kids and you can drive through quite easily but it is still a bit intimidating at first - I dread to think how many of them actually get injured from doing this. At the falls themselves, there was also an unofficial entrance fee from men wearing balaclavas and scarves. Again intimidating at first, but despite appearances, these people weren\'t threatening at all and not only gave us a ticket but also a friendly welcome and an A4 sheet explaining the reason for the their protest. Unfortunately as it was all in Spanish, we couldn\'t understand it!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

246675887.name: Beautiful place
246675887.author: a TripAdvisor user
246675887.reviewBody: The waterfalls are an excellent attraction and quite amazing. Walk to the top as you will see smaller falls and I managed to get some amazing photos which you would not with the main blast of water. Apparently you can bathe there but no-one did from my group and indeed I saw nobody doing so.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

246107732.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

There is a walk up the side of the waterfall with lots of offshoots to explore. Varied bathing areas to suit all requirements. When we were there it was not at all crowded and I really enjoyed the swim.\nMassive amount of souvenir sellers which can be good or bad depending on your point of view!

I found it more interesting to see how people live there then the waterfalls itself, I\'d say it\'s very nice but not worth a drive from Palenque.\n\nIf your go, bring swimming clothes and insect repellent.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

241034084.author: a TripAdvisor user

The water is beautiful and refreshing and there\'re a lot of small waterfalls to watch. We spent 3 hours there which is enought in my opinion including taking a quick bite. There\'re a lot of restaurants there. \nThe only downside is that the place is very comersialized, a lot of vendors trying to sell you stuff.

239869084.name: Thats a real beauty
239869084.author: a TripAdvisor user
239869084.reviewBody: I have seen most of the importend waterfalls in the world, but agua azul comes for me among the top ten. Ok its not that big, but its just besutiful, sall those different cascades. Its quite touristic, but what can you do if its a beautiful place.

239512270.author: a TripAdvisor user
