address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

239150550.name: Wonderfull place for swimming and walking...
239150550.author: a TripAdvisor user
239150550.reviewBody: ery nice place for cerating of many photos and also to swimming... lot of nice views of travertine cascades and blue calc water around, but after some big flood is in many accesses destroyed entry. Be carefull there...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

237773530.name: Pretty, scenic, and dog friendly
237773530.author: a TripAdvisor user
237773530.reviewBody:
I did not find the road from Palenque to the waterfalls to be uncomfortably windy. The nice views help. It is quite annoying to get harassed by kids holding ropes to stop cars and sell their products though. We got stopped at least 4 times. We found it inevitable as often those who were holding the ropes were usually young children, and in one case, we had a mother carrying a newborn child. We saw other cars (coming the opposite direction) drive faster than we did - and they didn't get stopped. 
The waterfalls are nice, if you are around the area it is worth the visit. However, warniing: if you're coming from far, it only takes about 20 minutes to reach from the bottom to the top of the waterfalls.
The water is cold but really refreshing, I suggest you to take a dip or the trip will not be too worth it. 

Unfortunately we weren't able to see the blueish color that others see despite the fact that it has been raining. Nevertheless, the sounds are nice and the place is beautiful regardless of the color. 

This attraction is dog friendly. There are a lot of stray dogs around the area and walking around the waterfalls so you have to be careful. We took a dip with our dog in the last "swimming area" which seemed like the one with less currents. We had a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

237580493.name: Amazing!
237580493.author: a TripAdvisor user
237580493.reviewBody:
It really is a site to see, from the parking lot you can hear them, but once you see it for the first time it takes your breath away!
Please feel free to swim, there are ropes crisscrossing all over for safety and there are local lifeguards on duty, (just don't expect no baywatch hunks) try to visit a couple of days after heavy rains, 'cause sediment will turn them a brownish color, otherwise, the colors are spectacular! Due to the heat the water might feel cold, but it really is wonderful. Oh! there's a tiny cave under the big waterfall you can get into, it feels exhilarating!
There are over a dozen different natural pools, both up and down stream so explore them all!!

But BE WARNED!!!! The only road to and from San Cristobal and Palenque can have a "bloqueo" (blockade) the towns people take down a big tree and with a makeshift spike strip, ask for a toll fee from every vehicle, it can range from $50 pesos up to $850 for buses, no problem what so ever if you are willing to pay, but it can get sort of scary when they have their machetes out. It goes pretty smoothly if you can speak spanish or have a local guide, or just pay!

My experience was pretty mild once I look back, but please don't be discouraged to go, there are a lot of foreign tourism up there and it is well worth going once you know what to expect!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

236550726.name: Not worth 2 hrs drive.
236550726.author: a TripAdvisor user
236550726.reviewBody: The cascadas were not blue, but brown since it had not rained. The road from Palenque is not very comfortable with all the speed bumps and the closer you get to the site, the more obnoxious the street vendors are. They would block the road until you bought or donated  something. I can understand up to some level - they have to make a living somehow and they were at the end of the road, but I thought it was quite annoying. The sanitary services were appalling and not sanitary at all. Silver lining: you do get to see a lot of nice country side and local villages along the way.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

231545645.name: Waterfall are nice
231545645.author: a TripAdvisor user
231545645.reviewBody: Waterfalls are nice, be prepared to be assaulted by hawkers and children selling Chinese junk. Water is brown when flowing, when it is blue they have no waterfalls

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

228735235.name: waterfalls
228735235.author: a TripAdvisor user
228735235.reviewBody: great, pretty place , a little commercialised. Not the dangerous place for swimming that  Loneley Planet led us to believe, nor did we get robbed!\nFabulous swimming , not overcrowded, clean water

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

226793302.name: Wonderful Waterfalls
226793302.author: a TripAdvisor user
226793302.reviewBody: Lovely visit to these beautiful falls. The water was clear and inviting but unfortunately we didn\'t have time to experience a dip. It would have been nice to find a nice cool tree and relax and enjoy the scenery, maybe on another visit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

226044168.name: Incredible!!!
226044168.author: a TripAdvisor user
226044168.reviewBody: A don\'t miss....at least a kilometer long cascade of small and large waterfalls...and you can walk along the side the entire way...what great pics.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

224583244.name: Tour from Palenque to San Cristobal
224583244.author: a TripAdvisor user
224583244.reviewBody: We took the tour from Palenque to Misol Ha and Agua Azul "continuing on to San Cristobal". We booked for 9 am but had to leave at midday because there weren\'t enough people at 9. This is NOT a good option. There isn\'t enough time at Misol Ha - we were 2 people and since one has to take care of valuables, only one of us had time to swim. Agua Azul was OK, but, because we were there in late afternoon, we were caught in a tropical storm. In the rainy season you need to get there earlier. The "travelling on to San Cristobal" bit is a swindle. You are actually taken half-way back to Palenque, where the tourists from the various minibuses are given tickets for the regular AXA bus. That bus then goes back up the windy road to Agua Azul turn-off, before continuing on through the night to San Cristobal. This wastes a whole hour and the drive is NOT pleasant. Because it was raining we arrived at nearly 11pm instead of the advertised 9.30.\nAfter having rented a car in Merida, we heartily wished we had done the same in Palenque. Same applies to other tours, including the Yaxchilan circuit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

222783517.name: Worth the windy road !
222783517.author: a TripAdvisor user
222783517.reviewBody: These falls are simply stunning. When we went there the water was the most amazing blue colour. A photographers delight. Great spot for a picnic and a swim and just soak in the natural beauty. The road to get there is very long and windy with hundreds of speed humps in the road . Not an easy trip for those who suffer motion sickness but it\'s all worth it once you get there. A must see !

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

221792228.name: Pictures waterfalls
221792228.author: a TripAdvisor user
221792228.reviewBody: These waterfalls are totally different from others. Especially at the lower part, where they form many pools with smooth edges where you may take a bath or just lay - some of them are deep, another one shallow. (they remind me pictures of Pink / White Terraces near Rotorua, NZ). The public beach (just under main waterfalls) might be crowded, but there is another one, at the camping site, where is more quiet, and at low-season should not be a problem to enjoy relax there (normally this place is available only for camping users). Do not forget to taste local "vegetarian piranhia" in the nearby restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

221727706.name: The real blue lagoon
221727706.author: a TripAdvisor user
221727706.reviewBody: This place you must visit... it has a singular view because of the chemical in the water they are blue but not like ocean, it seems to be a gouache tint! You can go in the beggining of the cascade and jump in the water where it is cleaner.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

220196505.name: Super!
220196505.author: a TripAdvisor user
220196505.reviewBody: Very pleasan place to see. You can bathe there. Nice pictures! The water is clean and dosn\'t couse any skin problems. Unfortunatelly there are some nice places where You have to pay for entrance - there are some local people sitting and they don\'t let You in unless You pay them...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

217266051.name: tremendous !
217266051.author: a TripAdvisor user
217266051.reviewBody: Wonderful place. I had never the chance to see such a place.  You have to go in all the place, climb  and see the different areas to have a wonderful panorama. Food at restaurant in the area is bad. Our guide became sick ! Pity that there are so many souvenirs shops on the walk  to reach the top.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

216708843.name: Azul, blue, bleu !
216708843.author: a TripAdvisor user
216708843.reviewBody: We were very happy to visit Agua Azul with blue water during our stay in juli because it could turn brown during rainy season. You won\'t be alone on the site of Agua Azul because a lot of tourists and Mexicans come there. The way from Palenque to Agua Azul is long (66 km) with a lots of toppes and bumpy road. It took us 1h 30 min! But the waterfalls are beautiful and it\'s really nice to swim there. You can swim near the big waterfalls (and pay for it) or you can go further (lots of stairs) and swim for free without crowd like we did. Just enjoy the beauty and fresh water!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

216053191.name: Wow!!!!!!
216053191.author: a TripAdvisor user
216053191.reviewBody:
Hesitatad after our visit to Misol-Ha to go, because Misol Ha totally swept us away, because of its beauty and lack of mass tourism. 
But we were not disappointed. Atmittedly, the circus you run into from the parking right up to the falls is off putting, but when you enter the raft (haggle a bit for this tour!) you are taken into the jungle to the back of the falls, up to a nice swimming spot. Tip your guide! Most of the money disappears into the first guys pocket who does not do anything really besides being there.. Water is cool. View breathtaking from every angle. Beware: after the wet season the falls are brown, not blue!

Road advice: (!!!)

When travelling by car, you will find that with every "topes" there are children trying to sell you food and drinks. They pull up a rope with rags attached to it, so you have no other option as to stop. Then, they start pounding your car (we had a rental!) till you buy something. If you are not interested: try not to stop, but drive on. They will drop the rope! Keep the speed.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

215693258.name: True blue
215693258.author: a TripAdvisor user
215693258.reviewBody: A series of cascades spread over several hundred metres of very blue water. The water was warm, unlike the mountain streams I\'m used to. Lots of scope for swimming, floating over small cascades, or just relaxing in a restaurant with spectacular views.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

215466407.name: Amazing swim and INCREDIBLE pictures!!
215466407.author: a TripAdvisor user
215466407.reviewBody: I went here in May 2013 and it was an amazing experience. I am not by any means a strong swimmer and there are ropes in the water to guide to from one side to the other. This was handy as not many people go to the central rocks(you will understand if you go), creating an amazing opportunity for wicked photos with friends without people in the back blocking the view. 100% RECOMMEND going here!!\n\nTake change as there is a fee of around 5 pesos to use the bathroom, nice food shops near by and local crafts on sale

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

209936766.name: WOW!
209936766.author: a TripAdvisor user
209936766.reviewBody: Do not miss Cascadas de Agua Azul. What a spectacular place to swim and enjoy the views. A must see!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

205289275.name: Disappointment
205289275.author: a TripAdvisor user
205289275.reviewBody: The waterfalls themselves are beautiful the disappointment is the area around the falls. Covered with vendors/ souvenior shops, the vendors are very pushy don\'t want to take no for an answer. Very crowded. Dirty, people threw trash on the ground with a trash can 5 feet away, people picnicked and threw the old food on the ground which stunk and attracted jellow jackets. We were on a tour and couldn\'t leave so we had to make the best of it. We did pay 50 pesos each to ride a barge across to the otherside which actually was nice and well worth the pesos. The kid that takes you across serves as a guide on the otherside through trails that lead to a few smaller waterfalls which you can get in. Not worth the hour and a half drive and cost.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

205135251.name: Spectacular waterfalls
205135251.author: a TripAdvisor user
205135251.reviewBody: We stopped here and at the Misol-H\u00e1 waterfalls on our way from Palenque to San Crist\u00f3bal de las Casas and found it to be well worth our time. The natural beauty of Chiapas is amazing and its maximum expression may be these waterfalls, along with Misol-H\u00e1. Yes, there are a lot of souvenir vendors. Yes, there are a lot of little restaurants. That still does not detract from the overall awesome and spectacular natural beauty before you. We were there in late November, at the beginning of the rainy season and the water was still very blue and beautiful in spite of the rain 2 days prior to our visit. It does get muddy after a torrential downpour, but we lucked out. Be careful putting your hands ( or any other portion of your anatomy!) on the wooden guard rails, there are biting ants. They charge 10 pesos for the bathrooms, so keep some change handy.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

203054946.name: Great Views and Swimming
203054946.author: a TripAdvisor user
203054946.reviewBody: The falls are beautiful, and there are lots of nice places to swim. I suggest walking all the way to the top and then making your way back down to avoid some of the crowds. You know you\'re there when you see a small hut with guards and a sign that says you\'ve reached the end of the route. Don\'t be surprised if the tours cost a bit more than than the lonely planet guide says. I paid 220 pesos, and the guide said it should be between 150 and 180.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

202901262.name: Prettiest place in the world!
202901262.author: a TripAdvisor user
202901262.reviewBody: Spectacularly pretty, also lots of fun to swim here.  I was worried that the water wouldn\'t be blue because of rain on the previous 2 days, but it was.  Only thing I found annoying was all the "monitors" telling us where we couldn\'t swim.  I know there are some dangerous currents here, especially in the seconds falls from the the bottom,  I also know from a previous visit that where we were told not to swim was safe.  We didn\'t give ourselves enough time here.  I wished we\'d had at least a couple more hours to hike the canyon at the top of the seemingly endless waterfalls.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

202643315.name: Beautiful blue
202643315.author: a TripAdvisor user
202643315.reviewBody:
Our tour group stopped off at this attraction on the way to Palenque. The location is beautiful and I couldn't believe how vivid the blue water was, this is caused by minerals in the water. Our group went swimming in the main pool which is below the waterfall and it was a lovely relief from the heat. We were fortunate that the place wasn't crowded at the time of our visit.

One thing to watch is the sections that have an undercurrent, as the pools drop down into other areas. I was nearly dragged towards a small waterfall and a friend was actually dragged over the same spot. We were all swimming in approved areas, but there was no warning or signs, so be mindful of this. We gave the local 'lifeguards' a shock, that's for sure.

Numerous vendors selling food and souvenirs. Enjoyed the chilli covered mango on a stick.

There were other areas to visit along walking trails but I remained in the water or along the bank, so cannot comment on these areas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

202158135.name: Beautiful blue water!!!
202158135.author: a TripAdvisor user
202158135.reviewBody: The place is full of people and a market with souvenirs and clothes and empanadas... \nThe waterfall is gorgeous!! a light blue water running down with a great force.. it is a show to watch!\nYou have to stop here for 2 hours at least to get to walk up around all the small waterfalls and there is even a small "boat" to cross the river...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

202090162.name: A dream come true
202090162.author: a TripAdvisor user
202090162.reviewBody: Agua Azul is a lovely place to visit, and I wish there were more possibilities to actually swim. You can walk along the water and marvel at the amazing color, and just wish that you were able to jump in. If you are very lucky you will actually get to visit when there are not huge groups flocking around the place.\nAlso, try and cross the river, if you can. There is lots of security because there are Zapatista communities living on the other side, but you never know....\nAgua Azul is one of my favourite memories of our travel in Chiapas!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

200049135.name: Good stopping place on the way to Palenque
200049135.author: a TripAdvisor user
200049135.reviewBody: As falls go, this is a small complex of cascading pools. Some of them are safe for swimming, and the water is clear and turquoise. There is a good path to walk up the side of the different levels of the cascades. Vendors line the side of this path, but are not intrusive.\n\nWe stopped for a break en-route from San Cristobal de Las Casas to Palenque, so it was only a short detour. Making a specific journey from Palenque probably depends upon your previous experiences of waterfalls around the world.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

197752111.name: Amazing colour
197752111.author: a TripAdvisor user
197752111.reviewBody: Water is beautiful shade of tourquoise. Several waterfalls and pools form the complex. Can be crossed on raft pulled by rope and possible to swim too if you like. \nThere are many traders selling all kinds of local crafts and a few restaurants but the one we were taken to was pretty basic so choose carefully.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

197657222.name: Beautiful turquoise cascading water
197657222.author: a TripAdvisor user
197657222.reviewBody: Unusual rounded rock formations with many cascades and one of two small waterfall.  Nice paved trail to walk up along side the river to even more cascades.  There are places to swim.\n\nThere were two bathroom structures, one near the parking area and another about 100 feet farther back.  The one closest was very poorly maintained while the one farther back was very well maintained.  The price of 5 pesos was the same for both.  It is a shame that the poorly maintained bathroom was allowed to be open.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

197515306.name: So Beautiful!!
197515306.author: a TripAdvisor user
197515306.reviewBody: Take your swimsuit and a towel and go. Shop the tours or find a colectivo to take you. You won\'t be disappointed!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

196575258.name: Another Pretty Stop
196575258.author: a TripAdvisor user
196575258.reviewBody:
We (there was six of us) booked a two part tour of Misol-ha and Agua Azul through Maya Tours, for the afternoon of Sunday, Feburary 16, 2014.  

Transportation asside, Agua Azul is a pretty streach of rocky rapids with a small series of waterfals in a rather remote jungle setting.  The water collects a lot of clay & silt which gives the water a light blue color - very simular to the color of the water from melting glacers.  
At the bottom of Agua Azul, there is a area with outdoor restaruants and shops selling tourist trinkits.  There are also groups who opperate several boats or rafts running along rope lines accross the river.  They will (for a price) pull you accross the open water to give you a ‘from the water perspective’ of the falls & rapids.  No one from our group chose to do this.  There is a trail that climbs along the river for several kilometers.  There are food and trinket stands along this trail, selling the usual.  Our stop there was for a little over two hours.  Agua Azul was over an hour away, from Palenque, which was a very long drive in an over-crouded van.  

Maya Tours - We were under the impression that the six of us would be on this tour, and that we’d be given information about the area.  In fact, we were placed in a 14 passenger van with eight other people (some quite large) who were picked-up from various locations around the area.  With the driver, that was 15 people, forcing one person to sit on the jump seat between the driver and the front seat passenger.  The van driver did not speak much english, and he provided no information about the area - other than to let us know when we’d be departing.  Although it was pretty, but I don’t think that it was worth the six hours we spent seeing it.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

196351342.name: Great picture taking opportunities, beautiful falls.
196351342.author: a TripAdvisor user
196351342.reviewBody: There could be many negative things to say, starting with the double entrance fees, need for more trash bins, and safer installations, along with no free restrooms, but the secretary of Tourism has not stood up to the plate here.  The road is quite an experience, and it scares you when young children block the road with a rope or string so that you will stop and they can sell you something or ask for a donation.  It is sad, but this is one of the very poor regions in Mexico.\nAll said and done, it is an experience worth the trip, and the tour to see the other 7 waterfalls is very good, with interesting river crossings, great picture areas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

195990096.name: Absolutely amazing!
195990096.author: a TripAdvisor user
195990096.reviewBody:
We visited this wonderful location while on a trip around the Yucatan, including the Palenque ruins. Although it is about 50 km southwest of Palenque, it takes about 1.5 hours to drive there due to twisty, narrow road through the mountains, which was a delightful adventure of its own. I took so many pictures getting to the waterfalls, I almost used a full camera battery and had to use my Samsung tablet as a camera.
Just loved the waterfalls, so much to see, many layers and, oh the colour and sound of the white water cascading into the aquamarine pools! It was great to be able to walk up alongside the falls and be able to see them from different perspectives. 
There were vendors along the way but they were not pushy, like they can be in others locations. In fact we kept noticing one little girl kind of walking along with us, who was carrying a covered bowl. She finally approached us and unwrapped the cloth, exposing what we call corn cakes. They were still warm and sweet, 4 to a package for 10 pesos (about 90 cents). Try them if you go to the falls.
There were other vendors making and selling empanadas, 5 for 20 pesos. We decided to try them but were disappointed,  not much filling, kind of like eating greasy tortillas. I'd pass on this next time.
I recommend anyone travelling in this area to take this in as well as Cascadas Misol-ha.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

195760737.name: Piece of Paradise
195760737.author: a TripAdvisor user
195760737.reviewBody: A beautiful site that is well worth seeing. Walk all the way to the top and pay the extra charge. The top part is breathtaking and very quiet (probably due to the extra charge). This is a wonderful natural cascading waterfall that should be a national park. We went with a guide/driver which was very helpful because the roads aren\'t great.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

194564940.name: The water falls are beautiful
194564940.author: a TripAdvisor user
194564940.reviewBody: Hike to top of walking trail and ignore the million vendors until you have had a chance to enjoy the falls. You will be charged for everything...walking on a bridge or platform and of course, this is Mexico,  banos. Swimming is possible but not exactly relaxing. If this is your only chance to shop for souvenirs there really is a wide selection of everything ever sold to tourists in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

194478789.name: What a shame
194478789.author: a TripAdvisor user
194478789.reviewBody: The w\u00e1ter falls are beautiful however the people that swim there are not cautious with the trash and the leftovers be careful with the restaurants that you pick because there are good ones and bad ones try to choose the ones that have nice seats .

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

194210516.name: Great place, but don\'t use Kim Tours
194210516.author: a TripAdvisor user
194210516.reviewBody: A common tour offered is one that goes to Misol-Ha and Agua Azul.  Both places were great.  The driver was really good and interesting.  The parks themselves were great, but do not book your tour through Kim Tours Travel Agency.  I booked a tour to these parks that originally included the transportation and the entrance fees.  When I got picked up, the driver told me that a meal was included.  I told him multiple times that I didn\'t believe it was, but he had on his ticket that a meal was included and insisted we eat.  When I got dropped off at my hotel, the owner of Kim Tours told me he made a mistake and demanded $160MX for the food.  I argued with him for a while and ended up giving him $100MX to go away.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

193792870.name: it was amazing
193792870.author: a TripAdvisor user
193792870.reviewBody: we have a lot of good luck, because we visited them and they were really blue water, because when it rained they turned into brown water, so they were beautiful, not for swimming, because they don\u00b4t have special and nice place to change and take a shower, but for visiting is worthy

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

192966489.name: Well worth seeing
192966489.author: a TripAdvisor user
192966489.reviewBody: I love epic waterfalls (Argentina\'s Iguazu Falls is one of the top scenic sites in the entire world) so I didn\'t expect a lot out of Agua Azul.  But they were surprisingly impressive, especially in the dramatic  variations as you climbed to the top and then back down again.  Also a lot of interesting perspectives to photograph.  Yes the water is brown, and yes the endless line of shops and restaurants detracts from the ambience, but somehow this is less intrusive than one might think because if you are concentrating on the falls,  the roaring sound of the water drowns out any background noise.  And if you climb high enough to leave most of the crowds behind, it can be really nice to stop at one of the little restaurants just a few feet from the falls and have a drink or snack with the kind of view most people would pay $$$ for.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

192045322.name: Agua Azul & Misol Ha Tour - Palenque
192045322.author: a TripAdvisor user
192045322.reviewBody:
Another EPIC day in Palenque, Chiapas, Mexico, hot and sunny, again. Took a day tour to Misol Ha and Agua Azul, waterfalls close-ish to Palenque, transport and entrance fees were just under $18US,  the tour was from noon 'til about 6pm, when we arrived back in Palenque. 40 minutes to take in Misol Ha, and almost 3 hours to enjoy Agua Azul, enough time to enjoy both places.

The tour cost 150pesos, entrance fees were extra - 70 pesos for Misol Ha and Agua Azul, for a total of 230 pesos for the day, and well worth it. Misol Ha was very natural, no vendors, and you could walk behind the falls, which was really cool. Agua Azul had a TON of vendors, restaurants, mostly close to the entrance, they thinned out the further up the site you went.

We had an excellent day for it, weather-wise, beautiful sunny day - bring sun screen with you, you'll need it. Agua Azul had some upsells further up the site, guided tours to other, smaller falls, though the main attraction is the BIG falls as you first enter the site, some great photo opps here.

Very nice, natural, untouched beauty down here in Chiapas, and lots of it, though some is pretty far away and hard to get to without a car, but some is accessible to the intrepid traveller. If you're hungry, you'll find a way to eat. Highly recommended to get out of Palenque and into the beautiful, natural surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

191826709.name: Nice waterfalls
191826709.author: a TripAdvisor user
191826709.reviewBody: Even though they are called "Blue-waterfalls" they can be a bit brown when you go after a rainy couple of days. Anyway it really worths a visit, and do the pass to the other side with the organised "floating-lodges" really fun.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

191518794.name: Ok
191518794.author: a TripAdvisor user
191518794.reviewBody: The waterfalls were nice, but not sure they were worth the extra drive to see them, especially with kids standing in front of your car to try and get money from you en route.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190559961.name: Nice on your way from here to there
190559961.author: a TripAdvisor user
190559961.reviewBody: If you need to travel more than 1 hour  - don\'t go there.\nIf you are on your way to / from Palenque plan a 1 hr trip there.\nThe place gets very busy in the holidays,

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190524686.name: so many great pics
190524686.author: a TripAdvisor user
190524686.reviewBody: This is a long series of waterfalls, very much worth the hike up the stairs for all the beautiful images.  You can also pay to get pulled across a raft to another path to see more waterfalls.\n\nThere are shop stands all along the path. There are also cabins that we did not try.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190490758.name: Just ok...
190490758.author: a TripAdvisor user
190490758.reviewBody:
We went there last October while we did one day trip to Palenque.

Well...it is not spectacular. We like that but we didn't love it. Water had  brown colour and apparently you can swim there but I wouldn't...

It is not worth a hassle - better idea is to spend more time in Palenque ruins...

Just my personal opinion.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190451247.name: Agua Azul is probably more "azul" when it\'s sunny...
190451247.author: a TripAdvisor user
190451247.reviewBody: The site is made of various beautiful cascades on different levels with teal colored water. The day we visited (Dec 28) was extremely crowded and the weather cloudy. \nHowever, on a calm, sunny day, this place must be gorgeous!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190208928.name: Palenque
190208928.author: a TripAdvisor user
190208928.reviewBody: Agua azul is a beautiful series of waterfalls. Try to avoid going after a rain as the water is less blue.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

190174643.name: worth a visit if you stay in Palenque
190174643.author: a TripAdvisor user
190174643.reviewBody: The waterfalls are nice, but don\'t try to compare them with Iguasu or Victoria falls. The place is nice but may be since we visited on Sunday (entrance fee is free for locals everywhere) the place was badly overcrowded. The road to the falls is serpentine, so it takes a while to get there, even though it is only 65-67 km from the Palenque ruins. If you stay overnight in Palenque it worth the visit, but if you head somewhere else afterwards combining it with the ruins might be very time consuming.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

189467999.name: Worth the side trip.
189467999.author: a TripAdvisor user
189467999.reviewBody:
I would not say spectacular waterfalls compared to  Iguazu Falls or Niagara but it was a pleasant break from all the archeological ruins and sites! Lots of shopping if you want good bargains for local arts and crafts and leather goods. I wished I bought more here because it got more expensive in  Palanque and Chichen Itza! 

There were lots of people swimming, but I didn't go in the waters! 

We had the worst fish meal here though at one of the local restaurants. Not worth 130pesos at all. Cold bland and not palatable.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

189011324.name: Worth the visit
189011324.author: a TripAdvisor user
189011324.reviewBody: Although several cascades in the region, these ones are spectacular and singular in their type.  Five or six different ones, but not easy to find them: look for a guide, quite unexpensive, 2 or 3 dlls.  Worth it!  Do not stay onlt with the one you\'ll see as entering the park, the hidden ones are must impressive.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

188736849.name: Worth the trip from Palenque
188736849.author: a TripAdvisor user
188736849.reviewBody: The falls are quite impressive and fairly clean (you do see a few plastic cups...grrr...but if you pick them up and throw them in one of the provided cans, you see them no more:D). The water is beautiful even when it\'s more of a green due to heavy rainfalls. Not too impressed with the food in the restaurants...30 pesos for agua de horchata made from powder?! :P The fried bananas are great. Worth the trip out from Palenque...it might be better to go with a tour than on your own. We took a tour from Palenque and there was a family that chose to leave their car and go on the tour because they had problems with people setting up roadblocks between San Crist\u00f3bal and Palenque and charging them to use the road.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

186951546.name: Nice but crowded
186951546.author: a TripAdvisor user
186951546.reviewBody:
If you hike all the way up to the swimming area ... with a little bit of luck you can swim in the pristine river alone or nearly alone for a few minutes. 

The waterfalls are nice to watch and the coconuts on sale are refreshing.

But the crowds and crowds of bused in tourists are a bit overwhelming.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

186863426.name: Nice day trip
186863426.author: a TripAdvisor user
186863426.reviewBody: Agua Azul\'s stunningly beautiful blue green waters with its many levels of waterfalls combined with a short visit to Misol-Ha will make for a very relaxing day trip from Palenque. The drive to both waterfalls through the mountains and jungles is both very scenic and also a bit nerve-wracking - there were 3 different sections of the road where the mountainside gave way taking with it half of the road.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

186467606.name: Lovely Side-Trip
186467606.author: a TripAdvisor user
186467606.reviewBody: Beautiful falls, plenty to enjoy on a side-trip to Palenque. There are many artisan stalls where you can see the vendors actually making their wares - even though the items on offer are the same as what you see everywhere else in this part of the country.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

186292169.name: Worth the extra time to vist!
186292169.author: a TripAdvisor user
186292169.reviewBody:
The cascades were unbelievable!
The trails were fun!
The only thing that the water was cold for this Texan!
Around 50 degrees!
There were many people swimming and sliding down rapids!
There was plenty of food and drinks for sell!
Very scenic drive to and from Palenque

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

185429391.name: plunge with
185429391.author: a TripAdvisor user
185429391.reviewBody: the cascadas is big and beautiful in the sunshine of sunset. but all views are all the same. and there are many people swimming and plunge in the river.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

185354497.name: Too bad the waterways not clearer
185354497.author: a TripAdvisor user
185354497.reviewBody: Was looking forward to the visit but they had too much rain so no blue waters but still pretty to visit

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

184214390.name: Nice for a visit
184214390.author: a TripAdvisor user
184214390.reviewBody:
We had a nice afternoon here, but found Misol Ha to be prettier and a better place to swim.

Agua Azul is a calmer waterway but much more hectic and touristy as a location. There are lots of restaurants and tourist shops, so as you walk up the river you inevitably get harassed to buy things.

There are a couple of places to swim that are nice. I'd recommend walking right up the top to swim there, it's quieter and there are some good deep pools and some small rapids you can sit on and climb up. We didn't take the raft across that's pulled across by boys with ropes, just under the main cascades. That looked like fun but we ran out of time.

We went after some heavy rain so the water was a little murky but it was still worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

183531824.name: Impressive series of waterfalls
183531824.author: a TripAdvisor user
183531824.reviewBody: This is a series of powerful low-level falls with  a footpath /steps up one side- take care as parts can be slippery. Grilled freshwater fish from a fish farm downstream are available at local restaurants-delicious but not  much fish after dissection.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

183302300.name: Paradise unless you\'re a bus tourist
183302300.author: a TripAdvisor user
183302300.reviewBody: Like many of the most beautiful locations, you\'re not the first nor the only visitor, However there\'s always a back door. Actually AGUAL AZUL while not an overnight destination for most, is well worth the extra day. The community cabins are VERY basic, but offer a good bed and hot water for $20 usd a night and are a couple of hundred yards removed from bus mayhem, enough to enjoy a tropical paradise with cheap ice cold beer, good basic meals and rustic lodging. But we came for the water, and near the community cabins you will find very private access to some excellent streaming pools, saving you many euros or dollars in hydro-massage therapy. Pick any of 15 cool spots out of site of the tourist zone and relax, steps from your cabin. there is 24 hr security and friendly staff, not sure if anyone speaks English, but if you can smile you\'ll manage.\nYou\'ll also be able to by fresh fruit from local girls for who will find you faster than you can say WOW! as you see your own private jungle water park.  The entrance fee is 30 pesos pp to cover the "ejido" cooperative staff who does a good job maintaining the area. Agua Azul is only 10 minutes down the main road, very winding, spectacular and welcoming, Bring a friend!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

180240429.name: Very nice
180240429.author: a TripAdvisor user
180240429.reviewBody: Agua Azul was a much anticipated excursion. Although it was incredibly lovely, I was greatly surprised at the incredible number of souvenir vendors lining the entire pathway  all the way up to the top of the falls. The access to the falls and swimming area was good but the visit was marred by the constant sales pitches from the vendors trying to sell things. Had it not been for these vendors crowding the park I\'d say it was much better.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

176526283.name: Beautiful waterfalls!
176526283.author: a TripAdvisor user
176526283.reviewBody: These are a series of waterfalls. There are several of them and they are really beautiful. When we went it had been raining a lot up in the mountains and the waterfalls were raging! All the locals said that it is much prettier when it isn\'t rushing so much. There is also a swimming area.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

176053706.name: Very nice, but not blue in summertime
176053706.author: a TripAdvisor user
176053706.reviewBody: The waterfalls were beautiful and big, but in summertime the water is brown. Glad we knew about this before visiting, so we were prepared to that!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

175612196.name: Beautiful for a short visit
175612196.author: a TripAdvisor user
175612196.reviewBody: The waters were so beautiful, but we kept hiking to see more and didn\'t. Seems like the most beautiful parts are toward the beginning, so unless you like hiking just to hike, stay close and enjoy the first bits.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

173934313.name: Nice place to go!
173934313.author: a TripAdvisor user
173934313.reviewBody: This is one of Chiapas most famous natural wonders. I really enjoy coming here especially towards the upper part where there are less people. overall nice place and good mix of locals and tourists.  Gets a little mucky the water during Rain Season so best to go during dry season. Also you feel rushed if you go on a tour so try to go their on your own or a more personalized tour operator where you can take your time and really enjoy without feeling rushed.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

172430957.name: View and refreshing bath
172430957.author: a TripAdvisor user
172430957.reviewBody: Do not stop at the first pool sorrounded by bars and booths but climb up a bit to gain wonderful views of the powerful falls and select the best spot to have a refreshing and natural hydromassage!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

170971346.name: Agua azul
170971346.author: a TripAdvisor user
170971346.reviewBody: The view is beautiful, the waterfalls fantastic! The water is cold but great after a long walk on a sunny day! Go when it\'s not raining or you\'ll see them brown because of the sediment in the river.\nGet ready to pay for everything, at least 4 times if you want to go to the small pools for a swim! It\'s worth the walk, slippery and complicated at the top of the waterfall but a must for nature lovers.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

170863472.name: Great surprise
170863472.author: a TripAdvisor user
170863472.reviewBody: Really great place with lots surprises. Typically in Mexico there to many tourist shops on the site, people have to make a living. It rained when we were there but only added the waterfall spectacular.  Toilet reek.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

170628239.name: They really are turquoise!
170628239.author: a TripAdvisor user
170628239.reviewBody: A definite must but make sure you are clothed ready for your dip and dry off.  A great market place with good local food specialities. We had taken a taxi from San Cristobal and the driver kindly stopped off here and at Tonina (great local ruins where we appreciated the personalised tour).

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

169812320.name: Huge but dirty. Not impressed.
169812320.author: a TripAdvisor user
169812320.reviewBody: This waterfall is HUGE. There is a pathway all the way to the top with the scenic waterfall on one side and souvenir and handicraft stalls on the other. A nice walk.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

169298763.name: Intriguing place
169298763.author: a TripAdvisor user
169298763.reviewBody: A very serene place when not many people are around because as we found out it is a place mostly visited by local people especially during weekends and holidays. A paved path and shor steps lead to the top, many spots to take pictures, many restaurants and many shops selling whatever you can imagine.It\'s a little bit far from Palenque but we were going by car to the borders of Guatemala so the deviation was not to big and the spectacle very compensating.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

164212904.name: Worth the drive
164212904.author: a TripAdvisor user
164212904.reviewBody: We did a tour to misol ha and azul. It is a nice half day and well worth the winding sick car ride.\n\nThe pools were slightly blue but the rains had taken some colour away. There are many vendors and restaurants on the way up. None selling anything new. Take your swimmers as there is a hole to swim in.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

162969186.name: When Agua Azul becomes Agua Marron
162969186.author: a TripAdvisor user
162969186.reviewBody: Fortunately, or unfortunately depending on your perspective, I visited this site after we had a couple of days of rain.  There was plentiful water going over the cascades which made it very impressive.  The water going over the cascades was brown water, not blue water as you would expect from the name.  Personally, I would rather see the volume of water than not.  The vendors are nicely separated from the views of the cascades and I could not complain about their presence.\n\nI had a nice leisurely walk to the end of the paved walkway.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

162659080.name: One of the cooler things I\'ve seen in Mexico
162659080.author: a TripAdvisor user
162659080.reviewBody: Make sure, if you are in Palenque, that you get to see these magnificent pools/waterfalls.  They are breathtaking.  You can swim in them, and the water color is like the Caribbean Sea.  Its in the middle of the jungle, but worth the ride (about 1-1 1/2 hours) from Palenque.  There are a lot of "topes" or speed bumps.  If you get car sick, take dramamine, as there are lots of ups and downs, and turns.  There will be kids trying to stop you with string or vines, just approach slowly, and keep driving slowly (if you don\'t want to give them money or buy something).  It is a must see in Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

162040142.name: great scenery
162040142.author: a TripAdvisor user
162040142.reviewBody: Great waterfalls which unfortunately weren\'t blue when we visited as it had rained and this changes the colour of the water.  you have to walk a fair distance to swim in shallow safe areas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

161611592.name: Amazing.
161611592.author: a TripAdvisor user
161611592.reviewBody: Such a nice place to relax and sunbath (if you\'re brave enough to strip to bikini & show your pale body to locals;). The colour of the water is just divinely blue!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

161374867.name: blue and popular with locals and tourists
161374867.author: a TripAdvisor user
161374867.reviewBody: on a perfect day the colour is amazing - the water in april was very crisp but crystal clear and the food stalls at the higher levels are better value as u need to go up more stairs - the top swimming hole was lovely

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

161300332.name: Get wet!
161300332.author: a TripAdvisor user
161300332.reviewBody: Agua Azul is stunning. Climb the hill to see more of the cascades and swim in one of the isolated, upper pools. Lovely!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

161021453.name: Very blue
161021453.author: a TripAdvisor user
161021453.reviewBody: These waterfalls certainly lived up to their name as the water was brilliant blue and it was nice to see the local people enjoying bathing in the natural polls below the falls.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

160780953.name: BEAUTIFUL and LIFELY
160780953.author: a TripAdvisor user
160780953.reviewBody:
A 3 hours trip to beautiful Agua Azul is not enough.

It is worth to stay there longer. Even one whole day would not get boring. 
Swimming, walking, enjoying. Between bathing having dinner at several small restaurants. 

Very nice and beautiful place!

Absolutely MUST SEE in Palenque area!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

159462599.name: Dangerous.   Natives  block roads with wood bars full of nails to get you a flat tire.
159462599.author: a TripAdvisor user
159462599.reviewBody: In general , Palenque, Agua azul waterfalls are unique, a nature\'s wonder. Chiapas is a beautiful state. However is sad that there are risks and you don\'t have any protection at all. \n\nDangerous native people, blocking roads with broken glass, wood bars with nails, rocks to stop you at whatever cost putting your life in danger. Federal policemen and military don\'t do anything about it even if you complain about the situation. I found a federal cop to notify the incident and he told me that he wouln\'d do anyhthing because he has been told to let the natives alone an the police also as to pay to them. He told me that these people will hurt us if we do something. These people ruined my trip and I had to pay the extra expenses for nothing. Th car rental people from Alamo car rental totally a complete fraud. Never going back. I don\'t recommend a trip there. These people are not prepared for welcoming tourists.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

158920627.name: Agua brun!
158920627.author: a TripAdvisor user
158920627.reviewBody: Unfortunately, after 24 of torrential rain the day before, the cascades were brown. Still impressive, but quite a long way to get there and our driver was crazy so I just wanted to get home in one piece for most of the day!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

158743736.name: Blue water
158743736.author: a TripAdvisor user
158743736.reviewBody: At Agua Azul you can spend couple of hours. Water is really fress, and - what is most important - color of water is bright blue.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

158265718.name: Bright blue agua
158265718.author: a TripAdvisor user
158265718.reviewBody: Gloriously brilliant blue falls, at a reasonably close distance to the Palenque ruins. I heard that the water in the days before I went was quite dull due to recent rainfall, though it is more often as beautiful as the pictures you see than not. Just be aware when planning what day you go - you want calm weather and a blue sky!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

157731645.name: A beautifull and incredble site
157731645.author: a TripAdvisor user
157731645.reviewBody: I have seen pictures and heard a lot about this place, but when you see it it is something undescribable, i`s just beautiful, so many falls, and the color of the water is incredible a clear turquoise, unseen in other places, very highly recomended, un fortunately is a bit far.  Its worth to take a deep in them. But our gide said that during the rainy season the weater turns murky, so avoid this place at that time.\nAlso nearbay ys a beautifull waterfall called misol-ha its also worth to visit and swim in it

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

157118376.name: Amazing Place
157118376.author: a TripAdvisor user
157118376.reviewBody: It is just beautiful, lush, exotic. A little busy, but still enjoyable. Best time to go is between December and February. Make sure no rain is in the forecast or you won\'t enjoy its beauty, since rains will stir up the waters. Good places to eat, nice spots to take a dip.  Totally recommended

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

156751269.name: Crowded
156751269.author: a TripAdvisor user
156751269.reviewBody: Beautiful place,great pics, however very crowded during Easter be ready, lots of places for food and souvenirs, get there early to find a spot

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155750440.name: Beautiful but don\'t bother bringing your bathing suit
155750440.author: a TripAdvisor user
155750440.reviewBody: The falls are truly beautiful, a clear turquoise cascading from far up the mountain.  The pathway along the falls and the terraces with benches for viewing are well shaded by trees and very welcoming.  To your left as you ascend are plenty of craft stalls and eateries, but the falls create a white noise that allows for few distractions.  We climbed until we could go no further without paying an additional fee.  We were disappointed in the bathing area. We had seen a photo of a woman swimming just below the actual falls, but in fact the area that is strictly marked off for bathing is murky, still, and only thigh deep.  If you are not a child or a hippopatamus, you will probably not want to swim here.  If you do though, and you have not brought a swim suit, there are plenty of shorts and tee-shirts for sale.  We had to pay 3 times:  to enter the short road leading to the site, to enter the site, and to park.  Then it was quite clear that you\'d better tip the young man who waved you into the parking spot.  Bathrooms, I believe, must be paid for as well.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155459698.name: Beautiful but ruined by tourist stalls
155459698.author: a TripAdvisor user
155459698.reviewBody: The falls and water are stunningly beautiful. Sadly there are slightly under a billon food and souvenir stalls lining the walkway that are manned by pushy people. The "attendant" that charged us entry over-charged us on the entry fee. We left this beautful place with a bad taste in our mouths.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155413356.name: Great natural beauty.
155413356.author: a TripAdvisor user
155413356.reviewBody: We spent nearly 3 hours there while travelling from Palenque to San Cristobal de Las Casas. Cascades are so picturesque and refreshing. The colour of the river is so nice. There are so natural pools to swim in. Many small restaurants and souvenir sellers. Really worths a visit.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155252993.name: Beautiful refreshment during travels
155252993.author: a TripAdvisor user
155252993.reviewBody: Great place to take it easy for one day. You can easily spend here 4 hours, do a little swimming (go all the way to the top of the cascade), have a lunch here. The best is fried whole fish (pescado enter a la plancha o frito). There are plenty of restaurants and they are really cheap. The only bad time to go is during or early after rainy season --- the cascades are wild and judy instead of azure.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155152651.name: Beautiful, worth the detour...
155152651.author: a TripAdvisor user
155152651.reviewBody: We were staying in Palenque and drove about 1h10 to get to Agua Azul. The road is quite curvy, be prepared if you get car sick. Also beware of kids "blocking" the way with ropes to ask for pesos or a bag of chips. They can be quite agressive but otherwise harmless. Getting to Agua Azul you will be directed to a parking space by a swarm of kids who will inform you that they will watch your car, you can tip them at the end. The bathroom facilities at the entrance are quite awful, dirty and smelly... and they charge $5 pesos to enter... there are other bathroom facilities inside, we didn\'t go in there but probably same thing. This time of year the water in the falls was beautiful, blue as their name suggests. The first "pool" that we saw was quite muddy and not nice to swim in, it was so full of people that it didn\'t look inviting at all. However, we went further up the road (stone steps) and it was worth it. We found other spots where we were able to swim in the blue water, not muddy at all. Keep walking and you\'ll find these less crowded spots. Bring swim shoes, as rocks get very slippery when wet. The water was super cold at the beginning, but once you are in, it was perfect.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155094810.name: If you are aiming to swim in the natural pool...
155094810.author: a TripAdvisor user
155094810.reviewBody: We were told to bring our bathing suit for this attraction, but at the ends we didn\'t want to dip in the muddy pool with a lot of people. It was Sunday afternoon, so, everyone and their brother\'s out for a swim. Maybe, if you are lucky, you will be able to find a quiet time to enjoy the water. The way to Aqua Azul was winding and on the road, there little kids that will pull up a string to stop you to sell their items. That was not a very good experience...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

155050339.name: Lovely!
155050339.author: a TripAdvisor user
155050339.reviewBody: Very scenic waterfalls with the change to have a swim in a little pool at the top. Changing cabanas available. Okay food in the restaurants and lots of little stalls selling souvenirs everywhere

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

154762248.name: Nice
154762248.author: a TripAdvisor user
154762248.reviewBody: If you ever been to Croatia, expect something similar as in Krka National Park. River with numerous cascades, quite nice, the pro is you can swim at places (not everywhere). Avoid crowds, go as soon in the morning as you can to beat the buses.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

154570361.name: Beautiful falls
154570361.author: a TripAdvisor user
154570361.reviewBody:
Cascadas Agua Azul is worth the one hour trip from Palenque.  The blue is a milky aqua marine or turquoise.  It's definitely not the "sky blue waters."  At first it may look cloudy and is some in the first pool with all the swimmers, but it is really very clear water.  The color comes from the stone underneath. It was cloudy the day we were there and that may have dimmed the color some, but it is a jungle, so cloudy and rainy are not that unusual.  

We paid 100 pesos at the entrance.  We walked all the way back to the canyon about an hour from the entrance and just before the canyon there was a sign saying it was the end of the tourist route. We paid another 20 pesos each for a guy to walk with us back to the canyon.  

There are multiple layers of waterfalls of a variety of heights, widths and shapes at the start, and then a flat stretch before the canyon. We didn't go into the canyon, and didn't see a way we could, but it was interesting to look into it. 

There are a lot of shops and food places along the path, especially at the beginning,but they were not aggressive, compared to a lot of places.  Our hotel had warned us that they had a lot of guests with stomach problems after eating at the falls and so we didn't.  The fried empanadas would probably be the safest bet, most bacteria don't survive a bath in hot oil.  

We didn't swim at it was cloudy and a bit cool they we were there.  

The toilets all seemed both primitive and with a small charge, we paid 5 pesos each.

Since the path is going up the river along side falls, there are stairs.  The path is stone paving for the fist 20 minutes or so, which covers most of the falls.  The path back to the canyon is dirt.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

154477567.name: Stunning day trip scenery!
154477567.author: a TripAdvisor user
154477567.reviewBody: The Agua Azul waterfall is absolutely stunning with beautiful turquoise water, but you won\'t enjoy it as much if you will come with a tour to make five pictures and visit one of the local food places lined up along side it. To really souk up the beauty of it and enjoy it to the full I think you you need to spend a day around there. I and my partner had an early (8.30-9.00 am) breakfast there and where the only ones (only with the local sellers and restaurants setting up). We had the best view just to ourselves and it was breath-taking. Then we walked up the river and saw more beautiful places, small waterfalls, had a swim, had a picknic, as lots of resting places are prepared a long the side. We really had amazing day trip, but coming back we saw the tourist groups pushing around for the picture next to the main cascades. I would imagine why some people with tourist group would not enjoy that so much.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

154358670.name: Meh, Okay
154358670.author: a TripAdvisor user
154358670.reviewBody: The cascades were pretty, but I wasn\'t too impressed.  Maybe it\'s more fun if you go all day and not with a tour and hike it or swim.  It seemed like more of a tourist trap to me.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

153461467.name: Impressive
153461467.author: a TripAdvisor user
153461467.reviewBody: Pros: beautiful cascades of water that went on and on up the hill. We though every viewpoint was the last but then there was another one. \nCon: an uphill walk from the car park. The heat even in early February made walking uphill a chore.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

153296966.name: Fantastic swimming
153296966.author: a TripAdvisor user
153296966.reviewBody: We went here and Misol Ha as part of the same trip (which I would recommend if you are coming here on a day trip from Palenque, as it is quite a long drive). We went in November, and it was fantastic! The waters are astoundingly blue, and the best way to experience them is by swimming in them! The water is clear, clean and warm (perfect way to cool down from the jungle humidity). I saw somewhere similar to this is Croatia (plitviche lakes) but the difference here is that you are allowed to swim in these lovely waters. The options for food are not fantastic, but I did enjoy coconut milk (they then cut the coconut up for me to eat).

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

153151591.name: A Mexican natural wonder
153151591.author: a TripAdvisor user
153151591.reviewBody: The Cascadas de Agua Azul are approx. 70 km from Palenque, on road between Palenque and San Cristobal de las Casas. The place is very nice, as there are multiple waterfalls and water is as blue as it appears on pictures.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

152664858.name: Even though
152664858.author: a TripAdvisor user
152664858.reviewBody: we\'ve seen waterfall before (Iguazu) it still gives a jolt of what nature is all about.As in Palenque, we arrived at the falls when it rained heavily.That did not ruin the beauty of the site, You can walk for 7 Km. along the river if you want, if not, just enjoy.\nWorth the detour

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

151958509.name: Agua Azul After heavy rain.
151958509.author: a TripAdvisor user
151958509.reviewBody:
Came to Aqua Azul after two days of heavy rain. The water was thundering down and the waterfall was much bigger then last time i visited the place. The Water wasent azul/blue - but dark brown full of earth and clay. 

There where many guest - not to many but many.  We had bought a ride from Palengue in a mini bus going to Misal Ha and then to Agua Azul  - price 150 pesos 8 hours trip.

When you arrive to agua azul you pay a small fee to enter. Try to take a walk up the waterfall banks on the left side of the waterfall and see how the place is changing the further up the streck you get. You can hang out and there is a small sandy area about 20 min walk up the waterfall.
 all in all this one of mexico wonders and a place to remember.

There are Plenty of places to eat and souvenirs to buy.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

150885353.name: Brown water
150885353.author: a TripAdvisor user
150885353.reviewBody: The park and walk along the falls were very nice but the water is blue only in the driest time of year, March and April.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

150550201.name: Well worth the drive
150550201.author: a TripAdvisor user
150550201.reviewBody: Beautiful cascading falls and pools to swim in.  The water is warm by Canadian standards. Lots of restaurants to sample local dishes at and vendors selling all sorts of goods.  A great place to spend an afternoon just enjoying the natural beauty of the falls given it\'s name for the color of the water or stay the night in one of the rustic little cabins on the site.  Public washrooms are available on site.  Any there are lots of young boys who will gladly help you park and watch your vehicle - for a price. Be prepared to pay the entry fee to the ijido to visit the falls - about 30 pesos per person.  Either because of the remote location or maybe time of the day or week, it was not at all crowded and we were able to wander around and enjoy everything this place had to offer.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

150465148.name: Great spot to refresh
150465148.author: a TripAdvisor user
150465148.reviewBody: After Palenque and Misol Ha it was nice to casually walk around the area. Was just before Christmas so very festive. Keep an eye for good deals on amber. If it is real the seller should have a black light to proove it...Couple excellent little places for a quick snack and a cerveza before we continued on for the day...Nice place...

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

150072931.name: Nice!
150072931.author: a TripAdvisor user
150072931.reviewBody: Muy linda, se puede nadar y hay caba\u00f1as para quedarse. Lo unico que no pude hacer nada de eso porque el clima no me ayudo, lloviznaba y el agua estaba turbia. Pero es muy lindo! Contrate un tour que me llevo a Palenque, Misol-ha y las cascadas de Agua Azul todo en el mismo d\u00eda. Si no tienen tiempo se los recomiendo. \nVery nice, you can swim and there are place to stay. The only thing I could not do any of that because the weather did not help, it was drizzling and the water was murky. But it is very cute! I hire a tour that took me to Palenque, Misol-Ha and Agua Azul waterfalls all in the same day. If you don\u00b4t have much time I recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

149603078.name: Blue waterfall
149603078.author: a TripAdvisor user
149603078.reviewBody: Nothing like swimming below the waterfall and it was a sunny day on December 20th. We were on our way to Palenque and stopped over for a swim then lunch. We had a whole tilapia fish for lunch along with torillas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

149505824.name: The perfect rest stop to cool down the heat!
149505824.author: a TripAdvisor user
149505824.reviewBody:
I loved the Agua Azul Waterfalls. We arrived at night and stayed in a very little not so cozy cabin, everything was dark and we didn't know what to expect but when the sun rised...
We could see from our room the emerald blue of the river flowing. Breakfast near the waterfall was great and all the walk up to the second swimming area is full of souvenirs and places where you can grab a drink or just some fresh water.

There are a couple of lookout points around the way up, I recommend checking them, nice to take pictures!

The second swimming area, which is maybe 500m ahead over the stairs was great. The water was so clean and so cool and it was not too deep (I don't know how to swim hehe), though in the middle of the river you could see people dipping in, I guess it was deep enough in the middle to do that.

It was a great experience and a very lovely place.
If you want to buy souvenirs do not forget to ask what is the lowest price you can get! -> "Cuánto es lo menos?" hehe.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

149170285.name: So much water..
149170285.author: a TripAdvisor user
149170285.reviewBody: Did not get to see the blue blue waterfall, it was cloudy and had been raining but just to see so much water is incredible.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

147070581.name: Waterfalls Above and Beyond

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

146787529.name: It was a gem!
146787529.author: a TripAdvisor user
146787529.reviewBody: the cascadas de agua azul was very beautiful! I really recommend that if you have time to travel to palenque dont miss this place!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

146615053.name: FANTASTICALLY BEAUTIFUL
146615053.author: a TripAdvisor user
146615053.reviewBody: The tiered blue wedding cake waterfalls are gorgeous.  Have never seen falls like this before.  The restaurants lined up across from the falls are absolutely terrible.  We were served cold and greasy french fries, cold rice and tepid salty chicken.  The dessert platter consisted of three small unpeeled bananas.  And it wasn\u00b4t a cheap lunch.  TREB\u00d3L was the name of this restaurant.  Avoid it and all others.  Pack a lunch and take it with you.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

146404794.name: Amazing!
146404794.author: a TripAdvisor user
146404794.reviewBody: The most gorgeous water in the world! We didn\'t take our suits so we didn\'t do any swimming but we enjoyed the sites. Be sure to take a camera!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

146215674.name: enjoyed the water falls
146215674.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

145643019.name: Go and see!
145643019.author: a TripAdvisor user

The colour of the water is truly amazing!\nIn order to spend there enough time (to swim, tosunbath and simply to admire) I suggest a trip from Palenque (3hours stay) and not from San Christobal (only 1 hour and a half). All of the small travel offices in Palenque offer a trip to Aqua azul and Misol-Ha(45 minutes stay). It costs 120 pesos + entrance costs (38+25?).

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

145632224.author: a TripAdvisor user

145524341.name: Cold Blue Water - very refreshing!
145524341.author: a TripAdvisor user
145524341.reviewBody: We went of a tour from San Cristobal to these waterfalls and to the palenque ruins. The waterfall was lovely - it is worth making the walk up all the steps past the vendors to get to the quite water pools at the top. he water isn\'t clear, but it is pretty clean and very nice to swim in!
