144620473.author: a TripAdvisor user
144620473.reviewBody: clear blue waters fall from the forest and you can swim on them, just something you dont want to miss, try to go on summer so you won get the rain cause with it the water will become muddy from the forest water. the waterfall are a great spectacle anyway

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

144016663.name: Beautiful falls in Chiapas
144016663.author: a TripAdvisor user
144016663.reviewBody: The falls were beautiful and fairly easy to walk to.  We brought our bathing suits to swim and were told that the water would be very clear.  The waters were a little muddy for swimming, but our tour guide said they were a little muddy due to the rain that morning.  These falls are a nice side trip on a trip to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

143493896.name: Unfortunately the water was brown
143493896.author: a TripAdvisor user
143493896.reviewBody: We had the misfortune of visiting during the raining season, which turns the beautiful blue waters into a muddy brown. Apart from that the waterfalls are still worth a visit, they seem to cascade endlessly into one another creating a very beautiful and powerful landscape.\n\nWe walked all the way to the mouth of the waterfall and really loved the quiet long walk next to the water under the trees!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

143085078.name: Splash!
143085078.author: a TripAdvisor user
143085078.reviewBody: Yeah - it\'s nice. Not only the waterfalls, but the fact that you can go and dip in as well. The water is farly cold, but just enough to make it refreshing in a hot day. Climb up to the 3rd "nadar" area. Or, at the 1st one (where parking lot is), cross the little wooden bridge and walk about 20m through the bushes to end up on a little ponton, which is perfect for taking pictures and swimming as well.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

142064757.name: Take a nice swim in the blue water
142064757.author: a TripAdvisor user
142064757.reviewBody: A must see when you are in Palenque. Don\'t visit when it is the rainy season. Though we were there as well, we were lucky it hasen\'t been raining. The blue water will turn brown. It is indeed very touristy, but there are also a lot of locals. First we walked up to the top of the huge waterfall. The surroundings are beautifull. Lots of stalls where people sell there handicrafts. \nOn the top you have a beautiful view over the blue river. \nLater we went swimming. Our guide knew a quite place so we could swim without locals and other tourists around us. The water is a bit cold but yet very nice on a hot day!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

140883781.name: Avoid on rainy days!
140883781.author: a TripAdvisor user
140883781.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place without doubt but it\'s a long bus ride from Palenque and back. It\'s not much fun if you have heavy rain while there or just before - the water is not inviting at all, just murky. \nWalking around the area is still amazing and there are ways to pass the time but prepare to be a bit disappointed if you have your heart set on swimming in clear blue water!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

140865418.name: Beautiful but very touristy
140865418.author: a TripAdvisor user
140865418.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place, a perfect stop on the way from San Cristobal to Palenque but I found it VERY touristy. I prefer other waterfalls,like MIsol-Ha

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

139698125.name: Water can be murky after rain
139698125.author: a TripAdvisor user
139698125.reviewBody: Visited after a rainy night and the waters were brownish/murky because of the sediment washed into the river. Lots of vendors around that offer their services and hand-made products. Can be bothersome.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

139339130.name: Ahhh, bliss
139339130.author: a TripAdvisor user
139339130.reviewBody: When you visit agua azul, try and go when it is not the rainy season.  If it is rainy season, the falls are brown and not so pleasant.  You can have a nice refreshing swim in some areas, and there are even ropes from trees so that you can swing and drop into the water

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

138594405.name: not impressed, much preferred the waterfall of Misol-ha
138594405.author: a TripAdvisor user
138594405.reviewBody:
maybe, we went on the wrong tour, i dont know but i definitely advise, dont go in the summer..as this is not agua azul but agua brown! dirty water!!! 
we went from palenque to misol-ha agua azul and on to san cristobal.
a great way to see the attracitons and get to san cristobal for cheap, i  dont regret this decision, but if it is summer time and you have already seen waterfalls before, dont bother, you get left at agua azul for 3 hours, where there is nothing to do but get hassled by the vendors!
if you can go on your own by rental car then it is probably more enjoyable, or in the winter where you can then swim in the beautiful blue waters
oh yeah an the people arent friendly there, they are rude and there are no access to toilets, you have to pay 5mx and then they stink are dirty and have no toilet roll

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

137333415.name: Roaring waterfalls
137333415.author: a TripAdvisor user
137333415.reviewBody: Having been to the place 15 years ago I was amazed in at the amount of shops which have sprung up along the waterfalls. This in my idea spoils the effect. We went a bit further up the trail and then the shops thin out and it becomes much nicer. The waterfalls in itself are superb. Especially when we went (rain season) and certainly worth a stop when travelling from Palenque to San Cristobal. I would probably not go from palenque itself unless you can combine it with another site.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

136002546.name: So beautiful!
136002546.author: a TripAdvisor user
136002546.reviewBody: We took a hike up to the top of waterfall, so pretty, lush and green.  Nature at its best.  Be weary of little kids that beg.  They charge money if you take their pics.  But when you get to the top its worth the hard incline! There are little pools where you can take a dip but there are some crazy waterfalls! if your a photographer, its a great place to photograph!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

134229315.name: Refreshing.
134229315.author: a TripAdvisor user
134229315.reviewBody: After a whole day of sweating, this was a real refreshment. Don\'t swim in the front where the "lifeguards" are. Take a path to the back. This part ismore relaxed and also very safe. The water was cool but not cold. It was perfect!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

133957796.name: don\'t miss it - fantastic blue water
133957796.author: a TripAdvisor user
133957796.reviewBody: We happened to be visiting on May Day, a national holiday.  Everybody and their family was there, having a great time -  we felt like we really were in Mexico instead of a tourist attraction.  For swimming, move up river toward the end of the incredible line up of vendor stalls where the crowds are a bit thinner. Do take heed of the warnings... it ain\'t Niagara, but it would hurt if you went over one of the cascades - so stay in the calmer pools.  And some of the vendors have a few really nice items (amber, needlework) at good prices mixed in with the usual trinkets.   The funny part is the Zapatista toll booth up the road from the official park toll booth that you miss if you are on a bus, but that you must deal with if you are in a car. Just pay both and don\'t ask questions.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

133766294.name: A walk and a swim
133766294.author: a TripAdvisor user
133766294.reviewBody: The waterfalls at Agua Azul is very beautiful, although not very blue when we visited.\nBut we had a nice walk along the waters and went in a couple of places. \nIf you only want to get in once, wait till you get higher up in the waterfalls, its much more beautiful and grand than the first area where swimming is allowed.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

132062242.author: a TripAdvisor user
132062242.reviewBody: The rains began early this year (2012), so I wasn\'t  able to appreciate the true blue colors.  It was recommended to me by the locals to not come any later than April but to be safe come in March or earlier if possible.  But I enjoyed the shopping and eating the empanadas with ice cold beer and the area and falls themselves are awesome.  You can be sure that: "I\'ll be back", yah!

129586413.name: nice waterfalls, very low quality accommodation
129586413.author: a TripAdvisor user
129586413.reviewBody: the best time to go to the waterfalls is besides rain seasson, since the color of the water is reall blue and not brown for the mud after rain. Skip the place during easter or  long mexican holidays since you will find lot of people and little dirty. Restauranst there offer just basic food. Careful to swim there strong corrents. \nAccommodation there: ..you can find cheap rooms at hoteles or Posadas just besides the watarfalls and in the streets besides parking place, camping is possible under your risk but you need to go uphill like 15 min or just at parking place. Bring your flashlight since its very dark at night.  If you camp at the parking place is not very comfortable.  I recommend to stay in Palenque better and just visit for the day. At night few options for stores and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

128953169.name: Beautiful, must see
128953169.author: a TripAdvisor user
128953169.reviewBody: It runs brown (muddy during rainy season) still very beautiful. I would love to see it when the water is blue. swimming is allowed at the bottom area. There are many levels to see, lots of steps, well worth the effort to climb all the way to the very top. Many vendors, if you don\'t show interest they leave you alone. Bottled water, pop available all the way up.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

127257904.name: Magical
127257904.author: a TripAdvisor user
127257904.reviewBody: I went to Agua Azul as part of a tour of Palenque, Misol-Ha,and Agua Azul that I booked in the town of Palenque. The cascades are beautiful, and there are blue pools to swim in at several areas along the river.  Local craft shops and restaurants line the path along the river.  As you climb the path, there are some smaller cascades and other areas for swimming.  The waterfalls are truly magical!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

126807275.name: Go at the right time.
126807275.author: a TripAdvisor user
126807275.reviewBody: Unfortunately, on the day of our visit the Casacadas were more "Agua Marr\u00f3n". Pleasant grounds, with a number of inexpensive eating places and, of course, all the stalls.  If you are game, you can take a dip in the water, but I would advise to head further up stream - I did see a few people washing themselves in the water. \nI\'m sure that at the right times, the waters would be blue and spectacular, but unfortunately I was there at the wrong time.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

126591326.name: Amazing Cascades
126591326.author: a TripAdvisor user
126591326.reviewBody: Easy to walk around and enjoy the scenery. One can also sit in one of the many restaurants and enjoy a cold drink as no one obliges you to have lunch.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125823765.name: A moutain-side of cascading water
125823765.author: a TripAdvisor user
125823765.reviewBody: I\'ve seen plenty of waterfalls, but these were pretty special.  The whole hillside is covered with staggered falls.  Some of the restaurants on the hillside tho, are a bit "careless" about the bill. Make sure you know what you are buying, how much it is, and if you\'ve got change coming back to you, (and if you care) that you count carefully.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125750185.author: a TripAdvisor user
125750185.reviewBody: Lovely to walk around and the water is so clear and blue! We did it as a stop along the road from San Cristobal to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125703099.name: Fantastic waterfalls, but too commercialised.
125703099.author: a TripAdvisor user
125703099.reviewBody: A favourite destination for the Mexicans who were splashing about in the water & admiring the views of the falls from the walkways & viewing platforms, but the natural beauty was rather spoiled (for me) by the nomber of takeaway food-stalls & souvenir-vendors, all selling the same stuff.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125613479.author: a TripAdvisor user
125613479.reviewBody: Very beautiful falls and not as heavy on the legs as "El Chiflon".  Lots of places to eat or just have a freshly made fruit juice.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125457413.name: The real Paradise
125457413.author: a TripAdvisor user
125457413.reviewBody: If you ever wondered how does paradise looked like when Adan and Eva where there, for sure it was Agua Azul....

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

125189856.name: Breath taking
125189856.author: a TripAdvisor user
125189856.reviewBody: Defintely visit these beautiful falls if you are nearby and swim in the pool up the top as more private and less like a beach.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

124671003.author: a TripAdvisor user
124671003.reviewBody: the big waterfalls as soon as youm arrive are stunning....walk upstream and you\'ll find few pools (with lifeguards!) where you can swim. A must-do!

Along the way you\'ll pass overlooks for several waterfalls - all beautiflul.  Lots of vendors set up along wth way with food and souvenir items.  Restaurants near the parking lot.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

124429753.name: Not that impressive.

124429753.reviewBody: This is a 1-hour stop on the marathon 9-hour van tour from San Cristobal to Palenque. The walk to the falls are lined with vendors all selling the same things. Seems a little shabby since many of the stalls are vacant. Takes away from the natural beauty of the place. Not worth the time, in my humble opinion. Preferred Misol-Ha.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

123333837.reviewBody: This is a series of cascades with swimming allowed in aqua blue water. Fabulous. There are plenty of locals serving up food and souvenirs so its a good place to stop for an hour or two for a swim and a bite to eat.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

121120475.reviewBody: It\'s one waterfall, nice if you combain it with Mishol-Ha.\nCheck the trips they offer in Palenque.

120504609.name: big crowds
120504609.author: a TripAdvisor user
120504609.reviewBody: This is more popular than Misol-Ha, and consequently more tourists.  A must see site, but we gave it a miss the second time we came through the area. If you like a lot of company, this is a great place.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

119927717.name: Waterfall inside tropcal forest
119927717.author: a TripAdvisor user
119927717.reviewBody: We visit waterfalls after 15 days of raining, so water were not blue/azul but cocoa/brown. Nevermind waterfalls are great and you can find out how local people lives... Good experience\n

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

117515745.name: Was great 20 years ago - abominable now
117515745.author: a TripAdvisor user
117515745.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to have known Agua Azul in 1989 and 1991. It was paradise. It is now transformed into a mass consumption touristic nightmare.\nBefore you had a dirt road, you had to earn it, hence few people, nature lovers. Now you have a very good road, hence zillion people all stuck to each other, sharing their sweat.\nI must admit that since it was Semana Santa there must have been more people than in February for example. But even without the people, the place is filled with ill-constructed concrete cabanas (for merchandise - made in China and restaurants), the access to the water has been drastically reduced to a tiny pool that is crowded with 10 people, stomping, raising dirt so that Agua Azul at this place is Agua Morena (brown). Then barriers with orange tape have been erected so that it is hard to take even a nice photo of the waterfalls. I was truly appalled and saddened. We fled to Misol Ha to bathe.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

117479832.name: Love at first sight
117479832.author: a TripAdvisor user
117479832.reviewBody: My first glimpse of Cascadas Agua Azul and I instantly fell in love ! The water is clear and blue just like you see in the pictures, as it turns out December is a great month to visit since the rain does not cloud the blue out of the river. I was a little bummed out that I could not go in the water, it seems that most of it is blocked off since it is quite risky. Only a few spots did I see people soaking their feet in the water. The cascades are breathtaking , the earlier you get there the better. As we were leaving a massive amount of tour buses created major gridlock, it seems they all get there late in the morning so if you rent a car you can beat the crowds. SHOPPING REVIEW: The edge is lined with vendors. I do not recommend doing too much shopping here even though a guide at Palenque told me that textiles and Bordados were cheaper here. Here is the thing I learned from this trip. If you see something you like don\'t assume you will find it cheaper elsewhere. I did score and fail in this regard at this very location. I picked up an awesome embroidered overnight bag at a great price which I did not see anywhere else but also overpaid for a Tzotzil black embroidered skirt which I could have purchased in San Juan Chamula where there were 100\'s to choose from for less than 1/2 the price. FOOD VENDORS: Try the empanadas 5 for 10 pesos, a very inexpensive and delicious meal. We had some filled with stinky cheese, others with what looked like a potato others filled with beans. Overall a great vibe ! I really liked the way they operate here, "todo para todos", the people really take care of eachother.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

116447029.name: We did not see any Agua Azul (Blue Water)
116447029.author: a TripAdvisor user
116447029.reviewBody: We get here on the rainy days, so we couldn\'t see the blue water. The guides explain about this, if you go there on March, April.... when there is not raining this much you can see the perfect color of this waterfall. Unfortunately when we get there there, we had 4 days of rain so the water was like any other waterfall in the world, but still amazing.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

109245214.name: Incredible waterfalls, a must see in Chiapas
109245214.author: a TripAdvisor user
109245214.reviewBody: We hiked all the way to the top, and I reccomend you do too if fit enough.  Don\'t worry, there will be plenty of other empanada stands with cold beer up there :)  We had a nice little place all to ourselves, and the views were amazing on the hike up.  A must see in Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

105706370.name: A Highlight Of A Holiday In Mexico
105706370.author: a TripAdvisor user
105706370.reviewBody: These waterfalls really were a highlight of my holiday. The falls cascade over rocks at various points at the site. While their name is Agua Azul - Blue Water - when we were there the water falling over the rocks was white, the water in the pools was a bright greenish colour and the rocks were an orange/brown colour. Added to all that colour was a beautiful blue sunny sky. It all combined to make an excellent canvas of colour. There are swimming places at the falls, and the water wasn\'t too cold when we were there.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

65591908.name: Incredible Jungle Falls
65591908.author: a TripAdvisor user
65591908.reviewBody:
Agua Azul waterfalls are not to be missed if you are in Chiapas visiting the Palenque ruins or San Cristobal de las Casas. They are a series of cascading waterfalls of brilliant blue which run over a red / orange bedrock and are simply beautiful.

In the heart of the jungle, you can follow a trail up the waterfalls to the top and off into the jungle. There are places to eat, buy souvenirs and simply sit and watch the falls. You can also swim in the lagoons at the bottom of the falls, although we didn't have the time to do this.

An hour is plenty of time, although if you have more time to sit and take it in then it’s worth it.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

52958374.name: AGUA AZUL is spectacular !
52958374.author: a TripAdvisor user
52958374.reviewBody: This massive jungle river flowing over hills carved limestone swimming pools all through the jungle! I loved it so much I went 2 days in a row by collectivo from Palenque town.Go on a sunny day to enjoy the color rain makes it muddy. Use a collectivo the bus could be targeted by rebel bandits ...see another travelers bandit warning review. I was charged a couple dollars more to get back.....typical. I have heard that drivers may not take you in wet swim wear. Don\'t stay too late before getting a collectivo back. I think you should choose Agua over Misol Ha as both may be too much exertion and exposure.Agua deserves 5 hr.s bring a picnic. Mayans have lots of food and crafts there, but I get paranoid about food . Nice crafts! There is camping by the waters ( research )...Safe?...maybe.\nBe  smart and cautious while traveling in Chiapas. The heat is incredible .Get a small AC room, I almost died of humidity in the hostels.Go very early to Palenque ruins on vans from town.SO HOT!! I saw shady dudes around the jungle tourist bungalows/bars,maybe just stop in for a drink. You get lots of jungle on day trips so why live with bugs and worse?\nEnjoy this jungle paradise!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

21829772.name: Bandits Attacked Us
21829772.author: a TripAdvisor user
21829772.reviewBody:
12-11-08

The  Agua Azul falls were beautifull !!!

BUT our bus got attcked by bandits wearing masks with guns and machettes. They put a log on the road and stormed the bus and took wallets and bags cameras etc. 

bandaits went as far as putting guns to peoples temples and padded down people for money belts. Really scary expierence. At least two other buses also got done on the same day in the same spot just 3 minutes from the falls on the road ajoining highway 191

 I would not reccomend anybody going to the falls until it is made safe by more police or amry patroling the roads.

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

4691128.name: Blue as the sky
4691128.author: a TripAdvisor user
4691128.reviewBody:
I happend to visit agua azul a couple of times and it's been always just so absolutly overwellming! If you have the chance to go there with your own car and not with some organised tour group it's even better. Listen mother natur waking up, monkeys hawling at you, humingbirds flying around your head and of course these gorgeous waterfalls!!
The only thing that I would advise you on, is not to go there after heavy rainfalls, espacially in the rainy season (which is more or less from may to early september), because then the water will just look muddy and grey and even swimming is not recomandable.
During the last years they (this place is a zapatista autonomy region) have put a lot of effort into this place to make it more attractive to people, that includes installing nice paths along the cascades, artisan stores and restaurants.
It's allways a place worth visiting!!!!

address.streetAddress: Reserva Especial de la Biosfera Cascadas Agua Azul Cascadas de Agua Azul Chiapas

664100029.name: A hidden gem!
664100029.author: a TripAdvisor user
664100029.reviewBody: This was such a pleasant surprise. The animals seemed well cared for and it was so easy to get around. The spider monkeys were so friendly. One actually shook hands. \nWould have gone back a second time if had time. Don\'t forget your camera!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

661598243.name: Not to be missed! \u00c3 ne pas manquer! Maravilloso!
661598243.author: a TripAdvisor user
661598243.reviewBody: We just visited Ecoparque Aluxes and liked it so much that we went back the following day. A must for nature lovers and photographers, also great for kids. It\'s a non-profit rescue centre that work tirelessly to preserve and reintroduce endangered species (plants and animals). There are animals in semi-captivity (some rescued from trafickers, such as young howler monkeys, will ultimately be released into the wild), but due to its biodiversity, the park also attracts many birds, butterflies and small mammals that roam freely. One flowering tree was abuzz with hummingbirds and we even got decent photos of these hard-to-catch tiny beauties. Expect to see crocodiles, a jaguar, an ocelot, agoutis, pecaris, countless parrots and macaws, flamingos, Roseate spoonbills, a stork, etc, etc. The parcel is opened 9am-4:30 pm (last entry, but you can stay until 5:30pm) and adult ticket full price is 150 pesos. Small shop, refreshments, toilets. I recommend going early morning or from 3 pm to avoid the worst of the heat and get better light for photos. There is a longer trail (at least 1h30 if you do it properly) and a shorter one (1h) but we spent over 2 h on our first visit. Many signs with explanations in English and Spanish. Very quiet when we went; an oasis. The opposite of a commercial zoo, this is a project worth supporting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

661504217.name: Magical jungle experience
661504217.author: a TripAdvisor user
661504217.reviewBody: We went with my 3,5 year old son who didn\u2019t tire during the walk because there is so much to see. Wonderful to see everything so well cared for, with attention to detail realized.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

659552985.name: Lovely setting with lots to see
659552985.author: a TripAdvisor user
659552985.reviewBody:
We stopped going to zoos after our safaris in Africa where animals roam freely and people are confined to jeeps. After reading the reviews we decided to check this place out. The setting is lush and tropical and there’s lots to see. Admittedly the big rescued cats looked like they were under house arrrest and confined to smaller enclosures. Apparently they have medical/health  problems and can’t roam freely. They looked healthy tho- the jaguar was rolling around on the earth and kicking his/her legs in the air. The staff are kind and caring towards the animals. 
We sat for 30 minutes and watched a pair of roseate spoonbills building a nest while caressing each other only the way spoonbills can do! One of them was blind in one eye. 
The monkeys are intriguing- they’re free to roam the jungle but come to the park for food. Watched a troop of 7 howlers above us in the trees growling/howling the way only howlers can do. 
Fabulous birds in a lovely setting. Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

654638189.name: Amazing wildlife, worth protecting
654638189.author: a TripAdvisor user
654638189.reviewBody: The Aluxes Ecoparque is a rescue site, a wildlife parc and a modern type of zoo with fortunately only a few cages (for jaguars) and rather large space for the animals. I was amazed by the parrots (guacamaya / ara), flying around and into the sky. I don\'t know if that\'s the best (?) way we can save a bit of wildlife on this planet...but at least it\'s a good try. Go and help them by paying your entrance fee. It\'s non profit, so it\'s really more than worth the 150 pesos p. P.\nWonderful experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

654193285.name: Aluxes Ecopark
654193285.author: a TripAdvisor user
654193285.reviewBody: We had a great morning in this ecopark. They are doing a great job caring for their animals, some of which they received injured and abandoned. They are also doing a great job educating their visitors about the animals and how endangered they are. You will see some rare animals and will support a good cause!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

649961870.name: Having Fun While Doing Good
649961870.author: a TripAdvisor user
649961870.reviewBody: A charming ecopark down the street from the ruins.  They care for wild birds, reptiles  and animals that have been injured and they try to return as many as possible to the wild.\nA great way to see the flora and fauna of the region.  It isn\'t anything grand (I grew up regularly visiting the San Diego Zoo),  but the animals are well cared for and easy to see.\nWe arrived too late for the parrot or manatee feeding, but my friends say it was an amazing experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

649050566.name: Don\'t Miss Aluxes
649050566.author: a TripAdvisor user
649050566.reviewBody: Aluxes are happy and playful Mayan elves who devote themselves to taking care of crops and the jungle for mother nature.  It\'s also the name of an extremely well done ecopark devoted to rescuing, rehabilitating and releasing when possible birds and animals that have been wounded, are ill, or have been held in captivity. There are a number of interactive things you can do such as feeding the scarlet macaws, handling a boa constrictor or feeding manatis.  But the real highlight is strolling through the immaculately preserved grounds and getting up close and personal with the birds and animals of the park.  This is an extremely well done preserve. The park and the structures in which the animals are kept are clean and well maintained. The enclosure for each species is well marked with information relating the the animal or bird. Aluxes is really a don\'t miss activity when in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

647266683.name: Fantastic Eco-Park to see the native fauna
647266683.author: a TripAdvisor user
647266683.reviewBody: This is a well run and kept eco-Park that takes in wounded and other animals from the area and shows them to the customers in a natural and proper way, it is highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

646171733.name: Excellent thing to do while in Palenque!
646171733.author: a TripAdvisor user
646171733.reviewBody: This ecopark offers the opportunity to see many interesting animals, including jaguars, crocodiles etc. However, what makes it different from a zoo is that many animals are walking freely around (obviously not the dangerous ones, so don\'t worry). We really enjoyed it here.\n\nAsk the colectivo that runs between Palenque town and the Palenque ruins to drop you off here - and then ask the staff to get a taxi for you when you went to go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

643343395.name: Nice morning out.
643343395.author: a TripAdvisor user
643343395.reviewBody:
We visited the zoo ahead of a flight from Palenque airport- it only takes 1-2 hours to get round. We went at 9am and had the zoo to ourselves which was nice. 

It was a pleasant experience, in a jungle like theme as you walk through. There are lots of different animals to see, some local to the surrounding jungle area and it is a great opportunity to see Jaguars which you are unlikely to see in the wild. 

Some of the animals did appear to have quite small plain cages especially the birds of prey or the jaguars which shouldn’t be in such tiny cages due to the nature of how they act in the wild. But I believe the zoo is doing some level of good by introducing species back into the wild. 

All in all, a nice way to spend the morning and lovely to see some native and exotic species.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

639249054.name: Great
639249054.author: a TripAdvisor user
639249054.reviewBody: For us a big thumbs up , better then a big zoo here you can interact with the animals for a small fee and support this animal rescue centre

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

632570781.name: Better than any zoo or similar park I have ever seen. We visited in early November
632570781.author: a TripAdvisor user
632570781.reviewBody: This park is filled with animals in their jungle setting. The jungle is what makes this place unique, Staff was friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this park to all travelers At 150 pesos for an entry fee, it;s well worth the price. You can easily access this site with any comvee in el centro.,

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

631775539.name: Do NOT miss
631775539.author: a TripAdvisor user
631775539.reviewBody: Don\u2018t go through Palenque without visiting this place. It\u2019s wonderfully made and whatever you spend helps endangered species and animals rescued from being illegally trafficked. Would love to repeat!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

626271424.name: Excellent park! Well worth the entry!
626271424.author: a TripAdvisor user
626271424.reviewBody: We went to Aluxes late one afternoon (they close at 6pm, not 5 like google says). We literally had the park to ourselves and most the animals were starting to come out after the heat of the day. The macaws and the walk in bird enclosures were amazing! All animals were in good condition and my husband is a vet so heis rather knowledgeable in that department. Overall we loved it and highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

622912535.name: Great eco park for local environment conservation.
622912535.author: a TripAdvisor user
622912535.reviewBody:
We went there in the afternoon and were the only visitors, what made this visit very interesting. 
In the entrance you will get a briefing of the park’s concept: all animals were rescued from illegal trading or kept as pets of privat people. 
The route through the park is very nice, as it is located in the jungle itself, so you will see many animals around the enclosures like black howler, different birds and reptiles. One howler came like 3 meters close, what was a really exiting encounter. 
Especially the crocodile area I liked a lot, as it is really vast and the enclosures are very spacious. 
I liked the concept of conserving the local Fauna a lot, that’s why we decided to visit the park. You will also get a lot of background information about the animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

618313981.name: 4n hours well spent - Would highly recommend
618313981.author: a TripAdvisor user
618313981.reviewBody: We went to Aluxes Ecoparque during the week on our second day in Palenque. We are both keen travellers & have experienced various types of \'conservation\' parks in the world through Asia & Africa. This was the first one we went to in Central America. I was a bit unsure if I wanted to go after reading some of the comment\'s on here about the animal\'s. I\'ve been to  \'conservation\' places In Asia & Africa where its been absolutely terrible & I\'ve hated it. When I am not travelling I work as a Veterinarian nurse & have a deep love for animals & environment conservation. Thankfully, we were both very happy that we went to Aluxes & donated both our time & money. It is one of the good ones! We do agree with some of the comments that the wild cats need bigger enclosures, as do the bigger bird\'s. However, Once we had finished walking about the sanctuary, I made some enquiries with the manager, asking who looks after the animal\'s ? how they were obtained? their future ? & the concerns that we had. She told me that all of the wild cats were seized from from illegal traffickers by authorities or abandoned by people who had obtained them illegally, intending to keep them as domestic pets. She assured me that the animals get regular veterinary assessments & the organisation work\'s very closely with a biologist who is in charge of the enclosures. She said a key focus for them is to make sure they are creating environmental enrichment & stimulation for the animal\'s. Sadly, none fo these cat\'s can be released back into the wild & be expected to survive. She assured me that all of the enclosure\'s are at or above the international standard for sizing.  One of the jaguar Negro\'s (black panther\'s) did appear to have some sort of deformity with one of it\'s front claws, however apart from this it looked very happy, healthy & even a bit fat. The female Ocelot appeared to be agitated when we arrived at her enclosure & we saw her doing circle\'s inside of her enclosure, we sat down and watched her for quite some time to see if this would change. This behaviour from her has been mentioned in reviews by other tourists who have also witnessed this. After about 10 minutes we realised it was lunch time & that she was reacting to this, the circling got worse when the male Ocelot, who is in another enclosure got fed first. Once she had her chicken, she ate it straight away & then went to sleep. She didn\'t appear to be neurological or stressed after eating & her enclosure didn\'t suggest that she does this circling all day, however we mentioned it to the manager who was grateful that we told her & said she would tell the biologist straight away so they can adjust her habits. Undeniably you want to see these cats in the wild where they belong & when they aren\'t, we resent that fact. I still do agree that the enclosures could be bigger, despite them meeting an international standard, however, we don\'t know if the animals have medical problems that require them to have a restricted exercise regime. This is the case again for the bigger birds. Perhaps they have had an injury to their wing which means they cannot fly or be released into the wild or have a cage big enough that would allow flight attempts. It\'s not a perfect solution for these animals, but in an imperfect world it\'s the best possible solution. I loved the fact that the cats were not being exploited for unrealistic tourist encounters or bred within this conservation park. I have a big problem when tourism and money are justification for breeding wild or exotic animals so that tourists can have extra special encounters with their offspring, for example the lion cub cuddling that we saw in Africa. I felt like all the animal encounters here at this place were done very responsibly so that both the animals & people had a nice interaction. The manager told me about the wonderful work that they have done in conjunction with the authorities & the general public to create awareness & education. It was also really good to be told about the breeding & successful rehabilitation & release programs for some of these animals. The howler monkeys are a good example of this. The original 2 where seized by authorities after being sold on the black market. Thankfully Aluxes could take them in,  which was a much better option that euthanasia. They are currently critically endangered, as are a lot of the animals we saw in Aluxes. Reading about the animal\'s survival status & realising that so many of them were critically endangered was the only bad thing about the day. We spent 4 hours looking at the animals in enclosures &  exploring the natural areas of habitat, looking out for wild birds, reptiles & insects that were in abundance here. I would definitely recommend going here & supporting this organisation. Our highlights were the Manatee\'s, Flamingo\'s, Tucan, Macaw, Spoonbill\'s (there are soo many birds here!)  Tapir\'s, the cats, otters, monkeys, anteater, racoons.... the list could go on forever!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

608235561.name: Love it but room for improvement
608235561.author: a TripAdvisor user
608235561.reviewBody:
After a long and very uncomfortable trip to Yaxchilan and Bonampak we decided to ditch plans to go to Agustin Azul and do this eco park instead.
We arrived at 9am and had a great 2 hours walking around the trails and seeing all the animals.
Definitely best to do early in the day while cooler and animals are more active.
We loved the all the birds (the macaws in particular) and seeing the wild howler monkeys in the area.
They clearly do a a great job but I agree with other reviewers that more information is needed to explain how the animals were rescued and what their status is (going to be returned to the wild or can’t be because of...)
Only other thing is that some of cats could definitely use bigger enclosures. Some displayed unusual behaviour like running up and down a short track repeatedly for the whole time we watched.
But overall a really great place that is worthy of support.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

601614815.name: Not enough informations about rescued animals
601614815.author: a TripAdvisor user
601614815.reviewBody: The park is beautiful. You walk through the jungle and you can see a lot of animals. BUT the informations are missing. Why are the animals there? What happened to them? Some animals didn\u2018t looked happy, especially the eagles: way too small cages. The animals you can see are fantastic but I am normally not a fan of zoos and thought this would be different but without the informations it\u2018s just another place where I feel bad about. If there would be more informations and if I would know that the animals can go back to the wild life sometime I would be way more happy with my experience..

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

597181244.name: Lovely place!
597181244.author: a TripAdvisor user
597181244.reviewBody: We had A great time at Aluxes!! There were a lot of beautiful animals and we even fed manaties!! Loved it

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

595728719.name: Perfect day
595728719.author: a TripAdvisor user
595728719.reviewBody: Really good experience visiting Aluxes! So much to see and do, a great experience feeding the manatees and holding the macaw! Loved this place - perfect for a relaxing day in Palenque!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

593090262.name: Interesting t see the wildlife of the zone. Sad to see captive animals.
593090262.author: a TripAdvisor user
593090262.reviewBody: If you like to see wildlife of the area, it is interesting to visit. The place is well kept.\nThe kids did not like to see captive animals, and the experience was not fun or nice for them.\nIf you are a true animal lover I would not recommend to visit. If you are not into that you might like the place

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

578947496.name: Enjoyable and relaxing place
578947496.author: a TripAdvisor user
578947496.reviewBody: Our hotel suggested we visit as we had a free morning in our schedule. We had a wonderful time!  The paths are very well laid out, with plenty of animals and birds to see in beautiful surroundings. The entrance fee of 150 pesos is well worth it. Walking round and stopping to look at everything took about 1.5 hours. Notice boards are in English.  Palenque definitely has more to offer than the ruins, superb as they are so do go to Aluxes if you have time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

577681694.name: Nice thing to do after visiting the ruins
577681694.author: a TripAdvisor user
577681694.reviewBody: We came here yesterday. It\'s pretty well laid out. Some interesting displays, signage is on English as well. Sad to see the big cats there. Not sure of their story but their enclosures should be larger. It was 150 pesos entrance fee/per person. The animals looked well cared for and fed. Probably a great activity for children.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

576069945.name: A very enjoyable few hours
576069945.author: a TripAdvisor user
576069945.reviewBody:
We had time to kill before a 1pm departure fromPalenque and decided to visit this zoo. It was 70 pesos in a taxi from our hotel and we spent about an hour and a half checkign out all sorts of birds, monkeys, reptiles,, wild cats and animals we'd never seen or heard of before.

The place is dedicated to recovery of animals and gettignt hem back into their habitat.

Highly enjoyable and recommended

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

575936259.name: Wonderful experience
575936259.author: a TripAdvisor user
575936259.reviewBody: Absolutely brilliant way to spend a few hours. Lovely staff, incredible surroundings, amazingly diverse wildlife largely in their natural habitat and/or rescued and in recovery. A truly wonderful place and well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

574635433.name: A good zoo
574635433.author: a TripAdvisor user
574635433.reviewBody: I was unsure at first due to not liking animals being caged but these animals appeared to be healthy and are given as close to a natural surrounding as possible where possible.\nMany of the animals are rescues, hoping to be released back in the wild and reading the response to one of the negative reviews makes me respect the staff even more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

573848268.name: Wonderful Center   Surprise for Chiapas
573848268.author: a TripAdvisor user
573848268.reviewBody: We were so glad we gave this rescue center/zoo a chance.  It was beautiful and a great experience for my kids but also for me and my husband.  It is very well layed out and the gardens between the exhibits are lovely and provide a lot of shade.  Our kids loved feeding the manatees and holding a snake.  Amazing to be able to walk inside the bird cages, and see wild monkeys roaming through the grounds.  Only felt a bit sad for the jaguar and panther habitats-  they need a bit more space.  But other habitats were large and well taken care of.  I would go!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

573191474.name: Good concept, great for kids
573191474.author: a TripAdvisor user
573191474.reviewBody: This was a very nice surprise! Well after these reviews here we had kind of high expectations but we were very happy with our visit. This preserve takes care of the animals and the area was for our understanding the most animal friendly we\u2019ve have ever encountered. If you do some feeding or photos of the animals with kids please look the kids are careful with the animals. For the entire circle it can take easily three hours with foto stops and and a relaxed walk. But if you just walk through (because you have to go to the toilet or cafeteria, you get it in about 25min to the start or end point. Overall, the 150pesos entry are a good investment. For groups (families as well?!) it seems that discounts are available. Bring snacks if you want to stay longer. Drinks and chips can be bought from the basic shop.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

570929282.name: Best rescue center and sanctuary I\u2019ve been to
570929282.author: a TripAdvisor user
570929282.reviewBody: I didn\u2019t know about this park until seeing the adverts on the way to the archaeological site and as a biologist myself I decided to give it a try. I lived and worked in a rescue center in Costa Rica for two years, and having been to a lot of rescue centres over there I can honestly say this is the best I\u2019ve been to by far. I didn\u2019t know there are rescue centres in Mexico so this was a surprise to me. The place is beautifully kept, the trail is easy and clear, the cages and enrichments are top quality and the animals look as healthy as they get in captivity. They have amazing programs and the activities they offer are completely worth the extra 150-200 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

569779157.name: Pleasant surprise
569779157.author: a TripAdvisor user
569779157.reviewBody: A guide at the ruins recommended a visit and it was well worth. This \u2018zoo\u2019 is full of rescue animals and they are working to save a critically endangered makaw. It is well landscaped, has mostly local animals and some information in English. The jaguar, panther and ocelot were highlights but there were many other good exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

569708551.name: Lovely experience!
569708551.author: a TripAdvisor user
569708551.reviewBody: A beautiful very informative eco park; most of the animals have ample space to live in; it is quiet, well laid out and sign-posted with information for each animal. One feels the caring effort put in for each of them.  We felt though that the larger cats would be much happier with a bigger area and not left to live alone perhaps that can be changed? \nOverall this was an intriguing and recommendable experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

566378302.name: Nice Nature Park
566378302.author: a TripAdvisor user
566378302.reviewBody: Go at 9  and see the wildlife at its best. If you are with a group of five or more, you can get even earlier entrance for an extra fee. Also try to go up the canopy tower - great views, birds, nice  breeze on a hot day - but only rarely open. My interest is butterflies, and this is one of the few places left near Palenque with accessible natural habitat.\nSort of sad the place is being taken over by zoo-like displays, but I guess that is what most visitors like - wildlife closeup.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

565458783.name: EcoHeaven
565458783.author: a TripAdvisor user
565458783.reviewBody: A beautiful sanctuary for the inhabitants as well as visitors.  The ecoparque is extensive, well tended and signed.  We sighted many birds in addition to those confined.  Highlights included the blue jaguar, unexpected python and agile anteater.  This is a fine institution with dedicated purpose to promote and protect indigenous creatures under threat as well as the wetland habitat.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

563020069.name: A great way to spend a second day at Palenque
563020069.author: a TripAdvisor user
563020069.reviewBody: Aluxes was really tremendous!    We enjoyed our couple of  hours walking around very much, the paths and exhibits are well laid-out and the animals were amazing.  Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

561630983.name: A wonderful surprise
561630983.author: a TripAdvisor user
561630983.reviewBody: We wanted something to do prior to being picked up at 12 for our tour to Misolha and Agua Azul, so decided to walk to the Aluxes Ecoparque. We arrived at 9am when they open and were very pleasantly surprised by what we found. We could have spent longer than the 2.5 hours we had allowed. The park is well set out and maintained with a variety of species on display. There is a lovely stone path that meanders through the park and you will spot many birds and animals that are not enclosed as you walk through the forest. This should be a must do on any visit to Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

560736815.name: Delightful!
560736815.author: a TripAdvisor user
560736815.reviewBody:
We ran into an American, Mike, who recommended a visit to Aluxes, so we went.  It was truly amazing! We saw 30 scarlet macaws fly overhead several times, saw lots of them sitting in trees, and heard them squawking the whole time we were there. This is a "zoo" only in the sense that there are lots of mammals in enclosures, but it gave us the opportunity to see mammals that live here in the forest which we'd never see otherwise--jaguar, black panther, ocelot, dwarf leopard, some black and white weasels, several coatimundi, tapir, wild pigs, howler and spider monkies, and lots of birds. It is really an eco park with a wide variety of habitats, which makes it easy to see a lot of birds. 

The best thing about Aluxes is that is raises scarlet macaws and has re-introduced them to lowland Chiapas after they had been exterminated by hunting and trade. 

There's nothing like seeing the scarlet macaws up close or flying overhead. This should be a must on your Palenque agenda!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

560641404.name: Nothing but praise
560641404.author: a TripAdvisor user
560641404.reviewBody: I have nothing but praise for the work that the charitable organisation that runs the Ecoparque Aluxes is doing.  It is as much an sanctuary for rescued creatures as a zoo. \n I spent a most enjoyable couple of hours there in January 2018.  It was fascinating being able to get so close to so many wonderful animals, birds and reptiles.  I cannot recommend a visit too highly.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

559827311.name: Surprising and wonderful ecopark -- must-add to your Palenque tour
559827311.author: a TripAdvisor user
559827311.reviewBody: We had not heard about this "zoological park" until we arrived in Palenque and spoke with visitors and residents.  We had a free morning and took a cab to the entrance (on the road to the ruins).  Opens at 9am.  It was a very classy ecopark--not your typical zoo at all.  Like something Bill Gates would discreetly underwrite.  A two-kilometer path winds around a beautifully landscaped tropical park with a huge variety of birds (parrots, ducks and geese, hummingbirds, etc), crocodiles, ferrets and raccoons, a tapir, a manatee!!, and (awesome) three jaguars.  These critters are all rescue animals an dhave found their home here.  The Saturday we visited--there was almost no one there.  You can tour the park leisurely in 1-1/2 to 2 hours--and be back in town for an afternoon excursion.  The community is rightly proud of this park.  It was a very delightful expereince--and I infinitely preferred it to the seven-hour excursion to Agua Azul.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

559576077.name: Excellent
559576077.author: a TripAdvisor user
559576077.reviewBody: Animals appear well cared for in as near natural environment. Very quite off tourist trail. Went my connective 20 Peso    And 100 peso entry fee . About 2 hours adequate there .night and day guides available

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

557758988.name: One of our favourite places in Mexico!
557758988.author: a TripAdvisor user
557758988.reviewBody: We visited here on recommendation of our hotel. We\'d not heard anything about it in the research we had done about palenque. But this was hands down the best thing we did in Palenque. We loved that it was a rescue/Eco park. And there were so many animals we had never seen. We fed manatees and got to touch the turtle, which was awesome. It was completely empty when we went and we had the whole park to ourselves. Staff were super friendly. We ended up spending 4 hours here and loved it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

550011091.name: Awesome
550011091.author: a TripAdvisor user
550011091.reviewBody: We did both tours, day and night, and all I can say is Awesome!. \nDefinitely a must in Palenque.\nThanks Dante for a wonderful experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

548576209.name: Best Place in Palenque
548576209.author: a TripAdvisor user
548576209.reviewBody: Aluxes ist the best place in Palenque. Very friendly stuff. Amazing location in the jungle, \nDont miss to feed the manatis and turtels!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

544683438.name: Night tour
544683438.author: a TripAdvisor user
544683438.reviewBody: After a long drive from Campeche to Palenque we decided to take the nocturnal tour at Aluxes before visiting the Palenque ruins the next day. We were very positively surprised by the quality and the enthousiasm of two young local biologists, who gave us a (almost private) tour through the park with plenty of information. The park is not a zoo but really a shelter for animals, where they are treated with respect and the ultimate goal of reintroduction into the wild (if possible). For example, they reintroduced several macow parrots at the archeological zone (which of course is not a guarantee you will see them there). \nGreat value for money!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

543064726.name: Surprisingly great - play with the big cats!
543064726.author: a TripAdvisor user
543064726.reviewBody: We loved this place. For 100 pesos entrance fee you get to see a large variety of animals. What we liked in particular was that you always have to walk a bit through some fauna between the enclosures which decreased the sensory overload and allowed us to enjoy more. \nThere was a black panther who seemed bored. I jumped around and did a cart wheel infront of him - he soon started playing with me and rolled around too! So instead of hitting the glass please try to get his attention with some stunts, he will enjoy the playtime!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

542509232.name: I cannot recommend this enough
542509232.author: a TripAdvisor user
542509232.reviewBody:
This animal sanctuary is wonderful and I cannot recommend it enough. It is a rehabilitation centre for injured and lost animals to restore them to health and release them back to the wildlife. As such I feel like my entrance money will be put to amazing news.

The lady on reception was very informative. 

I loved walking through the park and seeing all the exotic animals. The only thing that made me feel slightly uncomfortable was the size of the jaguars cage but it looked like it was limping slightly so I assume this was for it's own protection.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

538149349.name: Absolutely worth it!
538149349.author: a TripAdvisor user
538149349.reviewBody: We went there on a rainy day (October-raining season) and so we could not see a few animals (as the big turtle). But still it was absolutely worth it. Only 100 pesos entry fee and we paid 100 pesos per person additionally, so we could feed the manatis - best day ever!! Although I have to say: I recommend you take one of the other activities when its raining. the manatis didn\'t want to come out. also the parque itself is very beaitiful. getting there is easy via collectivo.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

533582540.name: Zoo with respect for the animals
533582540.author: a TripAdvisor user
533582540.reviewBody: We found that the staff in the park is very friendly, and you can see that they work with great passion for the animals.\n\nThe zoo itself is nice and breaths nature. Not too crowded; so if you have some time to spare in Palenque, visiting the parque is definitely recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

529275320.name: Don\'t miss this place!
529275320.author: a TripAdvisor user
529275320.reviewBody: One of the best attractions in all of Mexico! Be sure to stop by and plan to spend your entire day here; good attractions and reasonable prices; safe and clean. Great place for kids, too!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

521807632.name: Beautiful place, wild and jungly!
521807632.author: a TripAdvisor user
521807632.reviewBody: It was a rainy day, so we went to this place to learn about animal in mexico! we saw monkeys, perrots, big turtles and more! you can also feed the crocodiles i higly recommend this place and their values about the nature conservation, a place like palenque who deserve to take care of it. Thanks for being there !

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

520326078.name: A great zoo doing great work!
520326078.author: a TripAdvisor user
520326078.reviewBody: If you are visiting Palenque you really should take an extra day and visit this lovely little zoo which is doing great work with its conservation, breeding and rehabilitation programmes. Fun & interesting for adults and children alike - the kids rated this as one of their highlights of our trip to Mexico. Primarily Mexican and Central American animals who looked healthy and well looked after.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

508626362.name: Amazing ecopark!
508626362.author: a TripAdvisor user
508626362.reviewBody:
The staff is very friendly and the people full of knowledge concerning the rescued fauna.
The entrance fee (100 pesos) is very reasonnable.
You may visit this scenic place in 2.00 hours, but we felt so good that we stayed 4.00...
The animals seems to be in very good condition and are living in great areas.
A special mention for the «bamboo forest». We where seduced by this part of the park...
The manatee's feeding is a sympathic activity!
My family and I love Aluxes ecopark and recommand to visit it!💙💜💚

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

508216266.name: Beautiful animals
508216266.author: a TripAdvisor user
508216266.reviewBody: We spent two days in Palenque with one day at the ruins, and one day here. We arrived around noon and stayed until 3:30. The park costs $100 pesos each for adults and $60 pesos for kids. It is well worth the time and your money goes to the conservation of the animals that are kept here. This is an ecopark dedicated to the rehabilitation and reintroduction of native species to the wild, rather than a zoo. Do not rush your time here. There are so many animals to see and they are all in large spacious habitats. 95% of the animals are native to Chiapas with a few species visiting from Africa. When walking around the park there is a long path and a short path. Take the long path. That is where we found spider monkeys hanging out right on top and beside the walkway. If you are interested in feeding animals the night tour includes manatee and crocodile feedings as well as the opportunity to hold a boa constrictor. If you decide to do these activities the feedings cost $100 pesos each and holding the boa costs $50 pesos in addition to your entry fee. You can pay $250 to do these during the day or pay $300 pesos for the night tour where it is all included. We loved the park so much we decided to return that evening for the night tour. At the end of our visit we asked about the night tour.  At that time there was no one signed up. But by the time we returned at 7:00 there was a total of 20 people in the group. The tour itself is very educational but is led in Spanish. Because our group was large and consisted of primarily English speakers, a translator came along as well. As I am fluent in both languages, the Spanish version is much more informative and the English translation was merely a summary of everything the zoologist had said. I highly recommend going both during the day and at night. The daytime is great for taking photos of the animals. However, many of the species living there are nocturnal and we only saw them during the night tour. The only washrooms are by the entrance to the park, beside the palapa where you can buy beverages. Underneath the palapa is where you can find Scarlett Macaws and Blue and Yellow Macaws and is a great photo opportunity. These birds are not in cages and are allowed to fly around freely. We also spotted a group of 6 or 7 in the trees above the path. The Scarlett Macaws had been extinct in Chiapas for 70 years prior to 2011. In 2011, Aluxes began reintroducing the species to the wild. We were also informed that on August 15th or 16th I\'m not 100% sure which, they are going to release another batch of Macaws into the wild. Their hope is that they will live in and around the Palenque ruins. We also found out that the park is quite large (45 acres), however you actually only see 5 acres when you visit. This is because their first priority is always the animals and their conservation. If you happen to go to Palenque, make sure you give this place a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

507113230.name: Don\'t be skeptical.
507113230.author: a TripAdvisor user
507113230.reviewBody: We were definitely skeptical since animal enclosures are really not our thing but this is a great place. The animals are mostly rescue and they are kept in wide open or sometimes even totally free spaces. Jaguars, crocodiles, macaws, monkeys, etc. It is a long walk through the jungle and lots of fun. Pro tips: take repellent and make sure you find the path over the pond into the bamboo forest. It is not clearly marked and worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

506269056.name: Great Zoo!
506269056.author: a TripAdvisor user
506269056.reviewBody: Next to Palenque Ruins - great zoo for cost. Do the extended route. Plenty to see. Well maintained and you feel like you are in the natural habitat. Great job!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

504438828.name: Definitely worth a visit
504438828.author: a TripAdvisor user
504438828.reviewBody: Aluxes is an amazing park helping rescued animals and it is a great place to get to know native Mexican wildlife and relax after a whole day of sightseeing. For a small fee you can also feed the manatees - which made me absolutely fall in love with these beautiful creatures! The place doesn\'t really feel like a zoo, but more like a safari with parrots flying above your head and agouti running between the trees. I had a great time there and would visit again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

498063793.name: Perfect after a day at the Ruins
498063793.author: a TripAdvisor user
498063793.reviewBody: I went to the park for a quick stop after visiting the ruins. I only had an hour there, but could have spent many more. All of the animals are living in extremely high quality habitats. I\'ve never seen a park so well made and maintained. The wetlands, islands and moats were amazing to see. Wild animals and birds are all over the park so it feels even more natural. Will happily go back every time I am in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

495264445.name: Worth a visit whilst in lovely Palenque.
495264445.author: a TripAdvisor user
495264445.reviewBody: Enjoyed my time here visiting the ecoparque. Plenty of rescued animals that are being cared for by the park. \nFirst time I saw flamingos & jaguars in person. Good gift shop here & they were happy to call us a taxi when we had finished visiting. \nEnough of the information is in English to make the visit informative.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

494396533.name: 2017MexAdventure
494396533.author: a TripAdvisor user
494396533.reviewBody: Aluxes is a Conservation Park in Palenque, where they rescue native wildlife and reintroduce lost species into the wild. My son loved this place and was so happy to visit and had so much fun petting/holding the snake.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

492593045.name: Fantastic animal sanctuary.
492593045.author: a TripAdvisor user
492593045.reviewBody: It was very hot when we visited this animal sanctuary in the middle of the day. They also offer night tours. Many of the animals have been rescued, but all are now in good hands. They are all well cared for in first class habitats, with a very well designed walking paths, viewing areas, and a bamboo forest. You can also pay a small premium to pet turtles, manatees, and baby boa constrictors, along others. First class facility. Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

491329318.name: The night tour is awesome!
491329318.author: a TripAdvisor user
491329318.reviewBody: The night tour is a great deal. You have a guide, it\'s a small group, and you get to feed the manatees and crocodiles and hold a snake. All for $15 per person! The guide takes you to see the animals as well, which are more active at night. It\'s a 2-3 hour tour and going through the jungle at night is fascinating. The staff and guides are amazing and are passionate about their work. And it\'s all for a good cause...animal conservation.  It\'s also a good option because it\'s not as hot at night.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

479007136.name: Perfect after ruins!
479007136.author: a TripAdvisor user
479007136.reviewBody: Wonderful park! Go for a ruins in the morning, grab a lunch somewhere nearby (e.g. El Panchan) and then spend a couple of hours in this park. Bring anti-mosquito spray for both ruins and the park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

478089108.name: Unforgettable Experience
478089108.author: a TripAdvisor user
478089108.reviewBody: We visited Aluxes Ecoparque in Palenque during our Easter break. We had a wonderful time. Park personnel went out of their way to make us feel welcome, the animals were impeccably kept, the grounds are beautifully landscaped and clean   Feeding the manatees (who are all rescued animals) was one of the most incredible experiences we ever had and the keepers were great. Their  Scarlet macaw repopulation program is also amazing as we got to see these magnificent birds flying free for the first time in many years. I definitely believe this is a must see when you visit Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

476934154.name: One of the highlights of visiting Mexico
476934154.author: a TripAdvisor user
476934154.reviewBody:
I had an amazing time here in the middle of a huge thunderstorm. I spent about two and a half hours visiting and wanted to come back the next day (unfortunately, the park was closed). I could have happily spent more time here and would recommend it completely. 

The keepers and staff are really passionate about what they do and many of the animals, including the manatees, are rescued. It is a sanctuary rather than a park or a zoo. 

Feeding the manatees was one of the highlights of my holiday in Mexico - thank you to the park director and trainee vet who made that experience really special and told me about the history of the manatees.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

476482391.name: The night tour!!
476482391.author: a TripAdvisor user
476482391.reviewBody:
If you are looking for a mini safari with absolutely passionate people, this is the place for you! It would help if you speak Mexican, or as the Mexicans call it, Spanish. They will try to assist in English however. 
There are many so many different types of animals and you even get to interact with them. I was not a fan of feeding the croc pair meat though, being a vegetarian, but other people absolutely loved it. 
If you are going in the night tour, I would recommend wearing long trousers which cover up your legs and wear a ton of insect repellent.  
Over all a great place to visit if you are in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

473616822.name: Freaking alligators
473616822.author: a TripAdvisor user
473616822.reviewBody: There was this night tour, definitely a must. I don\'t know what else to say, if you like nature like i do, you\'ll be delighted

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

472169098.name: One of the highlights of Palenque
472169098.author: a TripAdvisor user
472169098.reviewBody:
Aluxes was so great, I went twice in three days! I started with the night tour -- includes feeding manatees, feeding crocodiles, and (if you choose) holding a baby boa constrictor. I went back this morning to get better photo ops and feed Patro, Mexico's largest crocodile in captivity. 

Every activity + tour they offer is well-priced, and well worth the money. The animals receive excellent care, and the staff clearly loves them.

Be sure to buy the bug repellent they sell for 60 pesos. You'll need it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

470351702.name: Excellent place to visit in Palenque.
470351702.author: a TripAdvisor user
470351702.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit in Palenque, much better than visiting a zoo, you may find many species that are protected in this reserve

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

469519531.name: A great visit!
469519531.author: a TripAdvisor user
469519531.reviewBody: This is a great ecoparque who do a wonderfull job of conservation and animal rehabilitation. Love that lots of the animals are in open enclosures. For $100 pesos you can help feed the manatee which was one of the most bizarre but best experiences of our trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

468743153.name: Awesome park!
468743153.author: a TripAdvisor user
468743153.reviewBody: We were really pleased with the park. It is large, well kept, informative, super helpful staff, and the animals are cared well for.\n\nI would recommend everybody who goes to see the ruins in Palenque to also go here to get an idea about the fauna that is native to the area the Mayans lived in.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

467389857.name: A wonderful zoo experience, from a guy that hates zoos!
467389857.author: a TripAdvisor user
467389857.reviewBody: Was skeptical going in as to whether I would like it. But attracted to it by the conservation programs it conducts such as Scarlet Macaw (guacamayas) reintroduction. But for 3 exceptions, I found the wildlife areas had no bars or glass partitions. All the species are local or at least southern-Mexico native. The entire park is set in the jungle and offer both its inhabitants and passing free wildlife a natural habitat. Part of its mandate is to provide a wildlife hospital where injured animals and birds, as well as individuals rescued from wildlife trafficing operations can be healed and rested before (hopefully) being returned to the wild. Animals that are permanently injured and may have died without this facility are permanently housed here. This benefits the visitors who can see them up close and can learn about their natural history....I actually brought my bird field guide so I could sit on a bench and identify the many duck, waders and songbird species that enter Aluxes of their own free will and seem happy to stay for however long. I recommend a visit here. Great for families with young kids.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

466341596.name: surprisingly great place
466341596.author: a TripAdvisor user
466341596.reviewBody: It\'s definitely worth to visit this place if you have enough time, staying in Palenque area. \nAfter climbing famous pyramids on the another sites and endless driving (if you came from the seaside) you will be happy to have promenade here in the shadows of tropical trees. Just take a look around and you will see monkeys, jumping above your heads and fancy birds, singing. All the animals are friendly and leave in almost natural environment. Park is very clear and staff is ready to help you in case of any questions. Location is very convenient, it\'s easy to get here from the hotel area and there are a lot of pointers on the road. We were going to spend 1-1.5 hrs. here , but actually spent 3 hrs, observing everything, it was so interesting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

461033588.name: I would give it 6 stars if I could
461033588.author: a TripAdvisor user
461033588.reviewBody: A great environment for the rehabilitation, rescue and, where possible release of animals.  A well maintained wooded path with well marked and identified animal habitat and flora.  Large spaces for them to roam, well treated species and a real, genuine experience. Monkeys, jaguars, near extinct macaws, and countless others. \nLow key, self guided, clean and real.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

460487096.name: Best zoo-experience ever
460487096.author: a TripAdvisor user
460487096.reviewBody:
This park was just amazing. Set in the jungle, which made the 1.4 km walk an experience on its own (not least the inner parts that was a wetland rescue project and a bambo forest. There was a great number of animals, furthermore in their natural habitat/for their own good rather than in cages for your own amusement. In short, it is both an eco park AND a zoo (despite them toning down the importance of this part). 

The best things was to feed tha Manate (100 peso), see a Tucan up close and all the Macaw's up close, 

Also great that there were few people - you were basically alone.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

458186561.name: A wonderful place to enjoy the native tropical animals and plants
458186561.author: a TripAdvisor user
458186561.reviewBody: This is a such a lovely natural setting for rainforest creatures like monkeys, agoutis, green iguanas, basilisks .. that some seem to come in of their own accord. If you are seeing scarlet macaws around Palenque they were probably released from here. Aluxes is a refuge for jaguars, ocelots, crocodiles and many other animals in a beautiful setting. You can go into the aviaries and  many of the animals are only enclosed by water, so you have wonderful views of them from shady benches. Have a big breakfast and take water - we stayed 5 hours! And it\'s only 100 pesos per person.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

458147463.name: A good activity to combine with a visit to Palenque
458147463.author: a TripAdvisor user
458147463.reviewBody: The ecoparque is a very interesting attraction.  It highlights many of the birds, mammals and reptiles found in the surrounding forests.
