Many of the animals have been rescued and are being rehabilitated for future release into the wild.  Most of the display areas are large and feature flora.  It is a good site to observe many species (that would be hard to observe in the wild) in a relatively native habitat.  The trails are extensive and you could walk several kilometers at the attraction.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

458106793.author: a TripAdvisor user
458106793.reviewBody: Nice place! Huge fan of the work they do as a nonprofit organisation. A mix between a zoo and a national park in the rainforest!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

457322850.name: Such an awesome place!
457322850.author: a TripAdvisor user
457322850.reviewBody:
Been there today and totally felt in love with this place. You can find a lot of local, African and Asian animals there. What makes it so special is the way how those animals are threated. It's not a Zoo, it's a place for rescued animals which would otherwise eventually have died. I am by far not an expert in animals, but as far as I can tell all those animals are living a good live in a secure and beautiful home.

The area is build in a circle way which brings you to all of the animals. You can either choose a short ~1,2km or long ~1,7km route. We took the long which lasted about 2,5hours. I recommend the long as, besides the animals, the route guides you through a fantastic a jungle/forest. The tour is not crowdy at all. The only thing you hear are plenty of animals around you.

Entrance fee is 100 pesos per person. You get there easily by taking a collectivo from Palenque. Just ask for one going to Ruinas, and ask for a stop at Aluxes. It's the same direction. We paid 20 pesos per person, one way.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

456812238.name: Exciting and Beautiful and Natural
456812238.author: a TripAdvisor user
456812238.reviewBody:
We loved it and spent twice as long there as we had expected 
Beautiful jungle setting and appears to be very well maintained
Crocodiles flamingoes and of course the black jaguar
Not crowded so you can get really close to almost all the animals
Plan to relax and enjoy the sounds of the wild

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

456559695.name: Great day
456559695.author: a TripAdvisor user
456559695.reviewBody: This animal sanctuary is great! A wonderful walk through the park, shade and sun ...can spend a few hours there! BeAutiful trees, flowers and habitat. Cost 100 pesos, 60 for kids or free is under 5. I was happy to see the majority of the animals in great habitat\nSome concern for Jaguars.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

456440904.name: Know your jungle
456440904.author: a TripAdvisor user
456440904.reviewBody: This is a thoughtful Ecco park beautifully designed in a natural setting with lots of wildlife both within and in the surrounding jungle. An opportunity to see what wildlife there is so close but often not seen by us city folk.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

454869593.name: Not a fan of zoo\'s
454869593.author: a TripAdvisor user
454869593.reviewBody: Due to some busses being burned on the way to the waterfalls we were taken to this zoo. I just don\'t like seeing caged animals and some of the enclosures left a lot to be desired, the big cats just didn\'t look that happy. There were some interesting statues and artifacts around the walks, but unless caged animals is your thing go somewhere else

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

453190185.name: A real zoo with live and active animals
453190185.author: a TripAdvisor user
453190185.reviewBody: I have visited many zoos in the world including.  Aluxes is the best I have seen.  It is not as large as some other famous zoos, such as San Diego Zoo, but it\'s not so small either.  It took me and my family 1.5 - 2.0 hours to complete the walk.  The best thing is that the all the animals are very active. (Well, except crocodiles...  They never move.)  It is as if the animals are excited to see the visitors.  It\'s not crowded with people, so we enjoyed our own pace of walking and taking pictures.  The entrance fee is modest.  It definitely is money worth.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

451800552.name: An absolute must-see in Palenque
451800552.author: a TripAdvisor user
451800552.reviewBody: The Aluxes Ecoparque is a beautiful and unique place to discover all regional animals in their natural environment. Most of the animals (except for the dangerous ones) live free in the area without cages. You can feel the passion of the people working there and it has nothing in common with a usual, commercial Zoo.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

451500804.name: Truly wonderful experience!
451500804.author: a TripAdvisor user
451500804.reviewBody:
Nice and welcoming place to stay with all your family for few hours on the way to/from Palenque ruins. 

Here you can see - and even touch some - almost all the species that live in the area: from coatis to jaguars. 

Highly recommend activity is to feed manatee. A very rare sepice, not easy to see in the open lagoons, here it will gently pick vegetables right from your hands or hands of your children.

It is actually a refugy for animal healing and reintruduction, which gives absolutely new level to your visit. Instead of going to a regular "zoo", where animals are holded mostly for human entertainment, here you may be sure you're founding a nature restoration programms, making the life better.

PS A tip - from the Tower in the park you may see the infamous Temple of Inscriptions of Palenque floating in the green forest from the distance.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

451056511.name: Nice if you have extra time - would be great for kids
451056511.author: a TripAdvisor user
451056511.reviewBody: Had a morning available before catching a bus. Liked the idea of the park\'s main purpose, which was animal rescue and rehabilitation (they are responsible for restoring scarlett macaws to the area).  It\'s a zoo, with nice exhibits with big cats, monkeys, birds, turtles, manatees, and much more.  The monkeys have real trees to swing from.  The animals provided for viewing were reportedly were confiscated by wildlife authorities from owners that had them illegally or that were mistreating them.  All appear to be very well cared for.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

449868321.name: Great!
449868321.author: a TripAdvisor user
449868321.reviewBody: Special in the afternoon so exciting at feeding Time to watch and scroll around. The Bird Watching around the Park is Great.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

449747223.name: Great 2 hours
449747223.author: a TripAdvisor user
449747223.reviewBody: Went to ecopark in the morning. Was almost empty - great experience walking around the park seeing the rescue animals. Paid extra to feed the manatees which was fun. Staff very friendly. Best thing I\'ve done on my Mexican trip so far

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

449735991.name: Amazing visit to a truly stunning place
449735991.author: a TripAdvisor user
449735991.reviewBody:
It was by chance that I went to the Ecoparque but I am very glad that it worked out how it did. It was a couple staying in my hotel that were going and I was fortunate enough to grab a taxi with them. Without ruining it for everyone, it is easy to navigate yourself around the ruins if you decide to get a taxi there yourself, we got one from La Cañada area and it was $50 pesos between 3. 

When you arrive it is $150 peso's to enter but it is worth it, you see a lot of beautiful animals, pften in their natural habitat, and certainly get a lot closer then you would in any English zoo (being English). You do not get hasseled at all by anyone and throughout the tour we only saw one family (and that was right at the very end), but this may be because we went in the morning rather early. 

Apart from one of the parrots being very mean and snapping at me, (the staff all found this hilarious - with good reason to be honest it made me jump out of my skin) all of the animals were friendly, including the stars of the show, the cheeky monkeys and also the manatees, who loved being fed and their noses scratched. 

The staff member who was on site couldn't go out of his way enough for us, trying to help us by speaking very clearly and slowly in Spanish, and trying hard in English. 

All in all I( definately recommend, and had I gone as a solo traveller, it would have been fine!!!). A must do on your visit to Palenque! And a worthy cause as all of the animals have been rescued and they rely soley on public support. 

Go! if you are there just go! :D

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

448370466.name: Walking and relaxing in nature
448370466.author: a TripAdvisor user
448370466.reviewBody: nice place to walk and enjoy nature, see  native animals like jaguar, crocodiles, monkeys. they do an amazing job in liberation of guacamayas, adults and childrens enjoy it equally. Its fee US 5, takes 5 minutes to go there from Palenque City in the same way to the archaeological site of Palenque

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

448365713.name: Great place to spend a couple of hours!
448365713.author: a TripAdvisor user
448365713.reviewBody:
I have visited the Alexes Ecopark a couple of times and have enjoyed it on both occasions.

It has all sorts of animals and birds that are mostly from the Chiapas region as well as acts as an animal sanctuary. The zoo is also situated in lush and leafy surroundings, making it a very pleasant way to spend an hour or two!

You can easily combine a visit here with the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

447211934.name: A Must-See for Nature Lovers
447211934.author: a TripAdvisor user
447211934.reviewBody:
Everyone goes to Palanque to see the ruins--and rightfully so. They are amazing. However, at the ruins you will hear all about the importance of the jaguar. . At Aluxes, you will see jaguars--both the black and spotted jaguar. Ideally, you would not see any of these amazing creatures at Aluxes--jaguars, ocelots, peccaries, monkies, deer, flamingos, parrots, and scores of other jungle wildlife--but many of these animals are being rehabilitated. Many have been rescued from the illegal trade of exotic wildlife that is a thriving business in Mexico, Central and South America. Some animals call Aluxes their permanent home because they are unable to ever survive being released in the wild. Even if the day comes when no more animals need rehabilitation or a protected place to live, Aluxes will still be a beautiful place to visit. 

The easy walking trails will take you through jungle vistas where you will see lots of wildlife that calls Aluxes home. As birders, we were able to see all kinds of beautiful birds that come to the waters and trees and vines and flowers of Aluxes. 

If you enjoy birding, you might want to purchase a copy of the magazine they sell in the visitor center called Diversidad De Aves En Aluxes. It contains many beautiful photos of many of the 153 identified birds you may see on your walk. 

I particularly enjoyed the Scarlet McCaws that fly overhead or just sit in the treetops as you walk by. These incredible birds were extinct in the area for 70 years until 2013 when these majestic birds were reintroduced to the area by the dedicated staff at Aluxes. Now, it is not unusual at all to see them in the trees and flying above you will you enjoy your walk. Earlier in the day, we say several of them flying over the ruins at Palanque which is a testament to the success of their reintroduction into the wilds.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

445967635.name: Awe-some
445967635.author: a TripAdvisor user
445967635.reviewBody: What a wonderful experience. An amazing opportunity to admire those animals you know are in the jungle but more than likely will never see as you walk through it at the ruins. A leisurely 1.5 hour walk refreshes and delights. And don\'t leave without feeding the manatees!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

443515816.name: Great for kids
443515816.author: a TripAdvisor user
443515816.reviewBody: We took our 4 year old and 8 year old here.\nIt was super beautiful and educational and we all really enjoyed it.\nIt was a great way to stay cool in the jungle and see up close some of the incredible animals that live in the area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

443340853.name: A few hours well spend in this nice animal sanctuary.
443340853.author: a TripAdvisor user
443340853.reviewBody: Having a couple of hours to spend it is definitely worthwhile visiting the Aluxes Eco Park. Keep in mind that Aluxes Eco Park is not a zoo but an animal sanctuary. You will get the opportunity to see quite a number of exotic animals, but some of them are in distress and will unfortunately most probably never return into the wild again. The entrance fee of MXN 100 is very low to see this collection of animals. The money is mainly spend to help the animals. We spent 2 to 2.5 hours in the Aluxes Eco Park and we consider it hours well spent.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

442861066.name: Do NOT miss this place
442861066.author: a TripAdvisor user
442861066.reviewBody:
We visited Aluxes with our 6 and 4 year old and it was one of the highlights of our whole trip. 
We walked from the Chan-Kah resort, which wasn't far but was very, very hot - if you're used to cooler weather just take a taxi and save yourself the buckets of sweat.

The woman manning the front desk was perfect - she spoke beautiful English and was very kind and welcoming. She talked to our kids about what they wanted to see, and shared some stories about the different animals and the park itself. 
The "zoo" is set up in a big loop, and the animal enclosures are well set up and clean. There are signs explaining that their goal is rehaiblitation and release, and they've done great work regeneratig the ecosystem. Don't miss the chance to do the "extra" experiences - there's a small charge for each but it's TOTALLY worth it. We paid a small amount to feed a crocodile, pat a giant tortoise and feed manatees. In the US, this would generally mean a quick 2 minute interaction. At Aluxes we were amazing by the amount of time we got to spend with each animal, and how awesome the staff was. For example, we paid for two people to feed the manatees, but the workers invited the other 2 members of our family in as well and we all got to spend at least 10-15 minutes kneeling at the edge of the water, feeding the manatees a full bowl of sliced fruits and veggies and stroking their noses and whiskers. It was incredible. 
The park was uncrowded and clean (we went on a Tuesday morning) and as we were leaving the woman at the front desk gifted our children with a small storybook about the Legend of the Aluxes. If we were visiting longer we would absolutely have returned again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

440165212.name: Pleasant discovery
440165212.author: a TripAdvisor user
440165212.reviewBody:
Created to save animals that were abused, neglected.  They also help animals get better. 
Its a sanctuary not a zoo.
Its beautiful to see so many animals in they habitat and healthy.
Crocs, turtles, monkeys, jaguars, flamingos... and more.
Have fun!  It will take you 2 hours to see everything and with your entry you are helping the animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

437200076.name: Great animal rescue centre
437200076.author: a TripAdvisor user
437200076.reviewBody: Gorgeous rescued Jaguars!! Birds, especially macaws and parrots, also toucans, flamingos. Crocodiles, boa constrictor...ocelots, fox, dwarf leopard, tapirs, manatees, tortugas, deer, iguanas and more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

435732969.name: Most beautiful zoo ever seen!
435732969.author: a TripAdvisor user
435732969.reviewBody:
This zoo is really easy to find (in the jungle) they have a big parking lot too (no payed parking). Entrance is 100 pesos. You can choose for 50 or 100 pesos more to feed a crocodile, touch parrots etc. 

The park has a lot of variation in animals. The tropical animals from the area of Mexico and down. You won't see safari animals like lions, elephants etc. 

The animals are in good condition, some you can see from close like the parrots! 

Conclusion: beautiful zoo in the jungle. And it's not crowded. Actually we were the only two that day! Don't miss it, 5 min. drive from the Palenque ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

427455818.name: Great place to see wild life in a well maintained park
427455818.author: a TripAdvisor user
427455818.reviewBody:
We really enjoyed our stay in the park. 
You can see plenty of regional wild life (Jaguars, turtles, crocodiles, birds-and also many mosquitos ;-) ) from very close without having the impression that the animals are treated badly (even though seeing animals in cages always feels a bit sad...).
If you are in palenque we absolutely recommend to go there (with some Mosquito repellent)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

425716756.name: Amazing Visit!
425716756.author: a TripAdvisor user
425716756.reviewBody: usually I try to stay away from zoo\'s but was recommended by another traveller. Upon entry we were immediately greeted and welcomed, we were given lots of information on all the animals and also bought the ticket to feed the manatees. This place will not disappoint, lots of helpful staff, and the pens for the animals were very large! The refuge helps take care of sick or injured animals and releases them back into the wild if they can manage to survive on their own. Feeding the manatees is a must, the guide that helped us shared lots of information and even gave us lots of extra fruit to feed them with. I will recommend however to wear fully enclosed shoes as the fire ants did get us a couple of times!\nThanks to all the workers and volunteers you are doing a great job!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

423841373.name: Awesome place to visit
423841373.author: a TripAdvisor user
423841373.reviewBody: This is a great place to visit after the pyramids. It\'s nice to see locals caring for animals that have a hard time surviving in the wild in Chiapas. The place was clean, the staff was very welcoming and amicable. We met Omar, one of the park\'s veterinarians, he talked with so much passion about what he does, about the rescue programs the park has, and how they reach out to the locals to educate them about caring for wildlife. This is a wonderful undertake, we read a lot about us Mexicans not caring for the environment or wildlife, definitely this project is step on the right direction to preserve animals who\'s population are being threatened in the wild. If you are in the Palenque region, you definitely have to stop by and visit Aluxes park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

421572036.name: Must visit
421572036.author: a TripAdvisor user
421572036.reviewBody: Great place to visit! Don\'t leave Palenque without passing by, it\'s a must! \n\nThe entrance cost is 100 pesos, the staff is very friendly and approachable. The animals are kept in very good conditions and the stories behind each animal are heartbreaking and inspiring.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

419298843.name: Well Done
419298843.author: a TripAdvisor user
419298843.reviewBody: People helping critters... rescuing and rehabilitating... living in beautiful natural environments with good trails throughout... options to help support the animals by buying and feeding them grub.  Great deal!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

414753863.name: Feed the manatees
414753863.author: a TripAdvisor user
414753863.reviewBody: I loved this place. It doesnt feel like a zoo at all (because its not really a zoo). the parrots are flying freely and the monkeys all live on their own island. we fed the manatees which was good fun but there are other options to interact with the animals if you want. i would really recommend it for any animal lovers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

407205931.name: Lovely place to wander, worth a visit
407205931.author: a TripAdvisor user
407205931.reviewBody: We spent a couple of hours wandering around and talking to the keepers, if you speak Spanish it\'s worth asking them questions to learn the history of some of the animals as a lot have been rescued by the parque....we also fed the manatees which was a really lovely experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

405436785.name: We fed Manatees!
405436785.author: a TripAdvisor user
405436785.reviewBody: This is an excellent way to spend 1.5 hours after visiting the ruins.  We fed the manatees and saw a whole array of great animals.  Really friendly people too and in a great cause as all the animals are rescued.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

404856474.name: Worth a visit!
404856474.author: a TripAdvisor user
404856474.reviewBody: It was very hot and humid when we visited,  but there were plenty of shady spots to sit.  Lovely, well planned park.  Our favorite zoo personality was a parrot that laughed and laughed and chattered like a woman.  They have a night tour that I wish we had time for, many animals were asleep in the heat of the day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

395814285.name: A suprising highlight of our trip
395814285.author: a TripAdvisor user
395814285.reviewBody: A really beautiful place with beautiful animals. Especially in a country where animal housing conditions often are not the best it was a nice suprise finding this place. Animals were treated well and most of the animal enclosures were nice and spacious (always hard to house big cats well). We fed the Manatee and it was really a once in a life time experience... I never thought I will ever get so close to these gentle animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

395620211.name: Don\'t miss feeding the manatees
395620211.author: a TripAdvisor user
395620211.reviewBody: This was a great experience for the whole family. We were 8 adults and 4 kids ranging from 1 through 10 years old. This park is very nice and clean - it is not a zoo!- and they are working towards a noble cause for the local animals. The staff was very nice and the facilities were clean and in good condition.  I would suggest to bring water since it is very hot and also keep in mind  they don\'t take credit cards. We fed the manatees and the tortoise - which costs extra-  but it was worth it. One of the manatees splashed us all!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

394033495.name: Very cool!
394033495.author: a TripAdvisor user
394033495.reviewBody: This was a surprise highlight of our trip to Palenque. It\'s an excellent little zoo that is set in thick jungle. They have a great collection of local animals which are rescued for conservation. The parrots talk to you and for an additional cost we fed the crocodiles and held a baby boa. The staff were very pleasant and we had a great experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

390853098.name: Zoo with animals from the region
390853098.author: a TripAdvisor user
390853098.reviewBody: The surroundings of the zoo is tropical forest so you really get a sense of how the animals are living. You can pay for doing  activities with some of the animals eg. feeding crocodiles, taking photos with macaws. In the park they are preparing captured animals to be set out in the wild again. It is worth a visit for its good collection of regional animals and for the fun with the partots.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

389459959.name: Fun way to spend an hour or two
389459959.author: a TripAdvisor user
389459959.reviewBody: This park claims to work to restore natural habitats and save endangered animals. They do have a lot of endangered animals, including jaguars and crocodiles. It\'s essentially a zoo, but it\'s a nice park and a great way to see animals you wouldn\'t want to meet in the wild. The price is good = $100 pesos and you can spend anywhere from one hour to three hours, depending on how much time you want to spend watching the animals. It would also be a great activity for families with young children.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

382746172.name: Ecotastic
382746172.author: a TripAdvisor user
382746172.reviewBody: We cannot rave enough about this wildlife sanctuary! The prices are extremely affordable. You pay separately to feed the animals, but it is minimal and the money goes back to the park. We fed the manatees, the crocodiles, the parrots and held a baby crocodile.  The kids (8 and 6)are still talking about it two weeks later. I can honestly say that this has been one of the most interactive and fun activities we\'ve ever done. We spent about 3 1/2 hours exploring the park, but you can move at your own pace.  DO NOT MISS THIS...especially if you have kids.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

379150508.name: A must see if you have time
379150508.author: a TripAdvisor user
379150508.reviewBody: Please support this wonderful ecoparque, the entrance fee was very cheap and there are wonderful animals, birds and reptiles to see.  It was really quiet when we visited and it was like we had the place to ourselves.  All of the animals were really well cared for and the staff were passionate about what they did.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

374319582.name: Excellent experience for a good cause
374319582.author: a TripAdvisor user
374319582.reviewBody: This is a great opportunity to experience wildlife from this area, learn about the rehabilitation of endangered species, and enjoy a beautiful nature hike.  The park combines reforestation to bring in bird life, and animal rescue and rehab.  It is not a zoo as most of the animals are only there temporarily.  We enjoyed watching the spider monkeys that were about to be released.  They seemed to be enjoying their habitat.  It was amazing to see jaguars upclose, but sad that their natural habitat is mostly destroyed.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

373380198.name: Surprisingly fun
373380198.author: a TripAdvisor user
373380198.reviewBody: We spent way more time here than we would have thought because we had so much fun.  Decent habitats for the animals except for the ocelots which I felt sad for. Really enjoyed watching the monkeys in the trees in the pre release area. Looks like are trying to reforest and restore areas on-site which is another plus. We paid extra to feed the manatees, which I highly recommend. All in all a great project and would highly recommend it. This is not a zoo, only injured or rescued animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

370502328.name: Very well kept.
370502328.author: a TripAdvisor user
370502328.reviewBody: This site was close to the hotels, and so we spent a couple hours here one afternoon. It was very inexpensive for the visit. You basically have a big loop where you can see a enclosures for all of the indigenous animals. It was sort of a zoo, but was more natural. I was actually surprised at the high quality of the facility considering it wasn\'t very busy. We did the manatee feeding, which was fun. These water elephants chunks of fruit right out of your hand.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

369584359.name: Very beautifull and well conserved
369584359.author: a TripAdvisor user
369584359.reviewBody: The ecopark was worth the visit. Nicely planned. The ride takes around 1.5 hours to walk around and see everything! The birds and the animals have a good treatment and you feel that you are in the jungle yourself! Kids loved it! The obly issue for us was the extreme heat we faced the day of the visit! My two years old cound withstand and we have to rush our way out beacause of it. Take cold water with you and be prepared!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

364231962.name: Great attraction
364231962.author: a TripAdvisor user
364231962.reviewBody:
We visited this after walking the ruins in the morning. 
There is an array of animals to see.
We paid 100 peso as entrance and then there is optional meet and great and photo options with different animals. 
We choose to have photos with the giant tortoise and to hand feed and hold a large Scarlett Macaw, they were just 50 peso each. The Macaws were just sitting at the canteen area eating and hanging around.
The had a range of animals and the staff explained they were not a zoo but rather a sanctuary for injury animals with the aim being for reintroduction back into their own habitat where possible.  
There are too many animals to list here. It takes around an hour or so, but it depends if you want to stop and spend time. 
Highlights for us was seeing the flamingos, toucans and the swimming big cat and the cheeky otters.  
It was a great attraction for adults and children alike.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

360967454.name: Visited it with the kids
360967454.author: a TripAdvisor user
360967454.reviewBody: Visited it with our kids and the experience was amazing, we thought it was a Zoo but the truth is they work really hard to preserve nature and local wildlife, also is amazing they are private held company... Anyway the place is wonderful, you walk through a path to discover several species of local wildlife... some are easy to see other a little more difficult, but you see a lot of animals, at the end they have a place where you can feed birds, rest and have some snacks and sodas... A place you must visit if you go to Palenque

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

359128524.name: Bigger than expected
359128524.author: a TripAdvisor user
359128524.reviewBody: This Zoo/ rescue park has much more than I expected . They have a mostly shaded trail that takes you around to lots of animal exhibits .

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

358752508.name: Beautiful Animals and Friendly Staff
358752508.author: a TripAdvisor user
358752508.reviewBody: We were able to feed manatees and talk to parrots that talked back. The park holds many wild animals and is located in the middle of a forest, which adds to a great experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

358617612.name: Unique experience
358617612.author: a TripAdvisor user
358617612.reviewBody: I love what they do!! Admirable people & great place to visit. I had the opportunity to do the nocturnal tour and it was awesome!! A MUST during your visit!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

355352954.name: Amazing Animal Sanctuary and We Fed Manatees!
355352954.author: a TripAdvisor user
355352954.reviewBody: By family of four had a fantastic time at Aluxes Ecoparque. It\'s located on the road to the ruins. Overall, we paid $320 MXN for entrance (100 per adult and 60 for each child), $400 MXN to feed the manatees (100 per person) and $100 for a picture with a large tortoise ($50 for each kid) and it was worth every peso! Feeding the manatees was for sure our highlight. The guide was patient and kind. He gave us 4 dishes of cut up veggies to feed them. He taught our 7-year old how to get a manatee to turn onto its back. We pet their heads and fins. They are huge, gently animals. There was even a baby manatee. \nThe other animals and exhibits were fun too. The whole family had a great time, way more fun than the ruins! If we were driving through Palenque, we\'d want to go again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

353656476.name: Chance to see Mexican wildlife up close in tranquil surroundings
353656476.author: a TripAdvisor user
353656476.reviewBody: My friend & I visited the Aluxes Ecopark on 18 Feb 2016 during our 2 week tour of Mexico coming from the UK.  I had heard about this place from the internet and another Mexican based friend also recommended it. We were not disappointed the park is a pleasure to walk round and the animals seemed very happy & content in naturalistic habitat enclosures. They are mainly animals confiscated as part of the illegal trade in wildlife so sadly cannot be released back into the wild. Some may also have been \u2018humanised\u2019 too much to be returned to the wild. So this place is NOT your traditional \u2018zoo\u2019 set-up.\nWhile visiting we saw lots of small monkeys of various species - crocodiles, deer, tapir, otters, terrapins/small turtles, flamingos. There were some captive macaws and smaller parrots too. The highlights for me were seeing up close the spotted and black jaguars and a couple of ocelots. The Ecopark is also home to a flock of approx 80 wild scarlet macaws. These are very endangered in Latin America and had been re-introduced in order to boost their numbers. The scarlet macaws are flying free but regard the Ecopark as their home territory so are easy to spot. They have some nest boxes and supplementary feeding to help them get re-established. It was magical to walk round the park hearing the macaws calling to each other as they flew overhead. If you like wildlife do take the time to visit this place if you are in Palenque. Its only 5 mins by taxi from the Cha Nabnal boutique hotel.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

353641654.name: Rainbows in Flight
353641654.author: a TripAdvisor user
353641654.reviewBody: A must see in Palenque, giving you a chance not only so see and hear the many animals that live in the jungles there, but to touch and feed some of them too.  I think i went there four times, seduced back by my desire to feed their four manatees - yet again!  Never could i tire of this experience.  They are such incredibly beings that I felt honored they would take food from my hand.  Be sure and ask (if you speak some Spanish) the man who provides the food to tell you about them, and be sure and give him a tip, too. I will never forget my time with them.  Besides manatees, I held a baby croc and baby boa, and even feed crocodiles.  Quite an adventure.  If you can try their night tour you won\'t regret it.  The price of the tour includes feeding the manatees and crocs as well as holding the baby croc so it is well worth the price - they need 4 people minimum, so unless you provide that many people they can\'t always do it - and it is in Spanish only.\n\nI hold all of Aluxes dear to my heart.  They are the reason you can see scarlet macaws flying overhead after 70 years of extinction.  And they are educating the people of the area, particularly the children to see the world through an ecological lens.  Thank you Aluxes for all you do, not only for Palenque, but for the world.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

352422520.name: Worthwhile excursion when visiting Palenque
352422520.author: a TripAdvisor user
352422520.reviewBody: Having seen the red macaws flying around our hotel and learning that it was a result of this parks raising an releasing over 90 of these magnificent birds, it was great to contribute by way of the admission price The visit itself is well worth it particularly when you can see the \'performance\' of the howler and spider monkeys, the magnificent cats, the spectacular macaws,and toucans all in a great setting. The manatees, crocs, snakes are also worthy of mention. The info boards about each animal are adequate and since some in our group had mobility issues yet were able to enjoy the walk speaks to the excellent layout. However they should speak more of the excellent work they do which if not for our tour guide I don\'t think would have been known. They are more than just an attraction/ ecozoo

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

351847179.name: Unexpectedly wonderful
351847179.author: a TripAdvisor user
351847179.reviewBody: Such an extraordinary animal reserve! It was very clean, with lovely stone walkway and beautiful landscaping and was much larger than I expected. Take at least 3 hours to stroll through. There is a large staff and they do a great job running the ecopark. They give you a map that shows trails and exhibits. There is a large variety of animals and they have natural habitats in which to roam. Very few are restricred, and I\'m sure it is for good reason. You can tell the staff loves and cares for their animals. Feeding the manatees was so much fun. They are gentle and patiently wait their turn. The night tour is by advance reservation, and has additional feeding opportunities.  It was only in Spanish and is more costly. Make your reservation during the day and return for the private tour. I will visit here again each time I am in Palenque!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

350069188.name: Superb
350069188.author: a TripAdvisor user
350069188.reviewBody: Gorgeous park extremely well laid out and great staff. My wife did the manatee feeding which was amazing for the extra 100. The enclosures for the ocelot and other cats will hopefully be enlarged in the future......at this time it will be up there with Zoomat.\n\nOtherwise we\'ll worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

348267642.name: Wonderful animal park that helps reintroducing animals and plants
348267642.author: a TripAdvisor user
348267642.reviewBody: We stopped to have a look what this was exactly when we were stunned by Red parrots flying over us. Completely excited we decided to visit the Park right away and it was absolutely worth it! You will see ants carrying leaves, crocodiles, taipirs, and many other animals. The Yucatan Jay around the Jaguar cages mimic their sound and hiss at you like a big cat, scary ;) The park is beautiful and well kept. You walk in a jungle setting where some of the animals even roam free. Your entree fee is a donation for the Park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

345652346.name: So happy we did not miss this animal sanctuary
345652346.author: a TripAdvisor user
345652346.reviewBody: Before we were even to the ticket office we saw red macaws flying overhead and heard their loud, comical screech. We knew would not be disappointed and we weren\'t.  There lots of macaws, parrots and other unusual feathered animals to observe in Aluxes and we also fed the red macaws before exiting the sanctuary.  We loved seeing the jaguar - the mighty cat of the Mexican jungle. These are gorgeous animals.  The water fowl were interesting and noisy. The crocodiles, snakes, and other reptiles were all fascinating to see and observe. The monkeys were very entertaining but constant overhead screeching of the macaws and the sight of them in flight was the best.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

345418621.name: Must see!!!
345418621.author: a TripAdvisor user
345418621.reviewBody: We went here on a rainy and misty day, and we were the only visitors in the whole park! The animals were out and about - we saw macaws & many other species of birds, crocodiles, snakes, jaguars, tapirs, and lots of other animals from the local region as well as endangered species from other areas. Feeding the mantis (for an extra 100 pesos) was the highlight of the visit - they came right up to me and ate the food right out of my hands! If you\'re coming to visit Palenque, take a few hours and visit Aluxes Ecoparque!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

344843112.name: Must do in Palenque!
344843112.author: a TripAdvisor user
344843112.reviewBody: An absolutely wonderful place to visit whilst in Palenque, with a huge variety of native flora and fauna! And such a great idea and message about rehabilitation and releasing the animals back to the wild! Suited to young and young at heart!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

343423261.name: Make time to visit
343423261.author: a TripAdvisor user
343423261.reviewBody: We were staying just across the road from this attraction, and at first were not sure it wasn\'t going to be just another over hyped animal park - how wrong can you be! They look after over 400 animals in this wonderfully laid out park in the jungle. Many of them are rescued or awaiting rehabilitation. The jewel in the crown is the reintroduction of the Macaws  - now these birds fly free overhead and are amazing site. What is equally impressive is the amount of wildlife that is attracted to the site because of the careful management of the ecosystem. They are non profit making, and worth supporting for the valuable part they play in ensuring not only the future of the animals they care for, but for the whole of the health of the land around Palenque and in turn, Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

341796352.name: Must do in Palenque!
341796352.author: a TripAdvisor user
341796352.reviewBody:
This was one of the highlights of our whole trip. We walked to the park from the ruins (it takes about an hour). Entry was just 100 pesos each and then we spent over two hours wandering around seeing all the animals.

This organisation is a not for profit and all the animals are rescue etc and it was good to read about the work they are doing to rehabilitate them. 

The absolute highlights for me were the Jaguars, ocelots and howler monkeys. You are also able to pay a small amount more to feed some of the animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

341197568.name: BEST part of our whole trip!
341197568.author: a TripAdvisor user
341197568.reviewBody:
We visited this place on a whim at the end of 10 days of travel in the area. Our children, ages 6 and 8, loved all the animals. We paid the 100 pesos each to get in, then addition 50 pesos for each of the girls to handle a macaw and a tortoise, and 100 pesos each for us to feed manatees. It was still a bargain. The animals are all rescues or have conditions that make them unable to live in the wild. Those that can be released are, so this is a "zoo" that I can really support with a clear conscience. 

We saw several different kinds of macaws, the girls held a scarlet one and fed it by hand. Jaguars, ocelots, crocodiles, a white tailed deer with a spider monkey buddy sitting on his back, wild monkeys and rescued ones, whistling ducks, dozens of turtles and tortises, two kinds of wild pigs, coatis, raccoons, and a variety of other animals. 

In addition to the captive macaws they have a breeding program for the scarlet macaws and release the young into the wild to help repopulate them. Wild ones flew over several times while we wandered the park, a beautiful sight. 

The highlight for us was feeding the manatees, although the water was muddy. They came right up and we were given large bowls of vegetables for them. We petted their noses and felt the rough whiskers, it was wonderful to be so close. 

There is an optional trail toward the back that leads to the bamboo forest and I highly advise you take it. It leads across the water over rocks that stick up (made me think of the movie Labyrinth and glad that it wasn't the bog of eternal stench.) There are no animals on that trail but the huge bamboo is impressive and crossing the water is fun. Our feet did get a little wet as the water was just over a few rocks.

There is a snack bar selling drinks and chips and a small gift shop if you want to shop. We spent at least 3 hours thoroughly exploring the place and will go again if we're in the area.   

To get there from town we took the Colectivo van going to the ruins, just tell them where you want off, it's 20 pesos per person. Walk up the drive to the park, then walk back out and catch one going back to town when you're done.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

340802726.name: Must to do while in Palenque
340802726.author: a TripAdvisor user
340802726.reviewBody: Brilliant Eco-system that the parque is developing. The team is very nice and devoted in sustaining it. \nThe parque gives also the chance to interact with animals like feeding the mamatis.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

340612241.name: A chance to see the local fauna and interact with it!
340612241.author: a TripAdvisor user
340612241.reviewBody: This is really worthwhile and kids especially will love the chance to interact with giant turtles, manatees, little boas and crocodiles, parrots etc...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

340441848.name: Wow!
340441848.author: a TripAdvisor user
340441848.reviewBody: The purpose of the ecopark is to perserve the fauna. Extremely nice staff, beautiful location and an amazing experience with nature.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

340109514.name: Aluxes Ecoparque should not be missed if you\'re in Palenque, Mexico
340109514.author: a TripAdvisor user
340109514.reviewBody:
Why anyone would come to Palenque and not go to this park, well, it's just not right.

 For the size of the park, they've done an excellent job of creating an atmosphere of animals in the wild that you probably won't see any place else in Mexico.

Macaws, crocodiles, spider monkeys, howlers, parrots, toucans and more. 

You'd have to be crazy not to spend 100 pesos for a walk through this delightful array of animals.

I could spend another 2 or 3 days here. Great for picture taking and just taking a break from the "sites".

A "Well done" to the organization that has worked on this park over the years.

I've been traveling Central America for over a year, and it's one of the best $6 U.S. that I've spent.

Keep up the great work!

Cheers

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

340046021.name: Wow - nocturnal tour a must
340046021.author: a TripAdvisor user
340046021.reviewBody:
Aluxes Ecoparque is an amazing experience. Definitely not a zoo (read management responses to previous reviews or go to website for background), the range of animals was incredible and so lovely to have the opportunity for an interactive experience.

The nocturnal tour was incredible (do first before visiting in day), sensory in all ways and our guide was fabulous as she obviously loves the animals and her knowledge was deep (plus great English).

Our children fed the manatees, we all fed crocodiles and held snakes, baby crocs and cuddled a tortoise.

Total highlight of Mexican trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

339689911.name: Spend a couple of hours here.
339689911.author: a TripAdvisor user
339689911.reviewBody: Well run, nicely set out animal sanctuary, on road to Palenque ruins. Lovely walk on stone paths through landscaped jungle taking you past animals. Saw flamingoes very close up, a pinto and a negro jaguar (not so close up thankfully), crocodiles, monkeys, tapirs, and beautiful birds. Couldn\'t resist paying 50 pesos extra to have my photo taken with a macaw. Great fun.  Most enclosures were great, especially the ones for the monkeys - lots of swings and trees to see them in full flight. Happy to support the work of the Eco park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

338522160.name: Perfect to visit after a morning at the ruins
338522160.author: a TripAdvisor user
338522160.reviewBody: Great selection of animals, nice natural environment. Does a good job of providing good habitats for majority of the animals in captivity.  It\'s not for profit and has a macaw breeding program.  Definitely worth a visit before or after the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

334320261.name: Good ecopark
334320261.author: a TripAdvisor user
334320261.reviewBody: Some of the facilities  were a little  small .  Animals  are all rescued and they have had success breeding and reintroducing  scarlet  macaws in area.enjoyed some if the small  exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

331853955.name: Wonderful ecopark/zoo, beware of bites!
331853955.author: a TripAdvisor user
331853955.reviewBody: This is a fantastic ecopark. It was larger than I expected, we stayed for a couple of hours. It cost 100 pesos each. You can pay extra for experiences, eg having your photo taken with a parrot, baby snake, baby crocodile or a big tortoise, each 50 pesos per person. We paid 100 pesos each to feed the manatees, which allows you to get extremely close to these unusual animals! I recommend it. We saw jaguars, parrots, flamingos, many crocodiles, monkeys, tapirs, snakes, raccoons, tortoises, turtles, a toucan, an ocelot, deers and many more! The enclosures are some of the best I\'ve seen anywhere, especially the monkey island. Having said that, I did think that the hawks\' cages were too small - not that they should really be in a cage anyway. The staff were really friendly and enthusiastic. My most important bit of advice is to wear insect repellent! We got a lot of bites. They sell it at the ticket office.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

329259924.name: Don\'t miss a trip to this wonderful ecoparque
329259924.author: a TripAdvisor user
329259924.reviewBody: Allow yourself several hours to wonder along the paths offering views of rescued animals, reptiles and birds. The scarlet Macaws are free and living happily in the trees on the reserve. Aluxes Ecoparque is a non profit organization to rehabilitate injured and maltreated animals back into the wilds. I wish we could have had another hour in the park. We were there for 2 hours and it was not enough time to thoroughly the sights on offer.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

327186753.name: Amazing place
327186753.author: a TripAdvisor user
327186753.reviewBody: Is a wonderful place to see Chiapa\'s wildlife, conserved as close as possible to their natural habitat. I loved this place :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

326066323.name: Amazing Place
326066323.author: a TripAdvisor user
326066323.reviewBody:
As an animal lover I asked my partner to bring me here. 

I was so impressed, all of the animals are rescued and then eventually released back in to the wild. The animals have so much space and freedom for the time they are there and you can see they are very well looked after. 

They only ask for $100 Mexican peso donation per person which I thought was very reasonable and you can have close contact animal experiences from as little as $50 Mexican Pesos. 

If you have time during your stay please visit this place and help a great cause. It's well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

325813073.name: Must visit when coming to Palenque
325813073.author: a TripAdvisor user
325813073.reviewBody: I was amazed and very happy to see many animals from Chiapas there. I was expecting to see the local "Jaguar" and some crocs and was lucky to see them very close. This was actually the best time I had the chance to see the animals the closest. A very cheap place and  you can also have the chance to have some pics with baby crocs, snakes and some other animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

325792100.name: Amazing place
325792100.author: a TripAdvisor user
325792100.reviewBody:
We can only recommend this place. It was a lovely break from the ruins and waterfalls. 
We had a really nice day among the animals and we feeded the crocodile and a kind of sea lion (man...) 
Very different from other zoo s 
The owner has done a fantastic job for the animals and the surroundings

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

323637402.name: Why not see the local wildlife
323637402.author: a TripAdvisor user
323637402.reviewBody:
For something different in Mexico - why not try the Ecoparque. Various things to be seen. My fav were the jaguars, the turtle, the flamingos and the colourful parrots. 
Entrance is 100peso and if you want to have photos with either the parrots or the turtle they are 50 peso each. 
Bring insect repellent, sunscreen, water and hat. 
A rather relaxing day

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

323440757.name: Delightful visit
323440757.author: a TripAdvisor user
323440757.reviewBody: My wife and I saw the Aluxes signs on our way to Palenque and decided to visit the place due the cute otters in the pictures. We were gladly surprised that there were plenty of other interesting and beautiful animals, like jaguars and ocelots.\nWe had a nice walk through the park and were amazed with the good care the personnel takes on the rescued animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

308607046.name: Well worth the visit
308607046.author: a TripAdvisor user
308607046.reviewBody: Our hotel was right next to the Ecopark and we had seen macaws flying over in the morning. In addition, we had read on TripAdvisor that the park was a nice place to go if you have a few hours spare time on your hands, so we decided to visit. This was a great decision. The free flying macaws are beautiful and we loved the bamboo forest. Also, the staff are really passionate, which is wonderful to see. We would certainly recommend everyone to visit the park and spend a few hours there!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

302339108.name: Great Place To Walk Around & View Animals, For The Most Part In The Wild!
302339108.author: a TripAdvisor user
302339108.reviewBody:
My wife and I stopped at Aluxes Ecoparque on our way back from San Cristobal while heading back to the east coast of the Yucatan.  We had previously been to Palenque and knew it was a short drive off the main highway to get to the location.  We arrived in the morning, and it was totally empty.  We spent a little over two hours walking through the park. When we left, it was much busier; we were glad we arrived when they first opened.  

Why we liked it:

Most of the animals are free to roam and not caged up.  A few were caged, mainly for safety reasons.  That said, most had spacious areas to roam.  For example, the monkey areas are islands surrounded by water.  So, the monkeys are not caged in at all, but free to swing on trees and rope structures. 

When you walk around, there is jungle all around you.  There are stone pathways that meander from one animal area to another with green plants and trees everywhere.  It was very peaceful.  There were many birds flying around us  as we walked the paths.  There were two Macaws that seemed to follow us around through the park, which was just an awesome experience.   

The staff was friendly and answered all of our questions.  I got a sense that staff at the park are dedicated to the animals they care for each day, and it's more than just a job. Many of the animals in the park are injured or come from illegal animal trade.  So, unlike your typical animal attractions, the park is a rehabilitation center as well.

The price of admission was reasonable, well worth it!

If you are in the area and want to see something besides the ruins, I would recommend a stop into the park for a few hours.   Make sure you bring a camera, we got some amazing photos with our zoom lens!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

301829073.name: Amazing park with a good variety to see
301829073.author: a TripAdvisor user
301829073.reviewBody:
We visited this park on our return to centro from Palenque ruins. You can easily fit both into a day if you have finished the ruins by mid-afternoon. We loved seeing the scarlet macaws flying around the area and perched in the trees. It's fantastic that they are trying to grow the population and reintroduce them to the area as they are beautiful birds. Our favourite was the aviary you can walk through, the cheeky blue/black bird was hilarious as it investigated us and tried to attack my shoes. Although if birds aren't your thing you might want to avoid it as we had multiple birds on us while inside the aviary.

The park has some shade but you still will want sunscreen, bug repellent and water. If you are visiting with children the prices are organised by height with 100 peso for adults with two kids prices below that.

Overall a lovely afternoon that we would recommend.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

300797139.name: Great complement to the ruins of Palenque.
300797139.author: a TripAdvisor user
300797139.reviewBody: This beautiful park is a great place to spend a morning, or better yet, the afternoon.  It is well taken designed and well taken care of. The animals are a pleasure to see.  You actually feel at times like if you are in the middle of the jungle.  The flock of guacamayas flying around made our daughter say she felt like if she were in the movie Rio!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

298091772.name: Exotic Park with animals
298091772.author: a TripAdvisor user
298091772.reviewBody: i went on a weekday afternoon and I was almost alone in the park which is very large. it is not a zoo but a park where you wander and discover animals.  Great experience of feeding the manatees, and fun to wander through the bamboo forest and watch the monkeys on monkey island. There is a tower to observe birds but it was closed when i went. I could see it was crowded with many parrots.  The vcages for the jaguars or Ocelys (beautiful) might be a bit small though. I really recommend this park. The staff is also very friendly.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

295121052.name: AMAZING!
295121052.author: a TripAdvisor user
295121052.reviewBody:
We had a day to fill in palenque and thought we won't  find anything good to do. We found this place with the help of TripAdvisor and at was a great success.

Although it may seem lika a zoo in the photos that won't be a good word to describe it. It feels like a small safari at some places and gives you the filling of walking in the jungle. Although most here paid attention to the animals i have to say that the plants there are amazing and helps a lotto the atmosphere.

There are a lot of peaks to our expirience there, but i think that the maon one is the birds cage. There are 3 sweet birds there that just love human attention and are so friendly - great entertainment.

A must if you have kids, and top priority if you have a few hours off in the city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

294742548.name: Excellent experience!
294742548.author: a TripAdvisor user
294742548.reviewBody: We don\'t normally enjoy seeing wildlife in captivity, but this was different. The animals were all very healthy looking and it appeared that they  had lots of space to roam. The park is well maintained and the staff were very helpful and friendly. After researching and reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we were most impressed with the owner\'s response to every review, good and bad. His caring about the sanctuary helped us to make the final desicion to visit. We weren\'t disappointed! We were also thrilled to see that there were NO VENDORS on the site!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

294105785.name: Great value for money, great work, very helpful staff
294105785.author: a TripAdvisor user
294105785.reviewBody:
Aluxes is more of a sanctuary than a zoo, with an emphasis on animal protection and reintroduction into the wild. It's an absolute must-see if you're in Palenque and is very, very reasonably priced with a 100-peso standard entry fee per person for the day tour (300 pesos for the night tour; 4 people minimum for an English-speaking guide for the night tour, starts at 7 PM). 

We took the day tour and added some extra attractions (holding a boa constrictor, baby crocodile, scarlet macaw, giant tortoise) for 50-100 pesos extra each. Other extras include manatees, feeding crocodiles and more. In total we paid 250 pesos each for 3 hours of viewing amazing animals! Go to Aluxes!

The staff were both extremely helpful, accommodating and very knowledgeable. A few we dealt with also spoke quite good English.

Take a hat, sunglasses, light clothing, sunscreen, camera and plenty of water to drink if you go at this time of year. Bug repellent might be useful, but was not necessary when we were there. It takes 2-3 hours to see the whole park, but the walking is not strenuous. Should even be possible to use a wheelchair for the most part. Good for kids too.

We really only have positive things to say about Aluxes. If I had to find one thing to improve on, it would be the size of some of the enclosures, especially for the big cats.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

293466917.name: Great Eco Park for lovers of the nature and animals. Awesome and gentle staff.
293466917.author: a TripAdvisor user
293466917.reviewBody: Aluxes is not just a zoo. It is a park protecting specimen of the wonderful Chiapas. The park is in the middle of the tropical forest of Chiapas, just before the entrance of the archeological site of Palenque. You feel more as doing a safari than just visiting a zoo. There are wonderful and amazing species there. Macaws flying and "singing" over the trees of the park. You feel as you are really walking within a forest as they are not in captive.There is a big pool for manatees, where they take care of injured animals found at its own habitat, which are treated and then sent back "home". Amazing experience is the possibility of feeding such wonderful creature at their mouth. Walking through the park you listen to the "Saraguatos" and the experience is incredible. It is hard to believe that the "noise" come from small monkeys. Looks like the sound comes from dozens of lions. It is wonderful to watch the rare black jaguar. The park really deserve a visit from everyone who loves animals and the nature. People certainly goes to Palenque to visit the ruines of the Mayan sites, but it really worths visiting Aluxes and have an experience meeting with the specimen of the incredible beautiful Chiapas. A strong recommendation is to interact with the staff of the park. They do love what they do and is always available to talk about the animals they take care with attention and love.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

291869361.name: Beautiful haven for rescued animals
291869361.author: a TripAdvisor user
291869361.reviewBody: I am wary about going to parks where animals are in captivity, but those fears are mercifully ungrounded at Aluxes. They are doing great work and care deeply for the animals here. I wasn\'t able to see the manatees, but that was actually good-not because  I don\'t like manatees, but because it means they live their lives here, they aren\'t here for our amusement. The big cats were the only place I got wary, but now understand that they are rescues...former pets that people couldn\'t care for and who therefor had no way of surviving in the wild. They seem healthy, fed and cared for, which in their case is as great a life as it gets. The staff I encountered were kind and informative, and of course I love the blue bird, who is already famous, it seems. ;) I was last there 1 year ago and can\'t wait to go back next month!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

289551853.name: Aluxes - very good way to spend few hours. Must see if you are in Palenque
289551853.author: a TripAdvisor user
289551853.reviewBody: We were there just before closing time, it was empty - no turists at all. Best experiences? Manatees and parrots - big, beautiful and sweet finger-eating Guacamaya Verde (green ara)  :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

281707819.name: Beautiful ecopark
281707819.author: a TripAdvisor user
281707819.reviewBody: We had a fantastic time wondering around the park, feeding manatees and watching macaws fly above us.\nA really beautiful animal sanctuary.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

275550557.name: Something between the zoo and the park
275550557.author: a TripAdvisor user
275550557.reviewBody: It start with beutiful parrots, but then you can many more: crocodiles, monkeys, flamingos, some huge water lion or something, The entrance is 100 peso each. All in all good, if you dont mind seeing some animals in cages.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

270756451.name: Extraordinary
270756451.author: a TripAdvisor user
270756451.reviewBody: Though I experienced this park first in a jungle downpour I was mesmerized by its beauty and the care that was given to the animals, the beautiful spaces they could call home.  I am indeed grateful to the owners for their creation of this establishment and to their dedication to educate the children to live in harmony with their animal neighbors.  The jaguar pinto has my heart.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

268162577.name: One of the best experiences when traveling to the southeast of Mexico
268162577.author: a TripAdvisor user
268162577.reviewBody: I found this highly recommended attraction in tripadvisor, and I must say it definitely overachieved my expectations. I took all my family (we are 6 members) to a very delightful trip to the Southeast of Mexico (we come from the center of the country) and we totally loved it. You may feel during 2-3 hours as being at the jungle itself when seeing all this amazing and well maintained wildlife. The beautiful jaguars, the cute ocelote, the parrots and a little friendly blue bird were the best part of the tour. Don\'t miss the opportunity to feed the parrots and carry a baby crocodile :). And the best part: You are not visiting a zoo. You are supporting to preserve the Lacandon jungle wildlife. My only complain: We were calling one day before to book the night tour (the 6 family members), but unfortunately we couldn\u00b4t reach you! :-(. Hopefully for the next time we can properly book it !

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

267388494.name: This is a natural reserve...
267388494.author: a TripAdvisor user
267388494.reviewBody: I highly recomend to visit the park is amazing! (2-3 hours) all the animals are very well take care and the price is fair (about $10 usd)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

266155178.name: The Ninos loved it
266155178.author: a TripAdvisor user
266155178.reviewBody: The Ecoparque at Palenque is a great opportunity to see Mexican native animals up close and in a close to natural setting. Our children, aged 7 and 9, loved it, especially the monkeys, flamingos and jaguars.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

261774193.name: Excellent opportunity to see wildlife up close
261774193.author: a TripAdvisor user
261774193.reviewBody: We stumbled on Aluxes EcoPark by accident as it was near our hotel.  It is a large facility with a wonderful collection of indigenous wildlife, including free-flying scarlet macaws that they are helping reintroduce to Palenque. They also have animals that they have rescued.  Staff is friendly, and there is a wide assortment of animals, from jaguars to monkeys to manatees to crocodiles to birds.  A great way to spend a morning or afternoon!  Highly recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

260774289.name: Excellent zoo, free-flying macaws
260774289.author: a TripAdvisor user
260774289.reviewBody: Animals nicely housed, well-cared for, easy to see. Mostly local animals. Notable conservation efforts. Macaws screeching overhead. Monkeys very entertaining. Interesting jungle paths. Spend a couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

259621521.name: Best Zoo experience ever!
259621521.author: a TripAdvisor user
259621521.reviewBody: This zoo/park was a refuge to rehabilitate jungle animals. We have never seen such an amazing set up for animals to be in their natural habitat under such good care. Beautiful paths for visitors to observe the jungle and its animals/birds at it s best!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

257745516.name: Amazing surprise!....
257745516.author: a TripAdvisor user
257745516.reviewBody: Great Eco Park, with rescued and preserved animals mainly from local fauna.\nWorth well the visit!...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

253691296.name: What a pleasant surprise, well work a visit.
253691296.author: a TripAdvisor user
253691296.reviewBody: About 1km towards Pelenque From our accommodations was the Aluxes Ecoparque. People at breakfast recommended it. It is a rescue, recovery, and conservation centre for animals. We walked over and for 100 pesos were very impressed with the design and variety of animals. It feels like a walk in the jungle. There are stopping points with good views of the animals, kept in good natural conditions, and good signage to inform about the animals. We got some fabulous, up-close photos.\n\n Does miss it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

252437738.name: A real bonus discovery
252437738.author: a TripAdvisor user
252437738.reviewBody:
Like many others, I suspect, we were here for the Mayan ruins at Palenque but we had a couple of hours in hand, so our guide recommended us to visit this place.

It was brilliant - well up to the best standards, with large enclosures, good information boards, an interesting range of species, and a first-class reintroduction programme for Scarlet Macaws. Like others, we were virtually the only people there, and we were surprised that there was not more publicity about it.

An excellent place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

248688028.name: Great find in Palenque
248688028.author: a TripAdvisor user
248688028.reviewBody: Staying an extra day because I could not get on a bus turned out for the best as I came here. The collectivo is 20 pesos and the driver if you tell him will take you right up to reception (think they get commission but thats between the park and the drivers) I took the long walk, it\'s the same price and the staff that were around in the park were friendly and pointed out the animals if you couldn\'t see them. Only thing I found sad was the pacing big cats, I\'d have loved more information on why there were rescued and brought here and what will happen to them. But amazing to see. Was empty when I went, you can easily do the ruins and the park in a day if short on time and agree with the other reviews that the park isn\'t heavily advertised apart from the boards on the way to the ruins. I felt like I had the park to myself as it wasn\'t busy but it needs visitors to fund the up keep - if they had more visitors then am sure the signs might be updated and fund the animals up keep and staff. Defo worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

248162760.name: A great way to spend a couple of hours
248162760.author: a TripAdvisor user
248162760.reviewBody: The Aluxes Ecopark is about 2km from the ruins and 300 m off the major road back to Palenque. It therefore makes a great stop on the way back into town. The zoo offers two routes: long and short. It takes about 90 minutes to do the long walk. Among the highlights are the animals that had been saved from eco-disasters and unscrupulous traders as well as the crocodile preservation and breeding lagoon. Definitely worth a visit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

248142961.name: Hidden gem in palenque!
248142961.author: a TripAdvisor user
248142961.reviewBody: This place is not overly advertised in palenque, we went here after seeing it on trip advisor and we are so glad we stopped in. The staff were great we held baby crocodiles and snakes and the staff let is watch the snakes being fed. Definitely recommend this place as a must see attraction of palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

246764929.name: excellent
246764929.author: a TripAdvisor user
246764929.reviewBody: We spent more than four hours in this park, enjoying every bit of it and walking the longer trail twice. In the cafeteria area I was given a baby crocodile to hold and caress. The flora of the place is as enchanting as fauna. The Yucatan Jay performed wonderful tricks with a coin. The manatee doesn\'t show itself much (due to murky water in which it resides). Even the two kinds of rather smelly wild pigs are interesting to see, and of course, the monkeys delivered a great performance. There is a souvenir store at the entrance with very poorly marked prices. I was interested in some large size brochures and thought they were free (the lady in charge seem to have agreed) but suddenly there appeared a 9 year old demanding 15 pesos for each brochure. I still don\'t know what the story was but I left the brochures behind.\nThe walking trail can be tricky - please watch your step, as stepping down from it can result in an unpleasant fall...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

246600816.name: Great animals, not-so-great staff
246600816.author: a TripAdvisor user
246600816.reviewBody: We came to this park specifically to see the famous friendly blue bird, and she was awesome! She sat on our shoulders, looked into our ears, accepted (and promptly stored away) a couple 5-peso coins, and even pecked at the white hairs on my head. The rest of the park was very nice too. We especially liked the sections of the pathway that go through the forested areas (we saw a gray fox run by us, and several iguanas). Two manatees played in their little pond, screeching macaws flew overhead, and the newly-rescued baby howler monkeys were very endearing. The only not-so-good part was the staff at the front desk. They were so unlike most folks we have met in Mexico in that they were just cold and unhelpful. it took several tries to cajole them into calling us a taxi to get back to town, since Aluxes is well out of town and set back from the main road by a VERY long driveway. When the taxi finally arrived he charged us 80 pesos for the drive back to our hotel, while on our way to the park from the very same hotel we had only been charged 40 pesos, which made us wonder if the park had some deal with the taxi-drivers to overcharge departing visitors? While 40 pesos may not be a huge deal to some, it might be to others, which is why we are sharing this information. Also, the cafeteria was the only place we\'ve encountered in Mexico where they did not have straws for the bottled/canned beverages, even street vendors  in Mexico provide straws for sanitary reasons.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

246562940.name: ALUXES MAGIC!!
246562940.author: a TripAdvisor user
246562940.reviewBody: Amongst the plethora of traditionally standard zoo\'s, there is a gem to be found, unbeknownst to the majority of the public it is a true shame that Aluxes Exoparque does not get the attention it deserves. \nThis rescue centre is not only responsible for re-introducing a previously extinct, but they also made me feel at home and provided a great atmosphere. \nThe animals on display are very interesting and are clearly taken care of with a high level of professionalism

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

246559772.name: Absolutely Incredible
246559772.author: a TripAdvisor user
246559772.reviewBody: This absolute gem of a place was one of the highlights of our trip to Palenque. We visited the ruins, Misol-ha and the waterfalls of Aguazul, however Aluxes was definitely a highlight. I love all animals, however the macaws are my favourite, and seeing them flying free was definitely a life highlight. We loved it so much that we did the night tour. The guide was interesting, and passionate about the animals and the project in general. Highly recommend to anyone in the area. And if you have a chance feed the manatees, or the crocodiles, it looked amazing, but unfortunately did not have the time to do it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

233804376.name: Well worth a visit, make a day of it.
233804376.author: a TripAdvisor user
233804376.reviewBody: The wide variety of animals at the park all appear to be well looked after and have large enclosures.  The Macaws are free and have NOT had their wings clipped, the park has a release programme.  It is non-profit making park and needs the support of tourists to keep going with its conservation efforts and animal adoption/rescue, they are expanding and when we visited they were nursing an injured manatee that had been rescued.  You can buy seed to feed the birds and you can pay to feed the manatee and the crocodiles.  It is a very nice, well maintained park and a really enjoyable way to spend an afternoon or even a whole day.  My husband and I stayed for about 4 hours and had to leave as it was closing.  There is plenty to see and do, we could have stayed longer.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

230698639.name: A very interesting place
230698639.author: a TripAdvisor user
230698639.reviewBody: Aluxes is a mix between a zoo and a nature park, there are animals both in exhibits and roaming free (howler monkeys, agoutis, foxes and large lizards, to name a few), as well as some very interesting birds flying around. Exhibit animals mostly represent local fauna, so it\'s all very organic. The main attraction nowadays are free-ranging scarlet macaws reared and released by a reintroduction project operating in the park. From what I understood, the project enjoys full support of park\'s administration and brings in increased attendance in return. I thought this was a great idea, and those large colorful noisy birds really add an unforgettable touch to the whole experience. The park is mostly visitor-friendly, with cobblestone pathways, signage, maps and friendly staff, and can be enjoyed by families with small children as well as nature enthusiasts and birders. On the downside, the paths become extremely slippery when wet (which is 90% of the time in this climate), so wear sturdy shoes and watch your step. English translations of the signs are a bit awkward. And if you decide to visit the aviary, beware of an overly friendly Yucatan jay which will land on you and try to pick on everything you wear or carry. This may be fun to some people (like me) but very frightening to others, and scared visitors might actually harm the bird, trying to free themselves. There were no warning signs posted on the aviary entrance, so consider this your warning.\nOverall the park was a great experience. I visited it 3 times on my recent visit and would definitely like to return some day. Hopefully, by then they will have new, less slippery pathways.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

223203677.name: Hidden gem
223203677.author: a TripAdvisor user
223203677.reviewBody: This attraction does not seem to be as heavily frequented as the ruins but it\'s every bit as interesting. It is a conservation site NOT a zoo , and I was really impressed with the habitats for the animals and the layout and pathways to walk around the park . We had 8 in our group and it was like a private tour of the zoo. One of the staff played with the Manitee to get it to come out if the water for us .
