There seems to be a lot more renovation and expansion going on to house more species. It\'s a little pricey to enter at 100 pesos each but I really loved it \ud83d\ude0a. Oh and beware the blue bird that attacks your shoes and the fire ants (don\'t let them bit you !!!)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

204467823.name: One of our biggest highlights on a 3-week trip to Mexico!
204467823.author: a TripAdvisor user
204467823.reviewBody:
We visited this ecopark after having visited the ruins of Palenque. it was a quiet and magical afternoon.

This place is simply wonderful, not your ordinary zoo near home.
This ecopark gathers animals native to the area, in almost their natural environment. 

We saw flamingos from a distance of about two meters, we saw splendid toucan birds, monkeys, other parrots and exotic animals. All situated in a beautifully maintained eco-park with trails, water ponds, signs of explanation, vegetation, and of course the natural surrounding jungles of Palenque area.

Jozefa was there to welcome us at the entrance and provided us lots of information. You could see the sparkle in her eyes. for Jozefa this park is not about money-producing business, it is about love and passion for animals.

Now, we are great fans of archeology. True - the main reason most people come to Palenque is the ruins. For us, this ecopark was not as less as a highlight than the ruins were! Exaggeration or not - this special park with its very special and colorful animals - is a welcome attraction that will diversify your whole stay in Palenque after (or before) visiting the splendid Mayan ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

193659585.name: Nice Eco-park, Like a Small Zoo
193659585.author: a TripAdvisor user
193659585.reviewBody: Nice eco-park to take a pleasant walk and enjoy some of the flora and fauna of the jungles in Chiapas and other parts of Southern Mexico. The animals are fenced off but some birds were free. I guess some visitors left a door open and they escaped from an area where one is supposed to shut the door pretty quickly. Somehow, a beautiful blue bird was attracted to my shoes and couldn\u2019t get it off! Pay attention to the warning signs regarding snakes. Thankfully, I didn\u2019t encounter any. Bring water and snacks to keep you hydrated and replenish your energy during the course of the stroll. There is also a snack store at the end (close to the entrance/exit) but it has limited assortments of snacks so you\u2019d be better off bringing your own and enjoy it at one of the tables under the shade.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

192496413.name: Aluxes Ecopark, beautiful, educational spot
192496413.author: a TripAdvisor user
192496413.reviewBody: We went to the park, not expecting much. What we saw and learned was so interesting. The park is dedicated to preserving the wildlife of Chiapas. All the animals and birds are from this part of Mexico. There are two routes to take you through the park. We took the shorter route which was about three quarters of a kilometer. Each animal is in a natural setting, as much as possible. Macaws fly above you in the trees.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

190524260.name: nice pleasant walk - like a zoo
190524260.author: a TripAdvisor user
190524260.reviewBody: Very nice pleasant walk. Most of the animals are in fenced off areas or pens, but a few of the birds are flying free which is cool. Didn\'t see many other people there so it was nice to have the place to ourselves.\n\nYou get a high quality map at the entrance which is a little out of date.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

190314588.name: great work
190314588.author: a TripAdvisor user
190314588.reviewBody: Aluxes Eco-parque, not far from the ruins, and just across the street from Hotel Piedra de Aguas, is not to be missed by anybody interested in natural life, animals, ecology, science, or anybody with kids.  An independent, local initiative started two years ago, their aim is to preserve, protect and regenerate the natural habitat, flora and fauna of Chiapas, which includes a great number of endangered (some critically endangered) species of both animal and plant life.  The park is big, well organized, clean, full of extraordinary sights to see: mono saraguato (monkeys), black jaguars, spotted jaguars, tigrillo, ocelote, tapir, loros (parrots & parakeets), Guacamaya verde & roja, lots of tortuga of different sorts, and too many!!! crocodiles.  So many birds! They are breeding animals, protecting animals which are critically endangered, and re-introducing some species back into their natural habitats when and where possible.  This is a really worthwhile project -- anybody who goes to Palenque should visit, you\'ll find something to fascinate you.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

182169090.name: A paradise for animal lovers!!
182169090.author: a TripAdvisor user
182169090.reviewBody:
My boyfriend and I went today and we had a blast, even though we had already seen almost all of these animals in the wild before!

This is a rescue center and the animals live freely, you see the majestic red macaws fly over the trees, the spider monkeys jumping on their island, the cute manatees eating, some crazy birds climb on the top of your head...
There are jaguars, ocelots, ant-eaters, agoutis, other beautiful night mammals, tons of crocodiles, and even a tapir!
You can easily spend 2 hours walking around and watching the animals.

You can see that the animals are well taken care of, which was ver important to us.

We highly recommend this place!
They also organize a night tour, which we haven't tried.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

176388007.name: A Zoo with a Ecological Twist
176388007.author: a TripAdvisor user
176388007.reviewBody: While the rainforest on either side of the paths in this Aluxes zoo may not look very imposing, the history of the place shows the great ecological passion of the owners.  The area, a pasture 20 years ago, is now a thriving junior-jungle, with a wide variety of endemic trees and plants as well as the local animals.  The swampy pasture was transformed into a series of islands, separated by streams, with many of the different species easily visible from the walkways without the need for cages.  Jaguar cubs tussling over a bone under their mother\'s indulgent gaze, alligators waddling rapidly towards a flapping umbrella held down towards them,  and spider monkeys leaping through the branches to keep an eye on a jaguar-print raincoat were some of the highlights of this visit.  We wanted to take the nocturnal tour but we found out at the end of our visit that we should have signed up for that earlier since it is only given when 10 visitors ask for it.  The educational signs referring to the trees were a bit confusing.  On the other hand, the howler monkey island is so comfortable that a troop of wild monkeys has taken up residence there!  The owners receive donations of older animals that have been kept in captivity all their lives, gently reinserting them into jungle life.  This was a fun place to visit and a laudable ecological project.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

169812047.name: Nice animals, but pretty run of the mill
169812047.author: a TripAdvisor user
169812047.reviewBody: We are from the Caribbean, so we are familiar with a lot of the tropical animals at Aluxes. For one of the most pricey attractions in Palenque, I was not overly impressed. We were particularly looking forward to the manatees... however they were nowhere in sight. This was very disappointing. This park can be visited in 1-2hrs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

168319940.name: Amongst the animals
168319940.author: a TripAdvisor user
168319940.reviewBody: We were so amazed at this park - the variety of animals. But the best thing we did - was feed the manatees! So lucky it was the right day to do this, other days you can feed the crocodiles. The staff were so helpful and encouraging, one of the manatees was rolling around to get fed upside down, they have very interesting mouths! So gentle and timid. This was the best experience ever, I don\'t know if you could do this in any other part of the world!\nWe caught the collectivo by the Mayan statue for 20 pesos each - they pass by every 10 mins. Then a short walk into the park 100pesos entry fee. They feed different animals on different days so you might get lucky like us and feed the manatees - it cost 100pesos extra.\nLots of different types of habitats and they are still improving and adding more. One area of 50 crocodiles!, a bird aviary you walk through, flamingos etc. We were in the park for 3 hours - its quite shady, take insect repellant and water.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

160781072.name: Nice animals in naturelike area
160781072.author: a TripAdvisor user
160781072.reviewBody:
Aluxes is nice.
2 hours walk through beautiful paths. 
Nice birds. Some monkeys. A lot of crocos. 
Flora is amazing.

Not a Must do, but a nice do.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

153481004.name: Gets better and better
153481004.author: a TripAdvisor user
153481004.reviewBody: This is only 1-2 years old and they make it better and better. I was last there about a year ago and never-the-less impressed then and still now. They display indiginous animals but more importantly care for them and are doing breeding and release programs (macaws, howler monkeys, spider monkeys, and more). Worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

150927659.name: amazing!!!!!!!
150927659.author: a TripAdvisor user
150927659.reviewBody: i visited the park twice, once during the day and once for the night tour. we had a most amazing time. the guides on the night tour were experienced and made it interesting and fun. we saw so very many different things during the day and at night that it was almost like we were visiting a different place. \nit so near the archeological site that it is almost a sin not to visit it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

133885192.name: One of the best places to visit in Palenque!
133885192.author: a TripAdvisor user
133885192.reviewBody: This park is so little advertised, but WELL worth the visit.  We were greeted by a bird walking toward us which proceeded to sit on my husband\'s finger and visit with us :-)  Another favorite were the howler monkeys, which followed us imitating waving motions as we left their area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Palenque-Ruinas Km 2.6

670191331.name: I expected a little bit more...
670191331.author: a TripAdvisor user
670191331.reviewBody: This museum is not at the site of the pyramids. But still on walking distance. it is part of the archeological complex and included in de entrance fee. But, don\'t feel sorry if you missed it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

647802199.name: A small but beautiful museum, well displayed artifacts with good lighting
647802199.author: a TripAdvisor user
647802199.reviewBody: The replica of Pical\'s tomb was very interesting and offered a clear perspective of how significant he was at the time....many other wonderful artifacts

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

634225102.name: Leave time to visit the museum
634225102.author: a TripAdvisor user
634225102.reviewBody: This is one of the best on-site museums I have visited.  It is not that large and the signage is excellent. Be sure to to thru the door to see Pakal\'s tomb.  If the door is not open, you might miss it,so be sure to look for it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

629003710.name: Good museum and good English information
629003710.author: a TripAdvisor user
629003710.reviewBody: If you go to Palenque make time for the museum. The tomb from the Temple of Inscriptions alone is worth seeing.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

622004386.name: Great museum, it\'s a must-see destination !
622004386.author: a TripAdvisor user
622004386.reviewBody: If you are at Palenque ruinas, don\'t miss the Museo ! We enjoyed it so much ! So many artefacts to look at, it\'s amazing !

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

601146097.name: Don\'t miss this beaty
601146097.author: a TripAdvisor user
601146097.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s small, but it is worth the visit. The museum is right next to the archeological site so there is no reason not to visit. Beside, you\'ll be able to be in air conditioning! But really, it\'s a small museum but some of the pieces found there are really worth seeing. Recommend to do on your visit to Palenque and the archeological site.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

597183640.name: Don\u2019t forget this place
597183640.author: a TripAdvisor user
597183640.reviewBody:
When visiting the Palenque Ruins you should definitely not skip this little museum. 

Don’t expect much from the staff but there are good and easy to understand signs with all of the displayed objects.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

587286431.name: Tiny but interesting museum
587286431.author: a TripAdvisor user
587286431.reviewBody: Yes if you have time do visit. They have a replica of Pakal\'s tomb witc is very interesting to see. Many original pieces found in the archeological site that are really beautiful and interesting.\nThe visit will take you around one or two hours depending on your interest in the details.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

577206694.name: Reasonable size museum, good exhibits
577206694.author: a TripAdvisor user
577206694.reviewBody:
Called in after I explored the Palenque ruins and was surprised firstly by the size of the place an found the exits good.

Definitely worth going to see if you're going to the ruins.

Collectivos from town (20 Pesos) will drop you off there or pick you up there. I'd recommend the later as you can walk around the site and exit via Gate 2 to get to the museum then catch a collectivo back to town. If you going by car or tour it doesn't matter which way you do it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

558314936.name: Amazing
558314936.author: a TripAdvisor user
558314936.reviewBody: If you are in Palenque, don\'t miss this museum. If you know nothing about the ancient Maya, you will learn a lot and be impressed by their culture. If you are a Maya scholar, you will be awed by the artifacts displayed there.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

556142492.name: Shows exhibits from Palenque ruins
556142492.author: a TripAdvisor user
556142492.reviewBody: Many of the more important treasures, including much of the jewellery, resides in the Archaeological Museum in Mexico City so some of the items shown here are just copies.  I also understand some items are also in the British Museum in London.  However, some of the items are quite brightly coloured which does enhance your view of them and it must have been quite spectacular back then.  Despite looking like a new building, there appears to be multiple leaks in the roof so you wonder when the problem will get fixed - lack of money probably will delay any remedial work.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

554095742.name: Fabulous artifacts and model of Pacal\'s tomb
554095742.author: a TripAdvisor user
554095742.reviewBody: There is some superb art here including incense censer stands, very ornate, stelae with interesting glyphs and a full sized model of Pacal\'s famous tomb with helpful explanations in English as well as Spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

545537123.name: Come here before the ruins - WOW!
545537123.author: a TripAdvisor user
545537123.reviewBody: This museum has a great collection of stellae, glyphs, and sensors.  It also gives information on the history of Palenque and its rulers. The model of the Palace is really helpful because you can\'t picture the layout when you are in the Palace.  The best part is the tomb of Pacal the Great.  His sarcophagus is there and the decorations on the side of the tomb are shown and explained.  It\'s very well done - don\'t miss it!!!  We went before we went to the ruins, and I\'m really glad we did.  Even though I had done a lot of research before we came, this museum enriched my experience at Palenque.  The museum is free.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

543844084.name: Museum closed for renovation?
543844084.author: a TripAdvisor user
543844084.reviewBody: After spending a wonderful Monday afternoon in the relatively uncrowded ruins, I went back today (Tuesday) to take another look and visit the museum, which is normally closed on Monday. I was disappointed to find that it looks like the museum is now closed for renovation. Workmen were working away, cement bags inside the lobby,  and there were signs on the door in Spanish that I couldn\u2019t read, so I don\u2019t know how long the closure will be. The lady in the gift shop confirmed the closure.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

543215496.name: Do not miss this place
543215496.author: a TripAdvisor user
543215496.reviewBody: Admission is included - spend 30 minutes here to see the huge sarcophagus and the intricate Mayan scripts.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

537757470.name: Impressive Museum!
537757470.author: a TripAdvisor user
537757470.reviewBody: After exploring the Palenque ruins for hours, you may be tempted to pass by the museum!  Don\'t!  It is an equally impressive museum, filled with artifacts and historical facts.  Most enjoyable and interesting!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

533594276.name: Don\'t miss this on your visit to Palenque!
533594276.author: a TripAdvisor user
533594276.reviewBody: The museum has wonderful artifacts that are incredibly preserved, in addition to a replica of the impressive tomb of Pakal. Price is INCLUDED with admission to the archaeological site, so hold your ticket!\n\nMAKE SURE to wear mosquito repellent when outside at Palenque.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

500114139.name: You must stop here on your way out of Palenque
500114139.author: a TripAdvisor user
500114139.reviewBody: You must stop here. You wont find an authentic Mayan art collection like it anywhere else. The Red Queen mask is amazing. But the real attraction is the exact replica of Pakal\'s Tomb. This one is much better than the one at the National Archaeological Museum in Mexico City. You can walk around Pakal stone\'s  which is housed in a glass chamber and there are explanation of the meaning of the different glyphs  through out (see photo). Since you cannot access the real one anymore which is inside the Temple of the Inscriptions (see photo) this is the best option to get close to such an amazing historical site.  (note: back in the 90\'s, when I first visit Palenque, Pakal\'s tomb was still open to the public and I had a chance to see the real stone, it was such an experience: dark, hot, humid and not apt for claustrophobics, so this replica is as good as it gets, and besides very welled air conditioned!) .

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

499790764.name: Essential for the Palenque visitor.
499790764.author: a TripAdvisor user
499790764.reviewBody: Here you\'ll find a truly breath-taking collection of ancient Mayan art and artifacts. This is a perfect companion to the archeological zone, as it provides a faded glimpse of how Lakamha (Palenque) must have appeared in it\'s heyday. The museum is spacious and airy, making the visitor feel more like a guest than an intruder. The jewel in this crown is certainly the atmosphere-controlled vault that houses the remains of Pakal\'s sarcophagus. There\'s plenty of information inside (in both \nSpanish and English) to explain the iconography and symbolism of this magnificent piece. The original cover-stone has been taken to Mexico City, but the reproduction is absolutely faithful it. Highly recommended for Mayanologists.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

492577932.name: New insights into Mayan culture
492577932.author: a TripAdvisor user
492577932.reviewBody: We visited the museum the day after visiting the Palenque ruins, and it helped to consolidate the experiences of the previous day. Free with your paid entry into the National Park, there is also a gift shop and boutique within the complex.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

484521645.name: A Small Gem of a Museum just at the entrance to the park
484521645.author: a TripAdvisor user
484521645.reviewBody: We visited the small museum on our way out from the ruins of Palenque and down the mountain. After spending the day at the ruins I was exhausted and I would have enjoyed this museum either the day before or after visiting the ruins. Air conditioned, about 6 or 7 different rooms with nice introductions to go with the artifacts. One can definitely spend an hour or 2 there taking in all various artifacts and information. Having experienced this once now, I would recommend going to the museum the afternoon before going the following morning. Visiting the museum will give you some background information that might come in handy for when you visit the ruins. Take some change, two or three hundred pesos, to buy from the local Maya women a couple of tamales, fruit, water, and, or souvenirs. Support the local Mayan community.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

474780241.name: Great place but museum staff lack commitment
474780241.author: a TripAdvisor user
474780241.reviewBody:
The museum has a fine collection of artifacts in six rooms.  However, when I asked the staff for more information about the place,  they  answered they  didn´t  have  any  and went on eating. I recommend visiting the museum before going to the site as it  will help you get a better idea of  the whole place.  At the museum shop you can buy local crafts, books and coffee from Chiapas.
 

Horario

Martes a domingo de 09:00 a 17:00 horas.

 

Costo de acceso
 
Entrada general: 70 pesos. Incluye entrada a la Zona Arqueológica.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

468591483.name: Best artefacts from excavations in Palenque are on display here
468591483.author: a TripAdvisor user
468591483.reviewBody: Archeological museum of Palenque is situated near the exit from archeological park, by lower parking and near the large souvenir shop. It is a large, new and modern airconditioned building, halls are not many and modern designed, with tasteful expositions of artefacts. The expositions mostly come from area of Palenque, it is nice pieces skilfully illuminated and placed in museum rooms. The masterpiece of museum is the giant sarcophagus of king Pakal, which stands in the own exhibition hall covered by glass, it is possible to walk around this massive stone piece and read / look at inscriptions and bas-reliefs on its sides and cover-stone. \nPlan to have about one hour for visiting this museum, including 10-15 minutes film show in one of the rooms telling and explaining about the sarcophagus and story of  its discovering in modern times.\nThere is a souvenir /tourist shop nearby the museum, as well as toilets and a large parking. if you continue further up the road passing by, in some km. You will reach a higher placed parking and main entrance to the pyramid-area, with ticket office, food selling stands and a lots of souvenirs.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

459180044.name: Some delicious pieces here folks
459180044.author: a TripAdvisor user
459180044.reviewBody: This stitches together much of what we had seen,found this place more interesting than Chichen Itza for a number of reasons and this I would say is No1.In particular is the giant coffin with its spectacular carvings,just how did they do that?.  Just wander about, and enjoy this place,many of us will never venture here again or see such wonders.....very pleased we came.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

458349138.name: Intersting
458349138.author: a TripAdvisor user
458349138.reviewBody: Plenty to see and easy to navigate alone for english speakers. This museum goes hand in hand with the ruins at Palenque.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

456562009.name: Palenque archaeological site is spectacular
456562009.author: a TripAdvisor user
456562009.reviewBody: Chichen Itz\u00e0 is more famous but Palenque is more interesting to visit. The buildings have not been over restored and it is possible to climb on many of the buildings and enter into some of the chambers. Many fascinating artefacts and decorations have been moved from the site to the Museum where they are very well exhibited and explained. The entry to the National Park, archaeological site and Museum cost a total of 100 pesos per person, only 4 usd.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

455047672.name: fantastic museum
455047672.author: a TripAdvisor user
455047672.reviewBody: one should actually go to the museum first then go to the ruins.  see the video and masks and know more of the history. not too large and well dispayed masks and steles

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

452662720.name: Small but nice
452662720.author: a TripAdvisor user
452662720.reviewBody: Probably not as big and as spectacular as the Anthropology museum in Mexico, the Palenque museum offers a good addition to that one as well as to the visit to the ruins. I recomend to have a look inside after the wandering throug the city above. It will give a glimpse to the Mayan culture of the classical period.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

443333005.name: To understand
443333005.author: a TripAdvisor user
443333005.reviewBody: You will understand better the site and Maya culture if you see this museum first but usually people stopp at the gate to the site , visit first the ruins and than go to the museum more than one kilometer down hill after the ruins

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

440967295.name: Free to view with a ruins ticket
440967295.author: a TripAdvisor user
440967295.reviewBody: Please if you are at all interested in the Mayan history Pakal and all the other blood thirsty kings you really cannot say you have visited the Palenque ruins without seeing the museum. For a start it has a life size copy of the famous lid of Pakals Tomb which is underneath the Temple of Inscriptions and too large to get out.\nIts all in English and Spanish and well laid out. Get to it by walking down a wide path over a waterfall. It will take you about 30 mins to get there from the main entrance via some interesting moss covered ruins or get a lift down via a collectivo from the main entrance. There is no food or drink on site.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Sitio de Palenque "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier"

address.streetAddress: Km 6.5 de la carretera ramal Palenque-Zona Arqueologica CP 29960, Palenque, Chiapas

647803032.name: Beautiful spot with bathroom area to change
647803032.author: a TripAdvisor user
647803032.reviewBody: Refreshing from the heat but was difficult to swim around the shoreline due to rocks and various plants.  Also was running big and difficult to swim against the current.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

557661265.name: Great little private spot on quiet days - just you and the monkeys
557661265.author: a TripAdvisor user
557661265.reviewBody: Lovely spot and can often be very quiet. We came here twice with different experiences. The first time it rained in the morning so people stayed away but we came in the afternoon and it was lovely. Alas the insect repellant was essential. The water wasn\'t very clear because of the rain and there was a fair bit of monkey poo on the water but still - it was nice.\nIt\'s a bit of a trek to get in there but worth it. Bring plenty of drinks and snacks, maybe an innertube or lilo to float on and hat, sunblock and a big smile for the locals.\nWheelchair\'s not suitable. Kids will love it.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

508159141.name: Another nice swimming spot
508159141.author: a TripAdvisor user
508159141.reviewBody: There was no one else when we visited after the torrential downpour in Palenque.  The road is good all the way to the falls but unfortunately it\'s used for local racing instead of responsible driving.  Visit if you have time to kill in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

494065373.name: So worth a visit
494065373.author: a TripAdvisor user
494065373.reviewBody: We pretty much had the whole place to ourselves as it is rainy season. This means that the water isn\'t as clear or clean and there is quite a lot of mud. However, we had a great time swimming and jumping around the waterfalls! \nMust check out as very close to palenque.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

490835388.name: Nice spot for a swim
490835388.author: a TripAdvisor user
490835388.reviewBody: Had this place to ourselves one afternoon.  Great clear stream with  a few small waterfalls flowing into it.  Good chance you will encounter the local troop of howler monkeys.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

467881396.name: A place we didn\u00b4t want to leave soon
467881396.author: a TripAdvisor user
467881396.reviewBody: Picturesque Waterfalls some 45 min drive to the south from Palenque lie in the beautiful surroundings very near Guatemala border.  From the entrance (some entrance fee) you follow the path some 200 meters until you reach a series of steps leading some 10-15 meters down to the water. Here is possible to get into water without any difficulty and bath in an natural pool where waters from 3 different waterfalls converge. Waters of the waterfall to the right are very warm, and here is possible to sit on the stones right under the natural shower, you can hold a rope for safety. There is much more water force in the rainy season, and less water in the dry season, so water streams can be differently strong. \nWith underwater camera we have seen lots of fresh-water fishes in different sizes and colours. It was a place we did not want to leave soon.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

463162643.name: Secluded quiet spot to visit.
463162643.author: a TripAdvisor user
463162643.reviewBody: This was very easy to find and close to the main road.  Sweet family runs the entrance and small restaurant.  Very clean facilities.  Well maintained path to walk on to falls.  Lots of areas to picnic.  Falls and area were very pretty, but not spectacular.  Worth a stop if your driving by or need a cool drink on a hot day.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

459855566.name: Beautiful cascades and relaxing atmosphere
459855566.author: a TripAdvisor user
459855566.reviewBody: We arrived one hour before closing time and asked them to camp. The people were very friendly and despite they have rooms for rent they let us camp wherever we wanted, so we stayed near the water for $150 Pesos per tent. We swam early in the morning with no people around. The four cascades are great and you can see them all in the middle of the natural swimming pool. We found a monkey relaxing in the trees. This is a great place to visit or stay overnight, to see nature, and chat with locals.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

451907111.name: More to it than first meets the eye
451907111.author: a TripAdvisor user
451907111.reviewBody: This site is very well organised with lovely places to swim and do zip-lines. The main waterfall is beautiful with picnic areas to enjoy the view and a snack. Toilets are clean and there are eating places at the site, so you don\'t really have to take your own.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

405065559.name: Cool Place
405065559.author: a TripAdvisor user
405065559.reviewBody: Welib-Ha is literally a cool place. A must go if you have kids that are good swimmers. This place is like a large natural swimming pool in the middle of the Jungle. It is not as crowded as Misol-Haor Agua Azul and the locals have put a number of ropes in the water to play around. When we where there local kids played around in climbing the falls and diving from the clips.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

403579793.name: Great swimSpot
403579793.author: a TripAdvisor user
403579793.reviewBody: From\nPalenque town centre I took a collectivo for 20 pesos. It was squeezed full of friendly locals and off I went. You get dropped off a 700m walk from the falls. The path is very evident and the walk is great. 25pesos entrance and there you have one incredible swimming area. There were local families having picnics and the vibe was very chilled. The water was clean and refreshing . Just wait where you were dropped off but on the other side of the road and a collectivo will come and take you back. Super easy. Super fun. Great afternoon cool down after the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

377529666.name: Cool Place for a Hot Day
377529666.author: a TripAdvisor user
377529666.reviewBody: You don\'t expect it, but the water is warm, so don\'t be afraid to take a swim. Two long ropes span the river, so you can hold on to them. The current is quite strong just by the waterfalls. Great place to visit for a few hours, perhaps after spending half a day in by Palenque ruins. A sign directs you to the smaller road that leads here from the main road.\nThere are benches where you can sit and eat, if you bring food with you. There is also a small cafe by the parking and WC.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

323037051.name: Pack a lunch and get off the beaten path
323037051.author: a TripAdvisor user
323037051.reviewBody: This is a beautiful waterfall with out all the tourist.  While not as tall as the other waterfalls - this one has nice picnic areas, hiking trails and really cool limestone pools and cliffs. To get here you pass through small towns and get to see rural Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

286186861.name: Like you own private waterfalls! :)
286186861.author: a TripAdvisor user
286186861.reviewBody: If you are looking for an amazing waterfall experience (sight-seeing, great photos, swimming, picnic, romantic or family adventure) but think Misol Ha and Agua Azul are too crowded, this is the place you\'re looking for. It\'s only 30 min away from Palenque, on the road to the Lacandon Jungle, it\'s quiet, it\'s clean, there are no vendors and their restaurant is simple but enough good. There are several swimming sections for all levels, and the main waterfall is absolutely breathtaking. If the level of the river is not so high, you can swim right below and have an amazing experience. Super recommended.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

281359728.name: Delighting!
281359728.author: a TripAdvisor user
281359728.reviewBody: We visit Welib ja Waterfall on our way to Cascadas Roberto Barrios, \nnice place to visit with kids, although we didn\'t swim.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

266813201.name: wonderful swimming!
266813201.author: a TripAdvisor user
266813201.reviewBody: A real authentic local swimming and picnic park. When we visited, there were many locals enjoying an evening picnic and social time, but we were the only ones swimming (late afternoon).  The waterfalls can\'t be described, but they are so pretty they don\'t look real.  Turquiose water, fish everywhere, howler monkeys in the trees, it was so cool.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

228735893.name: beautiful waterfalls
228735893.author: a TripAdvisor user
228735893.reviewBody: Off the beaten track but a real gem of a place. Easy walk through the jungle along the river. there are toilets on site. Swimming is a little more dangerous as there is a current but you couldn\'t be washed away and there is a rope to hang onto.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

180237228.name: Fabulous!!!
180237228.author: a TripAdvisor user
180237228.reviewBody: This is an absolutely beautiful park. Waterfalls and more waterfalls set in the most beautiful jungle. The flora in this park was incredible, the plant life here in the wild looked so perfect that it almost looked as if it had been arranged for a movie set.  There were beautiful areas for picnicking along the pathways. Marvelous areas for swimming there were even facilities for zip lining into the pools at the base of the waterfalls. The pathways and stairways were easy to navigate although some were steep. My photos cannot do justice to the incredible natural beauty of this place.

address.streetAddress: Welib Ja Waterfalls

561037104.name: Better sites elsewhere in Chiapas
561037104.author: a TripAdvisor user
561037104.reviewBody: Viewed this site as an alternative to Aqua Azul falls, it is not as well visited as Azul and it is for a good reason: it is not as good. It is interesting, but if you have limited time there are better places to see in Chiapas. You had to pay the local villagers to use the road to the site. The water is not clear, but greenish,  at least in February. There is a high pedestrian footbridge across the river that offers nice views and a little bit of a thrill. Locals use it for washing clothing, swimming etc. There were beggars present, be prepared to say "no" or make a donation. If you enjoy nature you will like this place but there are better places to enjoy the outdoors in Chiapas than this one.

address.streetAddress: 55 Km

457605068.name: DISSAPOINTED
457605068.author: a TripAdvisor user
457605068.reviewBody:
We decided to skip Agua Azul, as this is swarming with tourists for Agua Clara. Little did we know, this was a bad decision. 

We followed the signs, paid the entrance fee and drove up to the river to find it less than Clara. This was a complete desilussion. No turquois waters, no beautiful settings. The place felt eerie. Maybe the time we visited was not good.
The people at the "gate" where we paid the entrance fee should have told us that there was really nothing to see. But instead they took our money and sent us on our way. 

This was a waste of time and money.

address.streetAddress: 55 Km

452663537.name: Deep connection with nature
452663537.author: a TripAdvisor user
452663537.reviewBody: Before going here check the awailability with the locals. If allowed, this place offers a true deep experience of nature-lovers. Same river as at the cascades of Agua Azul, here is goes with its full strenght, providing good places for kayaking, swimming, jumping and enjoying the small cocodrillos of the sides - thus friendly but shy )))

address.streetAddress: 55 Km

408097069.name: Beautiful, blue and magical.
408097069.author: a TripAdvisor user
408097069.reviewBody: After visiting the touristy Agua Azul, Agua Clara is a paradise.  It is a local place.  Maybe on the weekend some families come here to relax, picnic and swim.  Otherwise there are no tourists. The water is so blue.  You can swim there or observe the local people crossing the river to their village or you pay for the ride for 5 pesos to cross the river.  You need your own transport to get there.

address.streetAddress: 55 Km

453287796.name: Hidden treasure
453287796.author: a TripAdvisor user
453287796.reviewBody: Not many people know that below the infamous but crowdy Agua Azul cascades lies much more spectacular part of the same river and waterfals. You will need to walk down the river for abou an hour. A local guide is recomended - the path is evident but you pass trough local ejidos that may ask you for permission. And then you arrive to the astonishing huge waterfalls that finally drop into another river... and very probably you\'ll be alone there! There are places to swim, but precautions are recomended. An experience for true adventure-seekers, indeed.

450717143.name: Hidden Jewel in Palenque, Stunning!
450717143.author: a TripAdvisor user
450717143.reviewBody:
It is a total adventure just to find Asunsion, the waterfalls are amazing and it is so hard to get here that you may have the waterfalls all just for you, it took us so much time to get the little tiny "ejido" called Asunsion that we couldn't do the 45 mins walking to the big waterfalls, but we did the 10 mins walk to the small waterfall. We met a very kind guy called Melquiziades who guided us to the small waterfall and he offers to guide us to the big waterfalls when we come back with more time.

Now, here is the important part. How to get Asunsion:

1. - From Palenque take the road to Bonampak ruins.

2.- Around one hour on that way, on your right you may see an entry that advertise some cabanas called Bajum Pakal, that place is currently closed, but it is a good referenfe. You also can try to find the little town called Nueva Betania.

3.- Once you find this is dirt road, when you start the road you may see a very little pyramid with the flat top on your right.

4.- After around 20 minutes you will find Nueva Betania which is a very little town, you may cross the town through the main road and continue in the same road.

5.- Passing Nueva Betania, like 10 or 15 minutes after you will find a fork, take left.

6.- Drive 15 minutes more on the dirt road, you will have a couple of hills, you will find some some little houses and a basketball court on your left. Park the car in the best spot you find around and ask for somebody who can take you to the waterfall or try to take the little path at the north of the basketball court. Our guide name was Melquiziades you also can ask for him.

659705259.name: Plain church
659705259.author: a TripAdvisor user
659705259.reviewBody: A good sign of the relatively un-importance of the church in this region. It would appear from the architectural quality that traditional values probably prevailed in these parts for long after the collapse of Palenque and long after 1531.

address.streetAddress: Primera Avenida Nte. Ote. s/n

594786912.name: Main church in downtown Palenque
594786912.author: a TripAdvisor user
594786912.reviewBody: This church is located near the plaza in downtown Palenque. Climb some steep steps and you\'ll be walking along the main pathway that leads into the main entrance. You will see local vendor along the pathway. The inside of the church is definitely different from typical Mexican Catholic churches as Mayan beliefs clash here with religion and definitely makes it interesting to see this intersection.

address.streetAddress: Primera Avenida Nte. Ote. s/n

492582711.name: Uplifting service in rustic church
492582711.author: a TripAdvisor user
492582711.reviewBody: Located in the center of downtown Palenque, surrounded by small hotels and popular restaurants, Iglesia Santo Domingo is an old church in need of care and maintenance. That said, it is an open air church serving a working class community, with limited funds to support such things. We observed patrons of the church coming and going with their prayers at all hours of the day. The Sunday morning church service was supported by a talented solo singer on an amplified, acoustic guitar. He complemented the service magnificently. The hymns were well chosen, and at times it sounded like there was a full choir supporting him. But it was the rest of the congregation, who know the hymns well, joining the chorus in full voice.

address.streetAddress: Primera Avenida Nte. Ote. s/n

492584202.name: Does not exist.
492584202.author: a TripAdvisor user
492584202.reviewBody: We carefully explored every place it could be, and asked very hotel and tourist official. The closest thing, the Plaza de Artesenal on the main road, is a souvenir stop for tourist buses.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo

460341560.name: Trying to find textile museum
460341560.author: a TripAdvisor user
460341560.reviewBody: After asking about a dozen people and looking for 1/2 hour in the general area where this museum was supposed to be located and being sent here and there by people trying to be helpful, but who obviously did not know, a restraurant owner told us that the museum had closed a year ago.  We found that frequently neither hotel front desk workers, city workers (police) nor local people close to an area seemed to know about the location of places listed on maps or in tourist guides!   (espeically small museums).

address.streetAddress: Zocalo

344040204.name: could not find this
344040204.author: a TripAdvisor user
344040204.reviewBody: We got caught in horrendous traffic inside Palenque and so we didn\'t see or couldn\'t find this textile museum, and our hotel owner thinks it is not there any longer. I\'m not sure.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo

647801609.name: My 3rd visit to these ruins and still my favorite of all Mayan ruins.
647801609.author: a TripAdvisor user
647801609.reviewBody: DO NOT MISS this ruin.  Its beautiful in a natural jungle setting and the restoration is great.  So many different buildings and styles.  Pical\'s tomb and temple of insriptions is simply magical.  Walking from the ruins, following the beautiful waterways and falls to the museum is a wonderful walk

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

646180465.name: Great pictures and a lot of history!!
646180465.author: a TripAdvisor user
646180465.reviewBody: The last of the three archeological sites we visited....and it managed to amaze us!! The views are fantastic and nature are breathtaking!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

642636144.name: Unique Archaeological Site but LONG DRIVE -- Would Have Planned My Trip Differently
642636144.author: a TripAdvisor user
642636144.reviewBody:
We spent 5 days in Chiapas, staying in San Cristobal de las Casas which meant that we drove 5-6 hours each way to see Palenque. We had a good guide who drove us from San Cristobal and gave us great information about the ruins, the Mayan culture, and  Chiapas. We also stopped at the Agua Azul waterfalls which were beautiful. But it was a very long drive for a visit of about 2 hours. Half of our group said they would not do that again. 

The drive takes a long time because you are on small roads that go through many villages. Every village has lots of speed bumps (topes) that slow you down to almost stopping. For anyone with a bad back or who gets motion sick, this would be very difficult. There are literally hundreds of speed bumps between San Cristobal and Palenque. We figured our average speed was about 18MPH. 

After Chiapas, we went to the east coast to Mahahual in Quintana Roo. We drove back to San Cristobal, got a plane two days later from Tuxtla Gutierrez to Cancun and then drove 4 hours from Cancun to Mahahual. Turns out Mahahual is about 7 hours from Palenque. So if I had to do it again, I would spend the night in Palenque, then drive east the next day instead of going back to San Cristobal and flying. Maybe stop some place along the way to break up the 7 hour drive.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

633766802.name: Unique
633766802.author: a TripAdvisor user
633766802.reviewBody:
I like this place the most comparing to other Mayan ruins in the country.
There is big area, so it didn’t feel crouded.
You can come to this place from Palenque by collectivo.
You must also visit museum!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

629002943.name: Amazing Ruins and Amazing Jungle Tour with Gabriel
629002943.author: a TripAdvisor user
629002943.reviewBody:
We'd heard of Gabriels jungle tours from travellers in San Cristobal and I managed to find his tel no from internet and what's app him. Gabriel is Maya, soaks excellent English and is very knowledgeable - he took us off the beaten track and barefoot. It was amazing. To what app him from a UK mobile 005219161183828, for other mobiles use the last 10 digits with whatever codes you need.

The ruins in the main part of the zone are jaw dropping. It is an amazing extensive site. The museum is a must do too.

The only irritating thing about Palenque is the people selling those annoying jaguar noise whistles and sounding then off.

Leave yourself a whole day for Palenque, it's a big site with lots to see. We started main site at 1.30 and left at 4.00 to get to museum. We should have given ourselves more time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

598698383.name: Nice ruins - information could be more interesting
598698383.author: a TripAdvisor user
598698383.reviewBody: We visited the old Maya temples in the early morning, which is really recommendable because it won\'t be too crowded. The temples are nice but it would be cool to have explanations featuring things you want to know instead of just some info about ruler x and ruler y and when they lived. The info displayed was somehow too complex and boring.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

589844189.name: Hidden Mayan ruins
589844189.author: a TripAdvisor user
589844189.reviewBody: Get a guide or you will miss the hidden Mayan ruins. Howler monkeys make you feel like you are in a horror film scene!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

585865117.name: Fabulous ruins and history, in an amazing jungle! Local knowlege is gold here.
585865117.author: a TripAdvisor user
585865117.reviewBody:
Like other historical sites, the more you learn about it, the the more you can see and appreciate. I recommend the guided tours from the booth on your LEFT (!)  Both booths are to the right of the main entrance -- be sure to choose the one closer to it. If you speak Spanish, ask for Delfino ("dolphin") who was just excellent -- if not they have English-speaking guides too. Delfino is a local Maya from over the hill who has studied the ruins and their history in great detail but also knows the jungle plants, trees, birds and animals. We hiked to some of the more remote ruins, and on the way I tried two fruit I had never even heard of before -- one was quite good, the other so-so... 

The ruins and glyphs are astounding. This is where the "Maya code" was first broken and after that glyphs throughout Mesoamerica began to be deciphered in earnest, finally  allowing the written history of the Maya civilization and culture to be better understood. This has an interesting history of its own. 

Palenque has a fascinating political, military and social history and includes unique-to-the-Maya architectural innovations that make many of the rooms notably more pleasant, light and open than at any of the other sites I have visited. Like Europe's flying buttresses, the insights that originated there enabled previously-unobtainable architectural effects. 

While their bringing pressurized running water to the second floor of the palace for use in the two flush toilets gets some attention, there are many other less obvious but perhaps more significant examples of Palenque residents engineering the ample flow of water through the site to their needs. 

Bring solid shoes, camera, binoculars, water, bug stuff and sunscreen and take a long tour through the jungle with a guide who knows his stuff. It's not cheap, but you won't regret it for a second...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

584446168.name: Lost temples in the jungle still to be unearthed!
584446168.author: a TripAdvisor user
584446168.reviewBody: Virtually a whole ancient city in Palenque was swallowed up by the jungle some time after the Maya left the area (circa AD 800). Our guide led us along a path called Sendero Moti\u00e9pa deep into a high evergreen forest, pointing out different aspects of the ecology & biodiversity. The National Park has 996 tropical species of flora and fauna\u2026we saw millennium-old trees, red cedar, mahogany, kapok and sapodilla, camedor palms including the threatened fishtail palm xate. The slopping trail was muddy & wet with streams containing prehistoric fossilised shells. We spotted the Mexican Red-Crowned Parrot but apparently there are 352 other species of birds resident as well. The jungle  is also home to howler monkeys (making their presence audibly felt), ocelots & pit vipers! After hiking for 30 minutes we reached our objective, a hill with skeletal ruins of a Maya temple peeking out of the jungle. Recently unearthed by Palenque archaeologists, the guide told us tests indicated there were undoubtedly many more temples buried under the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

576146410.name: Beautiful
576146410.author: a TripAdvisor user
576146410.reviewBody: Pay about 35$ for a wristband that allows you entry for 5 days. The only extra to pay is entry to the main ruins, 70$.\nMake sure you do the jungle trek to view the smaller ruins, amazing.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

573190958.name: One of the best arqueological sites
573190958.author: a TripAdvisor user
573190958.reviewBody: Luckily we made it to the entrance a bit after 8am what was very worth it. We were very surprised that only a few people were around. We could make great shots with almost no people. First we walked one quick round for the pictures and then a second one for a more intense visit ;-) What we really liked here is the possibilty to climb almost all ruins. Furthermore, the jungle scenery with the roaring howler monkeys in the morning light are a unique experience. The museum is also a highlight. It shows nice pieces and explanations. This was one of the best arqueological sites we found in entire Latin America so far. Enjoy and explore this remote and interesting area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

572299452.name: Interesting.
572299452.author: a TripAdvisor user
572299452.reviewBody:
The Mayan history is amazing.
And this site is one of the most important of the Mayan world.
This is definitely a must. 

Just to mention... Even though there are very important places to see (as Pakal’s tomb), there are few buildings.
Only 2% of Palenque buildings are uncovered. The rest is still under the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

568706029.name: One of the top Mayan sites in Mexico
568706029.author: a TripAdvisor user
568706029.reviewBody: So many unique things to discover: e.g. the stone reliefs including the prisoners in the palace court yard, the hieroglyph staircase and the iconic observation tower. I found that around noon it was actually too hot to enjoy the site so we took a break in the shadow on top of the Temple of the foliated Cross which offers an amazing view. As does the Temple of the Cross next to it. Make sure not to miss the Palenque Site Museum "Alberto Ruz Lhuillier" on the road leading towards Palenque and a 3 min drive away from the site. They exhibit a replica of Pakal\'s tumb which is really well done and explained.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

566367888.name: Amazing - Should Not Be Missed
566367888.author: a TripAdvisor user
566367888.reviewBody: Palenque is the premier Mayan site in Mexico. Many well restored structures over a large area without the huge crowds of Chitzen Itza. There\u2019s a jungle trail that loops around, but if you miss the return part of the loop it will take you to the main road, which for us was a good thing since there was a vendor there selling ice-cold bottled water to those who stumble out of the jungle onto the road. After buying our water we returned back up the trail a short distance to catch the return portion we previously bypassed. Allow 2 to 4 hours and be sure to take plenty of water since the humidity can be very draining. Palenque is quite a bit farther south than most Mayan sites in Mexico, but it\u2019s worth the drive for this once in a lifetime experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

557660949.name: Great place to visit but ohhh the humidity
557660949.author: a TripAdvisor user
557660949.reviewBody:
This is one of those places that you say.... another temple but like most of them in central America they are worth it and each one brings its own little something to be remembered from another.
I highly recommend you bring alot of water as I tipped at least 500ml on myself and scarf to cool myself down. Plus the prices by local vendors are expensive.
Good walking shoes, sunhat, sunblock and YES insect repellant please.
Takee your time as there is alot to see and well worth it.
Wheelchair and kid friendly.
Good toilets.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

556769113.name: Fantastic ruins
556769113.author: a TripAdvisor user
556769113.reviewBody: Excellent ruins. Huge ancient buildings. Tons of tourists over the December Holiday period, and lots of locals selling goods. Plenty of trees to provide shade. I recommend doing one of the jungle hikes/treks that are offered here, as well. Saw howler monkeys and the guides do a good job teaching you things about the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

554095559.name: One of the very best Maya sites
554095559.author: a TripAdvisor user
554095559.reviewBody:
This very famous Maya site is really one of the best.  The buildings are in excellent condition.  Although it is (unfortunately) no longer possible to climb Temple of the Inscriptions, let alone go in Pacal's famous tomb, one can still climb all 5 temples of the Cross group.   The qualitiy of the art and carvings is superb.  Traces of original paint still there in some places.   The grounds are also really lovely with a stream and pretty green lawns which set off the grey stonework.  Beautiful tall trees.  As another reviewer pointed out, there are also a number of buildings in the forest that the major crowds seem to avoid.
The site can be crowded later in the day so go as early as possible.  
In addition to the buildings, we saw some interesting birds.
There is a nice walk down along the stream with a waterfall.
Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

550099363.name: very interesting historical,site
550099363.author: a TripAdvisor user
550099363.reviewBody: This is a must see historical site, situated in the jungle just off Palenque.\nTry to be early and invest in a guide. Taxi-drivers often know someone who is worth your while. Ours did. This way you\u2018ll get to know things, that you will otherwise miss.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

549103233.name: Look for the hidden trails
549103233.author: a TripAdvisor user
549103233.reviewBody: Not many visitors know that just behind the infamous temples uncovered and restores in the central part of Palenque lies the whole anciend city covered by tropical forrest. If you go there, prefferably with the local guide who knows selva, you may find not only hidden ancient buildings, but the whole range of tropical wildlive - animals, birds, plants and trees, chrystal clear springs etc. Just leave begind the noisy crownd and enter the Forrest..

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

545067538.name: Small but famous
545067538.author: a TripAdvisor user
545067538.reviewBody: I came there at the opening just before the groups and other tourists. Sun is rising on the mane pyramide, it(s quiet , you can hear the birds. When you climb up on the top of the Royal palace ruins you can see the venders comming slowely with teir bags full of artefacts. the site is not spred out so easy to be seen in one day ( few hours - two are minimum). From the top of more remote construction you can see the jungle surrounding the ruins. If you stay longer the sun will move around the ruins showing different perspectives

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

539865887.name: Beautiful Jungle Walk!
539865887.author: a TripAdvisor user
539865887.reviewBody: Hired a guide to take us on a jungle walk, where we saw lots of howler monkeys that we\'re howling so much it sounded like we were in Jurassic Park. Cool experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

534961665.name: Amazing and howling monkeys everywhere!
534961665.author: a TripAdvisor user
534961665.reviewBody: We visited mainly to go to the Palenque ruins however there is a \u201cforgotten ruin\u201d off the beaten track. On the way back from the ruins we walked down the hill until we came to a corner with a sign post with a howling monkey on it. Walk through the jungle and you will come across the forgotten ruins with a little help from google maps. It\u2019s very impressive with many different birds spotted along the way and also many howling monkey calls. \n\nIt\u2019s a beautiful national park! Be sure to check out more than just the ruins!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

531537298.name: Come prepared it is very hot (and humid)
531537298.author: a TripAdvisor user
531537298.reviewBody: This amazing Mayan ruin sits right in the jungle. The 70 peso entry fee gives you access to the site which is quite extensive. You are able to walk on and through many of the ruins. The view from the top of some is quite spectacular. There are two entrances, unless you are super keen to see unrestored ruins (and walk up the hill) drive up as far as you can and go in the top entrance which is closest to the ruins. As always there are stalls everywhere selling food, drinks and souvenirs. The weather was very hot (34 degrees) and humid (over 80%) the day we visited so we could only stay for just over an hour. You could stay as long as your interest allowed on a cooler day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

528173741.name: Fascinating
528173741.author: a TripAdvisor user
528173741.reviewBody: We could have spent days exploring this extraordinary Mayan City State in its magnificent jungle setting: The Temple of the Inscriptions, the tomb and story of the Red Queen, the palace and it\'s sauna, the temple complex .... \n\nDon\'t miss the small museum containing many treasures from the site, and the walk down to it, passing waterfalls and many more Mayan ruins emerging from the forest.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

524986862.name: Go with enough time.
524986862.author: a TripAdvisor user
524986862.reviewBody: We were in a time crunch and didn\'t get to see everything.must do!! We hired a bootleg tour guide for 200 pesos. We had a baby on a stroller, the park provided some ramps, the tour guide also helped when needed. Beautiful place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

515611282.name: Full immersion with Nature!
515611282.author: a TripAdvisor user
515611282.reviewBody: I suggest to have this walk the same day you visit the archeological zone of Palenque. The guide of the ancient ruins can start the 3 hours visit early in the morning first with a walk in the jungle and then the ancient ruins. This gives you a complete picture of Palenque history.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

508890853.name: Historic Paradise
508890853.author: a TripAdvisor user
508890853.reviewBody: I can\'t decide between Palenque and Chich\u00e9n Itza. This place allows you to walk up in the ruins. The hieroglyphs on the walls makes up for all the walking on those stairs. One can appreciate such a historic site

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

498714133.name: Beautiful ruins in the jungle
498714133.author: a TripAdvisor user
498714133.reviewBody: We had a fantastic day st Palenque ruins. The park is different to what we saw before (Chichen, Ek Balam, Edzna). The area to visit is very big and there are a lot of tall buildings in a very good condition. \n\nWe booked a personal tourguide (Nacho) who was very motivated to teach us about Maya Culture. He really made this day special for us - I would recommend a tour (with him) even though it is quiet pricy. You just learn so much more about the buildings and the empire.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

497537566.name: Very interesting site in a jungle setting
497537566.author: a TripAdvisor user
497537566.reviewBody: This is an excellent archeological site in the outskirts of Palenque and a must see if you are anywhere near the area. The mayon pyramids situated in the middle of the forest with so much still uncovered is amazing. We also walked through part of the jungle as so much of site is still buried or uncovered, really interesting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

488566881.name: spectacular ruins  very well maintained but crowded.
488566881.author: a TripAdvisor user
488566881.reviewBody: as expected these amazing mayan ruins were crowded. best to avoid the high priced guides outside the entrance. we picked up a nice local boy for 500 pesos. weat comfy shoes....lottsa walking in the hot sun

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

485173757.name: Magical Palenque
485173757.author: a TripAdvisor user
485173757.reviewBody: It is my favorite Mayan ruin . Palenque emits a special mystical feeling in a jungle setting .\nMy first trip was 40 years ago before tourism . My small children and my Mexican friends  with 4 children drove through the jungle which took 2 hours from Villahermosa .There was an archeologist and a professor and us . There were no other people . We climbed  and crawled all over the pyramids  where the children found hundreds of petrified snails . We waded in the picturesque falls then  wandered through the jungle .\nOver the years it changed into a busy tourist destination . The petrified snails are no longer to be seen. I missed the quiet of my first trips . I wouldn\'t suggest walking Alone because my last trip there were young purse snatchers. Palenque still remains the mystical Queen of the Jungle

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

484991306.name: Absolutely Stunning
484991306.author: a TripAdvisor user
484991306.reviewBody:
We loved our visit to the incredibly beautiful ruins at Palenque. Make sure you give it pretty much a full day as it is a large area with a plethora of things to see and marvel at.
The temples are astonishing and the whole park is beautifully manicured to show them off, not overly though as to take away from the rustic, untouched feel of the place.
What I most remember now a few months later is the breath-taking views because when you climb up to the of the temples you get an incredible view of the others across and below you.
Mesmerising place best seen with a guide as there bis so much to know.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

482241645.name: amazing ruins.
482241645.author: a TripAdvisor user
482241645.reviewBody: excellent park, but the personnel ( guide tours) located in the entrance of the park try to fool the people charging a price too high for a giving a tour, that is a shame because also tries to fool  to the national tourism.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

481923419.name: The Best Mayan Site
481923419.author: a TripAdvisor user
481923419.reviewBody: Having visited several Mayan sites, to me Palenque is the best one. \nSet in a tropical type jungle, the temples and the un-excavated sites are stunning. You do need a good guide to understand all of it.\nThere are the usual facilities: Toilets, bars, souvenir shops etc. Do give yourself plenty of time as it is a big site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

481088782.name: Amazing national park
481088782.author: a TripAdvisor user
481088782.reviewBody: Tropical rain forest with so many different kinds of plants. A great place to enjoy the nature. Breathe the fresh air and hear the birds singing. Pure relax!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

479503968.name: Amazing!
479503968.author: a TripAdvisor user
479503968.reviewBody: Just go! Right now!  Book a ticket and go.  We loved, loved, loved our time here.  The English speaking tours are expensive - $190 USD for 3 hours BUT it includes a guided tour into the jungle where only tour guides can take people.  The jungle section was amazing because there are so many unexcavated ruins in the jungle.  Our guide stayed with us for over 4 hours at no additional cost.  Ask for Victor at the guide stand.  He is amazing!  One Tip:  Get there early!  Like 7:30am.  There is VERY limited parking, ticket lines get long and it gets hot.  We were some of the first ones into the park and Victor took us around to take pictures with no one in the background.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

477887158.name: Chance to climb the ruins
477887158.author: a TripAdvisor user
477887158.reviewBody: No need to join a tour to go to ruins. I really enjoy to walking around the park, but especially climbing on the ruins, sitting on top of there for a while just to watch the spectacular view was the memory that i will never forget. It s felt so much blessed.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

474819009.name: A must !
474819009.author: a TripAdvisor user
474819009.reviewBody:
This place is a must  if you want to see a magnificent site full of stunning temples and surrounded by a deep jungle and  beautiful waterfalls.  Allow yourself  three or more hours to visit the whole site. One of the most famous temples is the Temple of the Inscriptions where the tomb of one of the most famous Maya leaders of Palenque – Pakal was found. At the museum you can see a replica of the sarcophagus. Another incredible building is the Palace and its observation tower.
 I recommend visiting the museum first to  get a better idea of what you are about to visit and then go to the "back entrance" to the park which is just almost opposite the museum. You can easily locate it using google maps. If you arrive by taxi or bus ask the driver to stop at the museum. There are some steep stairs going up towards the ruins and surrounded by the incredible jungle. It´s completely worth the effort as the whole atmosphere is fantastic. I suggest to exit the site following the ecological trail that leads to the main entrance, where you can easily take a bus or taxi. This trail is awesome with even a swing bridge over crystal clear waters.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

466312453.name: Great site--excellent English speaking guide
466312453.author: a TripAdvisor user
466312453.reviewBody: Edgarguiapalenque@gmail.com. Contact Edgar!! Great guide, knowledgeable, kind and FUN!!  Palenque is a must-see site. We\'ve seen many many Mayan temples, this is one of the best preserved. We learned alot from Edgar and saw some sites you\'d need a local to find. We crawled through an ancient aqueduct and saw bats!!  We also saw 2 groups of howler monkeys.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

463772722.name: amazing ruins!
463772722.author: a TripAdvisor user
463772722.reviewBody: We went in twice- once with a guide and once by ourselves. Take your time to really explore this magical place!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

455052251.name: you walk thru the park to get to the ruins
455052251.author: a TripAdvisor user
455052251.reviewBody: if you stay at el panchan and walk early morning like 7am to the ruins, you dont have to pay for entering the park. just walk 3.5km past museum and to ruins entrance.  70p. nice walk through the jungle and hear the howling monkeys.  the park is extensive and best time to visit early in morning before the tourist buses come.  your ticket gets you into the musuem free

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

454594694.name: Excavations surrounded by rain forest
454594694.author: a TripAdvisor user
454594694.reviewBody: Magnificent archaological site with incredible Mayan ruins. It is worth spending hours walking around on the site. Some of the walking paths takes you through the rain forest. The nearby museum is worth a visit, too. Bring water, sunscreen and walking shoes. We went in January, which was optimal because it was outside the rainy season and not extremely hot.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

454089577.name: Incredible!
454089577.author: a TripAdvisor user
454089577.reviewBody: Palenque is incredible - almost mystical with being surrounded by the forest.  I would highly recommend this site.  It\'s one of the best and was our favorite in Chiapas.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

453890547.name: A Very Unique Experience!
453890547.author: a TripAdvisor user
453890547.reviewBody:
I've visited all the major Mayan sites--each is magnificent--but there's something very special about Palenque. I first went there in 2006 and returned this month (Jan. 2017). Surrounded by the rainforest, it has a certain mystique which I haven't found elsewhere. Since the big tourist season was over, I was able to wander in peace and solitude. The first day it rained which only enhanced its intangible beauty. The second day the sun was out and the late afternoon light was absolutely beautiful. When it was time to leave, I took the path which leads to the museum and walked through the rainforest past a waterfall. You should do the same so that you can savor the jungle and its powerful presence. The museum, by the way, is excellent.

Reaching Palenque is not easy. It has a tiny airport which doesn't function most of the year. Most people fly into Tuxtla (via Mexico City) and spend a night in San Cristobal de las Casas before catching the bus which takes five hours to reach Palenque. This is the route I took in 2006 except I spent a few days in San Cristobal. But there is a shorter route which I adopted this time by flying into Villahermosa from Houston.
There is a daily 5:35pm flight from Houston which gets into Villahermosa at 8:20pm.
You can catch the 9:30pm bus to Palenque directly from the airport or spend a night
in Villahermosa and visit the La Venta Park (with its Olmec artifacts in a jungle-like setting) next morning before catching one of the many ADO buses to Palenque (takes 2 1/2 hours). This was my itinerary and I would recommend it.

From Palenque, you must visit Bonampak and Xachilan, the latter on the Guatemalan border. You can cover both on the same day by taking a tour bus which any one of Palenque's travel agencies will arrange for about $45. Xachilan is remote, reached by bus and boat, deep inside the jungle. It fees like it's been just discovered. Surrounded by the green light of the trees, listen to the howler monkeys.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

448676909.name: Beautiful
448676909.author: a TripAdvisor user
448676909.reviewBody: we came into a road block and had to pay a small fee per person to come in.  This fee does not include the archaeological area or anything else.  However the area is beautiful tropical forest and it is well kept.  I did\u00b4t see any trash which we saw everywhere else we visited.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

447812706.name: Most wonderful Nationalpark in Mexico and Guatemala for me
447812706.author: a TripAdvisor user
447812706.reviewBody: I loved this breathtaking place. It is not only the ruins - the landscape and fauna, the whole atmosphere was wonderful. I learned a lot from the guide, who works for the park.
