He spoke perfect english and gave us (I met a group of people from Israel there) interesting and different insights. Also it was a pleasure to walk around by myself, to climb up one of temples and walk back to the excit the nice path near the river. Do not miss Palenque when you come to Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

442746892.name: Enjoyed it
442746892.author: a TripAdvisor user
442746892.reviewBody: Unlike Chichen Itza, you can still climb up the ruins here. For these ruins, I had a guide which did make a difference, though I still wouldn\'t do it for all ruins. Being on the oldest guides, he offered a very refreshing perspective that you won\'t find in any of the guidebooks so it was definitely worth it. Thoroughly enjoyed these ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

438332014.name: Magnificent Mayan site in a tropical forest
438332014.author: a TripAdvisor user
438332014.reviewBody:
Palenque is a medium-sized site, much smaller than such huge sites as Tikal, Chichen Itza or Copán, but it contains some of the finest architecture, sculpture, roof comb and bas-relief carvings that the Mayas produced. Much of the history of Palenque has been reconstructed from reading the hieroglyphic inscriptions on the many monuments. Historians now have a long sequence of the ruling dynasty of Palenque in the 5th century and extensive knowledge of the city-state's rivalry with other states. The most famous ruler of Palenque was K'inich Janaab Pakal, or Pakal the Great, whose tomb has been found and excavated in the Temple of the Inscriptions.

It is estimated that less than 10% of the total area of the city is explored, leaving more than a thousand structures still covered by jungle.

Beautiful nature walk through the tropical rainforest and visit of the museum.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

436266448.name: Howler Monkeys
436266448.author: a TripAdvisor user
436266448.reviewBody: If you are lucky you will hear them. Be sure to hire a guide. He\'ll show you plenty of things you wouldn\'t find your self like a snack of live termites, yum!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

430352284.name: Magical!
430352284.author: a TripAdvisor user
430352284.reviewBody: Palenque is a classic ancient site, and by this i mean its strong impression. It was bad weather and drizzling when I was there, but still you cannot and not be affected by this marvellous ancient site of the Mayas. It is very unique and different to almost all other Mayan site, and the story of the king Pacal and its hidden tomb is fascinating. The vegetation is jungle-like. Very beautiful place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

418556321.name: OMG!  So Worth It!
418556321.author: a TripAdvisor user
418556321.reviewBody: We took the overnight train, with a sleeping compartment, from Merida.  Woke up in the early dawn to find ourselves in the misty rain forest.  The park is astounding!  Spend as much time as you can there.  We had a tip about waterfalls in the nearby jungle off the beaten path, and since it was so humid I needed a swim.  Found the falls, along with a dozen naked German tourists, tripping on mushrooms!  Modest me stepped into the jungle to change into swimsuit. Eek, a snake!  Harmless green tree snake, but if I\'d  known about vicious, poisonous Fer de Lance, I would never have left the ruins proper.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

417112191.name: impressed!
417112191.author: a TripAdvisor user
417112191.reviewBody: I did not expect it to be so nice and big! Go there in the morning to avoid the tourists arriving by busses!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

401850989.name: Tip: Get a Guide!
401850989.author: a TripAdvisor user
401850989.reviewBody:
**TripAdvisor has two entries for Palenque National Park/Ruins this applies to both **

This is an essential destination for anyone remotely close. Transport to and from is convenient and cheap by bus (ADO GL is like business class on a plane). The history of this area is remarkable, and to experience coupled with physical surrounds is one for the memory bank.

Tips. 
1. Get a guide. You can negotiate, even though everyone has 'official rates'  if you are less than four people find others to collectively pay the guide (fee fixed by group size). Worth every penny. Suggest doing this at the actual entrance to the site. You will see official tour guides selling their services all along the road in.

2. Take a collectivo. 20 pesos for the drive is well worth it. Very frequent. If you like walking, do it on the way back and enjoy the downhill. The entrance to the park is roughly 5km from town, then another 3km (I would only walk the latter). 

3. There is food and water at the entrance so travel light.  

4. Wear hiking boots if you have them! The stone can be very slippery when wet!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

397159263.name: Pyramids and Mayan Ruins
397159263.author: a TripAdvisor user
397159263.reviewBody: This was an absolute fun road trip with my friend. The pyramids and Mayan ruins were definitely something to see while in the state of Chiapas, M\u00e9xico. Lots of history and things to learn!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

390172679.name: My first time at a archaeological site
390172679.author: a TripAdvisor user
390172679.reviewBody: This was the first time I\'ve ever visited an Maya site, and it was mind blowing, to be in a place with so much history.\nTry to get a guide that\'ll take you to a walk into the jungle so they can show you the ruins that are still under the vegetation.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

388880729.name: Fantastic!
388880729.author: a TripAdvisor user
388880729.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Chichen Itza, Teotihuacan, Tulum, and Ek-Balaam and Palenque has been one of my favorites. There are fewer vendors than at Chichen Itza and the ruins are more spectacular. It\'s awesome to hear the monkeys and walk through the jungle exploring the ruins. You can actually walk through these. And there are a reliefs and friezes in the ruins that you can check out. Depending on how much time you want to spend in the museum, climbing all the pyramids, and reading the signs, plan two to four hours. Don\'t miss this!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

387267244.name: Increadible Presentation of History about 100 AD to 600 AD
387267244.author: a TripAdvisor user
387267244.reviewBody: The park is fascinating.  On a prior visit I did not employ a local guide.  This time I employed a local English speaking guide. What a difference that made.  It is worth every penny, but they are not that expensive.  The history of Waring Kings and their rituals is fascinating.  The sarcophagus and murals tell real stories.  There certainly had to be a tie from these people to the people of Egypt.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

384064333.name: Great Ruins and Great Visit
384064333.author: a TripAdvisor user
384064333.reviewBody: If you have ever wanted to visit a Mayan ruin, you can\'t go wrong here.  The park is clean, the ruins in fantastic condition, and the layout of the ruins fantastic.  The ruins are really situated in a jungle, which really adds to the spectacular nature of the structures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

384033389.name: What a nice walk. I got lost several times, but I always found the way back home!!!
384033389.author: a TripAdvisor user
384033389.reviewBody:
Get a collectivo for 20 mxp in Palenque, near the "Mayan head" and the ADO bus station. Pay 30 mxp for the entrance and ask to the choffer to drop you at the turn between the entrance and the exit of the ruins.
Check the cascadas and follow the signed paths, you can  see spider monkeys and parrots if you are quiet and noiseless.
Once I ended inside undiscovered ruins, just priceless. Carry with you something for drinking:)
Enjoy the nature!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

379634687.name: i think very best archaeological in all of Mexico
379634687.author: a TripAdvisor user
379634687.reviewBody: Having visited twice, I am so amazed as I wonder around this site.  Multiple building in a fabulous setting, it is my fav of all Mexico

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

377177433.name: Fantastic
377177433.author: a TripAdvisor user
377177433.reviewBody: Spent 3 hours there first one with a guide ( cost of guide was $ 500.00 pesos)  well worth the cost.  Lots of history,  amazing ruins  not over crowded because it is off season,  this is the third time I have been there and we discover something new each time.  A must see on the way to San Cristobal Las Casas

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

373434600.name: Really nice "jungle" park
373434600.author: a TripAdvisor user
373434600.reviewBody: If you seek some nature, walks and ruins. I would suggest that you go have a look. You will be able to see and hear howling monkeys, birds and butterflies (maybe some scorpions too...)\n\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

362407931.name: Hiddem gem(s) in the jungle!
362407931.author: a TripAdvisor user
362407931.reviewBody:
I loved Palenque!! Its has a densed jungle with interesting plants and animals, impressive ruïnes, and nearby one of the most beautiful waterfalls I have ever seen. In my opinion it can compete with both Tikal and Semuc Champey; thought those are bigget but/and much more touristic.

Go with a local guide through the jungle of Palenque and visit the ruïnes. Take another day to visit Aluxes Ecoparque and visit the Agua Azul Waterfall (get a minivan or taxi, and let local kids show you around - for a fair tip, of course). And dont forget to get some local marinade bbq chicken to picknick at the waterfalls!

Ps. I was with a guided tour, just make sure you know what you do and go with a group to the waterfalls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

356450406.name: Well preserved ruins in a compact site
356450406.author: a TripAdvisor user
356450406.reviewBody: The ruins are well preserved and well worth the 2 or so hours it would take to look over the site. Spend longer if you want to see more detail. Good photos too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

352742208.name: Palenque national park
352742208.author: a TripAdvisor user
352742208.reviewBody: Every winter we travel from our home in huatulco to see more this amazing country, Mexico. This year it was Palenque. We hoped to drive from San Cristobal to Palenque but the road was blocked...regional politics. So we drove 7 hours around to Villahermosa and came in the back door. \nOur tour of the national park and the Palenque ruins was so worth the drive. This was in no small part due to Daniel Gallegos Sosa from Kim Tours, who expertly guided us through the ruins along with the Maya history and culture. I cannot say enough about the depth of this mans knowledge and enthusiasm for his local and national history. \nWe have visited many archeological sites and Palenque cannot be surpassed for its accessibility to the pyramids and the stunning natural jungle surroundings. We did not allow enough time to do the region proper justice.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

350668343.name: Hidden gem in the jungle
350668343.author: a TripAdvisor user
350668343.reviewBody: The Palenque site is simply awesome. Only a small portion of the 1500 discovered structures have been stripped of their lush forest blanket. Only half way through a month in central America but I doubt any other site will impress me as much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

346380258.name: Maya ruins and a great waterfall in one but far too many vendors
346380258.author: a TripAdvisor user
346380258.reviewBody: Beautiful Mayan ruins in a natural park where you can actually climb the piramids and have a great downhill stroll along a natural river.\nThe place would be even more beautiful if there were less stalls and artisan vendors who really spoil the experience and are a pain. One would love to enjoy this place in peace which would be possible even with big crowds if it wasn\'t for the vendors.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

344082441.name: Amazing Mayan Ruins, a must see for travellers to Chiapas Mexico
344082441.author: a TripAdvisor user
344082441.reviewBody: Amazing Mayan Ruins in an extensive national park. There are many palaces and burial pyramids with a huge collection of unexcavated ruins to hike to and explore. This site is extensive and some of the tour guides are very knowledgeable. Some of the tour guides can be pushy and they operate in a cue like a taxi line where they take turns. Make sure yours is understandable and knowledgeable before you agree to go with him, and your tour will amaze you at the depth and breadth of the Mayan civilization.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

344039208.name: Take walk to falls too near ruins or on way to ruins
344039208.author: a TripAdvisor user
344039208.reviewBody: Worth climbing into palace through tunnels and don\'t miss the museum as well as the buildings with structures on top unlike Uxmal and Chitin Itza.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

343912110.name: Nice natural and historic place
343912110.author: a TripAdvisor user
343912110.reviewBody: Nice place - amazing natural and historic. You can walk there many hours. Tip - there are monkeys on the trees.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

343893387.name: Ruinas
343893387.author: a TripAdvisor user
343893387.reviewBody: Best visited in the mid to late afternoons as many tour buses arrive between 9am and noon.  If looking for an English speaking "official" guide ask for Edgar.  Mondays they were cutting the grass in the plaza area so that really interfered with the tranquility of the place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

343396081.name: The Essential Mayan Ruin Experience...Three Days Minimum..Really!
343396081.author: a TripAdvisor user
343396081.reviewBody: Yes. All of what you want, and have heard about is at hand to  expand your Mayan Cultural Ruinas Experience here.  My favorite Mayan Site with other important sites only two hours away by car or collectivo. Now you can fly directly to Palenque on Interjet Airlines for peanuts, so the place that was hard to get to is one cocktail and an in flight snack away...Under 100.00 U.S. including taxes, 2 checked bags...etc from Mexico City.  NO REASON not to go now to Palenque. Magicamente\'

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

343380999.name: Travel to another Universe
343380999.author: a TripAdvisor user
343380999.reviewBody:
When You reach Palenque, sudenly, You see yourself In an ancient Mayan city...splendid, huge.
All around You the Temple of the Cross, the Temple of the Inscriptions, the Temple of the Jaguar...and In the center the Palace!
You can imagine Pakal, ruler of Palenque, majestically descending from his Palace revered by his people.
Protected by the forest it escaped the Spanish conquistadores voracity and thanks to that it's a well preserved archaelogical site.
Don't miss it and if You are travelling In a rented car, be sure You always drive In day light. At night, roads are note safe.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

341296770.name: Entertaining
341296770.author: a TripAdvisor user
341296770.reviewBody: The price of admission to the park does not include entrance to the Ruins-you have to pay for that separately. But it does allow you into a really cool little eco-park near the Palenque Ruins entrance that I recommend.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

339690879.name: Definitely worth the trouble
339690879.author: a TripAdvisor user
339690879.reviewBody: A friend suggested I visit Palenque, so I spent eight hours on an ADO bus from Merida (and mucho dinero) to get there but it was "vale la pena," as the Mexicans say. I thought it best not to spend 500 pesos to sleep on a hammock in the jungle since I\'m a woman traveling alone. Instead, I paid 1,800 pesos to stay at an overpriced resort, Chan Kah. After a pricey dinner the first night, I woke up early to the sounds of birds and jungle monkeys (awesome), grabbed an overpriced breakfast and walked to the main road to flag down a colectivo bus. That was 20 pesos. I paid 31 pesos to get into the area, then another 65 to enter the ruins. Some guy from New York argued about the 65 pesos, claiming he was told it would be 15 to get in. Really, dude? That\'d be less than a dollar. As it was, 65 pesos was less than $4. Well worth it for one of the most majestic, fascinating, sacred places on earth.  Wander the grounds, climb the steep stairs, appreciate Mayan civilization, check out the waterfall and the museum. Go early before the hordes descend. But grab your meals in town. Cheap and delicious.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

339286746.name: Jungle adventure
339286746.author: a TripAdvisor user
339286746.reviewBody:
Fabulous jungle walk (steep & slippery) to see or just hear Howler Monkeys, Toucan, Termites & ruins still covered in vegetation including the swimming pool & walk through the aqueduct that serviced it. 
Then, via many roadside traders, enter the site of the ruins (see separate listing) which I enjoyed more than Chichen Itza as you can scramble over them.
Walk down the steps by the waterfall (or just leave as you came in) and visit the museum. 
We had an excellent guide but it's signposted well enough.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

337097257.name: Wow
337097257.author: a TripAdvisor user
337097257.reviewBody: One of my favorite ruins. This place is huge a small amount is excavated the city covered 220 hectares!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

335728005.name: Amazing jungle ruins
335728005.author: a TripAdvisor user
335728005.reviewBody: I visited Palenque as part of my Archaeology degree and the ruins are simply amazing and offer a fantastic contrast to the temples of Oaxaca and Mexico City. This temple is in the jungle and you can almost imagine what it would have been like to re-discover it. Absolutely worth a trip to see them!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

335325340.name: The most beautiful
335325340.author: a TripAdvisor user
335325340.reviewBody: I think, this is the most beautiful ancient city in mexico. Breathtaking! The ruins are located in a very beautiful "jungle", you must see!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

334318751.name: Nice ruins
334318751.author: a TripAdvisor user
334318751.reviewBody: Affordable .  Easy  access  from town, don\'t  do organized  tour, just use collectivo. No need for guide, everything  is  there in Spanish  and  English . Food available  outside  ruins

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

330603793.name: You can see more than just history
330603793.author: a TripAdvisor user
330603793.reviewBody: There\'s beauty everywhere, if you want to know about Maya\'s history, your tour guide will help you with all your questions. You can see pyramids and walk around the Park and the Lacandon Jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

329264917.name: Amazing History of the Mayan city
329264917.author: a TripAdvisor user
329264917.reviewBody: The Palenque historic site is well worth a visit. We got up early and were there just before it opened so when it did open we were in before all of the bus traffic arrived with all of the different tour groups. I highly recommend getting there early! We loved the site!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

329014150.name: Should be a place for all to visit.
329014150.author: a TripAdvisor user
329014150.reviewBody: An amazing place, really enjoyed the whole experience.  Great ruins and they are just getting started uncovering this huge city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

327721202.name: What benefit did I get?
327721202.author: a TripAdvisor user
327721202.reviewBody: The ruins are in the park, so you pay the entrance fee to get to the ruins, then pay to see the ruins. No map or explanation of the greater park is provided... so it\'s a bit of a double dip (albeit incidental in cost). Would like to know where those pesos go though... Someone in Mexico is doing very nicely from this

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

325815646.name: Amazing but felt annoyed by tour guys
325815646.author: a TripAdvisor user
325815646.reviewBody: Amazing but I really felt annoyed by people offering tours. I had to say "no" more than twice and one guy even followed us until I said him "hey, dont get me wrong but I had told you no before", after that he finally stopped following us. Besides that, the place is huge and amazing. You will be surrounded by nature and jungle which makes this place beautiful. \n\nMake sure you bring water, fresh clothes (must), some snacks to refuel energy (you will walk and climb a lot of stairs), sunscreen and patience with local/tours people.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

325703361.name: Get a hotel near the park
325703361.author: a TripAdvisor user
325703361.reviewBody: Ever wondered about a place where howler monkeys kiss goodnight? Get a place near the park and enjoy a night in the jungle. Expect lot of insects and the fact that you will be wet. There is also a short jungle walk just before the palenque archeological zone - entrance in the curve of the road.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

325150670.name: Stunning archaeological site
325150670.author: a TripAdvisor user
325150670.reviewBody: We were first through the gates at 8am and were glad we made an early start, crowds arrive soon after but also warms up rather quick once the sun breaks through early morning fog. Truly stunning jungle setting very well maintained, lot\'s of Mayan touts and souvenir sellers but I\'ve certainly come across more aggressive types else where around the world. We took around 4 hours including a visit to the museum and a beautiful hike through the jungle nearby. Even spotted howler monkeys, a serpent and small Guinea pig like marsupial. Take plenty of water as it\'s very humid and hot. Well worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

323040029.name: Take your time
323040029.author: a TripAdvisor user
323040029.reviewBody:
This place is amazing. I suggest going really early and entering from the top - then really spend time enjoying the ruins and being amazed by the location. Go slow - spend many hours just enjoying the many different structures and views from the different vantage points. 

Once done, take the trail that goes down to the museum. This will take you down past some amazing waterfalls and later structures that are at the base of the ruins. You will cross a cool suspension bridge and possible hear/see howler monkeys. This trail was a highlight for us but I think it is easy to miss.
Once you get to the bottom - get some nuts or ice cream from the local vendors and then go to the museum. The esophagus alone is worth the small admission price. 

If you parked at the top - hop on a bus to get back to the top else you will be right at the entrance to the park and can get a bus back to town.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

322166900.name: On the traces of King Pakal
322166900.author: a TripAdvisor user
322166900.reviewBody:
Amazing National Park.  A must to see if you like the Mayan Culture.  Our visit was organized by Kim Tours and our guide Francisco was italian speaking.   Make sure you have good walking shoes, moschito spray and sun lotion.  In case you travel on  your own at the entrance lots of kids are selling "Off" spray and guides are waiting to take you around.  Its certainly a 2 or 3 hours tour.  Early October was an excellent period.  Not crowded and not too hot.  We were told that in the summer the archeological site is full and not pleasant to walk in.  Guards secure the Site  and make it a safe place to walk.  At the end of the tour do not miss to visit the Museum.  This is a MUST as much  interesting as the piramids.

If you stay few days in Palenque I recommend to visit Xchiland and Bonampak.  This can be combine in one day trip.  Its a challenge and long day but worth to be done.
Nicole and Marcello (Ariccia/Roma) - October 5-9, 2015

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

319964826.name: Amazing
319964826.author: a TripAdvisor user
319964826.reviewBody: This ruins are one of the greatest cities in the mayan state its one of the most impressive places in Chiapas when in there you can see the mayan ruler Pakal tomb and if you are lucky can also take a walk in the jungle and see the ruins that still there and feel little like Indiana Jones

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

316611445.name: Do not miss this park!
316611445.author: a TripAdvisor user
316611445.reviewBody: The National Park of Palenque is home to a Mayan city that is in various stages of restoration. Plan to spend a half day viewing the structures, the beautiful grounds, and the rainforest. This is a Unesco Heritage Site and it is best enjoyed with a good guide who can explain the site. This is a "must see" attraction.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

315219338.name: A must see
315219338.author: a TripAdvisor user
315219338.reviewBody: The ruins in Palenque were a delight to visit. I was surprised by the amount of history in the museum. To see an actual tomb was fascinating . There was so much to see of interest. The grounds were well kept and it was not too crowded.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

313364360.name: Definitely a must! Find Gabriel in El Panchan!
313364360.author: a TripAdvisor user
313364360.reviewBody: Absolutely loved Palenque, it is one of the highlights of our Latin American trip. The ruins are spectacular and the national park is really incredible. We stayed at a great hostel in El Panchan called Marguarita\'s. The room was affordable, clean and had really good bug protection with mosquito nets fitted throught the ceiling.\n\nIf you stay somewhere in El Panchan, find a guy named Gabriel, his office is in the local restaurant. He is a local Mayan tour guide who will take you on a barefoot jungle trek off the tourist track. We swam under waterfalls, in amazing cascading pools, climbed through caves, sat in a 1000 year old Mayan home which was being overrun by jungle, and walked among the howler monkeys. Gabriel is a fantastic guide. He speaks English and knows a lot about the area. This is a must-do if you\'re in Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

311565543.name: Great archaeological place to learn about the Mayan culture!
311565543.author: a TripAdvisor user
311565543.reviewBody: A little far away from San Cristobal de las Casas, but definitely is a MUST! The quality of the buildings and the views are amazing. Guide tourist is highly recommendable since they can provide you a lot of information and great views. Bring water and camera!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

310136356.name: A step back in time
310136356.author: a TripAdvisor user
310136356.reviewBody: Visited here on a day trip organised prior to our visit to Mexico.  Initially I was slightly sceptical of it but all ran smoothly.  The beautiful ruins, temples and palaces are a must to see and we had an english speaking guide who helped us to differentiate everything.  You are in a dense jungle so please take extra care with plenty of water and repellent as it gets very very hot and humid.  You can also buy souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

308569166.name: Day trip from Villahermosa
308569166.author: a TripAdvisor user
308569166.reviewBody:
Visited as a day trip from Villahermosa at a weekend. The journey there was ok (about 2.5hrs) along descent roads. The park was great, a fair bit to see. We didn't have a guide but wish we had, take lots of water as its sweltering and hard work up the hills and temples! 
We had lunch at a nice restaurant down the hill out of the park which was really nice.

You only need 3-4 hours max I would say so don't plan on a weeks trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

306431043.name: Amazing place
306431043.author: a TripAdvisor user
306431043.reviewBody: Historic and magical place. You can walk on the ruins and through the tunnels. You can be here at least two hours. Also you can buy beautiful handcrafts here. It\'s amazing place!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

303862505.name: Palenque, a must if you like ruins.
303862505.author: a TripAdvisor user
303862505.reviewBody: Get there early, so that you can visit with less people.  It is a magical place thanks to the beautiful jungle that surrounds these ruins.  It is uncommon to visit mayan ruins that let you walk through the inside like you can in the Palacio building.  Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

299018477.name: Beautiful power here ............
299018477.author: a TripAdvisor user
299018477.reviewBody:
Soak this place in. It is truly magical. The buildings are in great shape, being able to walk or climb on all but one temple. The Temple of the Inscriptions was roped off  :(   

I really didn't find it a hassle getting here from La Canada district, Palenque; it actually was very enjoyable. We took a local mini-van from the bus station. I think 10 pesos. Your right in with the locals. Very cool .....  Arriving at the Ruinas ( 10 mins. max. ) from bus station was convenient. The vendors were fine. No hassle's or such. Just the normal routine for Central American attractions. Prices were good and they did have some pretty unique art from that region. Don't blow through this part, it's worth a slow saunter. 

Inside the gates will bring you to awe-inspiring amazement. I would recommend this Mayan Ruinas. It is the Mecca of Mayans. Enjoy  !!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

298593547.name: Travel with wheelchairs
298593547.author: a TripAdvisor user
298593547.reviewBody: Wonderful site! We visited with my family of which two children use power wheel chairs. There is a great ramp to access the site from the car park. Once we arrived we could access most of the grounds, however some areas were difficult to get to. We are accustomed to travel and for us it was a matter of problem solving to access the areas. We carried the boys to the top of the structures! Arrive early and drink lots of water! There were no mosquito s and so you don\'t need to buy repellent from the hordes of people flogging it! A great visit indeed! I would say to the offices to provide better access for everyone.\nBeaulieus

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

298314015.name: Astounding presentation of a key Mayan archeological site
298314015.author: a TripAdvisor user
298314015.reviewBody: Palenque was one of the most important Mayan cities centuries ago. The temples, palaces, dwellings, etc. that have been resurrected from the jungle are nothing short of amazing. Mexico has had the resources to excavate far more than the similar city of Tikal in Guatemala. It is a must see, but realize that this is very popular both for international tourists and Mexican citizens. I was there in the latter part of the Mexican holidays, the site was packed (very few international tourists). It also has a huge population of vendors selling any and erery kind of souvenir under the sun. It is also hot and humid - don\'t plan on climbing all the temples unless you are in pretty good shape.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

297420773.name: Hidden and magical
297420773.author: a TripAdvisor user
297420773.reviewBody: A little difficult to get to, but amazing when you do. You can hear and see the howler monkeys, wander all over the ruins. Its a little something out of lord of the rings - absolutely stunning!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

294540423.name: Amazing site! Go in the morning
294540423.author: a TripAdvisor user
294540423.reviewBody: This is one of the most important Maya ruins, and it is spectacular. So many beautiful ruins to explore, and there is a lot of information in Spanish and English along the way. That information, plus our travel book, was enough information for us not to need a guided visit, which can be expensive if you\'re on a budget. We took a colectivo bus from Palenque town at about 8am, and were there fairly early. This is a great tip: GET THERE EARLY. Not only do you avoid the tourist buses, but it gets so hot and humid as the day progresses, and you miss the worst of it by going in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

293865579.name: Mesmerized
293865579.author: a TripAdvisor user
293865579.reviewBody: If you ever in Mexico, southern Mexico you can not miss visiting Palenque, this is an amazing archaeological site, well kept grounds, TONS of souvenirs and very interesting people that are more than happy to guide you. The town is also great, cafes, restaurants and beautiful areas for your enjoyment.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

293163732.name: Lovely
293163732.author: a TripAdvisor user
293163732.reviewBody: Lovely part of the world. Lots of wildlife but you will need to get to the quieter parts of the park to actually see some wildlife.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

292799597.name: Great great place!
292799597.author: a TripAdvisor user
292799597.reviewBody: The archeological area of Palenque is so breathtaking! It happens every time I visit, it is like a magic place. Don`t forget to visit the museum which is located before the park, where you can see a replica of the tumb. Bring water, as it is normally very hot and humid.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

289639518.name: My favourite Mayan ruin
289639518.author: a TripAdvisor user
289639518.reviewBody: Simply breath-taking and amazing!! The fact that most of Palenque is hidden in the jungle makes the experience unique. I could travel into the past and imagined the huge city that it was in the old Times. Worth spending a day in it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

289090580.name: one of the best site to be visited in Mexico
289090580.author: a TripAdvisor user
289090580.reviewBody: Palenque is one of the best site to be visited in Mexico. Not only for the ruinas but also for the biodiversity and people.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

288889305.name: Palenque ruins
288889305.author: a TripAdvisor user
288889305.reviewBody: Definitely worth to visit, this ruins were swallowed by the jungle, the anthropologists uncovered 28 buildings, nevertheless, at least 1400 are still covered by thick vegetations. \n\nYou will love everything this place has to offer

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

287133251.name: good choice
287133251.author: a TripAdvisor user
287133251.reviewBody: wonderful place to spend at least one day,  Like in Tikal in Gwatemala  u can see amazing  ruins surrounded by rainforest.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

286662505.name: Definitely A Place Worth Visiting.
286662505.author: a TripAdvisor user
286662505.reviewBody: This place is definitely off the beaten path in Mexico, but it is well worth the extra effort to come and see, especially if you are already in Chiapas.  The town of Palenque offers very little, but this is where you pick up the transportation to the National Park.  When you arrive at the National Park you will be approached by many English speaking guides.  I recommend you choose one because, otherwise, you will be on your own not knowing what you are looking at - they are worth the cost.  However, try to negotiate a better price and make sure you are comfortable with the guide\'s accent.  If one doesn\'t speak clearly enough then move on to the next.  Bring bug juice, hat, sunglasses, small towel if you have one to wipe the sweat off your face.  They sell water there, but make sure you buy it right after getting off the bus.  Have fun.  P.S. If my memory serves me correctly then you will pay a fee while still on the bus as you approach the park - this is the entrance fee to the park itself.  Then, once you are off the bus, you must buy tickets to enter the ruins.  So, don\'t be surprise when you are pulling out money the second time.  If you found this review helpful then please check the box below asking "Was this review helpful?"

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

284839338.name: Impressive site
284839338.author: a TripAdvisor user
284839338.reviewBody: It\'s very well preserved and you can climb up many of the temples for a closer look at some of the carvings. It\'s a whole city, smaller than Tikal or Chichen Itza which we also visited but with many different buildings that are in good condition including the palace in the centre. The signage isn\'t great so I would advise a guided tour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

278602589.name: Take the jungle tour
278602589.author: a TripAdvisor user
278602589.reviewBody:
I had been to Palenque several times before so said "no" when a guide approached. However, I had my young grandson along so agreed to a jungle tour and was not disappointed. Be sure to bargain!  

Our guide was very good and showed us many medicinal plants, edible plants, mushrooms, trees and their uses, etc. we saw and heard howler monkeys also. We visited several ruins, aqueducts, cisterns, waterfalls, etc. it was quite a physical walk. 

Palenque itself is beautiful in a gorgeous setting. Quite shady, don't forget repellant. Be sure to visit the museum and the lid of Pakal's sarcophagus. You can still climb on the ruins. Very few vendors. Very humid.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

277946645.name: 7 points for that
277946645.author: a TripAdvisor user
277946645.reviewBody: It is my favorite place in Mexico.  There are a lot to see and there are a lot of Maya Tempels to claim. Best thing ever

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

275811694.name: World Famous for good reasons
275811694.author: a TripAdvisor user
275811694.reviewBody: I have been to Palenque 4 times. It is famous because it is so well excavated and so much is known of the people and the culture. To have the best experience, get a guide. The signage is poor and the Moon Guide, Lonely Planet etc, have some information but you learn so much more from a good guide. The museum is also excellent, and has a reproduction of Pakal\'s tomb that is interesting because we cannot now go into the real tomb. Excellent displays and artifacts, don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

274457988.name: Great Ruins!
274457988.author: a TripAdvisor user
274457988.reviewBody: This is a worthwhile adventure if you are heading out to the cascades ague azul.  It is best to hit a couple of these attractions as it is a bit of a drive out of San Cristobal.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

271681386.name: Interesting and worth seeing
271681386.author: a TripAdvisor user
271681386.reviewBody: Very hot. We took a English speaking guide for a hour. 2 of us for 400pesos. Not terrible.  Very informative. I loved hearing about the culture and the meaning of the  murals on the walls. Bring water plenty of vendors outside to hassle you.        Take a guide it\'s worth it.  Without a guide. I would give it a 2-3.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

271420518.name: Ruins and Jungle
271420518.author: a TripAdvisor user
271420518.reviewBody: These were the most impressive ruins in Mexico. You walk through perfect jungle listening to howler monkeys - very atmospheric. When you get to the clearing to see the ruins it is quite an experience. What I love most about these ruins is that they are jutting out from the jungle. It looks very much like the archaeological sites you see in the films! The history of the site is fantastic so see if you can get a tour guide to tell you all about it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

270174666.name: A lovely place to stroll
270174666.author: a TripAdvisor user
270174666.reviewBody: While the Mayan ruins are the real draw here, the surrounding forest is very impressive. We were fortunate to have a guide travelling with us with us that knew some interesting routes through the forest. Palenque is a little off the beaten track for many and he park was pleasantly quiet.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

270050022.name: Not Disappointed!
270050022.author: a TripAdvisor user
270050022.reviewBody: The ruins at Palenque was one of the major reasons for visiting Mexico. Although it is not the largest of the ruins that we have seen it still is quite majestic. Highly Recommended!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

268430796.name: My favorite ruins
268430796.author: a TripAdvisor user
268430796.reviewBody: The structures are very impressive, the jungle surrounding the ruins is amazing and worth spending some time walking around before entering the ruins. As with many other ruins sites we found it busy in the morning, I think it is because of busses of package tourists arriving on route to another destination, if you wait them out it becomes more quiet again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

267431827.name: Fantastic Atmosphere and Impressive Ruins
267431827.author: a TripAdvisor user
267431827.reviewBody: It is hard to decide what I enjoyed more about my visit to Palenque. While the structures themselves are incredible and the Mayan history is very rich, the tropical vegetation surrounding the ruins is equally impressive. I could easily spend the afternoon walking around the Palenque grounds exploring the forests and relaxing near the ruins. Although it is a tourist attraction, the place did not feel crowded. \n\nESLVentures.com

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

265760566.name: The greatest day of my life
265760566.author: a TripAdvisor user
265760566.reviewBody:
Go to the nearby restaurant and backpacker hostel (the name escapes m) and ask to do a jungle tour.

There are 2 brothers that run the tours and both are extremely knowledgeable, fun and friendly.

The experience we had i still count as the best day of my life.

Try it. You will not regret it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

265153112.name: Amazing
265153112.author: a TripAdvisor user
265153112.reviewBody: The park is amazing you will be in touch with nature and you can know more about the mayans, being in the middle of the jungle makes this place unique and the heat bearable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

261987299.name: World cultural heritage
261987299.author: a TripAdvisor user
261987299.reviewBody: This place is beautiful. Full of power. It\'s amazing to see the ruins and the jungle living together, merging. Being here is to transport yourself to another area, ancient times were the humans were different yet humans...\n\nDon\'t forget to visit the museum.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

260869400.name: Howler monkeys
260869400.author: a TripAdvisor user
260869400.reviewBody: The forest around the palenque ruins constitute this National park. There is a separate entrance fee but it is worth it. You\'ll see lot\'s of wildlife including howler monkeys!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

260322871.name: Rainforest was more interesting as the ruins itself
260322871.author: a TripAdvisor user
260322871.reviewBody: Palenque national park is definitely one of the highlights of Mexico and really interesting place, but I have realized that jungles itself were more interesting as the ruins. Maybe I\u2019ve got this feeling because right before I already been to Chechen-Itza, Uxmal and Teotihuacan, or maybe because my expectation was too high... I\u2019ve spent a day for traveling to Palenque by plane from Mexico City and was a bit disappointed by ruins, but the rainforest full of birds and animals was great. We\u2019ve took a guide and he explained a lot of interesting about this place, so better take combined tour for ruins and jungles.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

260239858.name: Tropical jungle
260239858.author: a TripAdvisor user
260239858.reviewBody: Dense forest, clear streams, surrounds the amazing ruins. We glimpsed several toucans> We wished we had more time to explore the park.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

258790031.name: Definitely another WORLD WONDER!!
258790031.author: a TripAdvisor user
258790031.reviewBody: I am shocked that this is not one of the Wonders of the World.  This place is breathtaking!! To start the Ruins are absolutely amazing but the whole surroundings create a magical atmosphere.  We made the mistake of only allocating a few hours for this place and oh what a mistake that was.  There is SOOOO MUCH to see.  all around the site there are waterfalls,and lagoons that are absolutely GLORIOUS! we spent a night at the Cascadas de Agua Azul which was an amazing experience.  The name translates to: Blue water Waterfalls and in this case they do really mean it.  The water appears to be blue creating vails of water that beckon a jump in!  there are a few places where you can jump in but it is limited.  \n\nThe whole area was too astonishing for words.  I am so impressed that I am already planning a return trip.  This place is a MUST SEE!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

256733065.name: Amazing ruins!
256733065.author: a TripAdvisor user
256733065.reviewBody: The ruins are amazing and the views are breathtaking. My only recommendation is to take a tour or go in a big group. My wife and I decided to rent a car and was not a good idea. The road to the park is awful and really bad it took us almost 5 hours to get there. Besides that enjoy the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

255881256.name: Don\'t judge this stunning place by size alone
255881256.author: a TripAdvisor user
255881256.reviewBody: There are so many reviews that I probably cannot write anything new but I did have a traveler\'s tale to share. I woke up early to a huge storm and it was still pouring after I had finished breakfast. The ruins had been on my wish list for years and I was not prepared for the rain. After looking all over the lower town for an umbrella I actually thought about leaving. I just wasn\'t going to get soaked, but didn\'t want to miss this either. Then I found a cheap plastic parka and covered myself up and began sweating immediately. After a short walk I found a cambio and exited at the end of its ride which was the ruins. I hadn\'t done anything and was hot an sweaty with this non breathable parka but thrilled to walk through the gate and see the beginning of the ruins. Then thankfully it stopped raining and the sun came out. I walked every step of every of every building and took about as many photos. I have visited many ruins in Mexico, both before and after Palenque and I am not going to judge or compare any of them as they are all wonderful\\, but I do see why this one has an exceptional reputation. While it is a little isolated, and the town isn\'t much of anything, you will be well rewarded by your visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

254482427.name: part of the fee to see the ruins
254482427.author: a TripAdvisor user
254482427.reviewBody: Since the park and the ruins are actually one in the same, you receive a double treat. The ruins are fantastic, but the walks thru thr jungle and along the small river are equally enchanting. There are miles of trails and you can spend quite a while here. We only had one day, will return for a longer exploration soon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

252749839.name: Beautifu ruines

252749839.reviewBody: Great archeological site. The whole area of the site is quite big with a lot of ruines that are still in really good shape, Had a great time there,

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

251716849.name: Howler monkeys, untouched ruins, amazing jungle
251716849.author: a TripAdvisor user
251716849.reviewBody: you need a guide to enter the national park jungle, we heard and saw the rare howler monkey, learned about so many medicinal Plants, walked in and through so many untouched Mayan ruins, it was mystical and educational, i would reccommend a Mayan guide as it was their ancestors who built it and they have a gentle reverence about the land.  waterfalls are very beautiful as well, all around amazing

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

251714021.name: Protected Jungle, untouched Mayan ruins, amazing
251714021.author: a TripAdvisor user
251714021.reviewBody: we were lucky enough to see and hear howler monkeys, saw pottery shards all along the hike, learned about so many traditional healing plants, it was the Temple of Bloom!  not Doom at all, our 17 and 11 year old were captivated, get a guide and prepare to be blown away, i would recommend a Mayan guide since it was their ancestors who built it and they show a natural reverence!  the water falls are also amazing, so much ...so much good memories of this hike for our family, come to Palenque they wont cut your head off! lol

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

251203083.name: green!
251203083.author: a TripAdvisor user
251203083.reviewBody: a very beautiful place. they have kept it very natural and protected the environment. lots of resorts there. the ruins museum and waterfalls are all not very far from each other so can be easily visited. not to venture alone after dark.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

249735297.name: The most beautiful ruins in Mexico
249735297.author: a TripAdvisor user
249735297.reviewBody: This is simply the most beautiful ruins in entire Mexico! Very green and jungle all around this small ruins but the feel of well preserved and still virgin environment. There is also very beautiful nature around it and lots of monkeys and live parrots and their voices and screams add a very unique and authentic atmosphere to this magic place! Must visit place if you are in Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

249556964.name: Too popular!
249556964.author: a TripAdvisor user
249556964.reviewBody: I can\'t say that we were bowled over by Palenque. It was partly the timing of our visit: we were there in the last days of the Mexican new year holidays, which meant that the place was overrun with visitors. But it was also the fact that the site is now nicely laid out, with neat paths going from one monument to another; it seemed so tame compared to the visit we made 35 years ago. And it didn\'t help that what is probably the most spectacular monument at  Palenque, the Temple of Inscriptions, was closed to the public. But the bas-reliefs in the Palace complex were still amazing. And the museum is definitely worth a visit, although it\'s a long - but pleasant - walk from the ruins themselves (or you can drive there; it\'s on the entry/exit road). Unfortunately, we had to hurry our visit of the museum. We just got in a few minutes before 4:30 pm, which is the last entry, and the personnel were pushing us through, clearly anxious to get home.\n\nIf possible, combine a visit to Palenque with a visit to Yaxchilan and Bonompak. These are much more "ruins in the jungle", especially Yaxchilan.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

249194056.name: One of the most amazing places in the world.
249194056.author: a TripAdvisor user
249194056.reviewBody: Its extremly beautiful. Please keep it this way by respecting the land. I want to get married here. If anyone can give me details on how to go about that please reply :) A jungle wedding sounds extremly beautiful and romantic!\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

249108246.name: Palenque - Maya ruins
249108246.author: a TripAdvisor user
249108246.reviewBody: Amazing place. Worth visiting and worth every money although very cheap. The area, paths and grass around well kept. There is a beautiful waterfall near the museum. I REALLY recommend this place to anyone visiting Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

249033997.name: Impressive!
249033997.author: a TripAdvisor user
249033997.reviewBody: I can not believe the energy of this place! The ruins are impressive and be able to walk through all this makes the ride even more spectacular. In one of the temples is possible to climb the stairs to a high point which serves as a sort of observatory, taking a broad view of the park. Amazing !!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

248432937.name: Use a Local Guide at Palenque
248432937.author: a TripAdvisor user
248432937.reviewBody:
Palenque is extraordinary and to get the most out of it, use the services of a local guide.

Of the 10 Mayan sites I saw, including Teotihuacan, Tikal, Tulum, Yaxchiulan, Uxmal, Bonompak, Monte Alban and Chichen Itza, it was in the top three.

It's a large and extensive site set in virgin jungle at the foothills of the Usumacinta Mountains that, ideally, you'll set aside at least half a day to explore. 

Because it's on a high plateau in the jungle with huge trees, large, grassed areas and creeks, it's a beautiful place to be. The day we were there last April, it was a perfect day - fine skies with a slight breeze that made exploring ideal. Take plenty of water with you.

We had our own local guide who was brilliant and gave us a lot of fascinating information. He was also able to take us on another walk that would have taken 2 hours but, unfortunately, we'd run out of time. It's a shame we didn't realise how much there was to see.

Palenque was a bountiful paradise with plenty of fish, meats, fruits and vegetables during the height of the Mayan civilisation from the 6th to the 9th centuries AD. It was a centre for astronomy, art and religion with many fascinating and often brutal rituals.

It was also one of the first Mayan sites to be discovered and is one of the best preserved.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

247275771.name: Best Mexican Ruin So Far
247275771.author: a TripAdvisor user
247275771.reviewBody: I\'ve visited Chichen Itza, Teotihuacan, Tulum and Monte Alban, and I liked Palenque most. I particularly enjoyed its dramatic jungle setting. As for Mayan ruins I\'d take Tikal in Guatemala over Palenque. All-in-all, a really enjoyable day.

There are a few paths at the top of the site that lead to more structures. Then there is a path down the mountain (towards the museum) that is beautiful! There is a waterfall and more ruins that were the residential area.

The access is very easy, just grab a "colectivo" to the "ruinas" in the centro downtown. I highly recommend to arrive at the park at 8am, so you can be the first visitor to enjoy nice mystic atmosphere of the Mayan morning.  \nJust amazing!!

217301551.author: a TripAdvisor user

A picture perfect setting of ruins amongst a lush Mexican jungle backdrop, with howler monkeys and cicadas providing the background sounds. The ruins are truly majestic, I can\'t quite believe you\'re allowed to climb them! Just make sure you\'re wearing comfy shoes, there are hundreds of steps.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

214956044.name: Palenque is amazing!
214956044.author: a TripAdvisor user
214956044.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful sacred sites in all of the Mayan lands! A visit to the museum near the site is also a must.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

214020567.name: Definitely worth visiting! Majestic!
214020567.author: a TripAdvisor user
214020567.reviewBody: If you\'ve visited chichenitza and thought it was amazing then you should also see palenque. Though smaller it has a better jungle charm to it rather than crowds and crowds of ppl walking around with umbrellas like chichenitza. You can still see some of the pigment colouring on some of the walls  We spent about 1.5 hrs in the ruins before going for a jungle hike to see the jungle covered ruins. It gives  you a perspective of what it was like for explorers to find the ruins with the jungle built over it. Alot of the ruins are still not uncovered and I\'ll definitely be back to see it when they do! \nOh, outside the park where all the shops are there is stand that sells mangoes. Try it! really yummy!

213503777.author: a TripAdvisor user
213503777.reviewBody: Hiked for almost 2 hours into the jungle.  We learned alot about the local plants and animals.  We also were shown a hidden Maya temple deep in the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

213308865.name: Best ruins in Mexico
213308865.author: a TripAdvisor user
213308865.reviewBody: This is definitely worth the trip to see, out of all the ruins i saw in Mexico this was by far the best, our guide was fantastic and did a great group discount it is worth having a guide for here, its such an amazing place to see. Only 2% has been uncovered here and it also boasts having the only sarcophagus found outside of Egypt. The national park is the ruins and there is a lovely walk through the forest. Also check out the museum which shows you the artifacts that have been uncovered here.

205841022.name: A must do when visiting Chiapas...
205841022.author: a TripAdvisor user
205841022.reviewBody: It\'s a bit of a duplication as to reviewing the park and then seeing the second attraction as being the ruins as they are inclusive in the first... First off, the park entrance is cheap, 28 pesos pp. A great deal on tis own, but this does not include the ruins... When you take the time to explore beyond the actual Mayan ruins and venture around the park, you see that there is much more to explore in the parks entirety... If you are a trekker, the paths are quite intricate and if you\'re just passing thru, make sure to see the cascadas de la Reina, which are wonderfully clear and pristine pools of water that follow the path of the very different looking falls! Hope this review was helpful!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

204524288.name: Excellent
204524288.author: a TripAdvisor user
204524288.reviewBody: Well preserved impressive ruins. Take about 2-3 hours for the whole thing though bare in mind that it gets very hot and humid as the day progresses. \nA minibus from town costs 15 pesos per person (they will try to tell you that it is 20 but it\'s not!), and leaves every 15 minutes or so. \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

200050637.name: Excellent Maya Site
200050637.author: a TripAdvisor user
200050637.reviewBody:
This site is a must for anyone interested in Maya archaeology. The city state flourished from around 200BC to 800AD and then after it was abandoned, the site was overgrown by jungle. Only the main part of the complex has been excavated. One of the interesting features of the architecture here is the complex roof combs. 

If you want to get the most out of a visit to this, or any of the other Mexican archaeological sites, go with a good guide. This does, however, depend upon your level of knowledge and interest. The site is well maintained. 

It is worth staying locally, if possible, and visiting early, before it gets too hot and the tour groups arrive.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

199235077.name: National Park or Kitsch Market
199235077.author: a TripAdvisor user
199235077.reviewBody: We visited this interesting park as a group of 30 members from Finland. We liked the park very much. Early morning visit is absolutely the best timing. Take a good guide. We did not like the kitsch sellers. They should not be allowed to enter the park, but who cares?\nThe park itself is absolutely worth visiting!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

198116466.name: Awesome
198116466.author: a TripAdvisor user
198116466.reviewBody: This visit should take at least 4 hours. I recommend you buy a guide outside of the site before getting to Palenque (  frommer or other) that explains the ruins a bit more. Early in the morning is definetly the best time to go. Wear good shoes and be ready to climb up lot\'s of steps.\n\nIt\'s awesome to see the ruins of this city built so long ago in history.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

197515199.name: A Definite Go
197515199.author: a TripAdvisor user
197515199.reviewBody: Beautiful scenery and jungle, the mountains here are lush and green. Wildlife and flora abound, so much to see!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

196934768.name: Take a stroll among the Mayan pyramids of Palenque
196934768.author: a TripAdvisor user
196934768.reviewBody:
I've now been to Palenque 3 times and it's always worth a visit. There is no doubt that it's one of the best major attractions in southern Mexico. 

If you want to get the best out of Palenque (especially for photographs) then my recommendation is to take an easy stroll around the ruins spending half a day there. Climb whatever pyramid you can for views and to check out the stone carvings around each pyramid. Don't forget to go on the waterfall trail which takes you into the jungle where you eventually have to descend some steps which lead to a waterfall as well as a few lesser pyramids. You also might be lucky to spot a Howler Monkey. Enjoy the sceneries.

The place is also full of souvenir sellers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

193657747.name: Wonderful Ruins from the Maya Pre-classic Period
193657747.author: a TripAdvisor user
193657747.reviewBody: This ancient Mayan city, sitting in the jungles of Chiapas in Southern Mexico is truly amazing, considering that only a portion has been uncovered by archaeologists. The Observation Tower has been restored, pretty close to its original design. Unfortunately, the Palace of Pakal (the main pyramid, where his tomb was found) was closed to the public during the week of my visit. Otherwise, one could climb up all the remaining pyramids and temples. Don\u2019t forget to visit the Patio of Warrior Chiefs in the northwest corner. This ancient city boasted a drainage system, a water pressure system and saunas. According to the official guides, the latter were reserved for the nobility. There is also a waterfall along the way the exit of the complex which is very relaxing. Don\u2019t forget to visit the Site Museum after visiting the ruins (it was included in my entrance ticket). It houses incredible relics from this lost city.\n\nP.S. Bring plenty of water and some snacks, but don\'t toss the trash around! There are waste disposals right after exiting the complex.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

193388099.name: Excellent historical park
193388099.author: a TripAdvisor user
193388099.reviewBody: Really lovely park, manageable size and impeccably maintained.  Limited food and drink facilities inside (fill up at stalls at main entrance).  No access to main pyramid but you can climb most of the others.  Multi-lingual information boards.  Get there early to avoid tour groups.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

193254038.name: Beautiful Ruines!
193254038.author: a TripAdvisor user
193254038.reviewBody:
So we organised a group at our hostel in Palenque in the afternoon. We went for 50 MPesos per person return in a collectivo to the parc. 
You need to pay a fee to enter the jungle and later a ticket for the Ruines in combination with the museum.

Only 10 procent is discovered and the rest is in the jungle. 
We did not have a guide but that was not really nescary. 
There were a lot of signs were you can get a lot of information. The sights and the ruines are beautiful and amazing. It makes me more interested in the Myth of the maya culture. 

I went after to the museum and on the way you find a waterfal and if you follow the sounds also monkeys everywere around.
The museum is interesting and some artifacts. Special the tube of the king is in there. You get also some explaining in English or Spanish about all the signs. So it is wort to visit. 
And keep a hold to youre ticket. 

In total 28 pesos to enter the Jungle and 59 for the ruines/museum.

Ps Bring a bottle of water you need it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

190559695.name: enchanting place
190559695.author: a TripAdvisor user
190559695.reviewBody: in the hart of the jungle you discover hidden ancient city. Don\'t skip the good tourist guides outside the site

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

190490121.name: Amazing mystical place
190490121.author: a TripAdvisor user
190490121.reviewBody:
We went there last October - 12h overnight by Ado LT bus form Playa del Carmen. Very good luxury class bus with free soft drinks - well worth it - 35$. We arrived 9:30 am and we took cab to Palenque ruins. At the front of entrance we took private guide (800 pesos for two but you can split that between 6 people) - it was worth it because we had a guide for 2 hours inside ruins + 1 hour jungle tour when they will show you the rest of the city which is still untouched and you will not find that on your own.Only 5% of the city is excavated! 

That place is absolutely amazing and will stay in your memory forever...i am crazy about Mayan history and I know what to expect -  but the city of Pacal (king of Palenque) was beyond my expectations.

Architecture is beautiful so is a set up of that city. This is a real lost city because it was left by citizens for over 1000 years. All pyramids and temples looks amazing. Palace of Pacal with tall tower is way more advance that any other Mayan buildings from that era. There is a drainage system + water pressure system and saunas in place!!!

You will need to spend whole day in there as there is so much to see.

It is a must when in Mexico!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

189522344.name: the pyramid in the jungle
189522344.author: a TripAdvisor user
189522344.reviewBody: the ruins locate in the jungle. We got a huge rainstorm when we visited it, so we only explored half of it. But those pyramids are very impressive and much less tourist than chichen itza. I felt like went back to the anchient times.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

188736391.name: Gorgeous
188736391.author: a TripAdvisor user
188736391.reviewBody: Beautiful and clean. The part that goes by the waterfall is great and the views from the top of the buildings are worth the climb. Make sure to check out the museum so you can see Pakal\'s tomb.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

188700445.name: Amazing Mayan ruins
188700445.author: a TripAdvisor user
188700445.reviewBody: Definitely worthwhile. Amazing site of old Mayan ruins. The Palace is amazing. The park is well kept and although its very touristic you can still feel the magic in the air. The howler monkeys make the perfect eerie soundtrack.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

186948556.name: Incredible ruins and historical significance ...
186948556.author: a TripAdvisor user
186948556.reviewBody: The ruins were absolutely stunning and breathtaking ... the best I have ever been to.\n\nThe Park is laid out with very complete explanations everywhere so no need for a guide. The museum is also worth a visit as it gives a more in depth explanation of the Mayan Society that inhabited the ancient city of Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

186866335.name: One item off my bucket list
186866335.author: a TripAdvisor user
186866335.reviewBody:
After so many years of looking at pictures in travel books and magazines, being there and actually looking at it and touching it, the only thing I can say is WOW! 

Although it drizzled on and off, the combination of the buildings and temples, the mist and the low-lying clouds covering the mountain tops gave me a feeling that I was in a dream. Climb the Temple of the Cross and you get another spectacular view of the site. This is a truly remarkable place and one that I will think of whenever I need to relax.

Be sure to spend some quality time in the museum. Their collection of artifacts is outstanding and you get to see an actual sized replica of Pakal's sarcophagus.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

186845996.name: Unforgettable experience
186845996.author: a TripAdvisor user
186845996.reviewBody: jungle walk is a must. The site is awesome, one of the best experiences in Mexico. Enjoyed every view and every minute

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

183423204.name: Once in a Life Time Experience
183423204.author: a TripAdvisor user
183423204.reviewBody: This is a Special place, takes minimum 4 hours to make the rounds, w/out the museum.  If you are lucky to come on a non-rainy, but overcast day, great diffused light makes excellent compositions of ancient rocks and exuberant nature. Enter with a 20 peso colectivo from town, pay access and entrance fees and leave via "Murcielago" exit and catch a 20 peso ride back. nice half day trip, bring your own water and snack unless you had a good breakfast.  NO NEED for any tour guides, come early, like at 8 am to beat the pinche crowds.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

182993122.name: Fantastic experience!
182993122.author: a TripAdvisor user
182993122.reviewBody: You absolutely cannot skip Palenque if you are in the area!  We took a bus from San Cristobal (5-6 hours) and then spent a few days in Palenque to visit these ruins as well as Bonampak & Yaxchilan and the Agua Azul and Misol Ha waterfalls.  We took a collectivo (20 pesos per person) from Palenque town to the archeological park.  The entrance fees are extremely reasonable.  We hired a tour guide to take us through the main plaza of the ruins and also a short tour through the jungle to show us some Mayan medical plants and wildlife.  I would definitely recommend a tour guide to get a better understanding of the ruins.  At the park entrance you can purchase snacks, bottled water and other beverages, and souvenirs. Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

181772443.name: After 20 years my dream has come true
181772443.author: a TripAdvisor user
181772443.reviewBody: Ruins of Palenque are the most beautiful ruins you will see in Mexico. I have been to many of the ones in Yucatan and Quintana Roo and these are by far the best. Bring your camera and enjoy the scenery and magnificence of the Mayans.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

181154074.name: A must visit!
181154074.author: a TripAdvisor user
181154074.reviewBody: Make sure you visit the ruins at Palenque, they are incredible, and in my opinion one of the most beautiful Mayan ruins in Mexico.\nI would recommend you to hire a guide on the ruins entrance, so you can understand about its history a bit better. The tour usually lasts about 2-3hrs, and you can find guides that speak almost any language. You can haggle over the price to get a better rate, I got charged 450MXN for a tour just for me and my husband.\nKeep in mind, the weather is usually sunny and humid out there, so wear comfy clothes and shoes and if possible bring a cap and sun screen.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

181003650.name: Incredible Mayan Site!
181003650.author: a TripAdvisor user
181003650.reviewBody: This extensive site should be on everyone\'s "must see" list. This beautiful site includes everything from palacesa nd tombs to enchating waterfalls. Will gladly return whenever I get the chance.\nHighly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

180348408.name: One of the best Mayan Ruins
180348408.author: a TripAdvisor user
180348408.reviewBody: This was our second trip to the ruins of Palenque. The park is beautifully laid out with a path to follow, and the opportunity to climb all over the ruins. There so so much to see here that our half-day was not enough. On the trail down is a nice waterfall, and at the end an excellent museum with videos that explain a lot of the history (Spanish with English subtitles).\n\nNot to be missed!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

176385581.name: The Magical Mayan Ruins of Palenque
176385581.author: a TripAdvisor user
176385581.reviewBody: To see the imposing structures of Palenque, with their bas-relief carvings, their water channels and hidden chambers, is to feel an enormous respect for the civilization that produced them and to risk becoming an obsessive student of the great Mayan culture.  New discoveries, such as the burial chamber of the Red Queen (shown by DNA analysis to be unrelated to the King Pakal and so probably his wife) and the accurate dates of reigns from a millenium before Pakal, engraved on that king\'s tomb, will feed such a compulsion to know more.  The on-site museum is fascinating, but you might want to Google for more information afterwards.  If possible, athletic visitors should enter the site by the winding path through the jungle across from the museum, rather than proceeding directly up the road to the crowded parking lot.  The jungle path is a joy on its own as it climbs between enormous tropical trees or crosses clear rivers on wooden bridges, passing by small ruins of Mayan aristocrats\' houses.  The 20 minute walk will whet your appetite for the major sites you will see when you emerge into the main area of the site and heighten your appreciation of the dark rainforest behind the pyramids.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

176099733.name: Gorgeous Site
176099733.author: a TripAdvisor user
176099733.reviewBody: I have visited many sites in Guatemala and Mexico and Palenque was one of my favorites. For 20 pesos a person (there was 3 of us) we took a taxi all the way to the entrance. There are 2 fees you need to (most sites in Mexico ask for a national and local fee). I loved that you can still climb the pyramids (other sites in Mexico you can\'t) and its not over saturated with vendors (like Chichen Itza) or tourists. Very quiet. You can enjoy your walk and take plenty of pictures. I definitely recommend it and would love to go again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

173936822.name: Mind blowing, Place is amazing!
173936822.author: a TripAdvisor user
173936822.reviewBody: This is a must see in Chiapas. So much to see here. I really recommend checking out the museum too, some unique pieces can be seen there. The surroundings are beautiful jungle setting even able to catch a glimpse of some wildlife and saw spider monkies in the trees. I just wish it was closer to San Cristobal. It best to spend some time in Palenque so you can do a full day visit to the site. A typical Tour  offer too little time and a really late return to San Cristobal. So many places to explore on paths into the jungles with ruins all over the place you really need a good amount of time here. Bring plenty of water it can get hot and sticky plus need to do a lot of walking. I am glad the grounds are kept in good condition with all the people coming here. Palenque is a definate Hit!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

172328800.name: If you have to make a choice between palenque and any of the other maya remains : Palenque !
172328800.author: a TripAdvisor user
172328800.reviewBody: Actually it is not really justified to list archeological digs on something like a rating. They all have something that\'s interesting or unique. But Palenque even surprised me as a hardcore traveller and I was very glad I took the time to make a detour and visit this beautiful spot. It\'s obviously less crowded than Ch.Itza, but there\'\'s more to make it attractive. Nr 1. : less souvenir sellers, nr 2, the lush green sorroundings, nr. 3 the options of taking an ecological hike thru the forest. So, when in doubt ? Just go and enjoy this wonderful place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

171470630.name: Great Ruins - More Original than Chich\u00e9n Itza
171470630.author: a TripAdvisor user
171470630.reviewBody:
The National Park of Palenque is a great place to visit in the south of Mexico.
The ruins are located a little off the city. Buses and Colectivos/Combis run all the day. Take one near Palenque's Bus station that says "ruinas" on its sign. Prices vary depending on spanish knowledge and driver's mood.
The archeological sight is huge. In fact it's bigger than the one in Chichén Itza and far less crowded. Go there in the morning to hear the howling monkeys and to enjoy the ruins in a calmer atmosphere. Don't forget to check out the "queen's bath" at the opposite of the entrance (a 10-15 minutes stroll).
