If you wish to eat and drink during your stay, bring food and water with you. Prices are high at the entrance area.
There are several tour guides offering their services. Check out prices BEFORE the tour (if you want one at all).
Keep in mind that there might be events or gatherings at the time of the solstices. New Age followers should have their favourite turist season around those days.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

170970972.name: Palenque
170970972.author: a TripAdvisor user
170970972.reviewBody: The park is beautiful, very clean, this was not ,y first time so there have been many changes, some reconstruction was taking place but you could still admire the greatness.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

167509208.name: Amazing site
167509208.author: a TripAdvisor user
167509208.reviewBody: Amazing history, buildings and suroundings ! This site is huge !! Buildings everywhere and absolutly beautiful. Absolutly as good as chichen itza of maybe even better. After seeing all the buildings you Can take a walk in the jungles and se beautiful waterfalls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

166992350.name: Awesome
166992350.author: a TripAdvisor user
166992350.reviewBody: Ruins of the Mayan Empire that date from 226 BCE - 1123 CE; only about 5% of them are excavated: the remaining 95% are still in the surrounding jungle. Beautiful walking trails, unexpected surprises: cascades! - and of course, those incredible ruins in all their splendor

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

162972169.name: No need to look for unexcavated ruins, there are plenty that have been excavated that are not open to viewing.
162972169.author: a TripAdvisor user
162972169.reviewBody:
My biggest disappointment was in the number of areas that were closed to viewing.  Let me recount - Temple XIII and the tomb of the queen, Temple of the Inscriptions and the entire Southern Acropolis.which includes Temples XVII, XIX, XX, XXI and XXII.

Don't get me wrong, there was still a lot to see and I spent two days there exploring the site.  Most of my time was spent at El Palacio and Grupo de las Cruces.

The museum is a must see and is one of the finest site museums to which I have been.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

162658844.name: Gotta see it
162658844.author: a TripAdvisor user
162658844.reviewBody: We paid $500 pesos for a tour (3 hours) for four of us.  Ask for the jungle tour in addition to the ruins.  The guide was really knowledgeable.  His name was Joel.  He was great.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

161608031.name: Great Site!!
161608031.author: a TripAdvisor user
161608031.reviewBody:
You should definitely see this site. Its Beautiful and Has great Photo Opportunities. Also I found the vendors great here - I bought several great things here. Just be prepared to Bargain!! 
There are opportunities to do a jungle walk here - Do it! Great Pictures!
Do the guided tour - There is lots of interesting facts to learn. Edgar was great!! 

Bring Sunblock and Hat - You need water here for Sure!! Its Very hot! Plus Bugspray is a MUST - there are mosquitoes in the jungle..

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

161374643.name: it was an aaahhhh moment
161374643.author: a TripAdvisor user
161374643.reviewBody: the penultimate Mayan ruin and get a guide as it makes sense of all the old stone - jungle walks and museum also good

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

160486912.name: dissenting opinion / others are better
160486912.author: a TripAdvisor user
160486912.reviewBody: Palenque is a very good site, don\'t get me wrong. But if you are to choose between the variety of archaeological sites in Mexico, I wouldn\'t pick Palenque first (and I\'ve read/heard many people say they would.) For jungle experiences, Calakmul is absolutely the best. For proximity to major cities and grandeur, Teotihuacan, Uxmal, and Chichen Itza are both better bets. And for historical value, I think El Tajin is much more interesting. Sure, it\'s a good site, but i don\'t think it\'s the best - not even in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

160130155.name: The Best
160130155.author: a TripAdvisor user
160130155.reviewBody: Palenque is my favourite of the Mayan sites I have seen.  Such a gorgeous setting and such beautiful buildings.  I waited thirty years to get here and was not disappointed!  Better than Tikal and Copan, which are also great, but if you had to choose only one to visit, make it Palenque.\n\nYou need a lot of time, as there is also the museum to see, so start in the morning.  It was pouring rain when we visited, and there are vendors selling the plastic rain ponchos if you wanted one.  Admission price is very reasonable and it is easy to get to from town.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

159594227.name: Amazing!
159594227.author: a TripAdvisor user
159594227.reviewBody: My favourite attraction / ruins in Mexico, absolutely great!\n\nIt\'s good to see early in the morning when temperature is cool and site is not crowded.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

158920549.name: An absolute must-see
158920549.author: a TripAdvisor user
158920549.reviewBody: My favourite ruins in the whole of Mexico, even though the weather wasn\'t fantastic. We didn\'t hire a guide as we thought it was pretty expensive but still thoroughly enjoyed wandering around the ruins in such a fantastic setting. The museum at the end of the park is also definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

158895100.name: Best Ruins in the Mayan World
158895100.author: a TripAdvisor user
158895100.reviewBody: Great artwork, excellent excavations, interesting history and feel of the place.  Only wish we could have gone swimming in the pools of the waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

158422542.name: Go early
158422542.author: a TripAdvisor user
158422542.reviewBody: Excellent site - but make sure you go early, when it is cool and shaded, not in the humid heat of the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

157732372.name: Only 2% of the site is clear
157732372.author: a TripAdvisor user
157732372.reviewBody: Went to see the tomb of the great Rey Packal, in Palenque, but discovered that the jungle keeps covered must of the remains of this fantastic city, we went in a tour trough the jungle to find many, many edifications completeky coverd by jungle nd vegetation, it was an incredible civilization, they even built underground aqueducts, if you hire a guide, he can show you where they are covered by the jungle,  this is a fantastic journey back in time, spended over two hours just walking through jungle looking for sites.\nTha part of Palenque that is clear, takes only about an hour to see, I also recomend to visit the onsite museum at teh entrnce of the park

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

157216228.name: Serene and accessible
157216228.author: a TripAdvisor user
157216228.reviewBody: Palenque\'s ruins were a breath of fresh air. You can actually climb up most of them and fully interact with the environment while you hear the jungle animals in the landscape. It\'s worth it to be there early and take your time as there is a lot of climbing here if you are so inclined and the entrance can get congested later. There are plenty of interesting carvings, inscriptions and buildings on this site, but it is a little small if you do not go off the beaten path and will only take you 2-3 hours to fully explore. We took a taxi to the ruins and a collectivo back, as we couldn\'t find any taxi\'s after we walked down from the site and visited the free museum. Make sure you visit the museum as there is an amazing coffin on display which must be seen and I\'m not usually into museums while on vacation.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

157087794.name: amazing ruins
157087794.author: a TripAdvisor user
157087794.reviewBody: palenque ruins are my favourite, they are set in the jungle and there are waterfalls, its a magical place. there is also a possibility to stay in some of the places on the way to the ruins and enjoy the quietness of the forest. its difficult to say more, just visit palenque, its worth it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155971817.name: Palenque Ruins
155971817.author: a TripAdvisor user
155971817.reviewBody: Just came back from Palenque, Mexico.   I had been there some 20 years ago.  It was a bit disapointing since now you can\'t go into the Palace to visit the Pacal masterpiece.  I rate it with a four only because of the wonderful fauna and flora at the end of the visit, if not it would have gotten a three.  If you want to experience a mayan site go to Yaxchilan.  For us this was truly a trip worth taking!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155871529.name: Could have spent the whole day in this park
155871529.author: a TripAdvisor user
155871529.reviewBody: Like many other reviewers say, it is a very beautiful site of maya ruin. At the same time, it is not only a ruin site, it is also a national park with hiking trails which are fun to explore. You will see unexpected staff (monkeys, some more ruins etc.) There were some local tourist guides waiting in front of the entrance of the park. I would recommend hiring one if it is your first time visit. It helps you learn more about the site. Be sure to bargain the price with them as they expect you will.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155749741.name: Stunning
155749741.author: a TripAdvisor user
155749741.reviewBody: We stayed two nights in the town of Palenque so we could spend many hours at the archaelogical site. You can park your car in the museum parking lot, walk up hill a short way on the road, and enter the site by a path on your left. Here are only a few people selling crafts and bottles of water.  You must walk up quite a few steps to get to the plateau where the major buildings are, but you\'ll pass small ruins and walk along a cascade, deeper into the jungle.  If you are lucky, as we were, you will hear and see howler monkies.Once on the plateau, the gigantic temples loom above you, and you can still climb almost all of them.  There are stone benches under old spreading trees, where you can rest and regard the buildings.  We were at the site for about four hours, climbing and looking.  We descended by the same path and visited the museum, gift shops, and restroom.  If climbing stairs is not for you, I believe you can easily enter the site by the official parking lot up the hill from the path near the museum.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155739549.name: STUNNING
155739549.author: a TripAdvisor user
155739549.reviewBody: By all means, give yourself the gift of time well spent here at this truly remarkable corner of the world! The area is very clean, guides are abundant......\'tho not necessary...there is lots of shade, many, many stone benches for resting and various low key vendors here and there. Tour busses come from PALENQUE and are reasonably priced. The museum is state of the art.....I encourage anyone to visit this area.....one thing to mention....there are lots of areas with stairs....we were tired by the end of the day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155459537.name: You must visit this site before you die!
155459537.author: a TripAdvisor user
155459537.reviewBody: This city is awe-inspiring. The temples that have been reclaimed from the jungle are amazing in their design and history. We hired a guide for a tour of both the reclaimed city and the 75% of the city that remains under the jungle. Words cannot express the wonder and interest of this historic siteand the beauty of the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155412626.name: Breathtaking!!!
155412626.author: a TripAdvisor user
155412626.reviewBody: The best place to visit at Yucatan State. After a one hour walk in the tropical forest, we suddenly came to this archeological site. It may not be as popular as Chichen Itza but in my opinion you will like it more. Many stone reliefs are well protected. You can touch and walk on the history. Souvenirs are cheaper here. If you take a guide you can learn the amazing history of the structures. Check my pictures, you will really satisfied to be here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155354816.name: Spectacular!
155354816.author: a TripAdvisor user
155354816.reviewBody: Beautiful, awe-inspiring location.  Unique and exquiste ruins. Very good museum nearby. We were permitted to climb on, in, and around just about all temples, not including Temple of the Inscriptions.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155334308.name: Ruins of Palenque
155334308.author: a TripAdvisor user
155334308.reviewBody: Very interesting and a quite scary history in this large area of huge pyramides from the ancient Mexican history.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155294690.name: Good choice to go.
155294690.author: a TripAdvisor user
155294690.reviewBody: Excellent place to go on your next vacations, it is really impressive being in a place with thousands of years and imagine the lifestyle of that people, I strongly think you are going to enjoy the walking around the park, so do not forget to bring confortables shoes, a bottle of water and of course solar protector if you don want to get burned.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155174211.name: It\'s a must
155174211.author: a TripAdvisor user
155174211.reviewBody: Beautiful mayan site, absolutely worth the visit. The entrance is quite crowded, lots of food and clothes vendors. We recommend that you get a guide, they offer a quick one hour guided visit, which is perfect if you have small children in your group. If you can stay longer, by all means do it, the site is amazing and rich in history and anecdotes. You will not regret visiting Palenque!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

155094369.name: You will not regret the visit
155094369.author: a TripAdvisor user
155094369.reviewBody: We just got back from Palenque last night and LOVE the trip! We were told to go see the park early in the morning bcs it will get hot quickly isn\'t the day. So, we took our friends words to heart and got there before 9 a.m. It was burning by 10 a.m.. Also, take your water bottle with you! We, the family of both teens and toddler, of 5 have visited many of the sitios archeologicos in Mexico and this is by far the prettiest we have seen. Every corner you turn is another stunning view for photograph. Don\'t forget your Nikon at home for this trip!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154762625.name: If you can only visit 1 Maya site, go to Palenque
154762625.author: a TripAdvisor user
154762625.reviewBody:
It was our first Maya site, and we was really taken. Then we visited other places, so I will try to compare them with Palenque from my point of view:

Tikal is a bit better, but overpriced (about three times more than Palenque).
Chichen Itza is overpriced, overcrowded by both visitors and souvenir sellers.
Tulum is only visited because is on the coast. Not worth the money (same price as Palenque)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154648189.name: words can\'t explain
154648189.author: a TripAdvisor user
154648189.reviewBody: Incredible!  A real don\'t miss.  Far more impressive than the many other very impressive sites I\'ve seen.  It is a little out of the way and hard to get to, but well work the trip.  My photos of the place are outstanding.  It is beautiful, it is large and a real pleasure to tour this site.  Enjoy

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154503455.name: The most magical of the Mayan Ruins
154503455.author: a TripAdvisor user
154503455.reviewBody:
We have been to most of the Mayan ruins and Palenque is still our favorite.  The builders of Palenque had a sense of architecture and artistry beyond what you will see in the other places.  

We were here in the 1970's and the site is just as good today.  You can no longer go down into Pakal's tomb, but the exhibit in the museum is really better in many ways.  The tomb itself is very small and dark, so it was difficult to see much.  In the exhibit you can walk around the tomb and look in through the plexiglass walls.  

If you have studied much in advance you might not want a guide, but there are no books about the site available there, at least in English.  So for most people a guide is probably worthwhile.  

Palenque is in a jungle, so it can be hot and especially humid.  I think a little rain is common for much of the year.  But it can be very atmospheric with the mist hanging on the hills and trees surrounding the site.  

Between the museum and the site, you can spend most of a day here.  

Like all Mayan ruins there are a lot of stairs and many of them are steep.  If it is damp they can be slippery.  The temples at the tops of the pyramids are where most of the carvings are, so if you want to see them, you need to go up.  To really understand the Palace structure, you need to go up and down stairs there too.  
If you have any trouble with stairs or balance I would recommend a walking stick or trekking pole.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154373807.name: Beautiful Maya ruins in lush jungle
154373807.author: a TripAdvisor user
154373807.reviewBody: Even though travel guides advise to come early to avoid groups the best time to be in de central part (Templo de las Inscripciones and Palacio) is around noon when the groups have left for lunch. Don\'t just go to the central part though but also visit Grupo Murcielagos and Grupos 1, 2, A and B. After visiting I would advise the following itinerary: park at Museo (this also avoids being harassed by salespeople and "guides"), take the entrance here and go up via Grupo Murcielagos, A and B while enjoying the waterfalls. Then visit Acropolis Sur, Palacio and the Temples, conclude your visit of the central part with Grupo Norte and then go down via Grupos 1 and 2. If you choose one pyramid not to climb choos the rabbit skull one, although that said it gives nice views over the Palacio.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154358564.name: Awesome ruins with a superb guide
154358564.author: a TripAdvisor user
154358564.reviewBody: Palenque is so breathtaking that we visited two days in a row.  We were lucky enough to find Victor Damas, an amazing guide who speaks several languages.  He has worked at the Palenque site since the 1960s when he was a boy and worked with many of the archeaologists that have since passed away.  \n\nPalenque is so big with many ruins still engulfed by nature.  I would not recommend doing a tour from San Cristobal.  We came from San Cristobal from Palenque on a tour and it only allowed for 2 hours at the ruins which is not near enough time and you don\'t reach the site until the afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154301996.name: Spectacular
154301996.author: a TripAdvisor user
154301996.reviewBody: Stunning Mayan site, one of the top three we have visited, the other two being Tikal and Calakmul.  Get a guide, worth it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

154162808.name: Palenque should be a world wonder
154162808.author: a TripAdvisor user
154162808.reviewBody:
The ruins are stunning, sack off chichen itza for here! 

Less tourists and larger ruins. Surrounded by mountains and amazing sounds. 

Ignore the tour guides at the beggining head straight into the ruins, you'll love it, sun drenched.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

153882901.name: Palenque is a wonderful site!!
153882901.author: a TripAdvisor user
153882901.reviewBody: Palenque is a MUST if you are interested in Mayan history. The buildings themselves are amazing, but couple this with the scenic location it becomes magical. The only thing that I didn\'t care for was the close proximity of the merchants selling things at the entrance and inside the park. The only thing I could think of is the Jimmy Buffet line, "Fins to the left, Fins to the right and I\'m the only bait in town."

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

153816537.name: Magical!
153816537.author: a TripAdvisor user
153816537.reviewBody:
The road to the ruins climbs upward through dense jungle.  We try to catch glimpses of the ruins but all we see are trees and more trees.  It's not until after we've entered the park, climbed a set of stairs and wander down a path that suddenly everything opens up and wow! we're face to face with the Temple of the Inscriptions, the largest in Palenque. 

You're only allowed to climb to the first level of this pyramid, but it provides you a close up view of the level of detailed work done by the Mayas.  Be sure to take advantage of climbing all the other buildings not only for the amazing views, but to appreciate the numerous glyphs showcased.  The Palace, in particular, has plenty to explore including underground tunnels that wind from one end of the complex to the other.  

What's so magical about Palenque is the fact that it's been so lovingly restored.  You have to wonder how anyone ever stumbled across it, tucked into the jungle hillside.  The lush grounds are well-groomed, making the entire area look and feel like a giant park--so tranquil!  Do follow the path across the river that leads you through additional, smaller ruins and eventually ends steps from the museum, which is definitely worth visiting.

Tip:  if you've parked your car at the entrance, you can stop one of the Collectivos en route and hitch a ride for 10 pesos instead of walking the steep hill back to the parking lot.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

153462747.name: A breathtaking experience
153462747.author: a TripAdvisor user
153462747.reviewBody: View of the site from the top of the North Group of Buildings was stunning. Very accessible site for explroing; only the Temple of Inscriptions area was out of bounds for climbing and closer inspection. Be sure to explore the palace in detail and don\u00b4t miss the well marked path through the jungle past several other smaller groups of buildings to the magnificent museum. The highlight of the museum is the sarcophagus of the ruler Pakal found in the Temple of the Inscriptions. So impressive. Ties with Monte Alban as the best site in Mexico for me

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

153151210.name: A must see!
153151210.author: a TripAdvisor user
153151210.reviewBody: The Palenque archaelogical site is simply amazing! Besides the cultural and architectural richness of the site, its setting in the middle of the jungle provides an additional beauty to this place. We hired a guide at the entrance, who was knowledgeable and very professional, helped to better understand the history and setting of Palenque

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

153029553.name: One of the most important Maya ruins
153029553.author: a TripAdvisor user
153029553.reviewBody: You should try to go to those ruins, one of the most important in Mexico and of course in Chiapas area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

152664733.name: Atmospheric
152664733.author: a TripAdvisor user
152664733.reviewBody: What a place.We were lucky, (in my estimation) that we visited the ruin when it was overcast with a bit of a drizzle.That gave Palenque an amazing mystic. The mist over the jungle and the pyramides added an aura of a sort.We engaged a guide who was knowledgable and gave us more than just a written description.\nRun, don\'t go.\nIt\'s one of the most fantastic places to visit in Mexico

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

152064657.name: Wonderful, must see
152064657.author: a TripAdvisor user
152064657.reviewBody: Even when you don\'t know much about Maya culture, like me, these ruins are probably going to be one of the most impressing things of your trip to mexico. I visited the ruins in the afternoon, it wasn\'t busy at all.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

152063238.name: One of best Mayan sites in Mexico
152063238.author: a TripAdvisor user
152063238.reviewBody: Palenque is built on a mountain side, with the jungle as a back drop.  I have been to every major Mayan ruin in Mexico and would rate this number 1 for beauty.  Too bad they do not allow swimming in Queen\'s Bath any more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

151575480.name: Mayan Ruins
151575480.author: a TripAdvisor user
151575480.reviewBody:
On our way to Guatemala we decided to spend a night in Palenque to check out the ruins. During the morning and afternoon there are colectivos running along the main street so we flagged one down. It only took about 15 minutes to get from town to the archeological site. Note that you have to pay an entrance fee to get into the national park and another entrance fee to get into the archeological zone. I can't recall what the national park fee was but the archeological zone fee was $57MX. 

The ruin site is decent size but can be easily explored in 3 hours. You can certainly spend more time depending on how intricate your exploring methods are. The ruins are well restored and well maintained. Most of the structures are climbable but a few are roped off. This site doesn't have the tallest pyramids in Mexico but you can still get a great view from the tops of some of them. There aren't a lot of carvings or drawings left as looters have pillaged the site over the centuries. Luckily there are still a few spots where artwork is visible.

There's a small market within the archeological zone for purchasing souvenirs. Most of the vendors are selling the same stuff but there is a lot of nice stuff. We were able to get a Mayan calendar painting for 50% cheaper than the original asking price so be sure to make low ball offers.

When you're ready to go back to town there are Colectivos waiting in the parking lot. In town we were told that it's $10MX each way but we were charged $20MX each way. Perhaps we were ripped off but oh well, it's the price you pay for visiting amazing places like this sometimes :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

151079223.name: A unique site!
151079223.author: a TripAdvisor user
151079223.reviewBody: Archaeological site in the middle of the jungle, not much touristic and with a magical atmosphere. It worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

151074199.name: Amazing!
151074199.author: a TripAdvisor user
151074199.reviewBody: The great thing about the Palenque ruins is that a lot is known about it - the characters, the culture, the purpose of the buildings and temples.  Make sure you get a guide!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

150885288.name: Dramatic ruins
150885288.author: a TripAdvisor user
150885288.reviewBody: Very interesting ruins in a gorgeous setting.  I highly recommend hiring a guide.  It\'s not expensive and there are many good guides who speak English.  We chose a Maya guide who was very proud of his culture and that was a big plus

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

150549653.name: A "Must Visit" location
150549653.author: a TripAdvisor user
150549653.reviewBody: I have visited many archeological sites in Mexico but the Mayan sites are in a league of thier own and Palenque is perhaps amoung the best of them.  In a jungle setting and fairly well preserved although the humidity is taking it\'s toll on the limestone structures.  It is unfortunate that the more interesting parts of the site such as the tomb of Pakal are not accessible anymore.  We happened to be there on a no so busy day and were able to negotiate a good price with an english speaking guide who was able to tell us a little of the lore that goes along with this place and expand on the little bit of information on the information plaques dotting the area.  Certainly not the biggest site but very unique from Chichen Itza or Tulum.  A real plus is that the beauty of this site is not detracted from by hawkers and peddlers as it is in Chichen Itza.  We particularly enjoyed the walking path from the ruins to the museum.  There were a lot more of the ruins to be seen along the path.  If you\'re lucky, you will hear the howeler monkeys from the reserve not far away as you walk.  The museum contains some of the artifacts from the site and entry is included with your entry fee to the main site.  Unfortunately, some of the more important artifacts are reproductions with the originals being housed in Mexico city.  You will have to pay the entry fee to the national park as well as the entry fee to the site.  I wish we had more time to take in this site.  I would love to go back for another visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

150465024.name: Amazing. Worth the trip...
150465024.author: a TripAdvisor user
150465024.reviewBody: truly one of the top 10 ruins in the Mayan world. Kohunlich, Calakmul , Uxmal and Chichen Itza are all inspiring in their own right but Palenque has it\'s own charm...Take 1/2 a day and see it right. Start early and miss some of the crowds...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

150416756.name: You can\'t die without visiting this place
150416756.author: a TripAdvisor user
150416756.reviewBody:
I have visited this place many times and every single one of them I look forward to the next.

There is something really incredible about walking into the jungle to find such magnificent buildings!

Is hard to believe that a City of such dimensions could exist in the middle of the jungle and be kept the way this one is.

My personal favorite in all the Mayan places I have visited.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

150072763.name: Muy lindo!!!!
150072763.author: a TripAdvisor user
150072763.reviewBody: It\'s very very nice!!! We paid a tour to go, but you can go without tour by yourself. I slept in the town of Palenque and I enjoy their energy.\nEs muy muy lindo!!! Con mi pareja dormimos en el pueblo de Palenque y pudimos disfrutar de su energ\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

149686269.name: Palenque ruins, jungle walk and Museum
149686269.author: a TripAdvisor user
149686269.reviewBody:
Fantastic visit. The ruins are outstanding, mystical, ancient, buried in the jungle and impressive very impressive. We hired a guide at the ruin entrance. First guide to approach us wanted 700 or 800 pesos. We chuckled and met another guide going with a small group, paid 100 pesos each. My wife purchased a poncho at the ruin entrance for 50-60 pesos. Palenque is in one of the wettest regions in Mexico. The rain added to the mystery of Palenque. The rain clouds shrouded the tops of some of the ruins. The ruins are in excellent shape for being buried by jungle. There is still some stucco and color remaining in and on the parts of the ruins. There are also very detailed carvings still remaining at Palenque. The uncovered part of Palenque is so impressive because at the site you realize it is only a small portion of what remains uncovered in the area. Easily visible and towering over the uncovered ruins is hill with an uncovered temple. I was told the uncovered temple is as large as the pyramids in Eygyt. We were allowed to enter some of the ruins to see some tombs and sleeping areas. Some areas we explored i heard will be closed within the next year. At the entrance/exit area to the ruins there is a gathering of vendors selling their wares and food stands. 
Parking was a little tough for those who came later but really only added a few more minutes of walking to the ruin site.
The jungle walk was a fun walk through the jungle. We saw unexcavated ruins along the trail and some unique fuana. Was a river with waterfalls along the trail.Although available we did not hire a guide for the walk.
Museum- well worth the time. It would be a shame not to go to the museum if you were at the  ruins.
The museum has decorative collections that should not be missed. The museum was fascinating there are masks, a sarcoficas, (hope I spelt that right), walls with carvings, ritual items jade jewellry from tombs, writings, tools, and much more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

149673473.name: amazing
149673473.author: a TripAdvisor user
149673473.reviewBody: Make sure to get a guided tour. around 200 pesos. in english or spanish. so worth it to get the inside scoop. make sure to visit the musem as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

149421256.name: Richard in Palenque with friends
149421256.author: a TripAdvisor user
149421256.reviewBody: After many visits to the ancient Mayan city of Palenque I found the exciting addition of a jungle walk and wonderful new museum. My disappointment was the clutter of so many vendors and closure of the Temple of Inscriptions. Other than that it remains one of my favorite sites in the Yucatan.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

149170175.name: Just have to go..
149170175.author: a TripAdvisor user
149170175.reviewBody: I am amazed of what they did, but every couple of years they are closing limiting the climbing of the piramids so better go when you can.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

149132944.name: Mystical Mayan City
149132944.author: a TripAdvisor user
149132944.reviewBody: I wanted to come here some40+ years ago but our first child precluded us from taking what then was a difficult journey.  We are so glad we finally made it.  Having seen Eygpt Ankor Wat Mexico City Peru Greece Israel we were curious as to both the similarities and uniqueness of the mesoamerican cultures .\nThis is truly a mystical wonder both architectural and artistic. The surrounding jungle mist shrouded mountains significantly add to its attraction. These people were gifted beyond available tools of the day. Remarkable

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

148392130.name: Where a Predators movie should be filmed
148392130.author: a TripAdvisor user
148392130.reviewBody: Palenque is an awesome ruin surrounded by jungle rendering it into an amazing experience.  During the time of the Mayans the jungle was most probably clear cut, but as a modern day treasure it very much provides a remarkable perspective on its importance and size.\n\nHaving said that, it ,made me wish and hope that the next Predator movie would be filmed in this location during the time Mayans.  What if the archaeologist had found a tablet which contained the glyph of a Predator.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

148174402.name: Palenque: Pakal\'s Pride
148174402.author: a TripAdvisor user
148174402.reviewBody:
Palenque is one of the most important Mayan cities. Its architecture is astonishing and its currently very well preserved.

Its easy to get there. Signs to get there are clear and the road is in a good shape. Outside the ruins there are a lot of street vendors (a bit annoying) and they will charge you around 2USD for parking. Even though we arrived at the time the place opens, it was crowded within half an hour. Palenque is the most visited Mayan city in Chiapas so plan accordingly.

We paid for a guide that charged us 10 USD per persons (we were 4). We didn't appreciate the guide. Seemed like he was on a hurry and we didn't visit all buildings. He also gave us a mini tour in the Jungle which was a bit lame.

The place is huge and awesome. Its all green and very humid (remember to carry water).  There's a lot of pretty water ducts surrounding the place. The Mayans used this for their water systems (they even had toilets and sewer systems)
There are a lot of must see buildings. The Temple of the Inscriptions is the main attraction. These inscriptions record 189 years of the city's history. It also contained Pakal´s Tomb. The Palace and the temples of the Cross are other amazing buildings to see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

148157622.name: Jungle ruins!
148157622.author: a TripAdvisor user
148157622.reviewBody: This was by far my favorite of the Mayan ruins I visited in Mexico.  It\'s off the beaten path and thus less touristy (a good thing in my opinion).  You can climb most of the structures, and take in panoramic views of the jungle vista.  It\'s a large site; you can easilyi spend most of your day here.  There are many structures that have yet to be unearthed.  We hiked into the jungle and saw many mounds with stones protruding from under them; they\'re basically Mayan structures that are still buried by centuries of decomposed jungle compost.  Since you\'re in the jungle, be prepared for rain!  And some wildlife. (I saw howler monkeys and a snake)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

148052153.name: Impressive and worth a trip
148052153.author: a TripAdvisor user
148052153.reviewBody: While you can no longer climb and go into the Temple of Inscriptions, there are plenty of structures to climb on.  Our guide says that you can see the winter solstice sun as well as the summer solstice light hit inside the top of the Temple of the Sun (was raining on winter solstice 2012 so I couldn\'t see).  Be extremely careful when rainy, I saw someone fall off of one of the pyramids.  There are vendors outside the park with drinks/snacks and crafts.  Inside, there are also vendors with crafts.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

147259887.name: Very interesting Mayan Place
147259887.author: a TripAdvisor user
147259887.reviewBody: My experience was incredible!  We hired a guide outside the park and he explained all the constructions and history with pictures and all. We were 8 people and we had to pay 50 pesos each.  It is amazing all the work they have to do to restore this ceremonial center in the middle of the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

147070759.name: The Ruins
147070759.author: a TripAdvisor user
147070759.reviewBody: Have to visit it to understand but well worth the trip. This is by far the best ruins I have visited in Mexico however there are so many more than I can visit so I could be biased.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146815055.name: Not easy to get to, but worth seeing!
146815055.author: a TripAdvisor user
146815055.reviewBody: We started our trip in Mexico City, and got to Palenque by taking a 2 hour flight to Villahermosa, and then a 2 hr shuttle bus from the airport. Would recommend staying outside the town for the lushness of the jungle. The ruins are incredible! Since Palenque is not the easiest to get to, you may find yourself almost having the place to yourself (unlike other more popular attractions).  It\'s also great because, unlike Chichen Itza, there are no restrictions on climbing them, so you can explore freely.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146787735.name: Amazing
146787735.author: a TripAdvisor user
146787735.reviewBody: I never knew that there were a lot of kinds of mangoes until i went to National Park of palenque which our guide introduced to us. it was very delicious. the place is very beautiful, especially the hidden falls inside the jungle on the way out.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146548008.name: Fantastic Mayan site in the jungle
146548008.author: a TripAdvisor user
146548008.reviewBody: This is one of the most interesting Mayan ruins, not to be missed! It is a vast site, with many pyramids, the great palace and lots of plazas and it is right in the jungle.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146503178.name: Stunning
146503178.author: a TripAdvisor user
146503178.reviewBody: Better than Chichen Itza. Jungle walk to ruins a must do. Museum being refurbished, but still fascinating

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146404733.name: Breathtaking!
146404733.author: a TripAdvisor user
146404733.reviewBody: This place is spectacular! Be sure to bring a good camera! It was definitely worth the money to have a private guide....we weren\'t stuck with a slow crowd but still able to learn some interesting facts.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146392620.name: Absolutely Amazing
146392620.author: a TripAdvisor user
146392620.reviewBody: This ruin complex is simply not to be missed. We endured a 5 hour van ride through the mountains that left us irritable and tired. Then we entered the site, and coming around the corner out of the jungle - incredible ruins - a massive complex of building and temples. All of which are completely accessible to a fit person. None of this guard rail safety stuff - up the temple steps and watch your step. There are many treacherous places to go - but care is rewarded with an incredible experience. Vendors sell the local tourist items right among the ruins. It can get hot (33C when we were there) and taking water is essential. Absolutely one of the most amazing sites I have ever been to - and you can still climb and explore ! Just don\'t relax on the grass - the ants bite painfully ! Do not miss !

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

146234863.name: Nature\'s Ruins
146234863.author: a TripAdvisor user
146234863.reviewBody: Not to be missed ruins. I first saw themin the early 70\'s when it was still wild and rustic.  In a way it is barbaric to see the ruins today.  Overdeveloped and touristy.  But Oh what a thrill are the ruins of Palenque today.  The significances of these ruins is how they comforn to the jungles around them.  These pyramids are more verticle in uniformity with the trees and hills around them, unlike many other mayan sites.  While less touristy than Uzmal and Chichen Itza, Palenque does get crowded at times.  Great place to climb pyramids and check out fantastic bas reliefs.  Hopefully the tomb of Pical in the Temple of the Inscriptions will be open when you get there.  That alone is worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

145632323.name: A must if you are in Palenque
145632323.author: a TripAdvisor user
145632323.reviewBody: Although some parts were closed of to the public, it was still an amazing experiencing such a historic site. Be warned, climbing so many stairs will make sore the next day.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

145488356.name: Hot Time in the Old Ruins Today
145488356.author: a TripAdvisor user
145488356.reviewBody: Palenque is about an hour and a half drive down the highway from Villahermosa, well signposted once you reach the town. You have to pay 27 pesos entry to the park surrounding the ruins and another 57 pesos for the ruins, but there is some free parking at the museum. If you park there, you can enter the ruins from the south. It is a long uphill climb through the forest to the main ruins but there is a small waterfall and smaller ruins in the jungle as you climb to the main plaza, which is in full sun and very hot.. There are some massive pyramids in the center and again to the left of the central plaza and a variety of other structures scattered throughout the site. You can still climb most of the pyramids to see details of stonework, but not the Temple of the Inscriptions, which was closed off completely for visitors while we were there. The Temples of the Fine Relief, Skull, and XIII, the entire North Group and the Tomb of the Red Queen were also closed. Several places especially on the Palacio had interesting stonework and the Palacio also has an intricate series of passages, arches and rooms. There are many vendors on the walkways in one area but not aggressive. The museum is small but has some nice pieces from the site but more keep being moved to the big museums in Mexico City and Merida. The site is packed with tour groups, especially in late morning. No food or drinks allowed in the ruins so hydrate before you enter. There is a lot of hot climbing. Toilets, refreshments, shops, museum and snack bar at the museum entrance. One of my top 10 Mayan sites in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

145278485.name: Temple running
145278485.author: a TripAdvisor user
145278485.reviewBody: Fantastic ruins but a sad lack of information - the signposts are small and hard to see and there aren\'t enough maps, nor is there enough information.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

144016256.name: Interesting Mayan ruins
144016256.author: a TripAdvisor user
144016256.reviewBody: We had an English-speaking tour guide recommended by our tour guide from Chiapas Travel  and tours who filled in a lot of the details which made the tour very interesting.  The ruins are amazing and the grounds are beautiful with a great view of Chiapas from the top of the ruins.  We heard loud monkeys in the trees but didn\'t manage to see them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

143611539.name: Great - be sure to see everything and walk down
143611539.author: a TripAdvisor user
143611539.reviewBody:
On our way through Mexico we spent two nights in Palenque. Of course to see the world-famous ruins..actually a former city. We've been to Teotihuacan before and were eager to see this old mayan city.

Not far away from town you'll reach the ruins. Taxis cost about 70 peso. A shared van costs you only 10 peso pp.
At the main entrance (on top of the hill) there's loads of vendors. There's also lots of unofficial tour guides, many of them kids, trying to get some customers. There are also audio tours available.
For only a few peso you'll find yourself soon on the old city's grounds. Even there's lots of tourists, the area is so big and has so many old buildings you won't even notice the other tourists much. Most groups only visit the area right at the entrance (and even leave from there again), so if you walk a little further, you'll find yourself pretty alone soon. 
But make sure to see the whole area. There's a trail leading down the hill through the whole old city. It'll take you through a forest later where you'll find more faded ruins, but with lots of character (see my pics). It is a little steep and slippery to walk, but very rewarding. There's so many photo ops and so many interesting ruins to see, it's hard to describe it. 

Make sure to bring some repellent...the mosquitoes here are pretty agressive. I even wore long pants to avoid some bites. But it's hot...very hot and damp here. Bring water, you'll need it (except you prefer to buy it on the grounds here...for about 5$ a bottle).

If you ever get close to Palenque, be sure to visit this old mayan city. It's only a half day trip away from Villahermosa or a few hours away from Campeche.

So which one's better...Teotihuacan or this place. Hard decision, but I would say if I only could see one, I'd go for Teotihuacan.
Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile (where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels).

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

143493637.name: My favourite Mayan ruin so far
143493637.author: a TripAdvisor user
143493637.reviewBody:
Visiting one ruin after the other can leave you feeling a little lack lusher... Especially if you have visited the biggest and the most popular ones such as Teotihuacan and Chitchen Itza. 

After the bus loads of tourists and loads of walking Palenque is a breathe of fresh air. 
Its stunning mountain top jungle setting makes it mystical and unique, there are very few tourists and you can walk through and climb some of the ruins.   

We had the fortune of having an amazing guide how was very knowledgeable about Mayan history and culture. He gave us a tour of the ruins and the ‘special jungle tour’ which lead us through some beautiful cool jungle, where we got to see loads or smaller ruins which have not yet been excavated. 

For me the beauty and the grandeur of these ruin is as impressive as the ruins of Angkor in Cambodia.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

143084992.name: One of the highlights of mexico
143084992.author: a TripAdvisor user
143084992.reviewBody: I\'ve visitied a lot of ruins during my travel - including the temples of sun/moon, ruins in peru (machupichu), etc.. We intentionally skipped the Chichen-Itza on our trip through Yucatan as we were warned about the hordes of buses from Cancun. Palenque is very laid back, just-the-right-size (3hrs is about enough) and beautifully located within the jungle.\nI do recommend taking a tour-guide though - without it, the experience would be 10% of the fun. Oh and try to combine it with a visit to Aqua Azul in the afternoon as it\'s a nice feeling to splash after morning spent climbing steps :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

142918528.name: Superb
142918528.author: a TripAdvisor user
142918528.reviewBody: I\'ve been to most of the Mayan sites and Palenque is certainly one of the best. The size of the site,  along with the jungle location complete with brilliantly noisy howler monkeys makes this a special site. Personally I could spend days here but generally give it a good half a day. We visited in December when the climate wasn\'t overly hot and the crowds weren\'t too oppressive. Also I would highly recommend the early start day trip down to the other Mayan sites of Bonampak and Yaxchilan.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

142556450.name: Amazing! Must to go!
142556450.author: a TripAdvisor user
142556450.reviewBody: Wow! That is a place to visity. Take your time, go around to all the site. Enjoy it. If you want, take a guide, but don\'t believe in all the things they say. \nThe sitio museum is worth to visity. Don\'t open on Monday\'s!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

142089234.name: Wonderful place!
142089234.author: a TripAdvisor user
142089234.reviewBody: Palenque is terrific! Not too touristic, in the middle of the jungle giving you a special feeling... I understand the Mayans living there... \nDont miss it! It is not as big as Tikal but it is wonderful also. Evrerything is closer and walking around is a pleasure.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

142067983.name: Beautiful site!
142067983.author: a TripAdvisor user
142067983.reviewBody: Ruins of an old Maya city. The buildings are great, some you can walk on. We had a guided tour. \nThey are still working on the buildings to search for more answers. Some buildings give you a great view over the site.\nOn the site you can buy beautiful mayan masks or other souvenirs. We also went into the jungle with our guide. There are still lots of buildings coverd with trees and plants. Amazing to see!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

140402252.name: My #1
140402252.author: a TripAdvisor user
140402252.reviewBody: I\'ve seen Tikal, Chitzen Iza, Tulum, Coba but this one is unique.  It\'s like a mythic place.  The building are great, but the jungle around give the power to Palenque.  Go there early to avoid the crowd

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

139698799.name: Amazing sights - spring for a guide if you can afford to!
139698799.author: a TripAdvisor user
139698799.reviewBody:
We had a great time seeing this impressive city and imagining what it would have been like all those years ago.

We don't normally bother with guides, but I'm really glad we did this time. There are official guides at the entrance, and they know heaps. The site is actually very poorly labeled, and has very little information, but a lot is known about this civilization (unlike in Teotihuacan). It costs 960 pesos per person, but we didn't have anywhere near that much money on us, so our guide did it for half price. The lesson - don't pay full price. Just say you don't have enough money.

These are the most interesting ruins we have seen in Mexico. You really should make the time to go here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

139698400.name: Great site to visit
139698400.author: a TripAdvisor user
139698400.reviewBody: Impressive and well-kept site, go in the mornings to avoid the tours larger groups. Not as overrun as Chitzen Itza. Grounds are nice and invite for a small break under a shady tree. Plenty of vendors outside the entrance to the ruins, parking is MXN 20.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

139339682.name: My favourite
139339682.author: a TripAdvisor user
139339682.reviewBody: Of all the ruins that i have visited, i think that palenque would have to be my favoutRite.  The area is really big, so be prepared to walk quite a bit.  The ruins are amongest the trees in some parts, you can here monkeys and other animals

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

139107334.name: Amazing!
139107334.author: a TripAdvisor user
139107334.reviewBody: To me the best mayan ruins I\'ve seen! The jungle gives it a special atmosphere and there are some building lost in the forest, you feel like Indiana Jones ;) After visiting the ruins you can go to the museum which is included in the ticket, it\'s interesting!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

139017310.name: A mysteriously impressive place; despite chokin humidity, closed temples and lack of preservation, it is worth to go if you\'re i
139017310.author: a TripAdvisor user
139017310.reviewBody: An amazing collection of temples; palace and the rabbit temple were impressive but it is more than temples; among tall trees and howling monkeys\' sounds you feel isolated and small; respect the history of the location; museum at the exit is worth stopping by and you will see the Queen Bath , Cascades and the Palace of Bats on the way. I wish I could be there early in the morning or join the noctrunal tour; it should be even more impressive. If you can, avoid the noon time heat and humidity; it\'s exhausting. Oner Ayan

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

138594762.name: ruins amongst the jungle, beautifuL!
138594762.author: a TripAdvisor user
138594762.reviewBody: realy unique ruins set in the middle of the jungle, if you are in a group or a couple get a tour guide and ask him to show you the jungle! he will take you on a special tour, as i was alone i did not do this as a friend of mine as a single woman was shown more than she bargained for, be aware of this, but in groups you are absolutely fine,...and even alone there is no danger just stick to the main route!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

137688906.name: Nice ruins in the jungle
137688906.author: a TripAdvisor user
137688906.reviewBody: We went to Palenque in the evening and unfortunately it started to rain while we where visiting the site. Still we climed up the pyramids and had a breathtaking view of the jungle in the tropic rain. Most of the tourists were gone by than and we really felt kind of alone. Very very beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

136003056.name: An Adventure
136003056.author: a TripAdvisor user
136003056.reviewBody: Our group walks up to the enterance and our leader knowing the tour guide, asks to take us on a real adventure. And boy was it an adventure.  We enter through the dense jungle and walk behind the ruins.  We got to see what the normal tour never shows. We got to see true Mayan home security system! They dug huge trenches with poisonous plants at the bottom so if someone fell, uh, the didn\'t come out.  Our guide really made this a wonderful adventure! When we got to the main clearing we were muddied and tired but so worth the hard work! the view was spectacular!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

134351824.name: Nicest of all the Mayan Ruins
134351824.author: a TripAdvisor user
134351824.reviewBody: The setting was lovely and well maintained. The guides were good and the paths past water falls delightful. Also, the museum is well worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

134229144.name: Really worth it!
134229144.author: a TripAdvisor user
134229144.reviewBody: We\'ve already visited a lot of temples but this one is also worth it. The jungle is a nice extra. There are howler monkeys, eagles flying around. You\'ve got besutiful views. \nWe\'ve done it in a tour together with agua azul and ague misol ha. It was very cheap (130 pesos, transport only).

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133882126.name: Magnificent
133882126.author: a TripAdvisor user
133882126.reviewBody: We highly recommend these ruins! Beautiful, picturesque setting; well worth the trip.  You\'ll get plenty of exercise walking to the different sections and climbing the stairs of the temples.  Take lots of water!  Some parts of the ruins are very well-preserved.  Also, whereas it\'s difficult to find souvenirs in some parts of Palenque, here you will see many options for purchasing artisan goods.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133865493.name: The Ruins of Palenque
133865493.author: a TripAdvisor user
133865493.reviewBody: We love climbing and walking around the ruins of Mexico and have visited a large number of the Yucatan ruins.  Our favorites were Ek Balam, Uxmal, Coba and Palenque.  WE have climbed a lot of ruins, but Palenque was the only one we were actually allowed to go inside.   Wow what an experience.  Being able to go inside gave me a whole new perspective of things and how they were and how they functioned.   Thank you Palenque for opening the ruins up to the public.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133766874.name: If you only get to choose one...
133766874.author: a TripAdvisor user
133766874.reviewBody: If you only get to choose one mayan ruin site, you should definitely go for Palenque. Placed right in the jungle there is lots of beautiful views over the jungle with the temples popping up here and there.\nWhile in Mexico, we visited several mayan ruins, including Chitzen Itza, but this is where we were most amazed.\nWe started our visit with a short guided junglewalk - which also is highly recommendable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133717907.name: excelent place to visit
133717907.author: a TripAdvisor user
133717907.reviewBody: a clean, ordered and secure place. There are several places  authorized by authorities to sell ccopies and handwork.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133470456.name: Ruins in the center of an amazing jungle
133470456.author: a TripAdvisor user
133470456.reviewBody: We went in the early morning, and once we walked in we knew we were in for a treat! The howler monkey\'s were up and talking all around, butterfly\'s fluttering all about, monkeys swing on the trees ( well within sight) . Best ruins we have seen on our journeys ! Mini waterfalls everywhere, hardly any mosquito\'s, free restrooms. Must visit if in Palenque

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

133345581.name: Better than Chitzen Itza
133345581.author: a TripAdvisor user
133345581.reviewBody: The settings of these ruins are glorious making the walk through them a real pleasure. The ruins themselves were better preserved than Chitzen Itza or Teotichuacan. It is a bit up/down so require more effort but because it is at a higher altitude it was much cooler.\n\nThe museum is also recommended for a quick 1 hour browse. Getting there is easy using a collectivo and the entrance fee was minimal. You can combine this with a jungle hike to make a full day out of it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

132748821.name: Just visit it!
132748821.author: a TripAdvisor user
132748821.reviewBody: Together with Tikal in Guatemala, the best preserved and impressive ancient Maya town

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

132611648.name: Amazing! Increible!
132611648.author: a TripAdvisor user
132611648.reviewBody: A must see if you\'re into the Mundo Maya kick. I\'ve seen many other Mayan sites and they all offer something different. Palenque & Tikal are neck to neck for me. Go there!!! Get a guide & learn how all the big Mayan empires were connected...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

132543289.name: The best mayan ruin sight!
132543289.author: a TripAdvisor user
132543289.reviewBody: I have been to different mayan archelogical sites in Mexico and Guatemala, I think this one tops them all. The location being in a mountain in the middle of the jungle, the incredibly well kept sight, having enough restauration to give you the full idea but not overdoing it. The descending areas with the river and waterfalls, the ruins covered in trees, showing everywhere. It is truly a jewel

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

132001455.name: A very impressive site!
132001455.author: a TripAdvisor user
132001455.reviewBody: This is one impressive sites we have visited to date, better than Chichen Itza, Coba, and Tulum combined.  Even better than Uxmal!  You could really get inside the ruins, the jungle is amazing with Howler Monkeys treating us to their calls.  The Queens tomb was incredible.  The pyramids are huge and stunning.  The only Mayan toilet I have ever seen!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

131934113.name: Amazing ruins!
131934113.author: a TripAdvisor user
131934113.reviewBody: Just incredible - the best ruins I have seen. Hard to imagine how the Mayans did so much with so little. And, they were really into sacrificing those virgins!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

131588206.name: Great ruins
131588206.author: a TripAdvisor user
131588206.reviewBody: We got there just when they opened and pretty much it was just us and the groundskeepers. As the day went on, locals were setting up to sell their wares right inside the park. Unfortunately, we did not buy anything, thinking we could just shop in town....big mistake, couldn\'t find anything like the beautiful things they were selling at the ruins. If you see something you like, come back to the entrance and buy it before you exit so you don\'t have to carry it around....you probably won\'t find it in town. The ruins are incredible and you can have your fill of climbing just about all of them. Photo opportunities abound! Don\'t miss the museum either.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

131430779.name: Palenque is worth the trip to Mexico
131430779.author: a TripAdvisor user
131430779.reviewBody: This is easily one of the most beautiful sites in Mexico and well worth the trip. I\'ve been several times and it never ceases to amaze. Gorgeous, safe, photogenic, expansive\u2014get there early and enjoy the day, maybe even go back a second day. Great with or without a guide, though if it\'s your first time having a guide will help reveal some secrets you wouldn\'t otherwise discover. Spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

130315289.name: mysterious place
130315289.author: a TripAdvisor user
130315289.reviewBody: Hidden in forest, walk start by walking through forrest around a brook on the top to square with mayan pyramids. By my opinion the nicest place, which I saw in whole Mexico in time of my visit there. Mysterious place for that old Mayas and for us too. Native people walking around us and if you close eyes you can travel to 7th century.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

130281867.name: worth a visit
130281867.author: a TripAdvisor user
130281867.reviewBody: Preferably arrived at opening and hired a guide to better understand local history. Is very interesting.The price guide can be taken down, he asked for 80 USD for a group of 4 persons and in the end we paid 40 USD.\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

130156663.name: Wonderful!
130156663.author: a TripAdvisor user
130156663.reviewBody: Natural of earth and Maya/ruinsArquelogica\n\nNothing dislike

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

129982474.name: Amazing.. it exceeded my expectations. Please respect the site.
129982474.author: a TripAdvisor user
129982474.reviewBody: The site is really big and you can do a half day tour but you may be cheating yourself. Tour guides range in prices. We hired a student tour guide for about 20 bucks for two hours. We were disapointed we could not access Pakal\'s tomb. It is closed to the public due to tourism - taking pictures with flash and wear/tear.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

129060563.name: Medium-sized site, Chiapas\'s famous and treasured cultural  preserve.
129060563.author: a TripAdvisor user
129060563.reviewBody: Park is located in the middle of gorgeous deep jungle.  It contains some of the finest architecture, sculpture, roof comb and bas-relief carvings.  Two of t emost importants constructions are the Temple of the Inscriptions (you can not climb this temple) and The Palace which is complex made up of several building built at different times.  There are many interesting buildings; Temple of the Skull, Temple of Red Queen, Temple of the Sun, Temple of the Cross.  The Park has ecological trail and creek.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128953017.name: Well worth effort to see
128953017.author: a TripAdvisor user
128953017.reviewBody: Must see ruins. I had Raul take my wife and I around for an hour-tour, it was just amazing he is a wealth of information (ten years guiding tours/ speaks good English). He is there every day and approaches tour groups as they arrive. I paid $400 pesos a person for the tour-van ride down from San Cristobal de las casas, and paid him $500 pesos for the 1-hour tour. He is worth many times the price I paid. Only 5% of the ruins there have been uncovered, Dr. Barnhart, Texas University at Austin found 1500 more buildings hidden in the jungle. The Mexican government doesn\'t want them uncovered at this time. Before I went, I couldn\'t imagine how huge buildings could be lost, the grounds appear so cleared out on internet photos. While there, I saw a mountain densely covered in moss and trees, upon closer inspection the "mountain" had some moss removed on one side to show the stone brick foundation; it is another huge pyramid!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128823110.name: Atmospheric ruins in lovely setting
128823110.author: a TripAdvisor user
128823110.reviewBody: Very interesting ruins in a lovely area . It was not crowded when we visisted and we had plenty of opportunity to see the buildings and the wildlife and views . \nCan be hot. take lots of water .Highly recommended .

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128583850.name: Breathtaking ruins in an amazing setting
128583850.author: a TripAdvisor user
128583850.reviewBody: I really enjoyed Palenque which is spread out over a large area. Be prepared to walk quite a bit around the site including quite a few steps. Take lots of water as you cannot buy any in the site, although there are enterprising vendors waiting at the end with ice cold water and drinks. I would suggest going early and avoiding weekends if you can - it will be less crowded. This really is a very beautiful place with a great sense of the past.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128514727.name: Ruins in the jungle
128514727.author: a TripAdvisor user
128514727.reviewBody: Beautiful mayan temples lying in the jungle. The combination of nature and buildings makes this place a must-see

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128398559.name: Amazing Ruins
128398559.author: a TripAdvisor user
128398559.reviewBody: Nothing to dislike about this place. Less crowded and in a beautiful setting.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

128347651.name: You must go to see it
128347651.author: a TripAdvisor user
128347651.reviewBody: It was well worth going all the way to Palenque to see the runis.The only issue that I had was that there where too many tourist. Lot of fun for people of all ages.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

127850842.name: One of my favourite Maya sites
127850842.author: a TripAdvisor user
127850842.reviewBody: Palenque is an exotic one in the jungle, very different from those maya sites in Mexico.The Palace is truly the masterpiece among all Maya architectures. Unfortunately, visitors can not visit inside of the Temple of the Inscriptions where the tomb of Pakal is located. Be prepared that the site museum is not open on Monday. A colectivo is available at the parking lot for just 10 pesos per person to or from downtown Palenque.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

127829653.name: Great ruins but many people
127829653.author: a TripAdvisor user
127829653.reviewBody: The ruins are great - although one could get annoyed by all the street vendors. When I visited the park it was Semana Santa, hence many people everywhere. Strangely enough I did not manage to buy water in the park - everyone was selling keyrings and souvenirs, but not a single guy with water and sodas...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

127275994.name: Just like a story-book
127275994.author: a TripAdvisor user
127275994.reviewBody: Wonderful, magical ruins. You won\'t want to leave.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

127257725.name: Beautiful Maya Site
127257725.author: a TripAdvisor user
127257725.reviewBody: The site of Palenque is about 15 minutes drive from the town; you can book a tour, go by taxi, or hop on one of the buses that run through town.  At the site, you may also hire a guide to tell you about the site.  There are quite a few buildings to climb and the views are breathtaking.  It is one of my favorite places that I have visited.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

127042436.name: Unbelievable ruins in the rainforest!
127042436.author: a TripAdvisor user
127042436.reviewBody: The expanse and variety of ruins on this lush rainforest site are amazing!  We hired a guide for the experience and his knowledge really enhanced our knowledge and enjoyment of the visit.\nMake sure you wear solid footwear and have good sun protection as there is a great deal of walking and stair climbing!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

126807757.name: WOW!!
126807757.author: a TripAdvisor user
126807757.reviewBody:
This place, together with Teotihuacan, would have to be the most spectacular of the Ancient Civilization ruins I encountered in Mexico.  
From the first step into the ruins, to the last step outside, I was in total awe.
All the stalls are outside of the complex, so you are not being constantly annoyed to buy stuff you don't need, unlike Chichen Itza.
Make sure you take water and put on your sunscreen.
Allow plenty of time to properly explore this spectacular site.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125842056.name: Beautiful sight.  Well maintained and a total joy to see!
125842056.author: a TripAdvisor user
125842056.reviewBody:
Hard to add to what the people before have said.  It is an inspiring place to visit.  It is educational as well as physically beautiful.

It is hot so wear appropriate clothing and take a hat and water.  Be prepared to do some stair climbing if not more rigorous climbing.

Enjoy!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125823681.name: It\'s a "must see"
125823681.author: a TripAdvisor user
125823681.reviewBody: If you like ruins, you can\'t leave Mexico without making the pilgrimage.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125663524.name: The jungle is a value to the ruins
125663524.author: a TripAdvisor user
125663524.reviewBody: Because of the jungle surroundings, Palenque looks very authentic.  Much more than Chichen Itza for example. You don\'t really need a guide, it\'s fun to wander around the ruins.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125613402.name: Mayan world
125613402.author: a TripAdvisor user
125613402.reviewBody: This is a very famous site and archaelogist have uncovered quite a bit more of the ruins.  Was there 40 years ago and totally different from then.  Glad I saw the sarcophgus at the Temple of the Inscriptions then, as now you are not permitted to even climb it, no less go inside.\n\nA very nice museum and very reasonably priced souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125468854.name: Fantastic Mayan Ruins!
125468854.author: a TripAdvisor user
125468854.reviewBody:
Palenque is a wonderful site. It has a number of temples, some have remnants of carvings. There is a very little signage around the park, so it is best to go with a guide book so that you know what you are looking at. We visited while traveling as a part of a guided tour and so learned a ton of stuff from our archaeologist guide.  

Be sure to climb up to the upper section where the Temple of Sun / Temple of the Cross and Temple of the Foliated Cross are located. Climb their stairs and peer closely at the surviving carving. Very cool.

You can not enter all of the temples (The temple of Inscriptions is closed) but you are allowed to climb up most of the ruins. Be sure to check out the museum located at the entrance to the park, it contains a lot of fascinating artifacts - I especially liked the reconstructed incense burners.

I highly recommend visiting Palenque! Plan to spend most of the day so that you can check out all the temples, walk all the grounds, stroll down the jungle path past the old residences, and still have time to spend a couple hours in the museum.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

125457284.name: Greeeeeeeeeeaaaaaaaat!!! paradise!!
125457284.author: a TripAdvisor user
125457284.reviewBody: I do not recommend to use the children guides. They don\'t really know what they are talking about, and not so cheap.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124928545.name: Sublime.
124928545.author: a TripAdvisor user
124928545.reviewBody: The beauty and grace of the buildings here is unlike anything we\'ve seen at other Mayan sites.  If you\'re into beautiful architecture, or nature, or wish to explore native cultures, this is a fantastic place to visit (and it\'s not overrun by Americans during winter months amazingly enough).

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124724396.name: Amazing site - but choose your guide carefully.
124724396.author: a TripAdvisor user
124724396.reviewBody: Palenque is truly remarkable and you can easily spend 2-3 hours exploring the ruins.\n\nWe hired an English speaking guide called Victor, a nice man, but his English was a bit average. He spent a lot of time telling us how he was way better than other guides. He has some controversial and wacky views on Mayan history, which were interesting, but I\'m not sure how accurate they were. If you are looking for a good overview of the ruins, I would recommend you avoid him as a guide.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124693728.name: you have to pay 26 Pesos to get into park and then pay again to get into the ruins 56 pesos
124693728.author: a TripAdvisor user
124693728.reviewBody: Nice park we loved the waterfalls in the park just inside the ruins. Amazing cascade effect so do the forest walk down towards the museum and it takes you by the water falls.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124583829.name: Jungle Ruins
124583829.author: a TripAdvisor user
124583829.reviewBody: Liked seeing the different gods who were reverred here vs other sites, like Uxmal.  Lush, green surroundings, with lots of water, vs. sites that were dry and brown. Howler monkeys and lots of iguanas made this a true jungle ruin experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124490644.name: Jungle tour of the ruins
124490644.author: a TripAdvisor user
124490644.reviewBody: We arrived at 8:00 am, opening time.  We met a guide, Raul, in the parking lot who spoke excellent English.  We wanted to go into the jungle first thing.  It was a wonderful trek through the jungle in search of howler monkeys and toucans.  We stayed in the park for 5 hours and really enjoyed exploring.  There are restrooms located inside and outside the park.     Pack some water!  It\'s a very physical trek up and down slippery steps and jungle trails.  The waterfall was beautiful!  Repellent, sunscreen are a must have.  You can locate guides that are multi lingual right in the parking lot.  Driving there in a rental car from Puerto Chiapas was really quite a challenge.  Recommend taking the bus.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124429348.name: A rock climbers\' experience
124429348.author: a TripAdvisor user
124429348.reviewBody: Eerie howler monkeys, a vast site to climb and explore, ancient history, incredible to stand among one of the Mayans finest cities.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124403673.name: Do not miss it!
124403673.author: a TripAdvisor user
124403673.reviewBody: It was the most well maintained and interesting site to visit....

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Palenque- Zona Archaeologica Km. 8

124256772.name: Great ruins
124256772.author: a TripAdvisor user
