Whenever you travel in Mexico and have the chance to visit pyramids, do it!  It's always worth it and not expensive.

617969626.name: Beautiful
617969626.author: a TripAdvisor user
617969626.reviewBody: Lovely place. Great guide to share the history of the sites. Many photo opportunities. Bring a hat and sunscreens and wear good walking shoes. Enjoy!

616631759.name: AVOID TO VISIT (2018)
616631759.author: a TripAdvisor user
616631759.reviewBody:
Palenque ruins itself are great, you can enter into a ruin, climb other ones, they are well restored.
THE PROBLEM: to reach Palenque ruins there is only ONE road, unfortunately, in the SOUTH of Mexico (Oaxaca, Chiapas, probably Campeche and surroundings) , the local communities BLOCK those roads and DONT LET PASS ANYONE without its permit, in the best case you will pay 250 per car (2018) to pass, but it depends of the mood of the community. Sometimes does not let pass anyone at all even if you offer to pay.
I went in a tour (thinking would be safer) they blocked the road very early in the morning (4:00, 5:00 am), and dont let pass the cars until 13:00. We had to take a de-tour that took us 5 hours by a hilly and broken small road.
Talking with the guide he said they can block by several days, and they take shifts so always a group is there to control the pass.
If you want to take an aggressive position, keep in mind they come with MACHETES and if they hear something they dont like they will kidnap you. Another story of the guide: A woman was furious about the blockade she yelled at them, the local community kidnap her for 3 days and they kept the car for 3 months.
You might hear stories that they do that to build schools, make better the community.
Im mexican so 250 per car x (minumum) 100 cars a day 250,000, you can buy the materials to build 2 houses, they have done this for years, make the math....
Avoid to visit then the local economy will go down and they might re-think their stance, or the government can jail these people.
So you have to pay on your way up and in your way down, or de-tour of 5 and 5 hours or just sit hoping they let you pass.

608228791.name: Very enjoyable
608228791.author: a TripAdvisor user
608228791.reviewBody: Great but go early to beat heat.\nThe collectivos work well. The ones we took were air conditioned and for 20 pesos were great value

605606530.name: Beautiful
605606530.author: a TripAdvisor user
605606530.reviewBody: Very beautiful ruins - really worth the long journey. Make sure to get a guide - it is worth it. But shop around - some of the guides are very expensive.

605554381.name: Quiet ruins
605554381.author: a TripAdvisor user
605554381.reviewBody:
As with some of the other ruins in the area, Palenque is far quieter than more popular ruins, so you can move around at your own pace taking it all in.

It’s quite a large site still and very well preserved. You can go onto the ruins too, which you can’t do at ruins like Chicen Itza.

If you’re passing through the area, it’s definitely worth a visit.

604708008.name: Just awesome!
604708008.author: a TripAdvisor user
604708008.reviewBody: We booked a private tour of the ruins for after the park shut and all vendors and visitors had cleared the site. It\'s expensive but hugely worth it to get the feel of these unbelievable ruins in the quiet of the jungle as the sun begins to set.\nOur guide was informative and stressed the important points well and kept us interested but our younger teenagers felt the commentary a bit dry.\nYou can climb the main pyramid and get fantastic photos over the jungle and the other site features. We visited Chichin Itsa later in our holiday and Palenque trumps it hands down. Once you\'ve visited this site other Mayan sites look ordinary.

604291026.name: Amazing walk in the jungle.
604291026.author: a TripAdvisor user
604291026.reviewBody: Very nice trip to the ruines. We spent about 2,5 hours walking. Very nice views on top of the buildings. Great. Collectivo from Palenque costs about 40 peso\u2019s return. Entrance 105 peso (35 to enter the national park and 70 to enter the ruines).

601872230.name: Get a guide, bring lots of money
601872230.author: a TripAdvisor user
601872230.reviewBody:
This site is great.  Took the ruins + jungle tour.  Rudi was a great English-speaking guide.  
You can pay for this tour in USD 190 or in pesos. Fee is per group.
But in addition to the tour (or if you go it alone) there are two separate per person entrance fees, I think totaling about 100 pesos plus 20pesos per person one way the get to the ruins from the entrance.  There is a parking lot at the ruins allowing you to skip the shuttle but it is small and was full.
It is really really hot and sweaty.  Probably would have given up on reading the site placards out in the baking sun.  With our guide we could stand in the shade and learn about the site.
Bring a suit if you like there's a small waterfall you can swim in.  We were the only ones there, it was lovely.
If you are driving, the road from the north is under construction and kind of crappy.  Allow more time to get through and don't get stuck behind a semi. If you leave and head back into Tabasco you must go through customs (aduanas).  We thought we'd went the wrong way into some military installation. Stick to the right lanes for passenger cars.

601626559.name: Gorgeous and impressive
601626559.author: a TripAdvisor user
601626559.reviewBody: Having already visited the ruins in Tulum, we went to Palenque expecting something similar and were pleasantly surprised. The ruins at Palenque are stunning, with interesting and really informative panels in Spanish and English next to every construct. Being able to climb the ruins is fun and also offers a beautiful view of the surroundings. The path towards the exit is through a shady jungle with more ruins, and then there is a museum at the end which included artefacts from the tombs. The museum is fantastic, again very informative and includes artefacts that are mentioned in the information panels at the ruins such as the Red Queen\u2019s mask and a recreation of Pakal\u2019s Tomb which is incredibly impressive. All in all a brilliant day although I would advise to go earlier in the morning as we went in the full midday sun and it was very very hot!

601144404.name: Palenque did not Dissapoint!
601144404.author: a TripAdvisor user
601144404.reviewBody: Beautiful Palenque is located 10 minutes from Palenque\'s city center. Don\'t forget to visit the museum adjacent to the site. The ruins and site are well kept and the experience was wonderful. It is a must see!

600918848.name: Gem in the jungle
600918848.author: a TripAdvisor user
600918848.reviewBody: Worth a couple of nights stay in Palenque so good that they are leaving most temples covered so that the jungle survives \n

599921581.name: Middle in the jungle
599921581.author: a TripAdvisor user
599921581.reviewBody: Awesome Ruinas in the middle of the jungle. Unique compared to any other I\'ve seen so far. Loved it.

599400066.name: Beautiful site in the jungle
599400066.author: a TripAdvisor user
599400066.reviewBody: A beautiful site in the jungle. I was here 25 years ago and then you could climb al the temples. Now you can climb some temples and go inside one.

597399593.name: A Must Visit When In Chiapas
597399593.author: a TripAdvisor user
597399593.reviewBody: This is an amazing place.  The Temples, Palaces and Tombs are truly examples of great leadership in the Mayan culture.  It is interesting how  Palenque was interconnected with ruins such as El Mirador in Guatemala. The museum contains many of the artifacts contained in the tombs and baskets of the rules.

597182976.name: Ruins in the jungle
597182976.author: a TripAdvisor user
597182976.reviewBody:
This is one of the best experiences we’ve had in México. 

Not only are the ruins beautiful but the entire setting in the middle of the forest makes it absolutely worthwhile. 

The site shows obviously fully excavated ruins but also examples of what the ruins look like before and after the excavation. 

If you are lucky you might additionally see parrots, monkeys, toucans and hummingbirds. 

At the parking place just outside the national park there are many guides if you have not already arranged for one. It is very interesting to hear their stories about the life back then, but also about how many of the priceless prehistoric findings was stolen. 

Don’t forget the little museum just outside the actual park. There’s a very nice walk trough the forest and over a little suspension bridge.

595728987.name: Super interesting and different!
595728987.author: a TripAdvisor user
595728987.reviewBody: Very interesting visit to the Palenque ruins! We hired a guide, and didn\'t regret! This was a very good, interesting and beautiful day :)

594701685.name: Afterhours Tour
594701685.author: a TripAdvisor user
594701685.reviewBody: There is something secretive that i probably shouldnt say, maybe but i\'ve already wrote abour it in the Title of this review so just ask around, maybe it\'s out already, for me it was a mystery

594698640.name: Nestled in the jungle
594698640.author: a TripAdvisor user
594698640.reviewBody: These ruins are in the middle of the jungle! They are impressive. These ruins can still be climbed unlike chichen-itza, but only for a limited time now as access will soon stop. Our tour guide, Belen, was very knowledgeable and is able to answer any questions. You will have a fantastic time exploring and re-imagining what life was like during its flourishing time!\nSome things to consider:\nplease wear comfortable shoes and take water, bug repellent, and SPF! There\'s a lot of walking ;)

594133111.name: Enchanting
594133111.author: a TripAdvisor user
594133111.reviewBody: though certainly a very crowded place, it was one of these experiences that made me stop and standing in awe. I remember the photo of the main pyramid of Palenque up on the wall of my grandparent\'s living room and I always wondered as a child if this place was real. When finally standing in front of that pyramid so many years later I still couldn\'t really believe that these ruins were build by humankind. Just an astonishing remainder of the ancient cultures and how mighty they must have been.

593136360.name: Just the best
593136360.author: a TripAdvisor user
593136360.reviewBody: Palenque meets the expectations. Beautiful impressive and even more due to the natural background. Do not miss palenque, it is definitely worth it. Note also that the bracelet for the entrance to the national park is good for three days. The entrance to the archaeological park on the other hand must be played for every day. I would say visit it on two different days.

591690896.name: Breathtaking ruins in the jungle.
591690896.author: a TripAdvisor user
591690896.reviewBody: Even if you\'ve seen Chichen Itza, Palenque is very special and full of unique atmosphere. Don\'t miss it.

590709858.name: Awesome!
590709858.author: a TripAdvisor user
590709858.reviewBody: Fantastic in just about every way. Just what ruins should be: great architecture, fabulous setting on a jungle-clad hillside, well taken care of grounds. These ruins are easy to get around and enjoy, some areas are rocky of course. Good mix of excavated buildings and partially done ones. Try to arrive at opening to mitigate heat and crowds. If you can, be sure to visit group Murci\u00e9lago and surrounding buildings down wooded path toward Museo, there\u2019s even an Indiana Jones-like bridge on the way with beautiful waterfalls. Bring bug spray and your adventure hat and enjoy!

590262065.name: My favourite ruins! (So far)
590262065.author: a TripAdvisor user
590262065.reviewBody: I loved this site so much. We spent 4 hours here but I could definitely have lingered. There are vendors on site, but for the most part, it isn\'t TOO commercialized. We opted for a guide to tell us more about what we were seeing - well worth the money. I also loved the walk back toward town through the jungle train - past waterfalls and beautiful wild birds!

589843526.name: Quieter and cooler than Chichen Itz\u00e1
589843526.author: a TripAdvisor user
589843526.reviewBody: Not as grande as Chich\u00e9n Itza but equally impressive. Can climb structures. I don\u2019t think there are any shops or facilities inside, we had to use the toilets out the front amongst the street sellers. Ruins are surrounded by lush jungle, with archaeologists working. There is a beautiful jungle walk that leads you out to a road with a short walk to the museum.

588526480.name: Please see my review under "Palenque National Park", which includes these ruins and more
588526480.author: a TripAdvisor user
588526480.reviewBody: Please see my review under "Palenque National Park", which includes these ruins and more, for more detail. I recommend a guide.  The booths are both to the right of the ruins entrance, but choose the booth on your left as they are local indigenous with intimate knowledge of the site. Palenque is unique among Maya sites for several reasons. The more you learn in advance, the more you will see when you get there.

588129412.name: Must see
588129412.author: a TripAdvisor user
588129412.reviewBody: Really great to see mayan temples, only 2% are discovered here rill now, damn that thing will be huge. But already those 2 % are really big. about 1 and a half hour just to make tje tour for the ruins and another 2 for the trip trough the jungle. awesome experience, had the luck to get a monkey on picture

587285836.name: A unique Maya city
587285836.author: a TripAdvisor user
587285836.reviewBody: This place is unique in style, if you like the Maya world and history it is a must. I dare to compare it with Egypt in its uniqueness and beauty. The museum is tiny but worth seeing. It is very interesting and they have some really beautiful places there and a lifesize replica of Pakal\'s tomb, with is worth seeing as the entrance to the real tomb is impossible now.\nYou can spend a few days going back to the site to see different areas.that you can find in trails in the jungle. \n

587063672.name: Fascinating site
587063672.author: a TripAdvisor user
587063672.reviewBody: We booked a tour with Mildred, mildredlucasgarcia@gmail.com who is an excellent and knowledgeable English speaking guide. She took us around the whole site and provided a lot of fascinating information about the king\'s. It\'s a relatively compact site so you can see a lot even though it\'s only a few percent of the total structures in the area. The highlight for me was the jungle walk where we saw an anteater which is rare and then climbed through the jungle to a funeral temple, passing three Maya swimming pools and an aqueduct on the way. This was one of the highlights of our tour.

584358247.name: Temples evidence of what the Maya achieved
584358247.author: a TripAdvisor user
584358247.reviewBody: One of the most significant archaeological sites, Mayan ruins dating back to AD 600 or thereabouts. We met our local guide for the day at the National Park\u2019s entry turnstiles, stacks of people were already visiting the site when we got there around half-nine in the morning. Probably the pick of the temples we saw was the one known as the Temple of the Inscriptions\u2026the intact panels of the structure, guide Raf explained the significance of Maya pictorial inscriptions we saw \u2013 these are a kind of ideogram, a single picture which equates with a word or an idea or a number. These symbols (adopted from the Olmec people by the Maya) put together formed a text. On the temples some of these glyphs (hieroglyphic characters painted on the walls) survive, although the Spanish Catholics destroyed a lot of them! The unique Mayan numbering system is also evident. Exploring the Temples of the Crosses was another highlight with its elaborate, bas-relief carvings and sinewy interior chambers giving clues to how the Maya lived.

583869550.name: good, choose your guide!
583869550.author: a TripAdvisor user
583869550.reviewBody: they offer the Historical tour and the Ecological tour, seem pretty expensive, at the end our guide made a deal with  half and half of both tours and was a great experience.  get water, hat, sunblock and mosquito repellent.

581288228.name: One of the best Mayan sites
581288228.author: a TripAdvisor user
581288228.reviewBody: Indiana Jones wow factor with buildings rising out of the jungle, the whole place oozes mystery, there\'s even an eccentric count lived here once.  And you wonder how much more lies undiscovered under the rapidly growing vegetation.  You have to pay two fees, one to enter the protected park area 34 pesos, as well as site fee 70 pesos.  As usual going for opening time avoids the tour buses.  You can climb various buildings - no handrails, there are signs throughout in English.  No entry into Inscriptions Temple but there\'s a good mock up of the sarcophagus inside the site\'s modern museum.  Souvenir sellers in the grounds but nothing like the all invasive ones at Chichen Itza.

580875330.name: Beautiful Site
580875330.author: a TripAdvisor user
580875330.reviewBody: Beautiful Maya Ruins.  Tours are a little pricey, but the information was worth it.  Not as crowded as some of the other ruin sites.

579594465.name: Stunning place
579594465.author: a TripAdvisor user
579594465.reviewBody: We visited Chichen Itza, Uxmal and Palenque. If I would have to choose Palenque would be it. Wonderfully build into the junge hills, great views, very well maintained and not so commercial as Chichen which is awful (see there), hope the few sellers remain the few. One recommendation: there is a second exit, you walk down stairs through the jungle.

578664855.name: A great Mayan city
578664855.author: a TripAdvisor user
578664855.reviewBody:
Palenque is a nice Mayan city.
I was able to climb many structures, however the Temple of the Inscriptions is not allowed. The temple of the Red Queen you can go inside and see a tomb, I felt like Indiana Jones. The palace is such an interesting structure; you can climb the stairs and walk all around. You can easily spend 2-3 hours.

Wash your hands! After you leave because there are bat droppings as you climb the stairs. I ended up with diarrhea and dehydration for 2 days

I took the plane from CDMX to Villahermosa, around 1 hour with 30 minutes.  In the airport I bought the tiket on ADO buses to Palenque city about 2 hours in a minivan. Just outside the Ado bus station you’ll see the vans with the sign “Ruinas” that will take you   to the arqueological site.

The city of Palenque, well is not much to write about so I was back in my hotel by 4.

577680565.name: Place you can\'t help but love.
577680565.author: a TripAdvisor user
577680565.reviewBody: Start at the entrance up from the museum. This will enrich your experience by seeing the grandeur of the jungle to begin with. We have been to many other ruins but in this case you can actually walk into many of the structures. Going to see the tomb of Pakal the Great was incredible. Also, go to the museum first to get a basic understanding of the site and it\'s significance. Highly recommend. Keep in mind to bring bug spray, sun screen and tons of water. It\'s hot out there!!!

577211177.name: Great site well worth a visit
577211177.author: a TripAdvisor user
577211177.reviewBody:
If you've in the area get to the site as it's definitely something to see.

The site is quite large so allow 3 or 4 hours if you want to see it all. Best to go early to beat the crowds and the heat.

You can get there by car, take a tour or as I did a 20 Peso collectivo from the town of Palenque that will drop you at the entrance. 

It will cost you 34 Pesos to get into the park and 70 Pesos to get into the site. Guides are available but I didn't take one. Signs at each pyramid/building are in both Spanish and English.

Most people just do the main site area near the main entrance where all the big pyramids are. There's also a nice walk downhill through some smaller building areas and some nice jungle including a little cascade and stream. You exit at the second entrance a couple hundred metres away from the museum  (part of the same entrance fee) which is worth a visit.

If you've come by collectivo you can get one back to town from this second entrance or the museum. Just flag one down, it's 20 Pesos.

576135666.name: Palenque not so crowded
576135666.author: a TripAdvisor user
576135666.reviewBody:
I arranged a days transport to the ruins with a pick up afterward to go direct to the Roberto Barrios water falls - turned out to be a good way to fit two top sites into one day . 
Arriving at the ruins around 8.30 AM - easy to buy tickets fruit and water on arrival. 
The place was still relatively quiet. Indeed in the 3 hours I was there the place did not get too busy at all - 
Plenty of trinket vendors setting up inside but no one hassles you to buy anything. 
Park entry fee of 34 pesos , ruins entry fee of 70 pesos 
Recommend allowing 30-40 minutes at the end to visit the museum - about 100 meters down the road to right when exiting .

574293353.name: Good place to see Maya culture
574293353.author: a TripAdvisor user
574293353.reviewBody: It is a good place to explore Maya culture and rituals\nIt is not easy to climb stairs to the ruins but it is worth

573799956.name: Amazing  ruins waterfalls and more.
573799956.author: a TripAdvisor user
573799956.reviewBody: This place is magical. Walking in the middle of lush greenery and seeing these ruins around you is absolutely amazing. You find yourself going back to history. Waterfalls, trees and plants just surround you and it is breathtaking. Coming back with the kids... this place is a must see

571530063.name: Spectacular ruins in a beautiful setting.
571530063.author: a TripAdvisor user
571530063.reviewBody: This a remarkable site that shouldn\'t be missed.  It can get crowded when tour busses arrive, so go early.  Tasty street food is available just outside the entrance.  Sundays can bring extra crowds.

571012623.name: Extraordinary!
571012623.author: a TripAdvisor user
571012623.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful ruin settings I have ever seen. Bring comfortable shoes and cover for the sun. Bringing water for the visit is highly recommended. \nThere are two fees that need to be paid.

570930071.name: A must
570930071.author: a TripAdvisor user
570930071.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful archaeological sites in Mexico. Even if you\u2019re not into history or archaeology the place is very enjoyable and offers beautiful views of the rainforest surrounded pyramids. Lots of souvenirs to buy if you\u2019re into it and restaurants and shops outside. Wear comfy clothes, a hat and a lot of suncream.

570865652.name: Wonderful, beat the crowds and go early
570865652.author: a TripAdvisor user
570865652.reviewBody: Not sure about comparisons to the temples in Ankor or the Pyramids. Just appreciate them all. Jump into a Collectivo outside the ADO bus station. 20 pesos each. We grabbed one around 7.30 and it was full of staff making the same journey. Ticket office opens at 8, there were about 4 people in front of us. In through the gates, the only people inside were the hoards of vendors setting up their junk. Walked, up, down and all over the structures in virtual solitude. Didn\'t bother with a guide, just went and enjoyed the spectacle in peace. Maybe if you need explanations for everything, there are plenty lurking around the ticket office. By 10am there were people everywhere. Can\'t imagine in the heat later. Collectivo back and enjoying a refreshing michelada in the bar by 12!

570163892.name: The Egyptians have nothing on the Mayans
570163892.author: a TripAdvisor user
570163892.reviewBody: Blistering hot and suffocating humidity, but not enough to over-shadow the archaeological wonder that surrounded us. I\'ve been to the pyramids in Egypt and the Egyptians had nothing on the Mayans. My interest to learn more about this amazing culture was stimulated.

570034116.name: Palenque ruins under pouring rain
570034116.author: a TripAdvisor user
570034116.reviewBody: It was second day of heavy rains ,that followed us on our tour ,in spite of it we were impressed  of this remarkable hidden in jungle, archaeological site . Pyramid\'s ruins temple and park with waterfall worth to visit.

569777792.name: This is not world heritage for nothing.
569777792.author: a TripAdvisor user
569777792.reviewBody: The ruins are fascinating especially with a good local guide in a small group. We learned so much. The only thing that spoils it is idiots with selfie sticks climbing on things they should not and getting in the way. The setting against the verdant jungle, threatening to take over again at any time, is very atmospheric. The small museum is well worth the visit. Be warned, it is hot and humid and there are lots of stairs.

569593491.name: Great Jungle Atmosphere
569593491.author: a TripAdvisor user
569593491.reviewBody:
The Palenque resemble Angkor Wat both in size (although a little less can be seen) and in the jungle atmosphere (although both ruins have, of course, a unique character) - if they fit on your travel itinery, an absolute must!

They are easy to access, too: If you have a hotel in Palenque town, there will be collectivos (small autobusses) with signs „Ruinas“ on Benito Júarez (the road where the ADO bus terminal is) which leave every couple of minutes during daylight hours - just signal them, and they will pick you up. The ride to the ruins takes about 20 minutes - you cannot miss it because it is the last stop. You will have to pay two entry fees: Those to the National Park and those to the ruins. Don‘t forget to bring a hat, food and water because you can buy plenty of souvenirs but no food and drink within the ruins. Try to be there at 08.00am sharp (when the park opens) - both because of the heat and because if the crowds: We were there at 08.30, and there were already several tour busses arriving.

The main entrance is uphill, and all of the main sights are here, so if you do not want to or cannot walk so much, you can do a round trip. The Maya temples have a lot and very high stairs, so it is very exhausting climbing them - but it is still worth doing so both because of the views and because you oftenget rewarded by getting so see temple reliefs in the main altars (which are always ob the top of the temples). If for some reason you do not want to or cannot climb that many temples, I recommend climbing them in this priority (but not necessarily order): (1) Templo de la Cruz Foliada because the stairs are normal-size (so it is easier to get up and down), because it has beautiful relief and because you get one of the greatest views on the other temples. (2) The Palace because much can be seen inside and (3) Templo de la Cruz for more great views. For those who want to continue walking, you can walk downhill and see the minor sights. In any case, do the main sights first because the crowds will overflood them later and because visiting the ruins involves a lot of climbing if stairs - most people are exhausted after the main sights, so you will have the minor sights all to yourself even later in the day. If you do it by this order, you will very likely get your lonely jungle feeling (we did). You can end your tour with a visit to the museum which is outside the ruins (but can be accessed with the ruins‘ entry ticket) at the lower exit. Even if you take your time, you will be likely be finished between 12.00 and 01.00am. 

Another issue  we were not sure about is how much time to spend in Palenque overall.    Basically, I think, it is enough to time your visit to arrive in the late afternoon and then visit the ruins the next morning. Palenque town itself does not offer much more - neither concerning sights nor foodwise, and there are better places to relax. So unless you want to see further sights in the area, you can take a bus or flight onward in the late afternoon/early evening (say, after 04.00pm).

569470103.name: One of the best mayan ruins
569470103.author: a TripAdvisor user
569470103.reviewBody: The history of this place and its gobernant is remarcable, only compared to the seen in Yucat\u00e1n and Guatemala, fron the independent mayan states

568969880.name: Great site that seems to be relatively well preserved.
568969880.author: a TripAdvisor user
568969880.reviewBody: A well laid out site that allows the visitor to follow paths and signboards to gain a good insight into the history and development of the ruins and the ancient city. The museum is done very well with limited items displayed professionally and all tagged with descriptions. Well worth the time to visit.

568309132.name: Stunning!
568309132.author: a TripAdvisor user
568309132.reviewBody: Apart from the loud tour groups and some persistent souvenir sellers, this was an amazing place. It went early and took off from the route the tours were taking to see some of it alone and it was lovely. \n\nIt\u2019s worth walking up and down all the stairs just to get a feel for how big it all is.

566590646.name: Spectacular
566590646.author: a TripAdvisor user
566590646.reviewBody: Palenque was the third Mayan ruins that I visited in the Yucatan peninsula and I was not expecting to be very excited. I was wrong. It is really beautiful and the hilly jungle location makes it even more lovely. I rate it superior to Chechin Itza, which is listed as one of the 7 wonders of the world. To my mind it is a \'must see\' place. If you only visit one Mayan ruin, I would recommend Palenque.

565608261.name: Wonder of the world
565608261.author: a TripAdvisor user
565608261.reviewBody: These may not be the most well preserved ruins but the jungle setting is so beautiful. Don\u2019t miss the tomb in the museum

564254440.name: Very Dramatic Ruins
564254440.author: a TripAdvisor user
564254440.reviewBody: With a good guide, you will get a very interesting look at Mayan history over the centuries. The ruins you see are only about 2% of what\u2019s there. We spent 2 hours and found it fascinating.

563903854.name: Beautiful ruins
563903854.author: a TripAdvisor user
563903854.reviewBody: Palenque ruins were our favourite from all of the Yucatan Peninsula. The place isn\u2019t that overcrowded, but be prepared for the humidity. You get to hide in the shadows of the trees but it still feels like a sauna.\nThe ruins are set on different levels so be prepared to walk lots of stairs. Don\u2019t forget to visit the museum too! It\u2019s beautiful and there is also a sarcophagus which is breathtaking.\nI\u2019d definitely recommend everyone to visit! Much nicer then Chitchen Itza or Tulum where are tons and tons of tourist.

563713166.name: A must see
563713166.author: a TripAdvisor user
563713166.reviewBody: a guide is essential. They give the visitor a wondeful insight into the life of the maya. One comes away in awe of their achievements and a better idea of the history of this part of the world.

563589217.name: 2nd Favourite ruins
563589217.author: a TripAdvisor user
563589217.reviewBody: I saw 5 ruins in 21 days. This was my second favourite. First was Uxmal. V well kept. Has toilets and a cafe

563451523.name: Palenque
563451523.author: a TripAdvisor user
563451523.reviewBody: Have a good zoom lens with you as the Temple of the Inscriptions is closed to climbing and taking a good close shot of its bar-reliefs is the only way to see them for now. \n\nOT: I stopped writing reviews on TA since past summer as TA editors, being the jackasses that they are, deleted some of my reviews for not adhering to their standards even though some of those reviews were marked as helpful by other TA readers. But of course TA editors in their infinite wisdom know better what\'s helpful. So from now on I will write reviews only when the info may deem extremely important and helpful to other members.

563347076.name: Out of all the ruins, make sure you visit this one
563347076.author: a TripAdvisor user
563347076.reviewBody: Out of all the ruins in Mexico, this was my favourite and you must visit if you are in Palenque. Seeing the ruins amongst the jungle is spectacular. Go as early as you can in the day to really enjoy the place without the crowds. I was there around 9.30am (but it opens at 8am).

562762454.name: Majestic Place!!!
562762454.author: a TripAdvisor user
562762454.reviewBody: My experience in the Mayans ruins of Palenque, Chiapas is speechless this amazing place is surrounded by jungle and wildlife I was lucky to see toucans and other birds species. Exploring inside of the pyramid had gave me an idea of how could be the way of living back in those times. Climbing all the way up of some other pyramids was able to see the beauty of amazing views and take pictures. Walking thru paths that connects this ancient civilization from place to place made me peaceful and motivated. Love it!!!

562373315.name: Great ruins, spectacular waterfalls,  and a superb small museum
562373315.author: a TripAdvisor user
562373315.reviewBody: You don\'t need me to sell you on Palenque, one of the the best Maya sites in Mexico.  If you\'re on a large organized tour, you\'ll get your money\'s worth from the standard stroll.  But if you can,  convince your guide to take you out the "back door", down the waterfall path to the museum.  You won\'t be sorry.  The museum is newish and very well done, with a replica of the Red Queen\'s tomb and sarcophagus you can walk around and just enough other pieces to be awe-inspiring without eye-glazing.  Many guides skip this because the van/bus is parked at the main entrance (about a kilometer away) so they have to hoof it.  Make them earn their tip and insist!

562361432.name: Excellent Service
562361432.author: a TripAdvisor user
562361432.reviewBody: Excellent experience knowing the history of our ancestors in Mexico. Enriching and fun, you can also buy local crafts and eat with delicious taste. Great pictures are taken.

561982731.name: Amazing Place
561982731.author: a TripAdvisor user
561982731.reviewBody: Of all of the Mayan Ruins, Palenque remains one of the most mysterious and beautiful. Considered to be one of the loveliest archeological sites in the world. Nestled among steep, forested hills it is often shrouded in mist. Because of its location, Palenque is not overcrowded and visitors are still able to walk through the buildings and climb the pyramids. A lovely place to spend a day.

561827072.name: Must do
561827072.author: a TripAdvisor user
561827072.reviewBody:
Pro: 
-location in the jungle
-not that busy in February
-acceptable entrance fee
-not that many "street" shops
-nice hike from the park to the museum (DON'T FORGET TO DO THIS ONE) with beautiful waterfalls along the path.

Neg: seems to have a small parking lot (problem in high season). If so, park at the museum and do the hike to park.

561635630.name: Spectacular ruins
561635630.author: a TripAdvisor user
561635630.reviewBody: This is a well presented site. The grounds are well maintained and there the signs ate each of the main ruins are in English as well as Spanish. It is worth getting off the beaten track to visit some of the unrestored temples in the forest. The walk down the hill along side and over the cascades is a great way to finish the day. Allow a full day to fully appreciate Palenque. We went on a Monday which is the one day of the week that the Museum is closed. If you want to include the Museum in your day trip don\'t go on a Monday.

561044247.name: Enjoyable for all People and for all ages. Most enjoyable if you are in good condition.
561044247.author: a TripAdvisor user
561044247.reviewBody: If you love history, nature, culture and hiking you can make more than a day enjoying this place as many people do. The Lacandon jungle adds to the enjoyment of the ruins. Cascades, waterfalls, the museum and the site itself has many visitors but it does not seem that crowed as it is spread out. Parking can be a hassle if you drive. Take time to walk up each temple, study the inscriptions, the color of the lichen on the stones, listen to the sounds of nature. Enjoy just sitting on top of one of the sites and just observe the area. Trails lead to a waterfall and the sendero motierpa  makes for a good view of the jungle, trees and a cascade. Knowledge of  Mayan history and these ruins before you visit will aid in the enjoyment of this park. There is much to see and explore.

560357076.name: Palanque forever
560357076.author: a TripAdvisor user
560357076.reviewBody: Beautiful place.The main entrance la the second one and the ticket includes the jungle trip where you can visit some of the Maya temples without give money to the local mexican guide that try to stop you at the first gate.

560234177.name: Atmospheric and impressive
560234177.author: a TripAdvisor user
560234177.reviewBody: We visited these during a period of 2 days of constant torrential rain. Consequently the number of visitors was  low  and we had the place almost to ourselves. The rain added to the atmosphere. One could imagine   1400 years ago . Although we had waterproofs even they failed eventually and we had to admit defeat. Had it been dry we could have spent hours seeing the whole site. Ufortunatelythe museum closes on Mondays so we missed that. Profoundly moved and impressed. Was puzzled by the igress of water inside the  pyramids  as I assumed they were built waterproof. Possibly  the effects off  time?

559996302.name: Beautiful temples in an amazing jungle
559996302.author: a TripAdvisor user
559996302.reviewBody: We visited these temples late in the afternoon so only had 1.5hrs to explore but still managed to see most of the ruins. I\'m not sure what you can really say about an ancient archeological site other than it was awesome and very interesting. Its all in amongst a thick jungle and very well signed.

559895283.name: Beyond spectacular
559895283.author: a TripAdvisor user
559895283.reviewBody: One of the most intriguing ancient ruins.  Our guide, Victor was a wealth of information.  A guided tour is a must if you have limited time.  It\'s history is mind blowing.  And what civilization were they really.  Many unanswered questions by academia.

559829963.name: Jungle ruins in remote Chiapas - great adventure
559829963.author: a TripAdvisor user
559829963.reviewBody: We planned our Mexico trip this year with the Palenque ruins as our main destination.  We were not disappointed.  It was not easy to get here, which perhaps made the visit all the more valuable.  Fortunately, we arrived on an overcast day--so were spared much of the heat and humidity other visitors might experience.  The sprawling grounds would be difficult to navigate and interpret without a guide. It is easy to take a combi to the entrance.  There are two small entrance fees--to the national park and then to the ruins.  We requested an English-speaking guide at the entrance--and Balem hopped into our combi to offer her services.  She pitched $1200 (pesos), and when we balked she encouraged us (since it\'s Mexico) to barter.  She came down to $800 (pesos = $40 US).  Probably could have gone lower.  She was an enthusiastic, well-informed, energetic guide who led us around the ruins, paced our visit well, and gave us a wrapup plan when her tour concluded two hours later.  (That is: go see this and go see that and then take this path down to the exit.  Which we did.)  The path down to the exit follows a stream with a spectacular cascade toward the bottom.  The museum is easy to pass up if you feel exhausted by the heat and exertion,  but it is an outstanding exhibit with excellent English placards.  Don\'t pass it up.  There is also a great circular footpath that leads into the jungle hillside and past several overgrown and deteriorated temples and gives you an idea what the unexcavated 95% of the archeological site is like.  Palenque was worth the whole trip to Mexico!  What a jewel Chiapas has.

558314177.name: Stunning and important
558314177.author: a TripAdvisor user
558314177.reviewBody: Palenque is a very accessible site for seeing the grandeur and power of Maya architecture. You can climb through the palace or stay on the flatland and still admire the impressive history and building skill of an important culture. We\'ve been there twice in the last five years and would visit again. Great museum as well.

557635665.name: Fascinating experience
557635665.author: a TripAdvisor user
557635665.reviewBody: The ruins at Palenque feel very different than those at Uxmal or Tulum, being from an earlier period of Mayan history. The site is easy to explore with or without a guide. There were guides at the entrance who spoke some English but our 4 hour tour was more like 2 hours, and while he was very pleasant his knowledge seemed superficial and he wasn\'t able to answer many of our questions beyond his basic spiel. I would recommend stopping at the store first (near the museum where you pay for admission) and picking up a book about Palenque, Only a small part of the site has been excavated but what is there shows a lot about both the ceremonial and everyday side of Mayan life. There are still temple sites you can climb which gives a wonderful view of the surroundings. Wear good shoes or secure sandals! As with any historical site the more you know before going the better your experience, so read up on the history before going.

557226856.name: Watch out for bugs/mosquitos
557226856.author: a TripAdvisor user
557226856.reviewBody: A visual feast for ruins fans but by the time I reached Palenque, I was already suffering from the ruins fatigue. That was, after Monte Alban and Teotihuacan. The town wasn\'t quite charming. Go if this is on your way. But personally I don\'t think it\'s quite worth the overnight bus ride from Oaxaca. Definitely need a good amount of bug spray.

557199424.name: Not much to add
557199424.author: a TripAdvisor user
557199424.reviewBody: I don\u2019t think there is much to add sbout the Palenque ruins! I did also the walk through the jungle to see some ruins half covered by vegetation: it\u2019s a nice walk in the jungle .. highlight is the pool with acquedoct .. lovely warm water ! Also : don\u2019t miss the museum it\u2019s got nice things in case you haven\u2019t seen any major anthropology museum with maya things in it

556746798.name: Mexico\'s Mayans in Microcosm
556746798.author: a TripAdvisor user
556746798.reviewBody: A bit like Tikal in that there\'s lots not dug out. But quite compact and a great feel with a walk inside on if the palaces which was a first for us in Mexico.

556333374.name: Mayan Might
556333374.author: a TripAdvisor user
556333374.reviewBody: This is a Mayan site originally established in 100BC and situated within a National Park area very close to Palenque town.  The archaeological site is located quite a long way from the main entrance where you have to buy a ticket for the park only so make sure you have transport to the site if you have difficulty walking.  Here you need another ticket to visit the site.  The site, which is very impressive, is in the jungle and there are various temples as well as a palace to see. Some areas are deeper in the jungle but the main buildings are more accessible. Be aware that some of the stairs are steep and the day we visited they were slippery from rain. The most important discovery is the tomb of Pakal which is in the Temple of Inscriptions although it is closed to the public. There is a lot to see in this particular temple including many carvings and obviously inscriptions as well as a steam room and toilets. The actual skeleton and the original jewellery of Pakal are in the Anthropological museum in Mexico City but you can see replicas in the museum which is on the road back to the main park entrance.  My advice is to have a guide as you will get far more understanding from your visit. Within the site there are plenty of locals selling souvenirs,some handmade, others not.  A local tribe of Indians who live in the jungle and who are dressed in long white garments with long hair wander round outside selling such things as bow and arrows, dream catchers and jewellery made from local seeds. Better to buy something original from them rather than something produced in a factory.

556140395.name: Climb among the ruins
556140395.author: a TripAdvisor user
556140395.reviewBody: Only a fraction of this site has so far been uncovered.  To date the 4 main temples have been excavated along with a number of other buildings but expect excavations to continue way into the future.  You need to do an extensive amount of climbing quite high steps and walking over rough and slippery stones so not a first choice for those with limited mobility.  You will find load of souvenir sellers at the site with some items showing genuine craftsmanship and others just cheap junk items.  It would certainly help to have a guide as it is hard to comprehend what you are looking at without one.  Make sure that you get dropped at the temple site and not at the museum as they are some miles apart.  Allow 2-3 hours to tramp around.

555720869.name: Great place to see ruins
555720869.author: a TripAdvisor user
555720869.reviewBody: We were really impressed by the ruins here. It is not as crowded as some of the other sites closer to Cancun. The detail in some of the carvings was amazing. Good place to see ruins and jungle.

555314894.name: Magical Palenque
555314894.author: a TripAdvisor user
555314894.reviewBody: I have been traveling to,Palenque since 1973  before tourism . It was magical . Now it has many tourists , but still has a magical quality . I would not walk alone these days , but wLk with your friend or to trusts . I found tourists my last trip  to be safe and enjoy the sights .if you are an adventurer you can find ruins they are digging about an hour away .Palenque is  a pleasant little town  . Last time I flew from Mexico City to Villahermosa a Southern  city then took a good bus for about 2 hours to,Palenque . They used to have day trips from Cancun because European tourists love to visit ruins . I never tire looking at Palenque .

555039860.name: Awesome
555039860.author: a TripAdvisor user
555039860.reviewBody: This ruins are breath taking to say the least.\nI highly recommend to take a guide with you so all the rich history is explain in depth,still if you decide to guide your self it is a remarkable sight in it self

554643047.name: Spectacular
554643047.author: a TripAdvisor user
554643047.reviewBody: I had broken my wrist a few days earlier so didn\'t leave the area where the main pyramids are but just sitting under a tree enjoying the look of them was enough.  Not too many peddlers either.

554625967.name: Truly impressive
554625967.author: a TripAdvisor user
554625967.reviewBody: Absolutely impressive site, set in jungle. Lots of stalls outside site which can distract from authenticity, but it\u2019s not too invasive to the overall visit. Definitely hire a guide - they will tell you all the stories and explain the representations in the carvings. Given the magnitude and history of the ruins, you just can\u2019t miss it! Magical place - could have spent so much longer than one day there to investigate more!

554488421.name: Must see before you die
554488421.author: a TripAdvisor user
554488421.reviewBody:
You must see this!
Most people on an organized tour from San Cristobal de las Casas. However the drive is extremely long and if your driver - like ours - only think about speed and not about comfort or safety, you probably end up regretting it. 

We found out that you can simply fly in directly to Palenque, see the ruinas and fly out again. The town is not a place you will enjoy visiting for a longer period. Then rather choose SCDLC for a longer stay.

554217987.name: Atunkng
554217987.author: a TripAdvisor user
554217987.reviewBody: Great ruins and definitely worth the visit!! Very different from other Mayan ruins we had visited before like Tikal, Copan and Tulum. Getting here was super easy in a set prices colectivo for 20MX each way from the centre of town and from just outside the entrance for the return journey. Entrance cost 34MX for National Park and then 70MX for the actual ruins. Well worth it! Took us about 2hrs to wander around but you could probably stay for longer if you wanted to explore every part in detail. Unfortunately there are people selling things all around the grounds which is a bit of a shame but they don\u2019t bother you too much. Well worth the visit. Highly recommended!

554096001.name: Some of the best Maya buildings
554096001.author: a TripAdvisor user
554096001.reviewBody: Much of the site is extremely well preserved.  You can still explore the entire Palace (aside from going up in the tower) and still climb all 5 temples of the Cross Group.\nStellar art, beautiful setting with green lawns setting of the grey stone buildings.\nSomewhat disappointing can no longer climb Temple of the Inscriptions or go in the real Pacal tomb but there is a model of the tomb at the site museum.

553862260.name: Beautiful and breathtaking!
553862260.author: a TripAdvisor user
553862260.reviewBody: Plan on spending 1-3 hours taking in not only the excavated ruins, but also the hiking trails in the surrounding jungle. To get there, you can easily take a collectivo from Palenque or El Panchan for 20 pesos (tourist price). We chose to walk from El Panchan. There is a $35 MXN fee for the park, and an additional $70 MXN to enter the ruins. There are guides available near the entrance if you\u2019d like, but be sure to ask around for the best price/guide. There are labels near the large ruins in English and Spanish, however, so you may not necessarily need a guide (we didn\u2019t have one). The excavated ruins are stunning, and as you hike through the jungle, practically every hill and mound you see is an unexcavated ruin! This is not to miss when visiting Chiapas.

553617303.name: AMAZING PLACE!!
553617303.author: a TripAdvisor user
553617303.reviewBody: I loved this place!!! They are in great conditions! Clean and safe. I hired a guy (he was 16 years old), He is not a certificated guide but I did it to help him, he said that he is not certificated because he doesnt know languages, he just knew Spanish (I speak Spanish). I hired him for 300 pesos, 2 hours tour. Certificated guides cost 1600 pesos. Our guided was young but he knew the story of the ruins and he could explained about them. I got impressed for the beauty of Palenque. It is a must-seen of a traveller.

552806036.name: My First Ruins
552806036.author: a TripAdvisor user
552806036.reviewBody: We hired an official guide, Edgar. $1300 pesos for the basic tour 1.5hour  and it was worth it! Since it is right after the holidays, the park was not crowded at all. Bring sunscreen and be prepared to walk. The vendors were a bit pricier than in town however quickly came down in price without us needing to ask. Plenty of options for a snack and beverages. Next year we bring the kids!

551881742.name: Brilliant, great start to Mundo Maya
551881742.author: a TripAdvisor user
551881742.reviewBody: Loved it. Awe and wonder. Perfect first ruin (or end if you\'ve been to Chichen Itza). Lots of people selling stuff but not overwhelming and you get an amazing sense of history. GreT combo of pedicured lawns and jungle scrambles. I was totally impressed.

551829455.name: Palenque Ruins
551829455.author: a TripAdvisor user
551829455.reviewBody: Beautiful. Amazing. They do have bathrooms. FOOD AND WATER ARE AVAILABLE!   It is  27 Pesos to get into the National Park.   57 pesos entrance fee to access the ruins. Also includes museum admission fee. Present your ticket at the museum entrance counter.  Don\'t litter! Pick up after yourself!

551518649.name: Worth it / Vale la pena
551518649.author: a TripAdvisor user
551518649.reviewBody: Visitar estas ruinas es algo asombroso, sobre todo por la historia y por el tama\u00f1o de la ciudad. Si viajan de San Cristobal el camino es muy pesado, se recomienda quedarse una noche o regresar de Villahermosa. Tomen dramamine para el camino. \n\nAmazing experience, history and size of this city is worth visiting. If traveling from San Cristobal, the trip is quite long and curvy. I recommend staying a night or flying back to your home from Villahermosa. If visiting by car, take dramamine.

549738069.name: Tour bus blocked our car so we couldn\'t leave!
549738069.author: a TripAdvisor user
549738069.reviewBody: Very interesting and beautiful place to visit but don\'t be in a hurry to leave! We parked exactly where we were told to park and a tour bus blocked us in!! I went to the administrative office and the director said "pues hay mucha gente." LOL! Welcome to Mexico!

549684620.name: Marvellous
549684620.author: a TripAdvisor user
549684620.reviewBody: Despite crowds the ruins of the Mayan City were awe inspiring, romantic and fun. The backdrop is jungle which gives the sight a sense of mystery. A must

548510261.name: Just awesome
548510261.author: a TripAdvisor user
548510261.reviewBody: We\u2019ve been to Chitzen Itz\u00e1, but this one beats it by a landslide. The scenery in the jungle is amazing, the ruins are impressive, and the amount of tourist is doable. But the most important part: you get the chance to climbs pretty much every stone. Go!

548464761.name: The lost world in Chiapas
548464761.author: a TripAdvisor user
548464761.reviewBody: This place was amazing...we paid a tour guide and he was out photographer too.  It was great to get up to the top and see the beauty from high above

548418032.name: Great Ruins and a Fantastic Guide
548418032.author: a TripAdvisor user
548418032.reviewBody: The ruins were fabulous and all the more so because we had a fantastic guide.  We hired Mildred Lucas (Mildredlucasgarcia@gmail.com) to guide us through the ruins at Palenque and liked her so much we asked her to take us to the ruins at Bonompak and Taxchilan too.  She knew an incredible amount about the ruins and the Mayan civilization  and was able to explain it well in English.    We\'ve had many guides at many archaeological sites in the past, and Ms Lucas ranks right up there with the best of them.   These ruins are superlative and were made more so for us because we chanced upon a superlative guide.

548012566.name: Good but get a guide!!
548012566.author: a TripAdvisor user
548012566.reviewBody: When you go there, for a MXN $100, it is an option to get a guide that will explain everything. They charge MXN 32 for the entrance to the park and then MXN$70 to go into the ruins and if you go with a go pro MXN $45, all this is USD$15 approximately, which is more than fair. Do not be cheap on this, deserve it.

546249560.name: Excellent ruins
546249560.author: a TripAdvisor user
546249560.reviewBody: The ruins were excellent to explore.  We did it without a guide and used our cell phone and GPS to find our way about.  The downside was that it was really muggy from the rain the previous night.  Also be prepared to be confronted with an over abundance of souvenir sellers and freelance guides.

545540317.name: Magical!!
545540317.author: a TripAdvisor user
545540317.reviewBody: The view when you first enter the site is breathtaking - a huge plaza with views of the Temple of Inscriptions, Palace, the Cross Group, and more.  We\'ve visited a lot of other Mayan ruins, but it\'s setting in the hills of Chiapas and the architecture which allowed for bigger interior spaces makes it unique.  The Palace is huge and on an even bigger platform raised more than 30 ft!  The Cross group with its temples built on hills is so mysterious looking - the jungle surrounding adds to the effect.  It rains a lot here - bring an umbrella or rain jacket.

545252082.name: Breathtaking
545252082.author: a TripAdvisor user
545252082.reviewBody: This was our second visit, and we were able to see much more of the stunning architecture.  This place boggles the mind.

544578608.name: Ruins with great surroundings.
544578608.author: a TripAdvisor user
544578608.reviewBody: These ruins are not the biggest, or the oldest, but to me it was some of the best ruins in Mexico anyway. The surroundings with jungle made these my favorite. Quit and calming to walk around. Something disappointing was that there where no guides that spoke english. ( and the price for a guide was 1200 pesos (!)) But there were plenty of good signs to reed so it worked out anyway.

544273268.name: Great experience
544273268.author: a TripAdvisor user
544273268.reviewBody: The most incredible ruinas I have been after the Peruvians , but it was spectacular.very organized people were very nice and lots of tranquility.and very cultural .

544123118.name: Beautiful & peaceful - exceeded my expectations
544123118.author: a TripAdvisor user
544123118.reviewBody: I\'ve visited many of the ancient Mayan sites in Mexico, Guatemala, Belize and Honduras and Palenque is high on my list of favorites. The mountain side setting is rather spectacular. The weather was nice and there were not very many other visitors in late November. I was happy to see that the site wasn\'t overly commercialized. Collectivos and taxis are easily available from town near the ADO bus station.

544121554.name: Cool ruins
544121554.author: a TripAdvisor user
544121554.reviewBody: Neat to see very nice Mayan ruins. Too many people selling guide services outside. Otherwise the ruins we\'re in remarkably good shape for ruins and it was fun to see.

543719661.name: It depends on the guide
543719661.author: a TripAdvisor user
543719661.reviewBody:
Our guide was really good.
For two people it asked 1500 pesos. I was happy to paid it. 4 hours walking. 2 in the ruins and 2 in the jungle with good stories and explanation on the jungle.
You can find cheaper guides and you can discuss the price further.
On the same day we discussed with another couple and they had a bad experience. As said, matter of guide.

543214364.name: Excellent site - do not miss the museum
543214364.author: a TripAdvisor user
543214364.reviewBody: We took part in a group tour that drove 1200 miles in Mexico through five ruins. Palenque, Uxmal, and Thotoulican are all much more impressive than the far better known Chichen Itza. Anyhow:\n1. Watch the National Geographic episode on cracking the Mayan Code to better appreciate Palenque. \n2. Visit the museum to see the huge sarcophagus of King Bacal.

542841362.name: Best ruins in Mexico
542841362.author: a TripAdvisor user
542841362.reviewBody:
I was very impressed with these ruins, apart from the fact that in Palenque seems to be always raining! Very recommended to have  a guide for the visit as the ruins makes more sense if someone tells you the history  of the Red Queen, the Mayans and why they disappeared. Sometimes you could even feel like we were living those facts right there.

 
All the structure is very well conserved so it is easy to imagine and recreate the history. The landscapes are also stunning, in the middle of the mayan jungle, and surrounded by trees and wild animals. Not very far from there (10-15 minutes walking) there are a few small waterfalls that worth a visit.

 
The negative point was that they charged me for using my GoPro "because  I could record", when nobody else in my tour had to pay for their devices, even recording video. The lady at the entrance was so rude, I explained here that had no where to leave my camera and she just invited me to leave if I didn't want to pay the ridiculously high fee for my camera, not even offered to leave it at the reception or in a locker.

542509859.name: My Favourite Ruins in Mexico, Much less crowded than Chichen Itza
542509859.author: a TripAdvisor user
542509859.reviewBody: These were my first Mexican ruins and by far my favourite. The jungle setting around the ruins is stunning. You walk through the trees and they part to reveal the ruins in the middle. The air is very humid and sticky (as it\'s in the jungle) but there is lots of shade from the trees. It is much less crowded than Chichen Itza and also does not have people constantly pestering you to buy their tourist tat, which leaves you time to explore in peace. There is also a museum on the site, which gave further cultural insights. I cannot recommend this enough!

541813367.name: Palenque tour by Natural Focus
541813367.author: a TripAdvisor user
541813367.reviewBody: We had a great tour with Natural Focus, our guide Mina was really helpful and just so knowledgeable about the area and the ruins. We really enjoyed the whole experience -well worth seeing!

541570487.name: Mayan Wonders
541570487.author: a TripAdvisor user
541570487.reviewBody: The drive from San Cristobal to Palenque was pretty rough. This place is magical!  We saw the ruins, agua azul and Misol-Ha all within the same tour.  I would have preferred to separate the ruins from the other two trips because everything was in a rush rush to complete all tours in the same day.  Other than that no complaints.  I am so very happy to have had this wonderful experience.

541402531.name: Stunning & surprisingly quiet
541402531.author: a TripAdvisor user
541402531.reviewBody:
Some of the best renovated Mayan pyramids and temples, the site is beautifully laid out and manages to remain feeling uncrowded even with large numbers of visitors.

We had a local guide take us a round and bring the site to life - they are VERY worth the cost, (not much) and add to the visit.

I'd go soon while it's still possible to clamber over some of the ruins, as I am sure some will soon be roped off to visitors to ensure they last.

540543021.name: Nice experience
540543021.author: a TripAdvisor user
540543021.reviewBody: If you visit palenque, you should go here. There are guids at the entrence who can give you a your. there were 2 tours. one 1.5 hours only the tempels for 1300 pesos  and one 3 hour tour for 2300 pesos. We shared the price with 2 other girls that joined our group and did the 3 hour tour and we liked it. Our guide was Nacho and he spoke very good English.\nIt rained a lot and they also sold ponchos.

540436712.name: This is a great site in great surroundings
540436712.author: a TripAdvisor user
540436712.reviewBody: The very popular Palenque ruins are a real tourist attraction and arriving there in the morning when the site opens, makes you understand why.  This is a must see, when you are in the neighbourhood.  There are other sites in Mexico - that maybe are more enjoyable, because they are not so touristic - but this is a great site!

540130548.name: Amazing place
540130548.author: a TripAdvisor user
540130548.reviewBody: A lot better than Chichen Itza in my personal opinion. The fact that the site was almost completely covered by the jungle and the sky so dark and close to the ruins offers a unique experience. Unlike Chichen Itza we had the chance to enjoy the place without having to deal with people selling stuff at every 5 metres. Also, our guide was great.

539865656.name: Incredible experience
539865656.author: a TripAdvisor user
539865656.reviewBody: To summarize what others have said and we agree with... at the park entrance you will pay the park fee. Don\'t hire the guides there. Be sure to drive to the top, where you will pay another fee, for the ruins. Hire one of the certified guides there, and do the 3 hour tour of both the park and the ruins. Park opens at 6:30, ruins at 8. Get there early to see the most birds/ animals and less people. Plan to buy some great souvenirs and support the locals!

539817251.name: Palenque ruins
539817251.author: a TripAdvisor user
539817251.reviewBody: The ruins are about 7 km from the city. Pay at the gate for the car and later again for your entrance. At the parking place there are a lot of junkies so ignore them. The monument is magnificent, extensive. It takes an hour to get throught.

539441888.name: This has to be on your bucket list
539441888.author: a TripAdvisor user
539441888.reviewBody: Palenque is a bit out of the way, good news there are few people visiting the place.  Hire a guide, you can negotiate with them on the price of the tour.  The sign said 1300 pesos, but since it was just my wife and I we paid 600 for an almost 3 hour tour of the ruins and the jungle..  Worth going our of your way to see this place.

538833731.name: Ruins
538833731.author: a TripAdvisor user
538833731.reviewBody: Awesome spot. Best I\'ve seen behind tikal. Plenty to do, some off the beaten track paths, wildlife, and lovely waterfalls. Excellent day

537757117.name: Best Ruins in Mexico!
537757117.author: a TripAdvisor user
537757117.reviewBody: Without a doubt, these are the most impressive ruins we have ever visited in Mexico!  Definitely hire a guide (there are English speaking guides) to fully appreciate the enormity and history of this magnificent site.  Breathtaking!  Worth the trip to get there!

537537509.name: What an excellent experience!!! MUST DO activity
537537509.author: a TripAdvisor user
537537509.reviewBody:
We expected brilliance, but we didn’t half expect just how incredible it is!

The grounds are so well kept, and so much to see! 

It’s a full days worth, so make sure to bring plenty of water and snacks. 

You can walk up and around many of the ruins which sets this attraction apart from the rest.

Pictures do not do it justice. You can’t hear the jungle around the ruins through pictures, but the howling monkeys really add to the experience. Sadly we didn’t see any, but they are heard for up to 3 miles away and what a sound! Makes you feel like Mayans still live there. 

The ruins themselves are very well preserved, so much to see and take in. 

My favourite ruins I have ever visited, ever!

I recommend to anyone travelling to Mexico. Please please go and see this beautiful piece of history!

537224091.name: Amazing Ruins
537224091.author: a TripAdvisor user
537224091.reviewBody:
The ruins themselves are incredible.  There are numerous examples that you can get up close and climb to the top of.  They are pretty intact and have a sign next to each with some information about each one in English but not a great deal so if you are really wanting to find out about Mayan culture you may want to hire a guide.

We went about 8 in the morning and it was Dailey quiet but got busier as the morning went on with tour groups arriving but still didn't feel crowded.  It took 3 hours for us to fully explore and it was pretty humid so take plenty of water.

The museum is closed on Mondays.

The

536028098.name: Worth
536028098.author: a TripAdvisor user
536028098.reviewBody: Better than chichen itza because there wasn\'t do much people. You could feel the atmosphere of mystery. 2nd place is for Coba especially when its raining and there is nobody

535924027.name: Fantastic sight.
535924027.author: a TripAdvisor user
535924027.reviewBody: These Aztec ruins are justifiably one of the archeological wonders of the world. Just walking in through the dense vegetation and emerging into the open view of the ruins was a great experience. We had a well informed guide who made history come to life. Not even a tropical downpour towards the end of the visit could dampen our enjoyment.

535437676.name: Magic place
535437676.author: a TripAdvisor user
535437676.reviewBody: Magic, the place, the mountains and surroundings, really nice to visit and relax - Easy to arrive from the city too!!!

535094937.name: Best ruins in Mexico
535094937.author: a TripAdvisor user
535094937.reviewBody: We visited many a ruins in Mexico including the world famous Chichen Itza but for me these we\'re my favourite. There\'s lots to see and explore and you can even go inside one of the pyramids! I would also recommend doing the 4 hour jungle trek just the other side of the ruins to make a day of it!

533593792.name: Incredible experience
533593792.author: a TripAdvisor user
533593792.reviewBody: This site is a wonderful cultural experience that can take hours to explore and enjoy. Even with clouds and intermittent rain, I would recommend going here. The museum is a MUST and is included in the price of admission to park, just present the ticket at the counter. We didn\'t use a tour guide because there were signs everywhere, but may have missed some good information and they can be hired easily at the start.\n\nMUST SEE

533263852.name: Magic
533263852.author: a TripAdvisor user
533263852.reviewBody:
In the middle of the jungle the palenque ruins are magic. We arrived early in the morning so the masses weren't there. 

It was an unforgettable experience. We didn't have a guide we walked around.

Tip: take the paths down to the 2nr exit. It's a climb with steep steps but definitely worth it. Though the jungle and passing a hanging bridge and just before the exit back to the central plaza.

532572023.name: Lahkma - Big water, was amazing!
532572023.author: a TripAdvisor user
532572023.reviewBody: We hadn\'t planned on hiring a guide but I\'m so happy we did. I\'ve explored other Mayan ruins along with Machu Picchu without one but in this case, Edgar was amazing. It was low season so he gave us a deal: 1,000 pesos for the ruins and 1,000 pesos for the jungle tour, normally advertised as $1,500 each and you don\'t have to do both but we chose to. Our Spanish was okay but definitely not fluent enough to fully understand a guide in Spanish and Edgar answered all of our questions about how to say things in Spanish along with teaching us about the land, the ruins and nature. He took our water bottles and filled them with delicious spring water that runs under the ruins giving them Mayan name of Lahkma - "Big Water". He knew I am interested in plants and medicine and was able to show me many plants the curanderas and Mayans used to treat ailments. During the jungle tour portion he guided us though the national park outside of the ruins to an ancient Mayan bathing pool that was only uncovered 2 years ago (there\'s still so much archeologists are working on uncovering and studying) and we got to swim in it. You could see the spring that was bubbling feeding it. So refreshing and afterwards he led us through an underground aqueduct that we would have never ever known was even there on our own. We shared space with bats and appreciated the underground ancient stone work. If you visit Palenque and want a unique experience and a guide who speaks English, ask for Edgar. We also very easily found a shaman y champignons magico with his help. Thank you Edgar and thanks you Palenque for sharing your magic with us.

531693178.name: Mayan Ruins just outside Palenque.
531693178.author: a TripAdvisor user
531693178.reviewBody: "Guides" are available for about 200 Pesos AND WORTH IT! Our guide spoke English and was very enthusiastic about showing these Ruins and describing them to us and telling us their purpose to the Mayan culture. He was with us for 2 hours and he did a great job. Worth every Peso and probably more. (The 200 Pesos we gave him would have been $12 CAD at the time).

531126462.name: Incredible Mayan architecture
531126462.author: a TripAdvisor user
531126462.reviewBody: We got a guide who could speak Spanglish (Spanish and English) and he described everything brilliantly! No one was board, not even us kids. I\'m very fascinated about the history of Mexico and our tour made me even more interested! Our guide (his name is Salvador) told us all about the different aches, when the Mayans arrived at Palenque. I would defiantly recommend the ruins in Palenque.

530666929.name: Breathtaking
530666929.author: a TripAdvisor user
530666929.reviewBody: There are no words to describe the ruins. We\'ve traveled all over Mexico and viewed countless title and these by far are the most amazing.  Truly an awesome site.

530207187.name: A little bit of Maya magic in the jungle
530207187.author: a TripAdvisor user
530207187.reviewBody: The Maya Ruins in Palenque are located in the jungle and are very impressive, some of them are still hidden. If you walk around, there is a magical, mysterious atmosphere. Our guide Ernesto told us a lot of interesting facts and stories about these ruins and their red queen. This year is the last year you can climb on the ruins. Must do in Palenque!

529697399.name: Ruinas de Palenque....get a guide to go through the jungle!
529697399.author: a TripAdvisor user
529697399.reviewBody: If you go to the Ruinas de Palenque, pay for a guide. I know they can be pricey, but you can bring the price down. If the price is 125 dls, they can go all the way down to half :) The guide is well worth the money. They give you great info and the walk through the jungle is very cool, lots of interesting information. And you can drink the water from the cascadas, it is safe!! All 5 of us did it and none of us got sick. The guide filled up out bottles of water and we all drank it, no problem! Be sure to bring comfortable hiking shoes and get ready to walk.

529290756.name: Amazing
529290756.author: a TripAdvisor user
529290756.reviewBody: It\'s one of a beautiful Mayan\'s ruins. The place surrounded by jungle. You can make a hike in jungle. See monkeys and lots of different plants. You can climb almost every pyramids and it\'s nice. Great view.\nBring large clothes it\'s super hot and humidity but a lot of mosquitoes.

528748820.name: Visiting the Maya\'s
528748820.author: a TripAdvisor user
528748820.reviewBody: This is one of the places you ought to see during a round trip Mexico, Guatamala, Hunduras and Belice. Arrange a good guide to get known the history. Spend a few hours here and have a view of one of the big temples.

524388192.name: Do your homework
524388192.author: a TripAdvisor user
524388192.reviewBody: You can come here to do some exercising or to see some old buildings, but the best way is to study the background and learn the history.

524336955.name: Amazing
524336955.author: a TripAdvisor user
524336955.reviewBody: amongst most of the Maya ruins it\'s the most beautiful one. Set in the middle of jungle hills, surrounded by a big portion of jungle full of ruins this place is so romantic and charming. Get a guide for 500pesos it will help a lot and show you at the end the jungle path.

522302825.name: Impressive Pyramids
522302825.author: a TripAdvisor user
522302825.reviewBody: Just an amazing experience, beautiful pyramids with beautiful surrounding jungle, great hiking trails just outside of the ruin area, unfortunately people are not allowed to climb the big pyramid.

521794795.name: Beautiful history place
521794795.author: a TripAdvisor user
521794795.reviewBody: I was there with my boyfriend, we hired a maya guide who was on the side of the street, Best guide ever. he knew this place very well, he teach us about the place, the land and the jungle.

521523452.name: Breath taking !
521523452.author: a TripAdvisor user
521523452.reviewBody: To live in the era of cellphones, internet, and to have my father tell me stories about being the first farm in North Dakota to have a tv and everyone would come and sit on the front lawn and watch, going to a place like this is just mind blowing!  These guys did not have back hoes and tractor, they did everything by hand! As you walk around and see the 23 pyramids remember NASA has done mapping and there are 1023 more under ground! mind blowing! Remember to visit the tomb of Kaba its down the road near the exit, and remember to bring water lots of water ..

520115880.name: Top ruins of Mexico
520115880.author: a TripAdvisor user
520115880.reviewBody: Big grounds, beautiful ruins and less people than more popular sites around Mexico. Take sun protection

519349815.name: Breathtaking!
519349815.author: a TripAdvisor user
519349815.reviewBody: I had 8 years planning my trip to Palenque, finally it happened, thank God! While entering I had so much emotions, not knowing what to expect from the place - its such a beautiful and amazing place, so full of history, energy, peace, you want to go around every corner, go up and down every building and the best thing is you can do it in most of them. The location of the ruins in a place so green, with so much vegetation and so well maintained, is truly priceless!\nVisit Chiapas - it\'s fascinating, every place has its charms, every excursion so different, so worth and you will feel safe.

518558138.name: Awe inspiring and not too busy
518558138.author: a TripAdvisor user
518558138.reviewBody:
We really loved Palenque ruins, they were definitely worth the trip to the city. As they're completely nestled in the jungle-covered hills, we found them quite a different experience to Uxmal and Chichen Itza which are so much more open. 

Wandering through the ruins, you can really imagine the lives of the people living in this huge city as you catch glimpses of the other buildings through gaps in the trees. 

The one improvement they could make would be to add more information to the signs and plaques around the ruins as this would give you a more detailed idea of the uses and significance of the different buildings.

516892794.name: best site in the area
516892794.author: a TripAdvisor user
516892794.reviewBody: worth the trip !\neasy to visit, the site is in the middle of a beautiful garden/forest with shade where you can rest and meditate

516433913.name: A must
516433913.author: a TripAdvisor user
516433913.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit and taking a guided tour. You can explore the jungle and the ruins, I think this is the only Mayan city where the public can enter the tombs and walk into the palace.

515607592.name: Amazing Maya ruins, a Magic atmosphere
515607592.author: a TripAdvisor user
515607592.reviewBody:
Very well organized place with amazing ruins. I visited many Maya archeological places and Palenque worth a the visit definitely. I strongly suggest to book the guide the day before, if it is not possible you can do it in the morning and start your visit at 7:30 am.
Ask a 3 hours tour that starts with the guide that brings you to walk in the jungle to see the ruins that still are covered by the nature, you'll hear and see monkeys, birds, tropical trees and ruins of course. In the meanwhile he will explain many things of Maya culture.
After the walk in the jungle (about 1 hour and a half) the guide will bring you to the archeological zone explaining you anything about this place.

515351918.name: Don\'t buy water at the entrance!
515351918.author: a TripAdvisor user
515351918.reviewBody: The ruins are very nice, we went there in the afternoon and it was not crowded. BUT I would not recommend to buy water at the entrance. I bought a water bottle and noticed 5 minutes later that it was not fresh water and that the bottle was already opened before. Also the water was really expensive. So you should bring some water with you.

512723965.name: Espectacular Maya ruins! make the effort to get to Palenque and enjoy !
512723965.author: a TripAdvisor user
512723965.reviewBody: Chichen Itz\u00e1 ruins yes, but don\'t forget to make the effort to go to Palenque (Chiapas), it\'s a 8 hour bus trip from M\u00e9rida but definitely worth it. Hidden in the Chiapas jungle and unknown to the world for almost 700 years, these espectacular Maya ruins have a great architectural value. Bear in mind that only 5% (!) of the city has has been "cleaned" from the jungle , the rest is still mimetized/hidden in the deep green. A guide is recommended for the visit (1 hour with guide and 1 hour on your own will do it). If you make a group with others, 100 pesos per person for the guide is a good price.
