     As for returning home to Palenquè,  there are collectivos that arrive to drop off new passengers, and they always stop to see if people want a ride back.   Again, 1 way costs 20p, no more.  
     As for the Ruins themselves, there are many TA reviews that can help you with that.  We thought we would just clear up getting there and back.  Also, there is a restaurant beside the entrance for people  in a group that finish seeing the ruins before the rest of their group or people waiting for their tour bus to retrieve them.  Enjoy, bring water, and get ready to climb some stairs for the most epic photographs!

454866240.name: Simply Stunning
454866240.author: a TripAdvisor user
454866240.reviewBody: Having seen this place in so many TV docos, We were afraid it might disappoint, we shouldn\'t have worried, it\'s a fantastic place lots to see and explore, make sure you do a bit of training before you go, lots n lots of stairs to climb

454829298.name: Fantastic place
454829298.author: a TripAdvisor user
454829298.reviewBody: We visited Palenque due to its ruins and it  is the second most interesting place after Yaxchilan. Allow plenty of time (3-4 hours) if you want to make the most of the experience.

454267926.name: Interesting, beautiful and amazing
454267926.author: a TripAdvisor user
454267926.reviewBody: It is a great experience to meet this ancient civilization, it is possible to hire an official guide but there are also people from the locality that can explain you the ruins and its history. Unfortunately you can not visit Pakal\'s grave, but you can see it in the museum where you can learn more.

454096040.name: A place to see
454096040.author: a TripAdvisor user
454096040.reviewBody: The place is beautiful, a city of the classic Mayan period, in the middle of the jungle, recommended to make a walk, the museum is small with a replica of the tomb of Pakal. The archaeological site is near Palenque the cost of a taxi ride is 50 pesos, you can spend 4 hours in the visit.

453886515.name: Unlike Any Mayan Site--Absolutely Unique!
453886515.author: a TripAdvisor user
453886515.reviewBody:
I've visited all the major Mayan sites--each is magnificent--but there's something very special about Palenque. I first went there in 2006 and returned this month (Jan. 2017). Surrounded by the rainforest, it has a certain mystique which I haven't found elsewhere.  Since the big tourist season was over, I was able to wander in peace and solitude. The first day it rained which only enhanced its intangible beauty. The second day the sun was out and the late afternoon light was absolutely beautiful. When it was time to leave, I took the path which leads to the museum and walked through the rainforest past a waterfall. You should do the same so that you can savor the jungle and its powerful presence. The museum, by the way, is excellent.

Reaching Palenque is  not easy. It has a tiny airport which doesn't function most of the year.  Most people fly into Tuxtla (via Mexico City) and spend a night in San Cristobal de las Casas before catching the bus which takes five hours to reach Palenque. This is the route I took in 2006 except I spent a few days in San Cristobal. But there is a shorter route which I adopted this time by flying into Villahermosa from Houston.
There is a daily 5:35pm flight  from Houston which gets into Villahermosa at 8:20pm.
You can catch the 9:30pm bus to Palenque directly from the airport or spend a night
in Villahermosa and visit the La Venta Park (with its Olmec artifacts in a jungle-like setting) next morning before catching one of the many ADO buses to Palenque (takes 2 1/2 hours). This was my itinerary and I would recommend it.

From Palenque, you must visit Bonampak and  Xachilan, the latter on the Guatemalan border. You can cover both on the same day by taking a tour bus which any one of Palenque's travel agencies will arrange for about $45. Xachilan is remote, reached by bus and boat, deep inside the jungle. It fees like it's been just discovered. Surrounded by the green light of the trees, listen to the howler monkeys.

453857992.name: Beautiful ruins
453857992.author: a TripAdvisor user
453857992.reviewBody: Loved palenque and all of it\'s structures in the jungle. This was one of my favourite ruins in Mexico. The only downside was a lot of tourists and unfortunately local vendors offering drugs or extremely overpriced tours.

453692265.name: Beautiful
453692265.author: a TripAdvisor user
453692265.reviewBody: The ruins are amazing and the site very well preserved. I recommend in low season, as I imagine the place is swarming at any other time

453680392.name: No tomb
453680392.author: a TripAdvisor user
453680392.reviewBody: I came here to see the tomb of Pacal offcourse, wich is closed, due to danger of decay, wich i understand. They made a replica instead, wich is very impressive and huge. Yet, you can\'t see that either, because it\'s behind glass wich has huge drawings on it, and the top of the tomb is in an angle that you cannot see on top of it, wich is actually the most important part. So, i ended up buying a micro replica from the souvenirstands outside, wich i will go and watch when i am at home again ;-)

453653325.name: very impressive
453653325.author: a TripAdvisor user
453653325.reviewBody: rather large area.  lots of steps and right in the jungle.  after the ruins must see the museum.   we walked from nearby to get the tickets at 8am.  hardly anyone there. light and temperatures in morning perfect.  we saw most things before the tourist buses started coming in.

453453001.name: Great Civilization
453453001.author: a TripAdvisor user
453453001.reviewBody: This is the most magnificent ruin site that we have ever visited. The park is spectacular. Don\'t go on Monday if you want to also see the museum as it is not open. Be aware that the steps going down from the edificios to the back gate are long, uneven and could be difficult for older visitors. You can catch a collective at the back gate, however, and the museum is right across the street.

452661581.name: Mystical place
452661581.author: a TripAdvisor user
452661581.reviewBody: The world famous site always impress, no matter how many times I\'ve been here. Not many visitors know that the most of the ruins (95%) are still covered by the tropical forest in the surroundings. There are few pathways opened to the public - one starts just one curve before the upper parking. Wirth to visit, it offers another view on the mayan ruing, allowing to feel yourself a true explorer. Also there is a 4 houe trek to the nearest local town through the hills - contact local guides to arrange it, and you may find many interesting things on the way.

451953001.name: Excellently preserved ruin site.
451953001.author: a TripAdvisor user
451953001.reviewBody: Great Mayan site to visit though there are way too many vendors allowed in to the site.  Once away from the vendor\'s though, the place was quiet and peaceful.

451905177.name: Worth the Visit!
451905177.author: a TripAdvisor user
451905177.reviewBody: This fantastic Mayan site is really worth the visit. We read up on the site before going so did not take a tour or use a guide.  We were able to wander as we pleased and make our own itinerary, which made for a lovely morning. My advise is to enter via the first entrance  (by the waterfall) rather than the main entrance. It is quieter and more mystic as the ruins are amongst the jungle.

451761967.name: Definitely worth the Trip
451761967.author: a TripAdvisor user
451761967.reviewBody: This a really lovely site to visit, not so over run with tourists as some of the more well known sites. Set in the jungle it is a pleasure to explore. Definitely worth a guide.

450777398.name: Fabulous ruins in great surroundings
450777398.author: a TripAdvisor user
450777398.reviewBody: I went to quite a few of the ruins in Mexico, I really enjoyed the ruins at Palenque. It is set in very atmospheric surroundings, and you can walk around the jungle area later to see howler monkeys and ruins that have not yet bee excavated.

450202479.name: Amazing! Must see!
450202479.author: a TripAdvisor user
450202479.reviewBody:
Visiting Palenque was the main purpose of my trip and it did not disappoint. I got an official guide - Edgar, highly recommend him - to take me on a visit to the ruins and into the jungle. I saw all the major buildings - the red queen tomb, the palace, the ball court and the smaller temples (temple of the sun, of the corn, and the cross). Climbed every stair I possibly could. Edgar explained the history of the Maya, the culture, and showed me all the highlights of the sculpture. 

2.5 hours is very short for the tour, but there aren't other tour options. You can take the tour and then keep exploring on your own too! I walked from the main buildings down the path to the museum and got to see the Red Queens bath and other beautiful water falls - it helps you understand how the Maya picked this location - and how they thrived here. 

Definitely go in the morning to avoid most tourists - especially if you are going in December as it is Christmas holiday season and many Mexicans go on vacation.

450182088.name: Amazing!
450182088.author: a TripAdvisor user
450182088.reviewBody: We took a tour, an hour in the jungle and an hour of the ruins. It was a great experience and the tour guide was great. Wear good shoes if you do the jungle tour as they will get wet and muddy.

450099123.name: Amazing sight
450099123.author: a TripAdvisor user
450099123.reviewBody: Such a good sight in the jungle with many different temples and beautiful nature around. There\'s a jungle with a waterfall close as Well. Loved it!

449528448.name: Beautiful place and a must do when visiting Mexiko!
449528448.author: a TripAdvisor user
449528448.reviewBody:
Just stroll through the ruins, and enjoy the amazing place! 
We took a guide which actually was for us worth it, as he could tell us a lot of details and point out quite some things you would probably not realize if you go on your own. 
Edgar spoke perfect English and gave us around a 2 hour tour, starting of at the main ruins and pointing out various things in the palace area! 
Definitely worth spending at least 3 hours.

449144526.name: Great stopping point
449144526.author: a TripAdvisor user
449144526.reviewBody: We have visited several Mayan sites and don\'t consider ourselves big fans. We stopped here because it was en route to Chiapas in general and we thought it a good option activity wise. As the ruins are in the jungle, the ruins seem more mysterious than those heavily frequented by tourists in the Yucatan. We paid approx 200 pesos for car access and tickets for two people so the visit was cheap. Around the site you will find the usual tour guides offering their services (we did not take them up on the offer but they were asking 500 pesos for a private tour).  Jungle wildlife (monkeys) abound and adds to the atmosphere. Recommended visit for the average tourist but I guess a must for the Mayan fans. Enjoy!

448613819.name: Perfect weather
448613819.author: a TripAdvisor user
448613819.reviewBody:
The site was more than expected very clean and well kept.
Our guide Miguel was great very knowledgeable. Good prices, great food, you have to try Bajlum for dinner!

448586373.name: Great ruins!
448586373.author: a TripAdvisor user
448586373.reviewBody: Amazing and incredible ruins.  Well preserved,  interesting and beautiful.  We enjoyed the walk through the jungle, waterfalls and hanging bridge.  Getting any information on how to get to the ruins from the museum lady was like pulling teeth.  She preferred to be on her phone.

448166756.name: the splendour in the jungle
448166756.author: a TripAdvisor user
448166756.reviewBody: Well-preserved ruins set in beautifully maintained grounds and surrounded by jungle. WHat more could you want ? Well, bonuses are that it is not as crowded as other sites and it is shaded well and when your eyes wander elsewhere you can see (and hear) butterflies, birds and howler monkeys.It makes sense to get a guide but you have to dodge the unoffical guides (look for the offical hut close to the entrance) as well as the many souvenier hawkers that intercept you most of the way before you get in. Is it worth it ? A definite yes...

448087859.name: Palenque, a magnifcent place
448087859.author: a TripAdvisor user
448087859.reviewBody:
The ruins of Palenque and the surrounding jungle is a magnificent place that you must not miss. The ruins are a short taxi ride from the main town and hotels. When you arrive I recommend to bring water or buy some outside before beginning your adventure. You should check the weather but expect to wear light comfortable clothes and good walking shoes. Bring sun block, a hat and mosquito repellent if you are going into the jungle, and I recommend doing that.

Definitely find a certified guide outside the park and take the jungle hike. It's beautiful, peaceful and educational. We got to learn about the local fauna and flora, including edible and medicinal plants. I even tasted termites, which were delicious. You will also see ruins that have been consumed by the jungle and haven't yet been excavated.

After your jungle excursion, head to the main gate with you ticket from the ticket booth outside. Take your time and explore this magical place. There are several palaces and pyramids to see and the place is expansive. You will see incredible architecture built by an ancient civilization. Make your way out the back exit where you will descend a staircase, experiencing more ruins and a beautiful waterfall. You will end up at the museum at the bottom which is worth experiencing if you want to learn more.

Don't miss the ruins of Palenque!

447994236.name: Great ruins, great tourist trap
447994236.author: a TripAdvisor user
447994236.reviewBody: Interested in Mayan culture? This place should be visited. We liked it better than Chichen Itza. On the downside, the organization sucks. The traffic up the hill is a complete chaos and it is a miracle our car did not get scratched or dented. Upon parking we had to pay money to a guy \'to watch the car\'. Also, a bunch of people offered themselves as guides for ridiculous prices. So mixed feelings.

447980012.name: Beautiful
447980012.author: a TripAdvisor user
447980012.reviewBody:
The Palanque ruins to me were not the surprise - they were as good as the hype. The surprise to me was how big and buzzing the little town of Palanque actually was. Again, tons written about Palanque ruins, so restrict myself to only tips that might help fellow travelers:

Getting In & Out:
1. Flying in or out to Palanque from Mexico City. Flights operated by Interjet. Only ONCE a week - on Thursdays. (as in Dec 2016)
2. ADO operates overnight buses every night from Merida (and possibly other cities). We found that a comfortable option to get in early. The bus stop has clean restrooms (5 pesos) - if you want to quickly freshen up and head to the ruins before the crowds get in (around 9 to 10)

Palanque ruins:
1. You can get to a 'Collectivo' (shared mini bus) ride to the ruins from opposite the ADO bus stop. 20 pesos per passenger. About 10 min.
2. Please take a guide for a guided tour - as with  any of the Mayan ruin sites. It's worth it. 
3. Unlike the other big Mayan ruins (Chichen Itza, Uxmal, Tulum, etc) , getting guides in Palanque isn't organized. There are many operators and their rates are over inflated (quote was 2400 pesos for a guided tour against a similar duration tour at Chichen Itza was for a fixed 750 pesos). We finally negotiated one for 1050 pesos. Advantage of going when a lot of other people are coming in is you can make a group and share the guide cost. 
4. Ask the guide for a 'history/site + jungle' tour.  The jungle tour part takes you to some parts of the ruins where the jungle still rules (which is 95% of the total ruins) - gives a sense of how explorers found the ruins in and also how difficult it is to uncover them.

Palanque city and stay tips:

1. Try and stay in the 'canada' area. It is a quiet tree lined street with plenty of hotels, restaurants and coffee shops away from the noisy 'centro' part of Palanque. It is also walking distance to the bus stop and also to the shopping central - Centro
2. Centro is the main shopping street of Palanque - and you'll get plenty of food options, thingummies you may want to buy, pharmacies etc

Bit on buses in Mexico (in all my posts on travels in Mexico) 😊

1. Bus anywhere in Mexico is a good idea. They are cheap, safe, comfortable and are extensively networked. 
2. 'First' class buses as they call it are express buses that go from one city to another without stops. They are more expensive and luxurious than 'Second' class buses that stop at an infinite number of stops along the way. 
3. 'First class' ones which we have tried to be good are ADO (in the Yucatán region and up to Mex city), Primera Plus and ETN (the latter two serve north of Mex City). ETN has a super deluxe service with airline business class type seating (though on one leg they were very late). 
4. Intercity buses are from the 'Central De Buses De Guanajuato' (~ 60 pesos taxi ride from the city center). Bus tickets can be bought at outlets in the city center. Some OXXO (7 Eleven equivalent) outlets sell the tickets too for a small commission.
5. We have been advised by a local to not book online as he has had cases when the txn seemed to go through but in the end he had to rush to get it done. (We haven't tried it)
6. Online system does not take international credit cards.
7. They take international credit cards when you buy at their counters.
8. If you are flying in from a different country as we were, you could book as soon as you reach Mexico. Most cities have plenty of coverage and even a day or few hours booking in advance is enough. 
9. Quick note on 'Collectivo' (shared mini bus)- you can hail these shared rides for within the city. Very cheap. But no room for luggage.

Hope this helped and safe travels!

Cheers

447471641.name: Cool
447471641.author: a TripAdvisor user
447471641.reviewBody: Busy but amazing ruins. Lots of vendors in the ruins if you want to combine archeology, sightseein and shopping...

447453936.name: The Myan ruins in a jungle we all dreamed of visiting
447453936.author: a TripAdvisor user
447453936.reviewBody: Lovers of Indiana Jones/Lara Croft will love this place. Of course you are battling with other tourists to get the \'shot\' you want, but it\'s a spectacular place and the guided tour we got was excellent value for money. There is also a jungle tour you can do.

446811177.name: Ruins
446811177.author: a TripAdvisor user
446811177.reviewBody: Get there early by 8.30am to avoid the crowds! It\'s at the top of an 8km road from Palenque centre.  Lovely scenery; but imagine it in its full colourful state of whites, reds and pinks in an amazing jungle setting. Allow yourself 3-4 hours if you want to do the museum at the bottom of the walk. Up there with Tulum, Uxmal, Yaxchilan, Chich\u00e9n Itza in the region as well as Cholula, Monte Alban and Teotihuacan nationally as an archeological site that reminds us of the pre-Hispanic history and culture of this region that remains so alive today in Chiapas

446699843.name: Entrance Fees and  Park Guides
446699843.author: a TripAdvisor user
446699843.reviewBody:
I'm not going to begin to describe why you should visit this amazing, beautiful, powerful place. The purpose of this review is to prepare you for some of you the confusion you might experience getting into the Palenque ruins.

If you are entering the park in an automobile (and not part of a prepaid tour group), you will be stop at what appears to the be the entrance of the ruins and asked to pay a 31 peso (approx. $3) fee for each person in your group. Because we had not done our homework, we didn't realize that this charge was the entrance fee into the National Park itself. 

We then drive another half mile or so to the top of the hill, park, and then arrive at the actual entrance of the ruins.  At that point we paid the entrance fee of 65 pesos per person (approx. $3.50). We found this to be a little confusing.

Beginning at the first entrance and all the way until you pay at the second entrance, you will be bombarded with individuals who claim to be guides. Their prices range from about $5 a person to 4 or 5 times that. Many young children claim to be guides as well. I suggest waiting until you get to the actual entrance to the ruins and then inquire about a certified guide who has a photo ID stating that he or she works for Palanque. Once again the prices range quite a lot and seem to be quite subject to bargaining. We asked for an English speaking guide who charged 500 pesos ($25 total) for the 4 of us for 2 hours. He was excellent. His first language was Mayan and he other Mayan languages as well. He took his job very seriously and we learned many things that we would have missed without him. I have attached a picture of him in the event that you want to use him. His English name is Virgil. We did give him a tip, but I'm not sure if that is customary or not. 

If you have not been to Palanque you will quickly realize that it is a place worth all they hype. It is AMAZING.

446488656.name: Out of this world!
446488656.author: a TripAdvisor user
446488656.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning, well preserved, one really has the sense of travelling time. In the most extraordinary setting.

446086787.name: Palenque magical place
446086787.author: a TripAdvisor user
446086787.reviewBody: Magical place!! Invites you to dream about life of the Maya\'s. Very well kept and excellent guides \nDo not miss the walk in the jungle with guide

445953669.name: Excellent
445953669.author: a TripAdvisor user
445953669.reviewBody: Well preserved and easy to get to. Definitely eat at the stalls outside if you\'re craving home cooked food.\n

445730401.name: Great adventure
445730401.author: a TripAdvisor user
445730401.reviewBody: There is a fascinating place, the Palenque ruins are diferente than any other ones in Mexico. I like the pyramids and the surroundings because are settle in the jungle.

445717972.name: A must -see
445717972.author: a TripAdvisor user
445717972.reviewBody: These ruins and the surrounding forest have a mysterious and enchanting vibe.  I usally don\'t hire guides, but I did this time, and it was well worth it.  He explained some aspects of its history I would have forgotten or not known about.  He took me into the jungle as well to get a much better sense of just how vast this ancient city was.  Go early or late in the day to this must see site.

445091968.name: Amazing place
445091968.author: a TripAdvisor user
445091968.reviewBody: Very impressive place with a mysterious atmosphere in the middle of a forest. For me one of the best ruins in Mexico.

444715777.name: A must see
444715777.author: a TripAdvisor user
444715777.reviewBody:
Worth the drive, we started our journey in Tuxtla Gutierrez (Chiapas).

Once we arrived it was a little humid (muggy) but since you are in the jungle it is expected. Everything around you is green, the plants, the grass you name it. We did get a guided tour (for my dad) and this young man knew his stuff, great knowledge of history and it's people. 

The ruins are awesome, the size, the beauty, it really is something to see. I recommend taking your time and just looking at the work and detail that was put forth. You can climb certain parts to get some beautiful views but be careful the stones (rocks) are slippery due to the weather and humidity.

444555209.name: Fantastic place but watch out!
444555209.author: a TripAdvisor user
444555209.reviewBody: First of all, the ruins are amazing and many others have already described the site well.  Beautiful setting and interesting ancient buildings.  Unfortunately most of the site is roped off so you can only see the main structures that have been restored. However, there are some things to be careful of.  First of all watch out for the guides.  They will try to overcharge you.  They offer tours of the ruins and a jungle tour. We opted for the combined tour and talked them down a bit from the initial offer of around $125US for our group of 3.  We should not have stopped at the first entrance because there are lots more guides to bargain with at the second entrance.  We should have held out for a much better deal. Also the jungle tour we had was very short, only about 100 yards and it finished a at the other entrance so we have to walk back down the road almost a mile.  The second thing is the drive.  We drove from San Christobal De Las Casas and it took  about 7 hours.  The drive is beautiful with forested mountains the whole way but the roads are terrible and there are way too many topas (speed bumps).  Some appear with no warning and we bottomed out the car many times.  There is construction on the road and we had long waits in places just north of Aqua Azul.  On the way back, we were stopped by Zapatista rebels on that same highway. They put wooden boards full of spikes in the road in front of our car and demanded 500 pesos to pass. We refused and held up a lot of traffic.  The eventually agreed to 200 pesos which we paid under extreme protest.  We also has several local women and kids stop on on the highway with strings across the road.  They were selling snacks and we refused to buy any and pushed through the string.  All that being said, it was a great adventure and will worth the expense and road problems.  Just be ready for an adventure and be smart with the guides.

444125064.name: Very impressive
444125064.author: a TripAdvisor user
444125064.reviewBody: On a 2 weeks trip through Mexico and Guatemala we sofar visited the Maya ruins at Tulum, Coba, Chichen Itza, Uxmal, Tikal and Palenque. Altough it is near impossible to rate them, Palenque stands out as a close to perfect fusion between Culture and Nature. Apart from the great pyramids, palaces and other Maya structures, we\'ve spotted several spectacular birds in the Trees and jungle surrounding the Palenque ruins. Not going to this great place, cannot be an option

443896424.name: best in mexico
443896424.author: a TripAdvisor user
443896424.reviewBody: I am travelling for a while in mexico and palenque ruins are the best in mexico i have ever seen. It is huge, amazing and impressive. must go.

443332348.name: Mayas attack
443332348.author: a TripAdvisor user
443332348.reviewBody: You have to go there as soon as possible...it opens at 8...so be there at 8 and enter the site before the groups and souvenir vendors...it\'s magic... first go and see averything in a glompse just to know it is to be seen and than come back to the places you liked to see it in details. The palace ruins need some time to explore, also the other temples come out from the shade as the sun is moving and getting hotter. You will need no less than four hours to explore it properly..sit and contemplate the view from the top of the Temple of The Cross...if you want to buy some souvenirs buy there because in Palenque city they have almost nothing and often is more expensive

443069706.name: fabuloso
443069706.author: a TripAdvisor user
443069706.reviewBody: we celebrated the end of the mayan calendar from the top of the pyramid of the jaguar. it was fantastic!!! even pouring rain we enjoyed immensely. the staff is very friendly and accommodating.  there are lots of souvenir vendors but they are not pushy. the site is still under excavation so new structures are being uncovered all the time, but the jungle is all around. \n\nword of warning: there are some very real fitness issues with this site. you need to be able to walk long distances on rough terrain. there are no guard rails and these people really don\'t care if you fall to your death. i saw several horrific falls while i was here and took a pretty good header myself at one point. the hiking is exhausting but TOTALLY worth it. i took my sore/exhausted body back the next day for more abuse :)

442746863.name: Enjoyed the climbs
442746863.author: a TripAdvisor user
442746863.reviewBody: Unlike Chichen Itza, you can still climb up the ruins here. For these ruins, I had a guide which did make a difference, though I still wouldn\'t do it for all ruins. Being on the oldest guides, he offered a very refreshing perspective that you won\'t find in any of the guidebooks so it was definitely worth it. Thoroughly enjoyed these ruins.

442192615.name: Atmospheric jungle setting
442192615.author: a TripAdvisor user
442192615.reviewBody: Really enjoyed visiting this site which, with the encroaching jungle, was a bit different from some other sites we visited across Mexico. You are able to climb the steps up a number of the ruins.

441071541.name: Breath taking
441071541.author: a TripAdvisor user
441071541.reviewBody: I recommend that you get a guide and do the full jungle tour. It is a little pricey if you are doing it alone but if you have a small group the cost is reasonable. You are literally in the jungle so the heat and humidity are a factor but it so worth it.

441009656.name: Worth every drop of sweat
441009656.author: a TripAdvisor user
441009656.reviewBody: This was a family vacation. We arrived early morning approx 8:30 and hired a guide (about 400 pesos) to take us through and talk about the ruins.  Paid nominal park fee and took the road less traveled into the ruins.  Grounds are very clean and well maintained.  Able to climb most of the structures to take panoramic views.

440965418.name: Don\'t miss out its amazing.
440965418.author: a TripAdvisor user
440965418.reviewBody:
Lets be honest when you last went on a guided tour the information provided was I am sure very interesting, but a week later can you remember all the detail? No I can't either.
So with the hotel in Palenque 20 mins down the road take yourself forget the guided tours. If you want to know what you are looking at its all there in English and Spanish on information boards. Jump in a Collectivo parked up on the road to the ruins in front of the ADO bus station. I think it cost us 20ps each. We got there at about 9am and stayed all day.  We used the map of the site in the Lonely Planet guide. 
Having seen the main site, Palace, Temple of the Inscriptions, Temple of the Sun etc you must then go on down to the Museum Sitio via the waterfall and river. On the way stop off and see the ruins in the forest. Your ticket allows you to go in and out. The museum  is free and really well worth the long walk down in fact dont leave without seeing it. We then came back in and walked back up to the front entrance this time deviating via group 1 and 2 and some steep steps that come out right next to Group North. Again well worth the climb back up these steps as a much shorter route.  
Bliss hardly  anyone at Group North and all the morning coach tour crowds had long gone so the Palace was almost empty of people as well.  
Have a big breakfast and take food. There is nothing to eat at the museum. I think there may be a small cafe at the front entrance. 
Do go early. Don't hire a guide unless you want to study the site. Do go to the museum. Don't forget snacks, Don't be disappointed to learn that most of the main part has been substantially rebuilt by archeologists. Do visit the outer buildings which are largely original. A wonderful day and having only recently also visited Uxmal Kabah, Chitzen Itza, and Izamul this was by far the best only knocked into second place by Yaxchilan but thats a day trip away from Palenque.
Finally you will probably need insect bite cream in the summer but when we went in November we never even saw a mosquito.

440432587.name: Impressive
440432587.author: a TripAdvisor user
440432587.reviewBody: There are a number of impressive antique buildings in this site, but amazingly, there are hundreds of other buildings known to hide in the surrounding jungle. It takes a local guide to make sense of the history of this Mayan town. It is worth climbing to the top of one of the pyramids to get a fantastic view of the site and the jungle.

440119470.name: Very impressive,great views
440119470.author: a TripAdvisor user
440119470.reviewBody: Very interesting and a big site, it is actually a city chich you can see part of it and climb part of the sturctures, very big site, beatifull

439586830.name: Amazing!
439586830.author: a TripAdvisor user
439586830.reviewBody: We were here April 2014 with four kids. Youngest was 11 months. We loved it. What a great field trip for a homeschooling family ;-) If you go be sure to visit the waterfall inside the park but outside of the pyramid area. It\'s on the left on the way back out... After walking and climbing for a few hours the water felt wonderful! Have fun!

439460390.name: Great mixture of restoration
439460390.author: a TripAdvisor user
439460390.reviewBody: I went to Tikal first and I\'m glad that I did because Palenque ruins were way better. The setting that you walk through while you see the Palenque ruins makes you feel like you are there with me people who built it, less touristy. \nI also appreciated that it was so close to town so I didn\'t have to waste an hour getting to the ruins from my hotel and another hour to get back to my hotel, like Tikal. \nThere is a wonderful mix of restoration and lots of signs (in English and Spanish) telling you what you are looking at.

439425752.name: Truly amazing!!!!!!!!!! We love it!
439425752.author: a TripAdvisor user
439425752.reviewBody:
The city is very small (it is more like a village than a city). There is not much to do there, the night life is very limited, everything is being closed together with sun set. But also you can buy there the cheapest souvenirs, so do not miss this opportunity. On the contrary, the archeological site is truly AMAZING! Very less people, magical atmosphere of the jungle and wonderful history. You can climb on most of the buildings, also you can go to see the jungle (but the tour is costly - with guide more than 2000 pesos - if you are group of people then it is ok). We took a guide in the site, they offered us the price of 1200 pesos, but we couldn't afford it (I thought it will be cheaper from previous reviews, so be careful - prices are always rising!). So one lady said she will do it for 600 pesos (we were one couple). The experience was wonderful, also the guide (lady) was very kind and knowlegable. 
You can get easly to this place by colectivo (?). It cost 20 pesos per person and takes you direct to the site. The entrance to the national park is 33 pesos per each and then you pay for entrance to the site 65 pesos pp. It was kind of costly trip for us, but worthy. 
When we were there it was very rainy in the morning, so do not forget the stuff to protect yourself - otherwise you will need to buy the rain coat for 50 pesos.
I highly recommend!!! Nothing to compare, really!

439407568.name: Beautiful ruins
439407568.author: a TripAdvisor user
439407568.reviewBody: Palenque has been on my list of places to visit for a few years now and I\'m so glad I\'ve finally been there. It\'s very beautiful and nice to just relax or explore the ruins. Take a rain coat just in case.

439386979.name: A very impressive site
439386979.author: a TripAdvisor user
439386979.reviewBody: One of the sites not to be missed in Mexico. Its very big and in a remarkable jungle setting. Quite rainy on our day there, but that didn\'t spoil our visit. Best to do it with a good guide. As usual there are lots of vendors, but we didn\'t find them intrusive.\nOne of the days we\'ll always remember.

437658385.name: Excellent Mayan site in the forest
437658385.author: a TripAdvisor user
437658385.reviewBody: This is a great set of ruins with huge structures set in rainforest. After touring the buildings return via the forest path over streams and swaying bridges- really atmospheric!

437586382.name: Vast site in jungle setting
437586382.author: a TripAdvisor user
437586382.reviewBody: Very impressive, many original carvings to be seen, a few temple\'s here can still be climbed, fabulous views from the top. lots of vendor\'s selling crafts.

437199501.name: Palenque ruins
437199501.author: a TripAdvisor user
437199501.reviewBody: If you are going by car, get there by 8am to the car park or you will have a very long walk from the next parking area 1.5 kms away before you start on the ruins. Cobbled paths and disabled access ways are slippery in the wet. Take an umbrella in November

436924940.name: My personal favourite
436924940.author: a TripAdvisor user
436924940.reviewBody: Worth all the overnight night buses and travel, this is my personal favourite! \n\nYou can physically climb the pyramids, enter into the tombs and explore the surrounding jungle to the sound of howling monkeys!

436266065.name: Not to be missed
436266065.author: a TripAdvisor user
436266065.reviewBody: A stunning set of ruins excavated right out of the jungle. Don\'t miss the museum either before or afterwards. A private guide is a bit more expensive but well worth it  ask him to take you through the jungle and taste a couple life termites \n

436247352.name: Beautiful!
436247352.author: a TripAdvisor user
436247352.reviewBody: Was my first (not last for sure) mayan\'s ruin. Really interesting. And I would suggest to try to build up a group (we were 12) and pay a guide. They obviously know a lot of nice and interesting stuff. Go also in the "selva", the guide will show you a lot !

435963464.name: Great
435963464.author: a TripAdvisor user
435963464.reviewBody: Great site. The jungle and all of its noises make it really cool! A larger area than most of the Mayan cities with plenty to see. Need a good few hours easily. The collectivo is just 20 pesos, the national park fee was around 30, and the site was 65. Pretty cheap day! I was so ill and very nearly didn\'t go but dragged myself round in the end and was glad I did. It wasn\'t so bad as it seems cooler than some of the Mayan sites. That might have been the canopy... Or the illness!

435731453.name: Ruins
435731453.author: a TripAdvisor user
435731453.reviewBody:
We went to Chichen Itza, Uxmal and Edzna. Palenque was the biggest one. It's a lot of walking to see the whole area. Including the steep stairs everywhere. The ruins are always nice to see. The place is really beautiful green. Didn't see the iguana's, like the other places. 

Before you get there you pay 31 pesos (kind of fee). The entrance is 65 pesos. There was a small parking and a guy asked us 30 pesos to watch the car (weird, because it didn't look like an official parking like the other sites). The museum is included in the entrance price. 

Before the entrance there are a lot of vendors selling souvenirs, food and drinks. Inside the park, not that much vendors luckily. Palenque is not that busy like Chichen Itza. You have the space to walk and make pictures!

435689851.name: Amazing
435689851.author: a TripAdvisor user
435689851.reviewBody: This ruins are amazing, it takes you back to their time.  The weather is beautiful and there is so much to see.  Lots of well knowledgeable  guides

435272076.name: Spectaular
435272076.author: a TripAdvisor user
435272076.reviewBody: A visit to Mexico should include Palenque. It\'s incredible. The town itself doesnt have much to offer but the ruins are amazing!

435102520.name: Awesome place to visit
435102520.author: a TripAdvisor user
435102520.reviewBody: We went there for a couple of hours, to just stroll around. amazing what has been recovered there. If you visited Chichen Itza and thought that was cool, you have to visit Palenque. You are allowed to climb a lot of temples, which offer great views.

434854309.name: Ruinas
434854309.author: a TripAdvisor user
434854309.reviewBody: Excellent ruins with temples and inexpensive and expansive.   There are many tour guides that hammer you on arrival and many residents seeking to get you to purchase trinkets, especially children.

434642290.name: Another really nice ruin site to visit
434642290.author: a TripAdvisor user
434642290.reviewBody:
really nice peaceful place that you can wander around for a couple of hours without getting bored.  Plenty of buildings to look at and clamber over set in very well-kept ground.  We think we saw jaguars in the trees but they could have been howler monkeys.

I would definitely recommend this place for a visit of a couple of hours.  There is some walking involved.

the easiest way to get here is to hail a taxi from anywhere in Palenque and ask for 'ruinas' and they'll take you up the long winding path for a fair price. cheaper option is the collectivo but you'll have to work out where that picks up from.  they're very easy to catch back into town afterwards.

Someone who isn't me was offered magic mushrooms by stall holders before entering the site.  He assures me that they did not work so take from that what you will.

I would definitely advise anyone staying in Palenque that the ruins are not to be missed.

433429385.name: Awesome ancient architecture
433429385.author: a TripAdvisor user
433429385.reviewBody: Visiting and living in Central America over the past 3 years, I am gradually absorbing the majestic Mayan centers. On a recent trip to San Cristobal de las casas, I took the day tour, which only gave me 2 hours at the ruins, which is just enough time for a cursory look around. As with the other Mayan sites I have visited, I was amazed by Palenque, by the architectural design and magnitude of the temples and the water management system underlying those structures.

432503096.name: A big amazing beautiful incredible place. You shall go
432503096.author: a TripAdvisor user
432503096.reviewBody: I love it and i will return as soon as I can. This is a big, big, big city. Incredible, beautiful contrast between the city and the jungle. There is water running below the constructions! the constructions are stunning. This a must if you love mayans and Chiapas, is a very unique mix. Is like the city (mayan city) and the heaven, (the jungle) I really loved this place, pictures ca\'t reflect the green you see, the fresh inside the buildings... the big place. And it is clean, beautiful, is not crowded, you can be inside the buildings (some of them) Please make a favor to your self and GO!

430373292.name: Getting lost in Chiapas Mexico!
430373292.author: a TripAdvisor user
430373292.reviewBody: Very close to bus station.  About 15 min drive to ruins.  Also check out a tour with guide,  it\'s worth it.  Hotels are ok but I wasn\'t there for comfort I wanted to explore Chiapas.  The city is within walking distance of bus station so that\'s a plus.\nAlso take mosquito repellent if you are planning to go deep into the jungle.  I love nature so for me it was an amazing experience.  Good luck and be safe!

429669557.name: Awesome
429669557.author: a TripAdvisor user
429669557.reviewBody: Palenque is stunning! The main part of the ruins have been restored very well and it looks fantastic. The setting is truly beautiful too, with paths in the jungle to see more, less impressive buildings and waterfalls. There was a bit of hassle at the entrance from guides and vendors, but  a polite "no gracias" served fine.

429242561.name: Large complex...lots to see.
429242561.author: a TripAdvisor user
429242561.reviewBody: Lots of walking and climbing...very interesting adventure.\nThe guide we had was very knowledgeable..

429142764.name: Beatiful
429142764.author: a TripAdvisor user
429142764.reviewBody: It is a nice place to visit if you want to be submerge on the mexican ancient history. Place is keep clean and I felt safe during my visit

428422625.name: Amazing
428422625.author: a TripAdvisor user
428422625.reviewBody: What a beautiful site,  not very crowded and lots of places to explore,  I\'d have to say this was one of my favorite sites in Mexico.

428196743.name: Very impressive site!
428196743.author: a TripAdvisor user
428196743.reviewBody: Very impressive and amazing ruins. I recommend to do the jungle walk before visiting the ruins as you will have a better idea of how big the site is!

427732236.name: Great,  Great,  Great
427732236.author: a TripAdvisor user
427732236.reviewBody: Marvelous site. \nAn impressive well maintained place. Much more than Tikal.   Many locations and beautiful surroundings. \nA must visit.

427648379.name: Maya greatness
427648379.author: a TripAdvisor user
427648379.reviewBody: Experience and learn how mayas used to live... this is one of the best sites to experience ruins in a natural habitat, the site is easy accesible yet not overwhelmed by hords of tourist (depends of course on the season)

427153708.name: Another Amazing Archaeological Site
427153708.author: a TripAdvisor user
427153708.reviewBody: Yet another Mexican gem, reminding us of the richness of civilizations which existed long before Europeans colonised Latin America.  Some beautiful structures, with interesting overlays of architectural and sculptural approaches.  Thankfully, we had an excellent and knowledgeable guide who could explain much to us.

426848597.name: Really enjoyed my visit
426848597.author: a TripAdvisor user
426848597.reviewBody: A stunning set of ruins and quite expansive.  I would rank it right behind Uxmal and probably above Chichen Itza as well. Able to climb one of the pyramids for a great look over the complex.  Saw a couple monkeys as well which was a fun bonus.  Highly recommended.

426470541.name: Worth the money for the Waterfalls alone
426470541.author: a TripAdvisor user
426470541.reviewBody: This place was great - the ruins are well preserved and/or restored with three in particular being quiet outstanding. You have great access to be able to climb on or into maybe half of them too. The waterfalls are spectacular on the way out make sure you check them out before going to the museum. The museum offers useful history about the site as well has housing an impressive replica of the coffin of Pakal. I would set 3 hours aside for this. It can easily be done independently without the need for a tour guide. I got a collectivo to and from Tercera Pt Sur in town for $20 pesos that took about 20 mins to get there. I\'d recommend getting the first one at 8am to beat the crowds. It\'s then just $31 pesos to get into park and then $65 pesos to get into the archaeological site. So only cost about $7US inc. transport.

426239464.name: Extraordinary
426239464.author: a TripAdvisor user
426239464.reviewBody: Extraordinary place. Stunning view from the "cross temple". Be aware of the "guides" approaching you at the entrance.. A bit annoying, but ok.

425839992.name: Excellent
425839992.author: a TripAdvisor user
425839992.reviewBody: Very very Nice set of ruins, quiet big so it\'s easy to find a spot with no other people, it is very very hot so take plenty of fluids, it\'s super easy to get to and from, with collectives (small vans) going every ten or so mins from town

425028843.name: Amazing place
425028843.author: a TripAdvisor user
425028843.reviewBody: Of all the ruins we visited in Mexico, these are the  most impressive!\nAs all the other sites, you have to pay enter fees and on this one there is a lot of walking and climbing the ruins, but it is worth.

424068957.name: Really great experience
424068957.author: a TripAdvisor user
424068957.reviewBody:
We arrived early in the morning and it wasn't busy at all. 
You can really enjoy the ruins by yourself and walk around and read all the information on the signs. There are official guides at the entrance if your interested.
It's great that you can still climb the stairs and visit some inside chambers.
Beautiful surrounded by the jungle. A real highlight of our Mexico visit. 

The rocks are quite slippery so better to wear good hiking shoes. 
Bring water and some snacks because you can't buy them inside the archeological area. 

The museum is worth a visit too.

422653834.name: You have to visit this site when in Chiapas
422653834.author: a TripAdvisor user
422653834.reviewBody: This is one of the most impressive archaeological sites I\'ve ever visited. The Mayans were outstanding architects, astrologist and scientifics. Every little single detail in this city had a reason to be there a meaning . They were and are very spiritual and you learn a lot from them here

422212541.name: Deep into tropical jungle is amazing
422212541.author: a TripAdvisor user
422212541.reviewBody:
A mysterious and mystic place, now all in ruins, but perfectly recovered as ruin, Palenque is an amazing place to visit, I was amazed by the huge buildings, the large city within the jungle.

Moreover each Palenque building has a rich story behind, the way they look is not they way they end up looking, so It worth to hire a guide, be careful and look for the official guides, for your safe, they have n ID and all them are together in the official building close to the main entrance, ask in the cashier.

Having a guide you will quickly go through the Palenque history, governors, city facts and more!

Don't walk by what you see, there is more to see, check maps, and always follow them, there are more ruins but they are not prepared for all people to walk through jungle and see them, instead there are more already open to public, unless you get a guide.

It is a good idea to get some snacks and water, wether is so humid and there is a lot of heath, more If it rains.

Wear a confortable cloth, some steps and spots are slippery because It is all humid 

Sadly some buildings are not open to climb therm anymore.

Palenque Ruins are very safe as long as you are in the property and arounds, must be save outside but just take precautions

421599199.name: Favourite ruins!
421599199.author: a TripAdvisor user
421599199.reviewBody: Loved the Palenque ruins!! There were not too many people, they are really well preserved and you can climb some of the ruins. I also had the rare opportunity on my tour to go inside the Kings temple. Amazing!

420533872.name: Wow!
420533872.author: a TripAdvisor user
420533872.reviewBody: Ruins were breathtaking and very unique  in comparison to other ruins I\'ve visited. Give yourself ample time (and water!) to walk around the site and fully appreciate everything. We did our own little tour using a guidebook and map I had bought, so can\'t tell you if the guided tours are worth it. Make sure you drive all the way to the end of the road to the entrance... I saw a few people fooled into parking out by the visitors center parking lot and walking in - must have been at least a mile hike!

419980566.name: worth a visit!
419980566.author: a TripAdvisor user
419980566.reviewBody: It was very hot and sticky, so tough to travel through all of the ruins.  But Palenque is another must-see in Chiapas!

419298499.name: Top of the Heap
419298499.author: a TripAdvisor user
419298499.reviewBody:
Yep, it's Palenque!  All the reviews are true, and you definitely gotta go.

Not cool that the "public transport" collective vans blatantly double charge tourists!  At $20 pesos per person you can likely do better with a cab.

Ah, but the ruins...

417993108.name: Nice but Uxmal in Yucatan is much better
417993108.author: a TripAdvisor user
417993108.reviewBody: After seeing Uxmal an hour outside Merida, Yucatan, Palenque didn\'t feel like a must see. The surroundings are very nice as it\'s all jungle so that is beautiful. The ruins themselves are much smaller and less impressive than Uxmal. The buildings are shorter and more in a ruined state. At Uxmal the buildings are much taller and still have all the carvings in the stone buildings. At Palenque there is just a small area where you can see the worn down glyphs and carving of the Mayan kings but otherwise there are no carvings in the stone. It was fine and nice to walk around but not really worth an out of the way trip to visit Palenque vs a different ruin.

416526206.name: Exploring Mayan Kingdom
416526206.author: a TripAdvisor user
416526206.reviewBody: Great Mayan civilization hidden in lacandon jungle, local update is only 20-30% of the ruins are still explored. You can visit this site travelling few minutes from town center in collectivo (shuttle van service) for couple of US$. If you are staying in El Panchan try to request guided secret tours into lacandon jungle, to see hidden ruins. The guides are typical lacandon guys, I forget the names but there joint is El Panchan bars.

416165895.name: A must see in Chiapas
416165895.author: a TripAdvisor user
416165895.reviewBody: These ruins are impressive and well preserved. The drive from Tuxtla is grueling, so recommend stopping for the night if you travel with children. We stopped at Ocosingo and visited the ruins of Tonina, which was also a very interesting site, whose history is woven  with Palenque\'s. We stayed nearby the ruins so we could have a visit in the afternoon and one the next morning. If you take a guide on your first visit, a second lone visit is worth it to fully appreciate the site.

415076987.name: Amazing
415076987.author: a TripAdvisor user
415076987.reviewBody: I\'ve not been to Machu and imagine for someone that has this might be under whelming. But for me this was incredible. On a large scale and we\'ll preserved. I had a local guide show us around which was fantastic his name was Edgar and he was fun, and knowledgeable. A must see

413870292.name: Spectacular ruins
413870292.author: a TripAdvisor user
413870292.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful historical sites I\'ve visited. I recommend getting a licensed guide for maximum enjoyment. Overall a special place!

412418218.name: Even better than Chichen Itza!
412418218.author: a TripAdvisor user
412418218.reviewBody:
The Palenque ruins were my favorite site during my trip on the Yucatan Peninsula. Some of the reasons why I like them even more than Chichen Itza are:
1. Less crowded; that goes for tourists as well as souvenir booths.
2. More atmosphere! The ruins are in the middle of the jungle.
3. Howler monkeys! 
4. The feeling of actually exploring something, instead of visiting Disney Land. <- Obvious exaggeration, but you know what I mean ;-)
5. The setting of the ruins is more diverse than in Chichen Itza. 

When you already are on the Yucatan, make sure that you include Palenque in your itinerary! It is gorgeous!

411003288.name: Last stop of a Tour
411003288.author: a TripAdvisor user
411003288.reviewBody: Unluckily our tour (provided by Moreno Tours) was late so we had only one our to visit the place. We reached the place after a visit to Misol-ha and Agua Azul falls.\nDespite so, the ruins are massive and impressive; wild and surrounded by different animals. \nMust be seen

407695923.name: Beautiful, but go early to avoid the heat
407695923.author: a TripAdvisor user
407695923.reviewBody: Stunning ruins, lovely site, a must see but learn from our mistake, go early to avoid a heat stroke. Bring water with you and a hat, the ruins are not in the shade.

407659052.name: Better than Chichen Itza
407659052.author: a TripAdvisor user
407659052.reviewBody: Best Mayan ruins in Mexico in my humble opinion. Lots to see and you\'re free to climb the ruins and roam around at leisure. Great views from the top of the ruins. Not yet such a tourist trap like Chichen Itza!

407635810.name: Really hot and humid but beautiful!
407635810.author: a TripAdvisor user
407635810.reviewBody: To get to the ruins, we took a cab from the hotel where we were (the price is cheap for 3/4 people); once we were there, we paid a very low ticket. The ruins are immersed in the Palenque\'s jungle: the environment is truly impressive and quite unique in the Mexican context. Speaking, however, of the ruins... They are the typical Mayan ruins but, unlike Chichen Itza, you can climb the pyramids and there are accessible sites, in which you can also find remains of tombs, as well as bats. Really interesting as a site, do not miss it if you are in Chiapas!

406012805.name: Wonderful and well maintained ruins in the jungle
406012805.author: a TripAdvisor user
406012805.reviewBody:
The Palenque ruins are, in my opinion, the best ruins of Maya in Mexico. 
The site is 10 Km from the city (terrible city!) of Palenque. You can reach the ruins using taxi, or collectivo (80 pesos). The entrance costs 30 pesos for National Parque plus 65 pesos for ruins. 
After ruins you can visit the museum (free entrance) interesting especially for the tomb of Pacal  II (must see).
To visit the ruins take in account about 2,5/3 hours and, of course, the best thing is to go early in the morning in order to avoid crowd and high temperatures.
To come back to Palenque you can reach again a collectivo, the service is continuous.
I don't write nothing about the site, you have to go and visit!

405893257.name: Best ruins in Mexico
405893257.author: a TripAdvisor user
405893257.reviewBody: The ruins are situated in the national park so first you have to buy your ticket for the park. But, the ruins are impressive and you can climb on them. Also, the ruins are in the jungle so it\'s less dry than visiting Chichen Itza,

403051702.name: Stunning history & architecture
403051702.author: a TripAdvisor user
403051702.reviewBody: The Palenque ruins were truly impressive!  The architecture is amazing, the surrounding jungle adds to the experience of this historical site, especially hearing monkeys.  The number of structures that have been restored and yet to be unearthed from the jungle is unbelievable.  We found it extremely humid, although no mosquitos (when we visited).  Remember to wear comfortable clothing (in the humidity we wished we were in shorts & singlets) insect repellent, sunscreen, wear hat & sunglasses, take water and of course your camera/phone.\n\nWe were on a mini van tour from San Cristobal, dropped off at the top entrance an English speaking guide, Victor, then took us to the map of the ruins, explained a few areas and offered his guide services of the ruins for a total of $1000 pesos, regardless of how many people.  Six of us accepted as this was the best way to learn about the different sites.  Please note you can walk around the ruins unguided.  Victor was a wealth of knowledge (& also personal opinion), taking us to different parts of the ruins and a jungle walk.  He was definitely worth the $1000 pesos pyramid tour.  When we came to the end of our time & the 6 of us were working out the $1000 pesos split plus tip, Victor then notified us that $2000 pesos was required because the jungle walk was an extra $1000 pesos.  At no point did he mention this to any of us, the walk through the jungle wasn\'t worth the extra $1000.  We reluctantly paid $2000 plus tip, but be warned, clarify before you take a tour.

402919081.name: Palenque ruins
402919081.author: a TripAdvisor user
402919081.reviewBody: These ruins are definitely a must see for all who are in the area. Recommend hiring a guide to take you through. Don\'t miss the "Palacio" it\'s worth the climb.

402619578.name: The best I have seen in Mexico
402619578.author: a TripAdvisor user
402619578.reviewBody: Go go go! Palenque is a bit of a journey to get to, still it is just so worth it. I ended up visiting 9 different ruins in my trip from Mexico City to Quintana Roo, Palenque is hands down the best. Beautiful site, won\'t let you down

401863535.name: Climate change is nothing new
401863535.author: a TripAdvisor user
401863535.reviewBody: Many lessons to be learned from this impressive archaeological site.  The advanced state of astronomical and mathematical knowlege among the Mayans in the first millennium CE along with their demise due to anthropogenic climate change.  They cleared a lotof jungle to make space for their settlement and harvest materials such as stucco.  This probably was the major causeof several years of drought which rougth the centre to an end.  Wonderful structures to explore and learn about the early inhabitants.

401849660.name: Tip: Get a guide!
401849660.author: a TripAdvisor user
401849660.reviewBody:
This is an essential destination for anyone remotely close. Transport to and from is convenient and cheap by bus (ADO GL is like business class on a plane). The history of this area is remarkable, and to experience coupled with physical surrounds is one for the memory bank.

Tips. 
1. Get a guide. You can negotiate, even though everyone has 'official rates'  if you are less than four people find others to collectively pay the guide (fee fixed by group size). Worth every penny. Suggest doing this at the actual entrance to the site. You will see official tour guides selling their services all along the road in.

2. Take a collectivo. 20 pesos for the drive is well worth it. Very frequent. If you like walking, do it on the way back and enjoy the downhill. The entrance to the park is roughly 5km from town, then another 3km (I would only walk the latter). 

3. There is food and water at the entrance so travel light.  

4. Wear hiking boots if you have them! The stone can be very slippery when wet!!!

400623188.name: Amazing place
400623188.author: a TripAdvisor user
400623188.reviewBody: The archeological site of Palenque was the most beautiful of the ruins we\'ve visited durung our trip. The atmosphere is amazing especially when it is a little bit foggy in the morning. All ruins are surrounded by jungle which gives a great experience and you can also climb some of the temples. It is also possible to have a walk in the jungle where you can also find other ruins& houses which are not yet uncovered. We took a private official guide for 1200 pesos and it was really worth it. He spoke good english& really showed us a lot. We only can recommend this tour it was an excellent experience.

400558979.name: The most beautiful Mayan temples
400558979.author: a TripAdvisor user
400558979.reviewBody: I have visited various of the Mayan temples (Chitzen Itza, Coba, Tulum, Uxmal, Dzibilchalt\u00fan) so still a few to go to see all the major ones, but, I think that of all the ones I visited Palenque was the most beautiful. It has a sort of intimate character that you don\'t find in the other ones I mentioned. I would put it as a must see if you visit Chiapas. And the airport is extremely convenient, great hotels close by and one of the best restaurants for sophisticated Maya-inspired food is also close by (Bajlum, see my review of this restaurant). Surprisingly we hardly noticed any mosquitos. There are indeed many sales people on the ground, but they weren\'t were pushy (like in Teotihuacan) and when you have a professional guide they will avoid you anyway.

399765477.name: Palenque, Bonampak & Yaxchilan
399765477.author: a TripAdvisor user
399765477.reviewBody: Visited Palenque ruins one day.  The following day I visited the ruins at Yaxchilan and Bonampak using Wayak Tours.  I\'ve been to numerous Mayan ruins over the last several years but this was one of the best.  To reach Yaxchilan you have to take a boat down the Usumancita River (saw a huge crocodile and several howler monkeys along the riverbank)  as it\'s only accessible by boat.  A short hike through the jungle and you emerge at the Yaxchilan ruins.  After visiting there and the boat ride and lunch we visited the ruins at Bonampak.  Not spectacular like Copan, Tikal, Tulum or Chitzen Itza but the most beautiful and colorful murals in any Mayan site.  They were painted between 970-972 and look like they were painted recently.  Truly  amazing and moving.  I highly recommend Wayak as they were very professional, timely and courteous.  First class operation at a great price for such an extensive tour.  A truly outstanding but long (14 hour) tour.  So glad I made the tour.

398335793.name: A must
398335793.author: a TripAdvisor user
398335793.reviewBody: No question Palenque ruins are breathtaking. We were a bit dissapointed by the quantity of souvenir peddlers inside the ruins we foud it distasteful and I dont know why they are alowed inside. It is strongly recommended to hire a local guide and to take the trail which is amazing, you can see wild vegetation and get really close to the howling monkeys, dont miss it.

397451654.name: You have to choose to get a narrator...
397451654.author: a TripAdvisor user
397451654.reviewBody: then you\'ll know more about Palenque and what, when, where, "happened" in this magical place...\ntoo much mystery in this place, many theories, you may have a glimpse of what may happen when someone local explain it to you

397304744.name: The most impressive Pyramids in Mexico
397304744.author: a TripAdvisor user
397304744.reviewBody: Besides Tulum and Teotihuacan, the most spectacular pyramids in all over Mexico. - Huge area with qualified tour guides und surprisingly few tourists in the summer months. Really hot weather in june / july.

396979254.name: A \'must see\'
396979254.author: a TripAdvisor user
396979254.reviewBody: We are currently travelling through Central America and have visited many Mayan historical sites / ruins.  We have Palenque at the top of the list.  Must take the time to stroll these ruins.

396918095.name: some magic to these
396918095.author: a TripAdvisor user
396918095.reviewBody: I\'ve been in most of the major ruin sites in Mesoamerica, but Palenque has a special place in my heart. The jungle setting, the preservation, the detail, the history, the stream . . . Palenque is the crown jewel

395087634.name: Very commercialized Mayan ruins
395087634.author: a TripAdvisor user
395087634.reviewBody: The ruins are impressive, well preserved and really big. You can have nice walk around and also there is also small waterfall which you can see. Its really easy to catch minibus to this place from a city center for 20 Peso (about 8 km).\nAnd it is very commercialized. A lot of people selling snacks, drinks, ice creams and souvenirs (really pretty and really nice). Also a lot of visitors, its hard to do a photo of ruins without having other people on it.

393689996.name: Amazing site
393689996.author: a TripAdvisor user
393689996.reviewBody: Visiting Palenque was a great experience. It\'s cheap compared to Chichen Itza or Uxmal as well. You do have to pay twice which is a little annoying but it adds up to less than $100 pesos. The ruins are very attractive and you can climb most of the buildings. Unfortunately, the Temple of Inscriptions with the tomb of Pakal is off limits but it\'s still a great spot. The best part for me was seeing the buildings in the jungle. I think it\'s partly because I\'ve seen quite a few ruins since being in Mexico that this is what made it stand out from the others. There is also an excellent museum just before you enter the site. Well worth a visit!

392673225.name: Palenque beautiful!
392673225.author: a TripAdvisor user
392673225.reviewBody: We so much enjoyed our visit, Chiapas has everything for traveling with teens. Great nature and archeological spots. Palenque is awesome!

389133722.name: If in the area...
389133722.author: a TripAdvisor user
389133722.reviewBody: If in the area definitely visit these ruins.  Not only can you see the uncovered ruins but with the right guide you can explore the nearby jungle and see the ruin that are still covered up.  The best Mayan ruin you can see.

388712795.name: Beautiful!
388712795.author: a TripAdvisor user
388712795.reviewBody: There are very few informational plaques, so it\'s a good idea to get a guide. It\'s beautiful and worth it! It\'s very, very humid so keep that in mind. The museum is lackluster after being in the National Anthropology Museum in Mexico.

387965976.name: One of the top mayan archeological sites!
387965976.author: a TripAdvisor user
387965976.reviewBody: It has been our second visit to Palenque and it was well worth it. The site is big and we needed nearly a full day to visit the different temples and buildings. Nature there is also very lush: tropical forest with the the Howler Monkeys and lots of bird life. This time we visited the museum of Palenque which resulted a really great find: we spend several hours there as there is a lot to see and read of the history of Palenque, very illustrative and well presented. Worth it!

387262277.name: Amazing, a must see
387262277.author: a TripAdvisor user
387262277.reviewBody:
The pyramids are amazing! Definitely a must see.
 Prepare with cool clothing, it's very hot and humid in Palenque.  Take a hat and wear sunblock. 
Definitely need at least 2-4 hours to be able to see it completely.

386610631.name: Much more interesting than touristy Chichen Itza!
386610631.author: a TripAdvisor user
386610631.reviewBody: I have seen 5 different Maya ruins during my trip and the site in Palenque is one of my favorites together with overwhelming Teotihuacan. What I loved about Palenque compared to, for example Chichen Itza, was the quiet peaceful setting in the jungle. You can still climb some of the pyramids and from the top you have beautiful views around the area.

386248883.name: The best of the best
386248883.author: a TripAdvisor user
386248883.reviewBody: Comparing to Chitzen Itza is Palenque much nicer place. You can go to top of some pyramids. Very nice experience and do not miss this place when you are in Mexiko.. we bought nice souvenirs for reasonable price there. The entrance fee was 65 pesos.

384063698.name: Fantastic
384063698.author: a TripAdvisor user
384063698.reviewBody: We visited the ruins twice over two days and found them to be fantastic.  It seems that every ruin we visit is slightly different from the other, and this ruin is no exception.

384029441.name: Amazing in the jungle!!
384029441.author: a TripAdvisor user
384029441.reviewBody: Just get a collectivo for 20 mxp in Palenque, in front of the "Mayan head". Pay the entrance (around 60 mxp) and walk around with no tour guides. Starting from 8.00 am to 5.00 pm. Enjoy the walk beside the "Temple of the Inscriptions", enter in the tomb of Pakaal, walk up to the temples of the Sun, the Cross, ecc. Then check the acropolis and do not forget to get lost in the Palace. Just breathless. I did a picnic close to the Pelota field:)

384003880.name: Very interesting ruines.
384003880.author: a TripAdvisor user
384003880.reviewBody: An interesting site, not very large, I would say 2 hours is enough to visit. Unfortunately some pyramids are closed for climbing, also it was incredibly hot and humid in May. In my opinion Uxmal and Chechen Itza ruins are more attractive. However would highly recommend.

382736456.name: Awesome day at the ruins!
382736456.author: a TripAdvisor user
382736456.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our tour of Palenque. We ended up hiring an English speaking guide for $400 pesos for our group of 4 adults and two kids. It was well worth it. A great education. Only complaint, as many others have mentioned, is the amount of peddlers inside the park gates, selling their wares. Many of which I am sure are Chinese junk. There had to be 30+ vendors selling mostly the same goods. It detracts from magic of the place.

382700911.name: Highlight.
382700911.author: a TripAdvisor user
382700911.reviewBody: This was the highlight of our holiday. Enough information on site, so didn\u00b4t take a tour guide. We spend over 5 hours here, exploring all the subsites as well. Went there as early as possible by collectivo (went basically every minute from the ADO Bus Station near our hotel) and dropped us off at the entrance (be aware: you pay twice: once for the entrance to the natural park and once at the site. No major amounts). We spend the day exploring the site, saw howler monkeys, toucans, bats and so much more. We arrived at 8:15, had the site to ourselves until 9:30 and then again from 11:00-12:00. Tour busses come and go (most only stay for 1,5 hour or so and are then off again). \n\nTruly unforgettable experience -- Museum at the exit at Site I + II is also nice! Gives you a better overview of the site (of which you can only visit a tiny bit) and we bought a really beautiful statue at the museum shop (for around E35,-).

382669271.name: Incredible and mysterious ruins
382669271.author: a TripAdvisor user
382669271.reviewBody:
The experience at Palenque is second to none with howler monkeys screeches in the background making you feel as though you're in a Jurassic Park movie as you move through enormous and well-preserved jungle-shrouded ruins.
We arrived early as soon as it opened (around 8.30am), and sellers were only beginning to set up which is a relief if you want to visit the ruins without pressure to buy or be sold to. Even this early with the sun not yet high in the sky, it was unbearably hot due to the humidity - bring lots of water.
The ruins on the second level are worth the trip up the many stairs with incredible views over the lower compound, plus the less excavated ruins in the jungle were a highlight for me - they showed how they would have appeared upon discovery and the enormous jungle surrounds were so impressive. So many more ruins are hidden here that have yet to be restored!
We didn't get a guide but overheard some very good ones, who were very informative and excited to point out everything to their clients - we learnt a lot just by overhearing them!

381703258.name: Great place to visit
381703258.author: a TripAdvisor user
381703258.reviewBody: I highly recommend and use the authorized guides, they give the experience a total new meaning . I highly recommend , you will not regret

381265088.name: Stunning
381265088.author: a TripAdvisor user
381265088.reviewBody: We drove 12 hours from Cancun to see these ruins. They were spectacular and we will likely return with our family at a later date. One piece of advice is to hire a guide as there is so much detail that would be lost without a knowledgeable guide.\n\nWe hired Edgar who spoke English without a trace of an accent and was extremely knowledgeable about the site. His tour was definitely the highlight of our visit. He was a licensed but not official guide. The official guides get first crack at the tourists but they do not negotiate price. The unofficial guides are self employed and charge whatever they think they can get. When times are slow rates get very flexible. We paid $1000 pesos for the long tour which officially is priced at $2200.

380363568.name: Vacation
380363568.author: a TripAdvisor user
380363568.reviewBody: Trip was very long from San Cristobal de las Casas, we were informed in advance it would be a long drive.  Our bus/van driver told us that most make there way down and fly into Tuxtla then fly out of Tabasco, which makes sense since Villahermosa airport is about 2 hrs. He suggested visiting the Laconda Jungle.. The drive was very long, but very well worth the trip. We did hear of the dangers in the road and the driver said that they usually drive in big groups.  Luckily we didn\'t encounter any problems along the road.  The Ruins are breathtaking, we also had to pay a tour guide within the ruins, but our bus driver referred us to one and about $50 pesos per person.  \n\nFor anyone traveling, I highly recommend you book with hotel you are staying, our trip to Palenque cost $500 pesos about $30 USD.  Some of the tours I saw online were over $100 USD.  We used Osinga Tours, which was set up directly with Hotel Casa De Mama, they picked us up at the doorstep of our hotel, the 3 tours we took, we had the most knowledgeable drivers and I felt safe with their driving...They talked to us and gave us great information along the road.

380245376.name: Fantastic!
380245376.author: a TripAdvisor user
380245376.reviewBody: This was an absolutely amazing day !\nThe ruins are spectacular! And the National park surrounding is beautiful.\nUnlike other ruins it has not become overly commercialized and you can enjoy the beauty of the ruins and the area.

379526258.name: Awesome
379526258.author: a TripAdvisor user
379526258.reviewBody: There\'s a national park surrounding the ruins, so things are pretty nice. Great museum near the park entrance. The ruins themselves are too impressive, too overwhelming, to talk much about. Fabulous. I was with a small group and a guide, having a local person explain everything was great.

379151120.name: Magnificent and accessible if your legs can take the steps!
379151120.author: a TripAdvisor user
379151120.reviewBody: Well worth the effort to get there (I went via a short stay in Villahermosa, capital of Tobasco) as it is a huge site, in the middle of the jungle with barely a few buildings yet recovered considering the number present in the area. And you can still climb the steps up many of the recovered buildings. A lovely site steeped in history. Go with a knowledgeable guide and enjoy the day. It is so pleasant and peaceful you might want to stay for ever. There are merchants on site but no hassel at all from any of them.

379149748.name: The best ruins we visited - magical
379149748.author: a TripAdvisor user
379149748.reviewBody: What we liked so much about these ruins was not only the insanely beautiful setting in the jungle but the fact that whilst there were a large number of tourists there it was nothing like on the scale of other ruins (i.e. Chichen Itza) and we could quickly find ourselves alone looking at some of the less excavated ruins.  I\'ve wanted to come here for nearly 20 years and it didn\'t disappoint!

378942776.name: Monument of Palenque
378942776.author: a TripAdvisor user
378942776.reviewBody: A very interesting site.Plenty of monuments to see and climb up to get great photos.We had a Mexican guide Alejandro good English and very knowledgeable. Quite a lot of walking as the site is quite large but places to rest in the shade. Could have spent more time here but we were part of a tour. Would visit again.

378788271.name: Palenque
378788271.author: a TripAdvisor user
378788271.reviewBody: I stayed in Comitan, Chiapas a few hours away from Palenque. The entrance to the ruins is pretty cheap less then 100 pesos per person. My sister paid for the entrance. We didn\'t have a tour guide as we were in a hurry because we had a few buses to catch. I know that they charge more for tours for the foreign. Always try to negotiate they will lower the prices. The ruins seemed older then the ones in Chichen Itza and there\'s jungle and a water fall around them. The weather is always humid so take plenty of water. Mango trees are around the ruins too.

378742785.name: Amazing and extensive Mayan city ruin
378742785.author: a TripAdvisor user
378742785.reviewBody: An amazing and extensive Mayan city ruin, well cared for and well worth a guided tour. The jungle keeps trying to take these ruins back, and their size and footprint is extensive. With the right guide, its an amazing excursion into Mayan history and life. Highly recommended.

378734502.name: My favourite Ruins Site
378734502.author: a TripAdvisor user
378734502.reviewBody: Being located in the middle of the dense jungle, makes this site very special (and also quite hot and humid). I\'ve only visited 5 sites total in Mexico and I found this the most impressive. Other than the amazing buildings and tablets, the jungle itself around is beautiful. I went solo without a guide and went out after 3 hours only because of a tight schedule. There\'s a lot of history to read about. Definitely a must visit if you\'re in Chiapas, Mexico.

378395152.name: Magical
378395152.author: a TripAdvisor user
378395152.reviewBody: Palenque blows Chichin Itza out of the water. It\'s exciting, extraordinary and magical. There is still so much to uncover.
