You go and feel like Indiana Jones, Being able to climb the pyramids and explore the jungle adds to the whole experience. I loved it. Worth the trip to Mexico alone. \n\nWe had a great guide who gave just the right amount of information to bring the place alive and enough that you could remember some of it. No bamboozling with dates and facts and figures. The jungle walk was great - especially seeing a snake and hearing howler monkeys.

378027649.name: Temple Ruins Shrouded in Mist
378027649.author: a TripAdvisor user
378027649.reviewBody:
Early in the morning, the mist still lies thick between the temples in the jungle. Later in the day the mist clears and you can get great view of the valley below from the Pyramid of the Cross. 
This site is exactly what you imagine a classical lost city looks like and does not disappoint. It has the jungle, the pyramids covered in vegetation, a small river, great views and waterfalls. 
If you take the back way out, signed past the ballcourt, you will pass by a more tranquil part of the site, winding its way downhill to exit just uphill from the museum by the main road.  Here you will pass beautiful waterfalls, a hanging bridge and still pools of water, and this is a great path to take if you want photos of the jungle and water shimmering with sunlight.
It may be difficult if you have some problems with your knees/walking downhill. Otherwise, bring water and a sunhat and read up a bit before you come here and you should be fine. There are plenty of free maps to download.

377880762.name: As near to being Indiana Jones as most of us will get
377880762.author: a TripAdvisor user
377880762.reviewBody:
You walk through a jungle path with howler monkeys roaring, birds chirping and exotic flowers everywhere. And then through the trees you make out a pyramid. The Temple of the Skulls to be precise, and then the magnificence that is the tomb of Pakal and the Royal Palace.
Palenque is unlike any other archaeological site  have ever visited. Superbly maintained, yet still giving an air that you are the first person to set eyes on it for thousands of years.
In it's day, before the jungle swallowed most of it, this city would have been awesome. It still is, however much of it has never been reclaimed from the ever growing jungle.
The Temples of the Skulls, Inscriptions and The Sun are amazing and well worth the climb. The Palace too is fascinating with it's dark corridor that human sacrifices were led through before having their hearts ripped out.
The Temple of The Foliated Cross (all names were given by The Spanish) was weird, in that it loked more like The Bates Motel than a Mayan Temple, but nevertheless still fascinating.
The onsite museum is excellent and has videos in English explaining the rule of Lord Pakal and the importance of Palenque in Mayan history.
Of all the sites I visited in Mexico, the memories of this one will stay with me the longest.

376564047.name: An adventure in ruins and jungle
376564047.author: a TripAdvisor user
376564047.reviewBody: It is a wonderful place to explore ancient Maya ruins. What I like most is it is kind of combination of ruins and jungle. It is worth visiting and if you have time, don\'t forget a short jungle trek whose entrance you can find near the ticketing (ask locals) but don\'t expect too much.

373929963.name: Amazing
373929963.author: a TripAdvisor user
373929963.reviewBody: Incredible place! Visited all the ruins, but the view from the tallest one was amazing. I\'ve visited several ruins, but this is one of my favorites.

373433962.name: WOW, simply WOW
373433962.author: a TripAdvisor user
373433962.reviewBody:
This place is simply incredible !!

This was my favorite ruins in Mexico by far. You can walk and in it. The vegetation around with the old ruins in the jungle are really quite something. 

I would recommend it for anybody, I wasn't a ruin lover, but those ones changes my view. I loved them !!

373210302.name: Spectacular Ruins!
373210302.author: a TripAdvisor user
373210302.reviewBody:
I only visited 2 ruin sites during my tour - this one and Chichen Itza.   Palenque was by far my favourite because it was more interesting to photograph and the view from the top of one the highest buildings was just spectacular!  To get to the top of this one building you have to climb up quite a number of steps that seem to go straight up, but it was definitely worth the climb! Looking down on the ruin site from this viewpoint was awesome!  This is a good place to capture some memorable pictures.  
It is a good idea to take a hat with you as it is hot getting up there and up at the top.

Also, because the steps are quite steep you have to be really careful walking back down.

372925017.name: Beautiful, mysterious Palenque
372925017.author: a TripAdvisor user
372925017.reviewBody: We visited 12 Mayan ruins during our road trip around the Yucatan. Palenque was, in our opinion, the most beautiful. We visited the site first in the morning just as it opened (parking just outside the gate) and later during the afternoon (parking in the museum lot) after a lunch and swim break at our hotel (Hotel Boutique Quinta). Whereas we had the place pretty much to ourselves early and late in the day and on our hikes into the jungle, mid-day was very crowded. It rained during our afternoon visit making it especially misty and romantic and good for photos. We would highly recommend the museum and hikes into the surrounding jungle, especially to see the waterfalls.

371851389.name: Favorite Ruins in Mexico!
371851389.author: a TripAdvisor user
371851389.reviewBody: We arrived on Saturday to the ruins at 8:15am & the main parking area was already full but we were able to park on the side of the road close to the ruins (only a 3 min. walk to the ticket office). The jungle setting of the ruins is breathtaking & for me this is what sets it apart from any other ruins in Mexico. You are also able to climb several of the ruins & take in the picturesque views and scenery. We spent about 3 1/2 hours on the site and by the time we were leaving it was getting very crowded. I would recommend getting to the ruins when they first open for way less crowds.

371569086.name: amazing site, plenty options of souvenirs
371569086.author: a TripAdvisor user
371569086.reviewBody: This Maya city is by far one of the most amazing maya sites I\'ve visited.  The city is big, plenty temples to climb.  Note that 1 of the main temples is allowed to be climbed on for preservation purposes.  Tours there are generally self-guided.  When buying tours ask for price of Palenque with a tour guide if you want a guide.  If not, there are guides on site.  (Make sure if you hire a guide at the site, it is a genuine 1.  The site is full of young men and even very young kids offering to be your guide for cheap - very alarming given these are not legit or licensed guides).  An added bonus is the walk to the museum after.  There is a wooden bridge to pass through, very exciting.  Overall, lovely place!

371561593.name: My favorite ruins so far
371561593.author: a TripAdvisor user
371561593.reviewBody: I fell in love with Palenque. The fact that most of it is still undiscovered, embedded in the jungle\'s fauna, left me imagining how that place was at its best time. Highly recommended!!

370897181.name: Great visit
370897181.author: a TripAdvisor user
370897181.reviewBody: We spent a whole day to visit the ruin. We didn\'t take a tour as we were not sure about the quality. However it\'s always better to visit with a guide to have a better understanding of the ruins and sculpture. Make sure you ask around to check the price of the guide and you need to negotiate.

370713988.name: Absolutely amazing!
370713988.author: a TripAdvisor user
370713988.reviewBody:
We organised transport to the ruins and wandered around ourselves. All the sites have a detailed explanation  of what you're looking at, both in English, Spanish & native tongue. 

We also ripped out the pages from the Lonely Planet guide book & took them with us, as it has a map & more information. I can imagine it gets really busy from 9.30am onwards with tour buses, as well as with the jungle heat so head there early when it opens at 8am. 

Plenty of collectivos waiting to take people back to Palenque centro when your done. Probably need 2-3 hours there most..

370612630.name: Really nice
370612630.author: a TripAdvisor user
370612630.reviewBody: Nice interesting ruins to see. You can wonder about at your own pleasure which I really enjoyed.You must climb to the top!! But be safeeee!! Mind your step! views to mayan jungle from the top! I would recommend a guide as they give a wonderful history of the tombs there.

369726307.name: Magnificent
369726307.author: a TripAdvisor user
369726307.reviewBody: We went early with a guide and took lots of water.  It was very hot and humid as the site is huge.  The site really puts the Mayan civilisation into perspective with these magnificent palaces and temples.  You can climb a lot of the structures and indeed you need to be able to do that to get the full importance of the use to which the structures were used.  You really need a guide to appreciate the site fully.  We had one with us, but local guides are available at the gate.\nThere are a myriad of vendors all over the site selling souvenirs.  Some quite cheap and others with a lot of workmanship.  There are no facilities on the site until you reach the museum.\nThe museum is well worth the visit with its reconstructed tombs, relief work taken from the site, etc.  (Also for its facilities).  Do not miss this site.  We liked it better than Chichen Itza.

369295705.name: Brilliant site
369295705.author: a TripAdvisor user
369295705.reviewBody: Could have spent days there. Superb ruins. Make sure you read up or have a guide.  Setting in lush jungle so atmospheric. Go early to avoid heat. Worth a full day.

369227101.name: Up close and personal with Mayan civilisation
369227101.author: a TripAdvisor user
369227101.reviewBody: Wow. This place is just awesome.You can get right up to the ruins and clamber over most. I know this is sacrilege to some, so don\'t come here if you\'re of that mindset. The site is quiet in the mornings before the coaches arrive, and later in the day too. There is not much in the way of guidebooks - you can take a guided tour (we didn\'t). There are some basic signs in English. None of this matters - the real joy of Palenque is seeing the Mayan relics in their jungle setting, breathing in the atmosphere and trying to absorb the fact that these monuments were built 1500 years ago with almost no technology. We came back the next day just to soak up more of it. The museum is worth a visit, especially the reconstructed tomb of Pakal. The museum is NOT open on Mondays :-( . There are toilets in the site, but no other facilities - take water with you.

368875587.name: Historic place!!
368875587.author: a TripAdvisor user
368875587.reviewBody: If you love adventure and risk you\'ll enjoy traveling in Chiapas!! Good restaurants with amazing Mexican food... I went with my family to Yaxchilan you will learn a lot about Mexican history and culture...

366939915.name: Just amazing
366939915.author: a TripAdvisor user
366939915.reviewBody: You cannot be in Palenque and not visited the ruins of course. I did it by my own : taking a colectivo from the city to the site, it was a bit cheaper.\nIt takes 1 hour and a half to visit if u walk slowly but it\'s clearly worth it !!!\n

366048820.name: Beats Chichen Itza!
366048820.author: a TripAdvisor user
366048820.reviewBody: I was very impressed by the ruins in Palenque. The restorations are well done and with respect for the monuments. We had an older guide with us that spoke fluent English and really knows his stuff. The jungle setting makes it a more intimate site and has a great backdrop for photographers. Try to go this year because most likely you won\'t be able climb the ruins in the nearby future!

365917567.name: Beware of dodgy tour guides
365917567.author: a TripAdvisor user
365917567.reviewBody: Amazing must see destination. Be wary when getting an official tour guide. Our\'s was pretty pricey and gave an alternative take on the history - in which the Mayans never existed.

365803446.name: Best Ruins in Mexico
365803446.author: a TripAdvisor user
365803446.reviewBody: Palenque is amazing - very well preserved/restored. My son and I loved our visit there. We visited many pyramids/ruins in Mexico and this was our favorite.\n

364712837.name: Amazing
364712837.author: a TripAdvisor user
364712837.reviewBody: This was by far my favorite ruin in Yucatan/Chiapas/Quitana Roo/Capeche. The plants around the ruin makes it unique. Also the fact that it\'s built on hills made it a enchanting visit. Go early in the morning before the venders are all set up.

364227836.name: Awsome ruins..the best yet
364227836.author: a TripAdvisor user
364227836.reviewBody:
We went to this ruins very early in the morning and just had the most incredible tour.  We were ucompanied by an English speaking tour guide who pointed out the history and incredible architecture in the ruins.. 
We then took the free trail walk down to the Museum which took us on a beautiful walk through the forest seeing water falls, birds and under developed ruins. We even crossed a small river with a foot bridge.  
The Museum was free as it was part of ruins entrance fee and with the best part seeing a replica of the kings tomb plus many other uncovered artifacts from the site.  
We have been to Chichen Itza and Tulum and as far as ruins go this was the most impressive.

363971149.name: Go there in the morning
363971149.author: a TripAdvisor user
363971149.reviewBody: Been here first thing in the morning when they opened at 8 am sharp. The place is magical with few tourists around and the temples are surrounded by djungle with monkeys roaring. \n\nYou need around 2-3 hours for a full visit and when we left the place was swamped with tourists which you really want to avoid.

363356937.name: Fabulous
363356937.author: a TripAdvisor user
363356937.reviewBody: Awe inspiring. Really worth the visit. Hot and heavy going at times, but worth the effort. You can climb on some of the ruins and see above the trees and around the site. There are no real safety features and you need to take your time to be sure footed.

362766802.name: A wonderful visit
362766802.author: a TripAdvisor user
362766802.reviewBody: Learning about the history of the Mayan people and visiting this site in Chiapas was a high point of our trip there.

362405435.name: Hidden gem in the dense jungle
362405435.author: a TripAdvisor user
362405435.reviewBody: I really <3 Palenque\'s ru\u00efnes and dense jungle!!! In combination with the Agua Azul Waterfalls and the Aluxes Ecoparque its an unforgetable and unique experience. Almost no tourists and you really have the feeling that you are in a preserved and primeval forest. In my opinion it can compete with both Tikal and Semuc Champey and that in (almost) the same place!!!\n\nEnjoy the \'selva\' with a guide, the animal park with all the animals which Central America has to offer (except for sloths, didnt see them) and the cristal bright blue waters of the \'cascada\' with a local (kids who show you around and let you slide on a PET bottle from one of the rocks).

361016027.name: Wonderful site
361016027.author: a TripAdvisor user
361016027.reviewBody: I know the hawkers can be a problem but this was like a car boot sale. The site is really well persevered and you can visit a tomb.

360968354.name: Palenque Ruins
360968354.author: a TripAdvisor user
360968354.reviewBody: Really nice place... the museum is also nice and have really nice collection of Mayan art. If you are driving, parking is hard and local "tour guides" are a little bit annoying...

360800101.name: Must Visit
360800101.author: a TripAdvisor user
360800101.reviewBody: The place is the main attraction of Chiapas. The ruins are around 291 km or6 hour drive from San Cristobal. There are some travel companies which takes around 450 peso for roundtrip but you have to leave very early in the morning ( 5 am) and you return very late around 10 pm at night to San Cristobal. The journey is very tiring. My advice is to take a night bus to Palenque and stay there for 1 day atleast. The ruins will take you deep into the mayan history. You can climb up in some pyramids and see the rooms and structures closely. The weather is very hot in palenque generally so wear comfortable clothes. You can find bilingual guides outside the entrance and they charge around 1000 peso but my advice will be not to take it and explore the place by yourself.

360764023.name: Interesting, but ruined by all the vendors
360764023.author: a TripAdvisor user
360764023.reviewBody: This is a fascinating ruin with so many structures uncovered. The very disappointing thing was that they allow hundreds of venders selling trinkets on blankets spread out all along the walkways. It detracted from the beauty of the area and the sacredness of it. Why would they do that?

360568782.name: Magical Mayan ruins in the hills
360568782.author: a TripAdvisor user
360568782.reviewBody:
This place is really beautiful, you can feel the power of the genius loci right in the middle of the jungle. We visited ruins in Chichen Itza, Coba, Tulum and these ones in Palenque are really special because you can experience the site by climbing on the pyramids  and walking "inside" the palaces which is forbidden in most of the other places we visited. Palenque is very large and at the time of our visit in wasn't even too crowded.

It requires quite a lot of climbing up and down the hills and stairs (even if you don't climb up the pyramids) so I wouldn't really recommend it to people with prams or wheelchairs.

We visited in February and what surprised us was the early closing time, it was closing at 16:30. Unfortunatelly I don't remember how much we payed for the entrance but I think it was  around 200 pesos/person. Definitely much less than in Chichen Itza.

360361520.name: Most beautiful Ruins in Mexico
360361520.author: a TripAdvisor user
360361520.reviewBody:
They are not the largest or the most famous but they are the most beautiful and enjoyable. The setting in the middle of the jungle make for a fantastic travel in time. 

They also are UNESCO Human Heritage and their hieroglyphics were essential in understanding the Mayan language.

Enjoy your time there an make sure to enjoy the nature around. If you go early you can see the monkeys!

We took the road from Cristóbal de las Casas and that was really painful as it takes 5 hours to get from one place to the other and the road is full of bumps (there are close to  600, not a joke). So try to ride a VERY comfortable car or fly directly.  the vans that go from San Cristóbal are not comfortable especially in the back seats.

359890393.name: Great experience
359890393.author: a TripAdvisor user
359890393.reviewBody: this is very well kept place, you can still climb on most of the ruins, which is an experience that is getting rare. You have to know that when you get near the place you have to change to local guides and transportation, which can be strange, but the guide was good if  a little exotic to us. The place is amazing and you are not so harassed by sellers as in other ruins.\nLoved the place and the whole experience

359846516.name: A recommendation
359846516.author: a TripAdvisor user
359846516.reviewBody: Recommended to visit with an acknowledged local guide, although this isn\u2019t very cheap: 800 pesos each for a tour of 2 hours (jungle and site) in Spanish.

359126881.name: Great place
359126881.author: a TripAdvisor user
359126881.reviewBody: This is a very good Maya city ruins . There is more to see here than at Chitzen Itza by Merida . Go early and get a guide . It is hot and humid .

358806542.name: Beautiful old Mayan ruins
358806542.author: a TripAdvisor user
358806542.reviewBody: What else is there to say about this place? It is a magnificent ancient site with impressive buildings and stone carvings. It is probably the number one site in the state of Chiapas. 100% recommended.

358788959.name: You got to see it!
358788959.author: a TripAdvisor user
358788959.reviewBody: If you go please make sure you stay at the archeological site, since the town is not pretty and there are not many things to do.. You only need 1 day to enjoy the beauty of it! Make sure to bring an umbrella or a poncho because at least 1 day a week rains, and it reallyyyyyyyyy rains!!!

358752097.name: Beautiful!
358752097.author: a TripAdvisor user
358752097.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning sites! You are able to climb into and up the ruins in order to experience the lives of the Mayans.

358618135.name: Tourism
358618135.author: a TripAdvisor user
358618135.reviewBody:
It's a great place to visit, get a certified guide so you get reliable info worth the price. 
Be sure to be early.. Less people and sun... 
3 hr walk, ups and downs. Bring water!!! 
Not recommended for people with children or older people who can't walk in their own. Floor is too irregular for a stroller or wheel chair.

358248514.name: Sensational ruinas
358248514.author: a TripAdvisor user
358248514.reviewBody: Plan my route to make sure that I could visit Palenque and Tical. I do not need to sell the place, it is breathtaking for anyone that like old culture and history. Just need to be carefull of the guides, do not take the first one, shop around and you can even bargain them.

357932806.name: Impressive and beautiful
357932806.author: a TripAdvisor user
357932806.reviewBody: When we arrived, it was raining lightly, with a mountain in the distance shrouded in mist.  Our guide, Silvestre, explained that the "mountain" was another part of the ruin, buried under jungle and yet to be excavated.  It started raining harder and we, without umbrellas, became soaked through and through, but we were grateful that things had cooled down from the day before.  We were led through the palace and various temples and then took a short hike through the jungle over unexcavated ruins. I\'ve been to quite a few archeological sites, but this is my favorite of all.

357510244.name: nice area
357510244.author: a TripAdvisor user
357510244.reviewBody: I was looking forward to go over ther. And it didn\'t disapoint me. Totally worthy. As many attractions in Guatemala, even this one is surrounded by the green world. Very nice place

357021952.name: Stunning
357021952.author: a TripAdvisor user
357021952.reviewBody:
Discover an amazing old city in the middle of the jungle.

The size of the architecture is overwhelming.

My jaw simply dropped off just to realize the effort that required to build that place.

Simply one of the most incredible places in the world, you can almost feel the history beneath your skin.

356856771.name: You will love this place and surroundings
356856771.author: a TripAdvisor user
356856771.reviewBody: Astonishing place. You will love it if you like nature. This place is a witness of the Mayan culture. Don\'t miss it.

356377270.name: Spectacular jungle ruins
356377270.author: a TripAdvisor user
356377270.reviewBody: Despite the long trip down from San Cristobal these ruins are worth every minute of the journey. Nestled in the humid lowlands of the state and brimming with impressive structures at every corner this amazing site is even better appreciated when toured with a knowledgeable guide.

355900174.name: Excellent compact site for Mayan ruins
355900174.author: a TripAdvisor user
355900174.reviewBody: This is a relatively easy site to move around and certainly not as crowded as the Teotihuacan pyramaids can get. The ruins are also in parts better preserved. Bring your own water and go to the toilet before you start walking.

355351370.name: Hot, hot, hot and lots of ground to cover
355351370.author: a TripAdvisor user
355351370.reviewBody: My family drove to the ruins and there was parking near the entrance. We were approached by several guides, but we decided not to use one. We\'ve seen several ruin in Central America and have done the guide thing. There were several vendors inside  selling trinkets and Mayan souvenirs. The only thing we needed was cold water  because it was a hot, hot day. My husband and I would have liked to stay another 2 hours, but the children were melting down (heat and ant bites) so we decided to leave. \n\nCost - These were the most expensive ruins we\'ve been too. I don\'t remember the exact costs, but we had to pay first to enter the national park (about 30 per person and kids 6 and under are free) and second to go into the ruins

355138296.name: Impressive
355138296.author: a TripAdvisor user
355138296.reviewBody: I had already been to Tikal and done the El Mirador trek which was fantastic. Went to Palenque just because it was on the way but it was different from my first two Mayan ruins and a worthwhile stop in Chiapas

354916350.name: Fantastic!
354916350.author: a TripAdvisor user
354916350.reviewBody:
One of the most impressive archelogical site that I have seen.
Located on hills overlooking a vast valley, in a rain forest setting, a complex of Mayan temples and castle looked even better than expected.
Just a short drive from the city of Palenque.
A couple of hours can cover the site.

In fact, in 1 long day, we visited the ruins, the waterfall of ..Hu (1hour), the waterfalls at Agua Azul (2.5 hours) and arrived at 11pm to San Cristobal.

354466475.name: lovely ruins
354466475.author: a TripAdvisor user
354466475.reviewBody: lovely ruins, nice grounds, lots touts, but not too pushy. if you are not that into history, no need for a guide just hop in a collectivo, get there and wander around, you can climb some of the ruins.

353948047.name: To Far For Americans?
353948047.author: a TripAdvisor user
353948047.reviewBody:
At Palenque I asked our guide, Jose, why there weren't more Americans at the site.  I thought it was because of all of the nonsense news of crime in Mexico.  He told me that he thought that Americans preferred beaches and chose Chichen Itsa because it was near Cancun.

Let me tell you, you can fly into Villahermosa on United and rent a car.  The drive is safe (learn to avoid topes) and you really get a feel for Mexico during the 100 mile trip to Palenque.  Several accommodations near the ruins are four star.  All are scenic and beautiful.  We stayed at Chan-Kah.

The archeological site is on par with Ek Balam and Uxmal in the yucatan.  It is not quite as impressive as Chichen Itza but is equally enlightening in the Mayan culture.  Please hire a guide that speaks english.  A proper guide will make any site come alive rather than just walking around for photo ops.

Put this destination on your Mayan bucket list.  You won't regret it.

353110135.name: Palenque is beautiful!
353110135.author: a TripAdvisor user
353110135.reviewBody: What the Mayan were able to build is incredible. I was in awe of what I saw. The Mayan were highly intelligent people.

352882603.name: In my opinion - absolutly must see!
352882603.author: a TripAdvisor user
352882603.reviewBody: 3 days trip from Tulum, driving over 1600 km - totally worth the effort. Magical place in the middle of the jungle. Must see!

352701264.name: Beautiful ruins in the middle of the jungle
352701264.author: a TripAdvisor user
352701264.reviewBody: Everything here is organized well and the ruins are close together, so that\'s very nice! The ruins are surrounded with a beautiful jungle. Nice to that you climb on the buildings for the view. \n\nWorth visiting, certainly in the low season.

352424712.name: Not just another Mayan Treasure
352424712.author: a TripAdvisor user
352424712.reviewBody: We have been fortunate to visit 3 Yucutan Mayan sites but this is not just more of the same. \nI am not qualified to speak of the archeological differences but the opportunity to climb the sites to see the tablets, friezes, and see pigments still on the plaster up close and not from a distance is special. \nFrom what we were told of the history this was a lesser power in the Mayan world and so the scale and artistry found in this site make it one not to be missed

352230182.name: Majestic!
352230182.author: a TripAdvisor user
352230182.reviewBody: This construction is just simply majestic! You could not believe that this was built several years ago. There is like a jungle that sorrounds these place, I highly recommend to visit this place if you are near there, It totatlly worth it. And you can get a tourist local guide for a small amount of money if you are in a group. I\u00b4d say it can take the whole day to visit every corner of this place. Also was a good sunny day so my friend and I enjoyed it a lot!\n\n P.S. take a bottle of water with you!

351865105.name: Wonderful and Amazing!
351865105.author: a TripAdvisor user
351865105.reviewBody: I spent one day here, I have been travelling and visiting the various ruins throughout Mexico in the and this one is by far the most impressive I have seen (I have many more to see and others are amazing too) it\'s just the setting in the jungle and away from the Chitzen Itza tourist route it was a thoroughly enjoyable day. The tour guide was amazing too! Recommend tour guides I managed to only pay 150 pesos for dual lingual tour. Was super!

351842862.name: most amazing of all the ruins
351842862.author: a TripAdvisor user
351842862.reviewBody: extensive ruins amidst jungle - amazing! really need a guide to do it justice and explain the history and how it all worked. worth climbing the pyramid/temple to get the best views and appreciate what a priest may have seen

351324668.name: Impressive ruins without aggressive touts
351324668.author: a TripAdvisor user
351324668.reviewBody:
Palenque was one of the great Maya city states of the Classic Era. Due to its location in the state of Chiapas (far enough from Mexico City and the tourist inundated parts of the Yucatan) Palenque is less crowded and less commercialized than other major Mayan sites in Mexico.

While the impressive Temple of Inscriptions is not directly accessible, all of the other structures are open to direct exploration. Palenque has a bit of everything from forest covered ruins to a large palace complete with an observation tower.

Palenque is the most accessible major Mayan ruin in Mexico and likely in the world.

Palenque also features a site museum with some good examples of Mayan sculpture and pottery (albeit many of the displays are reproductions).

351174610.name: Palenque ruins a must see
351174610.author: a TripAdvisor user
351174610.reviewBody: If possible go with a guide who knows the history of,the Mayans and,the ruins.  Our visit was made more enjoyable because of,the information.   Very interesting place to visit.

351161495.name: Fabled Ruins
351161495.author: a TripAdvisor user
351161495.reviewBody: These are fabled ruins that live up to the hype.  In wonderful shape, easy to climb around and nice gravel paths.  Museum down the road also fabulous, and the artisan shop attached has some amazing bargains.  I bought a large dome amber/silver ring and when I checked my CC receipt recently, I was stunned to discover it was only a few dollars.  Since our guide bought some stuff also, that is a pretty good recommendation.

351075017.name: Highly Recommended and Did NOT Disappoint
351075017.author: a TripAdvisor user
351075017.reviewBody: Our first visit to this sight and we were lucky enough to have a perfect day. Lovely weather and great for picture taking.  It more than met our expectations.

350415222.name: Incredible place
350415222.author: a TripAdvisor user
350415222.reviewBody: If you are close to this archaeological zone, do not hesitate to enter (the entrance fee is 64MX plus 30MX to enter the area of National Park), it is huge and you can feel a lot of energy there!

349940413.name: super ruins
349940413.author: a TripAdvisor user
349940413.reviewBody: Very impressif ruins, its a long way to go but it is worth it, very nice small museum on the site. Its a pity that they have not a lot of tourist and every one wants to guide you, just ignore them friendly . You can walk on the site , we where lukly it didn\'t rain during our visit.

349457033.name: Amazing
349457033.author: a TripAdvisor user
349457033.reviewBody: This site was the best of the three Mayan sites visited to date. (Tulum and Coba being the others). Situated in forest surroundings, it was a special place to visit. Well worth the effort. We were there on a Monday and the site museum was closed which was dissapointing. The car parking was chaotic, and I am not sure how things would work when busy?

349303989.name: Spectacular Palenque
349303989.author: a TripAdvisor user
349303989.reviewBody: I\'ve been to a few ruins but this has been the best made special by the surrounding jungle and unexplored ruins. It was raining when we went and I\'d say it made it extra special... A must see.

348952507.name: Stunning
348952507.author: a TripAdvisor user
348952507.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning! Get a guide, it would make your visit much more thorough and will help you understand more of the Mayan culture. We got there at 3pm and got a great discount on a guided tour since it was only two hours before closing time. Two hours is plenty time for visiting, plus almost all tourists have gone by that time.

348947361.name: Best ruins I\'ve ever seen!
348947361.author: a TripAdvisor user
348947361.reviewBody: Cheap collectivo took us to the ruins in 10 minutes. You can still climb up all but two of the structures, which is awesome.  Beautiful mountain/jungle setting! Take a big water bottle with you and be aware that there are many indigenous people of all ages plying their crafts.

348701803.name: Impressive
348701803.author: a TripAdvisor user
348701803.reviewBody: Spent a few hours here. Impressive buildings. This was my second trip and will return again. It was cool so the crowds were minimal and the walking tolerable. The museum was interesting as well.

348093216.name: WOW - A must see
348093216.author: a TripAdvisor user
348093216.reviewBody: We visited a number of sites on our recent trip to Mexico/Guatemala and we were very impressed with this site.  It is quite compact but beautiful with plenty of lush trees and one can really imagine what life would have be like.  We had a wonderful guide, Mildred from Ketzaltour and she was sensational.  She was extremely knowledgeable and made our visit very memorable.

347877811.name: Review of Palenque ruins
347877811.author: a TripAdvisor user
347877811.reviewBody: Palenque is one of the best places ever. It is a site full of magic, situated near jungle settings. If you are lucky you hear or see the howler monkeys in the trees

347409870.name: Unbelieveable
347409870.author: a TripAdvisor user
347409870.reviewBody: This place is just breathtaking, I have actually been to visit 4 times because it\'s so good, years ago you could pitch a tent next to the ruins but they don\'t allow it nowadays\nIt\'s hard to imagine how they managed to build this all those years ago, it\'s well worth combining with a visit to Agua Azul

347205569.name: Impressive site
347205569.author: a TripAdvisor user
347205569.reviewBody: This site was very impressive. Although it was raining, we had a great time strolling through and admiring these massive masterpieces of Mayan architecture. After reading about Pakal and his kingdom, it was great to finally be here and get an idea how he and his people might have lived here. Unfortunately you cannot visit his tomb anymore, but you will see a very detailed explanation and reconstruction of his sarcophagus in the museum. The walk back from the site to the Main Street is very cool through the forest and crossing a river with a waterfall.\nIf you wonder why there are two separate fees entering the arqueological site, the first one is for preservation purposes and the second is the actual site fee.

346674487.name: Beautiful ruinas!!
346674487.author: a TripAdvisor user
346674487.reviewBody: Worth it to go there and to see these important ruinas! Actually the ticket very cheap! \nFor me Palenque ruinas was one of my favorite in Central America!! \nYou can go there by taxi or "colectivo" for 20 pesos! Then you will need to pay 30 P\' for the Notional Park and 60P to get in to the ruinas!

346375266.name: Excellent full day experience
346375266.author: a TripAdvisor user
346375266.reviewBody: We went to the ruins being uncommitted to getting a guide. We obtained Jose for a guide, which made a huge difference in our experience. We were taken into the jungle and had much explained to us. We went to the aquaduct and actually went in it where we saw bats with purple wings. Jose didn\'t go in but watched our camera and belongings. The ruins are exceptional and suprisingly different from those at Tikal. Jose explained so much of the history and significance of what we were seeing.After our half day tour we walked in the jungle and back to the museum. The museum was worthwhile too. I\'m so pleased we made the effort to come here and appreciate our guide Jose who was exceptional. It was a full, somewhat exhausting and very rewarding day.

345956004.name: Make a Full Day of It
345956004.author: a TripAdvisor user
345956004.reviewBody: This place was totally incredible. Spent 6 hours and was worn out by the end of the day. Well worth the visit. I suggest you go there by Taxi or Taxi Van and forget signing up for a tour. Waste of money and I am told they rush you in and out. Only about $5 by Taxi or by Collective (Taxi Van) is about $1.50... Once there you can read the signs in front of the various ruins and understand what they are and you can take your time or hire an English speaking Kid or Adult as your private guide.Just tip the good.

345656422.name: Amazing ruins with excellent guide
345656422.author: a TripAdvisor user
345656422.reviewBody: We decided to hire a guide even though we had studied a lot about the ruins before our visit.  Victor, our guide, was immensely proud of the Mayans and their heritage and he showed us the sculpture and architecture that he thought was most meaningful and important. He explained a lot about the Mayan culture during our tour and ended the tour with a visit through the jungle where he pointed out several un-excavated ruins. He also found two hard to spot howler monkeys in the trees while we were walking through the jungle. Palenque and one of its primary rulers, Pakal, has an interesting history and the visit to the Red Queens tomb is also one of the highlights of this historical place.

345629964.name: Best ruins we saw in Mexico
345629964.author: a TripAdvisor user
345629964.reviewBody: With its scrubby jungle setting and smaller crowds, we thought Palenque was better than Teotihuacan, Chichen Itza and Tulum ruins. We got there just past opening time, so it was still fairly quiet and the hawkers were only just setting up. You\'re able to walk all over the ruins (which in one way is sad because that\'s not preservation), but it\'s lovely to enjoy this site without hoards of people around you. Absolutely loved it and it\'s beauty! We recommend going without a tour and just screenshotting some information from the Internet and walking it privately.

345479295.name: Pouring rain yet as stunning an adventure as you can get.
345479295.author: a TripAdvisor user
345479295.reviewBody: We have made it our focus to see as many Mesoamerican historical sites as can be seen in 2 weeks by bus. We did not take a guide which was not a charitable choice, but with the rain we were not certain we would last for a 90 min tour. HA! Four and a half hours, it is still raining and we are still scrambling up pyramids, snapping photos of everything including the fog. \nI can say that if you do not want a crowd this is the perfect kind of day to go, not crowded, the venders are few and quite subdued, but the mystique is magical.

345458090.name: Breathtaking site in the middle of the jungle
345458090.author: a TripAdvisor user
345458090.reviewBody:
At the end of the day this is the only real reason to visit Palenque, but it does make it so worthwhile. 

These ruins are stunning. Set in what is now a National Park, the ruins themselves are extensive with multiple large buildings. You can climb the majority of them (though not the Temple of the Inscriptions) and many have gorgeous bas reliefs still in situ. 

We took a collectivo from outside the ADO station to the ruins (20 pesos each and you have to pay the National Park entry part way up) and were immediately swarmed by guides when we arrived. We opted to go it alone, which ended up being for the best as we really took our time going round the site. The views from the tops of the temples are stunning. It was drizzling so it wasn't particularly crowded either. 

After going round the site we followed signs to the museum which took us through the jungle paths to more residential ruins and some beautiful waterfalls and streams. It was a gorgeous walk and far better than driving down to the museum. The museum itself is really interesting with lots of fascinating artefacts found at the site, including the sarcophagus of Pakal II.  

Absolutely amazing day, everyone visiting Mexico should go.

345428403.name: A Must See
345428403.author: a TripAdvisor user
345428403.reviewBody: This is truly a magnificent site. Mayan architecture in a beautiful jungle setting. Having a guide is always useful. The guides are very knowledgeable in regards to the history of the area. This is a site you can do easily by yourself if you like. There are plenty of English translations.\n

345159706.name: Sooo beautiful!!!
345159706.author: a TripAdvisor user
345159706.reviewBody: The view from the top ruin was amazing!!! And the walk to the waterfall was amazing!!!! It is a must!

345044439.name: Hands-on Mayan history
345044439.author: a TripAdvisor user
345044439.reviewBody:
Palenque ruins are a large site and one of my favorites. Part of it is in clear areas where the sun will beat down on you, some back in the jungle. There is considerable climbing if you like to get inside (literally) the ruins so wear good shoes. 

All of the structures have plaques in English and Spanish that describe them so we felt a guide was not needed. The kids enjoyed being able to climb and explore inside many of the buildings. Throughout the site there are vendors selling souvenirs, but they are not overly aggressive and did not bother us. There is a bathroom after the majority of the structures but no food inside the ruins so pack a snack. Behind the bathrooms there is a trail that leads out to the museum through a scenic jungle walk past waterfalls and a few more ruins, I highly recommend you go this way.  

Take your time, read the history, and enjoy the climbing while you can, rumor is they will stop letting people walk on the ruins in the next couple of years. The museum is included with the ticket so spend some time there-don't miss seeing the tomb of the king, it's huge! There is a restaurant next door but we haven't tried it, preferring to eat back in town.

345007413.name: Great adventure
345007413.author: a TripAdvisor user
345007413.reviewBody: Drove from Playa del Carmen and was worth every bit of it !! Great experience all around and would recommend to anyone. Only 2nd ruins I\'ve been to but nothing can top it I\'m sure.

344972641.name: Worth a visit - nice ruins in a jungle setting.
344972641.author: a TripAdvisor user
344972641.reviewBody: A smaller ruin, but very nice.  The jungle setting adds to the beauty, especially from the top of one of the pyramids.

344879874.name: Can\'t get enough!
344879874.author: a TripAdvisor user
344879874.reviewBody: My family had never been here before, I had previously enjoyed a guided tour here, and every one of the guides has their way of telling it to you. Being New Year, the ruins were packed, at times you felt suffocated by the amount of tourists present.\nAfter the ruin tour, our guide walked us through the jungle close by, amazing! Check out my pictures, there are surprise guests in one!\nGo in the off season, that was my first visit and it was more enlightening!!!

344649258.name: Be sure to visit the Palenque ruins and the museum
344649258.author: a TripAdvisor user
344649258.reviewBody: We visited 3 x and the museum 2x. I think Palenque is smaller than Uxmal and Chichin Itza but it is very different, being in the jungle and the buildings atop the steps are astoundingly intact.

344503923.name: Magical Place
344503923.author: a TripAdvisor user
344503923.reviewBody:
Spent a magical day in the ruins. Dodging expensive offers to take hotel and tour guide transportation, we took a collectivo from just outside the centre of Palenque to the ruins. Costs 20 pesos per person each way. Very easy. We arrived early and ran the gauntlet of guides wanting to escort us. Arriving early, we wanted to experience the feel of the ruins and explore at our own pace. This worked well for us. It is a magical place and you can imagine how people lived. We'd heard about the museum and so , once we'd seen all we thought there was to see, we followed signs to the museum. And this was a treat. Because most people seemed to stay in the main area. We lost nearly everyone as we headed down a windy footpath parallel to some stunning waterfalls. It is on this side that you find the Queen's house, her sauna, and her pool for cooling off in. Still surrounded by tall trees and mottled shade, this was a magical find. We must have seen 6 or 8 other people in all the time we were there. The museum is fabulous too. A reconstruction of the room and tomb of one of the most important people of the day (so important I've already forgotten his name - oops!). Really cleverly done and very very interesting. 
So one magical, unforgettable day. My advice in summary...
- Take a collectivo bus, it's easier than you think
- Get there early
- Find the path to the museum
_ Remember that the museum is closed on Mondays
- Smile and enjoy the atmosphere of this amazing place

343510539.name: Palenque ruinas
343510539.author: a TripAdvisor user
343510539.reviewBody:
Palenque was the highlight of my 2 weeks in yucatan- Chiapas.
As a site guide, I had the chance to randomly have Senor Victor Damas Hernandez ( tel 916 345 0709  or cel:916348 5023)
Victor is a guide and researcher since 1965, the last from his generation.
he took the time to share with passion his knowledge.
Having travelled a lot and an opened minded view, 
he showed remaining evidence of ancients cultures that had settled on the site over the past centuries way before that the AMERICAS was discovered by Christophe Columbus.
Pyramid Architecture and carving stone style from Egypt civilisation.
stone carvings with dragons shaped as in Chinese's civilisation.
Hebrews and Hindu representations.
I was glad that I met him, as the new generation of guide explain the official government's version not always accurate.
eg:according to him, what was meant to be a steam exhausting system for bathing as in the Roman's civilisation.
is described nowadays as a toilet system....

343394128.name: The Original Stone Temple Pilot... Pacal II Rests Here.
343394128.author: a TripAdvisor user
343394128.reviewBody: Really takes about three days to fully enjoy. Only 2% of The Ruin Complex has been restored and that is massive and spectacular (My favorite Mayan City Site).  If you give yourself a little time, you can have a more primitive unreconstructed view of ruins still waiting for resurrection complete with an abundance of bird and wildlife.  Find a guide fluent in your language for the more primitive, but expansive experience, and to get the most from the Central Park that is well manicured and easy to navigate. The Museum is well worth your time as well, complete with a well modeled copy of Pacal II\'s tomb, sarcophagus, and, of course, the most famous Mayan Glyph in history.. with stars in correct positions and the first Astronaut manning the controls of your imagination. Viva Mexico!

342970335.name: Beats Out Chichen Itza Hands Down.
342970335.author: a TripAdvisor user
342970335.reviewBody: This is spectacular.It\'s equal to Tikal of Guatemala.I really couldn\'t add a lot as I\'m sure you will read a guide book before coming here. Elderly people and I suppose even slightly handicapped can navigate around most of these ruins.Although if taking the exit out to the museum handicapped folks would likely find considerable difficulty in the steep,uneven decline.One can just exit by going out by the main entrance.(i.e. the way you came in).You wouldn\'t miss a lot anyway as you would have seen just about everything.Take drinking water with you of course.We took binoculars with us in case of wildlife.A guide is advisable but if you are just a casual visitor not absolutely necessary.Lots of guides at the entrance. \nIf travelling by car there is "free parking" at the entrance.Not really free though as you have to pay to enter the park area as you drive up.

342966006.name: A Must-See
342966006.author: a TripAdvisor user
342966006.reviewBody: A fabulous site.  Interesting both from a historical and artistic point of view.  We really liked our guide, Edgardo, who spoke excellent English and was extremely courteous.   Also need to include a visit to Misol Ha and Agua Azul waterfalls.

342437812.name: A must see!
342437812.author: a TripAdvisor user
342437812.reviewBody: Amazing, that is why one goes to Palenque. A guided tour is pricy (1000-2000 pesos), but you will get so much more out of it. The trick is to find like-minded people and share the cost. We ran into three other people at the tourist office in Palenque and went together and shared an official guide (Victor) who spoke Spanish, French, English, Italian and German.

342407441.name: Fascinating Mayan Ruins!
342407441.author: a TripAdvisor user
342407441.reviewBody: Palenque is a large, fascinating Mayan site with both fabulous ruins and a very nice, small museum. The rock carvings (relief) are fascinating and very well preserved. There are several temples, an extensive palace, a Mayan ball court, and Pakal\'s tomb. In order to fully enjoy the site, you must be very comfortable with steep rock stairs    and areas of very uneven ground.

342385620.name: Richard in Palenque
342385620.author: a TripAdvisor user
342385620.reviewBody: Too much to say about this fabulous ruin. The site is located in the jungle with occasional howler monkeys for entertainment. Be sure to take a guide so you can have a full experience.

342213582.name: met up with a fabulous guide named gustavo.. whose explanations in engish really were informative .
342213582.author: a TripAdvisor user
342213582.reviewBody: I loved this ruin and the chance to roam freely around it and the park.  learned a great deal babout Mayan culture and construction...

342140116.name: WOW!  Beautiful site.
342140116.author: a TripAdvisor user
342140116.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite Mayan ruins visited.  Nice big site well spread out and a lot of history and the ruins are in great shape.  You can climb some of the ruins and the views are spectacular.

342126285.name: Amazing place
342126285.author: a TripAdvisor user
342126285.reviewBody: Best Mayan ruins I\'ve seen in Mexico. Not too many tourists (like in Chichen-Itza for example). Structures are in quite good condition so you can visualise how it looked like before. There is river and waterfalls on site, a few traders. We spot toucan, monkeys, and some lizards there. \nThere is a trail on the other side of the road, a bit uphill from the exit from zona archeologica - where you can see many examples of fauna and flora, and yet more Mayan structures.

342008188.name: Go early
342008188.author: a TripAdvisor user
342008188.reviewBody: We got there at 8 and managed to do it all before the tour buses arrive. It\'s beautiful with no one around. Beware of the various different fee on top of the 65$ entrance fee.

341796787.name: Evocative ruins set in the jungle
341796787.author: a TripAdvisor user
341796787.reviewBody: This site is huge, in spite of the fact that only a small portion of it has been cleared. Take a collectivo from the town - it is just 20 pesos per person. Entry to the national park us 31 pesos and to the ruins is 65.\n\nWe didn\'t take a tour but there are a number of information boards and it was easy to wander round the site. It was particularly good to be able to go inside the palace.

341541755.name: Popular Palenque
341541755.author: a TripAdvisor user
341541755.reviewBody: This place sees a lot of tourists in a day, but if you go right when the gates open, before the tour busses arrive and the souvenir touts spread out their blue tarps, you can still experience Palenque that is peaceful and beautiful.

341296662.name: Amazing
341296662.author: a TripAdvisor user
341296662.reviewBody: Some of the most impressive Mayan Ruins I\'ve seen, and I\'ve seen a lot. A must-see for Mayan history buffs.

341291921.name: Must visit - more charming than Chitchen Itza!
341291921.author: a TripAdvisor user
341291921.reviewBody: After Chichen Itza and Uxmal, Palenque were our third big Maya ruins. The location is breath taking - the highlands covered in jungle are a lovely background and when you climb the highest pyramid, you have a gorgeous view over the valley. And yes, you may climb most of th ruins! No vendors along the paths either and a lot less crowded. One of the highlights of our trip!

341290298.name: Great site!
341290298.author: a TripAdvisor user
341290298.reviewBody: Excellent Mayan ruins.  We enjoyed exploring the extensive grounds and recommend you visit if you are ever in the area.

341029999.name: Impressive site
341029999.author: a TripAdvisor user
341029999.reviewBody: Impressive classic Mayan site. Some very intact inscriptions and low relief carvings. The site itself is well-maintained, almost park like, with helpful officials. Highly recommended for both Mayan aficionados and tourists.

340742110.name: One of the best sites
340742110.author: a TripAdvisor user
340742110.reviewBody: This was the first Mayan site we visited on our central America trip. Don\'t know if it was because it was the first site we went to but it pretty much blew the others away. Go and see it !

340611737.name: If possible do not visit on a Sunday or else get there before 8 am!
340611737.author: a TripAdvisor user
340611737.reviewBody: The title I wrote does not make justice to this sensational Aztec stronghold - Palenque is superb and if you are going to drive through the Yucatan Peninsula ending at Villahermosa in Tabasco as we did then make sure you also drive through Chiapas to spend a couple of days in Palenque! Now as a general rule avoid visiting archeological sites on Sundays as this day they are free for the general Mexican population - I think this is a nice touch however Mexico has over 130 million people so don\'t underestimate the crowds that can show up!

340555159.name: Fabulous
340555159.author: a TripAdvisor user
340555159.reviewBody: Whether interested in history or not this is a place you must visit. Absolutely amazing architecture set in stunning surroundings.  Give yourself plenty of time and take a guided tour.  A walk through the jungle past the waterfall on the way out is beautiful especially if you hear the Howler monkeys too.

340323815.name: Fascinating. So much more spectacular than we expected
340323815.author: a TripAdvisor user
340323815.reviewBody: This is a 5 star MUST see if in Mexico. Seemed as if the whole of Mexico had also turned up on the Sunday after the Christmas break. The history is well told by local guides who are essential to appreciate the vastness of the site.\n\n

340315312.name: Beautiful!  And great if you can spend more than 1 day
340315312.author: a TripAdvisor user
340315312.reviewBody: Have been to quite a few Maya sites & this one is my favorite.  Ruins show a wonderful aesthetic sense also evident in other sites but somehow really alive here.  Had a guide who really knew the archeology, which was helpful (guide was not from the site, with a tour).  We got too interested to finish in a day so saved the museum for the next morning.  Otherwise would have been overload for us.  We did the walk to the waterfall (gorgeous) that leads to the museum on the first day--well worth the effort but requires the ability to go down many stairs, potentially slippery if wet.  There\'s lots written about Palenque & it\'s good to learn some before going, also see some of the artifacts that are in other museums (or photos of them) because they tell more of the story of the place.

339688198.name: Ruins in the jungle
339688198.author: a TripAdvisor user
339688198.reviewBody: For those who may be weary of visiting yet one more Mayan ruin site, make the effort for Palenque. Situated in lush jungle, making it quite different from most other similar sites, there are many unexcavated buildings protruding from the ground. More visitors here than at Monte Alban, though not nearly as crowded as Chichen Itza. We paid 1200 pesos for a guide for 6 people, but I think you could get one for less, say 1000 pesos. Our guide took us on a short walk in the jungle, which was good, but he didn\'t offer much information about the flora and fauna. Resist the overpriced Mayan calendars on leather being sold by merchants inside the archaeological zone. Better ones available in other places, such as Merida. Make sure you get dropped off near the ticket office, and then after visit take scenic boardwalk trail down the hill. Allow at least 2 hours for whole visit.

339500765.name: Lakam Ha
339500765.author: a TripAdvisor user
339500765.reviewBody: What to say, more beautiful finger, surrounded by nature, near rivers of waterfalls. Immense archaeological site, if co me the most beautiful so far seen here in Mexico.\nDefinitely a must-do.

339286197.name: More natural than Chicken itza
339286197.author: a TripAdvisor user
339286197.reviewBody: Really enjoyed my trip here, we first walked up through the jungle trail to see ruins still under vegetation & the Mayan swimming pool. Then into the ruins (via a lot of traders by the entrance) with an excellent guide for both. \nThe ruins only take an hour or so to see as they are in one small square area but you can climb over or into most of them. Then take the walk out via the waterfalls (rather than the way you come in) which is beautiful (but steep steps) and finish with a visit to the Museum (free with your ruins entry ticket)\nHighly recommended

339250928.name: Beautiful Ruins
339250928.author: a TripAdvisor user
339250928.reviewBody: Amazing well kept ruins, inexpensive to visit and you can climb up some of them and look at the breath taking views of the surrounding rainforest.

339009242.name: Well worth the road trip  from Cancun
339009242.author: a TripAdvisor user
339009242.reviewBody: We spent two days travelling on good roads from Cancun to see this ancient city.  It is strikingly different from those elsewhere in the Yucatan, the rest of Mexico and those we have seen in Belize, Guatemala and Peru.  The restoration work done here gives one the feel of the place without making it feel like a re-creation.  The fact that there is still active rebuilding and archeological exploration going on make it feel all the more authentic.  Its jungle location on a mountain slope overlooking the western Yucatan is beautiful. Unlike some of the other small sites (Chicann\u00e1, Becan) we visited on the way there, Palenque is quite developed with lots of vendors and guides offering their services.  It is however not nearly as crowded or over worked at Chichen Itza and, for those so inclined, climbing in and around structures is permitted on all but two of the restored pyramids and other buildings. Also unlike some of the locations closer to the Mayan Riviera and cruise ports, most of the visitors here at the time of our day long exploration were Spanish speaking.

338927992.name: Atmospheric and special
338927992.author: a TripAdvisor user
338927992.reviewBody:
The weather today was awful: rain, rain and yes, rain. But that made the visits to the ruins special and pretty atmospheric! There were few visitors so it was easy to picture how it must have been. Also, the jungle in the background was great, especially when the howler monkeys  made their calls: they didn't seem to like the rain...

The museum is worth visiting- it puts things in context. It also means you don't need a guide (plus: all ruins have an English description).

We've now visited Chichen Itza, Uxmal and some smaller sites. Palenque is easily one of the best!

Also, it was easy to get there: we just took a cab for 100 pesos. Buying a ticket was simple (unlike in Chichen Itza) and we took a collectivo back (very cheap).

338609403.name: Beautiful despite the rain
338609403.author: a TripAdvisor user
338609403.reviewBody: Amazing site   Probably our favourite in all of Mexico! Torrential rain did not deter and added another dimension. Walking back through the jungle highly recommended

338557356.name: one of the more impressive ruins in Mexico
338557356.author: a TripAdvisor user
338557356.reviewBody: A beautiful ruins in the heart of  a rainforest.plent of guides outside waiting to explain the story behind the fall of this city

338522685.name: Epic in scale!
338522685.author: a TripAdvisor user
338522685.reviewBody: Be ready to climb a lot of stairs to the top of over ten to twenty places, temples, n residences - each one has different murals, views, and location.  Brilliant.

338316315.name: The Ruinas
338316315.author: a TripAdvisor user
338316315.reviewBody: Incredible,mystic,historic,and a vacation I waited much of my life for. You can still get close to the ruins yet they are protected. Please respect them! Plan to spend at least a day at the pyramids alone and bring DEET! The nearby waterfalls are worth the trip and definately read up on Palenque BEFORE you visit.

338314935.name: Amazing Jungle Ruins
338314935.author: a TripAdvisor user
338314935.reviewBody: These ruins are some of my favorite in the Yucatan. Huge and sprawling in the jungle. There is some fun climbing. Go see them!

338018215.name: Beautiful
338018215.author: a TripAdvisor user
338018215.reviewBody: A must do....take a tour or have an amazing guidebook so you can appreciate the significance of the ruinas. \n\nVery popular, so be prepared for crowds.

337935783.name: Wow!! Some of the best Mayan ruins I\'ve ever seen
337935783.author: a TripAdvisor user
337935783.reviewBody: This place is amazing. They have only uncovered about 4% of the total Mayan city of Palenque and what you can see is unbelievable.

337921302.name: A must go
337921302.author: a TripAdvisor user
337921302.reviewBody: Very well conserved Mayan ruins! Was a bit skeptical about going to Palenque just to see this but it was worth the trip. Quite an unique place!\n\nThere are some guides just before you enter the price. Prices are high (MXN1500 for 1.5h tours, almost double to include the jungle) but are very negotiable (I paid half of initial price, and in high season). Guides are quite helpful but they are not very well prepared: make up some things, skip others...

337892985.name: Very large and LOTS of stairs.
337892985.author: a TripAdvisor user
337892985.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and huge place. I recommend that uf you have trouble with stairs, make sure you go in the enter acne without stairs. If you start at the entrance with stairs, there is a LOT of them. We had a tour guide from Merida. Juan was very knowledgeable about the whole of Mexico. We might book tours to other place through him.

337296278.name: Incredible ruins hidden in the jungle
337296278.author: a TripAdvisor user
337296278.reviewBody: The ruins of Palenque are very beautiful, and the way they have been eaten away by the jungle makes them a sight to see. Exploring the ruins takes a long time, admiring the buildings and the nature surrounding them. Be prepared, climbing the ruins is very tiring, and the heat is very intense, even on winter.

336302916.name: Much better than expected
336302916.author: a TripAdvisor user
336302916.reviewBody: I have visited other Maya ruins, but what makes Palenque unique is the palace of the king Pakaal or Pacal in Spanish. The other difference is that they have funeral buildings. Very rare for a Mayan ruin. It is the only Mayan city where they have found three corpses. It is easy to walk through. If you think the stairs to the Palace are too steep, there is a much shorter way of doing it from the front of the building. Personally, I liked Palenque a lot better than Tikal.

335325733.name: Beautiful
335325733.author: a TripAdvisor user
335325733.reviewBody: When you like the ancient ruins, must see it! Very beautiful landscape, like jungle. Breathtaking. My favourite place in mexico

335206347.name: Holidays in Palenque
335206347.author: a TripAdvisor user
335206347.reviewBody: Awesome place. The ruins and all what you can learn there is a reason to visit Palenque. You will find lot of small children working there, this is very sad, they should better be at school, but they are so cute.\n

334650304.name: Magical place
334650304.author: a TripAdvisor user
334650304.reviewBody: A magical place where the tourguides sells mushroom when in season, it\'s a big place and with alot to discover bring sunscreen and water. It sits on a mountainside with peaks and jungle around. You hear the howling monkies, and se hummingbirds if you\'re lucky, outside the entrance it\'s alittle chaotic with kids wanting money for watching your car and guides pretending to be police and offering stuff to sell. Ignore these people and just pay entrance fee.

334325879.name: Loved it!
334325879.author: a TripAdvisor user
334325879.reviewBody: Go!! Make sure to hire a guide to take you through the ruins and jungle! You will be wowed by the beautiful ruins in the mystical cloud forest.

333835817.name: Wow
333835817.author: a TripAdvisor user
333835817.reviewBody: Hidden in the jungle nice and quiet pyramid complex that is only magnificent. I was only disappointed that the entrance to Pakal tomb is no longer open to visitors due to archaeological preservation. There really is a feeling of Mayan Royalty about this complex with its palace and other pyramids. We were lucky to see a troop of howler monkeys feasting on the fruits of the tree tops surrounding the complex. Bring mosquito repellent!

333725518.name: Mystic feeling
333725518.author: a TripAdvisor user
333725518.reviewBody: From all the pyramids and ruins I\'ve visited in Mexico, las ruinas de Palenque are one of my favorites. Located in the middle of the djungle I felt completely alone even though there were many other people. I was trying to imagine how this must have been like in Mayan time. \nAs we had a guide I was additionally super impressed by what he told us. Forget about Chrisopher Columbus, he was literally the last person to discover America. There are many facts that prove Egyptians and Chinese have been there long before 1492.\nDefinitely recommenable!

333382920.name: Very nice, Pakal-fantastic
333382920.author: a TripAdvisor user
333382920.reviewBody:
This place is amazing and very interesting. A large ancient city of the Mayans, it must have been spectacular when it was inhabited. It still is quite nice, and a must visit when in the area. 
It's a good idea to hire a guide that speaks your language, several available and only a few $ for a one or two hours tour. Bring bug repellent, drinking water, comfortable shoes and willingness to climb many of the buildings, most have a temple on top with some type of sculpture or carved stone writings, paintings or all of the above. 
You do need to be in good physical shape to climb some of the tallest buildings. 
Beware, there are two exit ways, one that takes you to the main entrance in less than 10 minutes and another one that takes about 25 minutes of going down a long trail with many stairs, surrounded by the forest, with the intention to see the waterfall and/or the regional museum. This second exit (and the museum) is a mile away from the main entrance and the road back up is very steep so you either spend a good 30-40 minutes walking up that road or take a local shuttle taxi that charges10 pesos per person. But don't let this discourage you from going to see the forest trail and the waterfalls. If you have the extra time and can afford the shuttle, check them out.

332782460.name: None Better
332782460.author: a TripAdvisor user
332782460.reviewBody: Truly these are great Mayan ruins. These ruins compare to Tikal, Uxmal, Tulum, Coba. If you don\'t see them you won\'t fully appreciate Mayan culture. 10/10\n

332490383.name: Overrated and sold out
332490383.author: a TripAdvisor user
332490383.reviewBody: The ruins are teeming with people all the time, which pretty much ruins the experience. Signing is bad, better read up online before you go and walk around with a map... Disappointing.

332437711.name: Interesting site and informative guide
332437711.author: a TripAdvisor user
332437711.reviewBody: We\'ve been to a few archaeological ruins in Mexico and Palenque is right up there with the others, if a little overrun with tourists. Our guide, Jose, was very informative and had a sense of humour. I applaud the fact that although there is much more of the city buried beneath the jungle, ecological considerations have been the major priority and for the moment these ruins will remain buried so that the birds, animals, vegetation, and ultimately our planet, will benefit. What is there is spectacular enough.

331849371.name: Fascinating Place
331849371.author: a TripAdvisor user
331849371.reviewBody: No photos can impart the atmosphere of a place like this. The ruins have been expertly uncovered and in some parts restored. A very extensive area so allow at least two hours to walk around. A guide is highly recommended as the stories and legends are what make a place like this even more memorable. Guides will offer their services at the entrance, some negotiating is necessary.

331620000.name: Awesome
331620000.author: a TripAdvisor user
331620000.reviewBody: A must see site to visit and a must to climb. Suggest you wear sturdy walking shoes and carry a bottle of water

330665264.name: Fulfilling, Relaxing, Fun
330665264.author: a TripAdvisor user
330665264.reviewBody: I made a solo trip to the ruins for a vacation, and I must say I enjoyed it more than I expected. Although there were plenty of people there, it was in no way crowded. ..actually there were just enough people present to make the location feel secure. Definitely plenty of freedom to move about as one pleases. A great selection of souvenirs on the premises, some crafted by the locals while you watch. Not to mention a great opportunity to eat local delicatessen at the parking area. I can\'t remember the exact cost associated with parking, entering the ruins, etc., but it was definitely very reasonable.

330229824.name: Extensive Maya Ruins Surrounded By Jungle
330229824.author: a TripAdvisor user
330229824.reviewBody: Palenque was a major Classic Maya centre back in the day, and it shows. From the impressive Temple of the Inscriptions where they discovered the tomb of Pakal, the the Palace. These two probably give Palenque it\'s fame. However, the other temples in the extensive site should not be missed.\n\nOnly about 10% of the site is cleared, and you will notice an unexcavated pyramid in front of the Tomb of the Red Lady. There are many more in the forested area, although some are not accessible.

330177097.name: a MUST visit
330177097.author: a TripAdvisor user
330177097.reviewBody: Although is popular and crowded, is a visity you definitely have to do. Is well preserved and easy to get there, but bring your own water since the weather is too hot, even in the wet season!

330013116.name: I have never seen so many buildings in one area.
330013116.author: a TripAdvisor user
330013116.reviewBody: It was amazing. I loved the vegetation, the history the view and the whole feeling of being in a place of so much history. You have to have a guide to show you all the details of the pyramids.\nIt is incredible.

329086795.name: Great Ruins - Big Site - Can Really explore!!!!
329086795.author: a TripAdvisor user
329086795.reviewBody: Loved the ruins at Palenque. You can really explore the ruins, they are not so busy. Spoke to an Italian guy who took a pathway into the jungle as you come into the ruins. Took about 1hr or so through the jungle. Anyway the ruins have everything and there are tombs to look at, stairs to climb everything. You have to go. Better than Coba, Tulum and Chichen Itza.

329016074.name: The maya capital
329016074.author: a TripAdvisor user
329016074.reviewBody: Anyone interested in the Mayan culture must absolutely visit Palenque. Forget about yuca tan , it is a post classical area. Go to Palenque where the genius of the Mayan civilization really expressed itself. Only stay for the duration of the exploration of the ruins ( max. 3 days ) because there is nothing else to see.

328788602.name: Worth the long haul
328788602.author: a TripAdvisor user
328788602.reviewBody: Despite rainy season going later than usual we were able to visit the ruins early before the rain, heat, and crowds. It is worth it to get up early and arrive at the gates of the national park at 8am opening time. Be warned you need to pay there to get into the park. Do not pay for kids.  We got a local guide, spanish speaking for a deep discount (don\'t accept the posted prices-negotiate) and feel like we got our money\'s worth. The ruins are all the more impressive with a guide. Also so differrent than the other major ones. Nice that you can still climb some. Jungle tour with unexcavated ruins was an added bonus with howler monkeys and explanation of the local plants used for medicine and dyes. Museum was a disappointment after reading all the reviews but did have bathrooms.

328382045.name: Great place, worth a visit to see this remarkable ruin.
328382045.author: a TripAdvisor user
328382045.reviewBody: Palenque is one of the most amazing places I have been.  It was a huge city with a thriving population that ended up being gobbled up by the jungle.

328358678.name: It gets better every time
328358678.author: a TripAdvisor user
328358678.reviewBody: This was our third trip to Palenque.  I have seen a lot of beautiful ruins including Uxmal and Chichen Itza and many smaller sites.  This is by far the most magical, perhaps because it seems to be enveloped in mist and rain forest.  The government has done an excellent of guiding tourists through the ruins without being overbearing.  Since my last visit (2004), the paths and stairways have been improved significantly. The upper part would be wheelchair accessible. One is guided down steep areas of the second portion along the small river in wide paths and gorgeous recent? stonework which lets you out near the excellent museum.  I spent 3.5 hours on the grounds and another hour in the museum.  I personally don\'t like having a guide, because I like to wander and learn at my own pace. I did not hear the howler monkeys which added to the that magic.  I hope they were just sleeping and not gone from the site.

328058587.name: Top place to visit
328058587.author: a TripAdvisor user
328058587.reviewBody: Atmospheric,magical place with the right guide. Able to climb in and out of ruins and views are amazing. Jungle really adds to the scenary,

328027716.name: Magnificent place - poorly managed
328027716.author: a TripAdvisor user
328027716.reviewBody: As a Mexican I am saddened by my government\'s incompetence in managing this sort of places. 15 years ago you could visit the inside of the pyramid - now impossible due to poor management and oversight. Soon it will be impossible to climb the pyramids.

327589752.name: GIVE YOURSELF TIME!
327589752.author: a TripAdvisor user
327589752.reviewBody: Palenque is just too much to take in in only one day!  Incredible! HUGE!  I will be back!\nThere are plenty of willing guides for hire in numerous languages.  I was listening in on one in Italian.  He was very fluent!  Take lots of water.  There are restroom facilities, but they are rather spread out.  Don\'t miss the museum near the entrance.  Also, take some time to visit the nearby town of Santo Domingo, AKA Palenque.  It\'s charming.

327505068.name: Amazing jungle and ruins!
327505068.author: a TripAdvisor user
327505068.reviewBody: We took a guide Jose in 800 pesos for jungle+historical park. It was a brilliant decision!:) Jose is a big bald man. Half Mayan and half Mexican. Really smart and spiritual as Mayan should be:) after all we met him again in the jungle and he showed us a small Mayan ritual in the river. It was amazing! He didn\'t want to take any extra money so we gave him a small present :)

327455108.name: Amazing! A Favourite site
327455108.author: a TripAdvisor user
327455108.reviewBody: Visited the site last week and of all the sites we visited on our tour this was a favourite. It is expansive enough to spend a goof couple of hours and the restoration is exceptional. The Park areas are beautiful and we are able to climb the temples for spectacular views. There were of course some souvenir sellers, they need to make a living after all, but they were not invasive and certainly did not harass us. We had a guide already so again did not get approached on this front. There were facilities for drinks and bathrooms. Its true to say that there were lots of visitors there but it did not feel overcrowded and nothing like the madness of Chichen Itza! Highly recommend

327245059.name: A nice place to visit.
327245059.author: a TripAdvisor user
327245059.reviewBody: We actually stayed at Palenque only to visit these ruins. Make sure to get there early because it can be extremely hot by noon already!

327038707.name: Impressive
327038707.author: a TripAdvisor user
327038707.reviewBody: We came here to avoid the crowds of Chich\u00e9n Itz\u00e1. The ruins are a little smaller but you get a much more intimate experience with them.

326748506.name: great, but say no to the guides to ruins
326748506.author: a TripAdvisor user
326748506.reviewBody: Amazing ruins but READ your guide book to understand what you\'re looking at before during and after the visit... we went twice. My advice is to walk past the outrageously priced guides and think for yourself. Some might be worth the $$$ they charge! But if you see an elderly guide (Victor) with a white mustache, run the other away! He subscribes to old crackpot theories of Chinese, Egyptian and Hebrew influences, nude dancing, use of stone saws to cut stone blocks, claims the red queen is a man, alien spaceship sightings etc etc....complete waste of your money and time!!!

325808870.name: Amazing but felt annoyed
325808870.author: a TripAdvisor user
325808870.reviewBody: Amazing but I really felt annoyed by people offering tours. I had to say "no" more than twice and one guy even followed us until I said him "hey, dont get me wrong but I had told you no before", after that he finally stopped following us. Besides that, the place is huge and amazing. You will be surrounded by nature and jungle which makes this place beautiful.

325700781.name: The best ruins in Mexico
325700781.author: a TripAdvisor user
