325700781.reviewBody: If you are deciding which ruins in Mexico to visit, do not miss Palenque. Palenque is something you imagine Mayan ruins look like and you can just close your eyes and see yourself with a machete as a first explorer. Take a colectivo from the city, saying Ruins, 20 MXN one way. There is also a nice jungle walk in the curve of the road just before the entrance to the archeological zone.

325652337.name: Can\'t believe how impressive yet quiet it was
325652337.author: a TripAdvisor user
325652337.reviewBody: Given the fame of the ruins we expected it to be swamped with people, like Chichen Itza.  It was so quiet which enhanced the experience.  Extensive ruins in a stunning location and without all the stalls trying to sell trinkets that you get at Chichen.

325158604.name: You gotta go in from the back!!
325158604.author: a TripAdvisor user
325158604.reviewBody: I have lived in the south of M\u00e9xico for the last 10 years so archeological zones are not like my favorite thing to see on the world (all the same). The big highlight here are two things: One: you can climb up I think every monument in the park! Normally, in all the other sites I have been, you can see the pyramids from below and that\'s it! There you can climb and have a very nice view of the park and even a little bit of the city of Palenque. The second and best one is that you can go in from the back door while you see BEAUTIFUL waterfalls, undiscovered ruins and a pretty nice piece of jungle! You see the site backwards and you end where all the touristy buses are. Just ask the "colectivo" driver to let you go down in the museum and from there you walk 20 meters and there\'s a little entrance to the park, it is really worth it. Btw, if you are a mexican sundays is for free :)

324806226.name: Fantastic must see ruins
324806226.author: a TripAdvisor user
324806226.reviewBody: Take plenty of water, there seemed to be so many taxis offering tours but we decided to do it ourselves out hotel was very close. The trip was fine but it was very confusing as to where you entered the national park (that you had to pay 64 Mexican pesos) and then when you got to the ruins you had to pay again, but no signs to show where, basically you got shouted at by some random people and told to "buy ticket" to get a ticket to visit the ruins you have to go into the Museum which is located behind the service station to the ruins, it seams they are trying to discourage people from going solo. Also when you eventually get to the ruins entrance you have tour guides offering you a personal guided tour, we didn\'t see the point of this and enjoyed walking around solo.

323647588.name: DON\'T MISS THE MUSEUM
323647588.author: a TripAdvisor user
323647588.reviewBody: Over the years we have visited many Maya city sites.  Palenque may be our favorite.  There are others that are larger or better restored, but Paleque has some of the most beautiful structures of the Maya era.  In addition to the ruins, there is an excellent museum that should not be missed.  It contains the tomb of one of the rulers.  This tomb was not found until the 1950\'s and had not been raided or pilfered.  The objects are well preserved and displayed beautifully within the museum.  The museum also does an excellent job of displaying some of the stelae, and pottery recovered from the site.

323634776.name: The city of ruins
323634776.author: a TripAdvisor user
323634776.reviewBody:
Wow Palenque! All I can say is Wow! 
If you thought Coba and Chichen-Itza were impressive - you ain't seen nothing yet! Getting a guide is a must. It helps to understand the history behind the ruins, its construction and the people behind it. 
Get there early! If you're like me and want to see every ruin or at least climb every ruin then you need a couple of good hours. We had 3 hours and it wasn't enough. So much to see!
Water, sunscreen, hat and good walking shoes are a must.

323317255.name: A must see ruins site
323317255.author: a TripAdvisor user
323317255.reviewBody:
Really a spectacular site, surrounded by gorgeous jungle that give the ruins relaxing atmosphere. 

Much better to visit site early in the morning, that way you avoid the heat and stay ahead of the large groups that visit later in the day. Make sure you bring comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen and bottled water. It doesn't get that hot but it humidity levels are very high.

I strongly recommend to take the hike under the jungle, you see other structures waterfalls, birds and luckily howler monkeys. 

There are vendors inside the site, they all have the same speech and sell basically the same stuff, they will claim is all hand made, that they made it and so on. But you can find pieces made in other parts of Mexico at triple the price you'd pay somewhere else. Look around and if you want to buy something make sure you negotiate the price.

323048296.name: Breathtaking
323048296.author: a TripAdvisor user
323048296.reviewBody: These ruins, surrounded by lush jungle and waterfalls are so beautiful, there is a really powerful energy there. I was totally fascinated and inspired to learn more.

322692660.name: One of my favorite Mayan Ruins
322692660.author: a TripAdvisor user
322692660.reviewBody: The Ruins and the Mayan Museum are very well preserved. I enjoyed every second walking around and learning more and more about the Mayan Culture. Entrance is very cheap, and is very easy to get there.

321748567.name: Amazing but get a tour!
321748567.author: a TripAdvisor user
321748567.reviewBody:
The ruins are quite amazing. They are also quite large in size.
I would recommend a tour, as there are a lot of signs describing the ruins but can get confusing about what you are actually reading. 
Tours are offered out the front of ruins for 500 pesos but I know that you can get it cheaper, so bargain for it!
Easy to get to by collectivo from town. Pay no more than 20 pesos each way.

320491320.name: Better than Chichen Itza! Bring water!=)
320491320.author: a TripAdvisor user
320491320.reviewBody: You are in the middle of the jungle, you can see monkeys, birds and the icredible ruins! I really loved them because they are less crowded than chichen itza and also you can go up and take amazing pictures!

318448871.name: Past Power and Privilege
318448871.author: a TripAdvisor user
318448871.reviewBody: This is the real Maya experience for me, really, literally, deeply made me feel the power of the royalties who once upon a time lived there. This is a magical place beyond any doubts that there was actually people who ruled and thrived well before my time. This is an amazing place with the greatest view to see down to the gulf plain and realized that deep breathe is needed...

318345777.name: Awesome
318345777.author: a TripAdvisor user
318345777.reviewBody: The ruins come out of the jungle and are really impressive. Would definitely recommend a visit. All of the main ruins have good information signs beside them so a guided tour is not essential. \n\nBuses ruin to and from the ruins all day and can be hailed as they pass by.

318324486.name: very interesting
318324486.author: a TripAdvisor user
318324486.reviewBody: WE hired a guide and their knowledge of the history around the ruins was fantastic. do the jungle ruin tour as well as main ruins.  Great souvenirs can be purchased at ruins good prices.

317547793.name: Palenque arquelogical site
317547793.author: a TripAdvisor user
317547793.reviewBody: I know that sightseeing is not for everyone but for me it was a dream come true. Palenque is for beyond a site you can\'t miss to visit. There\'s a magic on that place that somurronds you with a feeling of peace you just can feel once you step into it. Is like being in another world. The architecture is amazing invites you to discover what the Mayan wanted to show us. It\'s a legacy in the lives of the people that are willing to let this magic in their hearts.

315807333.name: A city emerging from the jungle
315807333.author: a TripAdvisor user
315807333.reviewBody:
Precolombian sites in mexico are often remarkable,
Palenque and Ushmal are the sites with the best location I
viewed.  The achelogical remains in either places are
more than remarkable, and the pyramides in Palenque are
more impressive, and not the only impressive remains.

314975195.name: A great spot to visit ruins in the jungle and get up close to them.
314975195.author: a TripAdvisor user
314975195.reviewBody: Beautiful and up close. Ruins with wonderful views and interesting surroundings. One of the best for getting up close to all temples plenty of good tours available.

314571222.name: Fantastic!
314571222.author: a TripAdvisor user
314571222.reviewBody: These Mayan ruins are excellent. If you want to fully appreciate this site, find a guide. Back in the day this Mayan city had 1100 buildings but only a handful are excavated. But those buildings and temples that are excavated are magnificent. Plan to spend several hours exploring the grounds, ruins, and museum. This is one of those places you don\'t want to miss.

314491356.name: But what do I know?
314491356.author: a TripAdvisor user
314491356.reviewBody: Have you ever experienced that turn on the path within a luxuriant jungle where the dense foliage breaks and, around a soft ascending curve, the gleam of an ancient shangri-la suddenly embraces you completely in a softly wet mist coupled with the echo of a scant chorus of a overhead howler monkeys hidden and merging with the silvan background.  Notwithstanding the almost overwhelming gaggles of persistent vendors and self-appointed expert guides just outside the park entrance where you buy your tickets, the State of Chiapas has, in my opinion, carefully, tactfully and more or less completely divorced this unsightly crowd of human flies and parasites from denying you this experience.\n\nWell, that\'s how I would have described my first visit to Palenque in 2011.  True, the conglomerate of human pests pushing to get your attention before the gate usher tears you admission ticket in two seems to have incrementally increased these past four years along with the really ghastly city of Palenque itself, you can still experience (perhaps with a little more imagination on the inside--and less gullibility on the outside) the awesome splendor of an ubiquitous antiquity that time (and tourists) has failed to entomb more so than almost any other.  Except for the Khymers (and perhaps the Indians), no Egyptian pyramid, Greek temple, or monument from antiquity was built in a year-round climate as humid, wet, and oppressive as the Yucatan.  And in distinguishing the Mayans from the Khymers, the entire Mesoamerican rainforest from eastern Mexico and the Yucatan through to Honduras is saturated like the weather with more pyramids than anywhere else on earth.  But what do I know?

312895818.name: Cool ruins
312895818.author: a TripAdvisor user
312895818.reviewBody: As our first Mayan ruins these were pretty cool and not very busy at all. Pleased we visited, looking forward to comparing with the others we will visit. \nWe booked our trip from San cristobel de la cases and stopped at some waterfalls on the way. Not a bad way to get a transfer from there to Palenque. \nI would NOT recommend using mexica tours however as our luggage which was left on the mini bus was broken into and a decent sum of money stolen out of them. We followed up with the company several times by phone and email but have had no response. I guess we were easy targets with our limited spanish and them knowing we would not be returning to san cristobel any time soon.

312889754.name: Fantastic must see ruins in Mexico
312889754.author: a TripAdvisor user
312889754.reviewBody: Beautiful ruins in the middle of the Jungle. Must visit if visiting palenque! Was one of my favourite ruins in Mexico

312419737.name: BEAUTIFUL MAYAN CITY!
312419737.author: a TripAdvisor user
312419737.reviewBody: It is a beautiful Mayan City, very well maintained.  One of the biggest  and with a lot of finishings of Mayan constructions.  Located couple of hours from San Cristobal de las Casas.  If you\u00b4re in that area, you should definitely visit this ruins.  It takes the whole day for this visit, as it is an extensive place.  There is an entrance fee of around US$10 per person.   There are hotels and restaurants near to grab a meal.

312323374.name: In my top 3!
312323374.author: a TripAdvisor user
312323374.reviewBody: This summer we made a roadtrip through Mexico & Guatemala. Of all the Aztec & Mayan ruins we visited, this one is definitely in my top 3! The ruins have a very jungle look & feel, you can even hear the howler monkeys in the distance. It was very humid the day we visited and the fog came over the forest. It really added value to our pictures & experience!

312229419.name: Its a must lived experience  PALENQUE ,CHIAPAS!!!!!
312229419.author: a TripAdvisor user
312229419.reviewBody:
This place is so amazing , we had to visit twice!!!!.
The  first time we took a tour from San  Cristobal de las Casas (i really recommend to get perfect info
About the tours from SC) if i would have to do it again i will Just make it on my own  to Palenque  and all the other spots the tour offers  so you don't feel rushed the tour drivers are always rushing you ..The tours make 3 stops  cascadas de Agua Asul ,, cascada de Misolha  and Palenque Pyramids  is the last stop. 
It is very easy to get their on your own. Especially if you rent a car...,
every where we went  was very safe. People are ver friendly every where  we went ,The 2 time we went to Palenque we really went back to see Monkeys in the wild   And the second time was even better than the first had a great time we hired a 10 year old kid GAVINO the was great he new all the history better than the First tour guy ,,We got from the tour company  this 10 year old kid showed us the. Pyramids like the palm of his hands and then GAVINO   took us to see Toucans in the wild  and Monkeys  was great.  The real deal you have to go see the pyramids  of Palenque if you are in Chiapas

312149119.name: Stunning!  A must see!
312149119.author: a TripAdvisor user
312149119.reviewBody: I really enjoyed visiting the Ruins ... so much history and such a beautiful location.  Loved the wildlife and howler monkeys along the way!  Would certainly go back.

310972225.name: Must visit those ruins!
310972225.author: a TripAdvisor user
310972225.reviewBody: If you visit the Peninsula you Must visit those ruins! Amazing place in the jungle!! We stayed only night but if i had time, i would easily stay for a second one as well!

310319175.name: Best  ruins  ever
310319175.author: a TripAdvisor user
310319175.reviewBody: A must if in the area.  Large buildings, jungles, and amazing architecture.\n\nA guide  is a must.  As well as sunscreen and bug repelent.

307756777.name: Beautiful ruins of mayan history
307756777.author: a TripAdvisor user
307756777.reviewBody: Huge area of 1400 old mayan buildings, around 20 of those are dug out and restored somewhat so you can walk around and see. Houses, temples, tombs are things you can see here

307599394.name: Day tour from San Cristobal to Palenque and back - bad tour but ruins were amazing
307599394.author: a TripAdvisor user
307599394.reviewBody:
I booked the day tour with company called Agencia de Viajes Trotamundos II in San Cristobal. I DO NOT RECOMMEND YOU USING THIS COMPANY. 

Our driver showed up 2 hours late in the morning (they're supposed to pick you up around 5am), rushed us through Agua Azul and Misol-Ha not giving us the promised time. Palenque ruins itself are absolutely amazing. Ruins weren't crowded, you can climb and go in the ruins, too. Day was hot, so bring water. One of the guides was kind enough to show us monkeys, even though we weren't on his tour or paying customers. He gave us also some information about the ruins and told about the diggings and findings of the ruins still under the ground. 
Our driver showed up late to pick us up from the ruins, then he decided not to drive back to San Cristobal and dropped me in the middle of the swamp to "wait for another ride back". I was the only one from our tour returning back. Fair enough, another van pulled up in 10 minutes. In San Cristobal the driver had no idea where my hostel was (I had paid to get back to where I started from) and he tried to drop me off on the other side of the city. He didn't speak english nor I spanish so we had no common language to communicate. Finally I managed to get through to him and he dropped me off close to my hostel. The tour wasn't what we were promised to, so I went back to the office where I booked it. With a fair complaint I was able to get half my money back for the nightmare of the day, that was supposed to be a nice and relaxing day. 

Lesson learned: use companies with good reviews, usually the hostels and hotels have deals with reliable tour operators. 

Ruins visited at the end of August 2015.

307553175.name: The #1 on Chiapas
307553175.author: a TripAdvisor user
307553175.reviewBody: Its the top Maya Ruins in Chiapas!!...its a large complex and many pyramis to go upstairs,increible views ,highgly recommended to hire a local guide ,he will explain many details in the monuments and his history, you will appre iate more the ruins and the things happened ther many centuries ago!!!

306827389.name: private ruins
306827389.author: a TripAdvisor user
306827389.reviewBody: Amazing ruins which you can climb. I was there at the end of August and I had the place practically for myself!

306766905.name: One of the Best Mayan site in South Mexico
306766905.author: a TripAdvisor user
306766905.reviewBody: Cannot miss this beautiful Mayan archaeological site in the middle of the Jungle. The site is very easy to reach from the city of Palenque with some private bus with as little as 30 pesos, and after an entrance fee of 60 pesos you can finally visit the place. Temples are in very good conditions considering their history, and it was one of the biggest Mayan cultural center. Take your time to visit it, and when finished, ask to the guide or to some people to indicate you one of the many waterfalls around the site to have a refreshing swim. ;)

306721198.name: FABULOUS
306721198.author: a TripAdvisor user
306721198.reviewBody: My Maya guide Roberxel (pronounced robershell, not sure of spelling) was a real treat, happy to explain the local history of his remarkable ancestors who built this incredible city and its surroundings.  The ruins are spectacular, and many of the fragile features such as stucco masks are well protected against weather and vandalism.  If it\'s not on your bucket list, it should be.  After a tour of the ruins we went on a walk through the nearby forest, where the guide pointed out wildlife such as howler monkeys, useful plants, and a small river (unlike the Yucatan, the rivers here are above ground).  Some guides are trilingual-- Spanish, Maya, English.  Please don\'t look ignorant and insult them by suggesting that aliens built these cities!  After you see the ruins be sure to visit the excellent  museum at the park entrance.

305087885.name: Incredible
305087885.author: a TripAdvisor user
305087885.reviewBody: Everything you imagine \nit to be. Seriously though, go In the morning when it\'s cool. We went at 830am and hardly anyone was there and it was nice and cool temperatures. Fun to explore and take pictures. If you have been to Tikal, it is a very similar experience and just as great.

304814134.name: Amazing
304814134.author: a TripAdvisor user
304814134.reviewBody: These ruins blew my mind. Everybody talks about how great Chichen Itza is but that has nothing on the Palenque Ruins. Spent the first half of the day exploring the ruins. My tour guide was amazing and very informative. Best time to go early morning or late afternoon.

304100234.name: Must see!
304100234.author: a TripAdvisor user
304100234.reviewBody: This is definately a must see, the history behind every single building here is amazing. I suggest you take a guide at least once and explore all you can. Be prepared with some water and proper clothes to walk and hike up the ruins. On your way out there is a small waterfall to freshen up.

302408996.name: Exceptional.
302408996.author: a TripAdvisor user
302408996.reviewBody: Fantastic visit. Went right at opening at 8 am on a week day and was almost by myself for 90 minutes. On subday it is free for mexicans and residents like me so you will have more visitors. The grand palace is fascinating as you stroll through the different rooms. There is the bathroom, bedrooms, even the toilet.... The setting in th jungle is beautiful. Great views also from the top of the piramides you can climb. The one behind the juego de pelota allowas for views very far away on the jungle. Dont miss the walk in the forest to reach more temples and the museum. Was there in August and it was very hot. Bring water...

302299835.name: do not miss these ruins!
302299835.author: a TripAdvisor user
302299835.reviewBody: Simply breathtaking and unbelievably preserved! I enjoyed chitzen Itza but the palenque ruins coupled with the museum are better in my opinion. Take the trail through the jungle back to the main road and the museum, you\'ll love the wooden bridge and the scenery!

301982832.name: Mind blown!!
301982832.author: a TripAdvisor user
301982832.reviewBody: Amazing, amazing, amazing!!!! \nBest experience walking though the ruins. We also took a tour through the jungle and saw toucans, howler monkeys and some other amazing birds. \nDefinitely a must see!!

301592983.name: Off the normal route, but a great destination in Chiapas!
301592983.author: a TripAdvisor user
301592983.reviewBody: I\'ve visited the Yucatan twice and on the second time I finally made it to Chiapas (highly recommend renting a car!) to Palenque, Misol Ha, and Agua Azule.  Palengue reminds me of Tikal in Guatemala...secluded, hidden deep in the jungle, and there is still so much more to be excavated!  We took a guided tour from a local that was strenuous, but proved to be very rewarding.  We hiked to hidden Mayan pools and lots of ruins that had their tops sticking out of the jungle, but had yet to be excavated.  We were in Palenque in Jan and it was very rainy (off and on) so be prepared for the rain!

299109695.name: Very enjoyable and interesting
299109695.author: a TripAdvisor user
299109695.reviewBody: Very interesting and well preserved ruins. Take a guide to understand what you are seeing. Climb to the top of the last temple for a breathtaking view.

297894062.name: Great ruins in the jungle
297894062.author: a TripAdvisor user
297894062.reviewBody: After visiting Chichen Itza the Palenque ruins were a nice change of scenery. Very much in the forest but still awe inspiring. We went in the morning and got there before most of the crowds.

297015502.name: Wild ruins
297015502.author: a TripAdvisor user
297015502.reviewBody:
I love the setup. I have seen many ruins before mostly in Mexico. This one is the best so far. The jungle around the ruins. Green, wild and tall trees on and around the ruins, adds a great contrast. It's fascinating to read that this place was undiscovered or lost for so many years before it got discovered recently.

The Mexican archealogist who spend big about of his life discovering ruins and researching on the ruins right got the best place in the park. His tomb is resting just after you enter the park from the top entrance.

I am so glad that the Museum and the descriptions in the park have English texts. I learned due to the availability in the English language information at various places in the park.

I think guide would have been best but I arrived at the park much before they opened (at 8am), and I was the first person on a Saturday morning to buy ticket and enter the park. I was just me and one other visitor with bunch of vendors in the park. I got a good vantage points and solitude in the park. As I said, I loved the setup of the park. 

This is the best site to visit in Chiapas. I felt it is bigger than the the other sites I have visited in the North. So I am excited about the Mayan sites down south in Guatemala and other places. I hear they are big and much fascinating than Palenque.

My favourite place in the park is the Palace and Temple of Inscriptions. The palace seems very grand and well built. Reading the details and browsing through the ruins, it seems this place was a big settlement at its peak. What's more fascinating is that archeologists have discovered only 10% of the actual Palenque. There is so much discover and explore.

It's just amazingly mysterious ruins. I am curious to know if they would discover something more in the near future.

Best time to visit early in the morning. The park opens at 8am. Start from the top, and walk down as you are browsing the ruins. Do the museum at the end. There are many artifacts saved in the museum that was discovered in the ruins.

295679122.name: Historical Landmark
295679122.author: a TripAdvisor user
295679122.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place to visit\u2026.and I mean BEAUTIFUL, full of history. Get a guide, they are very knowledgeable, otherwise you won\'t know what you are seeing

295430926.name: Phenomenal place!!
295430926.author: a TripAdvisor user
295430926.reviewBody: This is an amazing place! The drive is a little long and with many windy roads. Also, I recommend going in a tour rather than renting your own vehicle. I am not for group tours because I prefer the privacy and my own tie dmanagement, but in Chiapas, there are many warnings about traveling on the road along especially at night. None the less, this place is magical!!! Also, get a professional tour guide, they charge somewhere between 400-600 pesos I think.

294920226.name: Spectacular Jungle Ruins
294920226.author: a TripAdvisor user
294920226.reviewBody: The Ruins of Palenque just cannot be compared to that of Uxmal and Chichen Itza because each has its own beauty. Unlike the other two, these are found in dense vegetation/jungle region of Mexico. Our tour guide was very informative, not just from a historical point of view, but also from a natural and wildlife aspect. We were able to see the type of plant (indigenous to the region) which produced the first ink/dye that was used by the mint to print US Dollars in the past!\nAs you can see the ruins, temples and palace are all picturesque in the background vegetation. Heat is somewhat sweltering and be warned it is humid! However this in no way takes away from the beauty that is right in front of you! \nDo be sure however to take lots of drinking water with you here and also while staying in the town center of Palenque! The water may not be potable!

294748215.name: What an amazing site
294748215.author: a TripAdvisor user
294748215.reviewBody: Spent the day wandering through the site.  Really enjoyed the ruins and the trees. We discovered that you don\'t need to do a tour. We picked up a collectivo in town for 20 pesos per person. We got to the site, found a map and headed out on our own. All the signs are in both Spanish and English. Occasionally we\'d run into a tour group and if we wanted to know more we\'d ease drop! The steps are treacherous so come prepared, in a good pair of shoes, to climb!  We were lucky there was a nice breeze the day we went, as it is usually hot and humid. Our only regret is to see the vendors on site. The paths around the park are lined with people selling cheap trinkets. We can\'t understand why they allow vendors into a world heritage site. They spoil the beauty of the park!

294183169.name: Wow - really felt you were going back in time
294183169.author: a TripAdvisor user
294183169.reviewBody: This place deserves the hype it gets. Really enjoyed both the scale of the place and the accessibility you don\'t get elsewhere. In all honesty didn\'t do it it justice as we were all knackered long before we had seen it all and didn\'t get to the much recommended museum on site. Take your time, do your homework and take it all in as this is a special place which you probably won\'t be going past again soon.

294158053.name: Beautiful Ruins
294158053.author: a TripAdvisor user
294158053.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many ruins and even though these are small compared to others they are still breathtaking.  There are still several you can climb that have not been closed off yet.  The jungle is amazing.  From the top you get amazing views.  Make sure to get there early because the humidity gets pretty gross.

293929397.name: Great Guide, Worthwhile Visit
293929397.author: a TripAdvisor user
293929397.reviewBody: If you like archeological sites, this is for you.  A great number of restored areas within the park, some very unusual.  We used a guide, "Edgar" who was delightful.  Guides can obtain passes without standing in line, so, if you are in a hurry, this is for you.

293870944.name: To really enjoy it go early
293870944.author: a TripAdvisor user
293870944.reviewBody: We went to the Palenque ruins and loved it. I think the best way is to get up early, have breakfast at 7, and get to the ruins at 8am when they open. We contracted a local guide outside the park entrance and were very happy with his sharing of the history of the site and the Mayan people. By getting there early you can get all the photos you want without the mobs of people which will arrive in a couple of hours. We toured the ruins for 3 1/2 hours and feel like we saw just about everything we could, and left before it got too  crowded and hot. After the ruins we went to the museum which was also very interesting and will take 45 min or so. Highly recommended place to see

293504896.name: Amazing Jungle Ruins
293504896.author: a TripAdvisor user
293504896.reviewBody: My favourite of all the Mayan ruins. I come back almost yearly, and stay for a week or so. There\'s always more to see and explore! Stunning, lush, jungle-enshrouded beauty. An incredible place.

293029159.name: Beautiful and special place.
293029159.author: a TripAdvisor user
293029159.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning! An incredible range of structures in a very beautiful jungle setting. Unlike many of the other ruins in Mexico, you can really imagine people living here. Would have loved to visit the museum, but it\'s closed on Mondays

292803946.name: Worth a visit
292803946.author: a TripAdvisor user
292803946.reviewBody: The ruins are very nice and deserve a visit. Please go early as it gets very busy, bring sunscreen and good walking shoes to make your visit more fun. The park opens before 8 so arrive earlier.

291790492.name: A must see when in Palenque
291790492.author: a TripAdvisor user
291790492.reviewBody:
The ruins are definitely worth a visit, super interesting. Make sure you get a guide, you can get one outside, or when entering by car. The official ones are expensive, we got a 2 language ( English and Spanish ) guide for almost one third of the official price, and he was excellent. Sadly, I do not remember his name, a gentleman in his 60s. 

I have visited several ruins in Mexico, and they never stop to amaze me, the things the were able to build 1000 years ago is amazing.

Bring sunscreen, it is VERY hot there.

291497316.name: Nice and best
291497316.author: a TripAdvisor user
291497316.reviewBody: Great, in the jungle,\nthe most beautiful ruins compared to all others, palenque is magic.\nIn the jungle, with rivers, really enjoyed

291392982.name: The power of history
291392982.author: a TripAdvisor user
291392982.reviewBody: M\u00e9xico has a total of 33 sites inscribed in Unesco World Heritage list, and Palenque was chronologically the fourth to be included in 1987. I\u2019ve been in most of the other archaeological sites, but Palenque remains one of my favourites and I am willing to go back many times, as I did with Tikal, which has some similarities. Both are in the middle of a lush forest where you can walk a number of trails with the feeling you are still discovering. Building are just magnificent and very well preserved.  It is a pity that you can no longer visit the tomb of King Pakal II, you are not even allowed to go up the Palace of Inscriptions, but there is plenty more to visit. Any description would be too short to describe the Palenque pre-hispanic city. Just don\u2019t miss it. One thing I did not like is the complicity between some tour operators and the guards of the Comisi\u00f3n Nacional de Areas Naturales Protegidas (CONANP) at the entrance of the park, who do not provide any receipt for the 30.5 Mexican pesos they get from every visitor. Clearly they are cheating with money that should go to the institution.

291318946.name: Beautiful Site
291318946.author: a TripAdvisor user
291318946.reviewBody: Traveled here in 2009 when they were in the middle of excavations. Incredible ruins and history. I later read up on the incredible discoveries they\'ve made there since and hope to go back! Beautiful area of Southern Mexico.

290156149.name: A must-see!!
290156149.author: a TripAdvisor user
290156149.reviewBody: One of the most awesome and incredible maya cities! The site is pristine, the information available is sufficient and well placed, and you can even find a good choice on handicrafts

289090157.name: Ruinas, the must in the South of Mexico
289090157.author: a TripAdvisor user
289090157.reviewBody: Very nice ruines to be visited in Mexico. The site is more interesting than the others from the Yucatan due to his size and the ambiance between \'temples\'.

287067160.name: Amazing ruins ruined by the commercialization
287067160.author: a TripAdvisor user
287067160.reviewBody:
I wish I could give it a 5.  The ruins are 5 star for sure.  Unfortunately, the core of the ruins are tainted and over-crowded by the street vendors.  The park needs to control the souvenir vendors inside the park, right in the center of the ruins.  The vendors that sell the noisy howler monkey sound players are especially aggressive and overtake the otherwise amazing beauty and peaceful scenery.  It is absolutely unnecessary to have souvenir vendors inside the park!

Don't get me - the park is definitely worth visiting.  Overcrowding however is definitely a major issue.  

Tips for visiting: 
- Get there early before the crowds.
- Do not miss the museum - where all the real treasures lie!
- For museum visit, it is definitely riding the collectivo back to the park, as it is a long and hot uphill walk.  
- The same entrance ticket allows you to leave the park and go back in.
- Be sure to have with you insect repellent.

286733892.name: Fantastic
286733892.author: a TripAdvisor user
286733892.reviewBody: We loved the ruins at Palenque. Had previously been to Tulum ruins, which we found to be too busy, with not enough information and not very big.\nPalenque was the opposite - although there were people around, it didn\'t feel crowded, we took around 4 hours to walk around, up and down all the ruins and spent time reading the information on the signs around. Very impressed, would recommend! Make sure you go early in the day if you are there in summer like we were, it gets hot!

285839940.name: Amazing!
285839940.author: a TripAdvisor user
285839940.reviewBody: An amazing collection of ancient ruins and a must in your travel to Southeast Mexico. Bring sunblock lotion and enough memory for your camera.

284520072.name: I\'ve never been so impressed..
284520072.author: a TripAdvisor user
284520072.reviewBody: It was quite impressive! It was worthy to travel all the way there. No regret. Better than Ch- Itza.

284192421.name: Great ruins.
284192421.author: a TripAdvisor user
284192421.reviewBody: If we\'d known in advance we wouldn\'t have paid  200 pesos per person to go, we would have taken the mini van which go very frequently and saved a lot, but hindsight is a wonderful thing. The ruins were great with all the signs in English which was very helpful. The setting and upkeep are great although the sellers can be a bit annoying. Easily spent 3 hours wandering around.

283947266.name: Palenque
283947266.author: a TripAdvisor user
283947266.reviewBody: Get there early!!    Once the tour busses arrive, there will be people everywhere; forget photos of the ruins w/out  them in the picture.   Howler monkeys  roaring in the distance,  humidity fog rising from the river -  it\'s magical -   early in the day !!\n\nIt\'s a small site -  not like Chichen Itza -  but for me,  more memorable.

282475466.name: Wanted to see this place for so long - didn\'t disappoint!!
282475466.author: a TripAdvisor user
282475466.reviewBody: Amazingly impressive.  Of all the things we saw in our tour of Mexico this was the one I desperately wanted to see.  It surpassed expectations.  And as a bonus not very busy.  Lots to see - too much to mention for a short review.  Just go there!  Saw hummingbirds and toucans fly past, and heard the howler monkeys in the trees.  Also great little market outside the ruins.

282182473.name: Impressive
282182473.author: a TripAdvisor user
282182473.reviewBody: The complex of the ruins is impressive. I found most of the ruins in good shape. I would go in low season, like I did, because I find it to be a better experience if there are not a lot of tourists.

281499166.name: Land of kings
281499166.author: a TripAdvisor user
281499166.reviewBody: As youvwalk from the entrance up towards the complex through the jungle clearing you arrive to the sight of incredible burial complex pyramid as if spring up out of the ground at time of visit was unable to go down and into the kings tomb but the whole complex will amaze your senses. If in palenque the site is a most go see

281037687.name: Magical!
281037687.author: a TripAdvisor user
281037687.reviewBody: The archeological site of Palenque is well worth a visit. The location in the lush, green jungle makes for a serene and mystical atmosphere.The mayan arcitecture is exquisite and a stream meanders it\'s way through this beautiful setting.

279195408.name: Great ruins, come here!
279195408.author: a TripAdvisor user
279195408.reviewBody: This site was a surprise, there is many to explore and lots to see.\nWe stood 3h at the site and we had a guide who explained everything

279114572.name: Best place in Mexico
279114572.author: a TripAdvisor user
279114572.reviewBody: This is my favorite place in Mexico, better than Chichen Itza, very well conserved, it makes you feel you that they are still working as in its time, all green around it, beautiful!, you can spend all day here if you go by your own, I would recomend to do it alone if you have time otherwise a tour would be ok but your time will be limited.

278514733.name: Must see if in the area
278514733.author: a TripAdvisor user
278514733.reviewBody: This site is spectacular. The restoration work is first rate. I recommend hiring a private guia for a personalized tour. A guide can offer much deeper insight to the layman tourist. The guides are expensive by Mexican standards but ours was well worth the money.

277947595.name: More than excellent...superb
277947595.author: a TripAdvisor user
277947595.reviewBody: Palenque is a must. By all means hire a guide, but you can spend all day just wandering around these fabulous buildings by yourself. Buy a hat at the gate (US$2) and drink plenty of water. Maybe take a few sandwiches with you. Read up about the ruins before you go and everything will come to life.

277543883.name: Best ruins we visited
277543883.author: a TripAdvisor user
277543883.reviewBody: Must visit! We could\'ve spent a whole day walking through all the ruins.  These were by far our favorite ruins of the whole trip considering we went to Teotihucan, Chichen Itza, and Tulum.

277087509.name: The most beautiful archeological site in Mexico
277087509.author: a TripAdvisor user
277087509.reviewBody: Better than Chichen Itza, this place is set in the jungle making it a perfect place for pictures. The palace can be explored inside and some pyramids are still half overgrown by the junge. There\'s even a waterfall at the southern exit/entrance to the park. Very recommended!

276306993.name: Spectacular
276306993.author: a TripAdvisor user
276306993.reviewBody: One of the highlights of our Yucatan adventure. Far superior to Chichen Itza. Setting is dramatic and the ruins impressive. Our kids loved exploring and we took our time as it was really hot and humid. There are plenty of shady areas to rest. Bring plenty of water and insect repellent. We didn\'t get a guide as wanted to take it in at our own pace.

275549640.name: Totaly different experience
275549640.author: a TripAdvisor user
275549640.reviewBody: I was totaly amazed by what i saw. these pyramids are nothing like what you see in Teotihuacan with its buring sun. Here you can feel the nature all around you and imagine mayan live and spend their days in in pyramids, being great parlamanterians, architects, ball players etc. Liked the guide a lot. Thank you, Carlos

275332053.name: A Must SEE
275332053.author: a TripAdvisor user
275332053.reviewBody: If you are in the area you must see them - there are pyramids to climb if you are fit enough, as usual there are a lot of local traders to avoid.

275320800.name: Wonderful!
275320800.author: a TripAdvisor user
275320800.reviewBody: It took over 3 hours. The ruins/ pyramids were fantastic. We did it in the morning so it wasn\'t that hot. We stayed overnight in a place close to the ruins. You don\'t have enough time to see it all or to take all in with a day trip.

275163475.name: Awesome ruins
275163475.author: a TripAdvisor user
275163475.reviewBody: I went to a number of ruins in Mexico and these were some of my favourite. Be sure to hire a guide and walk through the jungle section.

274670703.name: amazing
274670703.author: a TripAdvisor user
274670703.reviewBody:
i recommend you to take a local guide to the hidden ruins. It is a walking tour that takes like one hour and a half. This tour is offered  a few steps from the entrance to the national park.

when you access to the discovered ruins, take a certified guide, it worth it, ask for them on the front desk where you access de ruins.

on sunday you can access the national park and the ruins for free :D

274265985.name: Our favourite Mayan ruins in Mexico
274265985.author: a TripAdvisor user
274265985.reviewBody:
We caught a collectivo from the ADO bus terminal in Palenque to the ruins. M20 per person (pp) and it took approximately 7mins. 

We paid an entry fee M25pp for entry to the National Park and a further M64pp for entry to the ruins. 

We arrived just after 8am with very few tourist strolling around which was nice for taking photos. The grounds were amazing. Each temple or site was sign posted with information in English which meant we didn't require a guide. 

It took us about 2 1/2 hours to cover the ruins and a further hour at the museum (where we weren't required to pay an entry fee).

We hailed a collectivo from opposite the museum to take us back to town (M20pp).

If you can visit in the early morning we would highly recommend it to avoid the heat of the sun and to maximise photography opportunities.

273798009.name: Worth it in spite of the heat
273798009.author: a TripAdvisor user
273798009.reviewBody: We booked a tour through our lodging. I would suggest taking a taxi and touring with an official guide.  when I booked the tour, they neglected to tell us that the guide at the ruins was not included,  It is a extra $85. Worth the trouble but too little time there.\n\nThe tour included two waterfall features. They were interested but the sites are crowded and dirty..  I would have rather spent more time at Palenque.

273783318.name: Fantastic site to visit.
273783318.author: a TripAdvisor user
273783318.reviewBody: The area around the ruins was well maintained. I was excited to see Pakal\'s tomb with all the inscriptions and drawing on it in the museum.  I could climb the Temples without much difficulty. This site helped me understand more about how the people lived in past. There is much more land that has not been excavated as it is surrounded by jungle. The area is quite large there is a stream flowing through it that I would have loved to jump in, but I\'m happy they did not allow this to keep the area preserved.

271559433.name: AN obvious must do for a good reason
271559433.author: a TripAdvisor user
271559433.reviewBody: It\'s an awesome and big place. There are loads of excavated ruins with many informational boards. You can walk/run up most of the ruins and they stand perfectly for photos and general admiration. You can explore this place for hours! There are also many spots to buy souvenirs.\nBut please don\'t waste 1000 pesos on an expensive guide. Firstly, you can easily haggle them down to at least under 500. Secondly, there are loads of other guides walking around there already, just hook on to one of them. I managed to find a nice Australian couple and asked whether I could hook on to their tour. Most don\'t mind ;)

271024872.name: One of my favorite places in Latin America!
271024872.author: a TripAdvisor user
271024872.reviewBody: Palenque is among my absolute favorites! And I can say that after visiting 6 continents and seeing most of Latin America. The site is beautifully located in the middle of the jungle. Unlike in Chichen Itza or Uxmal, you can still climb all but one pyramids here. There quite a lot of tourists but still far less than in Chichen Itza. The site is not as grand as Chichen Itza but it\'s beautifully decorated. Build in the 8th century tall temples and a grand palace (with a very unique tower - not found in other Mesoamerican cities) are a must-see. Add to it the fact that the majority of the site is still covered with jungle and the Indiana Jones-type adventure becomes a right comparison for visiting this place. I planned to stay 3-4 hours, but ended up staying all day. Amazing!\nIt\'s far from major cities, but I took an ADO bus here (overnight from Merida) and then a taxi to the ruins from the city center (it was cheap).

270946277.name: Stay one night in Palenque to do it
270946277.author: a TripAdvisor user
270946277.reviewBody: The ruin itself is great, one of the best in Mexico. But as we are staying in San Cristobal de las Casas and will head to Xela afterwards, we took the cheaper choice of joining the day tour to Palenque.\n\nAlthough the tour stopped at Agua Azul and Misol Ha, we arrived at Palenque only around 3 pm. It made our visit very rush and we did not have enough time to visit the museum. If you want to have a better experience in Palenque instead of just going there to take a few pictures, it is better to stay one night in Palenque and then spend a whole day in the ruins.

270910650.name: Awesome
270910650.author: a TripAdvisor user
270910650.reviewBody: This is another must see archaeological site - well presented. With only 5% of the site restored it makes you wonder just how much more there is still to discover.\nWell worth a visit.

270757158.name: Extraordinary
270757158.author: a TripAdvisor user
270757158.reviewBody: The ruins captured my soul 20 years ago and they haven\'t lost it.  It was just as beautiful and magically powerful as I remembered.  I was disappointed that so many of the powerful spots were now of limits, but alas I allowed my memories to go where my feet couldn\'t.  The jungles around the site are spectacular and the sound of Howler monkeys will forever hold a spot in my heart.

270668785.name: The best ruins in Mexico
270668785.author: a TripAdvisor user
270668785.reviewBody: I was recommend by a friend to go to Palenque and I\'m so glad a did. I hired a guide at M$1000 it was well worth it. He was very informative on the area, history and surrounding jungle. \nYou can climb these ruins unlike at others such as tulum and chichen itza.

270472949.name: Palenque is Great!!!
270472949.author: a TripAdvisor user
270472949.reviewBody: I personally like this place a lot, take your time hire a personal guide.. who can spend the time with you and explain everything if you go with a big group forget it..  you will not learn anything

270220457.name: Sight to Experience
270220457.author: a TripAdvisor user
270220457.reviewBody: Amazing ruins, set in an amazing jungle!!! It is definitely a sight to be experienced, you get a sense of the great culture that built and inhabited this site.  You have an understanding by the architecture of how royalty had a special place and were well taken care of, protected and revered.  The jungle, the width in the trees is evidence of years of establishment and respect  they had for the Earth.

270173288.name: Simply wonderful
270173288.author: a TripAdvisor user
270173288.reviewBody:
We visited here as part of a 28 day Central America trip.

The Mayan site at Palenque, though less well known than some others, is still a wonderful, world class site. The ruins are majestic and wonderfully located in the dense forest. The site was relatively quiet, though very hot (+40C) on the day we visited, so the abundance of shade was very welcome. 

Just wonderful.

270071809.name: If you only do one set of ruins - this is it
270071809.author: a TripAdvisor user
270071809.reviewBody: The setting of haunting ruins against the backdrop of jungle and hills sets Palenque apart from the open starkness of most other Mexican historic sites. \n\nAvoiding the crowds (and a 14 hour bus trip comprising several things you do not want to do) is easily achieved by taking the ADO bus the day before and staying the night in Palenque town

269118957.name: Very interesting
269118957.author: a TripAdvisor user
269118957.reviewBody: The open space in very interesting but do not miss a walking trip into the surrounding woods. Nature walk and an opportunity to view the ruins covered by the jungle

268827914.name: Fantastic place
268827914.author: a TripAdvisor user
268827914.reviewBody: Beautiful ruinas in the selva forest. If you are lucky, you can hear the monkeys. Do not forget to visit on time the Museum after visiting the ruins. The section with the tomb of the Rei Pakal closes much earlier than the museum. The best transport to the ruins are the small collectivos from the round point in front of the Bus Station in Palenque.

268735391.name: Well worth the trip
268735391.author: a TripAdvisor user
268735391.reviewBody: I was visiting in Villahermosa and wanted to do some adventure and decided to go to Palenque Ruinas just for a day. We took the bus and drove to Palenque and there was these tour guides right outside offering round trip to the Ruinas and Cascadas (Waterfalls). the Ruinas are an amazing view and the once you get their there are tour guides for hire and they can explain the whole history of the Mayans. You don\'t really need them to explain everything but if you are in a big group then its definitely ok to have them there. otherwise as a couple you could just enjoy it together and reading the explanations.

268565688.name: One of the best days of life
268565688.author: a TripAdvisor user
268565688.reviewBody: I almost don\'t want to review this, because it\'s so good it will soon be over-run with tourists.... but go. Just go. I saw Palenque as part of the G Adventures "Mayan Discovery" tour, and it was one of the highlights of my trip. It\'s a very large site with lots to see, and I basically lived out all my childhood Indiana Jones fantasies climbing the ruins.

268077017.name: Beyond Imagination
268077017.author: a TripAdvisor user
268077017.reviewBody: This is a must see. Lots to see and explore, you are able to climb on and in the structures. \nDo get there early to avoid the hottest sun.

268065015.name: Best Mayan Site in Mexico
268065015.author: a TripAdvisor user
268065015.reviewBody: We visited quite a few Mayan sites during our stay in Mexico and this was the best (though Tulum is a close second). I think what made it was the surrounding jungle, it made it feel more atmospheric. The ruins themselves were well preserved and unlike Chichen Itza there were parts of it you could go into and climb up. Don\'t forget to bring plenty of insect repellent, and if you go down to see the waterfalls be prepared for a long uphill walk back up to the main site.

267833105.name: Unspoilt and beautiful
267833105.author: a TripAdvisor user
267833105.reviewBody: Impressive ruins you can climb up and wander freely around, but he best is the nine-tenths of the site that is still mostly buried.  As you walk through the lush jungle you stumble across other parts of other ruins hidden in the vegetation.  Peaceful atmosphere, beautiful setting, the most unspoilt I\'ve seen so far.

267387821.name: Very interesting!
267387821.author: a TripAdvisor user
267387821.reviewBody: The tours and the vendors are overated, the ruins are amazing;  The museum is interesting and the hit and humedity is high, I recomend early visits, Not apropiated for babies or toldders.

267241807.name: Brilliant ruins! Get there early for best light and it\'s quiet!
267241807.author: a TripAdvisor user
267241807.reviewBody:
I visited the ruins as soon as they opened, managed to get our tickets and be through the gate before 8am. The sun is still quite low so it lights up all the ruins facing the sun, which leaves a little jungle mist in the background! I spent about 2 hours there and not only is it quiet but it's cool enough to cope at that time. 

It's good to be able to get inside some of the ruins! Another bonus of getting there early is no sellers had there stalls set up so no one was selling to us. Bonus!

266028089.name: Absolutely worth the trip
266028089.author: a TripAdvisor user
266028089.reviewBody: If I had to choose, I would visit Palenque instead of Chichen Itza or the others. Because of its jungle setting. I took us from 8 till 4pm including the nice museum. We did see the more remote jungle temples too, where there are almost no tourists.

265955960.name: How long to visit Palenque Ruins
265955960.author: a TripAdvisor user
265955960.reviewBody: If you are not taking a tour and have a choice, get there early in the morning to avoid the intense heat and humidity. The ruins open at 8 AM and the share buses (20 peso) run in the morning also. If you are considering a tour of the ruins + the waterfalls, do so. Seeing the ruins in the morning, then going to the waterfalls in the afternoon is well timed. Take water with you, there are some vendors in the ruins, but they are only selling trinkets. Expect to visit the ruins for about 2 hours, more if you like climbing over everything. You can crawl around and through most of the ruins so they are super fun if you love exploring. As a bonus photographic hint, don\'t get excited and start snapping photos when you first get in. If it\'s the morning and you came in the top (main) entrance, the sun will be the wrong directions. Walk in a ways, turn around, and then take photos.

265573783.name: A beautiful place
265573783.author: a TripAdvisor user
265573783.reviewBody: The ruins here are definitely worth the long drive from wherever you\'re coming from. They are both more wild and more accessible than those at Chichen Itza and even Uxmal. The architecture and grounds are quite beautiful. You can go into several structures, and get a feeling of what it might have been like a few hundred years ago.

265170335.name: Fabulous
265170335.author: a TripAdvisor user
265170335.reviewBody: These ruins are absolutely amazing - a must see\nHou need plent of time to observe and explore the ruins

265100085.name: My favorite ruins in the world
265100085.author: a TripAdvisor user
265100085.reviewBody: Okay, maybe it is a three way tie with Siem Reap and Machu Picchu, but Palenque feels hidden away and secret.  MP and Siem Reap were covered in tourists, and when I visited Palenque I felt like I was there on a secret mission because I hardly came across anyone else.  I loved the fact that it is surrounded by jungle and that you can climb on the temples and take pictures to your heart\'s content.

264208871.name: Totally worth the trip!
264208871.author: a TripAdvisor user
264208871.reviewBody: Our "first" Mayan ruin and we were not disappointed. We had a good guide, which probably helped with the details.

263869493.name: Fantastic Time Travel...
263869493.author: a TripAdvisor user
263869493.reviewBody: Awesome place for those of us that love history and are interested to learn how the ancient people used to live. I recommend to hire a tourist guide that has knowledge of the jungle and the ruins. Both tours are incredible nice. Make sure to drink water from the natural source, it is just great!!.

263268092.name: Our first contact
263268092.author: a TripAdvisor user
263268092.reviewBody: with one of the renowned Maya ruins. It was a misty and rainy day. After negotiating we finally  hired a guide who turned out to be about our age and helped us to facilitate the visit by selecting the easiest possible accesses. He was most informative and helpful. Not only about the Maya way of life but also the surrounding vegetation, animal, bird and eco system, not to mention the howling monkeys. A recommended way to visit the site. Once on our own we visited the small museum on the way out.

262545260.name: Dense jungle & ruins
262545260.author: a TripAdvisor user
262545260.reviewBody: Get there at opening (0800) and find yourself having the ruins (nearly) to yourself.  They are in a league of their own - Classic Maya, set in thick jungle and in a hilly and compact scale.  Go in the entrance and dont back track - rather follow the path out towards the North and the site museum.  The museum too is worth a visit. We did both the ruins and the museum in 3 hours. No guide , just a very good book to explain what each building or ruin was.\nTake very comfortable shoes, with good grips (as the steps were a bit slippery).

262435744.name: Well maintained place to visit
262435744.author: a TripAdvisor user
262435744.reviewBody: We were one of the first to arrive at the ruins so we had them to ourselves for a while which was magical. There is plenty of shade and you can visit them on your own without a guide very easily. The area is beautifully maintained and this is definitely a site worth visiting.

262400039.name: Fascinating
262400039.author: a TripAdvisor user
262400039.reviewBody: In a wonderful jungle setting, very atmospheric. We also did an optional jungle walk where we realised that we were walking over buried pyramids. Very highly recommended.

262286927.name: Incredible !
262286927.author: a TripAdvisor user
262286927.reviewBody:
Having looked forward to this visit for years, I was reassured in my belief, that this is one of the beautiful places in earth.

Mythical, as it appears out of the jungle and you really feel the wings of history, when you wander around and walk up some of the pyramids.

The museum close by is excellent.

262265096.name: Fairly compact ruins in the middle of the jungle.
262265096.author: a TripAdvisor user
262265096.reviewBody: Small enough to get a good feel for within a few hours and set in the jungle so some interesting wildlife and birdwatching. We were treated to an awesome display by 2 groups of howler monkeys and spotted 2 toucans!

261992355.name: Simply amazing!
261992355.author: a TripAdvisor user
261992355.reviewBody: You would not be disappointed visiting these ruins, they are simply amazing.....it can get quite hot here so bring some water, there are many stands outside the ruins to buy drinks and food, the toilets are free but you have to pay for the toilet paper so take your own. If you are staying in or around Palenque to catch the public transport or van cost 20 peso but be careful some tend to try and rip tourist off....El panchan is a really nice place to stay close to the ruins, actually right outside the National Park toll booth thing with many different accommodations for diffrent types of travellers. All in All is sooo worth visiting!!!

261980636.name: Paradise!!
261980636.author: a TripAdvisor user
261980636.reviewBody: We have been to Palenque in the past and we couldn\'t wait to return this time and we will definitely return again in the future. This site is paradise with ancient ruins and the beauty of the jungles of Chiapas. We saw parrots and spider monkeys and howler monkeys and the most amazing huge old trees and lovely flowers and waterfall. We never get tired of this place as each time we return it has new experiences to delight us. Last time we heard the howler monkeys in the distance but this time we saw them in the trees just above our heads and they serenaded us with a cacophony of roars unlike anything I have ever heard before. The word loud doesn\'t do justice to the volume they can reach. The beauty of the flocks of parrots that fly throughout the site is impressive and the ancient structures in the main site and in the jungle are absolutely magnificent. There is also a museum to explore that has some incredible relics and a very realistic replica of Pacal\'s sarcophagus. This site is open daily from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. and there are facilities on site and food at both the museum and upper parking lot. There are also plenty of little stores for shopping. The price is currently 64 pesos to enter the site plus parking if you have a car.

261774726.name: Beautiful ruins flanked by jungle
261774726.author: a TripAdvisor user
261774726.reviewBody: The jungle setting of Palenque adds to its charm... howler monkeys roaring in the background, toucans and macaws flying overhead... it\'s a magical place.

261011473.name: Misty mystery in the jungle
261011473.author: a TripAdvisor user
261011473.reviewBody: Like most of the major sites in Mexico Palenque gets crowded by mid-morning, so the earlier you go the better; you also get much more out of it if you have a good guide. The weather is often damp and misty (unusual for Mexico in the dry season), but this adds to the atmosphere of the site, which is much more enclosed and limited in space than most. A thorough visit takes about three hours.\nAs a further point - if you can, stay at Quinta Cha Nab Nal, about two miles from the site, and one the most superb hotels we have ever stayed at (see separate review)

260940363.name: One of the best of the Mayan ruins.
260940363.author: a TripAdvisor user
260940363.reviewBody: There are hundreds of Mayan ruins scattered throughout the Yucatan (and east), and Palenque is one of the best.  It has some of the most elaborate pyramids and temples and is set in an absolutely sylvan setting.

260869019.name: Go early
260869019.author: a TripAdvisor user
260869019.reviewBody: Palenque ruins are one of the true musts in Mexico. The templo de la inscripciones is one of the finest mayan temples in the world. In Mexico city there is an interesting recreation of Pakal\'s tomb. There are hords of tourists so make sure to go early.

260721739.name: One of the Mayan must-see sites
260721739.author: a TripAdvisor user
260721739.reviewBody: No overview of Mayan culture is complete without a visit to this city. It is of the Classic Period, and went into decline about 800 AD. Only about five percent has been excavated, so there are many more treasures awaiting discovery. The contents of the principal tomb here, that of Pacal the Great, who died in 683, have been moved to Mexico City. It is odd to be sitting on the lowest steps of another vast pyramid that is totally covered, knowing that there must be fabulous things under the soil and trees. Come in the morning when the heat is most manageable.\nJohn Scherber\nAuthor of Into the Heart of Mexico

260362224.name: Understanding the Mayan Culture
260362224.author: a TripAdvisor user
260362224.reviewBody: The Palemque archeological site is an extraordinary example of the history of the Mayan people in Mexico. Palenque is the cornerstone of travels in the state of Chiapas to help explain the links between historical and current people and cultures in this wonderful state. Palenque allows you to "live" this rich and important historical experience.\n\nPlan to walk and climb, listen and learn. Take a guide who knows the history and can explain it to you, don\'t just wander the site. There is much to learn and experience.

260237597.name: Spend an amazing day at Palenque ruins
260237597.author: a TripAdvisor user
260237597.reviewBody: We paid a fee to enter the park, then we parked our car at the museum (don\'t miss that) where we paid the entrance fee to the ruins. Not far up the road from the museum, on LHS, is a pedestrian entrance to the ruins.  We walked up through the  beautiful jungle past the smaller structures, across clear streams and cascades, to the main site which is breathtaking. We spent several hours exploring the various temples and palace. The views from the top were wonderful and the sound of the howler monkeys added to the experience.  Take food and water - the many hawkers inside the site sell souvenirs but not refreshments.

259847367.name: Better than Chichen Itza
259847367.author: a TripAdvisor user
259847367.reviewBody: Tour is not necessary. the map is fairly self-explanatory. You can walk through the palace going into tunnel in the palace as well and you can climb almost every temple except the first few when you enter

259653737.name: One of the Best
259653737.author: a TripAdvisor user
259653737.reviewBody:
Mexico does its ruins well and Palenque is no exception.  This is actually one of the best Maya ruins we've visited and completes our circuit of the major Maya ruins.

The reconstructions are well done and, as always in Mexico, the signage is complete and very useful.  The place was generally quite clean and tidy.  The only annoyance was a large number of vendors lining a few of the pathways but at least they were respectful and didn't accost the visitors.

If you go, don't exit by the way you entered.  Rather, follow the signs to the cascades and the museum for a very interesting walk through the jungle (on well prepared pathways) following a couple of small creeks and passing more ruins, to the museum.  Very interesting and I would bet less than 2% of visitors get to experience this worthwhile walk.

259619634.name: "Never gets old"
259619634.author: a TripAdvisor user
259619634.reviewBody: Some years back we had scaled the ruins of Palenque and had a great time! This time we were even more impressed and they have added the excavated Red Queens Tomb. We were able to find ruins that we hadn\' t seen last time! What an amazing experience! A must see if you are visiting the state of Chiapas, Mexico.

259537280.name: Better than Chitzen Itza
259537280.author: a TripAdvisor user
259537280.reviewBody: Hidden in the jungle you\'ll find numerous of ancient remains of the Maya\'s. I am not sure for how long you can climb the ruins, to me it seems quite harmful for the buildings, but the fact that you can do it is so amazing. You can even visit the tomb of the Red Queen! Or hike the beautiful surroundings. Don\'t get scared by the sounds of the howler monkeys though :)

259502839.name: SPEECHLESS!
259502839.author: a TripAdvisor user
259502839.reviewBody: It was an amazing and beautiful! The history of the ruins and the environment are astonishing. I would recommend getting the unofficial guide instead of the official guide which charge you 3 times more, when in reality the information that guides know is the same. Overall it was a unique expeirence. I would go again.

259496030.name: Amazing Mayan ruins
259496030.author: a TripAdvisor user
259496030.reviewBody: The ruins are located high on a mountain but worth the trip if you are even close. There are rumors that some Mexican ruins may be closed either partially or completely due to damage from visitors. Although Palenque is not as large as Chitzen Itza, it is clean and well preserved. We climbed up to the temple, which has fabulous views. Although you don\'t need to be athletic, there is a good deal of walking and many steps to see the sights. Try to walk back to the tourist center through the jungle. It is beautiful and downhill all the way.

259276058.name: Fantastic
259276058.author: a TripAdvisor user
259276058.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this site, even though we were a little short of time at the end of the day! Restoration is only partial, allowing you the comparison. You also get a chance to go inside a burial chamber.

258797609.name: After many visits still enjoyable
258797609.author: a TripAdvisor user
258797609.reviewBody: This marks my fourth time to Palenque, but the first in over twenty years and the first with my wife and family. It remains a great site and has not changed considerably over the last twenty years, except for more tourists and more hawkers. The one thing that they do here that is not allowed in most other archaeological sites is to let the vendors inside the archaeological site and that certainly diminishes the splendor that you would otherwise experience. The other thing that has changed is that they do not let you climb the Temple of Inscriptions or enter the tomb of Pakal any more. I suppose just too many tourists now. This is all the more reason that you need to visit the museum that you pass as you drive toward the site. The museum has built a replica of the tomb of Pakal with his carved sarcophagus lid in place (probably the single most iconic monument in the Maya world) also check out the superb ceramic, incense burners. One thing I missed was seeing a replica of the famous jade Pakal death mask (original is in the Anthropology Museum in Mexico City).

258697861.name: Amazing ruins and worth the visit, don\'t forget the museum
258697861.author: a TripAdvisor user
258697861.reviewBody: You will need lots of time and it is essential to have a guide to not only show you around but to tell you of the history. Don\'t forget to visit the museum at the ruins entrance as it is worth while to visit.

258392336.name: Lifetime\'s ambition achieved for my husband
258392336.author: a TripAdvisor user
258392336.reviewBody: Mind blowing!  Wonderful, wonderful place.   It will surpass your expectations!   If you want to visit the museum - which is excellent - on the same day, make sure you don\'t go on a Monday, as the museum is closed that day.

257873768.name: Well worth the trip. The site truly inspires awe
257873768.author: a TripAdvisor user
257873768.reviewBody: We were struck by the beauty of this site. We have visited well over 100 UNESCO sites in 5 continents and this was just amazing. Arrive early and take the time just to site and absorb the atmosphere. The physical setting rivals Ankor Wat, Tikal and Machu Pichu (if you do the trail). Because it is difficult for many to get to it is best combined with other Mayan sites in Mexico, Guatemala and Belize.\nSite is lovingly kept clean, as were all Mayan sites we have seen.

257742805.name: Give yourself ample time & get a guide
257742805.author: a TripAdvisor user
257742805.reviewBody: The ruins are easy to get to and there is a lot to see.  Guides are available (some speak English) and will be able to explain what you\'re looking at.  There is a market where you can get souvenirs, but look for the ones that make the stuff they sell.\n\nTip: Don\'t go with the first guide that comes up to you. Shop around & grab a map.

257129665.name: The Mayans were truly of another planet
257129665.author: a TripAdvisor user
257129665.reviewBody: The complexity, aloof beauty and otherworldliness a must see. Watch out for the plethora of \'guides\' at the entry - if you can read spanish or english you don\'t need them, buy your ticket and continue to the sites yourself.  It\'s a full day if you are trying to see all the ruins and the museum. I found the minor temples to be more intimate but as interesting and mysterious as the \'main area\' so walts through the upper and lower sections! \n\nReduced by one star because vendors are allowed to sell very poor touristic reproductions on the site (mostly behind and around the Palace in the main plaza.)  And the general touristic attitude that prevails here at the entry (and elsewhere in Palenque) is a turn-off.

256987539.name: Loads to see, with great access
256987539.author: a TripAdvisor user
256987539.reviewBody: So many buildings to see, temples and domiciles. Beautifully maintained public areas. Waterfalls. Museum. Jungle walk. Enoughfor many hours education and entertainment.

256818533.name: Need to come back!
256818533.author: a TripAdvisor user
256818533.reviewBody: Definitely get a guide....needed more time to explore.  We have seen many pyramids, these being one of our favorites!

256577236.name: Can only be 5 stars!
256577236.author: a TripAdvisor user
256577236.reviewBody: Can\'t add much else to what others have already said.  The Palenque ruins are spectacular - particularly with the jungle setting.  As others have said - get there early if you can - makes the experience much more special without people crawling all over the ruins!  Also take the time to explore the whole site, not just the immediate ruins - you will miss some lovely things otherwise.

256161788.name: Nice ruins and location
256161788.author: a TripAdvisor user
256161788.reviewBody: Maya culture ruins at Palenque park is really a great place, clean and preserved. Official guides are everywhere and for a low price they give a 1 hr tour. Nice place

256076930.name: awesome
256076930.author: a TripAdvisor user
256076930.reviewBody: ruins are gorgeous, arrive early to beat the crowds, spend at least 3 to 4 hours exploring and climbing all of the pyramids, the park around the ruins is beautiful, only downside to this site is the ridiculous amount of junk sellers right on the site that are constantly trying to offer their cheap trinkets.

255677411.name: No. 1 in Mayan Art
255677411.author: a TripAdvisor user
255677411.reviewBody: I was just amazed by the quality of art at Palenque, those ancient artists were so experienced in stucco modeling like probably no one else in the Ancient Mesoamerica. Definitely I will come back to enjoy the atmosphere of this wonderful Ancient Maya city.

255127642.name: Charming ruins
255127642.author: a TripAdvisor user
255127642.reviewBody: Much quieter and cheaper than any of the larger Mayan ruins. You can definitely feel the Mayan magic at these ruins. Best to go in the morning before the crowds arrive. Also souvenirs here are much cheaper than places such as Chichen itza. Barter!

255111741.name: Nice place
255111741.author: a TripAdvisor user
255111741.reviewBody: Visited 18th feb 2015 .Got the colectivo by the main roundabout after waiting all of 2 minutes at a cost of 20 pesos, reached the ruins about 10 minutes later , after paying 30 pesos to enter the national park.You have to enter the park to get to the ruins.Once we arrived we purchased our tickets for 64 pesos each, (so it really costs 94 pesos each) no queues to be seen at any stage. We then battled past 100 guides who were all keen to give us a guided tour, to enter the site.At this point the security guard noticed I had a banana, apple & orange which of course are strictly prohibited, but I was totally unaware , just wanting a few healthy snacks whilst walking around for a few hours, so handed them in to collect on departure.then we entered the ruins which are palenque.  At this point it is hard to judge if they are better or worse than Chichen Itz\u00e1, tulum,Uxmal etc because we all have our own views, and saying this or that one is brilliant & the other is terrible without giving reasons is pretty futile. All I can say is they are extensive & quite stunning in magnitude. After 2 hrs it started to rain & rain & rain, and then it rained even more so we took cover and I noticed everyone seemed to be eating food. Not fruit, but sandwiches, crisps chocolates , so I asked if a cafe/restaurant was available on site(not expecting one) to be told no, of course not. So unhealthy junk food is ok , but fruit no ! This could be linked to seeds in apples & oranges I guess but still a little strange, standing hungry in the rain watching rather obese tourists stuffing chocolate & crisps inside whilst my fruit stayed at the entrance , but that\'s life. After an hour of standing around we just carried on with our visit, just a little wetter, but we had a good time & got the colectivo back from outside the entrance as soon as we left and we were back in our hotel 15 mins later all dried out. So a good day out & a nice trip & another life long experience achieved.

254937018.name: Quick & lonely
254937018.author: a TripAdvisor user
254937018.reviewBody: I arrived with a bus at 6:30 at the bus station in palenque city and my next bus was to leave the city was already at 9:30. I did not want to wait for three hours and at the same time not miss the chance to the the next big Maya ruins after Tikal Tulum Chichen Itza and uxmal. So I took a collectivo to the ruins (10 pesos) and dropped of there with all my stuff. I was very surprised to see that at that time there was no soul around. When standing at the empty ticket place I saw that the park doesn\'t open until 8:00 in the morning. Very bad timing for me since I wanted to see but also had to return to the bus station. Since there is no real hate that keeps you from entering and there was no person I just walked in and enjoyed a magical ruins walk all alone. There where some Mayan venders in the ruins preparing their stuff and they seemed to be amused to see me all by myself before opening time. One of them walked through the park with me so I actually I had a great time in an empty park with a local and the sounds of the Forrest and monkeys around me. Highly recommend this place because you are actually allowed to climb the pyramids

254930723.name: Worth the Drive!
254930723.author: a TripAdvisor user
254930723.reviewBody: We drove from San Cristobal de las Casas to Palenque through a tope ridden road.  Beautiful scenery - but very long.  The ruins were definitely worth the trip. We had a rental car and thus independent of a tour group.  We spent the night in Palenque close the the park entrance. We have seen many beautiful ruins through out Mexico and these are totally amazing. We arrived just as the park opened and the weather was cool since it was December.  There are many guides who can escort you through this expansive complex and provide you the magic of Mayan history.  I would allow at least 3 hours. The museo is at the exit and definitely worth your time.  Keep your park entrance ticket since it also allows you inside the museo.  If you have the time spend 2 nights in Palenque since the drive back is 5-6 hours of the same road.  There is also an airport in Palenque if you desire to fly back.

254917552.name: The best site in Mexico
254917552.author: a TripAdvisor user
254917552.reviewBody: Absolutely wonderful ruins - you could spend a day here and still go back for more! You can climb the ruins and spend as much time as you want looking into the palace and temples. Photographic opportunities are fabulous.

254550134.name: Incredible ruins
254550134.author: a TripAdvisor user
254550134.reviewBody: We spent a day at the Palenque ruins. We arrived shortly after the park opened and hired a guide who gave us a two hour tour of the ruins. He was local and spoke excellent English. Well worth the 1000 pesos for the four of us. Most of the temples and residences are still covered by the jungle but those that have been excavated are massive. You can climb up and explore all but the inscription temple.
