191826373.author: a TripAdvisor user
191826373.reviewBody: Make sure to have a local guide you can enjoy it better. Try to go early as it gets crowded quickly. On the way out, don\'t miss the waterfall.

191519006.name: Very impressive
191519006.author: a TripAdvisor user
191519006.reviewBody: I love visiting ruins so really enjoyed the trip. It is a big site though so make sure wear comfortable clothes and shoes. You can climb the pyramids etc which is great, and you get great views from the top but make sure to bring water to keep you going.

191277893.name: Top of the charts
191277893.author: a TripAdvisor user
191277893.reviewBody: Been to Chichen Itza, Uxmal and Palenque.\n\nPalenque = Uxmal, AWESOME.  Worth every penny and effort to see if you can manage the extra time and energy to get to them.  Makes Chichen Itza a distance three place. Chichen gets all the accolades...but it\'s all marketing and vendor infested.  Go for the "real Maya experience at Uxmal or Palenque.

190876584.name: Awesome archeological field
190876584.author: a TripAdvisor user
190876584.reviewBody: You will discover amazing facts, history and Mayan culture in this place. I wished I could have stayed days.

190524056.name: Awesome
190524056.author: a TripAdvisor user
190524056.reviewBody:
If you are interested in Mayan ruins, Palenque is a great place to go.  We went around Christmas, so there were a lot of people, but it didn't get in the way except if you wanted a photo with no people in the background. In that case, you can always go to the pyramids in the back which are less popular.

We ended up doing it in two days, although you could do it all in one day if you start early. There are two entrances. 1) the main entrance at the end of the road (with all the people parking). This puts you at the main pyramids in the open field.  2) the back entrance near the museum. This puts you in the area of the jungle pyramids.  Completely different vibe, and some pretty waterfalls along the path as well.

We didn't get a guide, but be careful. When we first parked (near entrance 1) there were random guys offering to work as guides for 800 pesos (!).  As we got closer, the price was dropping. Near the entrance some kids offered 200 pesos.   Palenque does have some official guides you pick up near the ticket area. Not sure what they cost, but at Tonina we only paid 150 pesos so would expect it to be a bit more.

Unfortunately the Temple of Inscriptions is sealed from the public, but you can get some great views from the Temple of the Cross.

190514140.name: Don\'t Overlook Palenque!
190514140.author: a TripAdvisor user
190514140.reviewBody: If you are on the Maya train and think that you can miss Palenque because you\'ve been to Tikal, Copan and others, you\'re wrong.  The great and interesting thing about the Maya world is how spread out it was and how many amazing sites there are to visit that have been excavated.  Plalenque is certainly near the top of the great ones and certainly one of the largest.  I recommend off times to visit, not holidays, as this site sees a tremendous amount of visitors.  This is in the jungle as well with spider and howler monkeys all over the place as well as iguanas and certainly Jaguars, however only to be heard and tracks to find.  Also, in the area, don\'t forget about Bonampark, Yachiclan and Tonina.  All spectacular and very different

190450971.name: Palenque, the beautiful!
190450971.author: a TripAdvisor user
190450971.reviewBody: I highly recommend visiting the archeological Maya site of Palenque! But I also higly recommend studying its history beforehand, it makes a tremendous difference to enjoy the various structures.\nAlso, we visited during Christmas break (no choice) and it was very, very crowded. If you have a choice, go out of season and show up early (it opens at 8 am). The atmosphere is completely different when the grounds are somewhat deserted. :-)

190312489.name: Palenque
190312489.author: a TripAdvisor user
190312489.reviewBody: Palenque is fabulous. Before you go,  read  Palenque: Eternal City of the Maya by David Stuart and George Stuart (2008)  first for the extraordinary story of the archaeology, the history, and the amazing life of this city, which was at its height in the 7th & 8th centuries. The park is really well maintained and organized, clean -- lots of people visiting, mostly domestic visitors when I was there. Climbing the pyramids is great for the extraordinary views, but eventually they will have to prohibit it, since so many people are coming.  The museum on site is really great.  I think they should do more sculptural and relief copies of the original to install, if they can determine the original positions and sites -- it makes the experience more meaningful.  It was a pleasure to wander around and everything was convenient -- transportation, fair prices, not over-crowded, seems very well managed.  It was really cool to be here in Chiapas.

190208668.name: Palenque
190208668.author: a TripAdvisor user
190208668.reviewBody: Palenque is a beautiful site. It has two large pyramids, a ballcourt, an incredible palace, and an abundance of flora and fauna. The rainforest here is thick, maybe 40 feet visibility. While i am sick of people claiming it better than tikal in guatemala (its not, tikal is better) palenque is worth every penny and minute spent there. If i were to go back i would try to spend more time. I spent two nights there, and wish i had more time so i wasnt rushed. If i were to go back, i would spend a full day in palenque ruinas (see the ruins, museum, and pay a guide about 100 pesos to take me out into the forest in search of monkey, birds, and waterfalls). I would spend day two on the long day trip (very long from what i hear) to yaxchilan and bonampak ruins. Day three i would sleep in and see misol ha and agua azul waterfalls on way to san cristobal (the waterfalls are beautiful, especially misol ha). If you only have the time or money for a day in palenque, see the ruins and the waterfalls, but try to spend as much time as possible in this beautiful site.

190173244.name: picturesque site
190173244.author: a TripAdvisor user
190173244.reviewBody: Palenque being remote from the rest of other famous ruins in Yucatan had a big question mark for the visit. However since the visit the question mark transformed into the exclamation mark! The site is located in the jungles with well preserved ruins. If you have time it is definitely worth a visit! Fantastic place.

189485702.name: Pyramids, Temples and jungle
189485702.author: a TripAdvisor user
189485702.reviewBody:
I've seen a few Pyramid sites in Mexico (Tulum, Teotihuacan) and I've seen thousands of pictures of Tchitchinitza. but Palenque and Yaxchilan are from far the best sites of Mayan ruins to visit in Mexico. Located in the jungle, you walk up in the woods to discover this huge city. Only +/- 20 monuments have been dug up in Palenque but the jungle still contains over 1000 of them.
Yaxchilan is even more impressive as you have to rent a boat to get there and the ruins themselves are covered with moss making this greenish view of the ruins that is magical. Our guides knew everything about the sites. they had both worked there for years and participated in the archeological digs.

Magnificent place to visit!

189171568.name: A glimpse into a different world
189171568.author: a TripAdvisor user
189171568.reviewBody: Why go to Palenque for anything else?  Sit awhile among the relics of a people who lived there a millennium ago, try to take yourself back and think like they may have, and come out a bigger person for the experience.

189010993.name: Impressive
189010993.author: a TripAdvisor user
189010993.reviewBody: I am a lover of arqueology places, this one is one of the best.  Of course a visit to Bonampak is a must!

187099931.name: Famous and still lots of Magic
187099931.author: a TripAdvisor user
187099931.reviewBody: For years I wanted to see these ruins- famous through the drawings of Catherwood. I came from Calakmul, where I met two (!) other visitors! That was pure magic in the jungle. In Palenque there were some hundreds when I came in the morning. Lots of trash souvenirs and that try to hijack you. But once you are in its still beautiful and with lots of magic. The landscape is totally different from the Maya ruins further  north. Its worth even a six hours drive.

186846102.name: One of the best mayan sites in Mexico
186846102.author: a TripAdvisor user
186846102.reviewBody: Try to climb all the pyramids, the views are incredible. But be careful on the stairs, they are uneven

186467371.name: Lovely Ruins with a Jungle Backdrop
186467371.author: a TripAdvisor user
186467371.reviewBody: Even on a gray day, the ruins at Palenque are a powerful example of Mayan architecture. My whole day trip from San Cristobal cost less than $30USD per person, included two waterfalls (and was over 16 hours roundtrip). The journey there from San Cristobal is also beautiful, but very winding and would not be easy for those who suffer from motion sickness.

186291810.name: Amazing
186291810.author: a TripAdvisor user
186291810.reviewBody:
This is just amazing ruins!
February is the best time to visit.
The observation tower was different from other ruins.
The descent to Ahua Pacal was great!
Just stand there starring at the final resting place of the greatest ruler of Palenque  was fabulous!
Just seeing how the Maya conquered hydraulics was amazing!
There were several Landicon Mayans at the park!
We hired a guide to take us back deep into the jungle to learn about the natural medicine of the Maya! It was a great experience!! 
Do your research before you go!

185428997.name: ruins in jungle
185428997.author: a TripAdvisor user
185428997.reviewBody: the ruins locate all the jungle, you can see old walls and stone steps through the jungle, that feeling is interesting.

185354416.name: Not to be missed
185354416.author: a TripAdvisor user
185354416.reviewBody: I was not interested in visiting ruins but after hearing so much about these, I am glad I went.  Get an English guide but not at $85.  We got a 10 year old who knew as much as the adults and he only charged us 50 pesos per person and he wants to learn English so he will be great when he does.  Luckily, my friend spoke Spanish and interpreted for us.

185353770.name: Palenque
185353770.author: a TripAdvisor user
185353770.reviewBody: Excellent ruins-well worth the trip.  However on November 20, 2013 (today) I was on the way from Palenque to San Cristobal and it was awful--the teachers were on strike,  They were blocking the roads with trucks and boards with nails--they were demanding money.  It took a few hours more to get to San Cristobal and my bus never left so I had to take a shuttle-the shuttle could get around the blockaid.  The 5 hour trip is very long in a crowded shutte.  This is why people are afraid to go to Mexico--you have to love it a be very flexable. I wonder where the police are and if these are really teachers and not just bandits.

184208991.name: Amazing piece of an ancient times
184208991.author: a TripAdvisor user
184208991.reviewBody: This place is a must when going to Chiapas. We hired a "private guide" to show us around. Lots of  kids will give you nice tour through ruins and jungle for a reasonable money. Negotiate tour price. The entire civilization is buried under the jungle out there. Just a couple of pyramids were revealed so far. Highly recomended.

183842178.name: Doesn\'t get much better
183842178.author: a TripAdvisor user
183842178.reviewBody: This ruin is spectacular!  Get there early so you can really spend time looking at everything. Each ruin has details galore and just the view alone is breath taking.\nThe museum is 5 star.  Even the vendors at the entrance are polite and not pushy.  If you can only see one ruin this one will not disappoint

182236893.name: A Chiapas Must See
182236893.author: a TripAdvisor user
182236893.reviewBody: This is one of the better Mayan ruins experiences available. I was impressed by the quality of the restoration, the interesting buildings and very pleasant mountain landscape with lots of water.\nWe enjoyed a guide, an extended tour including Group B and C ruins, which are off the normal path, as well as a jungle walk. I  hope to return to further explore the jungle and unrestored portions of the city.

180013956.name: Wow!
180013956.author: a TripAdvisor user
180013956.reviewBody:
Fabulous site! Highly recommend a guide for the hike around. Provides a different appreciation of the history and architecture. We had an English speaking lady named Belen as our guide. She was fabulous!

Make sure you wear appropriate hiking footwear. Well worth the climb up the hundreds of steps for the view at the top! 

Various indigenous traders selling craftwork but unlike other places they are not pushy.

There is also a jungle trek off the main site. A local guide is essential for this as the paths are less well defined. If you are into local flora and fauna ala 'bear grylls' this will reward!

179663183.name: Great place
179663183.author: a TripAdvisor user
179663183.reviewBody: I really liked this place...everything is green and the waterfall is beautiful! They just need like a map beacause it quite of big and if you dont go with a guide you could miss some good things!

179115487.name: Nothing short of impressive
179115487.author: a TripAdvisor user
179115487.reviewBody: This is the largest ruins site I\'ve visited so far so I  have nothing but great things to say about it. You walk in and first see the temples and it really takes your breath away. It is very easy to get overwhelmed with the height and number of temples just by looking at them but it\'s really not so bad. Besides the ruins you can trek the jungle but as I was told by the park employees, you HAVE to hire a guide or you\'re not allowed on the trails. I\'m not sure how much they charge but I think it\'s around $100 if you\'re just one person. I did stumble upon a trail that had a $27MXN entrance fee but I think you didn\'t need a guide for that one. I opted not to pay so I can\'t comment on it.\n\nColectivos from Palenque town are $20 pesos and about 15 min. and the entrance to the park is $57. There are bathrooms inside that seem clean judging from the sinks, I didn\'t use the toilets and it\'s nice that the sinks were plentiful with big mirrors and to my surprise there were paper towels.

178655546.name: Good, but not as good as it used to be...
178655546.author: a TripAdvisor user
178655546.reviewBody: Many areas have been closed off for conservation of the sites.  It is necessary because of the huge volume of visitors.  I would recommend Tonina, the enemies city of Palenque, to be able to experience more.

177887172.name: Amazing!
177887172.author: a TripAdvisor user
177887172.reviewBody: Loved these ruins! It was like walking through a village... \nThe think I liked the most is that you could enter them and climb them. This was a much nicer experience than for example chicen itza...

177793711.name: Better than Chichen Itza
177793711.author: a TripAdvisor user
177793711.reviewBody: we had a great tour guide who explained the history and numbers relating to Mayan beliefs. given time to wander around and see more hidden gems after tour and just soak in the atmosphere.

177309114.name: Pakal
177309114.author: a TripAdvisor user
177309114.reviewBody:
Pakal the Astronaut, awesome ruins in a beautiful jungle setting.
The Temple of the Inscriptions up close and personal after seeing it on tv 
for so many years. The sacred cascades are magical, it's to bad you can't
 jump in and cool off after climbing the temples.

177076449.name: A lot to discover
177076449.author: a TripAdvisor user
177076449.reviewBody:
Palenque was beautiful. The day we went there were not too many people. We did not take a guide because we already visited a lot of ruins but what I heard when passing by other people with a guide was actually really interesting.
In Palenque you get the chance unlike in most other ruin sites to climb on top of some of the ruins, which is sometimes hard (I don't understand how these small Maya people did it, the stairs are usually superhigh!).

A lot of the ruins are still to be restaurated and in the middle of nature surrounding.

If you go here, take mosquito repellent! best to wear maybe something that covers most of your body but is really light. Humidity here is very high as well. 
Take your time.... I don't know if guides rush you trough, but its a quite big site, I would not agree on an hour-set guided tour...

No food available to buy inside the park, you better take a snack and your own drinks.

176655974.name: A place of beauty
176655974.author: a TripAdvisor user
176655974.reviewBody: This is a great archeological site. I would say it was medium in size to other sites in Mexico and South America. I have only visited these ruins twice. The first time was in very early morning and the fog hung over the ruins so thick,you could not see them until you were almost on top of them. The entire place is beautiful and you will want to walk by each ruin so you can get the full exposure to the beauty\' Remember this is a jungle and you will be hot, tired and dry, but you won\'t regret it.

176526105.name: Beautiful ruins in the jungle!
176526105.author: a TripAdvisor user
176526105.reviewBody: Huge ruins! Lots to see... you could spend the entire day just walking around in this jungle. Saw some howler monkeys as well! Very cool historical spot. We did it without a tour guide, but I think it could be cool to have someone tell you more about the history!

176053442.name: Beautiful area in the jungle
176053442.author: a TripAdvisor user
176053442.reviewBody: The location is great and it\'s different than the other Maya ruins we\'ve been through. One of our favorite! \nOnly thing; could be hard to find the right exit, since there is one exit 1,5 down the road of the main exit/entrance.. There are signs with "salida" that lead you to that one. You have to walk up to the entrance in the heat, but there\'s also a path through the jungle that makes your walk much nicer!

175611808.name: Great Experience
175611808.author: a TripAdvisor user
175611808.reviewBody: What made this trip so great was our tour guide. We didn\'t think it would be worth it to get one, but in this case, it was. If you can find Nacho (Ignacio), get him to do your tour!

173930901.name: Very good
173930901.author: a TripAdvisor user
173930901.reviewBody: We stayed in PanXan and we walked to the ruins. The best way is to buy your ticket in the museum (there is have a nice video about the ruins and its included in the ticket) and enter on the firt entrance (not the main one). You walk along the river and waterfalls and its like you are exploring the jungle, lots of monkeys etc. Then you get to the top, that is absolutly amasing and after visiting you get out from the main entrance, and on you way back stop at the waterfalls for a "swim". Really good!

172511390.name: Don\'t miss
172511390.author: a TripAdvisor user
172511390.reviewBody: I keep giving 5\'s to the ancient ruins we\'ve seen on our trip but that\'s a big reason we came and we have yet to be disappointed.  Most surprised how much that we saw is original, not reconstructed.  Our guide, Mildred, was extremely knowledgeable and added greatly to the experience.  If you are able, climb all the steps you can.  The views were phenomenal--all the way to the Gulf at one point.

172430820.author: a TripAdvisor user
172430820.reviewBody: Useless to describe the enchantment...the view is just breaktaking - and so are the numerous stairs to climb to gain it...;-)....just visit them!!!

171252690.name: My favourite Mayan Ruins
171252690.author: a TripAdvisor user
171252690.reviewBody: If you\'re sitting there thinking that these ruins are too far off the beaten track/can be taken out of an itinerary... Think again. The setting of these ruins puts places like Chichen Itza, full to the brim with tourists, to shame. We saw howler monkeys, areas of the park where there was nobody to be seen...it\'s a special place & well worth the trip.

170971129.name: Palenque
170971129.author: a TripAdvisor user
170971129.reviewBody: The main pyramid was under repair, it was not my first time so it was a surprise that everything ins closed, pity that tourist tend to destroy everything. Very clean!\nGraeat views, definitely a  must to walk down to the waterfalls into the jungle!

170862789.name: Another amazing place
170862789.author: a TripAdvisor user
170862789.reviewBody: Again get there early as the place fills up with people pretty much after 9.30. Great ruins with more details in tact than other places I have been to. Pity when we were there that the main ruin was under restoration and covered in blue tarps. Other than that I had a great time taking photos and wondering around the temples and palaces. Be prepared to climb plenty of stairs, sweat a lot and drink heaps of water, But it is worth it.

170628031.name: Huge but very busy!
170628031.author: a TripAdvisor user
170628031.reviewBody: We took the guided but individualised tour and were pleased we had arrived at opening time. Any latter and there would have been too many others! But amazing and great crafts to buy along the way.

169982155.name: way more than the main tourist tour
169982155.author: a TripAdvisor user
169982155.reviewBody:
palenque ruins themselves are easily accessed without a guide, super well marked, easy to wander around and were pretty nice (lots of other tourists walking around though)
we met jorje that night at don muchos (restaurant in el panchan), he works as a guide and is there most nights at a small booth near the entrance
jorje took us on an amazing tour the next day through the jungle, climbing up gentle waterfalls, wandering through stream beds and to ruins that are still buried beneath trees (some massive, some it was still possible to climb down into)
I cannot recommend this walk highly enough, we found fossils, mayan pottery shards, climbed through a cave, swam in waterfalls and had some great chats with jorje about the mayan people
jorje is an excellent guy and this private tour (just the 2 of us and jorje) was super cheap and way better than the palanque ruins tourist walk
definitely do it

169812231.name: Great ruins. Worth a visit
169812231.author: a TripAdvisor user
169812231.reviewBody: DO NOT TAKE A JUNGLE TOUR - nothing to see. Its more useful to pay for the tour in the uncovered restored area. We got caught and did it the other way around - regret this.

169344185.name: Fantastic
169344185.author: a TripAdvisor user
169344185.reviewBody:
Palenque is a long way off the beaten track but it really is worth it. The site is fantastic really well kept and beautiful. 
There's alot of street sellars but they're fine and accept a 'np thankyou'. although some are wortha second look!
We parked at the top by the market stalls which was convenient. Alternative parking is by the museum but that is quite a walk uphill if you're not terribly mobile.
It really is a 'must see'
Make sure you go into the area that is unexcavated in the forest,it's really beautiful.

169296746.name: Early morning a magical time
169296746.author: a TripAdvisor user
169296746.reviewBody: We arrived at the archeological park when they opened the doors because the less people the better, even though it is a huge park. The most  important buildings are close enough the one the other and the place seems crowded without really being so. When you go early you can hear the birds and the animals and you can feel the good energy of the place.We could not climb to pakal\'s tomb or see the tomb of the Red lady ( red colored skeleton due to some substance thrown to the dead) because they were sealed to avoid decay. they have a Pakal\'s Tomb replica in the Museum.After a long tour mostly unde the shades of trees we reached the Museum you should not miss.Also, the quesadillas at the snack bar were very delicious!!!!

168627031.name: Beyond the dimensions of time and space
168627031.author: a TripAdvisor user
168627031.reviewBody: When you are in the archeological site of Palenque, the best is you take time! Let yourself disappear in the jungle or blend yourself energetically into the vibration of the space while sitting on top of one of the temples. Let you carry away - and do not so much allow your head to dictate you. Your conditioned head won\'t be so much able to understand that place, but allowing your body with its 5 senses to perceive it: that\'s the richness of Palenque!\nBest is, you enter, as soon as the gates open at 8:00am, because by 10:00am the tourist buses have usually filled the precious place. Or you go even there, when it is raining - or stay there when almost all people have left because of a big rain, because this assures you to feel the place with its strong energy.

168130700.name: Timeless beauty
168130700.author: a TripAdvisor user
168130700.reviewBody: The ruins are in the edge of a jungle, and you can hear the screams of monkeys. The experience of being there is incredible since they are so well taken care of. The place was clean, and we could walk on our own, and the nearby river was under the shade of the trees, with a very special coolness in a warm day.

168092892.name: Overcommercialized!
168092892.author: a TripAdvisor user
168092892.reviewBody: Nice buildings partly fake. The site is overwhelmed with souvenirs sellers. It\'s a shame. This downgrades this site. This is not about culture anymore. This site becomes a disneyworld.And it is not sheap. Better go to al pilar or yaxha.

167450202.name: Start at Main gate
167450202.author: a TripAdvisor user
167450202.reviewBody: As you enter the park the Musuem is on your right and jungle walk to park on the left. Go straight past and up to the Main gate.Guides cost about 100 P per person if in group. By starting here you have a flat walk. If you start at Jungle gate then ITS UPHILL AND STEPS for a long way till reaching the ruins. Best ruins in Mexico!. Go early and it gets very hot.\nVictoria / Australia

166992559.name: Walk through Time
166992559.author: a TripAdvisor user
166992559.reviewBody: Nearly all the ruins are "user-friendly" allowing you to walk on and about the same places the ancient Mayans did over a millennium ago! At times, you can almost feel  their presence.

166321185.name: Best Archeological park in Chiapas
166321185.author: a TripAdvisor user
166321185.reviewBody: Signage is in English and Spanish. Wasn\'t like that when I first came. Don\'t miss Pakal\'s tomb in the museum.

165716775.name: Temple of the Skull
165716775.author: a TripAdvisor user
165716775.reviewBody: The well known ruins are a sight not to be missed. They can be easily reached by collectivo local mini bus, which gives you all day to leisurely wander around and explore and take pictures to your heart\'s contend. To catch the bus, when coming from the hotel, make a left on the main street, and where you see the large Maya Head sculpture, get on the right side of the street. The collectivos that go to the ruins will see you and stop for you.

164444462.name: Unbelievable
164444462.author: a TripAdvisor user
164444462.reviewBody:
I preferred these ruins to Chichen Itza (accessibility, lack of other tourists, the history). If you are in Mexico for a long enough period, definitely make your way to them, They are beautiful, accessible to walk on and well posted in terms of information although you can also get a guide.

The information available is good enough to allow you to tap into the lives of the rulers of the 7th Century Mayans here and walking through the palace courtyards and up to the temples allows for a really intimate experience. The vistas from the temple of the crosses was worth the whole trip alone.

Get there as early as you are willing to experience the ruins in a quieter, cooler environment. 

The reviewer before gave up to date prices on getting there from town and getting in.

164212568.name: Go early
164212568.author: a TripAdvisor user
164212568.reviewBody:
We went last week and did it on our own without tour.

There are many posts about prices but these are as of june 2013.

Collectivo leaves from town every 10 mins. Costs 20 pesos each gringo. There is an entrance fee to park which is 27 pesos each. Then entrance fee to park is 57 pesos each. These are prices for non nationales. It is cheaper for mexicans. 

It is well worth the prices. Takes about 4 hours and if u go early u will see animals. Its hot so take water but there is not much climbing if you dont want to. If you dont want to walk up hill look at complete grounds before heading to museum.

163902925.name: Beautifully maintained ruins
163902925.author: a TripAdvisor user
163902925.reviewBody: We had a good guide and luckily it wasn\'t too hot.  Some of the sites were closed for restoration, but you could still see them from the outside.  Just the right amount of climbing.   Get there early to beat the heat and the crowds.

162681090.name: Loved these ruins
162681090.author: a TripAdvisor user
162681090.reviewBody: These ruins are just beautiful, The lush area will amaze you. It is in a rain forest. We had a guide which make things more interesting

161611188.name: Park with Pyramids! yay!
161611188.author: a TripAdvisor user
161611188.reviewBody: Hidden in the jungle nice and quiet pyramidal complex. Perfect picnic place (if your own beverages where allowed..oh well, we managed to sneak in a bottle of red to enjoy the views even more). I was only disappointed that the entrance to Pakal tomb is no longer open to visitors but we saw the copy of the tomb in Museo de Antropologia in Mexico City.

161375193.name: dont miss
161375193.author: a TripAdvisor user
161375193.reviewBody: i enjoyed these more than chichen itza and it reminded me of Angkor wat in style in places - get a guide its worth the fee

161337727.name: One of the best ruins in Mexico to see
161337727.author: a TripAdvisor user
161337727.reviewBody: If you only visit 2-3 ruins in Mexico, let these be one of them. It is not the largest, the tallest, the most impressive, the cheapest or the most detailed, but scores very good on all of these criteria. This Maya city is nested in the jungle which makes it quite special. It is quite large with many buildings you are still allowed to go on or in to. Moreover, it is easily reachable, has a good museum I heard (closed on Monday I had no notice) and although touristy, it is large enough to be ok most of the time. I liked that animals are around, next to cascades. The heat is really very though sometimes and the info on site not always the best. But still, if you are not keen on visiting all ruinas, this one is the Maya one you want to visit.\n\nOh, on your right hand side just in front of the main exit, there is a trail starting that is worth it as you will be able to see many animals. I also think you do need to pay both fees to get in. Collectivos are currently 10 pesos one way, all along the road to the ruinas and there are plenty. And Palenque is becoming too turisty, so always check they are not playing you...

161300184.name: Get there soon!!!!
161300184.author: a TripAdvisor user
161300184.reviewBody: If Palenque is on your Bucket List (as it should be), be advised that the Palace building will be closed to visitors forever beginning December 2013. Before that time, you may explore this ruin at your leisure -- very worthwhile to do.

161091076.name: Amazing Ruins - UPDATE on Scams and Costs
161091076.author: a TripAdvisor user
161091076.reviewBody:
We had an amazing time visiting the ruins. We arrive right at 8am when the park opens and stayed for 4.5 hours (including the museum). Awesome day. However, it is a little hard to figure out what you have to pay online and we think that there are some price updates and there are some scams at the park entrance. Here is the updated list:

May 2013:
Entrance Fee to Ruin - 57 pesos
Entrance Fee to National Park - 27 pesos (YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY THIS)
Collectivo Buses to Ruins from Palenque - 20 pesos (cheaper for locals)

When we were on the collectivo in the morning, it stopped at the national park entrance and handed us bracelets for 27 pesos that we were supposed to wear. Inside the ruins, I noticed that not everyone had them on. So I asked several staff members at the park and they said that it was a donation and that we didn't need to pay it. You only need to buy the 57 peso entrance fee. My suggestion is to tell the guy at the gate when he tries to make you pay that you are only going to the ruins. 

We also noticed some guards early in the morning hassling one tourist. They were laughing and blowing whistles at him. Later we saw the tourist and asked what happened. Apparently, a guard tried to throw him out of the park for walking up some stairs that had no sign saying you couldn't walk up them. Bottom line: BE CAREFUL IN THE MORNING OF CORRUPT GUARDS. The tourist ended up "paying off" the guard in order to stay in the park. Such a shame!

160967447.name: Unforgetable experience
160967447.author: a TripAdvisor user
160967447.reviewBody: I spent 3 hours in Palenque. It was an unforgetable experience. The Palenque ruins looked different from other Mayan ruins. It has it\'s own and unique beauty. The old Palenque temples are a must to see coz you can take a great photo of entire Palenque area from there.\n\nThere is a museum near the bus station and conviniet shop. Do visit the museum! The coffin of Palenque King is located in the museum and it\'s a fantastic attraction. You will feel like crossing thousands of years when you stand in front of the coffin.

160780739.name: A must see
160780739.author: a TripAdvisor user
160780739.reviewBody:
Take a whole day time there!

Breathtaking site!

The ruins of Palenque is a must see!

But dont forget to take enough to drink with you!

158966973.name: Amazing visit
158966973.author: a TripAdvisor user
158966973.reviewBody:
Visiting Palenque is a bit cumbersome these days, since there is no airport (the closest, at Villahermosa is a 2-hour drive away), but that shouldn't prevent you from getting to know this true Mayan wonder.

What makes Palenque stand out from the other ruins is that a lot of inscriptions were found there, which helped reconstruct part of the Mayan lives at that time.

It would certainly be better if you hired a guide (it should cost you no more than 500 pesos) This will make sure you will profit from you visit knowing every detail of the site. Do not forget to pay a visit to the nice museum after you leave the site.

158743592.name: Magic ruins
158743592.author: a TripAdvisor user
158743592.reviewBody: For me Palenque is one of the most beautiful places in Mexico - it situated in mountains, on the middle of the high jungles.

158265354.name: Superb jungle ruins
158265354.author: a TripAdvisor user
158265354.reviewBody: This place was amazing. Not so busy and surrounded by superb jungle. The grounds are well kept and stunning to walk around. As with any ruin, it is best to hire a guide, who can talk you through the architecture, carvings, monuments, sociology. The guide I had was selected by my Intrepid tour guide, and happened to be one of the archeologists there, who took us into a roped off section to visit a ruined dwelling - so beautiful, nestled in the jungle, with trees towering on top of it. \nListen out for howler monkeys as you walk around!

157548095.name: So beautiful!
157548095.author: a TripAdvisor user
157548095.reviewBody: I stayed in Mexico for three months, during which I had the chance to see many ruins, some of them very well-known and visited, other less touristic but even more amazing. Palenque is visited by very many people, but there I found the best ruins I have seen in Mexico. I suggest you take a one-hour tour in the jungle with one of the young boys who offer their guiding. I was skeptical but it was worth it, they only asked 100 pesos and I was so happy that I ended up giving him the double (which is not a lot anyway).
